knowledge onely glorieth knoweth christ thys delyghte confort cor plesure ioy brother saith came vnto came gloriousnes wordes wysedom shewing vnto testimonie god neither shewed self knew thyng among phil saue iesus christ euen crucified epistle philippian couteth al thing comparison knowledge christ vile base nothyng worth coloss howe oftentymes epistle wysheth suche writeth vnto may fulfylled saluation faithfull christian god saieth prophet knowledge rightous seruat shal iustify multitude esa without knowledge al knowledge science nothing worth onely profitable also wicked damnable writte1 cor iac wisedom world foolishnes god wisdom descendeth aboue earthy naturall deuillish cause holy apostle termed great learned wise gentile stode much owne conceite thought selues knowe thing fooles vnwise foolish heart saith blynded rom much whe counted themselues wise became fooles consideration wherof wel said great lerned philosopher socratessocrates notwithstanding oracle apollo iudged men wisest best lerned one thing know saieth knowe nothynge uerily although man know natural morall thynges documentes therof whatsoeuer doctrine scienceall knowledg wythout knowledge god vaine vnprofitable knowledge reckned vp besides one brest conteined whatsoeuer knowledge hath ben found breastes naturall men beginnynge worlde vnto day shalbe vnto end yet yf knowe christ knoweth nothyng notable distichon worthy euer remembred hoc est nescire sine christo plurima scire si christum benescis satis est si caetera nescis whiche thus englished doubtlesse know nothyng without christ many thyngs know see thou know christ well thee befall thou nedest inough thee knowledge god goten worde iohn knowledge god sonne christ meanes obteyn word god sauior christ saith serche scripture ye think ye haue eternal life ar testifie abraham sayd riche man beyng tormentes hell fyre luc haue moses prophet let hear agayn euangelist iohn writeth hath sene god tyme begotten sonne whiche bosome father iohn hath declared hym word therfore diligently bothe day nyght read psal heard considered weighed pondered yea whole delight pleasure reposed may truely vnfaynedly bottome heart say disciple vnto sauior christ lord shall go iohn thou hast wordes euerlastyng lyfe beleue sure yt thou art christ son liuing god also psalmograph maner psal haue lorde great delyght waie thy testimony maner rychesse thy testimony delight councellers lawe thy mouthe derer vnto thousandes golde siluer loue thy commandementes aboue gold precious stone glad thy word one fyndeth great spoyles swete thy wordes vnto throte sweeter honye vnto mouth psal desyred gold yea much fyne golde sweter also hony combe woordes lord pure wordes psal euen syluer whiche frome earth tried purifyed seuen tymes fyre c moreouer thys worde god hydde treasure fielde math whyche whenne manne hathe founde euen verye ioye thereof goeth selleth hathe bieth field yea precious pearle whiche merchant man long sekyng hath one foundthe excellencie god worde selleth euer hath byeth swearde byenge wherof christe commandeth v sell cote signifieng hereby aboue thynges worde god ephe heb luc knowledge therof gotten saith place seke fyrst kyngdome god ryghteousnes therof sayd martha busyly occupied housholde business preparynge meate body sister mary sittyng christes feete math luc hearynge worde doctrine martha martha sayd thou art carefull troubled many thynges uerily one nedeful mary hath chosen good part whiche shall taken away meate perisheth iohn exod psal sap abydeth vnto euerlastynge lyfe yea heauenly manna whych princelike prophete moste counnyng musitian dauid psalmograph calleth bread angel wyse man termeth foode angel also suche meate pleasant good taste exod iohn rock fountayn liuyng water wherof soeuer drinketh shall neuer thirst water shall drinke shalbe hym well water springyng vp euerlastynge life piller fyre exod psal luc geueth lighte walke darknes syt shadow death guyde theyr fete way peace dauid saithe thy worde lorde lanterne feete lyght pathway salomon saith psal commandement lanterne lawe light yea waye life likewise saith peter haue right sure word prophecie prouer pet whervnto ye take heede vnto lighte shyneth darke place ye well vntill day dawne day starre aryse heartes ende rom power god vnto saluation many beleue furthermore able expresse ioyfull iewellthe frutes worde god precious pearle incomparable ouche moste noble tresure worde god shall founde fewe wordes consider commodity fruictes profites come thereof turneth soules saieth dauid maketh vnfaithfull man faithfull beleuer apostle saieth faith cometh hearyng rom hearing commeth word god maketh idolater true worshipper god psalmograph saieth psal people whome knewe hathe serued hering eare haue ben obedient vnto maketh sinner righteous person reade noha loth gen exod moyses dauid manasses zachee peter thiefe mary magdalene c conuerteth synners maketh sory theyr former wycked lyfe become newe creature god preachyng shall turne many sonnes israell vnto lorde god shall go spirit power helias turne herts father child vnbeleuers wisdome iust make redy perfect people lord iohn turned many preachyng god word vnto lord math luc act manifest euagelical history great multitude people peter may speake nothing apostels turned vnto christ preaching word blessed luke chronicle apostle act doth partly declare holle world maner turned vnto faith christ thorow preaching word sainct paul saith faith cometh hearing rom psal hearing cometh worde god aske haue heard doubt sound went oute landes woordes endes worldein matter cotrouersye must haue recourse vnto worde god matter controuersie concernyng religion declareth sheweth maintaineth truthe approueth falshode true touchestone wherby easily discerne true doctrine christ fro fals corrupte teachyng antichrist therefore called psalmograph faithfull testimonie wytnes lorde matter doubt prophet exhorteth v flee vnto word psal learne certaintie al matter cocerning faith doctrine man saieth want lyght esa lette hym looke vpon law testimonie whether speake meanyng doo stumbleth suffreth hunger suffer hunger pacience blasphemeth king god reade noble men thessalonica act whiche herd paul sylas preache christ muste nedes suffer rise agayn frome death saluation worlde receaued word wyth diligence mynde yet notwithstandyng searched scripture dayly whether thing euen paul sylas preached therfore paul afterward writing vnto one greatly alowing act saith epistle quench spirite despise prophecyings examyn al thing kepe good and1 thess iohn canonicall epistle saieth derely beloued beleue euery spirite proue spirites whether god c1 iohn psal geueth wisedom simple poore spirit ye huble meke litle one babe wisdom true knowlege god blessed wil wisedom ca haue word god saith prophet esa unto shall haue respect vnto poore lowly troubled spirit standeth awe wordes fyne phariseys sawcie saduceis subtil scribe lustye lawyer bite hepe byshoppes patteryng priestes maye speake nothyng eloquente oratours noble hystoriographers learned poetes quickewitted logitians farre syghted astronomer c worlde great wyse learned men yet vnderstode nothyng god aryght symple ideots vnlearned men true knowledge god oure sauiour christ sayd vnto heauenly father thanke thee math father lord heauen earth thou hast hid thynges wyse prudent hast shewed vnto babe uerily father eue thy good plesure likewise sayth paule many wise men flesh1 cor many myghty many highe degree called god hathe chosen foolish thynges worlde confound wise god hath chosen weake thynges worlde confounde thynges whiche mightie vile thinges world thynges whiche despised hath god chosen yea thinges reputation bring naught thing reputation flesh reioyce presence iames also saith hath god chosen poore worlde suche riche faith iac heyres kyngdom promised loue hym reioyceth maketh heart mery prophet ieremie saieth psal iere found thy wordes dyd eate vp gredily haue made synnes forgeuen thee go peace man able expresse thefe likewise hanging crosse luc hearyng wordes spoken vnto christ uerily verily say vnto thee day shalte thou paradise conceaued heart vnoutspeakable ioye many suche example fynde scripture bothe olde newe testament worde god meane gospel lord sauior christ iesu apprehended layde hande sure strong faith bryngeth heart conscience man peace rest ioy solace confort c thys cause called worde reconciliation attonement ioy peace confort helth2 cor luc ephe iohn spirite lyfe c lyghtneth eye sheweth vnto men ryght waie howe ought walke please god doo thynges acceptable vnto deliuereth men cloudes ignorancie psal darknes men tradition openeth vnto glorious god may stumble walke safely way lord hath appointed declinyng neither righte hande left hande psalmographe saieth esa psal prouerb pet ephe iohn thy worde lord lanterne vnto fete lyghte pathewaies cause termed holye writer light diuers place sacred bible sauior christ saieth condemnation light come world men haue loued darknes lyght myghty shielde stronge defence agaynst satan infernall army salomon sayth prouerb worde god bucklar beleue therfore paule certaine epistle appointeth armour shold put may able stand assault deuill ephe resist gouernours darknes euyl day stande perfect thynges exhorteth v among weapon put sworde spirite saieth worde god spirituall sword dyd sauiour christ wyldernes fight sathan mightily ouercame conflict declaring vnto v math luc noble weapon word god vanquishe ouercome satan soeuer putteth swearde myghty faith falleth hand olde cankred ennemy mankind may sure haue victory word percyng stone reg wherewith dauid ouerthrue kylled mighty great gyant goliath prowd philstine blasphemous rayler vpon god hoste ouercommeth subdueth antichrist aduersaries god pure true doctrine paul witnesseth saying2 thess wycked synfull man sonne perdition whiche aduersarie god trueth exalted aboue called god worshipped dothe sitte temple god bostyng god shall disclosed vttered broughte lyghte whome lorde shall consume spirite mouth c agayn iames iambres withstode moses2 timoth exod euen also resyst truth men corrupt myndes leude concernyng faith shall preuayle longer madnes shalbe vttered vnto men euen thing god thanked wee haue experience daye wherein antichrist reueled wycked doctrine disclosed blynde begynne see hys iugglyng though whyche manner atlas susteyn vnderprop hold vp wyth shoulder say writynges preaching kyngdom antichrist much antichristian actes deuillish decree croked costitutions trifling tradition drousie dreames idle inuentions vnwritten verity c yet tyme iudgement great whore babylon hande wherin marked merchauntes wyth blasphemous beast false prophete shall bee caste lake burneth fyre brymstone whome iohn sawe syttyng vpon white horse apoc clothed vesture dipte bloode whose eies flame fyre whose name worde god whose mouthe went sharpe two edged sworde math shall smyte kyll destroy euery plant saieth christ heauenly father hath planted shalbe pluckt vp rootes agayn gospell kyngdome shall preached world math wytnesse vnto nation shall ende come defendeth louer embracer therof frome synne wyckednesse lewde behauiour psalmograph saith thy wordes haue hydde within heart psal synne agaynst thee agayne wherwithall shall yonge man clense hys waye euen rulyng hymselfe thy word one agayne order steppe thy worde shall wickednes haue dominion ouer comforteth troubled tribulation suffereth hym faynt desperate mynde dauid saythe delight bene thy lawe psal haue perished trouble agayne thinke vpon thy seruant concernynge woorde wherein thou haste caused put trust conforte trouble thy woorde hath quickened place also sayeth though walke valley shadowe deathe feare euyll thou art psal thy rod thy staffe confort cureth healeth spiritual sickness disease wyse man sayth neyther herbe emplasture restored health sap psal thy woorde lorde healeth al thing likewise saieth psalmograph sent hys word healed saued fro destruction purifieth clenseth hearte man yea whole man sauiour christ saieth nowe ye cleane thorowe worde haue spoken vnto iohn hereto pertaineth saying thapostle christe loued congregation gaue hymselfe sanctifie clensed fountayne water thorough worde peter also saith ephe pet ye borne newe mortall seede immortall worde god whiche lyueth abideth euer bringeth peace rest quietnes ioye conforte men conscieces psalmograph saith great peace yt haue loue thy law offended psal peace peace vnto farre nye saith lord make whole wicked lyke ragyng sea rest whose water fometh myre grauell euen wicked haue peace saieth god bringeth holy ghost beleue rede chronicle apostle act esa peter yet spake wordes saith blessed historiograph luke holy gost fell al heard preaching likewise saeith paule act christ also beleue forasmuch haue herd word trueth ephe euen gospel saluation wherin ye beleued ye sealed holye spirite c epistle galathians galat saieth receyued spirite preachyng faithe able make man learned vnto saluation thorow faith whiche christ iesu timoth teacheth al degree ought behaue selues euery one theyr vocation callyng may please god woorke whiche acceptable eye hys diuine maiestie bryngeth health lyfe saluation glorification many beleue accordyng testimonie paule ashamed gospel christ power god vnto saluation euery one ye beleueth rom likewise saith sainct iames epistle lay apart filthynes superfluitie maliciousnes iac receaue mekenes worde graffed able saue soules may one make ende ende may founde endlesse matter scripture geuen inspiration god profitable apostle saieth teache2 timoth improue amend instructe righteousnes man god may perfect prepared vnto good workes thus haue heard dere brother precious pearle ioyfull iewell noble treasure woorde god also inestimable fruictes incomparable commodity vnoutspeakable profites bryngeth vnto v uerily woorthe precious stone thynges salomon saieth thou canst desyre pro compared vnto gettyng better marchandise syluer profite better gold upon ryght hand long lyfe vpon left hande richesse honour way pleasant wayes pathes peaceable tree lyfe lay holde vpon blessed kepeth faste doctrine better syluer pro knowledge thereof worthe fyne gold precious stone blessed man heareth word god watching dayly gate geuyng attendance postes doores fyndeth fyndeth lyfe shall obteyne fauoure lorde offendeth agaynste hurteth owne soule hate louers deathe fruictes comodities profites receyue word god haue tofore partly heard pro salomon addeth saith worde god geueth long life maketh walke safely slepe swetely deliuereth sodain feare pro preserueth embrace promoteth bringeth vnto honor lyfe vnto health vnto al body pro deliuereth straunge woman harlote geueth swete woordes enricheth louers wisedome knowledge vnderstanding doctrine learning councell pro magnanimitie strength righteousnes iudgement richesse wealth prosperitie honour renoume glorie c incomparable treasure meane woorde god fruites therof hath god great mercy committed vnto callyng vnto ministerie moste glorious gospell vnto dispensation diuine misteries ye become dumbe dogges able barke ye conceale hyde kepe secrete ioyfull iewels precious pearles ye publish sette foorth declare make knowen sauiour christe saieth citie sette hyll hyd neither doo men lyght candel esa put vnder bushell candell sticke geueth lyght vnto house agayn tell darknes speake ye lyghte ye heare eare preache ye house top god wyll haue mystery lawes decree statute testimony blased abrode math made knowen creature kept houcker tongethe office spirituall pastore exorcise coniure water salt bread candle fyre palmes ash c offer sacrifice quicke dead hear auricular confession absolue men synnes fewe latin wordes c preache gospell poore euangelicall hystorie saieth esa luc let v go next townes may preache also therfore come preached sayeth euangelist theyr synagoges galilee sayth marc must preache also city gospell kyngdome god ende sent ye therfore sent christ luc called vnto ministerie haue rather thruste selues hope worldly gayne bodyly ease euen entent ye maye lyue wealthylye ydelly labour mennes handes sweate mennes browes bee feared greate number doo present daye rather seekyng owne profyte flocke ye sent preache mennes tradition gospell kyngdome god commission christe gaue apostle marc theyr successours goe sayeth thoroughe worlde preache gospell euerye creature ye therefore bee successours christes apostle haue ye receaued iniunction frome hyghe shepehearde euerlastynge byshoppe iesus christe preache gospelle neyther canne ye bee disciple excepte ye earnestly studye obeye fulfyll iniunction christe woulde haue loue hys apostle towarde hym none otherwyse knowen iohn feedynge lambes shepe thou louest sayeth feede lambes feede shepe fede shepe ye therefore wyll shewe selues loue christe muste ye feede flocke christ sainct peter saieth elder whiche among exhorte whyche also elder1 pet wytnesse affliction christe also partaker glorye shall bee opened feede ye christes flocke muche lieth takyng ouersyght theym compelled thereto wyllynglye desyre fylthy lucre good mynde thoughe ye lordes ouer paryshes ye ensample flocke whenne chiefe shephearde shall appeare ye shall receaue incorruptible crowne glorie yf ye feede flocke christe rather selues ezech ye eate vp fatte ye clothe selues wyth wolle ye deuoure mylke yet laboure aboute safe kepyng flocke rather churlyshly cruelly reigne rule ouer catchyng snatchynge frome theym ye gette scattered shepe without shephearde deuoured beastes fielde howe ye iustly saye ye loue christ thou louest saith fede lambes fede shepe agayne ye frendes ye doo thynges iohn commaunde christe hathe commaunded feede flocke preache gospell ye doo ye christes frendes louers yf ye doo ye foe ennemies christe saieth good shepheard geueth lyfe hys shepe signifyinge hereby whiche faithfull feder trewe pastor lordes flocke1 doth faithfully truely feede shepe also yf nede require redy bestow lyfe al euer hath safegarde flocke thynges found ye good shepheardes ye doo teache rather reache muche ye get bearyng good affection towarde flocke concernyng theyr saluation seking ye comoditie shepe priuat lucre gain ye shepheardes hyrelynges pastor wolues heardmen teacher theues robber kepers murtherers theefe commeth saieth oure sauioure christe steale iohn kylle destroye agayn hirelyng seeth wolfe commynge leaueth shepe fleeth wolfe catcheth scattereth shepe math luc christe requireth suche bee ministerye faithfull wise seruants euen due time wil geue meate lordes houshold christ calleth seruant blessed lord commeth shal fynd doynga spirituall pastore ought faythfull wise addeth ouer saith lord wil make hym ruler ouer al goodes heare required ye true seruautes fyrst ye bee faithfull paule sayth required minister christ steward secretes god1 cor man found faith fullfaythefull ye shall shew selues faithfull ye truely faithfully purely syncerely diligently behaue selues accordyng commission executyng youre lordes maisters commaundement may display sette abrode owne fancie yet decree tradition ye must publish set forth good wyl plesure lord al sinceritie purenes without corruption comixtion man doctrine yea sort conteyned commission alwais remembring ye legate embassadours moste myghtye kyng yea ye mouthe moste hygh god heareth luc math heareth saieth christ agayne ye speake spirite father whiche speaketh faythefull true ambassadour symply playnly without addition diminution expresseth lordes mynd wyll pleasure suche sent vnto euen shall ye shewe selues faithfull seruantes ye vtter vnto people thynges onely conteyned commission say sacred bible sauiour christ saieth teachynge obserue thynges math soeuer haue commaunded notable wordes noble eloquent doctor iohn chrysostom nothing ought put vnto word god rom pluckt away proper peculiar worke office embassadour onely carye thynges committed vnto hym therefore priest called embassadour malach declareth hys owne matter matter hym sent hym sayeth apostle sent vnto ende vtter declare sette foorth thynges receaued shoulde put thyng thervnto theyr owne secondly required youwyse prudent ye onely faithfull also wyse prudent seruantes wherby signified ye ought haue onely zeale doo good many vnlearned minister pretende nowe dayes also wysedome knowledge vnderstandyng good howe doo duetie howe accomplishe enioyned commission lest sayd written iewes rom haue feruent zeale good mynde godwarde accordyng knowlege minister seruantes lord may lyke horse moyles haue vnderstandyng psal suche must theyr knowledge may able thapostle saieth exhort wholsome learnyng tit improue speke priest lip saieth prophet sure knowledge men may seke law mouth holy ghoste throughly furnyshed wysdome knowledge vnderstandyng holy scripture ready tymes geue euen lyues nede require glory god confirmation theyr doctrine healthe flock christ purchased precious blood apostle saith act holy ghost witnesseth euery citie sayeng bandes trouble abyde none thynges moue neyther lyfe deare vnto may fulfyll course ioy ministration word haue receued lord iesu testify gospel grace god act agayn redy bound also dy name lorde iesu ignorancie lacke knowledgeignorancy discommendable common persones ought teacher onely discommendable also intollerable yea abhominable christe sayth blynde leade blynde bothe falle dyche math agayn lyght body eye wherfore eie single body shalbe full lyght thyne eye wicked math thy body shalbe full darknes wherfore lyght thee darknes great darknesse becommeth professe selues guide blynde lyghtes darknesse rom informer whiche lacke discretion teacher vnlearned c ignorant vnlearned voyde knowledge god mystery vtterly estraunged man god wyse psalmograph saith vndefiled lawe lord turneth soules faithfull wytnes lorde geueth wysedom vnto babe psal litle fidelitie profite wysedome wanteth thyrdly required ye geue meate lordes heede ye defraude lordes familie theyr foode sustenance euer settynge eye saying wyse man word god preached people peryshe prouerb quarter sermon preachyng ought suffise lordes householde worde god oughte continually ministred sette lordes familie god hym selfe saieth prophet cry cease lyft vp thy voyce trompe shew vnto people wickedness esa house iacob theyr synnes agayn haue sette watchemen vppon thy walles hierusalem whyche shall neyther ceasse daye nyght preache esa godly inspired apostle sainct paule saithe wrytyng vnto byshop timothe2 timoth preach thou worde feruent season season improue rebuke exhort long sufferyng doctrine tyme wyl come shall suffer wholsome doctrine owne lustes shall whose eares itche gette heape teacher shall withdrawe theyr eares trueth shall turned vnto fable watche thou thynges suffer affliction worke throughly euangeliste fulfyll thyne office vttermoste blessed luke chronicle apostle actes wytnesseth sainct paule sendyng elder god congregation ephesus come mileton vnto hym act among spake woordes vnto take recorde daye pure bloode menne haue spared labour haue shewed counsayle god take hede therefore vnto selues flocke amonge holy ghost hath made ouerseers rule congregation god whiche hath purchased hys bloode sure departyng shall greuous wolues enter among sparyng flocke moreouer owne selues shall men aryse speakynge peruerse thynges drawe disciple therfore awake remember space three yeares ceased warne euery one night daye wyth teares peter speakyng hym selfe2 pet writeth maner wyll bee negligente put alwayes remembrance suche thynges though ye knowe selues stablyshed present truthe withstandyng thynke mete longe tabernacle stere vp puttyng remembrance c thus ye see diligence required feedynge lordes housholde wyth holy worde god office aboue maye mean neglected herein maye speake consisteth either saluation damnation bothe lordes householde god saythe prophete ezech thou sonne man haue made thee watcheman vnto house israell thou hearest thyng mouth thou mayst warn behalfe saye vnto wycked thou wicked thou shalt surely dye thou geuest hym warning may beware vngodly way wicked shal die owne sinne blood require thy hande neuertheles thou warne wicked way turn fro yet turned shal die sinne thou hast deliuered thy soule wicked turne fro sinnes thing yt laufull right shall surely liue dye yea sinnes hath done shall neuer thought vpon somuche doth thyng laufull ryght shall lyue ye tongue tyed playe placebo ye reproue wycked worde god theyr wickednes suffer go forthe theyr wickednes though good righteous fautlesse bryng ye damnation bothe vpon selues vpon yf ye sharpely rebuke wicked theyr wyckednesse meanes turne theyr lewdnes woorke whyche good pleasant eye god maiestie ye shall bring well suche labour worde teachyng oxe treadeth corne labourer double honoure due none one agayn sayth2 timoth husband man laboureth muste fyrst receaue fruictes ye wyll reape fruictes ye muste fyrste worlde come yea saieth sauioure christ blessed seruant lord commeth shall fynde doyng uerily say vnto shal make hym ruler ouer goodes chiefe shepheard shall appeare sayth blessed peter faythful pastor ye shall receaue incorruptible crowne glorie1 pet wordes prophete daniel concernyng rewarde true preacher dan wyse suche haue taught shall glyster shynyng heauen haue instruct multitude vnto godlynes shalbe starres worlde without ende yea written gospel shall shyne sunne kyngdom heauenly father math math shalbe angel god heauen contrarywyse ye negligent slouthfull euyl wycked seruantes ye feede lordes housholde rather begyn stryke churlyshely handle felow seruauntes math luc yea eate drynke dronkardes lorde shall come daye ye looke hym hower ye bee ware shall hewe piece geue portion hypocrite wepyng gnashyng teethe shall esa worme shall gnawe youre conscience shall neuer dye fyre wherwith ye shall moste greuously tormented shall neuer quenched yea lake whereinto ye shall cast shall burne fyre brymstone apo worldes without ende thynges doubt moste dere brother ye dayly diligently consyder also labour vttermoste power satisfye good pleasure god framynge selues doo whyche sweete sauioure christ iesv assembled math iohn gathered together thy holye blessed glorious name heare healthfulle woordes euerlastynge lyfe conteyned thy pure lyuely gospell whych power god vnto saluation euery one beleueth whiche also able thorow workyng holy spirite saue soules rom iac one heart one mynde approche present vnto gracious throne thy diuine maiestie moste humbly besechyng thee psal iohn cor ephe tit luc iohn math forasmuche selues owne nature altogether corrupte ignoraunt blynde vtterly estranged felyng perceauynge thy diuine mystery suche ignorance blyndnesse thorow olde adam may please thee thy mercyfull goodnesse thy holy blessed spirite open sens leade v truthe purifie heartes make oure myndes mete vessel receaue swete wyne thy swete glorious gospell open thou eye may see wondrous thinges thy lawe psal hyde thy commaundementes frome v teache v thy statute make v vnderstand way thy commaundementes may talke thy meruailous workes teache v lord way thy statute make v go pathe thy commandementes encline heartes vnto thy testimony quicken v thy wayes take worde truthe oute mouthe geue v vnderstandyng acordyng thy word may learne thy commandementes occupied thy lawes let oure heartes sounde thy statute neuer ashamed shewe lyght thy countenance vpon v thy seruantes teache v thy testimony order oure steppe thy worde wickednes may haue dominion ouer v sanctifie v thorowe thy truthe iohn thy woorde truthe geue thy minister stewarde mystery god well learned tongue may confort whiche troubled1 cor esa esa yea due season may shew good tydynges vnto poore maye bynde vp wounded heartes may preache deliueraunce captiues open prison bound may make ioyfull heauynesse thorowe thy worde geue mourne beaultie stede ash ioyefull oyntment syghyng ezech pleasant rayement heauye mynde may hold vp weake maye heale sycke may bynd together broken esa may bryng agayne outcaste seke vp loste thys people may called tree righteousnesse plantynge lorde hym reioyce geue mouthe spirite wisedome luc act p l agaynst whyche aduersaries thy truthe shall able speake resyst geue preache thy worde great power may able exhort wholsome doctrine improue speake passe haue preached other1 cor selfe cast away become slaunder good doctrine professe teache geue also people gathered together heare worde saluation good spirite al cloudes ignorancie brought olde adam vtterly dispelled driuen away may learne knowe thee theyr alone sauiour knowledge perfect righteousnesse sap iohn roote immortalitie yea euerlastyng lyfe without whyche knowledge moyles horse voyde goodnes grace walkyng vanity owne imagination vtterly estranged god godlynesse moste louynge lorde open theyr heartes may vnderstand thorough preachyng word thy holy blessed wyll always doo whiche carnall reason fleshly imagination blynd zeale good intent humayne wysedome iudgeth good holy whiche thou thy blessed lawe commaundest doone strange woorshippynges vtterly excluded banyshed swete sauiour math make good earth receuing healthfull sede thy moste wholsom worde may bryng forth fruite plentuously hundred folde sixty folde thirty folde phil tit iac geue theym grace lyue behaue selues poyntes becommeth embrace thy gospell lette theym bee number whyche wyth theyr mouth professe god deedes denye hym make onely diligente hearer thy woorde also feruent earnest doer math let lyke fyue foolishe virgin whiche hadde lampes oyle rather woorke theym thy holy spirite maye worthyly resembled fyue wyse virgin whyche onely lampes also oyle lampes saye dyd onely beare name chrystians theyr conuersation also garnyshed wyth woorkes meete seemely christian make suche man iustely complayne euen vnfayned sonnes god without rebuke phil shynynge greate lyghtes worlde euen myddes croked peruerse nation holdyng faste woorde lyfe whyche backebyte euyll doer seynge theyr good workes1 pet may cease speake euyll glorifie thee lord god day visitation fynally graunt bothe preacher hearer manye vnfaynedly professe thy blessed name grace strength aboue maye soo handle heare thy woorde iac beynge forgetfull hearer diligent doer may thorowe faithe thee obteyne blessyng whyche thou haste promysed theym heare worde god luc kepe grant thys moste louyng lorde swete sauiour thy greate mercy goodnes sake amen shorter prayer sermon almyghty god moste mercyfull father authour geuer wysedome whych intercession thy welbeloued sonne eccle iac iohn luc act iesus christ lorde sauiour diddest sende downe accordyng thy promyse thy holy spirit lyghten heartes sens apostle could syncerely vnderstande hygh mystery thy diuine wyll moste humbly beseche thee cloudes ignorancie darknes dispelled put away beyng gathered together thy name may thorow thy spirite enioye lyghte thy eternall veritie reuerentely preache mekely heare thy moste blessed worde present vnderstandynge beyng enflamed loue therof may poyntes fashion oure lyfe accordyng thy holy wyll seriously prouide light actes maners maye shyne men seyng good workes math may glorifye thee father arte heauen wyth thy derely beloued sonne iesus christe holy ghost three distinct persones deitie yet one true perfect god essence bee honoure prayse glory euermore amen thankes geuynge sermon prayse honour glorye vnto thee heauenlye father whiche tyme haste fedde v wyth meate perysheth iohn abydeth vnto euerlastynge life graunt moste humbly besech thee hauynge knowlege thy word may also practise conuersatio bothe entierly louyng vnfaynedly lyuyng bothe heartily fauoryng earnestly folowyng couragiously professynge diligentely practisyng thy holy heauenly worde maye mortall lyfe lyue thee lyfe whyche immortall thorowe iesvs christ lorde amen geue glorie god alone first sonday aduent pthe gospell mathew xxi drew nygh ierusalem come bethphage vnto mount oliuet sent iesus two disciple saying vnto go towne lieth ouer anone shall fynde asse bound colte louse bryng vnto man saye ought vnto saye ye lord hath nede streight way let go doone might fulfilled spoken prophet saying tell ye daughter sion behold thy kyng commeth vnto thee meke sitting vpon asse colte foale asse vsed yoke disciple went iesus co maunded brought asse colte put theyr clothes set theron many people spred theyr garment waye cut downe branch tree strawed waye moreouer people went came cryed saying hosanna sonne dauid blessed commeth name lord hosanna hyghest come ierusalem citie moued saying people sayd iesus prophete nazareth citie galile iesus went temple god cast solde bought temple ouerthrue table money changer seates solde doues saide vnto written house shall called house prayer ye haue made denne theues exposition people israel many notable excellent promyses concerning messias christ shoulde come lyfe set vp euerlastyng kingdom deliuer people euyl geue helpe euer appereth writynges prophetes preache magnificently kyngdom christ come promise amongest people greatly hindered false prophet teachersof kyng christ kyngdom whiche dyd expounde promise though kyng worldly maner shold come kyngdom great magnificence pompe aduaunce people hygh dignitie power might made lordes ruler prouinces tyme persuaded haue opinion messias kingdom tha soone commeth shalbe chiefe heades ouer gentile shalbe bondman vnderstand haue nede christes coming ende might deliuered synne eternall death wherfore lewde perswasion myghte remaine people peryll god longe raised vp zacharie prophetewhy zacharye prophcied low degre christ long co commyng shew vnto christ shoulde come facion kynges kyngly apparel loftynes great pride imperie rule saith like begger hystorie gospell nowe entreate declareth lest people shold haue excuse pretend would haue receaued kyng ben ignorant matter mysterie opened vnto many yeares prophete zacharie act christ done priuie solitarie place came lyght daye tyme vnto people begger rydyng man asse nothyng prepared redy purpose muche disciple fayn helpe poore kyng casting clothes pompe myght somwhat likely wherfore iewes excuse themselues way prophecie euidet whe christ shall come kyngdome ierusalem shall come maner kyngs gret shewe horse armie gospell saieth meke prophet poore though prophete spake admonysh wise marke diligently asse knowe christe sitteth thereon wherfore wyse looke scepter diademe kynges robe christ shall come poore meke humble shewynge foorth hym selfe asse shall magnificence glorie whiche shall shewe worlde pompe commyng ierusalem cause christe vsed thys pompe suffred matter done also great circumspection christ declareth hereby sufficiently committeth thynges done diligence commeth night priuily openly daye entreth ierusalem alone greate multitude people goeth aduanceth praise sonne dauid wishe kingdome might prosperous matter done openly must nedes knowen citie commyng let behold asse poore kynge whiche zacharie prophecied gaue warning iewes offended poore shew humble lowly coming christ rather condemne imagination thought christ shoulde come gloriously sight worlde shalbe kyng saieth prophet yet pouertie miserie without al princely reputation matter consydered custom world prince prophete also speaketh power kyngwhat power kyng righteousnes ioyned wyth pouertie calleth hym righteous sauiour riche fortunate glorious kyng worlde righteous sauior whiche bryngeth hym iustice saluation destroyeth synne death enemie synne death whiche shall delyuer synne death beleue hym take hym theyr kyng offeded borowed asse haue geuen vnto remission synne remedye agaynst deathe attainement euerlastyng lyfe althoughe body dye buried yet called death rather slepe zacharie wyll teache v christ geueth two name righteous sauior whiche may deathe deathe destroy power deuyll meanes deliuer v beleue hym sinne death transpose v kingdom angel wher life saluation left kynges worlde glorie richesse tower palace let lyue glorie neuer muche buyld neuer gorgeouslythe kyngedome worlde suche power christ theyr apparell neuer costely yet haue power whiche poore kyng emperor kyng pope mighty hys power delyuer v least synne heale small disease richesse hath shall say haue muche lesse power agaynst euerlastyng deathe hell poore kyng onely helpeth therin one synne al sinne agaynst synnes agaynst synnes whole worlde came onely take awaye disease also death onely death also deathe world tell sayth prophet daughter syon offended lowe behauiour shut vp eies open eares let consyder howe poore kyng syght word doth teache kyng pouertie open forasmuche commeth asse without ridyng apparell forgeueth synne deliuereth death geueth saluation euerlastyng life sanctified sene wherfore word therof herd beleued saith zacharie tel daughter sion may knowe moued offended commeth pore vnto people dyeth shamefull deathe thynges doone thy sake thou thys sauior mightest saued deuyl death purpose sanctifie thee delyuer fro synne endeuours vayne regarde sence eares loke haue allowed eies kyng differeth muche kyngs euer great magnificence pompe christe fyrst baptisme gaue v strength wher ar deliuered sinne death eies se nothing comon water included word pronunciation therofthe ryghtuousnes saluation christ baptisme supper lorde gospell eies see nothing breath man must ware folowe iudgement eye eies ar shut vp eares opened worde heard whiche teacheth lord iesu christ shed bloode remission synnes euerlastyng lyfe gyftes founde suretie holye baptisme supper lorde preachynge gospell true simplicitie therof ar thought haue great efficacie lauer water supper lorde beware thy eies bring straite semeth absurde thyng eies people came vile asse crucified shoulde thought haue power agaynst synne death hell man sight clere see prophet saith therfore matter nede eies faithe eares wherfore sayth euangelist tell daughter syon prophete sayth reioyce syon glad daunce leape ioye ierusalem beholde thy kyng commeth maner kyng righteous kyng sauior shall sanctifie thee saue thee wyl communicate righteousnes saluation thee thou myghtest free synne wyl dye thee thou death mayst delyuered frome eternall death wherfore let great pouertie hym offend thee thy lyfe saluation lyeth hydde hym geue thankes benefyte vse thy comforte thynges doone thy saluation wherfore kyng iesus christthe lyfe saluation congregation lyeth hid pouertie christ kingdome office handleth tax tribute careth tower worldly magnificence come marke deathe lyue longer office kyng passion death may walke paradise say maner sanctified kyng iesus christe whiche cause came vile forme would crucified myghte sanctifie might slea synne death beleueth wise heareth preached gospell shalbe sure saluation therfore baptisme ordeined christe might put iustice holynes innocencie may become thyne right al miserable synners baptisme christ doth comfort v saith geue thy synnes take thou rightousnes holynes let thy death taken thee lyfe put thee wherfore doctrine ought gladly receiued godlynes therofthe worlde vnkynd lyght also ought declared lyfe god myght seme haue geuen lyght vayne vnto earthe chanceth contrarywise world made oftentimes worse doctrine diuel reigning al kingdom vnkynd worldly man greate grace god matter playne nowe auarice couetousnes crueltie impudent lechery aduoutrie wickednes vnder popedome cause uerily thing gladly receiue doctrin behoueth set naught care golde rich incomparable treasure christ sonne god brought downe v heauen wherfore punishement deserued wherwith god plagueth vnkynde person thou sayth thinkest thy self vnworthy geue tha kes delyuer thee great euyls frome syn death truly wil make thou shalt greuously trauaile vnder sinne death seyng thou louest wel luc wher thou danger one diuel nowe shalt thou vexed seuen worsean abhortatio ware danger wherfore adhorie doctrine godly feare thakfull pray god hart may confirme fayth ye may kepe suche doctrine wherby shall come passe made daily sobre obedient gentle chast better nature doctrine make men ful modestie softnes obedience chastitie cast becom seuen tymes worse without doctrine example doo testifie euery wherfore take ye hede truly tyme come come without doubt god shall reuenge vnkyndnes shall sene world hath deserued vnkyndnesto v spoken kyngdome christe wherfore marke wel hystorie gospel seyng iewes woulde voyce prophete sayd vnto v kyng commeth meke poore shoulde offended neither haue respect pope rich worlde let v consyder kinge righteous sauiour whiche deliuereth v sinne deathe taught receaue gladly louingely geue god thankes least ye fayne receiue deuyll howling wailing gnashing teeth whiche thyng adhorted also example apostle otherthe example ye apostle trayn kyng seyng christ kyng must nedes haue kyngedome people people muste shewe due seruice kyngethe fyrst seruice thys king halowed thy name seruice hystorie declareth found knowlege lord iesu kyng come ashamed amongest waiting men asse poore kynge amongest apostle firstwhat asse colt signifieth knowledge lord iesu christ true messias shall iustifie become sauiour agaynst synne death wherfore bring vnto christe asse councell iewes go christ whiche hytherto haue lyued vnder lawe haue borne burden therof lyke ass asse bryng colt also vnto christ gentile yt yet tamed neither wer vnder lawe christ sauior men wherfore al true euangelists teacher ought bring men vnto christ one seruice due kyng knowen receyued glorified men rightuous sauiour second seruice isthe seconde worship thy kingdo come sing osanna christ asse haue receaued sauiour knowledge hym kyng men wyshe well kyngdom thynges belonge aduancyng thys kyngdome although offend phariseis chief priestes neuer muche osanna signifieth saue lord blesse lord sonne dauid say lordes prayer thy kyngdome come diuell membres cease go abolyshe leaste corrupte kyngdome haue nede prayer may please god infringe represse enterprise diuell third pray also put clothesthe third thy wyll bee fulfylled sprede lord christ way pompe comming may syghtfull beggarly done accordyng abilitie helpe ministery worde may plentie teacher good men teachyng lyuyng maye gouerners congregation also nowe minister may handled may see duetie geue selfe studye fall away ministration lack lyuyng busied thyngs haue leasure doo theyr duetie short soeuer thyngs rich bestowed vse ministration cogregation may wel ordred maie haue true pastor vnderstanded clothes ar spread christ commyng may somewhat kynglike began seruice kyngthus must seruice doone kyng neither care thou priestes phariseys whiche moued sclender pompe al let christ doth suffer kynge canne without people hath nede also serued like kinge happy serue king king serue v againe rich store base thyng king righteousnes agaynst synne saluation death dampnation wherefore expedient redy glad doo king seruice neither let v offended example pope bishop suche bring asse christ apostle put theron thei may ride vpon asse themselues may kepe men vnder danger doctrine list thei make christ go foote neither suffer come gospell turne men eies vnto hym false doctours haue disciple also whyche flatter theim strawe boughes palmes oliues waye cast stone christ persecute hym gospell professe daye shall knowe iewes haue despised righteous kyng sauiour therfore shall suffer wrathe god euer wheras contrary haue receaued hym confessed hym hath become parteners haue shall obteine hym iustice euerlasting lyfe whiche thyng truste wishe might chance vnto v lorde iesu christe sauiour amen seconde sonday aduent pthe gospell luke xxi shalbe signes sonne moon starres earth people shalbe wittes ende despaire sea water shall roare men heartes shal fayle feare lokyng thing shall come earthe power heauen shall moue shall see sonne man come cloude power great glory whe thing begyn come passe loke vp lyft vp youre heades youre redemption draweth nye shewed similitude beholde fygge tree al tree shoote foorth buddes ye see knowe youre owne selues sommer nye hand lykewise ye also ye see thynges come passe sure kyngdome god nye uerily say vnto generation shall passe tyll fulfylled heauen earth shall passe wordes shall passe exposition signes god goeth fore strange new mutation maner hath lord god vsed alwayes beginnyng vnwonted thynge hath alwais sent great meruailous signes wold punishe egyptian deliuer child make peculiar people sette foorth many great wonderfull token kinde plage frogges locustes botch suche lyke dyd greatly hurt egyptian vntill length first borne slayne one nyght remnant people drowned vp red sea amonge iewes thinges good signes led dry foote red sea drowned enemy giueth manna suche lyke thinges token god would worke new practise people shold kingdome common wealthe also woulde punishe iewes ordeyne congregation christe honge vpon crosse graues wer opened dead came went ierusalem strange eclipse moone chanced vayle temple rent dydde signifie straunge thynge come abolishing old experience proued wher seruice iewes vanyshed away christe sette vp newe kyngdome iewes lerned often owne peryll wherfore apostle come christe question sygnes come destruction ierusalem ende worlde onely eternall kyngdome christ commeththe apostle asketh destruction ierusalem also destruction world christ answereth concernynge destruction ierusalem ye shall see sayth ierusalem sieged wyth host know ye desolation farre therefore counsaileth flee vnto mountain god wrathe pacified lyke maner teacheth also concernynge last day ye shal se signes sonne moon starres sea fluddes men heauen thynges saythe begynne come passe must deferre vntyll men thynke paste make lyght though suche thynges hath chaunced take good hede thynk time iest laugh signes signes certayn last day draweth nyghquestion question signes shalbe whether shall fall together oughte bee demaunded christ sayth hym selfe begynneth come passe must ye looke vp therfore beleue certayn thyngs perchance part shal come passe day beginneth opened wherfore sufficient christe teacheth signes must marked looked forwhere signes muste marked heauen sonne moone starres men sea shalbe sene ye must loke shall come passe muste make v redy season maye prepared receauyng daysignes sonne moone two maner signes sette foorth shewed sonne moone fyrste haue eclipse although naturall motion art may wel knowen signe chance yet signe playnely expressed mathew likewise also may signes sonne could knowe chaunceth sodeynly perceyued prognosticator thing thought vpon eclipse yt time christ crosse reason art eclipse son coniunction beginnyng moone opposition day moneth naturall wherfore eclipse great signe although haue sene yet may chance sodenly loke also xx yeares haue sene many strange thing ar counted strange seldom bough copasse sonne great bignesse sonne semed come downe sonnes one yet lyke thing signified hereby neuer proued saw wherfore haue sygnes sufficient sonne nede carelesse looke true healthfull comming lorde signes christ speaketh ofthe signes sea water great rorynges noise sea wheras thinges neuer chance comonly great destructio euen naturall death approcheth first vexed sycknes beginneth diseased ye feuer pesti ence disease thynges token must leaue lyfe world also shal man wold say waxe sick heauen sonne moone starres men water thinges maye signify geue warning notable infirmitie sickenes miserable affliction vtterly perishe touching signes menthe sygnes men thynke fully declared tyme detestable pope doctrine hath promoted set forwarde signes fearefull conscience haue bene much vexed muche taughte greuous synne go confession pray fast masse c suche vexation manne coulde learne howe rydde hym selfe therof trewe comforte remyssion synnes throughe christe abolyshed laste sette vp place tourment nowe thys satisfaction may well beleue chiefest myserye earthe deede sawe manye whyche coulde byde tremblyng dreade dydde feare pensiuenes despaire mystrusted wer able susteyn god iudgement pope doctrin brought v opinion yt feared christ horrible iudge many haue case thought hope saluatio loked christ cause prayed virgin mary would bee theyr patronesse make intercession theym suche iudge man knew thyng christ cleane loste wherfore thyng looked dyd tremble quake thought iudge wherfore thynk greatest part signe past iudge likewise celestiall signes lest part remaineth thei yet come passe yet may chaunce dayely done neuer lesse must nothyng slacke caryng therfore may redy mete day christ hereafter dothe exhort v ende christ speaketh also prodigious signe sayth men shal pyne away feare dreadful expectation thinges shall chance worlde speaketh confusion whiche excedyng great thereof chaunceth men feare signes laste daya speciall con usion men suche wycked vngodly godly timorous wherfore ioyne signes meanyng therof whiche wicked doo foolyshely despise thynke themselfe wyse doynge many suche sygnes hath chanced yet day came wherefore see signes dayely heare better neyther doo thynke thyngs chance last day shewed make ware circumspect suche despisers dothe christe caste frome hym seynge dull hartedthe wycked despise sygnes nothynge moued signes much lesse wyll care woorde doctrine good whiche marke signes moued dothe christe take cure comforteth swetely sort forasmuch confesse christ set worde wyll depart wyllyngly denye ought afrayde abashed syght sygnes bee neuer horrible dreadefullthe comyng christ signes shall see sayth christ sonne man commyng clowde power great glorye magnificence passeth triumphes kynges emperours shall ayre full angelles sainctes whiche shall shyne bryghter sonne christe shall myddest elect shal geue sentence agaynst damned whiche shall stande beneth earthe dyuell tremblyng quakyng wherfore sayth christ thynges begyn come passe loke vp lyft vp heades good chere see ye mery thynges must done worlde muste nedes fall must fyrste geue cracke great buildyng fall except thinges therof fyrst shake pluckt piecesthese signes geuen terrify congregation man nowe poynt death wrastleth rolleth eye mouthe membres face waxeth pale hym sene great deformitie suche shall facion worlde shall nowe perishe say vnto discoraged myndes lyfte vp youre heades may pleasure behold thyngesthese signes geuen terrifie congregation occasion ioy despised redemption saith hande meane beleue beleue shalbe condempned wherfore ought fearethe cause ioy signes christ shall bryng thing heauen beleuers godly hell damnation speaketh christ godly whiche also shall afrayde sonne moon shal change countenance world shall full signesthe sainctes also fear signes deathe sainctes bee stronge yea peter paule would thynke signes fearfull lyuyng strong saith christe shall horrible syght shall hurt shall hurt dyuell vngodly shall come therof saluation moste ioyfull redemption whiche ye haue desyred greately haue prayed kingdom come synnes forgeuen selues delyuered euill thyng therfore ye haue prayed longe hartily shall nowe geuen vnto called day redemption wherfore latter day may wel called day damnation redemptionthe last daye day da nation redemption daye sorowe ioye daye hell kyngedome heauen christ xxiiij mathew sayth shall tribe earth lament myth shall god grace amongest wyll leaue pope fantasticall spirites wrongfull extorcioners wicked citizen seditious people suche whiche leaueth kynde wronge vndoone whiche persecute gospell begynners euyls shall smoke nowe oppressed theyr myghte dare looke face whiche wepe vexed shall tyme laugh see face howe dryuen dyuell hell wherfore although shall seme dreadfull vnto afrayde seeke corner hyde inchristes commyng terrible oppressed congregation myght delyuered whenne thynges begynne come passe lyfte vp heades meryly stryue agaynste youre temptation remembre ye woulde haue suche one ye woulde haue redemer fyrste must oppresse hold captiue robber taken thee put thee castell thou heardest castell strongely besieged thou woldest care muche cruelnes thy enemy woldest rather reioyce thou knewest doone thy sake thou myghtest delyuered thy enemy thinke ye also ought seme terrible world shall plunge miserably greuously tormented punyshement prouided whome ye made complaynte wherfore take comynge comyng youre saluation come condemne helle delyuer wycked frowarde corrupte worlde separate dyuell garde put amongest angel ye shall suffer euyll haue fruition euerlastyng lyfe comforte belongeth goodly similitude treeschristes co myng lyke sprynge spryng sayth wynter ende earthe renewed colde departeth heate approcheth bare tree begynne bee greene wyth newe bowghes thynge foloweth hereof tree bryng foorthe buddes spreade abroade theyr leaues common saying wynter gone goodlye sommer draweth nyghe gladly let wynter depart imbrace pleasant sommer hys commyng therfore similitude tree may haue euident resons declaring maner ought loke last day leaues commeth sommer earth shalbe moued heauens shall tremble sonne moone shall appere mourneful let thyngs seme dreadfull vnto v tender leaues crepe forth tree sommer begynneth come sygnes v euen leaues iuyce tree may ioyfully looke euerlastyng sommer presente miserable lyfe well compared bareyn euil fauored winter whiche thyng dye wyther awaye thynges shall come ende euerlastynge sommer shall come theyr stede kyngedome god whereby kyngdome deuyll shall peryshe manye myseries geuen punisshement earthe ye lyue amongest couetous wycked blaspheme curse gospell stirre vp mischiefe worlde muste see looke daiely worse frome thynges deliuer commyng ye may constrayned behold longer wickednes wherfore terrible state world doth com enemy haue good cause afrayde sorowfull reioyce ye godly loth dyd whiche sayth peter dwelt sodoma figure destructio sodome compared destructio worlde constreigned innocent eye eares heare se detestable synnes vntill grew fulnesse ripenesse god coulde lenger refrayne came two angel whyche ledde godly loth citie surely thyng without terrible sighte element horrible wyth clowdes thunder hard clowde wente aparte great wydenesse brymstone fyre fell downe rayne gaspyng ground ensued swalowed thinges otherwise thought loth greatly dismayd thyngs comfort hande horrible dredful tempest dyd strike hym sodomite whyche beleued word god gaue themselues kynd abhominable lewdnesse yea without al mesure must nedes meruailously troubled fyry rayne godly loth behelde tempest pleasant tree spryng tyme putteth forth buddes beginneth grene feeleth receyueth helpe mercyfull deliuerance wicked shall chaunce v also latter daye befall oure lyfe tyme shall seeme terrible thyng heauen earthe shall burne shalbe changed moment dye christian man must take eye iudges marke howe christe doeth expound flower boughes moste pleasant albeitthe sume doctrine co cernynge last day greuous syght worlde shall terrifie abashe reason yet let heart truste worde god may feare outeward syght say mystrust hurte damage dothe signifie christe sayth euyll redemption redemer hande hayle redemer christe therfore come thou art wyshed haue desyred oftentymes prayed whyle lyued thy kyngdome myght com vnto receyue christ commyng maner shall momente chaunged glory may shyne sonne euer sort dooth christ teache v knowledge truly last day may lerne great succour haue therin also ought loke feruently desire comyng pope doctrine christes co myngthe pope preacheth christe seuere iudge must haue healpe hym good woorkes intercession saintes hadde yf manne wyll sure damnation hath put foorthe picture howe christe commeth iudgement howe holdeth swoorde rodde mouthe whiche bothe signes wroth mary iohn standeth bothe sydes shewethe prayer intercession suche good sainctes muste soughte trusted good father bernard persuaded hymself mother sheweth pappes sonne denye thyng whiche euident proofe christe come lyke seuere iudge gospell teacheth v otherwyse shall come iudge condemne v deliuer redeme v wil graunt dede praied bring v kingdom beleue vexe christian railyng reuilyng sharpe sentence punishe greuouslye thys saieth beleue ye onely looke comynge ioyfully shalbe welthe ye may saued euer synne deuyll deathe hell worlde greate comforte thys place one thyng remayneththe daye iudgemente shall come sodeynly wherby fearefull conscience troubled christ saieth daye shall come vnloked shal chance likewise men chanceth byrdes flee mornyng hungry woddes fynde meat somwhere suspectyng euyll bycause deceiued hope place sodeinly wrapped nettes taken killed thei feare god wil take hede therof proue dayly exaumples howe soone stande fall weake hearted soone ouerthrowen thynke vncertayne shall become morowe perchance houre wil come thou shalt vnready dydst see orels thou shalt entangled sinne art thou vndone ioyfull day shalbe chaunged mourninge doubt christ leaueth v comfortlessewhat done day iudgement sodayn vnto v teacheth christen men howe shall bee rydde pensifenes sayth see heart ouerladen surfet dronkennes care lyfe least daye oppresse vnwares watche tymes praye ye maye bee founde woorthye escape thynges shall chance stand sonne man excellent necessary doctrine whiche ought neuer fall myndes christ geueth iniunction forbear meat drink wholly neither pope dothe commandeth cast away thynges lyue oute worldes trouble god doeth disalowe vse meate drynke neyther vngodly prouide thyngs necessary household god cause made v worke take hede harte opprest thing much ye forget comyng watchewatche loke time ye wayt armed feare god good conscienceprayer fyrst ioyn herewith prayer temptation hard combrances may escaped ye may stande sonne man comprised two last petitio lordes prayer leade v temptation deliuer v yll ye wil peril whether daye come suppyng sleaping whether churche market place one shall fynd v feare protection god place noted god well prayde vnto neyther prayer bee true man careth leaue certayn vice amende lyfe wherefore true prayer required true repentance man sinne wittingly hynder consciencerepentance let v call vpon god mercy name lorde iesu christ kepe v true feare holye ghost helpe v agaynst synne preserue v true fayth vnto ende may ioyfully looke helthfull daie receaue iesu christe sauior confidence prayer thorough christ heard without doubt wherfore let v folowe counsell precepte wyse prepare oure selues expectation daye whiche thyng lord redemer iesu christe graunt v amen thirde sonday aduent pthe gospell math xi iohn beyng prison heards woorkes christ sent two hys disciple sayd vnto art thou shalt come doo loke iesus answered sayd vnto go shew iohn agayne ye haue hearde sene blynd receyue theyr syght lame walk lepres clensed deafe heare deade raised vppe poore receyue glad tydynges gospell happy offended departed iesus began say vnto people concernyng iohn went ye wildernes see rede shake wynd went ye see man clothed softe rayment behold weare foft clothyng kynges house wente ye oute see prophete merely say vnto prophete whome written beholde sende messanger thy face whiche shall prepare thy way exposition gospell sette foorth two doctrinesthe work god hyghly magnified fyrst highly esteme christes worde set greate price therby thyng great weighte shalbe described shamefull wicked vnkyndnes word see signes yet regarde neither beleue whiche horrible thyng first therefore word christ ought diligently hearde taught hereby iohn whe bandes soone heard workes christ sendeth disciple vnto hym commaundynge aske hym whether come concernyng many thynges written old testament prophetsthe question iohn disciple afterward many thinges shold spoken ye new testamet yt whether promysed christe written kyngdome people lawe moses shold endure vnto coming deuter afterward heard plainly spoken prophetes christe haue corporall kyngdom prophet lyke vnto moses yet come kynde doctrine moyses dyd deede iewes wel know wherfore chanced bandes iohn christe preached eternall lyfe kyngdome god seemed good iohn sende hys disciple vnto hym iohn mente sendyng disciple vnto christand sent onely testimony prophetes see eies prophet come last whome looked according prophecie moses wherfore message thyng iohn shold say knowe christ men beleue wherfore nowe go ye vnto hym learne hym ye may depart tradition iewes become disciple whome thynges necessary saluation saluation worlde chiefe cause message vnto christe iohns disciple myght see hym eye begyn acquainted hym beleue hym saued dooth christe answere messangers neyther denyeth neither affirmeth answereth symply workes sayth ye se heare fele esay esaie prophetes shewed christe lame goe blynde shoulde see c nowe see ye wyth youre eies ye haue nede declaration answer ye wil behaue selues vprightly matter thys aunswere christe wounderfull compriseth proprely oughte taughte christe settethe foorthe hys kyngdome magnificent thyng isof christe kyngdom called christes kyngdome suche kyngedome belongeth lame blynd leaprous spechelesse deade especially poore myserable synners sure haue succoure ought taught thys doctrine shoulde commonly proclaymed kyng wold healpe wretched vexed soule body whiche coulde healped good worldechristes doctrine neuer suche prophete coulde delyuer blynde leapres frome theyr dyseases neuer also suche teacher coulde teache gospell poore promyse sure healpe hymselfe contryte vexed miserable conscience make herts full tremblyng ouercome dreade feare mery ioyfullmoyses doctrine moyses high prophete doo sermon doo sounde wise thou must obserue law orels perishe torment iewes phariseys dyd fast payd tithe endeuoured study represent lawe thought nede gospel christ thynges without peryll god coulde receaue heauen fastes prayer almes c riche perfect sprited men haue nede god grace true doctrine moyses necessarie men ought indued discipline instruction euen empire kyngdome must nedes somners hangman execute corporall punyshement theim wyll obey lawe steale commytte aduoutrie slaughter agonie death handmoyses doctrine doo nothynge deathe doctrine moyses me iudgement purpose although thou hast obserued neuer muche thou must nedes saye confesse although haue ben aduoutrer thefe robber yet doo onely flee thy mercy workes neuer great preuaile desperation historie lyues fathersan hystorie certayne man stode styll three whole dayes one place continually lyfted vp eye heauen mournyng waylyng whe disciple asked hym greately troubled answered feare death euery man endeuored comfort hym thought best purpose put remembrace straight kynde lyuyng kepynge goddes preceptes testified playnly made nothing fear death although sayeth haue kept god preceptes straightly yet without feare deathworkes quiete conscience synner knowe god iudgement lyke vnto man father proceded farre vnderstoode tourmentynges begynne dryue v god iudgement god iudgement greuous seuere harde holines good workes withstande susteyn wherfore although lawe taught discipline good woorkes bee put execution comandements done yet death commeth let v dispaire concernyng oure workes rightuousnes therof one poore mencioned place hee telle myght surely stycke vnto lackyng wherof christ speketh place gospell preached poorethe gospell doctrine comfort gospell suche doctrine touchyng christe comforteth synner dothe adhort hym feare christ commaunded preached contrite geueth owne rightuousnes thee euerlastinge thys grace dooth hee procure bee taught thee worde wherfore doubt shall chance vnto thee thou hearest thou beleue gospell signifieth faire quiet doctrinewhat gospell ioyfull tidynges riche man woulde promise begger thousand noble would gospell begger ioyfull tydynges pleasant eare ar rich comparison gospell good tidynges christe hath respect vnto poore suche kyngedifference betwene kingdome christe ye worldes whiche maketh dead synners captiues lawe parttakers euerlasting life righteousnes suche kingdom saith muche vnlike kingdom ye worlde wher regard aduaunce ye mighty yt moste might doth moste oppresse poore ther ye potestate vseth extremitie spareth man suffer vice vnpunished wher hath sergeats rod ye sword water fier ye euyll doer may punished kingdom christ wil otherwise wherfore miracle rayse dead chiefe miracle yt god hath sent v kinge kinge sinner sheweth gospell moses law knoweth kinge enacted yt sinner condemned diuell death appereth hereby god kinge holy rightuous hath farre perfecter holynes ciuill lawes requier trew doctrine law god word moyses ministration lawe god ministration lykewise ciuill empire well called empire god much comaundeth v also obei therto onli ye empire god lefte ye kingdome right hand wher reigneth self neither doth substitute lieutenantesthe kingdo christes right hand paretes magistrate officer ruleth self ordreth ye matter yt ye gospel preached poore ye thou learnest yt whe thy rightuousnes ca abide iudgement god say thus haue done lord yt cold haue obeied parets master wt al diligence haue done man dishonestie haue ben murmurer haue sene diligetli houshold committed cure haue done wrong neighboure haue stollen haue comitted aduoutery c ye purpose whe matter tried thy iudgemet nothing thy kingdo wherfore whe know yt thing thy gospel yt thy sonne lord iesu christ shewed diuers signes amogest also yt thi sonne preached ye poore yt sent fro purpose cofort afflicted cosciences entet haue receaued gospel without wheras vexed poore wher el confort either goodes either worlde thus saith also ye prophet esaias christ christ saith also lord hath geue learned toung god hath put word tongue may due season speake weary yt confort ye dreadfull coscieces ye euagelist doth expoud place saith ye gospell preached poore king christ sent preache good tydings cofirme trembling fearful cosciences kingdome kingdo cofort wherein dreadful muste strengthned made ioyfull yt done ye doctrine lawe ye gospel chereful happy tidinges christ hath satisfied oure synnes belongeth poore saith christ myne entent righteouse haue place wil rebuked synners persecute gospel condemne heresi saying good workes forbid therby yt word blasphemous moses lawe wherfore christ saith blessed yt offended ye truly blessed al ye worlde offended wt kingthe doctrine gospell wath offence wisheth yt might sone co founded say yt turneth al vp syde doune condemneth righteous suffreth kingdom redy geue heue ye sinner kind doctrine say wherin respect good workes wherin wicked haue easy way heauen christ could scotfree sclander amongest owne neither bacbited aduersaries teache agaynste good workes make way saluation easy thys place sentence blessed offended thou consider christes doctrine well thou shalt perceaue doctrine good workes papisticall dothe falsely report v teache thynges necessary earnestly cared nothing may done agaynst word conscience wherfore gospell dothe disanull ciuile power dothe abrogate office maiestrates doth offende thee doest thou imagine forbyddeth good woorkes gospell dothe disalowe neyther forbydde good workesthe doctrine gospel forbyddeth good workes trust forbyddeth thys wee muste nowe dye departe lyfe broughte straightes put trust oure rightuousnes workes haue succour remaynynge onely christe muste stycke merite satisfaction obtayne grace euerlasting lyfe god geueth suche body vnto v ende idle long liue walke fete put handes worke speake mouthe see eies c hath put forthe worde tenne commandements might compare workes contrary glory profyte neighbour gospell doth onely permyt also commaunde v doo diligently man alone voyd thynges gothe world iudgement seate god dothe gospel teache go way wherfore thou haste done godly thy life thou couldest maintayne otherwaies name godlynesse life thou muste thanke god gifte death beware thou put truste godlinesse though thou hadst deserued heauen therby yeld thy self wholly king iesus christ whose office saith ye euangelist help ye blind lame lepres deafe dead preach poore yt comfort ye troubled conscience sent god father punishe v sinnes profite v susteyn comfort v wil vse hym sort offended rather despise iewes hipocrites doo yet day shall represse tyme one offence ar auoyded also christ offence men dare cofesse hym fear crosse fall hym temptation furthermore called offece haue respect hart conscience entent gospel sorow worke syn greater comfort christes mercy sake comon offence wherby al christen men vexedchrist offenceful preacher christ euery wher ye world offenceful teacher wil shew plainly gospell men doctrine offended begin despise persecute worlde shall iudged sermon three city capernaum corazim bethsaida dothe declare likewyse greuous coplainte christ iewes declareth iohn rigorouse teacher repetance dyd eat hony locustes dronke water liued hard life preuailed therby ye said diuell saith eate drink shewe self moste full humanitie men call drinker wyne adder froward man satisfie yf man lyue libertie blamed yf lyueth straightly please shall please froward worlde wold pleased well yf doth allowed neuer lesse dothe nothing good suche offence must paciently suffred wer hard case whe christ taught selfwicked worldling abyde ye gospel preacher therof al thing full miracle blinde dyd see lame go dead rise yet could nothing preuayle herby word despised yea rather christe auctor doctrine moste shamefully crucified apostle driuen iurie safe al worlde word sake maruell worlde hateth gospell without mercy resiste handle moste vilainously fortune christ apostle tyme may seme maruelous preach also wrought many notable famous miracle wherfore must endeuoure oure self beare miserie worlde take rudenes wel worth fortune gospell shall neuer otherwyse doctrine wherewith men alwayes offended thei common sorte men holy righteous wise mightie worlde experience teacheth blessed knowledge word god good case haue confort helpe offence yt knowe inflamed good workes sake fall word owne righteousnes thinke doctrine full offence sedition yt stumble offended yet chaunceth whiche worlde counted moste holy wherfore haue iuste cause complaine christ obstinate blindnesse worlde haue songe vnto ye wold daunce oure lamentable songes ye wold lament neither ca doctrine lawe math neither gospell moue men either lament either reioyce neither suffer theyr sinnes rebuked neither geue place confort synnes neither blind yet see example oure aduersaries papistes hand proue muste learne thing also gospell gospell suche doctrine vnkindly horribly despised worlde men offended seing kinges prince pope cardinalls bishop priest monkes citizen rustikes mighty excellentest worlde receaue also scorne persecute suche fortune christe miracle cause el say blessed offeded chaced thee christ wheras thou mightest haue stopped men mouthes diuine miracle maye wel refrayn complainyng despised gospel sake laughed scorne persecuted doctrine offence necessary specially tyme wherin offence greuous fyrst doctrine also necessary ther consysteth saluation euerlastyng lyfe knowe howe crist kynge comfort gladde shewe bounteousnesse towarde oure troubled conscience comforte synne healpe v euerlastyng lyfe althoughe strayghte kyngedome worlde hys also yet principall kyngdom seyng shall euer endure chief euerlastyng kyngdome christe falle acquaynted hys worde must preached poore wha dye may say beleue iesus christ lord whiche restore geue syght blynd whole lymmes lame clensyng leapre dobe vse speache dead lyfe wyll helper wyll see forsaken moste nede cause became man descended earthe vnto beleueth truely departeth myserable lyfe celestial euerlastyng ioys thing may chance v lord iesu christ myght graunt amen fourthe sonday aduent pthe gospell iohn recorde iohn iewes sente priestes leuites ierusalem aske hym arte thou confessed denied sayd playnly christ asked hym art thou helias saith art thou prophete aunswered sayde vnto hym art thou may geue aunswere vnto sent v sayest thou thy self sayd voyce cryer wyldernesse make straight waye lorde saide prophete esaie whiche sent phariseis asked hym sayd vnto hym baptisest thou thou christ helias neyther prophete iohn answered saying baptise water standeth one among whome ye knowe whiche though came whose shoe latchet worthye vnlose thynges doone bethabara beyonde iordan iohn dyd baptise exposition gospell also one especiallest gospel proueth hygh article religion belongeth tenne commaundementes workes hygher matter teachynge christe hath done wherefore almost one gospell laste sonday conteyneth doctrine excepte matter sette foorthe wordes persones laste sonday ye heard matter consisteth poynte haue chiefe respect vnto person christ nothing besyde great estimatiochriste alone saueth mynd thought reste man swarueth hym fyndeth remission synnes deliuerance deth hel wholly decreed god iohn man thynges way truth lyfe hym onely patriarkes prophetes apostle saued beginning worlde knoweth iohn sendeth disciple cause vnto hym lacke great tresure goodnes doth god wel perceiuethe patriarkes prophetes saued faith christ fault desyrous serche many way one ye loue monkerie becometh monk fasteth slepeth ground euery man foloweth owne deuise goeth forth owne way may bryng heuen wherfore god talketh v gospell protesteth alloweth seme good v putteth forthe word shewe v true way sonne iesus christewithoute christe saluatio wherefore strayeth hym shall depart voyde saluation although fast pray neuer somuche contrarywyse cleaueth vnto faith hath remission sin life euerlasting neither diuel synne deceaue trust way patriarkes prophet walk obtained saluation christ saued workes theyr owne rightuousnes surely must nedes prophet apostle mesure wrought suffred many thinges dispaire owne rightuousnes toke hold sede firme faith shold breake serpentes head iewes wil walke way could beleue gen ther help carpenter thinkyng selues must worke fast almes praier may god foly thynke craftesman saue cause god toke orderthe office iohn iohn shold come trompetter christe meanynge trompet sound therof haue eies attent mark well cometh iohn true expectation israell wherfore iewes sende legate demaunde whether christ elia prophete aunswereth instant sayenge arte thou recorde geuest thou thy selfe aunswerethe voyce cryer wyldernes make readye waie lorde trompetter kyng wherfore attente worde shall come incontinently whiche shall baptise holy ghost baptise water minister standeth myddest ye know hym wherfore duetie voyce crier wyldernes ye heare sound trumpet ye may vnderstande come soundynge voyce crier ye ought attet therfore foloweth next hym selfe esaye esaie prophecieth xl chapter voice cryer desert make redy way lord make streight pathes lord wildernes saith iohn word wherfore attent nowe amongest ye know hym office bryng acquaintance hym ye may receyue hym next prophete commeth euen hym selfe one sent office doo execute fulfyll duetie prophesyed yet priuate vnknowen shal come abrode prophetical office teaching wherefore take ye good heede least ye deceaued markyng hym haue hygh estimation among neither truely end matter iohn prophecied inco tinently baptisme christe began work myracles galilee sent twelue apostle seuetie disciple preache kyngedome god hande christ come sayth iohn ioyne selfe hym receyue hym ye shall deceaued came iohn elder christ six whole moneths yet saieth amongest iewes ben blasphemous worde tyme vnderstande playne iohns gospell saith abraha much say man borne earthe heauen yet iewes dyd vnderstand neuer lesse saying iohn trewe iohn dothe notifie v person godhed declareth plainely hereby saith worthy lose lachet shoe iewes haue diligently consydered maner man comparison iohn denieth abaseth hym self muche saith self vnworthy serue hym ye leaste thyng testimonie iohn cometh frely hart worthy although saith neuer much sett yet comparison man nothing wel content lay asyde glorie saith plainly take yt great renoume yf might thought necessarie man moste bassest office wiping shoe wherfore leaste iewes surmyse humbled self muche wheras iohn author baptisme executed ye ministerie prophet doth expoud trew meaninge baptisme saying haue signe also hathe prophetes ieremie weare chaine woode esai walked naked barefooted esa prophesied aegiptias ethiopes shold pray ther enemy spoyled auctor new word new signeiohn declareth baptisme preache ye prepare way lorde ye nede worde yf way prepared alredie washe signe ye vnpure filthie beginner lauer foloweth wil prouide better baptisme baptise holy spirit spoken might cout christe vnworthy sighte haue remebrance word iohn borne recorde come foorthe magnificetly teaching signes thei might doubt euident matter thei hear iohn thinke authoritie sufficient beheaded iohn crucified christe touching whome iohns witnesse faithfull suche regard godlines despised word god also killed prophetes nayled crossethe iewes regarde iohns doctrine lord prophetes goeth matter also christ condemned crosse beyng earth nowe also member labour iohn bringe men way muche without christe ther remission synnes lyfe euerlasting go withdrawe men trust oune workes vnprofitable righteousnes sight godpapistes abyde word god leade christe much greuously condemned heretykes aduersaries agreable doctrine knowe sette foorth mounkes rule mass ostentation offer vp mass dead ordeyne seruice go pilgrimage bye pardon thing caste away christe searche new way heauen alow meanes therfore abstayne rayling slaundering v bishop highe priest wold deale lykewyse v iewes yf coulde lacking vnto abuse v pleasure cause greuously offended v surely teache iohn geue glory god humble selues christ iudge selues vnworthy seruice good workes wipe great mannes shoe chose graunt iohn holy yet saith caste away holynes yf might receaued felowshippe grace haue ouersight shoe wold thynke selfe honorable man therfore testifie proteste worlde pope bishoppes priest mounkes righteousnes holynes neuer much yet poynte nothyng compared iohn wherfore ye ye fastyng saying prayer also see thing caste christes feete lett looke iustified saued therby say humbly refuse lowly humble teache suffer christ holy persuaded doo crie vpon v lyke madde men saying faith sufficient muste good workes make holynes christ ground piller iohn dydde gladde forgo owne holynes count much worthy cloutes wherwith durty shoe made cleane testifieth plainly holynes muche worth vyle cloute much lesse worthy dothe iudge wipe christes nosepapistes seke saluation
