worthie haue holines geuen steade almes sacrifice heard iewes thei despised persecuted vnto tyme cotempt persecution lefte madnes chaunced iewes destruction shall god grace chaunce papistes wherefore muste diligently marke example iohn moste holieste man christ saith hathe none lyke amogest borne woman matth passed mounkes priest farre yet dothe demitte humble self saith wt holines workes worthy clout wipe shooes truly example worthye folowed good workes muste doone great diligencegood workes hath god commanded ten preceptes come pointe muste entreat man iohn doth caste downe feete muste confesse hartely iohn worthy doo leste seruice mane iudgemet hereof chief respecte thou art aduouterer thefe robber thou geuest almes thou seruest well thy vocation thynges boasted amongest men highe estimation matter tried sight iudgement god lothe say lorde know thee excellentest thinges nothing worthe wherfore iudge accordig workes willinge byde ye losse wishe better thinge yf might haue desier therin may thinke self well blessed doth paule also philippi saith israelite phil profession lawe pharisei touchyng righteousnes vnblameable man reproue much sene one stande thyngs iudgement men yet saith thinke chyppes trust confort resteth herein may found hauing owne righteousnes lawe righteousnes fayth christe whiche righteousnes belongeth faith god saith wherfore might take fruite man caste away owne righteousnes chip saying paule cotumelious good workes iohns cotent suffer estemed cloutes paule nameth chip paryngs scrapyngs paule apostle nothing feareth reproch vnciuilitie wheras vseth suche vnpure word suche example necessary maintayn study honesty sobernes worlde men might haue cause reproue v righteousnes belonging lyfe hath ende lyfe knowen good men put graue well euill matrones well harlot whe thou wilt make thee way euerlasting lyfe say christ refuge righteousnes promiseth geueth baptisme worde supper body bloudthe differece betwene righteousnes faith good workes last shall stand hym poore worme meanes may put difference betwene oure righteousnes whiche consisteth function common lyfe betwene righteousnes whiche god ethnykes also hath shewed honesty sobernes theyr lyuinge donne suffered many thyngs natiue countreye haue due renoume death commeth nothyng therof steppe foorth take part suche righteousnes good workes attayne remission synnes whyther must go righteousnes holynes accepted god alowed euerlasting lyfe holy anker caste muste oure refuge come humbly precept iohn thynke vyle oure self paule saith shamefully eye worlde maye perchaunce seme excellent god cloute wipe shoe sonne god whose righteousnes wold gladly haue geuen helpe wherof might certayn saluation wheras owne righteousnes ought refuse damnation hell cause say surely mounkes priest cooles thing sort destinate damnation applie work obedience god honest lyuing auoyding offence might hereby obtayne saluation wherfore sell thyngs also denie christ papistes sell theyr word mocke despise iewes mocked despised hym lett v beware abomination let v learne aunswer suche iuglers woldest thou wretched mighty thy workes righteousnes thou mightest purchase saluation therby vertue iohn peter euer suche power ben otherwysemonasteries would neuer haue thought lightly word shewe vse abbeis turned instruction youth trayning vp scripture man could reproue done great reason brought wicked order referre obtayning saluation wherfore yt better suche abbeis cleane put downe men shoulde fall offence thereby straye christ lose body sowle learne therfore gospell lyue godly righteously chastlygood work ought diligetly done diligent good workes suche obedience doth god require lawe wold haue v let v know punishement redy v seeth v amende bodyly paynes punishe v euerlastyng thing done yet god say wyse lord much belongeth work righteousnes haue hope desier may haue lowe seruice christes feete muche belongeth liuing haue deserued cast hell call vpon holynes sanctifie better eternall lyfe shall sure haue euerlastyng lyfe pope bishop heare yf woulde priest college mounkeries mass suche ceremony seruice wold sone ouerthrowen whiche thing defende stubbornely truste haue saluation
