way might saued thing god father graunt v sonne iesus christe amen christmas day pthe gospell luke ij chaunced dayes went commaundement august emperour world taxed fyrst taxing made syrenius lieftenaunt syria euery man went vnto owne citie taxed ioseph also ascended galile citie called nazareth iury vnto citie dauid whiche called bethleem house lynage dauyd taxed mary spoused wyfe childe fortuned whyle tyme come shoulde delyuered brought foorth fyrste begotten sonne wrapped hym swadlyng clothes layde manger rowme within inne math regyon shepheardes abydyng fielde watchyng theyr flocke nyght lo aungell lorde stode harde brightnes lorde shone rounde sore afrayde aungell sayde vnto afrayde beholde bring tydynges great ioye shal come people vnto borne daye citie dauid sauiour whiche christe lorde take signe ye shall fynde chylde swadled layde manger strayght way aungell multitude heauenly souldiours lauding god saying glorye god hye peace earth vnto menne good exposition feast christes byrth ordayned ye congregation especially hystory therof myght taught knowen perfectly men youth sort people might haue remembrance prynt well myndes although matter hadled yearely yet neuer sufficiently knowenthe cause feast wherfore make two partes gospell fyrste reherse history see angel dyd shewe seruice kept day also fyrst history this1 tyme byrth christ borne tyme fyrste taxe made amongest iewes vnder augustus caesar tyme dyd christ begin kingdo worlde howbeit somwhat priuily neither could valiant emperour augustus free seruice king yt comaundement maketh way prophecy yt mary ioseph might come bethleem2 place yt might borne ye sauiour world bene ioseph mary would haue taried home busines miche bethleem appointed yt place christes natiuitie therfore cesars commandemet necessary yt christes parent might come bethleem albeit neither emperour neither worlde know thing matter worlde knowen malice therof would rather hinder alway set forth marueilous prouidence god hath vnknowing obedient vnto obtayne nothyng wittyngly come fro galile bethleem yt comandemet3 emperour rome helpeth knowing doth mary tyme bringing foorth come saith ye euagelist ther prouision al made child bed bothe strange lad farre fro coutrey wher dwellig was4 maner byrth part stuffe although like yt kinsfolke yet thei regarded pouertie furthermore yt towne self full men appeareth euagelist yt roume ye iune content lowe degree take part oxe stalle beastes nothing buylded prepared bedclothes lye amongest straw hay better tha yt beast doth place middest ye cold night borne ye moste excellent babe iesus christ hystorywhy hystory write ye euangelist putteth forth plainly vnto v hard harted perchance might moue v ye consideratio thing yt oure sauiour borne ye worlde great scarcity al thing yt thereby greatly abhorre madnes ye worlde despiseth disdainfully holy thing kingdome god would curse bethleem lytle humanity therof comberance straungers fyndeth meane thyngs fyrst swathyng clothes mother lappe oxe stalle delicates thys babe cherished mother trauell feared cold vesture clothes wore man lend thing necessitie pourpose euangelist describe diligently great pouertie byrthe leaste thou shouldest forgett tyme thynges myght make sober amend thy naturall fearcenes thou haste heard yt done thy self thou mightest take confort therof geue thanks god long iorney nazareth galile vnto toune bethleem went saxon franconie herof man may easely gather caried much stuffe swathelyng clothes suche thing wer costely put smocke child laid maunger could alwayes hold yt lappe must warme clothes dresse couche thing wer requisite infat meane tyme must babe reste oxe stalle neither could ioseph lackyng necessary busynes lyke went maydens house gett water busines written came proffer seruice vnto trauaill regarded whan tolde mayde deliuered chylde stable wherfore towne worthy hated great barbarousnes although mary pouerty thought much worth yf bene vnhoneste yet tyme ben part man shewe humanitie man greued therewith childe muste suffer paciently great extreme pouertye looke better beggerie sorowfull life lord borne wheras deuoure riot awaie cosume prodigallie al thing costly apparell gorgeous buildig c historie whiche set forthe v entent graue picture christes byrthe faste oure hart great miserie lord iesus borne wordle might learne geue god thankes great benefit miser wretched men also damnedwe made fleshe bl sone god hebr came day high renoume day made one fleshe bloud sonne god made heauen earth nothing borne man lyke vnto v thing excepted child thing without synne wherfore may boste magnificently god become oure brother oure fleshe bloude renoum geuen angells diuels v men wherfore although angells excellet creature yet god geueth renoume v angells made angell wherfore yf men could thinke beleue greatnes therof requirethe mynde wold moste redie sett moste god thanke obey gladly pope religion reigned suche historie read vnto v vpon time diuell came churche masse wordes made man songe men made obbeisance bowinge knee gaue one great blow rebukinge said thou monsterous beaste art ashamed litle moued fallest thou downe thy face ioy yf sonne god ben made oure brother youres surely wold haue measure reioycing although matter true yet semeth fayned good manthe incarnation christ well dyd perceaue great renoume geuen vnto v sonne god became man maner adam eue made grounde made conioyned vnto v borne fleshe bloud virgin mary men excepte mary virgin sole alone conceaued without synne holy ghoste excepte worthely named naturall sonne woman adam eue borne made god made man earth woman ribbe gen much nigher christ v eue adam oure bloud flesh ought esteme renoume highly haue great meditation thervpon sonne god made oure fleshe difference betwene flesh except synne conceaued holy goste heb god replenished bothe body sowle virgin holy ghoste without synne conceaued christe afterward wared great child hym difference thing lyke men vsed meate drynke felt hunger thyrst colde dyd phil subiect suche naturall infirmity paule sayth shape found lyke man eate drounke sorowfull gladdethe humblenes christ truely profound humilitie subiection myght haue vsed sorte became man sort nowe heauen hath flesh bloud haue yet subiecte naturall action might haue done begynning wold might declare singular loue toward v might haue therby sure confort ioy knowe haue brother nowe heauen whose sure helpe may stycke vnto bound doo cursed euery man doth receaue conceaue stedfast hope sake therfore history rehersed euery yere ye tender myndes might haue meditation theron geue god thanks say matter good takynge haue brother made lyke made yet tell cause1 natiuite might confortable v might helpe agaynst syn eternall death nowe speake renoume mankynde wherof boaste reioyce sonne god become man renoume may euery man boaste christian men somwhat renoume shallbe endlesse profyte firste learned history2 also myght make v humble meke secondarily marke also great example christe sonne god dothe humble self communicate glory fleshe wheras hyghe maiestie whome angells tremble dothe demitte hym self goeth ye lykenes man heauen angel worship earth serueth v subiect beggery seing ye sonne god doth matter lightly sett lett v caste selues away glory honour sake yf aduersitie suffered muste refuse christe self hathe suffered likewise frost hunger misery trouble whan borne wordle poore thing neither place neither bed clothes neither stuffe houshold maunger oxe stable refuge desier better state seing kinsman ye rather brother kinge heauen founde poore thing oure eye refuse hardnes seing kinge glorie refuseth take thing sake sinner worthie lie amonge sharpe cutting flagges yet lie softer prince suffered lye hay abhorred maunger yet case vnworthie stockes blockes nice delicate suffer payne yet se oure eye example christe paynes toke oure sake vnknowen reward shall haue oure foolishnes yet wit wold beware therfore lett v briefly reherse bothe doctrine lessons1 honor congregation firste yt regarde owne honoure christe made honour renoume great man angell state myght worthely well wish self man might counted amongest glorie boste fleshe blud placed aboue angells blessed ye creature man second is2 example loue patience might example v charitie pacience might folowe walke steppe oure brother kinsman christe helping seruing men gladly although oure labour payn thing god father holy ghost thorough oure lord iesu christe graunt v amen second sermon vpon saying angel concerning christ borne haue rehersed vnto history feast made mentio also saying angel whiche ther also assembled many thousand angel whiche shewe synge altogether two three shepheardes sermon one angell feare ye behold declare vnto great ioy shall ye people ye haue sauiour borne day christ lord citie dauid although sermon angell repeted euery yeare yet may conueniently renewed agayne mynde shall neuer come ye perfecte knowledge thyng long lyue sermon angell necessarie christ hadde neuer much bene bornechrist knowen profiteth lytle yet haue profited v nothing bene vnknowen purpose treasure lyeth hyd thou knowest wher thou shalt take pleasure profite therby prouerbe saith pleasure vnknowen treasure prouerb hyd treasure treasure men passeth ouer durt caring also moste ioyfull byrth angel brought tydings therof opened treasure men man could haue taken fruition therof cause common man setteth affection knoweth neither doth thyng delight displease though neuer shalbe wherfore one especiallest thing gospell angel sermo doth speake openly byrth sheweth v treasure passe ouer ignorant presence therof come take part confort therof wherfore saith declare vnto great ioy word weightie ye shepheards greatly astonyed meruailous light celestial shyninge vnwonted thyng sodeinly heauen earth suche great light though earth bene fyer hath angell respect applieth word therto saying feare ye shold say ther cause feare feare sheweth ye knowe ye ye wold put away feare reioyce owne felicitie come bring tydings great ioy great work miraclegods messenger conforte fearefull whiche thyng ye wold well consyder ye wold much reioyce therfore entent angel tydings make men regard earnestly let passe without effecte wherfore speaketh common ioye great ioye thing moste necessary diuell synne hath brought v naught disturbed belongeth vnto v sustayne originall synne therby eternall deth also al yt haue danger almoste maye euery moment looke dartes body lyfe goodes thing thousande peril casualtyes yea gospell testifieth dyuell possesseth men dryueth madnes may worthely said man fylthy puddle syncke dyuellsata thorow sinne reigneth men suche corruption engendred v synne haue sure helpe thing worlde speake greatest misery muste abyde wrothe god eternall damnation moste horrible violent kyngdome diuell consider well compare together myserie kyngdome dyuell compared glorie reward great ioy wherof angell preacheth sauiour borne v wherfore angell entendeth chiefely remoue myserie oure sight geue v chyld behold see let know hath done office good preacher brynge v true beholding sauiour knowledge oure owne flesh bloud doughtles prynted v plague wherwith dyuell vexeth v seme light neuer paynfull pernicious let v come moste requisite necessary knowledge diuine worke godchrist ouercommeth satan dyuell poyson ouercome meanes godly power angel speaketh v place saith sauior borne whe ma minde attaineth knowledge ye synner oute perill matter depely consydered sorte haue bene defiled dyuel wholy opprest ouerthrowen headlong god wrathe eternall damnation myschance great haue greater helpe geuen god agaynst god possesseth mankynd sorte diuell doth self made man god mannes nature might made one person diuell ioyne self nighe god made man yet remayneth man meanes set self depely mannes fleshe dyuell may enter mannes body vexe made man diuell man might become one person betwene two nature ther alway remayning difference persones substance also person christ borne thing one sone god made one flesh one bloud borne virgyn mary course nature math luc excepte conceaued holy ghost hath escaped fylthy mark dyuell borne pure flesh bloud wheras oures full synne thing lyke v subiecte naturall action psal ephe phil poyntes men sayth paule found behauiour man sawe hym heard hym dyd affirme muste nedes true naturall man phantasme appearing property belonge lyfe ioy touching speaketh ye angel speake glorie fruite therof wont declared history passion resurrection speake glory god nighe ioyned vnto v flesh bloud soule man great meruailous glory hath begon matter aduauced mankind therby high renoume angell setteth forth vnto men sayth shew great ioy shall whole people word sheweth yt mynde rauished great ioy telleth boldly shepheards wold men hym shold know great honour wherby mannes nature come dignitie god whiche made thing become oure flesh bloud wold ponder well although profite therbythe byrth christ ought moue v vnto mutuall charitie loue yet wolde make together amongest v great flame charitie loue speake yet said profyt vse glory therof moued earnestly therwith yt wold suffer malice remayne amongest v reason wold hate kinde hurt euen oure god body sowle shall glory sake wher god hath garnished v loue men best men angel excellent creature men glory geuen god made angell neither angell made god furthermore angel innocent holy condicion agreable god maiestye semeth otherwyse choseth viler creature subiect syn hold captiue vnder kyngdom diuell tyrannye death dyuel vexeth troubleth extremely could humble self lower stirred hereby loue charitie esteme one neglecte proue mastries moste good notecertayn father amongest cometh mynde bernarde thought diuell whan heauen se sonne god become man cause enuied man began hate god chosen rather become angell man enuie pride caste heauen whether fayned done dede yet wold holy father signifie hereby howe great oure renoume god became man tooke mannes nature belongeth v whiche haue ben dyuels daunger captiue synne death wretched case whiche ignorante renoume yet much wretched ye angel apostle shew thing god hath visited man nature tooke made lord ouer al creature yet reioyce wretched moued tidings one amongest many bretherne come kig wold al ye reioyce bolde would waxe iosephs bretherne may example naturall zeale chaceth reioyce great matter moued neither geue thanks god oure god hath taken oure flesh bloud sitteth right hand god lord ouer creature therfore wold esteme dede wold loue flesh bloud worlde flesh blouds sake wold hate gloriouse sight contemplation humanitie christ oure god wold chere v replenishe v ioy yt neuer angry man yea beholdeth image continually sonne god made man wold loke wrathful displeasure fro christe hope goodnes hand man angry self hurteth self christ one v man could hate self yt say v flesh bloud sight well printed v wold sone put away exaples god wrathe oure myndes no floud punishement sodom gomor wold vanishe away contemplatio wold muse man god hath estemed mannes nature greatly became man thing neuer inestimable yet mad yt care caste away treasure set mynd thing heape vp rich purchase get whereto men myndes wont wholy stirred cause fele ioy rise v tydinges angell wherfore thing may wel make v ioyful proude preferred creature renoume yea angel may boaste say flesh bloud sitteth right hand god hath rule angell creature hath suche renoume flesh bloud fier ought melt one men harte inflame men suche mutuall loue embrace one al oure harte continuall working diuell make v forget home lerned churche enemy doth corrupte oure ioy care neuer regarde sight ought nothyng el renoume therof yet wer thynge worthy reioyced besydes glorie great ouerplus ther also man iesvs sauiour dede true cause ioy angell sheweth say agayn miserable case neither heare know thyngs much miserable know yet regard word wold melte heaue earth make v care death thynke sufficiently sauiour borne v treasure doth angel shew mother mary virgin saith sauiour borne christ lord speaketh shepheardes whiche ieweswhat christ well acquainted word knowing christ dyd signify kynge lord great parte people deceaued thought corporal kingchrist corporal thing angell hath higher respect saith almoste hytherto haue ye ben captiue vnder dyuell hath persecuted water fier moreyn comprise al myschefe moste cruel tyranny yow miser seduceth myndes errours hurte sowle thousand tymes moreyn hurt body yow say yow whiche body sowle vnder slanderous hurtfull spirite yow borne sauiour doth speakechrist sauiour stone brute beastes men one two buth whole people dare bold reproue voyce angell take peter paul oure sauiour flee hym sinner thou say haue nothing hym demand thee whose shalbe borne beastes thou muste haue respecte wold haue ben sauiour anye creature wold haue taken hym forme shape creature become sonne man art thou men yes truely doth chyld belong men aungels haue nede dyuels despise haue nede hym v made man wherfore must count hym may loke surely helpe angell sayth borne aboue ioy shall great people honorable thyng angell heauen bryngeth tydings men many angells come gratulations melodious verse men reioyce receaue great grace thakes geuing wherfore saying vncoparable heare yt v borne sauiour thyng doth say byrth belonging requier part therof reioyse sake myserable corrupte damnable men sauiour suche wherfore embrace haue nede sauiour thynk ye might escape ye dungeon syn death glory wherof spake yt god made man great passeth farre sauiour thing eternall spirituall knew beleued fruition whole ioy wold peradueture die ioy longe lyfe shall neuer receaue know ioye lyfe narow straight weake possible mannes mynde could truely esteme wold able hold self ioye much wholly performed let v yet least learne muche hereby may shewe mutuall loue cease slaundering deceauing vice maruelous example god made perceaued great infirmitie ioy perce farre shold forgett ye word angel also sauiour geue self customable vice couetousnes like toke yt beleue word veri litle dyd beleue dede wold excedig great ioy inwardly v sauiour geue v time syckenes plague wold haue good hope knew remedie hope open sensible wheras haue put v sure remedy sin death man made chereful therby wherfor testifie self yt heare good tidings yt slepe herby declare great frowardnes yt wheras haue great treasure v yet nothing moued therfore yt ca regard great thing doth worthely bewayle owne miserie thing might make ye minde ioyfull yt great vertue ye angel tidings yt sauiour borne ca ye better word neither applieth self godlines herby yt nothing affectioned moste cofortable effectuous sayigs ye ca amended wt grace muste nedes tamed wt euil crueltie sure toke yt al daned cursed yt haue grace let make huble petitio god ye holy gost bring hart vnderstading sence wher ye angel saith yt sauiour borne ye citie dauid calleth hym ye lord christ yt doth make v haue respect vnto ye scripture prophesied micheas miche yt bethleem shold ye place natiuitie wheras calleth lord taken lordshippe master hath ouer bondman god saith ada yt oure lord wil defend v resiste ye diuell gene ye office lord yt maye challenge v kingdo withdraw v fro ye diuels powerwhy angell calleth christ lord seing yt al power ye diuel falleth hereby christ doth take v owne made v redemed v also wt body wherfore contendeth al might haue christ sort may taken lord wt right challenge reclayme saluatio disturbeth ye false vsurped power diuell recouer owne commeth enemy face indighteth openly robbery yt cursed spirit hath take much vpon hath caste v miser headlong synne death hath vsed crafte gile entycinge away couenant seruantes belonged nothing vnto true lord dyuell vsurpeth power ouer violence christ true naturall godand much angell geueth hym great title calleth hym lord sure token child sonne mary verily nature eternall god wer otherwyse wold neuer haue called lord sauiour self angell angell sayth expresse word yow borne sauiour oure lordchrist lord angells also lord also angel touching lord one familie v counted vnder one lord v men thrall slaues dyuell might aduaunced child great renoume receaued holy angells one citie ioynte felowes v may well boste childe come moste familiar felowshippe angells may bold homely wold oure houshold felowes angel might well behaue selues stately v passe v worthines firste nature substance also without synne disdainfull oure felowshippe neither despise v oure misery greueth see v vexed death synne calamytie cause gladde oure saluation cometh v chylde glad see oure saluation ownewhy angells reioyced byrth christ therfore reioyce day haue gotten child lord bryngeth v degree become felowes member body despise v say away synners stinkinge rotton dead carcase graues adulterer wicked doer proude glad hart suche synners come felowshippe geue thaks god deliuered synne come dwell one house vnder one lord grace glorifie god although haue profyt therby howe much rather oure deutie geue god thanks loue one sonne god loued v whiche made oure flesh moste nighly ioyned vnto v regardeth loueth neighboure saued fyrst sermon made byrth christ touchig childe endureth euer ye ende worlde wherfore euery man ought diligetly haue mynd theron hereby mistery opened angel become oure frends brought v ioyful tydings commanding v put asyde al feare much child borne v oure sauiour hygh true excellent confort mercy god may perceaued felte sensibly conuenietly god oure sake hath humbled self lowe yt gaue v sonne moste bouteouse sorte mayde layeth lappe sendeth v word tydings oure sauiour let v seke helpe oure nede let v trust surely hym succoure wrothe betwene god v may depart euer may vse kynd humanitie gentlenes one iudge thy self whether god blamed vnrighteousnes sith suche thyngs declared vnto men regard despise owne saluation euen mad papistes thynke sauiour sufficiet setting vp besydes whome may truste sermon angell obscure touchyng chyld oure sauiour grounde oure saluation may confort v replenishe oure harte ioy man tourneth bothe angell also god eye hym self putteth treasure mother bosome also geueth hym vnto v oure owne belongeth vnto hym heauen earth heareth moued therwith worthye caste hell lyghtninge esai ioan rom wherfore let v geue god thanks grace pray instantly vnto hym printe sermon angell oure harte may conceaue true hope sauiour hym may ouercome death dyuel obtayne oure lord sauiour iesus christ graunt v amen thyrde sermon songe angel hitherto haue spoke touching ye feast first history ye sonne god made man borne wretched worlde miserably virgyn mary ought neuer forgett leaste founde vnkynde god great benefit hath bestowed v byrth sonne hystory entreated godly sermo angel wherby natiuitie declared vnto shepheards wt great brightnes shyned round shepheards whiche thing vnwonte yt god letting passe great potentate ierusalem sendeth magnificent legacy many thousand angel ye miserable shepheards watching ye nighte angel geueth hym suche honour christ geueth v al submit selues lowely seruice neither disdaine oure vilenes shewing vnto v moste miserable beggers plaine sermo yet extant shalbe surety ye congregatio vnto ye worldes ende may marueill moste huble modeste spirit whome pride statelynes althe angel huble spirit whose exaples might become folowe yt wold counted moste holy mightie prince puffed vp vertue wisdo power thing giftes geue mainte ace pride mighte ye angel iust cause disdayne poore beggerly shepheards ye maner angel shepheards ca abiect vyle son neither ye angel fortunat noble mighty yt greatly delighted message ought also ought vse giftes wtout pride me profit saluatio despise exaple christ touchig euidet regardeth euery man muchchristes people pore nedy yt cam poore nedy world taketh vnto pore nedy seke helpe yt hath nede hym cause called sauiour great estate ierusalem neuer thought christ pertayned vnto bare shepheards haue nede therfore iudged worthye heare first short sermon ye angel touchyng byrth sauiour christ wherein angel wold v vnderstad ye sauiour geuen v syn death dyuel word sermon feare ye day borne sauiour christ ye lord mannes word neither haue beginning mannes hart ye wisest know nothing word put godly reuelation thaks god chosen felowshippe al one whether thou readest hearest word ye angell though thou hadst heard presently ye angell shepheardes sawe ye angel dyd see light brightnes heard word angel whiche yet rehersed sermon read bookes grace learne put practyse copare word ye angel yt word moses heard ye angel mount sinay shal fynd great differece al thing wer applied terrifie almost body lyfe daunger thuder lyghtning thing ye angel preach banishe feare make men cherfull put away dread truste saluation begin looke better might good courage specially childes sake called oure sauiour named angell entitled christ ye lord whatsoeuer ther write always hope wayte called christe law could thing syn death work euery man righteousnes preuayled saluation sett christ might trusted vnto trouble doth ye angel beholde testifie dependeth hope saluation remission synnes muste cast away al doctrine religiosif christ sauiour th n saincts work wherby saluation eternall lyfe wrought without christ christ ca mary mother peter paule austyne france dominike rule wheras papacie doctrine led men intercession saintes obseruations mounkerie doth agre angel sermon yea doth agre verse songe church wherin glorifie christ condemne pope iusticiaries moste greuouse wickednes wheras syng sort childe bene borne v surely ther could haue bene way foud saue v without christ damned helpeth mounkes rule priest masse saluation thing subiect damnation ther exceptio speach vniuersal loke saluation haue mounkerie massinge faste canonicall howers christ hath yt name called sauiourby ministerie worde doctrine preserued sermo angel lefte ye papacie verse vsed church vnto tyme man vnderstode lacked true faithful preacher therfore wher preaching wher word set foorth effectuously thing song reade man vnderstandeth man ca denye thing ye papacie baptisme ye lord supper texte gospell prayer lord article faith ten commandements euen ye papistes haue thing v sauing haue changed supper lord hath peruerted testament al thing domb wherfore reherse reade otherwyse vse neither vnderstad ye word ye ceremony al ye fault yt regarded ye doctrine yt men might certified ye meaning ye word dayly vsed hearing reading singing ca wel stirre vp yt slepe preacher must earnest vigilat cold make audiece wearie neuer attete may se true ye pope dalying al kind idlenes pastance wherfore cold take hede sermo although set forth wt versicle lesson yet know nothig vnderstad bi meanes thing amog papistes reade gospel yt sauiour borne singe ye church yt child borne could saued yt saluation al men yet neuer ye lesse cal ye virgin mary faste worship saint go pilgrimage relikes hire bye mass make sauiour cotent ye testimonie sermo set vp mary sayntes yea beggerly work men ye rome sauiour borne child good preacher helpe muchwherfore haue small cause pray god couragious earnest preacher enkedle ye light doctrin yt heare reade also vnderstande wher suche preacher ther hope yt falle therby peril good nutt thou come kernel profiteth treasure haue power bryng abrode sermon ye angel euident inough borne sauiour yet pythye yt old papistical doctor ca perceaue perceaue wold councel men mounkerie pray vnto sayntes purchase merites men seke sauiours wher god sendeth diligent wittie preacher yt stirre vp ye vehemencie word ye mynds ye hearer geueth great power doctrine iudge false doctrine deceytfull spirit neither possibleby angel doctrine al false doctrine iudged although dyuell tourneth self sort yt must nedes perceaued reproued craftes deceytes much spirituall wickednes heauenly thing lie hyd paul doth boste also corinth knoweth mynde thought dyuell nede wayse compare doctryne chyld whether agree papacie extolle selues hyghely gorgiouse ceremony rite may perceaue yt al idolatrie beleue merite saluation therby yt men put truste saued therby pleasant god due seruice wher yet plainly declared place touching chyld must oure sauiour wherfore pope bishop may worthely accused false doctrine wicked seruice al agreeth nothing wt doctrine angell hath sauiour rule neuer ouerseen neuer deceaued whatsoeuer take vpon hym iudge wherfore thing worthie prayed light childe may neuer go oure syght openeth vnto v wycked prankes dyuell worlde may sure agaynst thing soone confounde oure iudgementes whatsoeuer set vp childe doctrine oure saluation matter hath nede farre compassinge many word meaning playne sermon angell wherfore thou contrarie counceller sent god teacheth sorte yt sauiour borne whose name christ peter paule rule augustin france mass pylgrimages saintes pardon proper office sauiour isthe office christ minister vnto al thing necessary oure saluation go take doctrine wil suffer eye bleared sermon angell passing comparison whiche great multitude angel mustereth together setteth vppe quiers musike syngular order processe verse much marueyled sermon selfe singe genethliacon byrth verse neuer heard worlde word therof glorie god hyghe earthe peace good towards men hymne consysteth three partes fyrst parte taken thoughe church office thereby appoynted expediet also prophecye effect herof ensue god great glory ryse herof meaning yt angel sermon farre wyse childe borne ther blasphemy idolatry tyme worlde whatsoeuer without christ neuer glorious glystryngenote well yet bee counted thing blaspheming god ther wais worshyp glorifie god chyld christ may tru bounteousnes mercy humanitie god knowen spared onely begotten sonne sent hym fleshe sake greatnes benefite causeth herts coceaue true loue trust hope toward god geue largely thanks fruit song yt angel come taketh beginning wheras god truly glorified high workes canot reach high heaue herts fro earth raised surmout vpward ye mercyfull god father thankes geuyng great confidence wherfore loke wher child truely knowen god truely glorifiedwithoute christ god ca knowe glorified example worlde specially people declareth true thing ful idolatrie folowed diuers sectes ordeined many kynde worshippinges bee groues hylles worlde testifie prophetes thyng yea aboue damnable idolatrie good entent god hym sacrifice fast vexe body spared lyfe selfe yet diuellyshe owne imagination thyngs god glory bestowed shame blasphemy wher god dishonored throughout erth wher christ knowegod diuersly dishonored world therfore doth angel reioyce behalfe thyngs blasphemie end moreouer dishonoryng god lesse fine sensible former men worship mammon suche lyke thynges worlde full idolatrie men great small worshyp grosse imagerie put al trust time nede wherfore part god dishonored blasphemed make idoll owne rightuousnes also worshyp mammon angel syng shalbe wyse appearyng light men shall put longer trust owne rightuousnes shal care parentes thyngs striue shall onely imbrace sauiour trust hym shalbe beginnynge god true glorie shall truly knowen glorified worshypped glorie lost adam paradise men wittes corrupted nature rather haue glorie seluesoriginall syn broughte ambition take example pope byshops riche yet brought mind promote word god howe greatly esteme seyng basest persones loue glorified seynge therefore lowest persones none would without glorie muche must come passe hath high matter hande suche holynesse rightuousnes good workes ciuile honestie behauioure wyll well contente god shoulde haue honour suffer owne honoure dimynished therby suche ambition besieged men fyrste mankynde paradise brought diuell point would like vnto god neuer liue without wherfore al men yt gyfts god science rich imperie diuers vertues c seketh selues glorie yea trifle vice cannot escaped angel mean light chylde shal come otherwise passe nowe god glorie shall surrendred vnto therfore reioyce syng god man behalf true difference thinges shall receaue chyld shal confesse rightuousnes holynes knowledge power altogether nothyng chylde god glorye restored vnto hym onely wisedom strength rich doo reioyce boste onely hym wee knowe hym well put truste hym mammon suche giftes count otherwise necessitie requireth vse receaue poore men vse v also turnyng glorie god saluation neighbour transpose trust hath rich iesus christ sonne god true glorifying godto glorifye god render vnto due honor maiestie yt may frely confesse thyne author therof furthermore escape tyrannie diuell deliuered synne cometh god power wherfore glory proprely thyne suche confession dooth god requyre v moste necessary ornament thynges referred vnto hym case chalenge part therof knowledge selues haue receaued hym well greate small one part verse wherin angell compriseth thing especially spirituall giftes rightousnesse holynes wisedome good work comaunde v vsurpe restore god geue vnto hym glorie therof thyng shalbe done chyld meanynge verse sheweth worlde dothe chaunge versethe vntowardnes world greate whiche doth wholy change verse contrary sense must nedes com passe lack knowlege child thing world ful pompe thynges tende renoume glorye village men citezens knightes lordes prince couete higher degree whiche token christ know furthermore theyr verse glorie depth great rich power frendes c worlde withdrawen foly departing shal perceiue madnes rather sing glory mammon diuell hell god high second parte verse earthe peace vnderstanded ye maner first example wishe shewe foorth suche successe come hereof amongest theim knowe receaue chylde thynges shall ioyfulle prosperous christe thinge worlde helle thynges full lye deceites gyles fraudesthere nothynge worlde synne subtilties extortion surfetyng slaughter thefte robberie especially mayst thou knowe diuell gouerner men themselues speke otherwise maner men would safe craft guyle must euer contrary opinion faithfulnes godlynes man safe one muche perill feared frends handes enemy yea oftentymes kyngdome world wherin diuell grand capitaynchristen men peaceable receyue chylde accordyng angelles songe geue glory god verse declare suche men shalbe god toward men peaceable redy good one eschuyng contention discorde great concorde peace good may amongst christian wher enticement ambition concupiscence voyde thynges prosper wyth mutuall loue helpe eche hereof wyl easyly folow whe due renoume geue god knowleged lord whome commeth haue wil great beneuolence mutuall loue betwene man man shalbe hatred enuie emulation railyng euery man shall set pray may helpt ma prayer brother shalbe plentiful peace great felicitiepeace signifieth hebrewe worde peace large compriseth kynde felicitie kynde christian lyuynge described hygh humanitie concorde euery man shoulde gratifie beware diligently offend heare verse angel heare howlynge wolfe soundeth earesthe dyuell changeth verse thefe aduoutrer murderer c diuels song must amongest christen men angel verse appointeth liue doo teache wel belongeth god seruice fyrst glory plucked fro heauen praise renoume geue god lyfe full mutuall amitie beneuolence angel endeuor studiously comende sette foorth touching lamentable successe ignorant great part meanes brought chyld wherfore adde thirde part verse thyrd part songe good towardes men shew though would say would wyshe wer successe matter wyll many shall regarde gospel shall receaue sonne god borne man wyll go persecute therfore god hand comfort confirm truly myght thynke surely wyth self matter certayn concernyng sauior way saluation perfectly tried wherfore although shall handled cruelly wyll suffer good opinion haue touchyng god good wyll taken take good worthe yea count honour must suffer payne sauior sake suche mynde doo angel wishe beleue ioyfull aduersitie learne despise ragynge diuell make hym hange vp hym selfe sorowe canne preuayle thyrde part therfore verse make v haue cherefull myndes bolde agaynst trouble maye chaunce may always redye say diuell thou shalt neuer defraude thys ioye thou canst doowhat good wyll whiche conceaue chylde nonlatin alphabet dothe signyfie chearefull peaceable couragious hearte careth greately howe worlde goeth answere may geuen diuell world truely wyll caste away ioy thy sake neither doo regard muche thy displeasure away haue pleasure delite christe thou canst worke sorowe suche mynde dothe angelles wyshe v verse dyuels songe cleane contrarye wherein god blasphemed cursed slaughter commytted thynges ordered thynges defyled care sorowe moste myserable calamytie furtheraunce hereof doo secte maysters bestowe theyr laboure dylygence dyuelles mouthepapystes banne god heauen sette prynces varyaunce discorde thynke nothynge amitie peace feyne good wylle syghte priuilye entende myschiefe moste subtyll deuyses thys pleaseth wel saith diuell thys glory dyuell hell sedition earth amongest menne desperate mynde full care whote blastynge myserye manye founde suche mynde hath store goodes thys theyr myndes possessed vexation diuers torment grypinges helpeth nothyng although myddle pleasure doth diuel wish al god gift may vnfruitful vnto angel songe contrarie wyshe bold couragious heart vnmouable marpese rocke glorieth agaynst stormes temptation bitter tribulation song ye angell yt found bokes made amongst earth set fro heaue god holy spirite help v may holde faste fulfyll dede thorough iesus christ sonne lorde amen fourthe sermon concernyng hystorie mary shepheardes thus farr hystorie haue proceded taughtthe sermon thangelles vnfruitfull god sent angel eue great prince preach vnto two thre shepheards also rude people sing vnto ioyfull verse touchyng chyld iesus whiche nowe foloweth hystorie came passe angel departed heauen sayde one c dothe appere sermon song angel vnfruitfull shepherd set much theyr flocke take iorney child angel called lord one fruite spronge angel sermon shepheardes made preacher shewe men heard chylde euangelist saieth herd thinges yt declared shepheards meruailed admiration continued long greater sorte thing dothe testifiethe world forgeteth god miracle men belongyng vnto kyngdome god kepe long mynde neither god mercye wrathe neyther punyshemente benefites wycked man mynde quickly forgetteth example god shewed vnto v therby prouoketh god always shew new example signes plague may vtterly falle oure remembrance taken wheras euangelist saith heard merueiled communication talke longe cotinuance endured monethes childe borne bethleem whome ye angel triumphed ayre whome wyse men came easte grete worshippe one two yeares al cleane memorie man cared wheras thyrtie yeares christ began come abrode teaching miracle man called reme brance fyrst thing verily much better man may scarsly finde one amogest thousand remembreth ye misery especiallwe also forget misery popedome great calamity vnder ye doctrine worshipping god lay oppressed popedome place tormeting coscience confort iewes lyke case ther measure ende complayning lamenting vexed egypte scarsely bene foure dayes desert deliuerace desired retourne egypte mindefull old state suche vnstablenes vnconstancie mannes mynde forgetteth almost moment greuouse punishements howe long remeber benefyte case prouerbe seme vntrue nihil cit u senescit quam gratia nothing sone worne remembrance good turne although god sheweth example wrathe sendinge sycknes euyls yet commeth profit therby wash tyle howse grefe payne body somwhat moued assone ende quite forgotten thyngs meaning ye euagelist wheras saith men dyd meruaile meruaile longe continuance yet diliget disciple obserue matter certayne great grauitie set lyghtly thyngs world doth euangeliste saith moreouer mary kepte sayingsmary forgetteth pondered heart nowe example worde god truely heardegods word pondreth hearte hath diligent meditation theron kepe god word diligently serchyng puttyng practise suche dayly encreased vnderstandinge surely confirmed chanceth negligent receaue one eare forget whatsoeuer put fyndeth place abyding water doth botomles barrell mary doth otherwyse kepeth podereth heart perceaueth belongeth vnto wherefore prynteth mynde pondereth bestoweth great studie great matter howe could come passe called mother chylde angel called lord concerning preache magnificetly sort thought caste depe rootes heart worlde afterward spoken agaynst matter yet could persuaded thinke otherwyse certainly assured herof sonne sonne god sauiour worlde word god wold haue selfe familiar vnto vsthe word god lightly regarded might custome turned oure nature balad ballade put token remembrance vpon thy heart bracelet thy arme requireth signe marke onely may flowe aboue heart fome doth water spettle tongue caste thynges might surely printed hearte might surely graued therin man might abolishe wyse geuen byrth nature whiche extinguished power suche hearte mary whiche kept word sure though graued therin doth receaue word wyse hath true marke christ true cautery signe suffer word wreste hand harte whatsoeuer sectary scysmatykes rise agaynst ye dyuell hym self haue beleued knowen chylde kepe constantly great dilige ce geue learning god wordbut must marke also desire god word enter maner harte muste also take hede lett v learne lytle example oftentymes one thing taught repeted childern vntill beare away thynke yt great matter gotten lytle care assone sermon done go vnto busynes care hearde vse deaffull ouerthwartnes thing ought fyrst seke kyngdom god haue diligent studie theron think may done laste math oure owne busynes fyrst concerning oure wordly welth pleasure c wold sett god word much oure busines men persuaded wherfore marueill ther great infirmitie yt quickly forgett altogether appeareth temtation yet christian men know duetye counte nothing better precious god word wherfore myndes dwell although haue muche wordly busines yet mynde inclineth wherin lyeth matter greater weight farre haue spoken example mary whiche euangelist thought worthy rehersed small commoditie profite foloweth shepheards retourned glorifying praysing god thing heard seen said vnto themhe serue god must cha ge vocatio mounkes shepheards hade spred abrode fame touchyng chylde iesv could vnknowen man towne bethleem retourne flockes glorifie prayse god angel gaue commandement verse doctrine therfore besyde taken worthy remembred shepheardes gotten great light knowledge christ go desert take vp lodgyng monasterie abbey maner mounkes nonnes see vocation bestowe selues serue helpe neighboure leaue kynde lyuinge body take lyue sorte neuer made faith mounkes opinion could saued excepte ende shewed selues vnlyke men excepte wore apparell dyd eat sorte also watche c thought selues also prophane vnreligious wherfore inueted vnused trade liuing peculiar selues apparel meate tyme place count christianitie naming religio dede religio yet ye diuell also hath religious christ came change externall thingschrist commeth change externall thyngs subuert creature make new wherfore body may appareled fed constrayned labour nede necessitie requireth creature vsed god ordinance without chaunging came chaunge thing therof permitted mannes free chaunge apparell meate matter require chaunge may done beastes also chaunge thing great estimation neither necessary christ set foorth much reason mutation change estemed god seruice religious obseruation herein consisteth true mutation came christchrist chaungeth heart men chaunged inwardly heartes openinge gospell oure tyme thought god regard gouernance saluatio consisted self knew nothing herof synne death ought ordered therfore many fell vnto mounkerie great vertue cowle apparell eating faste c death slayne herby syn put asyde remayne vnder cowle well vnder garmentes thing gone heart self may purchase new light new token remembrance said may surely persuaded god hath respecte vnto regardeth sent sonne flesh hym myght ouercome death obtayn euerlasting lyfe true change heart knew knoweth chaunge brought christ heart mynd may renewed vnderstanding affection might rise therin great loue mony rich christ knowe thing also body lyfe thing rather put perill christ forsaken word thou woldest bye christ fauour half peny nothyng hygh pryce thou woldest set christ thou thoughtest thy saluation consisted fryer wede thou hatest worse madde dogge adder counted great synne hade eaten fleshe frydaye nowe doo abhorre execrate wickednes whiche made deadly synne doo inwarde chaunge whiche belongeth heart whereas affection heart yet forsaketh vocation kepeth old kynd lyfe example shepheardes teacheth v fyrst shepheards neuer thought sauiour bornethe example shepheards knew angel make haste towne seke chylde seen hym declared prayse geuen hym rendred thankes great benefite retourne heardes chaunge part apparell remayne shepheardes kepe accustomed kynde lyfe christian doctrine lyfethe chaunge creature last day christ cam chaunge creature vntill laste day sowle shall perfecte renewed whiche thing begonne lyfe shall body chaunged mannes vnperfections taken awaye shall go vp downe ayer lyke angells bright starre oure body shal spirituall shall nede helpe oure naturall necessitie shall externall thing channged come passe nothyng innouate oure customably lyfe god ordinance obserued vertue exercised hinderance christes religion neither doth christ regard codition state thou art hym neither man woman lord seruant galat neither superior neither inferior neither circuncision neither vncircuncision new creature whan gotten touching thing thou hast changeth nothing commandeth kynd lyfe shewe obedience god care diligently wherfore thing set forth hystory shepheards praysed glorified god cast new additio god religion institute new ceremony solitarie place lyue strange lyfe cotrarie common example worshipping god contemplation god seruice true religion much despise obedience due god delight selues owne inuentions phantasy wheras true worshipping god execute diligently kynde lyuing god gaue content thy state desyre thynke suertie thy duetie beautifie order person geuen god nature euery man degree may know god glorifie hym seruice pleasant acceptable god done god requireth garmet heare neither fasting neither coule thou shouldest obey word glorifie sone pleased seruice prophetes describe great wrathe godthe prophetes alwais require inward change rebuke hypocrite wyse offer ye many sacrifice vnto take selues burnt offringes offered beastes hunger tell world myne plentie therof gaue ye comaundement touchyng burnt offrings c comande ye heare voyce glorifie name geue thankes gaue beastes vnto eate therof referre worshyppyng seruice though receaue handes suche lyke prophetes declare also tyme duetie entreat men change mutation theyr heart inward sence dothe god require especially word residue causeth change mutation kyndes vocation lyfe loke soeuer man hath inward renouation let hym shewe odedience diligence therin truely ecclesiasticall doctrine example shepheardes returned wyth thankfulnes ioy belonged vnto shepeheardes dyd onely ioyned therunto praise glorifie god paragraph euident example vitis patrum certayn man whiche semed hym selfe holy would certayne hereof place degree haue heauen bounde mynstrell learne example degree demanded therfore thyngs could duetie mynstrel answered speciall thyng bestowed worke labour husbandme daunce companion woulde certaine tyme haue rauyshed maiden letted defended mayde agaynst wrong long would knowe seconde tyme also thyng comanded go two maried wome neither dyd geue hym answer wer demaunded duetie mynstrell dyd vse holye exercise lyfe seyng familie child cause doo best diligence euer endeuoured haue commoditie refrayn braulyng chidynge learned muche two example confessed openly bee kynde lyuynge vile despised man lacke occasion doo woorkes charitie godlynes god dothe allowe obedience kynde lyuynge peraduenture thys doone dede yet necessarye fame shold spread wyth wysedome world myght auoyde monkerye christianitie pleasyng god consysteth externall obseruations inward hearte thou mayste thynke surely iesus thy sauioure haue thy truste hym myndful kynd prayse hym god wyll count common practises lyfe vnpure thynges true godlynes consisteth outewarde obseruationswherfore must stick surely beware christen righteousnes separated frome worde coupled appoynted vesture whiche oftentymes theyr coloure worthy iested surely fond thynge contrary propre true sentence christian godlynesse hearte requireth let outwardly change god hath called euery man vsed men honest conuersation custome trade oughte endure ende lyfe lyfe come body also shall rydde strypped cleane fylthynes impedimentes thyng god graunt v thorough healpe oure lorde iesus christ amen sonday newe yeares daye pthe gospell luke ii father mother meruailed thinges spoken simeon blessed said vnto mary mother behold childe appointed fall risyng many israel signe whiche spoken againste moreouer sworde shal pearce thy soul thoughtes many heartes may opened exposition chiefest part gospel simeon doth prophecie christ kingdome howe fyrst iewes people israel shold receaue gentile shalbe ruine fall great parte declared vpon third sonday aduent neuertheles mean season herby shold come resurrection abundance saluation many besydes dyuers lesson purpose runne lightly ouer waye hystorie befell chylde iesvs moneth half olde brought temple maner iewes redemed lord offring first begotten wer wont wont taught day whan christ offred temple cam simeon temple holy ghost began preache chylde shoulde become saluation lyght iewes one place gentile whole world eua gelist saith simeon caused father mother meruaile greately sermon made touchyng chyld called ioseph christes father speakynge common sorte men euangelist circumspect warie inough fore wher wrote testifying christ conceiued holy ghost born virgin mary wherfore notedluke calleth ioseph father christ man take hereof occasion erroure luke place scripture place dothe vse wordes doth math declaring matter priuie working god virgin mary wared great chylde whiche thing iosephs dutie beleue angel opened vnto slepe ye old man simeon commeth whose eye dimme age preached magnificentely chylde doubtlesse many iudged wordes came right mynde meruaile old dotysh man spake dotyshly testimonie euangeliste sheweth contrarie suche sermon saith father mother taken great meruail touchyng matter well instructed aungels place simeon lyghte gentile wherfore place exposition sheweth meruailynge signifieth doubte rather token greate faithe disposition faythe greater isthis meruailyng ryseth faythe admiration meruaile causeth vncredible ioye bryngeth fayth thyngs colde without affection withoute motion yt may take exaple haue heard fewe day christes natiuitie byrth chylde made fleshe bloud myght sauiour delyuer v synne death kyngdome diuell thou haste true beliefe faith bee withoute admiration neither eye satisfied seyng neither hearte thynkynge chylde wherefore prayse bothe father mother faythe mother excedyng glad chylde put foorthe lyght lyghten gentile comparison whome kynges prince shoulde darknesse nyght hath store cou cell healpe men asmuch oppressed bound selues wyth synne death corrupt naturewe ought voyde meruailyng shold voyde meruaile heare tydinges oure myndes woulde bee exalted puffed vp prowde ioyefulnes woulde boaste sorte christian baptised doubt haue maistrie ouer synne deathe thorough christe heauen creature shall turne best saluation howe greatly dothe greate gyfte greate manne delyghte poore man comparison turkes dominion whiche nowe greatest vpon earth myne yet noo poynt compared haue portion inheritaunce christe lyue hym euer howe many truely delyted herewith haue learned knowe wee beleue easye proue wee meruayle therat wherfore faith muste nedes colde scarcely half alyue beleue truely glad also prowd gladnesse lette manne meruaile pride christian commendableit becometh christen proude excellent manfulnes haue hyghe myndes agaynst dyuell aduersitie knowe christe lordes ouer thou muste euer haue respect lytle people chose felowshyp neuer falleth embraceth kynge ryseth saluation howe offence hadde christwherfore offended yf many peryshe heapes course thynges accordyng prophecie simeon pope banneth curseth doctrine suche horrible sorte neuer heard goeth aboute myght destroy feareth seduced thereby vnderstandeth well truthe verye malice stubbornesse wherewith moued agaynst v bee offended euen take heauylye greued heare thys chyld sauiour say shoulde thys nothynge doo damned hitherto haue folowed thys kynde doctrine religion haue thys principall offence whiche simeon speaketh place therefore soeuer thou seest thynges call remembrance foorth doone god commaundemente chylde whome mary hathe brought foorthe offence stumblyng block whyche wyse worlde holye shall stumble fall headlonge wherefore euer hee receaued muste passe wyth closed eye deafe eares neyther must change thyng purposed order iewes thys matter geueth v euidente examplethe offence ye iewes greatly offended christe disputed spake vnto wise ye shall dye youre synnes iohn iudged sayinge foole howe shoulde people ignoraunt truthe wyll god hath moses prophetes shoulde thys nothynge preuayle healpe v saluation condempned suche myserie carpenter sonne shal teache v way saluation men stumbled brake neck throwen headlong destruction lyke maner doo monkes calle oure doctrine dyuellyshe hereticallthe offence monkes shewe foorthe theyr prayer fastes crake great burdein say shold nothing god let v doo euyll let v surfet bee whooremongers thynges maye make oure selfe allowable god gette saluation seynge good woorkes preuayle nothynge thys theyr offence also dampnable stumblyng theyr confusyon neuer aryse wherefore yf thou bee delyghted trewely wyth state christianitie behaue thy selfe thy prince chrit thou thy selfe thy doctrine thy trade lyuyng maye please men thou hearest without longe circumstaunces christ worlde stumblyng blocke caste way whiche myghtie holye men shall stumble wherfore thou doest refuse called heretike foole seducer ioyne thy selfe kyngechristen men offence thou myslyke state haue nothyng doo kyng vnmutable lawe kyng kingdom according prophete bothe maister disciple lorde seruantes whiche lorde hym selfe haue geuen bee signe wonder stumbling stone rocke fall terrible image greuous wrathe god putte forth exaple ful humanitie swete comfort whiche passed many saith put ryse nowe therfore turne thy selfe vnto receaue kyng doubt sake put lyfe haue ieopardiechrist put foorth risyng doo rise vp christ knowe theim selues haue hope saluation fallen downe wyse fynde helpe ryse signe ware fierce thyngs blaspheme curse great impudencie pride take diligent hede offence moue man woulde say turne awaye thy eye muche otherwise thys chylde seke delyght thy eye beholdyng thys poore nedye people whyche fynde thys chylde way rise whatsoeuer combrance heauy laden braste disconforted heart fynally whatsoeuer redy perishe appointed king thing condemned restored hym folishe thing learne wyse thing blamable iustified sanctified stycke sure co forte neuer fall thou man popedome say thing quiet trouble neither heresy neither dissention springing doctrine sprong vp also trouble litle good nothing al come therby suche reprouers aunswere mayste thou geue gospell christ shall neuer preached earnestly fall ouerthrowe many afterward become begynners great turmoylings yet neuer lesse muste leaue commoditie vnspoken certaine embrace recouer falle conscience myserie affliction feare receaue confort ye gospell thing oure aduersaries consyder behold falle offence could meanes escaped fault doctryn good syncere perfecte fault men applie selues doctryn neither obey cosider matter vprightly whether muche better papistes offended oure example dyuell rule place without offence quiet possession idolatrie false doctrin miserable men driuen perdition whole flockes rather suffer short punishement tyme endlesse punishemet punishemet euerlasting vnrecouerable popedome corrupt doctrine without knowledge god without true seruice haue proued tried many generall councels doctrine might applied men offed man matter euident thou take away offence christ remayne sight man forthwith riseth trouble ruine falling vnto v also laste christ come gospell whilest thinke litle theron euen came also iewes whiche thyng ought repute great renoume geue great thanks therfore thought worthy vnspeakable grace goodnes god pope bishop angry god called fyrst councell matter reformation church myght set vpon assent god vsed order doyng riseth offence euery christ maner preacheth freely pope bishop suffer hereof commeth trouble prophecie simeon endureth euer child put forth falling many israel yea rather worlde wherfore muste nedes offence come math cor christ saith place muste sectes heresy doctrine without persecutio yet remaineth christ ye middest fury madnes men rise saued falle perishe wold faine haue christ sorte sent god father blocke helpe lyfte vp make men rise wheras madnes many suche crepe humbly blocke stryue hym styffe necke owne desire put self perill falling fault christ mad men thorough pryde make christ put forth sygne rise signe falling ruine wherfore gospell falsly slaundered troblesome seditious doctrinethe gospell ye cause trouble men stubbournes pope byshops say though euill rose comon welth though dyd stirre vppe kynd myserie plague synnes idolatry wold geue place doctrine caste stoppe dissention euill set self stubburnely thinke self mete geue place marueil god doth alway desyers ye iewes also offended christ ther fault christ wold rather haue saued came purpose men beleue hym obtayn saluation hym faulte christ mete lyue maner christ whiche lord christ gospell cause ought haue respecte therto loth blame nothing owne stubburnnes damnable wickednes gospell without faulte fyrste parte prophecye simeon turneth speach mother word sworde shall perce thy heart thoughtes many harte may open semeth litle agree word euangelist wher said simeon blessed blessing wishing good thing wheras prophecieth come passe heart shall perced sworde written christ mary sake learning written haue nede may fashion oure iudgement therby man therethe gospell openeth heartes chiefe apostle wold haue suspected malice world wold haue ben great except gospell geuen v reuelation herof many good men reuelation whiche lyued soberly godly many wyse whose honestie man might well pronounce othe litle renoume worlde without gospel haue science wisdom honestie c also greater thing religion worlde hath inuented ordayned religiouse order popedom example man beholdeth wil conceaue great opinion godlynes worlde gospell shyneth wyse men honest sober vpright men reason ciuill vertues partly iugling ceremony excepte goodnes god helped cast headlong destruction pretence iuste holy wyse pure synne gospell opened child iesus preachedthe gospell plucketh visards world openeth heartes almoste proued ye sences declared picture yt saynctes moste synners wyse foles sober men moste cruell tyrantes neither hath gospell enemy spitefull men great wyse prudent vpright lyuing good holy excell vertues much behaue selues enuiously gospell proue experience religion mounkes shewe praying fasting chastisings furiously behaue selues gospell simeon speaketh place great shew saith maketh worlde administration well ciuill religiouse lyue honestly holyly great sparing defrauding self pleasure may soone taken angel sonnes god great wisdom holynes could beleue might lie hyd suche corruption vnder fayer shew art full knowledge might iudged perceaued excepte texte wheras saith gospell shall vtter poyson wherfore opened moueth wrath great holy men muste nedes betray selfes shew men hypocrisiethe gospell openeth heartes exaples besyde caste wyse prince earnestly moued care sauing subiectes couetouse dronkards glutton diligent busines realme defend men wronge chast husbandes short king prayed wished wold thought moste mete theyr vertues prudece goodnes holynes c wilt thou know matter goeth scarsly publyshing gospell may man perceaue vncredible hypocrisie bloud thyrstye hearte gapeth shedding innocentes bloud whiche myngleth thing great deceites letteth passe kynde subtiltyes oppresse gospell ryd way yet occasion made open whiche wold beleue great synnes lye hyd vnder holy apperance chanceth launcing cutting thing pestilent poyson gusheth gospell reason thisthe holyest hateth gospel moste gospell man cosent taught fyrst alowers therof set purpose professe religion euer thou art aunswer pope bishop priest mounkes vniuersities doctours spitefull enemy thing simeon meaneth saith mary thy child shal author great tumult shall bewray myght sone haue lyen hyd al men ye wold scarsly know selues shall open heartes counted moste holy may knowen blaspheme full gyle deceit periurie hate enuie malice suche fylthynes shall opened hym whiche neuer lesse dyuers vertues wisdome innocencie vprightnes holynes might counted worthye rule worlde ye heauen also opening heart administred chylde fyrst whan gospell came abrode neuer thought worlde wold madde iudged men self whereas thought men wold triumphe ioy deliuered earnestly tyranny pope christ made partaker good thing whiche studied great coste payn purchase yet vayne thought thing wold specially please scoles byshops wold please handled doctrine intreated without mercye man hate v religiouse men muste accustome selues suffer iniquitie must caste gospell wickednes worlde set forth doctrine therof earnestly bewrayeth dyuell member great enemy god world giftes vertues could neuer know self great wickednes contempt man heart gospell teacheth v knowe well pope bishop prince noble citizen rustykes euen vexed dyuels much doo refuse holsome doctryne persecute also spite despise prowdliethis opening pertayneth iudgement perceaued learned gospell thought holy ghoste reigned doyng pith saying whereas simeon saith christ shall open thoughtes mennes heartes doth open truely oure instruction coforte instructe v sorte offended troubled folishenes men betrayeth selfe matter without admiratio goodly wise prince good procede madnes suffer word god curse moste wickedlye thing gospell geueth succoure openeth mysterie tyme thoughtes heart secret cometh forth dede also called opener ye heartes doth open secretes may appeare mennes thoughtes whiche neither selues neither knew yet opened better ouer couered colour could seen thoughtes heartes lay hyd gospell set foorth appeareth playne sonne hyd euen pit al myschefe state wherin goeth sorte ye well amongest hye lord low loordaynes look much better holyer partes much hate gospell full poyson blaspheming god momus thought omitted perfecte making man accomplished gospell euen open place se heart breast ye priuities heartes may seen nothing according saying simeon may hyd opening pertayneth confortsecodarily opening heartes oure confort seing world brought meanes allow god word yet sheweth outwardly great pretence holynes feare thinke surely whatsoeuer apperance righteousnes ther yet much found giltie vycethe greatest vice presete word god despise euen abyde god word persecute condemned dyuell thereto belongeth holines workes counterfaited thing considered proper naturethe greateste vice persecute worde god despise let euill thynge indued wisdome rightousnes sobernes euill excellent vertues vsed clokyng greuous synnes cursing god persecutynge worde uirginitie muche craked dede rare great gifte commendation woldest thou leaue uirgin woulde commit murder commendation gyfte shoulde seme great seing ioyned wit suche great crime myghte thought worthie lyfe lykewyse also goeth matter case accordinge sayinge simeon speakynge vnto marye thy sonne shall conuicte worlde greate crime thefte man slaughter murderynge father euen nowe almost counted god shall open heartes shall declare euidentlye themselues extreme enemy god hypocrisie suffered wherin outwarde apperaunce hydeth greate offence continewe longe let christ onely come abrode gospell shalbe euident worlde full leude person enemy god theues robber pacientlye suffer themselues named yet god purge themselues crime althoughe outwarde lyuynge vpright yet faulte greate vngodlines suffer god worde whiche make good name agreable men tounge handes lytle thynge smale occasion driuen slaughter wheras hearte ful slaughter vice opened gospell whiche otherwise man could knowe man also beleue wherfore simeon addeth nowe furthermore spech mary sworde saieth shal perse thy soule faine behold fele outragiousnes world vniuersall churche nowe vnpossible man see without sorowe greate trouble minde peter sayeth loth dwelled amongest righteous man seing hearyng2 pet day day vexed righteous soule vnrighteous workes sworde perseth hearte saye hearte tormented wickednes worlde greatenote full dissimulation worketh meane tyme kynd iniuries infamy god saintes one cross christian men euen sorow hearte whiche passeth thynges greue causeth beinge vexed groue payne whiche haue doubtles paynes wicked tarrieth longe spoken touchyng ye prophecie simeon prophecie simeon ioyned hystory anne prophetesse testifieth preacheth also herselfe holy ghost christ reporteth euangeliste serued god daye nyght prayer fastynge aduersaries papistes caste teth thought made themfaste prayer seruice god wheras yet neuer denied god must serued fastynge prayer seing fastynge temperance eating dr kynge prayer also commanded god also count portion god seruice obedience commanded papistes content cast addition thertobut remission syn commeth therby requiringe obedience shoulde belonge obtayninge remission synnes euerlastyng lyfe denie precisely answere angel child iesu called iesus sauiour maye saue people synnes let v make end cal god grace mercifull vnto v defende v al offence geue v muche power maye rise christ neuer stumble offence doctrine thinge christ lord vouchsalf graunt v amen circumcision christ iewes fyrst sermon galat iiii tyme ful come god sent hys son made woman made bonde vnto lawe redeme whiche bonde vnto lawe thorowe election myght receaue inheritaunce belongethe vnto naturall sonnes ye sonnes god hathe sente spirite hys sonne heartes cryeng abba deare father wherfore nowe thou arte seruaunt sonne thou sonne thou arte also heyer god thorowe christe exposition daye wont preache two matter first circumcision name iesu thynge euangelist doth especially notifie prophecied childe conceaued mother wobe wherfore vertue name hereby greatly adua ced asmuche intende make doctrine circuncision plaine difference especial marked consisteth thing person consider thynge great differece betwene circucision iewes christ person christ fare vnlyke person iewes beginninge circumcision declared bible firste booke moysesthe beginning circu cision hath also appointed ende whiche shall endure euen vnto christ abraham principall ground matter whome god gaue commandement circumcise hymselfe housholde also whatsoeuer male kynde borne shoulde circumcised eyght daye theyr byrth therfore came suche signe theyr bodye god protectour sauiour god promised woulde appointed god nothynge litle cause gene onely abraham also familie whatsoeuer male kynde borne shoulde subiect circumcision onelye iewes myghte boste selfe people god receaueth seruaunts abraham whiche gentile people sonnes haue righte inheritaunce whiche appointed abraham seede dyd obtayne isaac whiche neuerthelesse afterwarde promesse ioyned yet bought seruauntes gentyles wherfore iewes haue cheife occasion boste although extolle circumcision muche yet denye god hath called vnto gentyls whiche sonnes abrahamcircumcision abrogat boughte seruauntes touchinge circumcision nothynge el lefte v type fygure fayth also touchynge hystories paste whiche onelye profyte v maye take therof example fayth true godlynes bounde ceremony yet haue nede suche obedience suche fayth whiche lyued vnder suche ceremony wherefore doctrine circumcision put foorth intent circumcised thys ceremonie disanulled rehersall therof shoulde remember shewe obedience god abraham shewed yf christ hade come circumcision shoulde haue ben necessarie euen tyme v woulde people god condition straight without exception circumcised soule must exempt people god wherefore example take olde circumcision god image declareth vnto v contrarie reason worketh commandeth man vse iudgement reason amongest proud gentyls semed thynge laughed god wise shoulde set foorth suche mad precepte wherof made mention preachynge contrary lawe shamfastnes honestie chastitie especiallye aged commanded abraham tyme fowre score nintyne yeres olde herof riseth contumelious namesthe wisdom worlde offended iewes named recutiti appelles among gentyls saye men whose skynne growen againe men without skynne true cause therof sayde gospell nexte whatsoeuer god put foorth done fashion men laughthe scorne man aloweth testeth vpon though olde wyues fable contrarie looke whatsoeuer commandeth owne imagination require acceptable vnto hym woulde haue obserued euerlastynge lawe neuer alowed god1 cor herof springeth cause greate offence paule saith wisedome god worlde knewe god wisedom pleased god saue beleue folishnes preachynge maye reason bread body christ cuppe bloud christe receaued remission synnethe supper lorde reason howe shoulde lytle bread wine worke suche greate thynge thynketh reason neyther thynke anye otherwise god therfore purposeth change yf reason doth beleue alow god cause neuer worse thatbaptisme agaynste reason lykewise also goeth baptisme howe shoulde seme proueable reason child washed lytle water therby purged sinnes translated kyngdome deuil kyngdome god dede might stand wel reason synne shold washed awaye water sinne spote asmuche sin fastened minde bone inermost parte body agreable reason water shoulde perse far washe awaye nowe consider well circumcisioncercumcisio agaynste reasone mighte abraham lyke reason alleage himselfe refuse doth profit saluation circumcised mine age good doth child profit doth man take circumcision god would haue bodye changed mighte haue made beginnynge shold nede nothing cut fro reason ben taken councell time wold haue sayd euen neither doth thinke otherwise dayes proueth wisedom learned placereason ought make search god comandemet whensoeuer question moued god shold geue commandement deuill hath ye vpper hand ye exaple eue paradise doth shew comadement geue yt shold eat ye tree whan began regarde litle commandement hard deuill reasonynge god made suche lawe fell downe hedlonge caste suche disobedience vnto time suffer blame penaltie therof wherefore lette lawe congregation god geueth commandement thynke thy duetie honour submission make searche yf commande obey speake attent disalowe nothyng doth certain principle doth god diriue set doinges men fooles lyers euyll greate madnes neuer oughte maye able vnderstande worde workynge ieremie sayth leud vnsearcheable hearte man seinge therfore oure leudnes vice great shoulde owne accorde correct oure iudgement thynke uchynge god workes commandementes seme contrarie reason trulye cause haue suche corrupt vnderstandynge dul knowledge nothynge hindreth iudgyng god wisedo myn owne natural folishnes wherfore circumcision example fayth singuler obedience wheras abraham seruates nothing offended commandement obeied without reasoning thought thus circumcision folish thing aged peraduenture god meanynge thought otherwise yt sin ye flesh shold restrained man wold cut doubtles ye true circucision shold god comand thing contrarie reason body circumcised entent done men thought obedient commandement persuaded selues syth god doth requier seme neuer much reason yet shall saued obey precepte wherfore example stedfast faith wherwith abraham seruantes endued put forth v folow geue oure selues oure owne wisdom reason deceaued haue spoken touching circumcision ieweswhy childern circoncised eyght day whiche hath longer power law selfe vnto comminge christ signified childern circumcised vpon eight day order law six day sabboth day foloweth sabboth eight day euen beginning weke folowing christ circumcisio began fulfil saying prophecied hym euen sauiour light lighten getiles haue kyngdome limited border iewes gospel extend kingdom throughout world herof begynning wherfore said must put great distance difference betwene circumcision iewes christ person vnlykea difference betwene circoncision christ iewes although thing vnlyke circumcision geuen whiche synners condemned euerlasting death christ without synne lord law vpon whome law hath stroke law synners synner much circumcised law chyldern synners law ouerseen doth hym wronge cause law compelled make recompence therfore power disanulled abrogate pleased christ might abolished abrogated law power lord ouer law law haue naught without synne wold nothing presumptuously rigour order hym self humbly equall triall law done oure sake might take confort therof oure doyngschrist hath nede circumcision owne behalf christ nede obey mother crucified doth oure sake nede man without synne fulfill law v turne away wrathe god cause made subiecte vnto law afterward geueth v victorie whiche law might helped hym law haue power ouer v ouer hym least accuse condemne v embraceth christ true faith obtayneth hym deliuerance law damnation therof wherfore remember well difference matter restethe therein abraham subiecte lawe circumcision synner lawe hath power hym synne christ synner therfore constrayned vnder law yet doth submit hymself law receaue hym faith may free curse lawe wherfore history christ circumcision geueth smalle conforte remembrance wherof thankes worthely geuen god although daunger lawe syn yet perill oure saluation christ haue deliuerance curse law gal whiche oure sake suffered curse law made hymself subiecte lawe necessarye wyse delyuered lawe saying paule romains sayththe sentence paul rom rom circumcision preuayleth nothyng keping god commandements confident kynde speache much say man circumcised fulfilled law god kepte law god thing circumcised circumcised god commandement euer ioyned prescripte thou shalt loue lorde thy god thy heart thy sowle thy mynde let one brought forth al men may boste hath done law commandeth thou shalt desyer shew one boste deut deut hath done shorte chose whatsoeuer commandement thou wilt amongest thou causte denye thou haste kepte tymes sentence geuen agaynst kepe notthe conditio law vnpossible ueryly pronounced paule cursed vnder lawe coulde perill sith certayn sure law accuseth v killeth deliuereth v dyuell condemneth hell wherfore haue nede highe profound doctrine whiche may v lawe doth nothing commande v loue god oure heart oure neighbour oure self yea hurteth v also wold desier reuenged law preuayleth nothing controllinge nedes muste oure nature anger variance vnpacientnes hatred enuie pride lyke remedie wherfore ther obey doctrine neither thing preuayle iudgement god fulfill law much cause greater euen christe sonne god commeth worlde great moderation submitteth self lawe take wholly away may pleade law wyse thou doste men looke thou shouldest doe thou makest righteouse thou doste purifie harte proue experience el cause dauid haue say psal comprise faultes purge lord secrete synnes lykewyse psalme psal enter iudgement thy seruant man righteous thy sight psal psal thou marke straightly oure iniquity lord shal able stande iudgement lyke sentence testifie man say lorde haue done worke euen thou comandedst doubt much law hath v bound vnto wyse dryueth v sight godlawe yea beateth downe oure confidence faith ought haue god must necessitie graunt haue nede perfecte doctryne may come god sight doctryne gospellgospell whiche christ procureth preached v iewes sentence damned oure synne profiteth iewes nothing circumcised circumcisio deliuereth synne prophet saith although haue flesh foreskyne circumcised yet heart vncircumcised vnpure deliuereth gospell preacheth wyse oure lord iesus christ whiche ought nothing lawe without synne made hym self subiect lawe wold circumcised might haue lawe much wher lord lawe yet challeged bondman ye lawe againe abydeth controling dominion christ power christ hath ouer ye lawe doth make common v allchrists actio ye law benummeth lawe power whiche v synners deliuereth v entent nothing regard geue ouer oure self lustes whe haue done might forgeuen v layde oure charge neither turne away oure saluation wherfore beleue christ hath nede circuncisionhow christ deliuereth v law free suche lyke burden lawe haue also remissio synnes promesse euerlasting lyfe christ doth profit beleue christ circumcised done sake might suerty whatsoeuer action ye law haue wherfore wil truste innocencie hym shalbe confort although tyme lawe lord heauen accused v men god safegarde neither could complayne wrong oure syn ope yet matter otherwyse ye circumcision christ deliuered curse lawe put great confidence oure circumcision loue towarde god obedience toward oure neighboure truste stycke thing oure truste christ obedient innocent holy trust shall deceaue v certain opened vnto v thought must nedes fulfill lawe damned knowledge impossible men beare burden christ hath taken v put hym self began matter circumcision fulfilled lawe herein oure truste oughte truely carelesse taming flesh instructing may obey god leaste founde vtterly disobedient whatsoeuer able remit safegard whatsoeuer haue done dyd christ sake shall neuer good takynge may ought doo paule sayththe saying paul rom delighted lawe god inwarde man finde lawe member repyninge lawe mynde subduynge lawe syn member whiche muche say must compulsion obey flesh fayth greueth abyde bondage sorte christian righteousnes made perfecte acknowledge synnechristian righteousness neuer fulfill lawe god yet despaire therefore example knowledge christ regardeth sake made hym self subiecte lawe fulfilled hereof ensueth new zeale new affectionchrist fulfilleth lawe euen loue toward god bycause loued v fyrst may obedient diligence herof according psalme riseth willing people whiche beginneth loue god lawe althoughe slacke vnperfecte mean flesh yet alowed god fayth christnote well whatsoeuer vnpure vnperfecte fleeth remission synne meane lefte escape haue spoken two sortes circumcision first commanded god iewes haue obeyd vnto hitherto vnto lawe yet obtayned saluation therby man could fulfill lawe wherfore although lawe yet neuerthelesse lawe accused condemned god saluation holynes obtayned hereby christ subdued hym self lawe bore curse therof wherfore iewes beleued saluation consisting promised sede circumcision outwardly seale assure righteouse god circumcision saith christ whiche thing sith hystory circumcision christ worthely estemed full confort whiche doctryne set foorth desyer way leade v god may obtayned lawe whiche commandeth deut thou shalt loue thy lord thy god thy heart thy neighbour thy selfe neuer wold oure safegard whiche make oure refuge euen christ iesus sonne god oure lorde hath satisfied god made hym self subiecte synner lawe bene neuer haue bene circumcised chyldern vpon eight day done mennes synnes men may haue trust hym nede hym selfe wherfore pertayneth vnto v doo well put oure truste hym may saued righteousnes holynes may briefly one word note matter must sticke righteousnes iustification christ god moste certayne aproued way hath moste suer ayde succoure synne death whiche thing god graunt v oure lord taken away wherfore first consyder thing wel thy self whether thou maist hope greater saluation sauiour mightiest ye worlde thou hast feling euerlasting lyfe come thou shalt haue nede iesus god hath
