succourring helping ayde goodnes must looke easement presente euyls christ alsothe office christ howbeit chyef propre office wherfore doctryne gospell referred especially corporall lyfe propre office declare name deliuerace syn death kyngdom dyuell hand also necessarie synne death nede sauiour belly goddes haue profite sauiour thing sauiour thing regarde herof appeareth great contempte epicure whiche thynk neither god lyfe euerlasting beleueth yt god muste nedes collecte gather al thing ended lyfe ther remayneth lyfe euerlasting proue experiencesignes god regardeth much present lyfe god regardeth muche present lyfe sith wicked hath libertie prospereth wel promiseth v lyfe may seme haue great respecte lyfe chylde iesus set foorth sauiour v geueth v saluation thynge greatly required hym although thing lyfe go wold although perceaue great signes god helpe oure matter saluation euerlasting saluation let sufficient v difficulty encombrances lyfe neuer great see pope cardinal bishopsgod regardeth lyfe specially persecute word lyue great securitie vnshamfastly bent agaynst word christian god seeth suffereth maketh though saw muche may seme haue shewed care gentile people thou christian let moue thee euen cause god hath promised v sure saluation euerlasting lyfe suffereth v lyfe wander men destitute without helpe god may know fayth chylde iesus sauiour whiche neuerthelesse saueth v although thing besyde help gotten syn shall either accuse v hath alredy condemned v eternall death excepte tyme appeareth haue nede sauiour neither much regard helth hath plentie goodes hath nede christ muste redeme matter pryce hath mony enough wt ye corporall gyftes wit wisdome power store helpe saluation farre god hath appoynted oure saluation mother bryngeth foorth chyldern physition helpeth sycke lawyer exacte lawe defendeth wrongfull doer lyfe ende neither coscience hyde synnes god iudgement place made sauiour iesu store helpe thing besyde thing fayle power great wil redy yt ca defed euill conscience death case thou demand whence thou moste looke helpe haue respecte chylde cause named iesus might present saue knowledge looke saluation hym resteth ye whole matter thou suffer name geuen chylde thou graunt name belogeth chylde transposed otherthis name iesus muste made common france dominike carthusian mass uigiles pardos almes fasting lyke abhominable good cause whi ca sauiour inuented synne wherfore wold haue sauiour whether rule carthusian thing goeth cleane without saluation therfore could name child true name could inculcat christ hymself blessed name al thing wherfore store saluation looked wher el dyuels endeuour lyeth chyld might haue name made men perceaue hym iudge chose sauiours helper god wrothe matter certainethe dyuell abhominable sacrilege worke name iesus name belongeth chyld pope byshops mounks c doth neither also geue place oure conscience feare oure synnes sake confort christ sake neither thinke lyued wyse done worke haue easier case god holy ghost abyde indeuoreth might chyld may haue name remayning whole may receaued felowship therof haue nede saluation syn eternall death put trust oure workes merites al ye saintes stycke vnto child faith hath name called iesus neither taken hym without sacrilege go take hym pope turke mounkes presume shal perceaue dede haue committed sacrilege shall neuer remitted cotrarily two three v trust name chyld might power hell able caste v saluation speake world somwhat feare hindering saluation angell brought name heauen named child iesvs conceaued mother wombe wherfore persecute name sette vp sauiours shall go gabriel angell shal reproue lye self shall appeale god say lord thou hast geuen commaundement geue chylde name shall knowen persecuters preuayle name haue remayning self neither god neither iesus shall dye perishe euer synnes shall ende matter moste greuouse destruction wherfore let v neuer forget name let v surely beare away chyld sauiour agaynst death syn dyuell world shall hate v therfore surely doo good lucke prosperitie knowledge chylde sauiour constrayne let consyder whence shall receaue saluation death shall fall head whether defence agaynst mennes workes faste prayer almes mass inuocation sayntes c let stablishement oure matter know suertye name geuen god chylde called iesus sauiour shall know fele oure sauiour without coaction shall haue suer truste hym dreadfull sens synne death shall caste agaynst v prepared hym v moste sure saluation knowe hope fayth greatly alowed god receaueth great renoume contraryly suffereth great indignation god whiche doth either seeke sauiours el know sauiour therfore compare name chyld thyng done name geuenthe name agreeth c rcumcision chylde iesus receaueth circumcision chyldern doo neuerthelesse hath nede synner hath without synne nede purifyed muche pure redye done bycause name iesvs may sauiour agaynst synne euill conscience agaynst death euill commeth synne circumcised might vnder lawe let none al thing vndone enioyned god tyme men see oure vncircumcised heartes oure vncredible disobedience might despaire therfore caste oure selfe christ say synner denieth neither dyd euer fulfill god christ hath done doughtles lawe condemne hym hath lefte least pointe righteousnes vndone wherfore haue nothing lawe accuse condemne alone christ hym embrace righteousnes lay god synnes let dyuell lawe therfore worst trouble synnes muste vse circumcision name christ hath leasure may gather longe sermon full confort touching christ kingdom maner shall remit synne iustifie geue euerlasting lyfe angell doth breifly comprise long sermon one word christ shall sauiour haue name iesus belongeth especially singular prophecye esa esa prophet nameth christ sixe name meruailouse one couceller vertue stronge father worlde come prince peace name belonge hym may obtayn saluation synne death righteousnes euerlasting lyfe behoueth antichrist geue accopt doings rable sophisters whiche taketh name christ describeth hym men cruell angry iudge man may come intercession sayntes good work offend two way fyrste christ spoyled name may iesus sauiour name geuen sayntes yea rather oure workes though christ refused sauiour delighted oure destruction great deceites dyuell vnknowen defyleth oure heartes thoughtes god angry casteth v awaye hath respecte vnto v temptation pray howe thoughtes agree name angell commandement god nameth chyld iesvs name true god perishe rather recouered euill therfore let v lay vppe name oure armary may oure temptation trust vnto safegard therof sonne god christ oure lord called iesvs paradyse declared touching hyme gene seede breake head serpent helpe succoure v agaynst dyuell kyngdome god father conforte mercie geue v alwayes encrease fayth sauiours sake preserue v euer amen vpon epiphanie lord otherwyse called twelfth daye mathew ij iesus borne bethleem citie iewry tyme herode kyng beholde came wyse men east ierusalem saying borne kyng iewes haue sene starre east come worshippe hym herode kyng hearde thynges troubled citie ierusalem hym gathered chiefe priest scribe people together demaunded christ borne sayd vnto hym bethleem iewry thus written prophete thou bethleem lande iew art least among prince iuda thee shall come vnto capitayne shal gouerne people israel herode whe priuily called ye wyse men enquired diligetly tyme ye starre appeared bad go bethleem sayd go way thyther searche iligently child ye haue found hym bring word maye come worship also whe hearde kyng departed loe starre sawe east went tyll came stode ouer place wherein chyld sawe starre exceading gladde went house founde chylde mary mother fell downe flatte worshipped hym opened theyr treasure offered vnto hym giftes gold frankensence myrre warned god sleepe go agayne herode returned theyr owne countrey another way exposition day epiphanie say befell three reuelations one day yet one yeare christ opened hym self wyse men cam east starre baptized iohn floud iordaen dyd fyrst miracle mariage whether chaunced one daythe feast epiphanie make great matter specially consydered hystories bee describe speciall doctryne hystorie daye touching wyse men christ wold haue hym self knowen amonge iewes also amonge gentile leaste iewes lay excuse kept hym self close man could know hym confirmed prophecy borne iewesthis opening necessary gorgiouse magnificent kyng poore could scarsly finde place borne could otherwyse muste nedes rise great offence coming iewes litle offended therby wherfore necessitie required make suche open reuelation hym self amongest gentile although great poouertye kynge yet might euident commendation hym counted smalle matter whereas wyse men came easte brynge tydings chyld ierusalem euen simeon also temple anna doth commende hyme angel ayer shepheards bethleem occupyed chylde extoll commend chylde lacke gloriouse commendation chylde bringe hyme light amonge iewes make hym knowen reuelation moste famouse wyse men comme farre costes ierusalem doo open matter touching byrth kyng iewes herode citie ierusalem hym troubled moued wherfore iewes make excuse ignorance though knew kyng borne troubled tydinges wyse men yea greater witnes also declare herode wyse men place wher christ borne wherfore conuicted owne record also record wyse men king byrth vnknowen vnto doctrine therfore example put forth v looke way man come vnto chyld fynd hym foloweth word leader neuer goeth bredeth nayle let passe wordthe word leadeth christ stumble euery chyld lytle regarded muche despised wherfore possible reason muste nedes stumble offended euerye considereth great pouertye chyld borne worlde thyng lyfe el pouertye myserie affliction calamitie contempte reproche therfore setteth syde word careth heareth preached chylde onely take eies iudges matter ioyned christ iewes thinge perillouswithout word nothing done done conscience example papistes doth testifie whiche omitte worde applie mynd suche imagination yt phantasie christe one conceaue wit reason allowe hym onlye sholde sauior wherfore patche therto workes looke saluation well christe praye vnto marie also maye recocile sonne suche prayer holde opinion sauiour dede false imagination soeuer bestowed serche christ without word goeth dyuell whiche afterwarde causeth men thynke christ iudge appoynteth moste cruell punyshementes men wolde confounded presence must well defenced intercession sainctes mary wherfore maner popedome put trust theyr supplication christe hym selfe neuer come poynte worde caste asyde verily dyuell vnderstandeth hys chief safegard al matter consisteth therin laboreth make men forsake worde folow imagination perceaueth mean shalbe sure haue victorie ouer v wherfore nothynge necessarye hold fast word haue trust touchyng matter belong vnto godlynes holynes worde selfe prescribeth easye men beleue persuade selues many entreated beleue wordes lordes supperchrist ca founde ierusalem beleue reson sence perceaue thei beholde worke selfe without word see thyng bread wyne nothyng el behold outward shale let passe thyng christes wordes wise men also first high cogitatios touchyng christ opened vnto god euen kyng iewes borne take iorney forthwith ierusale thinkyng shold fynd king noble courtit semeth co trary reason yt christe founde ierusalem gorgious palaice thing could reason conceaue suche matter thought without word come soone nought neyther find child ierusalem neuertheles holy citie habitation god must nedes haue word bryng christ true starre sonne leadeth chyld wherfore example wise men counted singular excellent thyng remoue eies heart thoughtes men folow worde put forth micheas prophete ar abashed offended sent place fro ierusalem true seruice god god abode hymself god himselfe temple vnto bethleem vile town wheras neuertheles cam salute person lowe degree workeman kyng iewes folow word streight way care nothyng thoughtes haue onely respect micheas sayth sticke sure faithe thyng common example ben case wold haue departed temple like kyng iewes found famous god hath habitation priesthode religion hath fundation goeth otherwyse kyng alloweth place amonge priestes ierusalem neither tyme founde pope congregation gothe rather abrogate take away priesthode kyngdome great confidence thynges priestes leuites people god temple dothe christe thynke ought suffered suche defilyng temple priesthode seruice myght suffered would stubbornely procede suspendynge moyses seruice disanulled prophanation defylynge laste came passe obedience wise men commeth true godlinesse therefore haue theyr dooynges confirmed god soo theyr waye shewed vnto frome ierusalem vnto bethleem house chylde starre hadde lyttell neede confirmed least shold offended strange sight pouertie euidente euery ioseph marye theyr owne home chylde layde maunger thynges necessarye shold suche great kyng might rather counted thynge woorthy laughed good wyse men bee offended suche thynges regard rather saying prophet signe starre wherfore soeuer matter gothe geue perfourme honoure due vnto kynge fall downe chylde worshyp hym open theyr treasure take foorth kyngly present hystorie whiche chiefest poyntei christ careth onely iewes also gentile god calleth gentils also kyngdom maketh people although circucised neither subiect law iewes great benefite neyther mete christian men vnkynde sure euidence v gentile wee may despayre though part christ wee maye thynke surely christe pertayneth v well iewes although people iewes ther doubt yt wise men gentile whych neyther priesthode neither seruyce word god circumcision yet notwithstandynge come although stranger without commendation settyng foorthe selues felowshyp christ lyght acknowledge acknowledgeth also alloweth theym theyr worshippyng reuerence done hymself thyngs belong confirming v yt may shew selues thankful god hath set vp kingdom erth christ whiche wee people receaued merite deserte mere grace must learn historie alsoii duetie doo towarde chylde duetie doo christ agayn euen resist manfully offence wise confesse christ worlde dyd seeke hym worship hym sauiour kyngdom weake simple syght therof opprest many great difficulty bestowe oure goodes substaunce gladly maintaynynge thereof haue store enough open oure treasure wise men dyd vnto christe offer presentes vnto hym written ye doo least myne ye doo math wherefore healpeth nedy myserable wretched fyndeth charge fitte men may instructed studye learnyng holy scripture processe tyme maye doo profitable seruice congregation offereth nedy chylde iesuthe wyse men brought victuall christ fledde egypt soone borne poore nedy constrained also flee banishment egypte escape tyrannie perill enemye wherfore prouidence god wyse men prepared wayfarynge victuall chylde parentes iorney like ye wordes euangelist small gyft whiche sayth opened theyr treasure seyng euident great good wyl wise men towarde chyld doubt magnificence liberalitie great thyng ought admonish christen men despaire whe suffer persecution tossed vp downe banyshement god lyttle abyde christen men shoulde perishe hunger rather stirre men dwel farre ofgod neuer leueth people succouries bryng succour aide sufficiently confirmed exaumple onely begotten sonne touchyng matter must ioyne also hystorie put forth prophecy micheas wherin conteined euident description christ syngular doctrine lesson selfe whose wordes thou bethleem iuda art least amongest thousandes iuda michee thee shall come gouernour israell sentence iewes testifie themselues god gaue playn euident prophecie christe loked bethleem first swathling band apperyng man naturebethleem ye litle towne christ birth hath great renoune chief renoume setteth forth litle town bethleem magnificently noble excellent citie ierusalem cause euangelist semeth change woordes prophete prophete calleth small euangelist wyll haue counted smal euangelist beholdeth outward syght prophete dyd spirituall glorie sonne god borne whiche honor none honour euer geuen citie compared wherfore magnificent glorious woordes wyth whiche euangeliste commendeth bethleem thee sayth shall come foorthe capitayn shall fede people israell sweete prophecye whiche describeth christe vnto v suche wyse although world man despised pouertie borne obscure vnknowen place yet captayne prince israel ouer people god maner kyngdome taken declared sermon angellchrist capitayne whiche hym self also calleth christ lord suche one tyrant wyll vexe men wyth cruel imperye euen cause sayth prophete bethleem arte smalle though shoulde say thys lorde woulde haue hadde imperiall maiestie myghte seme terrible vnto might haue chosen place byrthe princely prouision armour rich waightyng men appointyng office fyrst principle myght foorthewith declare kyngdome come chose ierusalem moste holyest rome mightiest content poore towne might foorthwith declared therby becom lord common facionwhat maner lord christ poore nedy sight world eit riche spirit spirituall giftes title lord prince yet sight borne born bethleem soeuer thyng apparaunt sens touchynge hym lyke princely pompe wherfore sith lord prince yet glorious worlde poore nedye glorie bee euen hee myserable respecte worldlye felicitie contraryly myghtye greate thynges wherein worlde founde bee needye starke begger excellente rightuousnes world oppressed sinnes eternall wheras worlde casuall lorde dyuell dyuell hath worlde yoked vnder moste cruell bondage good whereas worlde naught hath god mercifull vnto hym worlde struggleth wrath god lorde euerlastynge lyfe worlde appointed hell imperie chylde condition state doth fruite redound vnto people wyll geue bodyly saluation farre soules helth glorie requireth poore nedy wherfore let man come kyngdom christ entent may enlarge good encrease substance ye may loke pope men sorte aduanceth creature imperie getteth rich parteth amog prouinces daniell prophecied princely power childe felte thy synnes may forgyuen maye iustifye saue thee may geue holye spirite transpose thee kyngdome worlde death kyngdome god faith requisite sayd thou kepe sure worde god letteth passe god woorde foloweth owne thoughtes shall lose christ neither shall knowe hym king iudge shall hatred feare dyuell wont feare hym also feele selues gyltie synne least shoulde take punyshed wheras christ meane season confesseth hym selfe lord prince people delyuer theim synne transpose kyngdom grace people myserable synners tremble felyng theyr synne afrayde would fayne god fauour herby may playn description prophet perceyued fyrst shal bodyly prince yet exercise spirituall punyshementes agaynst wyckednes geue saluation men beleue hym agaynst synne deuyll death hell suche prince sure hope saluation thus farre doo scribe recite saying prophete farther feare peradueture lest muche perceaue well herodes entent seeke way howe slea take kyng iewes way wherfore reherse whole sentence herode almost professe worde time acknowledge kyng iewes besyde herode yet prophete prince iewes shoulde come shoulde procede oute bethleem therfore leaue vnperfect neither dare pronounce farther prophete although lyuyng tyme yet dothe procede describe maner captayn kynge whiche belongeth also persone wordes et egressus eius ab initio diebus aeterni tati going hath ben beginning miehee euerlastyng dyd scribe reherse herodea testimonie christes true humaniti godhead neither selues dyd vnderstand ther obscuritie therin word byrth bethleem selfe captaine ouer israell obscurelye spoken sure signe shalbe man wheras prophet sayth furthermore procedyng begynnyng dayes eternitie signifieth eternal euerlastyng god whiche beginnyng bethleem trouth born bethleem one maner procedyng also beside sayd beginnnyng day eternitie wordes prophete changedfrom whens christ borne fyrst sayth shall procede priestes scribe testify procede borne signifieth one wherfore word afterward must nedes signifie thyng saith whose procedyng old dayes eternitie yt tyme dais houres wherefore thou wilte know fro whece child borne mark prophecie born saith fro bethlee hath birthe prophet saith furthermore yes rather borne al creature heauen earth sonne moone may determined wordes nothyng el borne without begynnyng eternally tyme dais neither herode neither iewes vnderstand neither wer worthy vnderstand prince king born bethleem man neuerthelesse hath name also procedyng old dayes proceded born world ischrist god true eternal god also true naturall man cause great stir rynges motion worlde vnderstand procedyngs birthes without discention child also haue procedyng sonne moone iewes could abyde afterward sprang vp many heresy whiche spake agaynst matter left consydered hast god word put foorth vnto whome borne borne ye world uerily god must reason nedes confesse beleue god made heauen earth thyng could heauen earth god childe proceded borne heauen erth made must nedes folow borne god god besydes god creature nothyng surely sentencefor christ god dothe workes belo ging god conteyneth ground foundation thing christ onely pure man death wold haue confounded hym mortall men yt born virgin hath great strength death greatter miracle god made eue ribbe tha virgin brought forth chyld virgin sexe kynd whiche borne bryng foorth child wherfore thing coulde represse dyuell deathe borne uirgin marye healpe consysteth herein virgin mary onely great wyth chylde also suche chyld borne worlde wherefore dyuell deathe kyngdom dyuell ouercom proue maistrie suche manne whiche hadde hys procedynge begynnynge beefore worlde procedynge bethleem onlychriste dyeth man god die coulde haue vpper hande ouer death danger therof aswel mother mary iohn baptist excellent sainctes procedyng named old day wherfore death could shewe suche strength chylde wherwith hytherto kylled men wher god coulde synne neither bee made gyltie lawe neither killed deth neither damned ye diuel yet forasmuche procedynge tyme bethleem borne worlde chyldren coulde dye hereof death dyuell layeth snare theym selues consyder procedyng bethleem procedyng chyld daunger death sepulchre trieth righte woordes borne world diuine godly power breaketh bandes death synne diuel take hold vpon suche memoriall would prophete set foorth touchyng kynge shoulde ignorant two maner procedynges saye two maner byrths person whiche bothe true god also man yet suche wyse two person one confesseth christ sonne mary whiche sucked brestes encreased body men dyd yet neuerthelesse borne worlde without beginnynge nowe two seuerall substance manhoode godhead withoute separation vnited togyther one persone ioyned togyther dyd hygh priestes tell herode neyther worthye knowe greate mysterie byrthe excedynge meruaylous whiche desyre knowethe procedyng bethleem ought fyrst learned muste take begynnyng discipline meditation procedyng bethleem also order prophete soon reherseth carnall byrthe yea hee maketh large mention touchyng concernyng byrthe eternalle hee wylle meddle wyth matter belongyng god without peryll muste begyn lowest first learne thynge doothe earthe howe hee reueleth openeth hym self men shal go foorth stumblyng order prophetes description appoynteth shall know chyld borne euerlastyng shall bee terrible pleasant cofortablethe thoughtes predestination ouerthwart nature men marreth confoundethe thynges begyn discipline predestination sithe god knewe thynges dyd hee take hede man haue fallen thou takest waye knowledge god thou shalte fall downe headlong fall lucifer whiche coueted hygh renoume coulde comprehende hym selfe pride thou wilt go right waye knowledge god take thy begynnyng christes swathing band prophet setteth foorth order man fyrst go bethleem afterward clymbe vp heauen eternitie christ hym selfe teacheth sayth philyp waye seeth iohn seeth father despiseth principle tendeth goeth forthewith hyghest searche gouernement god punysheth reward folishnes taketh euen stumble damnation wise man saith searcher maiestie shall oppressed glorie prouerb god knowenwherfore true waye hym desyreth true knowledge chyld fyrst come bethleem hath sufficientely beholden considered hym maunger succede selfe onely sonne mary also sonne god borne god creature created god matter shall without perill thou canst truly comprehende man christ thou shalt know god also thou beleuest hym thou beleuest god thou callest vpon hym thou callest vpon god thou blasphemest hym thou blasphemest god prophecie touchynge chylde iesus bethleem consyder also therwith peruerse vnresonable reason herodeherode scribe madde scribe herode persecutethe chylde scribe despyse hym way god worthy mynd whiche putteth foorthe moste euident scripture men wherof may talke syng speake dayly communication yet vnderstand word thereof thys straunge monstrous thynge scribe recite thys prophecie herode iudgemente prophecie sendeth bethleem addeth therto hym selfe saying make dyligente searche chylde whenne ye haue founde hym brynge woorde maye come worshyppe hym yet vnderstande one iote meanynge thereof alwayes kept busye shadowes neuer attayne bodye matter neither goeth matter anye otherwyse tyme amonge vnkynde yeamany gospeller vnderstande gospel wherof talke muche onely amonge papistes whyche haue bible wel whiche reade knowe wee doo also amonge men part reason gospell vnderstande nothynge therof vnderstode woulde hearte declare theyr lyuyng scribe herode reherseth prophete mouthe yf vnderstande woulde haue surely gone wise men chylde woorshypped hym doo despyse greate thynges brute beastes doo token knowe thynge whyche teache wherefore christian haue aboue doo onely heare also vnderstande woordes conceaue exceadynge meruaylle pleasure thereof wherefore althoughe worlde pope proude citisens husbandmenne doo farre passe v rychesse strengthe dygnitie yet wee knowe passe theym agayne farre thys thys theyr incredyble punyshemente notwithstandynge doo heare god woorde talke teache vnto yet doo vnderstande nothynge thereof esai math theyr owne lyfe maye bee euidente proofe thys haue eares iewes heare haue eies yet see let v pray god wil starre moste holy worde lead v son iesus christ preserue v euer agaynst offence goodnes amen sermon baptisme christ vpon twelfth daye math iii came iesus galile iordan vnto iohn baptised hym iohn forbad saying ought baptised thee comest thou iesus answeryng sayd hym let nowe thus becometh v fulfyll righteousnes suffred iesus soone baptised came straight oute water loe heauen open vnto hym iohn sawe spirite god descendynge lyke doue lightyng vpon hym loe came voyce heauen saying beloued son welpleased exposition feast epiphanie haue intreated hath name christ opened hymselfe onely starreof baptism christ also iordan hee baptised forasmuche reuelation greatest chiefest comfortable vnto v reason wer called feast christ baptised math opened iordan thirtie yeares old euangelist dothe shew hystorie playnly moued galile came iohn vnto iordan baptised hym synners whiche knew synne desired remissio iohn troubled strange case knew christ childhode thinketh self worthye baptise hym christ saith suffer must done righteousnes may fulfilled math may bring passe miserable synners may come righteousnes saued wherfore herein set forth confortable example vnto vschrist hath nede baptisme wheras sonne god offered self baptised neuerthelesse synned doth bounde doe wheras yt boude farre vnlyke oure duetie oure wickednes farre shoulde wherfore ought especially marked place christ sonne godchrist came baptisme baptisme therfore waighcie matter whiche holyer al baptisme notwithstanding baptised gaue commandement baptisme kepte congregation al wold saued baptised euident al men damnable accursed stryken madnes blindnes god punishemet intreat obtayne much eye eares marke done matter contene dispraise baptisme speake vilanously therof doste thou thy childern refuse baptisme seing ye sonne god receaued great madnes great furie thou shouldest denye suche great worke doth baptisme seme worthye great renoume cause profitable nothing el yt great vsed wher euident yt ye sonne god came baptisme yt thou sholdest come baptisme ye renoume therof thou hadst comoditie therby baptisme profitable v father reueleth hym self vnto v baptisme matter without oure profyte good doth vnto v appeareth wher god baptisme sheweth foorth hym selfe wholye euangelist beareth witnes iohn sawe heauens open whiche signe god delighted baptisme whiche christ hym selfe sonne god sanctifieth body wherfore heauen opened shut vp aboue baptisme christ ye gate windowe heauen made wyde open henceforth distance betwene v god bycause god fallen downe vnto iordane reuelation none wherfore feast epiphanie reueling appearing requisite constitute appointed wheras playne manifestation opening father sonne holye ghost sette foorththe reueling holy ghost holy ghost procedeth moste gentle sight symple doue whiche amongest byrdes moste tame affirmed voyde wrathe entent might conceaue hereby sure token holy ghost declare crueltye towarde v bestowe v thorough christ wherby may iustified saued cause christ also opened suche gentle sorte sonne godthe sonne god wher nede baptisme owne behalf present therat receaueth baptisme example also sacramet baptisme might profite v also may cause v haue sure truste god mercifull vnto v besyde wheras ye father openeth hym self voyce dearly beloued sonne delighted maner voyce shewed ye mount sinay earth hylles dyd shake men hearde thought self danger lyfe sheweth cruell voyce thing full swetnes humanitie god doth almost pronounce wt saying wyse mortall men man put forth baptisme ye desyre know dearely beloued sonne whome chief pleasure neither cause ye shoulde feare set forth naked without armour without cruel sight cause ye feare come thunder lightninge wt horrible dreadful trumpe came ye mount sinay thing peaceable quiet calme spice crueltye may sonne god innocent without synne standeth iordane receaueth baptisme holy ghost commeth meeke forme doue besides god sheweth forth humane gentle voyce declaringe sendeth vnto v apostle prophet angell sonne whome may greatly delyght greater recorde ye haue althe baptisme christ co fortable make v marke obserue sonne god sith hath pleased god geue comendation yt sonne v maye sure moste certain tried god wil haue god merciful vnto let imbrace sonne ye father meanes turne fauour sonnes sake must nede accepted ye father wherfore let men regard diligently commandement heare obey precept nede circumcision baptisme bycause voyd synne baptisme iohn made god sinne al acknowlegde synnes sory desyer might pardoned go baptisme thinke suerty yt god merciful vnto christ baptised neuerthelesse without synne owne behalf synners taketh oure synnes vpon hym deliuereth v cause cometh baptisme euangelist sheweth properly wheras saith christ forbidden iohn aunswereth suffer mete fulfill righteousnes much say baptisme conteyned ye righteousnes al world wheras al ye world synnes put recouer worlde sought muste god commanded synners baptised thou forbyd rather euen gladly take vpon baptisme synnes sake thou gladly procure baptisme wrath god may pacified remission synnes ordeyned meaning sendeth father voyce heauen dearly beloued sonne math well pleased speaketh word tyme christ baptised may vnderstande oure baptisme thinke surely wrathe god pacified oure synnes purged baptisme god wil receaue v fauour sonnes sake difficultie combrance neuer great take sound voyce magnificet reuelation oure sight mynde wheras lord oure god openeth heauens sendeth doune holy ghost forme doue wher god father hym self sendeth forth pleasant voyce saying beholde sonne whome loue esteme aboue thing yea self also wholy doth sonne behaueth hym selfe miserable wretched synner baptised iohn coulde gentler meker reuelatio al godheade according ye three person three sortes men may sure receaueth christ beleueth word trusteth working pleaseth god pointes thing set forth confirmed place whatsoeuer commandeth saith doth verily pleasure father blessed wold obey embrace sonne stedfaste faith confidence wold meruaill great madnes themthe vnkindnes world sound magnificent voice passe deafe yet rable papistes adde contempte greuouse crime curse persecute voyce speake open blasphemy christ whome father delighted delighted also mounkes mass pilgrimage suche lyke wold earnestly ponder hym selfe blasphemy dishonour disgrace god goodnes humanitie pryde wold thynk better dye lyue leaste fede ayer wicked kinde wherfore childern learne whyle ye haue occasionan adhortatio baptisme fewe yeares paste ye knew thing heauen shut vppe fayne hear beleue mounkes dreames touchyng purgatorie terrible spirit soules suche lye thing taught remayneth men learne muche preuayle nothing worlde touching leaste wyse let v remember oure duetye geue god thankes benefite reueleth mynde vnto v daye geuing vnto v thing inestimable pryce euen holye ghost lykenes doue owne sonne iordane baptisme hym self voyce full maiestie confort woulde therfore condemne hym worthely whiche geueth thanks reioyceth receaueth sonne god feruent desyer whiche standeth iordane receueth
