dede reuelatio wher christ openeth hym self wyse men starre reuelation passeth farre three especiall kynges god father god sonne god holy ghost whiche al present together christ baptised pleased hym reuelation might haue ben done well either wildernes temple ierusalem shewed euen baptisme set purpose god might learne religiously reuerently esteme baptisme bycause also baptised let v esteme oure selues wyse fresh new made sayntes pratynge anabaptistes great say nowbaptisme water baptisme nothyng el water word myght man sufficientlye curse execrable heddye person iudgement brute beastes christian water also worde god seen chrites baptisme god father sonne holye ghost present wherfore water element suche water sonne god washed vpon holy ghost caried god father preacheth water might counted symple water sanctified whereat god father sonne holy ghost present math christ also cause appoynteth forme baptisme geuen name father sonne holy ghost wherfore chylde baptised sonne god present baptisme whiche body holy ghoste whiche presence god father whiche voyce hath consecrated halowed baptisme wherfore said water godhead present cause iudge baptisme man worke although man baptiseth yet baptiseth name name father sonne holy ghost whiche come present worke owne accorde el wold neuer folow baptisme ought folow wold count vile valew god father sonne holy ghost present bold calle water euident god owne addeth water water mingled loseth namebaptisme work man doe place seue word water pronounce water though word god though god hym self water father sonne holy ghoste present water iordane christ stode water holy ghost caried aboue god preached wherfore baptisme suche water taketh away syn death euill geueth saluation euerlasting lyfe great price added water god demitteth hym selfe god god lyfe sith water muste nedes ye water lyfebaptisme taketh away syn death taketh away death damnation geueth lyfe euerlastinge ought baptisme truely knowen highly estemed baptised name angell man name father sonne holy ghost actes apostlesto baptise name iesu name iesu much confesseth iesus christ truely confession compriseth father holy ghost christ saith commeth father sendeth holy ghost confesseth truely iesus christ dyminish authoritie word shall beleue sonne alone father sonne holy ghost together although father holy ghost named wherfore let v lightly esteme let v separate ye word fro holy baptisme water wher baptised let v confessewhat vse baptisme therfore appointed god purifie v oure syn christ sake holy ghost father sonne holy ghost haue ther wherfore thou beleuest new borne chyld synfull dippe hym baptisme god may worke work hym word commandeth doth promise new byrth water holy ghost also marc beleueth baptised might saued lykewyse thou confesse death dippe hym baptisme lauer commandement christ shall death swalowed vp neither muste thou art baptised thinke otherwyse baptisme seale pledge assurance god hath forgeuen thee thy synnes hath promised lyfe euerlasting christ sake baptisme hath godly power take away death synne therfore baptised although synnes committed work godlynes perfectly done yet repente agayn forfeit couenant baptisme promise therof meanes agree man desyer remission syn also geue vp hym self wholy synne poyntes necessarie repent consyder hym self vprightly truely god hath promised v grace fauour cam baptisme sonne retourne grace beleue surely oure synnes forgeuen v creature sake christ oure lord whiche hath commanded baptisme baptised hym self also synner wherfore reuelation passeth litle whiche shewed wyse men starre frute redoundeth chrystian men reuelation wise men gentile cam knowledge kynge iewes wherfore without good cause called day baptisme christ whiche christ baptised haue iuste cause geuen pleade matter baptisme agaynst anabaptistes dyuell whiche may soner entreated v matter consyder busynes oure saluation ther setteth agaynst v tooth nayle may come sight oure inheritance example popedome doth yet admonishe v vnder whiche litle nothing set foorth congregation touching reuelation iordane wherfore thynke thing worthye remembred god daye moste euident sermon touching sonne opened hym self euen matter betwene christ v highly please god father obeyeth sonne kepeth word accepted god receaueth holy ghost whiche openeth hym self baptisme amiable pleasant sight herevnto also agreeth father sendeth foorth verye bounteous voyce sayth behold angell prophet apostle sonne owne self also reuelation greater seruice acceptable hym obey decree proclamation moued let hym seeking perishe dyuell neither worthye heare godly sermon wherfore let v geue thankes god great vnspekeable grace let v pray preserue v thereby lenghth saue v amen fyrst sonday twelfth day vpon gospell luke ij father mother iesus went ierusalem custome feast day hadde fulfilled dayes returned home chylde iesus abode styll ierusalem father mother knewe supposing haue ben companye came dayes iourney sought hym amonge theyr kinsfolke acquayntaunce founde hym went backe agayne ierusalem sought hym fortuned three dayes founde teple sitting middest ye doctours hearing posing hearde hym astonyed vnderstanding aunswers sawe hym meruayled mother sayd vnto sonne hast thou thus dealt v beholde thy father haue sought thee sorowing sayd vnto howe happened ye sought wyst ye muste go father busynes vnderstode saying spake vnto went downe came nazareth obedient vnto mother kept sayinges together heart iesus prospered wysdome age fauour god men exposition gospel hath depe profound vnderstading hard thing attempt interpretation therof conteyned hystorie matter goeth chyld iesus loste heart tyme let passe hyghe mysterie deferre vnto tyme take vpon v expounde moste playne euident touching last feaste haue sayd named epiphanie appearing christ thing done entent chylde new borne kepte priuie opened al men otherwyse haue vse chylde gotten knowledge hym cause hystories put foorth whiche appeareth howe christ hath reueled opened hym self iohn baptised hym iordane opened glorie signe mariage canaa euen suche lord hath full power creature knowen amogest men also couted famouse power farre passing power knowen lord whose power hyghest almightie ought take hym oure sauiour vnto whome haue refuge difficultie aduersitie looke helpe thing doth present gospell belonge also reuelation whiche christ doth declare child common sorte peculier manner trade whereas commeth away hym self pryuily mother regardeth obedience whiche otherwyse chyldern owe parent god comandementhow christ loste ierusalem matter chanced occasion parent iewes bound euery yeare kepe passouer came temple lord ierusalem wheras brought child iesus whe feast done child folowed companie parent taried temple begynninge mother sorowful peraduenture wont tymes paste go kynsefolke christ folowed nothing fyrst yeares common capacitie age grym sadde otherwyse agreable chylde runninge playe shewed hym self vnlyke chyldern excepte appeared suche sedes vyce hym hereof ioseph marie sone persuaded kynsfolke carefull hym iorneied one daye euening inquire inne chylde found hym amongest kynsfolke greatly moued chylde committed peculiarly mother ioseph also hadde litle comaundement see diligently chylde yet mary mother wherfore toke matter moste greuously feared greatly found hym sought hym easie iudge smalle feare doubtlesse returned night nigheste way finde chyld thought case heart hadde iudge thou thy owne felinge although lyke one day passed ouer without care whiche loste vpon second make inquisition thyrde daye length fynde hym two nyghtes together slepte passed ouer carefull thoughtes doubtelesse mother mynde greuously wounded suche moste bytter suspitions reasoning self god hath taken away thy sonne suffer thee take anye longer ioye gifte bycause thou haste kepte hym negligently ioseph toke punishement god wrathe bycause tooke better hede chylde therfore worthye marked christ wolde declare priuiledgewhy christ wold hyde hym self bound lyke force chyldern subiecte parent whatsoeuer dyd dyd example free constrayned rigour lawe sonne mother also god lorde wherfore subiecte mother shall heare nexte sayth woman haue doo doth also declareth pure man whiche constrayned necessitie obey parent doth openly professe hath hygher parent whome bound mary ioseph sayth ye sought knew ye behoued thinges beloged father though say youre sonne yet suche wyse bounde obey heauenly father wherfore made open manifeste oure behalf might wel know hym repose lay vp within v true example hym man also god wherfore assone mother said vnto sone dyddest thou deale thus v aunswereth disobedient vnto haue despised ye thought wherfore defendeth right mother bycause parent sorow great vexation mynde case semeth muche worse might haue called mynde word ye angel shepheards touching chylde might know although chylde folowed yet ought blamed disobedient part thinke greater obedience whiche ought shewed heauenly fatherchrists example tendeth purpose know god muste obeyed man necessarie cause example put forth christ oure reason ouerthwart maner doo alwayes iudge ye seruice inueted man better seruice appoynted god wherfore rule learned matter commeth point muste either denye god seruice el oure parent magistrate muste aledge christes worde oure defence say muste rather thinges belonge father whiche heauen besyde case gladly fulfill duetie towarde father mother toward power satisfie familie maister state muste declare haue father whiche ought obeyde thing christ parent forgotten place wherfore christ calleth agayn way admonisheth touching duetye wherfore christ putteth foorth example reasonwe muste obey god mor man whiche ought obey serue god excuseth self pretence god hath commanded obedience also done parent magistrate euen persecuters gospell tyme haue learned v haue magistrate hygh reuerence extoll muche obedience magistrate know say true accordyng scripture kyndes sacrament ought receaued bound obedient magistrate oure parentes agaynst oure kyng agaynst whiche forbiddeth wherfore may doo thou doste magnifie power whiche appointed vnto god verily god whiche geuer power magnified whiche decree wherby gaue power speaketh suche wyse greater obedience due vnto hym selfe lorde thy god ought seme iuste cause thou sholdest soeuer byd thee yea tyme also thy gouerner commaunde thee contrary thou shouldest also say obiect thy instant aduersaries must go thynges belong vnto fathernote god commandement charge ought estemed thinges fulfilled afterwarde thou must fulfil also ordinaces emperor parentes magistrate commonalty disturbed therby vtteryng hystorie christe belongeth onely faithchrist vttereth selfe ensample dothe reuelations made starre opened iordan mariage pertaineth also geuing ensaple touchig matter religio thing pertaining obeying god shold haue respect neither parent prince ar bound obligation higher lord yt god whose comandemet must nedes must serue thou hast performed obedience maist thou denie obedience yt due inferior gouerners yet suche wise lette performyng greater obedience whose seruice must done others touching ye high temptation wherin christ lost ye heart speake haue mynde vttering chyld wherin declareth one hath greater right casteth yoke obediece made without power waiteth vpon parets causeth com back vnto thintent yt might confirme hearde spoken angel shal called sonne highest meaning saying might remembrance forgotten expedient renewed dede reuelation dothe well agree made euident christ chiefest man shepard simeon testifie hym wherfore thinketh sure yt cause state chief aboue al childre howbe yet forsaken felowship pastime play felowes christes busines temple euangelist doth sufficietly declare reasonyng touchyng dearth victualswhat busynes christe temple suche trifling matter conferred disputed scribe touchyng ye word god first knew vnderstode expou ded scripture reproued error yet wise agre age math yt may brig exaple mathew yt scribe disputed fift comandement expouded though yt murder hand wer forbyd ther cometh forth perfecter meaning sence therof yt al railing false accusatios cursyngs hatred braulyngs ye angry ar taken precept pythe precept exclude priuate reuengyng thyngs geue occasion inticement thervnto myght mercyfull affection gentylnesse toward al men thys sorte dydde chylde tyme teach make inquisition moste weyghtye perfecte thynges lawe hym selfe also demaunded thynges reason meanynge newe neuer hearde amongest scribe myghte gette admiration wondrynge howe maye bee chylde shoulde haue perfecte iudgemente greate matter thys doubtelesse hee thoughte vyces faultes teacher errours interpreter ouerpassed hym thys thynge verye lykely dyd conferre wyth doctoures touchynge messias shoulde bee borne office shold yet dyd hee thynges wyth moderation meanyng though lerned thyngs discipline mother might iudge child messias yet replenyshed wyth holy ghost wyth towardnes chiefest vertue power hope vertue godly towardnesse chylde may well perceyued certayne token age hystoriechrist subiect parent ou example howe chyld christ opened hym selfe towarde mother ioseph howe aboue common capacitie chyldren wyl wholly vnder controllyng parentes neyther doth suffer office blamed thys hystorie dothe euangelist conclude sayth came downe subiecte vnto chylde vsed hys priuiledge matter requyred hee myght rather obeye hys celestiall father hee suffereth hym selfe bee broughte order agayne submytteth hym selfe commaundemente parentes althoughe hee bounde therevnto lawe luke sygnifiethe whenne hee sayeth obediente thoughe hee shoulde saye obeyed owne free copulsion ye subiect vnto parets sake exaple touchyng seruice houshold doubt yt obedient comandement parentes ready healpe father worke dyd thinges belonging age helping familie thought selfe good doo example put forth remebred childre lord god v refuse behaued self vnwillyng nothing byd parent although without drudgerie many thinges therof full seruilitie verily child ought lothe shew obedience modestie parentes pleaseth god fyrst precepte sheweth requireth people obey parentes heartes tyme remember tyme paste question sort christes chyldhode monkes fayned boke infancie christ tolde fable certayne byshoppe would haue knowen cause dreame whiche sawe carpenter preparynge wodde buylde hym lyttell chylde caryeng chyppes wood vntyll laste vyrgine graye clothynge hauynge hande cauldron came vnto called bothe manne chylde byshop dreame semed folowe hyde hym selfe within behynde gate hee myghte knowe meate dydde eate mother set meate chyld self alone chylde asked behynd gate wold haue byshop cast suche feare wordes waked slepe thou wylt haue true knowledge touchyng chyldhod christ haue respect place wordes euangelist whiche subiect say obedient commandement thought nothyng base hym doothe childh christ ought make child seruantes ashamed heare hystorie chylde iesu obeye neither maisters neither parentes familie men pretend thought worde woulde gladly folowe christ knewe franciscan frier wyll haue selues knowen folow sainct francis vesture watchynges suche lyke forasmuche saye man hath knowledge christes chyldhode matter without example say true hath knowlege therof put forth ernest testimonie subiect vnto fewe word euangelist compriseth chyldhode christ tyme adolescencie youth yea rather al whole space vnto thirtieth yere meanyng subiect vnto uerily nothyng el looked first precept glasse doynges commaundement sheweth chyldren seruauntes boud familie parent seruice setting thing necessarie procuryng houshold fulfyllyng commandementes childe iesus thought belonging duetie nowe ought al child vnderstand renoume honor yt haue christ author woorkes folow christes steppe taskes appointed parentes delight doyng duetie see child iesus especially endeuoured hym selfe doo neede haue longe commentary gloses touching actes iesu chyldhod consyder onely taskes work parent require childre family haue euident testimonie place went wyldernes cloister cometh nazareth highly estemeth ciuile felowship obeyeth parent child subiect discipline vnsauery foolyshe flocke monkes maketh mecion chyld christ writing made lytle byrdes small beast work obedience neither commaunded doo parentes obedience chylde sorte thynges make prouysion famylye gouernance thereof may neglected smallest matter euangeliste maketh mencion hereof wyth one woorde obedience declareth wholle duetie towarde parentes meanyng thereof may certayne withoute doubte neyther lette manne thynke otherwyse whole obedience fyfthe precepte sanctified consecrate chylde iesvs oughte seeme vnto v thynge moste bee regarded wee departe voyde mooste perfecte vertue worlde hathe eares hearethe good counsayle wherefore menne dydde laye asyde trewe obedience regarded onely mounkerie relyques sainctes vysited great labour coste euery man thoughte woulde better precious thynges chylde christe dydde dyd perceaue workes belongynge householde bee sanctified glorious persone sonne god youth thought shame doo fylthy seruile woorkes parentes request wherfore ought thynke nothyng excellent precious hystorie hyghly esteme felicitie shewe suche obedience example christe obscure vnto v thinges thus doone folowyng christ thousand tymes better holyer euer monkes haue doone doo euer shall doo monkes haue christ capitayne whiche euangeliste affirmeth went cloyster went parentes home obediente vnto thys summe gospell christ lorde aboue yet humbleth hym selfe exaumple v dothe obeye parentes wee myghte haue full knowledge bothe offyces fyrste maye shew obedience god thenne vnto oure parentes magistrate wyth greatte faythe reuerence god graunt example chyld iesus may admonishe v duetie perfectly may pay vnto god belongeth god cesar belongeth cesar parentes belongeth parentes amen seconde sonday twelfth day pthe gospel iohn ii third day mariage cana citie galile mother iesus iesus called disciple vnto mariage wyne fayled mother iesus said vnto haue wine iesus said vnto woman haue doo thee myne houre yet come mother said vnto minister whatsoeuer saith vnto doo standyng sixe water pottes stone maner purifyenge iewes conteynynge two three firkyns piece iesus said vnto fyll water pottes water fylled vp brymme sayd vnto draw nowe beare vnto gouernour feaste bare ruler feaste tasted water turned wine knewe whence minister whiche drew water knew called bridegrome sayde vnto hym euery man beginnynge dothe set foorth good wyne men dronke whiche worse thou hast kept thy good wyne vntyll nowe thys begynnynge myracles dyd iesus cana galilee shewed glorie dysciples beleued hym exposition ye first miracle lorde iesus christ wrought wherewith iohn saith wyl open glorie vnto discipleschrist declareth hymselfe god signe myracle might knowe hym beleue suretie sonne god true messias forasmuche doo man coulde change creature make wyne water thynges onely god power doo whiche lorde creature ma power wherfore signe miracle referred applied ende truly learn know christ may flee vnto hym sure trust see oure selues pouertie straight combrance aske helpe succour hym whiche shall perceaue due tyme chiefest part gospell forasmuch common doctrine sygnes miracle christ wrought wyll take matter nowe specially bee entreated christ wrought signe especially mariage doctrin touching matrimonie myght grow vse congregation thyng necessary men know great contempt matrimony popedomethe popedom alloweth matrimonie great praise extolled virginitie chastitie neuerthelesse coulde sene fewe howe god hath requited mariage hater spiritualtie hath reuenged wrong vilanie done ordinance easy shewe hated mariage also cleane extinguished loue womankynd heart great contempt suche hamousnes synnes meruaile god droue mounkes nunnes chanons suche lyke hell blast lightnyng may iudge otherwise matrimonie may agaynst flee pope dothe gospel may much profite v thervnto lord shewed firste miracle mariage vnknowen towne called cana christ honoreth matrimonie thirtie yeares olde nowe baptised iohn takyng hym office preachyng pope canon lawes christe shoulde well orderlyke haue doone yf opened glorie mariage called office teachyng anoynted holy ghost excellente exaumple onely dreames pope whiche caste thrust church clapping handes hissyng sectes come counte chief religion despise forsake matrimonie go wyldernes desert place quiete lyfe lesse dangerous matrimonie whiche greate braulynges chydyngs much trouble thy wife thy child seruants euil neighbor c monk set forth life holy lifethe lyfe monkes priestes say ye truth wer rather called swete quiet idle lyfe wher haue liued great abundance plentie wher miserable maried hath ye meane time striued misery hard getting liuing yet clean banyshed put beside title pope holy monk kynd lyfe matrimony might kyngdom god go euerlastyng life although exaple yt christ hath put forth vnto congregation magnificent glorious euident yet hath nothing preuayled wicked rehersed church man yt could gather much light therby could truly ponder matter wise great matter go wildernes cloister came christ mariage suche vnholy thyng occupied worlde become maried persone dyd christ presence first miracle honour mariage tragicall myseries myghte haue bene mytigate state monkerie heremitage ben put foorthe fewe yeares nowe sithe onely mariage also abiure selues othe euer holy kynd lyfe folowyng rest idlenes contrary god commaundement ordinance therfore lerne know place greatly lord god honoreth ye fift comandement parent matrimonie without familie without gaines without housholde stuffe without meanes encreasyng substace thynges therfore hath comendation fact christ holy thinges whiche true godlynes may wel ioyned christes example may despise thing haue great reputation magnifie thinges comaunded god doctrine gospell may instruct youth vnderstand god highly pleased gouernance familie neede newe institute monk hath corrupted ye path godlines housholder applieth thynges gouernyng house feare godmatrimonie holy doth wel instructe fashion familie lyueth suche kynde lyfe acceptable god yea wife also prouideth chyldren thing necessary age let seke holyer kynd life serua te also subiect bodily maisters diligently execute worke commandement maister hyghly please god hold fast principle continue faith vylest basest workes acceptable god fastes howers prayer mass monkes yea whatsoeuer boste ofmatrimonye prophan thyng chief amongest al ceremony rite wherfore thynges belonging vnto mariage counted vile neither example monkes folowed whiche iudge thyngs worldly vnholy respect owne christ dede dothe signifie present marying person fauoureth kynde god requireth thyngs appertainyng housholdes gouernace myght great high matter vnholy thynges first precepte beareth recorde whiche chiefe second table wherfore lette maried person seruantes thynke vilely basely office thynges please god god hymselfe hath blessed matrimony hath honored nonce beyng preacher gospelle came marriage byddyng mariage hadde ben holy inough hee myght haue alledged excuse holynes office absented hym selfe beynge chief prelate lette moste holy office come mariage whiche first foundation housholdynge getteth vnto commendation estimation soeuer thys kind lyfe doo highely esteme iudgemente god hath placed roume whether man wyfe either chyldren eyther seruantes familie may sure office god christ honoreth mariage woulde bee moued notable exaple christ christ beyng great teacher yea god self onely renoume also healpe mariage declaring good wyll euidentely doctrine first necessary heretikes wee time without congregation sectescomplaintes agaynst mariage diminishe estimation matrimonie raileth thoughe occasion discomodities seruantes child neighbour wyfe houshold stuffe sufficient care god kyngdome may bee therfore seke deuise take vpon lyue vnmaried make selues colledges abbey may lyue withoute suche paine authoritie dyuell haue folowed deuises euery man embraceth rule kynde lyuynge semeth beste vnto hym selfe perill doctrine necessarie example christ euident whiche mariage cause separation diuorcement copulation myght straighter narower beneficiall selues doth man would saye admonyshe owne beneuolence goodnes yf would haue disallowed mariage made would haue ben presente vnlaufull thynge hadde fauoured hearte maried persones sone thereby hadde declared fauour god towarde maried woulde haue blessed mariage gyft excellent wyne neyther would haue geuen token maried succour comfort shold surely fele god hand miserieschrist blesseth maried person yf feare god thys one meanynge christes exaumple hereby myghte gathered matrimonie ought honoured counted among moste godly sortes lyuyng agaynst phantasticall imagination monkes whych longe reproued iudgement apostles1 timo called seducynge spirites doctrine deuyls forbyddynge marry eate meates meanynge comfort maryed persones may surely beleue god presente bee neuer muche vexed wyth pouertie nede myseries onely lette thys bee thy care thou neuer lacke gueste thy feast neyther bee thou longer ruled suche rule canon thenne doubtlesse shall alwayes thy sake make wyne water shall prosper thy dooynges hys blessyng thou shalte neuer lackynge greate glorye god also thy tribulation whyche doo seeme paste cure shall succoure thee hys tyme appoynted example dayely chauncynge mannes trauayle shewe thys trewe maried persones godly feele blessynge god preparynge theyr lyuyng whiche promysed psalme ecce dat dilectis suis dormientibus psal beholde geuethe electe euen sleape lette v take experience hereof craftesmen meane godlye laboure dilygently theyr vocation yf whole summe gaines gette theyr yeares laborgod blesseth labour faithfull put plaine summe number woulde vtterly despaire fynde thereby prime blessynge god amonge necessary ministred vnto perceaue geuen vnto goddes secrete woorkynge may perceaue goddes priuye lyberalitie bounteousnesse theyr moste scarcitie bee shorte presence christe shall bee perceaued oure house math yf se onely thys caste sekynge kyngedome god thenne doubte wyl daylye tourne water wyne v blesseth oure breade loaues fewe maye suffise manye symple meates maye seme v moste delicatea great comfort garmentes maye soone worne yf wee coulde marke attente eye myghte saye thys lorde manyfeste gouernaunce ordrynge mariage belongeth thee office thereof pertayne vnto thy seruice thy redynesse good wylll appeare euidentlye maryage cana yet seene thou doste louyngly make prouysion godly maried person wherfore wil count thyng lighte vnholye thinge wyll decke sette foorth poore mariage maye least seme willyng folowe moste euident example christe thy sonne euangelist maketh speciall mention iesus mother presente also peraduenture bride mother mariagemary virgin helpeth mariage al shee thynketh matter belongeth chanced nede feast appeareth mariage suche whiche nothyng lackynge necessarie mary also exa ple testifieth mariage despised som superstitious people despise shee thereat highest rome hath iesus sonne disciple whiche moste honorable guestes ioyned vnto office also glorie boasting would monkes make great company sainctes saye christe mother disciple ben sene wyse theyr matter moste holy mother thynke scorne shewe labour diligence moste vylest base seruice mariage thynges lacke onely voyce god protestyng pronouncynge may beholde kynde lyfe consyder accordyng propre nature true dignitie whiche god hath hygh estimation pleasure sonne mother shoulde renoume healpe mariage feast example great yet nothyng preuaile among papistes neither housholders moued therby sufficiently dyuel cause thereof whiche suffereth lyght appeare vnto may perceiue whatsoeuer belongeth seruice housholds taken god owne men wolde thinke suertyethe state matrimonie ought estemed v also seruantes wold counte workes done pleasant shewe ye sight god wold obey master gladly wolde beware offence diligence chidden wold take good worth knewe yt kinde lyfe suerty acceptable god wold euer beholde shewe christ self present mariage declared singuler good towarde maried person gouerners housholdes least seme greuouse vnto take labour paynes busines housholde stubburne regarde thinges neither moued therby haue stonie heart wher may haue powerstony heart eue serue god house yet care moued therby shew selues ioyfull prosperous case hand mayde wolde know base work felicitie might copared work marie done mariage cause ioyfull good trust busynes ueryly work taskes belonge state vile person iudge truely thing excellent bycause know whatsoeuer ther sort pleaseth god whatsoeuer iudgemet worlde touching matter thou ruled therby whiche folowest true godlynes reason iudge great seruice god whiche god hath commanded neuer base vyle howe fortunat lower state could acknowledge felicitie god alowed doynges true seruice contraryly mounkes muste nedes discouraged bycause haue commaundement god makinge theyr institution lyfe none amongest seruile kynd lyfe would consyder sort lyuinge maner would take great pleasure perceaueth god angel beholde alowe worke yea hereby fynde master gentle vnto would diligence shew fidelitie office due tyme haue sufficient commoditie therby faithfull godlye seruantes worthie honour although verye true nature yet men brought beleife men set inuentions man touchyng worshippe god sorte god hath commanded concerning gouernance familie wherfore chaunceth worthelie vnkynde fyfte precepte faule mounkerie besides doyng yet neuer obtayne desyerthe vnmaried punished vnkindnes offende god greuously great disobedience neuer gaue commandement touching trade lyfe matrimonie best kynde lyfewherfore example lightly estemed hereby ought true godlynes encrease euery man parte may diligently furder matrimonie whiche god hath made gloriouse commandement mariage preserueth kynges prynces onlye bycause kynges prince springe mariage also bycause maried person haue neither men people yearlie reuenewes gouernance housholdes prepared wherby therafter office necessarie amonge men well hyghe low mayntayned wherfore god hath ordayned matrimonie wel springe commodity earth councell god knowengod blesseth maried might doo thing ioyfull heartes kynde lyfe might commended furthered v let maried person seeke especially herby necessarie succour confort selues godly feare god haue hystorie certayne pledge god helpe busines maried continuall blessing correcte mynish incommodities testifieth place refused maried shall nedes suffer affliction flesh christ taken mariage matter referred worshippe god sure god blessinge helpe shall lacking much therfore learned concerning present matter ought know thing put forth preaching ye entet yt al might haue yt excellet length magnifie matrimonie count renoume maried bestow som furdering mariage fyrst let see selues doctryne leade fantasticall spirites superstition whiche count thinges vnholy either maried either gouerne familie would lyue fauour god muste attayn thervnto chastinge kepinge vnder bodythe anabaptistes forsake mariage whiche dreame anabaptistes day forsake wyues chyldern familie take religion bycause perturbation mynde ther doth ensue deceit dissemblinge hypocrite paynefull dede one taketh hym owne accorde enioyned men much paynefull wherfore leaste fayne suffer diuers paynes grefes innumerable bandes bynd maried bandes anabaptistes breake take selues libertye least fayne stryne common myseries maried men take great penance shake yoke yoke moste hardest sort one bound yokefelow daunger prince bound neighbour helpe al godly office comme springe euery part louinge sufferinge many thynges brought sight hearinge knowledge whiche moste paynfull fele wold wish ridde yet must endure neither must yelde discoraged although al thing ful misery paynes yet recopenseth maketh amendes al god doth greatly fauour matrimonie especially delighted functio ye maried felicitie worthy thanks great ioy maketh v partetakers therof excludeth v gloriouse sacrarie acceptable state thou shalt vexed pouertie thou must despaire declareth mariage delighted helpinge maried ought learned gospell must call helpe god may neuer forget neuer cease diligently serue oure vocation according commaundement god glorie euer amen thyrd sonday twelfth day vpon gospell math viii come downe mountayne muche people folowed hym beholde came leper worshipped hym saying master thou wilt thou canste make cleane iesus put foorth hande touched saying thou cleane immediatly leprosie clensed iesus sayd vnto hym tell man go shewe thy selfe priest offer gifte moses commaunded offred witnesse vnto iesus entred capernaum came vnto centurio besought saying master seruaunt lieth home sicke paulsey greuously payned iesus said come vnto heale centurion aunswered said syr worthy thou shouldest come vnder roofe speake worde seruaunt shalbe healed also man subiect auctoritie another haue souldiers vnder say man go goeth another man come commeth seruaunt doth iesus heard wordes meruayled saide folowed hym verily say vnto haue foude great faith israel saye vnto many shal come east west shall rest abraham isaac iacob kyngdome heauen chyldern ye kingdome shalbe cast vtter darkenes shalbe weping gnashing teeth iesus sayde vnto centurion go thy way thou beleuest vnto thee seruaunt healed selfe houre exposition two thing set forth v gospell first leapre lord doth purifie centurio asketh help christ sick chyld ye euagelist sheweth christ miracle forthwith ye loge sermon made ye mountaine meaninge first might teache afterward cofirme doctrine signes yt might iudge doctrine true without fraud beleue gladly haue nede miraclesmiracles testimony doctrine ye doctrine cofirmed alredy man doubt therof yet neuerthelesse requisite yt especially beare office teaching pronouce ye word godlines also shewe declare godly life work godlines kingdom god cosisteth paul saith word power wherfore doctrine lyfe agree1 cor moue hearer earnestly lyfe accordeth doctrine occasion stumblinge manie signes cosidered testimony ye doctrine passe al power might men reason self also costrayned subscribe herevnto example nicodemus plain signes iohn except god wherfore thinges also ought take exaples faith charitiean example true charitie christ may perceaue gentle heart christ redy wil moued worde bestowe gifte health wher otherwise hope helpe al ye goodes world sure token yt wil gladly ease ye poore miserable ye wretched vexed el wold haue folowed oure exaple wrothe behaue oure selues frowardly chorlisly yt come vnto v desyer oure helpe doth christ leaper scar lie ended speche ye christes ready helpe dyd helpe hym benignitie christ shold moue v aske helpe hym trouble aduersitie sure hope wil denie v helpe ought also example vnto v shewe lyke gentlenes benignitie oure neighboure christ dyd haue respecte obedience whiche owe vnto god profite commoditie oure neighboure christ seketh owne glorie profit benefite hath respecte miser lacketh help pertayneth glorie god obedience may shewed vnto thinke yt done god thou geuest benefit requite recompence lyke thou doest thy selfe wher thou sekest thy owne profite good occupie hym self wel duetie toward god neighbourecharity ought haue respect vnto necessitie let hym haue respecte owne profyte vrgent miserie whiche requireth present helpe god wold haue done yea although least profite worlde come vnto v therby yea although benefit loste vpo chorle taught also historie christ healeth ten leaper one returneth geue thaks christ luc nine dyd muche remember receaued benefite possible christ dyd forsee vnkyndnes yet refuseth good miser call redie helpe residue committeth al god lykewyse may sayde charitie second signe centurion christ referreth ende goodnes bounteousnes lord may glorified miserable ridde misery true charitie hath respecte nothing sauing word god commandemente example faith meruailous miserable person lawe forbydden companye felowshippe commeth christ without doubtingan example faith leaper falleth flat hym praieth lord thou wilt thou mayst clense two thing noted fyrst beleueth steadfastly without waueringe christ hath power helpe disease wher men wold beste helpe nothing wher christ neuerthelesse differed nothing shape behauiour priuate person secondly although doubted nothing yet yelde christ deliuer hym disease body contrary god owne saluation yt ready abyde euil paciently lenger propertie true beleif also true prayerhow man may praye truely two always ioyned gether nature beleueth truely prayeth truely beleueth truely prayeth truely wholye requisite true prayer heart doubteth god good mercifull whole ridde v oure myseries yea especially faith ought moste stronge thing beloge vnto glorie god oure saluation ye remiss synnes restitution dyuell death god geue v holy ghoste preserue v word helpe v temptation minister vnto v encrease faith charitie cnote well thing chiefly pertayne glorie god oure saluation wherfore haue nothing doo condition pray vnto god things1 ye prayer ioyned faith though god could herein otherwyse mynded thing wold vse leaper forme praying lord thou wilt pardon synnes thou wilt saue c shold pray aright thinges may doubt god whether hath put forth expresse absolute worde1 tim ratified vnchangeable wil men shoulde saued cause procured sonne sacrifice crosse synnes world math put forth commandement al shold heare hym receaue beleue hym ye leaper doth vse coditional prayer thou wiltin thing te poral oure wil ought subiect god thou maist clense thing considered ye entreateth sayd whatsoeuer belongeth ye glorie god saluation muste surely loked without condition willl god certain hath declared absolute perfecte promise yt touching thing ther misterie required god bodily promise goeth may miserie wordlie calamity yet ye true saluation nothig diminished therby al christias exaple wherfore sith yt true saluation cosisteth bodyly thing yea oftentymes damage body goodes helpeth much true saluation prayeth ridde entised leaper exaple ought think surely hym self god helpe helpe yet ought ioyne god goddes glorie oure principal saluation god gratifie fulfill oure suche thing true prayer beleue surely yet point god neither time neither way shall deliuer v euill haue fault moste part know shold aske rom paul saith god doth best know glorie oure saluation wherfore oure ought made conformable vnto ought doubt surely heare v petition belongeth glorie oure saluation wherfore ought notable example congregatio first doubt good god toward self knoweth oure euils calamity hath respecte vnto v ought sticke vnto yet prescribe thing touching maner deuise tyme successe therof ye congregation remembreth sentece ioyned ye promise thing obediet bearinge crosse leapre doth doubteth christ ca helpe yt hath redie helpe nothing mistrusteth cause el praye earnestly vnderstandeth saluation health asketh touching yt ca alledge absolute god goeth thynges aboue rehersed suche faith obedience meruailously alowed christ wherfore suffereth desyer miser petition wherin obtayned yet might haue retayned hope true saluation voyde frustrate may set forth euident example churche greatly god delighted prayer godly obediet mynde herevnto belonge notable sentence prophetes dauid saithwe must despeire obtayne forthwith psal psal abacuc tarie thou leysure lord stronge shall confort thee put thou thy trust lord soule doth waight hym worde truste morning watche vntill nighte abacuk sayth also vision maketh tariance looke come spedelye without prolongynge knowen hystories although helpe hath ben delayde yet hath appeared laste yea proper trade god wher heareth forthwith doth declare liberalitie abundantly toward v desyer vnderstande ephe paul sayth thing superfluouse make inquisition touching thiswhy christ sent leper priest leuit christ clensed leaper sent priest offer gifte moses commanded man may aunswere hereto well say christ set foorth vnto v example charitie cocorde sobrietie wher wold nothing diminish right priest yt graunted vnto god thing yet might haue done learne hereby defraude right chief cause commandement tendeth ende might common testimonial yea aduersaries concerning miracle pryest receaueth gyfte cofesseth clensed testifieth self rebelles christ wrought signe ought receaued ought beleue true messias prophesies agree herevnto christ shall come signes worlde christ respecte vnto testifieth owne wordes saying offer thy gifte moses commanded testimoniall vnto though say muste nedes confesse yt thou art cleane thou art truely clensed ye leaprosy know messias bewray theyr vncurable stubburnes shall duely punished tyme yet meane season testimonie shall profite yt may receaue beleue pope rome wolde stablyshe confession commandementthe pope proueth confession hystorie vnaptly synne may compared leprosie therfore iudgement priest purifyinge synne requisite sure establishement sentence haue god commaded iewes touching busynes leprosie haue suche priest tyme hadde yet euident priest clensed leaper bare record clensinge cleane pray maketh confession whiche referred remission synnes leaper offer leprosie cleane body offer theyr gifte priest thinges worthie aunswered wyseman nedes confesse let hym fulfill phantasie knowledge confession necessarie mannes mynd cofesseth freely synnes god confession heart whiche deceaueth doth confession eares ye mouth yet confessio god clenseth v fro synne iustifieth muche lesse confession eares doth clense iustifie euen fayth christ iesu worde apprehended fayth name remission synnes receaued promisse offereth vnto v let sufficient touchyng fyrst example second miracle concerning sick chyldthe second miracle also testimoniall doctryne christ thinges may knowen vndeniable god signes miracle redye helpe man gloriously doctryne syncere true fautlesse messias christ besyde example singuler true faith centurion christ hym selfe testifieth touching fayth found lyke israel fayth hereby trieda great example faith centurion iew gentile yet sendeth hym christ beleueth steadfastly christes contrarie able helpe hym thought hym self wold neuer according wrytinge luke helpe elder iewes intreat iesus hym send vnto hym sure token hoped obtayne matter faith ioyned great incredible modestie humilitiehumilitie ioyned faith counteth self vnworthy come vnto christ aske thing hym fyrst sendeth elder synagog afterward heard lord comminge sendeth fryndes mete hym take paynes come vnworthie haue suche great man come vnto hym nedeth muche wearie selfe syth lord ca bryng effect word desyreth although present therat thynketh hym self sure taketh owne example confirmation thereof sayth verily man subiect power hauing vnder souldiers say vnto one go goeth come commeth seruaunt dothe wherfore word man doo muche muche shall done thou speake worde doyng doth beleue therewith also put foorth true doctryne faith nature wherfore also wyshede oure faith christ might lyke sort whiche might helpe v great vertue word although see person example exceding faith man diligently attente vnto word christ fyrst doubteth nothing fauour christ towarde hymthe centurion attent worde desyreth christ shoulde speake worde doth looke sure truste persuasion though obtayned redy perfecte recoueringe chyld wherfore thou hast worde studie folow point extant large promise god mercifull christes sake faithes sake christ haue remission oure synnes lyfe euerlastingewe haue word vse lyke maner moste part lacke faith wher centurion endewed see thinketh obtayne word hym nede care reste forthwith ensue yt word doth promise obtain much oure selues herof commeth regard word meane season haue oure recourse carnall succour wher word almightie centurion doth testifie deceaue promesse sure haue good successe fayth much worthye meruayled atthe centurion heathen bycause centurion heathen whome promise lykewyse made iewes wherfore challenge right belonginge iewes people god nature faith maketh humble myndes thinke prowdly selues high minded therfore sticke mercie grace god ought consydered v example speciall cause anye thought oure owne synnes vnworthynes shall vexe oure myndes yet caste hope constantlie embrace word god beleue hope contrarie hope acceptable god requireth v without coulde grace wold applye oure selues promise without merite worthynes centurion alledge iewes god oweth thing hym maketh hym humble dareth come christes sight humbleth hym selfe loweste math woman canaan dyd sendeth entreat christ hym yet hath certainly persuaded self touching goodnes humanitie christ thynketh heart shal haue help christ verily true fayth true humblenes oure vnworthynes cause v somwhat doubt yet without desperation bountie mercie god maketh v chereful iewes proudefor god requireth fyrst appeare hym confidence oure selues maner hypocrytes secondarily maner hypocrytes despaire vtterly thynges impossible reason accordyng psalme may fele god delighted feare trust vpon mercy iewes dyd persuaded selues god fauoured dyd good bounde doo thoughte proudly insolently selues executed wyll god deserued benefites god vnderstode nothyng mercie wherfore christe pronounceth greuous sentence agaynste saying many shall come east west whiche shall sytte downe abraham isaac iacob kyngdom heauen child kyngdome shalbe caste vtter darkenesse wailyng gnashyng teeth shalbe cause vnbelefe trust much selues meane season set nothing mercy wherfore profiteth nothynge sede abraham shall nothynge hynder gentile child abraham imbrace christ sure trust aspire grace mercye god god trade luc math fyl hungry good thinges send riche empty away neither gentile neither iew neither circumcision neither vncircumcision thyng preuaileth faith christ men beynge destitute helpe may flee vnto ye mercy god gospell teacheth exactely bothe charitie faith propertie nature faith imbraceth worde looketh mercy god great humilitie whosoeuer shall order faith wise shal obteyn petition leapour centurion shalbe done vnto hym beleued hath bounteousnes mercy god onely heart coueteth putteth trust therin god declare mercy hym receiue hym fauour deliuer hym trouble pray god instruct v holy ghoste stirre vp oure myndes suche truste mercye meanes bryng v euerlastyng lyfe amen iiii sonday twelfth day upon gospell math viii entred shyppe disciple folowed hym behold arose greate tempest sea somuch shyppe couered waues slepe disciple came awoke saying master saue v perishe sayd vnto ye fearefull ye litle sayth arose rebuked wyndes sea folowed great calme men meruailed saying maner man windes sea obey hym come side countrey gergesites mette hym two possessed deuylles whiche came graues measure fierce man myghte go way beholde cried oute sayinge iesu thou sonne god haue doo thee arte thou come hither tourment v tyme good way hearde many swyne feedyng deuyls besought hym saying thou cast v suffer v go hearde swyne saide vnto go youre wayes went departed hearde swyne beholde whole hearde swine cried hedlong sea perished water kept fledde went theyr wayes citie tolde euery thyng happe ned vnto possessed deuyls c exposition hystoriea doctrine faith sette foorth vnto v gospelle suche teacheth v oure duetie doyng good workes toucheth nothynge tenne commaundementes teacheth v ought doo ought haue ayde fayth peryls desperate temptation wherefore doctrine hyghest sorte belongeth faith touchyng whiche men thynke haue hath place moste especially aduersitie wherfore may better perceiued matter deuide sorte fyrste wyl entreate touching crosse affliction concerning christ faith christ onely beyng sure ayde delyuereth frome euyll laste wyll entreate fruite profite ensueth deliuerance temptation faythe partes shall shewe weightie hystorie euangelist setteth foorth fewe wordes ought greatly estemed v fyrst iesus disciple taketh shyp ther tepest al thing calme quiet yea sea also pacified without tossing ye disciple could persuaded take ship shyppechrists companye shyppe without condition te pest especially perill soone christ taketh shyp disciple loose cable rope tacklings sayle hast mayne sea ariseth sodeinly suche tempeste flouds couer shyppe put ieopardie drownynge hystorie ought vsed commonly v myghte bee vsed prouerbe signifie trouble churche myght speake prouerbe sort christ dooth shyppe enter peace wyll longe continue prouerbe foorthwith foloweth storme tempest thou must loke bodyly reste trouble christ luc order thynges verye necessarye christ saith strong armed man obteyneth palaice peace vntyll stronger commeth hym thynges filled enmitie trouble peace quiete thinges malicious enuying horrible spoylyng falle flame whiche thynge whole hystorie gospell beareth recorde thynges without trouble soone christ entreth shyp eyther preachynge doyng miracle thou mayst see al thyngs ar turmoiled fiery myndes seditious flocketh routeth together phariseis scribe hyghe priestes poete saith set vpon one man spite dartes foote neither woodnes satisfied withoute death christ tempest muche greuous stirred vp deuyll thereof dothe christ prophecie long tenth mathew h thynke came send peace earth came sende peace swoorde came sunder sonne agaynste father daughter agaynste mother daughter lawe mother law man shoulde haue hys ennemies theym hys owne housholde thynges tende enda christe man must thynke byde trouble thou sholdest well consyder whether expedient thee christian thou purpose verily become christian loke certainly nothing tempest battayle eccles wherfore syrach second chapter admonisheth saieth sonne thou commest serue lorde vpright iustice feare prepare thy mynd temptation subdue thy heart pacient though say thou comest seruice god thou shalt haue nede supported deuil wil trouble thee cotrarily thou regardest god seruice louest christianitie thou must refuse byde tempest great trouble wherfore make thy selfe bold strong tremble tempest feare god rather yt thou mayst therfore fall frome worde thys thyng muste thou purpose strong vnabashed hearte nothynge taken hande wynne fauour worlde neyther ought lette passe feare worldes displeasure thys thynge euangeliste entendeth teache v hee sayeth tempest fyrst beganne christ entred shyppe caried frome earth mayne sea meane season maye profyte thys poynte euen maye haue whereby geue checkemate raylers lewde whiche nothing blaspheme gospell whyche speake wisethe gospell cometh tempest doctrine came foorth thynges quiete great plentie great miserie combrance man number sectes battailes sedition ommotions famine turkes encreasement myschiefe may put sylence well example euen christes entryng shyppe tempest rose befell fault christ dyuell whiche hateth christ suffer hym dothe hate gospell also endeuoureth make odious manye tragedy commotion may lengthe forsaken menthe vnkynd worlde man preuayle soo muche blynde persones make consyder thyng dede haue respecte onely trouble impute gospell haue regard thynges whiche procede gospel knowledge god remission synnes iustification sanctification euen ouerthwartthe example iewes vnkynde styffenecked people iewes dyd wyldernesse egypte taskes doubled prayed god feruently helpe greate deuotion godlynesse long theyr departure delyuerance forgat done wyldernesse remembrance theyr miserie anguishe egypt called mynd meane tyme pottes fleshe breade exod num plentuously egypte neither vnlyke papistes poynt heaped togither counnyngly commodity theyr olde state kepe close heynous discommodities whyche delyuered whenne god gaue manna plentuously foorthwith wearie set muche delicates egypt froward nature originall synne god great benefite nothyng estemed amongst thynges vnacceptable worthye thankes whiche god geueth great good wyll hereby long suffrance god meruailously espied suffer moste vnkynde worlde longthe tyme popedom man twentie yeares past put v choyce whether would abyde hardnes one yeares dearthe myght delyuered wronges pillage monkes priestes either suffer common iniuries haue therewith plentie victuall would rather haue wished dearth daily spoilynges deuourers cormorant thys might cofort v yeres shuld make good one yeres derth cosumed yt wicked neuer leaue spoilyng ware dayely greuous thys choyce proffred v promptly may delyuered cormorauntes lyght gospell yet forgette soone thys case doo highly commende quiete state neyther doo consyder end therof yt ydlenesse could repelle put v craftie conueyinge awaye onely oure goodes also bodye soule thynges made noysome false doctrine idolatry yet neuerthelesse myddest pestiferous euyls wee coulde free discommodities scarsitie pestilence battayle troubled commonaltie neuerthelesse thynges chaunce tyme thought haue gospell cause therof though gospell rydde oute waye men shoulde lyue golden lyfe shoulde bee oppressed suche great calamity nowe long sufferance god appeareth sufferynge vnkynde froward person loke howe muche longer god doothe suffer greuous shall punyshement length shall fall god loueth estemeth nothynge word haue safegarde agaynst synne death el gospell yet great vnkyndnes wyckednes still inuent defame punishemente vnkynde embrayde gospell wherfore sclaunderers laste tyme sha come shalbe punyshed shall stryken god madnes blyndnesse may lyue voyde great light god may hardened cast away iewes speake nothyng blasphemously god vntyll laste yealde selfe wholly kyngdom deuill shall haue ye last worthy reward foly madnes neyther way withoute trouble misery bee man lyuynge although gospell away always mutuall wronges hatred battailes c imperie rome neuertheles mightiest power coulde without calamity diuers comotions yea hadde gospell wherfore ought imputed gospell yt wer plagued receiuyng gospelwhereof euyls world come faut therof lyeth deuyll vnkyndnes dyuell abyde gospelle woulde haue wholly destroyed cause stirreth vp great tempestes commyng therof howe muche clerer lyght gospell goeth abrode muche cruell greuous deuyll agaynst itnote well god moste offended oure vnkyndnes regarde suche greate treasure wyll suffer oure selues bee helped matter bryngeth death punisheth vnkynde mete calamity plague men may perceaue helpe idol euyls first part thre matter whereof wee purposed entreate thou lykest state christianitie refuse abide tempest thou doo thou shalte violently handled therfore thou shalt perceaue thou haste doone thou muste suffer agonie deathe seconde part concernyng faithhowe faythe fayleth trouble temptation agony fleeth christ awaketh hym also worthy printed mynde aduersaries papistes doo deface faith greatly extoll fre wyshe might receyued shyppe myght lest proue power strengthe free hath temptation daunger apostle fele matter goeth although faith smalle yet smalle faith ben would haue despaired free wyll sunke downe desperation lyttell fayth christ witnesseth sayinge lytle faithe helped doo vtterly perishe flee christ wake hym call hym helpe small lytle fayth doo muche greate stronge fayth doo late example leapre centurion declaredfrewyll trouble nothyng wherfore freewylle vertue strengthe moste requisite nothyng vanysheth away stande styffe man feleth wayes escape peryll wepyng cryinge wysheth hymselfe afarre saye freewyll geue comforte peryll casteth v desperation lytle last tremble sounde leafe blowen wynde faith although litle weake yet standeth striueth desperation perceyued place disciple waues fell vehemently couered shyppe would afrayde suche doubtfull danger peryll faithe although lytle yet standeth sure rocke sea lytle dauyd holdeth vp hym selfe agaynst great goliad comyng towarde hym agaynst deathe synne daunger despaireth seketh helpe christ styrreth hym slepe cryeth lorde saue v wee peryshe faithe wonte doo althoughe destruction myschiefe hangeth ouer v yet looketh prayeth helpe sayth psalme beleued therfore haue spoken prayde man praye excepte beleue free wyll doo onely beholdeth peryll daunger psal consyderethe persone whome must aske helpe suche tyme neyther man defended synne deathe thyng belongeth free wyll faythe neuer lytle yet dothe apprehend christe obteyneth helthefaith praualleth perill faythe strong sure fayth ionas prophete whiche endured whale bealy thre day myght haue sayde sea whaues thynge feare ionas neyther ragyng vnrulynesse shall haue quiete hauen agaynste youre wronges myddest youre surge escape perylle therfore true faith hath respect onely thynges presente hath freewyll therfore feareth dispaireth considereth promyse whyche yet presently perfourmed myddest mischiefe hopeth saluation wherfore although middest wide chaw deathe yet casteth hope saluationpower taken f ewyll trusteth constantely shall come lande appeareth place small faithe disciple wherfore faith thing common small efficacitie rom neither without strength power god cometh fre ye word working holy ghost aduersaries ye papist know knew wold set theselues stoutly sentece wherin say faith iustifieth sauethonely faythe iustifieth saueth faith bringeth comfort synne death hell damnation falleth v sheweth poison v wherfore ar fierce stout sea calme wether fayre dark cloude stadeth ouer ye hed maketh seme night winter water waxeth darke dothe heartes fall heles desperation ensueth forthwith haue faythe freewyll whiche voyde without helpe forgetteth worde god fyndeth place refuge dangerous thyng christ sleapeth peryll death lyfechriste sleapeth shyppe thyng perchance came hereby wearye teachyng day praying fightynge temptation nyght doo surely thinke muche vexed night season diuell whiche tempted hym complaineth psalme poore greate trauaile youth haue dronk thy wrath troubled psal cause counted people melancholike person shewed mery countenance seldom went musyng hangyng downe heade shewyng outwardlye pryde stoute stomacke although slepe trewe cause yet behoued shoulde serue encreasyng apostle faith work hath chiefe regarde therunto christ also slepeth co gregationand christe euen tyme also sheweth countenance vnto churche thoughe hee nothynge regarded thoughe hadde forgotten v dothe shyppe sleapeth regardeth tempest disciple shyppe yet shyppe neuer muche slepe temptaions vexe churche christ sufferethe fluddes ryse agaynste shyppe hee suffereth deuyll worlde bee troublesome vnto christian hereof riseth feare thynges shall come naught also tyme see thing come passe pope rable hateth worde stirreth high power continually v turkes ar set forward diuell shyppe tempestes wyndes among looke safegard possible lorde may wynke thynges shewe token helpe v yet sleape hys shyppe must take good heartchriste waked think must vtterly dispair lord v shyppe although faineth regardeth v yet ought declare yt let go syght thynk constantly hym yt may make sea calme although neuer muche opprest waues tempestes must doo also oure priuate temptation deuyl layeth thy synnes thy charge feareth thee wrath god yea threatneth euerlasting damnation also herin must thou thynke christ hand yet slepe thou must sette lyght negligent go vnto hym wake hym prayer founde disciple place thinke better saue selues suffer christe slepe thynke thys haue nede haue christ waked el vndoone wherfore cease callyng vntill hym wakynge folowe thou example also bothe must nedes done thou enter christ shypchrist foloweth true christian alwaye tempest wyll bee lackynge christ layeth slepe myght fele temptation dede yf shoulde slepe afterward represse tempest neuer well perceaue true christianitie yea myght soone brought belefe saued oure owne power faith strengthned temptatio confession myght made thyng necessarie power man coulde haue preuayled deliuerance came onely god worde besyde doctrine christ described sette forth vnto v manchrist god man accordyng man nature whiche consisteth body soule therfore nede naturall action eatyng drinkyng sleapyng thyngs without synne euen haue myght bee defenced agaynst dotage manichee whiche iudged christ haue counterfait body body declareth selfe verye man slepeth naturall man dothe dothe declare godhead almyghtinesse maketh sea calme agayne worde thys worke dede belongynge man power herein god power requisite violence suche great creature god may bee restrained word cause might esteme miracle forasmuche open howe god man one person christ cause wyll helpe combrance affliction suche call vpon hymhow godhead mahod ioyneth together one person doone without felynge feare peryll well declared must content therewith muche wicked bee withoute affliction therefore neuer free frome euyll conscience fynally goe damnation haue thirde part touchynge fruitethe fruicte foloweth tempest whiche ryseth suche faythe consyderynge thys myracle fall repentaunce say greate admiration man wyndes sea obediente vnto hym lyke hytherto tooke hym carpenter neyther thoughte ayde agaynste perylle deathe oughte bee asked desyred hym nowe atteyne farre knowledge hym hathe greate sure myghte helpe man helpe continuall nature thynges howe much temptation greuous much fruict greater ende nowe rage worlde great v almost hope none thyng destruction tempest sea shall haue victorie destruction haue grace sticke sure woorde faith shall see ioyful end could thynke heart hate pope turk greater man wold beleue wherwith persecute congregation whiche cause grone mourn woman trauaile whiche hate neuerthelesse shall bring comfortable thing neuer hoped ought euery man thynk surely behalf also enuironned belayd round temptation ende fruict shall moste certain swete pleasant wherefore howe greate doctrine gospell howe muche necessarye ayde hathe true godlynes may knowe thynges whiche setforth intreated touchyng whole course vertue godlynes sure congregation amog godly let v take shyppe christ let v refuse abyde tempeste moste greuous troublous estate sea worlde greuous trouble commeth foorthe lette v kepe selues diligently within hold defence faith word god lette v thynke truely tempest temptation shall haue ende conclusion shall folow suche prosperous successe thynges suche abundance ioye shall soon recompence myserie whiche felt suffering ioy victorie approued power faithe word sory labour affliction haue bestowed suffered rather would condemne owne nicenesse except suffered tutne frome crosse wher deliuerance great glorie set foorth peryl gospel sake great grefe springeth hereof fleshe old man wyll gladly combred crosse wherfore muste neuer let example goe eies must diligently consider word may defenced temptation let v haue recourse vnto christ sleapeth among v sheweth though regarde v let v ardent earnest praier aske help shal surely fynd present thyng setforth vnto v wt sure knowlege touchig god god graut come passe dede prosperously vnto ye glory god ye saluacio soules amen fyfte sonday twelfth daye upon gospel math xiii kingdome heauen lyke vnto man whiche sowed good seede field whyle men slept enemye came sowed tare amonge wheate went waye blade spronge vp brought forth fruite appeared tare also seruauntes housholder came sayde vnto sir didst thou sowe good seede thy fielde whece hath tare said vnto enuious man hath done seruauntes sayde vnto wilt thou go wede vp said nay left whyle ye gather vp tare ye plucke vp also wheate let growe together vntil haruest tyme haruest say reaper gather ye first tare bynde together sheaues brent gather wheate barne exposition appeareth gospell tymes paste easye vnderstadthe expounding doctrin diuers specially bycause christ self setteth forth meaninge yt parable concerning field sower corrupter ye good seed tare c difficultie hardnes afterward sprange gospel yt playn doctor agreing together herein must take ye diliget hede leaste ye true sentece shold take v say tare signifie heresy therby gather belogeth ye ciuill power punishe heretikes opinion augustin graunteth hym selfe haue ben sayeth constrained sure reason experience selfe yeld vp opinion make differece betwene ciuil officer seruaunts housholder expounde tare signifie common offence conclude christian officer ought iudge matter life death ther whiche sorte pope adherentes regarde christ forbiddeth plucke vp tare owne iudgement pronounceth doctrine gospel tare therfore neuer cease moue persecution againste gospell professor therof murderinge kylling wherfore seing meaninge diuers first muste inquire entreat true meaning common question ought done heretikes parable appliedand touching true meaning christ putteth forth generallie parable kyngdom heauen maner declareth fashion ye church shewing geuing example al godly men especiallie ruler congregation ought haue eye attent lest sholde owne imagination swarne turne contrarie kyngdome dreame vndefiled felowshippes sainctes earth worde kyngdome heaue semeth receaue kynde man filthines maketh reason nothing ought receaued holy place holy thinges god suffered man defiled syn holy place yea cause forthwith repelled lucifer hym wherfore nature kingdome heauen sea suffer dead carcase vncleane thinge defyled syn abidyng kyngdome god one consideration kyngdome god gospel entreateth especially herof condition kyngdome vnpossible sinner kyngdome god kyngdo heauen churche earth heauen earth reuealed sonne god god wolde haue suche might set vp horne saluation rightuousnes synners hath synners interest right receaued synnes riseth kyngdome holines iustice1 cor whiche remission synnes christe whiche wisedome rightousnes satisfyinge thinges belonginge determinat tymes prescription concerninge person god haue time waye repent taken stopped synners thynges necessarie executynge matter synner comminge remission sinnes demaunded kynde sinnes done prouide one thing euen yt surely beleue yt sinnes forgeuen christes sake neuer counted god mercy lesse sufficiente pardon sinnes strange kyngdome doth god set vp gospell sonne appointeth certaine tyme administration therof whiche first vttering reuelie hym vntil christ come iudge quicke dead christ wheras compareth kyngdome god saluatio mercy necessary synners capacitie worlde dyuel ca neuer fauorable ye kingdo god seketh diuers occasion fulfill forseeth mynde great offence come wickednes shall ryse kingdo god mercie word god taketh roote fewethe nature true christias esteminge grace god truely embrace true faith renewed ye holy ghoste alway moueth haue faith thorough christ god mercie performe obediece mete yt new borne praye waight alway certaine ayde christes sake al ye multitude although wil lothe named forsakers christian professio counted god kingdom goeth yt professio word much void righteousnes wtout ye holy ghoste therfore subiect diuels power worke shal see occasio yt dyuel settethe forth hipocrisie meruailously wheras part beareth name church yet voyde god grace without holy ghost therfore sheweth foorth work godlynes vpright holy sober lyfe part ther cotente haue certaine enormity errours corrected whiche seeme contrarie reason vnprofitable comon welth yet order matter wreste god lawes maintenance mannes inuentions rather examine mennes lawes rule god worde herof sprang diuers heresy arrians macedonian donatistes nouatians nestorian al endeuored make heauenly doctrine seme agreable man reason iudgement dyd bycause knew god kingdom vntill laste great aduersarie heauenly kingdome byshoppe rome corrupted pure sowen word god kind tare fell great wickednes vsurped false power ouer kingdom labouring haue daunger wicked canon decree decretalles expresse word great corruption hurt hath wrought lordes felde go shew great hurt damage done studie make true face forme churche knowenthere must nedes sectes church amonge many seducinge sectes true church may perceaue long feld world must necessitie lyue amoge many deadly sectes heresy many meanes suffer selues counted kingdome yet true hearted subiectes kingdome rest professe selues word declare partly dedes kynde lyuinge partly doctrine opinion know belongeth kingdome neither true vertues workes therof sayntes godly abyde suffer great goodnes god abused ought muche care satisfyinge oune minde seing glorie god maner marke rather ende way shall come laste assone church beginneth seclude god kingdom abuser god grace vnworthy synners receaueth righteous whome suche kynd vice espied abolished kyngdome god grace mercie meanes nouatias anabaptistes time also fell errour whilest time goe pluke vp tare corne christianitie make monkrie take away kyngdome god grace neither ye first monkes yt vncorrupt circumspecte warie ynough behalf went solitarie place wildernes auoidyng many offence euilles chaunce amongest ecclesiasticall minister congregation citie began litle litle maintainer lewed opinio though true child god ciuil corporation gouerne either family ruled city town lyued prophane vnholie ley kynde liuing wheras neuer lesse true godlines requireth suche thing truth first behoueth men know kyngdome grace god may knowe obtayneth mercie remission synnes christes sake let euery man liue ye euil felowshippes men let gouern housholdes communalties let seruaunts laborer family subiectes citisens city let euery man owne part doe owne duetie psalme admonisheth v superstitio biddynge v beware psalm psalme agreeth meaninge parable trust lord doe good dwell lande shall fede thee rich therof forbiddeth v careful pluckyng vp tare wheras commaudeth inhabite earth either ruler family gouerners city true godlines meanes least kyngdome god mercie ther shold spring monkry new inuented seruice yet churche god must nedes know difference corne tare knoweth suertie liue kingdome god throughe faith christ holie gost wher man newe borne regenerate man sanctified renewed made obedient god yet least ouerthrowe kingdome grace suffereth long example god stablishinge owne minde conscience midle great temptation seduced neither doth loke helpe succoure flitting auoydyng mennes company going side wildernes cloister monkrie nonrie vseth circumspection iugement fall like euilles parable therfore lesson set forth learned churche first must thinke self kingdome god lawes condition wherof verie fewe know folowe time albeit kyngdome grace wherunto sinner ought desirously flee yet diuel ye helpe fleshe whiche alwaies fauorable part doe muche euen middest god holy people cogregations thrusteth great heape hypocrite whe church perceaueth within selfe matter suche great offence must violentlie resiste defend saue self warelie offence although offence euident yet state kingdome suche force violence remedie offence ciuil worldly manerthe offence church may remedied force ciuill maner state maner kingdome must kept whiche euen doctrine gospell purelie set forth touching remission synne men wel instructed concerning must renued holy ghost mercie forgeuenes pronounced suche diligently vocation work godly loue doctrine ought tyme omitted carnall wordly men neuer much offended therby yet feare offending must occasion v ouerthrowe kingdom let v consider example mounkes bishop rome whiche whyle went auoyde offence seducinges chance common lyfe brought greuouse occasion offende chaunged true religion ceremony rite obseruatios vtterly abolished kingdom mercie grace also practice ye diuel slaundereth professers gospell bycause many offence euill example amongest denye suche offensiue example many hypocrite boaste god mercie grace yet licentiouse liuinge maners aduoutrie extortio vsurie sensual lustes many vice declare regard grace god truely remedie forth tempted plucke vp tare seke separation euil good meane season corrupte heauenly doctrine touching grace god remission synnes wise wil suffer oure selues withdrawen oure duetie importunite outragiouse behauioure muche better resiste striue wicked example lyfe maners contrarie preserue doctrine mercie grace correcte plucke vp violently example mounkes nouatians flee scylla fall charybdis auoiding lesse daunger fall greater especially syth ye nature kingdom vterly auoyde offence bycause muste maintenance necessarie doctrine grace wherfore papistes lay oure charge frutes oure gospell thing meane therby kyngdom without offence euill example may iustly lay charge go mounkerye tradition make kingdom without offence fallen errour blyndnes therby haue cleane loste doctrine iustification godly righteousnes workes true godlines also therfore put oure choyce whiche discommodities rather hauein punishinge offence ought haue chief respecte doctryne mercie grace whether rather take uerily wold graunt muche kingdom without offence yet yt better chose offence neuerthelesse kingdom might sumwhat vpholden wherby kingdom quite destroyed without hope recoueryng wherby doctrine true godlines vtterlie decay perishe chanced amongest papistes monkes doctrine meaning parable christ put forth thende aboue thinges might haue good respect know maner god kingdome offended suche inconueniences chaunce alwayes ye wordle vnto wheras offereth free remission sinnes sinner fyrste cometh herby passe many hypocrite come felowshippe kingdome also som men laboringe remedie discomoditie finde meanes make ciuil separatio may falsly boste grace god yet felowship vse well christ sheweth greate damage ensueth therby euen separatio plucke vp good corne also doctrine grace pluckt vp men tradition whiche inuented make separation nowe churche brought suche miserable vnscapable case member perill hed like decay wherfore muste folowe christes councel byddeth v suffer tare precise pluckyng vp least oure vndiscrete diligence ouerthrowe gouernaunce kyngdome touchyng remission sinnes nowe must vse kyngdome many remission sinne may forgeuen ther ther many rather sene kingdome grace true member therof dede therwith nedes misuse gyfte god shoulde extreme sake would vse violece force kyngdome shall get therby see example go seperat wycked abusynge goddes grace vtterlye subuerte kyngdome grace wherfore let v leue done angelsthe angel shall make separation wha god kyngdo mercy come ende may sunder euill good shal kyngdom grace lenger amog sinner euery man shall receaue accordynge workes ther shal peril wher grace gospel kyngdom heauen shoulde taken away pluckynge vp tare appearinge sonne god greatest yea onely refuge sinner might seme disturbed taken awaye separation angel shall nede inquire whether lefte called saluation shalbe cosidered hath vsed well kyngdom cofort hath ben true mebers therof dede hath ben subiectes ther vnto name yet dede neuer true felowship therwith haue spoken touchinge true meanyng parable intreat onlye must done heretikes vniuersally yt hath office correcte offeces ought al kynd offender whether ment saying let growa question touchinge punishyng heretikes ther offeces kynd offence either life doctrine shold punished restrained haue declared christ especial entent parable euen vndiscrete vsage men kyngdome heaue shold hindred thing god commandement ordeyned furtherance kingdom ought thought co trarie fyrst begin principall matterexcommunication excommunication vsed churche parable necessary preseruation therof without mercie remission synne pure doctrine therof retayned absolution god grace must applied penitent byndinge must god wrathe curse applied vnpenitet2 cor paule hym self saith power binding geuen hym destroy edifie wherfore excommunicat destroyd fyrst ought haue singular respecte maintenance ecclesiasticall body church hasard thing ordeyned god bring men repentance saluation openly suffred vsed vnpenitent wherfore church shold either superstitio vayne ostentatio mercifulnes omit authoritie byndinge excommunicatinge vnpenitent punishe sharplie suche offender saue self holy vndefiled suffer litle leauen corrupte ye whole dowe greatly blamed consider also donne destroy excommunicat excluded comunion felowship saintes herby put shame entent amend obtaine saluation ye church god kingdo wold amed may appeare ye churche faulte whiche dyd feare lest also defyled destroyd sufferinge wicked intermedell holye thinges wherfore church doth commanded good cause excommunicat stubbourne synners neither violat breake christes commandement forbad tare pluckt vp christ hym self commanded saying let hym ethnicke publicane math yet owne comandement forbad tare pluckt vp euidet former description excommunication hyndreth principall entent christ doctrine grace rather ye maintenance therof casteth behaue selues disorderedly kyngdom heauen entent may beter come selues retourne obediently wil vtterly caste kingdom lesse daunger otherwyse heape together greuous offence defilinge prophaninge holy company saintes church also negligent regardige vndefiled holines prouoke god hyghe displeasure wrathe al restrayninge offence amogest magistrate officerswhat offeces punished magistrate bound diligetly see therevnto lykewyse father mother gouerners family informer manner learninge forbydden commandement christ execute officemagistrates rather strayghtly commaunded charged touching iurisdiction power gouernance exercise kingdom heauen exacte certaine office rite donne whiche thing belongeth kyngdom grace haue regimet kyngdom belongeth body bodilie thinges ciuill maners office order humanitie honestie firste procure bodie bodelie thinges may safegard therby soules spiritual thynges maye better gouerned magistrate maintaineth onlie second table touchynge duetie towardes men also firste concernynge duetie towardes god punisheth idolatrie blasphemie wytchcraftes periurie punisheth restraineth heretikesmagistrates may lawfully punishe teacher false doctrine blasphemous god teache false doctrine taketh correction stiffe defendinge heresie error punisheth malefactor bycause seduce many truth doth thought plucke vp tare bycause office belongynge kyngdom whiche forbid plucke vp tare superfluous thing commande teach lesson gouerners housholdes ciuil officer haue charge geuen vnto must nedes
