vnderstading therof cause men superstitio abstaine doinge certaine office necessarie comon welth declare large haynouse thing christe describeth howe ennemie night sowed pestilent tare howe byshoppes superattendets sleping sluggyshnes gaue hym occasion leaue long matter fyt handled shorte tyme time thinke sufficient haue enstructed touching true meanyng parable thend ye may earnestlye regarde euen christe would shold put forth parable tare let v pray vnto heuenly father thyng necessary whome praise glory euer amen sonday called septuagesima gospell math xx kingdome heauen lyke vnto man housholder went early mornyng hyre labourer vineyarde agrement made labourer peny daye sent vineyarde went third houre sawe standing ydle market place sayde vnto go ye also vineyarde whatsoeuer ryght geue went theyr waye againe went vi ix houre dyd lykewyse xi houre went foud standing ydle said vnto stade ye day ydle sayd vnto hym man hath hyred v saith vnto go ye also vyneyarde whatsoeuer ryght shall ye receiue eue come lorde vineyarde sayd vnto steward call labourer geue hyre beginning laste vntil firste dyd come came eleuenth houre receyued euery man penye whe fyrste came also supposed sholde haue receiued lykewyse receyued euery man peny receyued murmured goodman house saying last haue wrought one houre thou hast made equall v whiche haue borne burden heate day aunswered vnto one sayd frende thee wrong diddest thou agree peny take thyne go thy waye geue vnto last euen vnto thee lawefull lusteth myne owne goodes thine eye euill good last shalbe fyrst fyrst shalbe last many called fewe chosen exposition meanynge gospell profound high wherby youth rude people learne muche yet appointed learned thys tyme speake somwhat therof heare parable housholder went foorth morning hyred workman vineyard whiche wrought twelue houres afterward hyred wrought nine houres also wrought sixe three laste one workes farre vnlyke yet reward equall one hauing housholder dyd according couenant fyrst ye rewarded pleasure without couenat yet gaue much yt last wrought one hower first yt agreed hym peny daye semeth reason world foloweth rule yt doth muche work must haue much reward wage doth litle must haue litle yet man complain wrong payde due one due howbeit geue equal wage equall labour according rule iustice yt biddeth geue euery due christ reherseth parable shew differece betwene kingdom ye kingdom ye world teach yt otherwise kingdo tha world wheras ca equalitiethe state christ kingdome world vnlyke reson yt ye degree state therof contrary ther one degree master seruates master hath substace seruat labor nothing agreable parable wherin christe taketh away al inequalitieall thynges vnequall world rewardeth al state degree alike ye one hath interest kingdom tha ye ye corporal ciuil life otherwise must nedes inequalitie eue ther differeces degree husband life vnlike life ye citisen likewise ye lordes ye knight equalitie neither must go seke ye kingdom christ whether king prince lord seruat mastresse handmaide like equall haue one baptisme one faith one gospel one sacrament one christ one god al alike aswel ye great small heare gospell likewise touchyng baptisme baptisme baptisme child one one fayth peter paule magdalen hanging crosse v christian god iohn baptist synners repente neither doth make differece matter god ciuile respect superiours inferior accordyng men office degree ye chiefest part gospel lerne yt touching state codition god kingdom ar equal world differece must nedes father better son maister better ye seruant kyng better subiect god wil dyd ordein constitute diuers state degree kingdome world wold go aboute make lowest equal ye highest shold bring ye co minalty cofusion end teded ye comotios ye rude people comos wherfore great soeuer ye diuersitie office ye world yet let v think suretie yt god regarded alyke asmuch one christe one baptisme one gospell one holy spirite v neither hathe one better gospell baptisme christ lowest state seruats hath good ye highest although som hath good thing thou hast yet passeth yt hath better god thou hast diligently learned specially cause eue yt euery vocation may ye bottom heart willyngly obey god asmuch may assuredly trust yt although emperor pope abundant rich neither equall power ye higher state yet yt equall ye best yt hath obteined baptisme death christ hath sure confidece trust yt death shall hurt hym hath highest yt mete yt haue obteined great rich christ abiect fearful heart rather yt shold lerne litle esteme thinges yt glorious world haue hope yt baptised name lord iesu christ died v ascended heauen sitteth right hand god father almighty aide succour v syn death euill wherfore knoweth perfectly yt equall christwhat con ort cometh equalitie christes kingdome dothe busines duetie without wearinesse griefe greued state condition lyfe base lowe otherwise kingdom ther must nedes diuersities degree ye one le ye greater ye one rule serue let grefe christia must take good part state ye world bewaile case grudge seruile miserable lyfe leadeth base low degree must faithfully maintein state lyfe god hath appointed hym take well worth present degree vntyll god shall open hym way better mean season let hym comfort hym self hath christ high emperours prelate monkes haue muche furdered saluation euerlasting life graunt lowest haue equall felicitie kyngdom haue themselues place must nedes kyngdom accepted god fauour christ iesus suffered washed v bloud one lesse alike euery man hath lyke right tresure neither wil greatly greued inequalitie wyll sory state make disturbace publike order therby contet present state vnequal euer yt may felowe partner haue like right al saint thing yt ar hoped euer lasting wel beaten men myndes yt al haue like right christ kingdo wold certain godly spiritual pride war ioyful harty yea vilest seruice drudgery yt yt godlines al thing must done wt ioyfull hart wheras yt christe perceiueth beleueth firmly yt god displeased wt low degree ye yt gret renomes sake wherin al saint ar equal christ canot coceiue incredible ioy somuch yt wold refuse scoure sink yt may wel accepted wt christ ar chiefest aduersaries monk nonnes imagin god hath writing table cou ting boke note euery man labour woorkes taskesthe iusticiaries make christ parciall kyngdome marke much one doth labor thereby myght haue higher roume heauen haue better christ euery man christ haue taught priest masseth doth worke profiteth well dead quicke forbecause worthier person higher degree kyngdome christ laye people person abide equalitie christes kyngdom go make inequalitie wordly maner lyke maner haue taughte nunne abbey holyer better houswyfe house man teache contrary condemne hym heretike herein lyke vnto murmured parable require shewe god roll written al howers wrought suffred heate day marke answere god geueth inequalitie ciuil gouernace wil reason hygher degree higher honour due ye come saith kingdome sonne equall haue one baptism one christ neither better gospell taught worse monkes saye maried men haue worst gospell worst commandementes selues haue beste hygher degree god kyngdome false contrary gospell therby go make inequalitie gospell neuerthelesse christ made thing equall especially techeth thing parable kingdom one better liue chast man haue gyft euill thyng neither forbidden lawes statute affirm man woman therby higher degree god must haue greater reward therfore fals doctrine great rock whereat pope stumbleth therfore doth falsly accuse v forbyd good workes affirme equalitie christes kyngdom forasmuch god accepteth v merit deseruing mercy grace christ thus proceding matter man hath obteined equalitie felowshyp let euery man comon lyfe applye vocation see charge either gouernyng youth schole teachyng people churche gouernynge familie home lower seruice let euery man doo duetie diligently neither let loke equall higher degree christ man state better hym obteine mercy god iewes wold haue inequalitie god kyngdomeand worlde iewes greately offended heare gentile vncircumcised receaued saluation whiche neuer burdened saboth neither burden law haue caried borne great peine sweate christ parable describeth proprely fyrst thought receaued therfore murmured whan euery man penye euen also hower vineyard christ suffreth inequalitie frende saieth doo thee wrong take thyne gon say haue receiued wage euen land canaan wyll ordeyn new kingdom wherin al thinges shalbe equal rich therin myn may order list doth become teache wage shal geue laborer workman therfore iewes vndiscrete maner enuye doo caste awaye kyngdome god thynke vnmete thing gentile shold made equall therfore accuse god though dyd wronge dryueth answer yt faine chyde say aylest thou goodes geue thyne laufull doo myne owne goodes lusteth lyke importunitie vndiscrete maner pope also abhorre kyngdome wherin al thyngs equall require chiefest preeminence selfe duetie theyr pride shal obteyn ye iewes obteined wherfore must lightly regard differece betwene corporall spirituall lyfea difference betwene kingdome christ worldly kyngdome must otherwise bee named betwene kyngdome world christes kingdome christes kingdom thynges must equall comon goodes god christ holy ghost gospel baptisme supper lord faith equalitie lyke holy righteous c syth haue obteyned lette v thankefull god great treasure let v truely knowledge ignorant excellencie renoume let v thinke state condition much belongeth god kyngdom thing inferiour state great mighty holy angel cometh passe euen christe instructed made ioyfull heartie let euery man diligently gladly apply busines according callyng vocation encoragyng selues hope ful trust tresure christ must lern gospel worldly thynges must nedes difference degree touching diuers person office state lyfe otherwise kyngdome christ right lawe geue vnto laste euen vnto thee right cometh kingdome heauen deliuerance syn deathe due man merite geuen onely grace wherfore ought specially beware murmure rather geue thanks vnto god take comfort peril laboures misery chaunce vnto v corporall life shall perceaue fele great pleasure thinges thoughtes predestination perillousin last sentence gospell many bee called chosen curious haue take great occasion inuent wicked vngodly opinion thoughtes imagination thinke must nedes saued god hath chosen contrarywise chosen whatsoeuer neuer good worke yet escape damnation come saluation wherfore wyl striue must nedes done determined shall saued shalbe safe leese labor vaine euery man may easily iudge frowardnes carelesse liuyng springeth vngodly thoughtes feaste epiphanie expouded saying micheas prophethowe god wyll truly learned declared sufficiently suche thought auoided diuell hym selfe must go way work haue true knowledge god medle priuities god maiestie neither predestination election thing passe man capacitie muche thinke therof without great offence say either must nedes ensu suche thoughtes desperation dissolute lyuyng fear god come true way knowing god willin christ god knowen must walke may beware suche occasion fallynge seke may encrease godlynes christ hym selfe appointeth v saith iohn commeth father wherfore wyl come vnto father knowledge hym must go first vnto christwhat christ vnto v know euen christ son god god almightie doth sonne god made man v deliuer v lawe crucified dead crosse satisfie synnes riseth death ope v way euerlasting life resurrection aide v euerlasting death sitteth right hand god make intercession v geue v holy ghost sanctifie gouerne leade v defende v temptation dartes dyuell true knowledge christ thy mind well confirmed strengthened knowledge nowe way heauen without perill thou canst haue imagination god shall bee euyll dangerous syth sonne god hath done much man saluation may assured therby god wil shold saued howe haue pleasure oure destruction syth let nothyng passe wherby may bryng man life saluation agayn true way god christe preacheth thirde iohn god loued world gaue begotten sonne iohn euery one beleueth hym perishe haue lyfe euerlasting let thought copared former thoughtes predestination shal euidently appere former thoughtes deuyll whereby men ar seduced destruction either despaire made voyde godly motion haue trust good wyll god towardes expound wordes maner many called saye god offereth grace many fewe chosen co municateth grace fewe fewe shall saued wicked meanynge wyll hate god vtterly yf thought thys god came wyll faulte saued nowe lette sentence bee compared sentence sayd knowlege christ must ground foundation laide buylde knowledge god wyll thereon shalbe euident last exposition blasphemous agaynste god wherfore must take true meanynge sentence many sayth callednote preachyng gospell vniuersall comon open receaue god spread abrode men beleue saued doth preuaile euen shall folowe next gospell fewe chosen say endeuor selues therby doo god requireth heare care heare yet sette lyttell put selues danger som heare regarde rich pleasure pleaseth god suche thinketh worthy kyngdom meaneth christ sayth fewe chosen fewe declare suche godlynes god requireth chosen acceptable god diligently heare gospell beleue christ declare theyr faith good workes refuse suffer kynde persecution meanyng true seduceth man destruction maketh learne way saluation thus shold serch ye truth doyngs wold please god chosen must beware euill conscience syn god comandement must diligently resyst sinne attentiuely god worde studiously exercise selues therin must desire god holy ghost neuer cast away god worde must always ready fight deuyll subtilties desiryng god alwais send helpe defence pacience men waxe perfect christian wher contrarywise thinke god saued either fall desperation el dissolute careles liuing whiche afterward nothing differ fro beast couersatio whilest thynke wise decreed alredy whether shalbe saued damned bestow labour vayn thou sholdest wise take thy beginnyng thou shouldest haue ended commaundement god put forth thee thou shouldest beleue christ thy sauiour hath satisfied thy synnes comandement must thou folow thou felest thou haste faith litle pray god holy ghost doubt christ thy sauiour thou arte predestinate saued yf thou beleuest thou sure faithe trustest hym commyttest thy selfe vnto hym god graunt v lord iesus christ amen amen sonday called sexagesima pthe gospell luke viii muche people gathered together come al city spake similitude sower went sow sede sowed felle waye side troden downe foules ayre deuoured vp fell stone assone spronge vp wythered away lacked moystnesse felle amonge thornes thornes sprang vp choked som fell good ground sprang vp bare fruict hundreth folde saide thynges cried hath eares heare let hym heare disciple asked sayinge maner similitude said unto geuen knowe secretes kyngdome god parable see see heare shoulde vnderstand parable sede word god besyde waie heare commeth deuyll taketh away worde heartes least beleue saued stone whiche heare receyue worde ioy haue rootes beleue tyme temptation go awaie whiche fell amonge thornes whiche haue hearde go foorthe choked care richesse voluptuous lyuyng brynge foorth fruite whiche fell good ground pure good heart heare worde kepe bryng foorth fruite pacience exposition gospell put foorth fower kynd disciple heare word god thend euery man shold cosider himselfe sort self endeuour diligence made part good ground soilefower maner disciple maye bee fruictfull first saith christ sede cast hie way bring forth fruict either trode vnder foote deuoured birdes second heare professe onely worde beleueth groweth though wold bryng forth fruict doth sowed amongest stone yet abyde heate deepely caste rootes iuyce moysture saue selues agaynste heate wherfore cometh tempestuous persecution temptation wyther away yelde fruict pacience long suffering hope third sort easiest knowen christian man would saye sede vnder thornes although bringeth forth blade yet haruest ouergrowen thornes choked vp fourth ar true disciple whe pure mynd ioyned word cast therof vntil bring forth fruict paciece suffer thing wordes sake study wholly loue obey god yeldeth fruict thousand fold ar foure sortes yt hear gospel let euery search cosider sort thre naught vnfruictful specially first worst heare word herd saith christ diuel cometh taketh ye word heartes yt may beleue saued marke wel myne owne iudgement wold neuer haue thought yt herts whilest thei hear word godthe deuyl cause men remeber word doctrine ar besieged assaulted diuel though yet litle regard neuer reme ber vtterly forget semeth reso chauce yt careles light negliget ene natural vice negliget forgetfull person take litle hede thing yt ar profitable necessary semeth also like matter iudgemet whe word god heard regarded forthwith forgotte christ iudgeth wise eue yt diuel stealeth word herts ye se ye ought iudge men yt ar forgetful word thei behaue themselues afterwarde though neuer heard trust yt haue holy ghost deuil nigh yt putteth hand heart stealeth worde wherfore kind vice must nedes ensue therof stubbornesse disobedience vnfaithfulnes iniquitie filthines diuelish desire reuenge word remained still heart herd attentiuely wold haue garnished heartes true obedience faith modestie mercie lyke vertues first worst al christ littell offended vntoward person therfore rebuketh none sharply opely affirmeth yt dyuels flying aire steale word hertes yt may regard set much thinke great faulte men lightly esteme voyce god worde thou wilte knowe trespas iudged heare iudgement christ without doubt vnderstandeth better tha al wisedom world saith precisely yt diuel doth wherfore whersoeuer word yet ar moued therby block se plaine experiece herof example couetous byers seller husbandman townes men especially aduersaries papistes regarde doctrine gospell wolfe dothe lambe thinke verilye diuell dwelleth heart swaloweth vp al word god co meth therein yt may beleue saued diuel wer present forgetfulnes came nature se yt one man hath better remebrace memory yet ferue desyre losse would constrayn hym thynk miesrable remember muche lord bee mercyfulle fashion thou mynde may regard marke thynges whiche set foorth vnto thy gospel wise thirst worde embrace full wyl deuil preuaile hartie desyre deuyll abyde together forsayde persones described christe care iote god word sente vnto thynke muche worthe lytle gaynes lucre lette man thynke otherwise men deuils power verily greatest part men ar sort word regard deuill plucketh heartes two sort ar wicked ar weake despise instructed begyn well delighted therwith wherfore christ doth say farre diuels daunger fyrst although neuerthelesse appeareth true fruites godlynes therof consequently succede first ar tyme persecution temptation forsake ye worde maner corrupt fruicte long shaken wynde abyde place soone tempest ryseth shaketh tree fall one also accordyng christes wordes tyme beleue see crosse commyng abyde terrour seke danger multitude dothe folow fruite euerlasting life good fruict springeth worde faith thyrd loue worldly rich pleasure regard worde geuen worldly care seketh sercheth scrapeth togither bestoweth labour get hym store rich man ouerladeth heart christ saith luke cometh passe fruicte godlynesse choked vp luc euen corn thornes substance must gotten labour euery man acording vocation boud therin shew industrie diligence god hath comanded gen al mynd care bent al thy heart wholly addict geue kynd study care almost thou studiest nothyng el mischief thornes yt presseth god word cannot grow vp bring forth fruit studied shold thing alwais set thre sortes god word taketh place neither bryng forth feare euerlastyng lyfe thing cou ted small losse wherfore christ exhorteth heare saith se ye geue good eare hath shalbe geuen hym hath shall also taken hym thinketh hath wordes appereth speaketh light matter litle daunger thus neglect contemne ye wordhowe dangerous rhynge lyghtly regarde god worde doth deuise hymselfe wyl without cessyng vse customable trade bargainyng occupying gaynyng winnyng takyng pleasure folowing heartes lust dissemblyng thynk god truthe worde shall haue tyme sufficient heare lyue accordingly therunto hereafter shal haue leisure take ye fruition goodes take diligent hede thou preuented making thyne accompt thou knowest long thou hast liue neither whether thou shalt euer haue oportunitie occasio heare neither chace god shal sed al deuise thyne owne peril danger al thy craft shal turne man hurt thyne owne wherfore heare christ warneth thee hath eares heare let hym hear saying meaneth shold busines prolong lynger delaye tyme maner v begynne nowe sayth whyle thou hearest study death may come season wherfore let v order selues maye fowerth sort although small let v prayer diligence prouide mynde sinistrall vntoward let v regarde worde god kepe bryng forth good fruicts sorte company sainctes meane pope holy sainctes disguysed shorne whyche massmongers fryday fasters whose holynes wedes strange vesture c yt heare word god wher contrary wise pope holy one euidently appereth extreme persecuters god worde heare word bringeth foorthe fruicte yea hundred fold much plentifully mathew speketh parcel math som hundred fold som sixtie fold som thirtie fold ye ministration office ar sundry fruit vnlike ministration ye precher church better comon congregation tha craftesman rulyng owne house yet bothe christian made free synne death ordeined heires euerlasting life christ let v number truly small haue nede toward pure heart christ saith iswhat maner thynge good hart suche heart negligent forgetfull careth earnestly god woorde thynge fyrst necessary deuyl may haue waye leste come steale awaye ye word secondarily necessary haue strong couragious heart feareful dastardly wyll moued terror dreade care men hatred fauor except loue god aboue thynges dread hym woorde longe endure v neuer suffered place worlde long without persecution dyuell abyde busy styrryng kyngdome hys suffereth seruauntes ydle proue feele papistes dayely thyrdely muste take diligent hede poynt also thornes trouble regard substance rychesse pleasure concupiscence flesh eies pompe pryde lyfe muche dothe woorde worldly trauayle bee estemed worde god christ saythe math fyrste seeke kyngdome god ryghteousnesse thereof heart becom studious strongfruicte pacience religious fear loue god pure apt purpose yeld fruict pacience long sufferance crosse tribulation affliction canot lacking al2 tim paul saith yt liue godly christ shal suffer persecution wherfore pacience necessary remedy christian men praier fyrst greatest incommoditie wee tangled combered wyth suche lettes reson natural inclinatio neglect despise worldly thing besides deuil letteth occasion passe deuiseth meanes possible take word v put place therof couetousnes pride wrath thinges like sort exaples shew ther shold many excellent person cogregation wer hyndred auarice ambition lechery regard god word wherfore expedient diligently marke vicious nature lyue carelesly part doo entreate god gift holy ghost promised suretie geue v luc father geueth yt holy ghost aske may remoue fro v suche stop stay wold cut sunder thornes snare may heare kepe worde god bring forth true fruicte faith christ faith may shew onely obedience god may become also child heires chiefest cause seede spread gospell preached throughoute worlde euen yelde suche fruictes euerlastyng lyfe nowe description true godlynesse hope good encreace therof doctrine let passe parable let seme meruaile vnto vsthe word euerye fruictfull god worde shoulde euery yelde fruict learne distinction christ maketh fower kynds hearer wherof one onely good thre ar fautie yet ought hynder let fourthe doyng theyr duetie maner god worde suche neither otherwise put forth men saluatio part men nothing preuaileth parable specifieth howebeit worde precher fault ragious furious papist thinke may boast v behalfe rose also many sectes offence settyng foorth doctrine made thing v wold saye example christ iohn apostle thynges tyme also full greuous offence trespass hystories record hearde iohn yet sayd math math marc luc diuell herode hym selfe greatly estemed hym delighted doctrine euangelistes testifie last caused hym mprisoned beheaded heard christ sonne god yet crucified hym saiest thou nowe iohn christe apostle false teacher suche incredible stubbornes malice verye fewe conuerted theyr woorde dare speake thynk lest openly betray selues antichristesthe word christ euery fruitfull think haue lauful cause therfore raile vpon doctrine cause oure doctrine right may maintayn set foorth shew tyme haue respect christes worde thus sayth sede worde verily fall wicked papistes heart saye worde christ speaketh euill corrupt saieth christ touchyng pure good ground encrease cometh therof fourth part saith commeth good groweth ripenesse therfore doubt worlde continueth wickednes without amendemet although worde doctrine pure true without faulte pleade cause sayde doctrine least proue oure aduersaries papist confesse whether wickednes worlde bee amended thereby taken awaye althoughe bothe pure doctrine preacher come vnto example christ besydes iohn apostle sheweth sufficiently matter brought suche case shall beleue embrace worde greater parte wyll alwaies euyll lewde vnfruictfull fewe conuerted brought beleue chanced sonne god meruaile chaunced iohn apostle v also time shal fault therfore layde doctrine doo well blame denie good sede fell vpon way stone thornes rather folow truth refrayn railyng backbityng worde sede sowen neuer euyll neither dooth owne pure nature bring forth fruicts good fruicts folow thereafter beware thou blame god wordthe cause ye worde fruictfull fault ground wherin good sede hurte corrupte made vnfruictfull wherefore sclander papistes mysreport doctrine assaulted many offence sectes let condemne selues rather wil receiue worde true heart fault word hearte mynd corrupt also stirred diuel forsake god worde christe sheweth parable good ground sowed good sede math yet without tare ye demand commeth passe diuel saith christ soweth night suffer thyngs shold cleane pure albeit vtterly roote vp altogither yet mingleth tare ye residue yt pure blame god worde though wer ye cause al sect wherfore let al take hede theselues doctrin propretie ye gospell neuer som shal therby restored brought ripe corne cotrarywyse greater part shal alwais remaine vnfruitfull wherfore cometh passe yt christ said last part ye gospell many called chosen wil make mynds agreable conformable gospel hearkeneth rather diuel let passe word wickednes please god wherfore fal comon vulgar sin offeces also christ saith thei strike madnes blindnes plague vnclenlines yt seing see hearing vnderstad know howe yt matter stadeth wherfore let euery beware fall neither let blaspheme ye gospel neuer cometh forth without offence falling fault ye word malicious diuelish hert fault ye sede yt way bringeth forth fruit amog stone thorn must fight agaist offece labor rather yt euery mai get sede praye god fascion forme frame heartes holye spirite prepare way heare worde may perce heartes bring foorth fruict pacience may obteyn saluation faith christe whiche holy ghost word god sacramentes worketh v thyng god graunt luckily come passe amen purification mary virgin first parte gospel luc ii tyme purification law moses come brought hym ierusalem present hym lord written lawe lord euery man chylde fyrst openeth matrix shalbe called holy lorde offer said law lord paire turtle doues two yong pigeon exposition historie gospell set foorth howe chylde iesus presented temple time mother lying euangelist maner lawe calleth whole tyme lyinge dayes purification terme vsed moses leui law nature wherfore gentile vsed god dyd constitute lawe amonge people peculiar purpose mother brought foorth man chylde shoulde xxxiii dayes come temple woman lxvi law hath pope made churchyng named woman haue layne chyld bed comandyng certain dayes returne churche purified halowed vncleannesse though certaine lawe vncleane therfore vnmete present holy ceremony haue companie congregation pope doth without right ceremoniall vncleannes natural ceremonie comanded certayne law whervnto none wer bound ye iewes neither ought yoked lawe specially commaunded lawe first begotten forsaid tyme expiredthe fyrst begott n male muste presented lorde presented dedicate vnto lorde written moyses law euery man child openeth matrix shalbe called holy lord men beastes also called lord lordes herof sprong prerogatiue interest eldest son first begotte wer preferred priesthode thing great numbre people exod nu wold haue growen infinite multitude al first begotten remain temple serue lord therfore god permitted parentes redeme child price lambe one yeres age paire turtle doues accordynge euery man habilitie sonne restored parent yet called chylde lord appereth mary substance great offred pair turtill doues whiche gyfte poorer sorte gyfte redemeth sonne meanes confesseth although true mother yet sonne sonne god also wel owne first begotten turke taketh first bornethe turke counterfeiteth god taketh parentes towardest son daughter causing brought vp vse cause yt hath store mightye warriours god dealt gentilly required fyrste borne hym selfe suche maner neuerthelesse gaue power redeme ende iewes knowe theyr god suche delyuered oute bondage aegypt destroyed one nyght fyrst borne egyptian therfore commanded fyrst begotten iewes exod memoriall thys wonderfull deliuerance shoulde presented offered temple thys lawe nowe also abrogate abolyshed neyther christian menne bounde law ceremony made peculiarly iewes christ example obedienceand thinges great thyng v learne except wherof haue entreated concerning circocision christ euen christ vnder law though right subiect bound therunto wherfore obedience christ shew foorth yet applying high degree applied doctrine furtherance rightuousnes god made rightous sight god nowe lette vnto v exaumple charitie good workes humble obedience chylde iesus hyghely praysed sette oure eies make v ashamed hys laboure longe trauaile stirre v doo halfe duetie muche crookednesse v doo commaunded done vnder peyne damnation euerlastynge punyshemente mary neuerthe lesse whyche virgin therfore bounde lawe moyses lawe suche woman broughte chylde common naturall course yet shee demandeth pryuiledge womenne hadde humbly obeyeth lawe dyd chylde iesvs whyche lorde lawe whome moyses compared yet submitteth hym selfe lowely hee obeyeth lawe seruant example suche proue vertues doynges lytle worthy prayse therfore described sermon sette v make v ashamed lordes sake whome haue thynges much necessary duetie byndeth v oure sake dothe seruaunt commaunded hym therefore hathe anye vnderstandynge lyke manne woulde deteste abhorre hym selfe hee seeth greate exaumple christ hys delyuerer whiche muche humbleth hym selfe sheweth suche obedience men coulde neuer haue inuented lyke yet wee withstandynge lytle regarde obey hym whyche hath power eyther caste v helle ell receaue v heauen wherfore christes obediece putteth confusion shame ought admonysh v great dishonestie yt may reason thus selues doo caytiues meane shall neuer come right wittes obey hym folowe example whiche became man sake whiche cried swadelynge bandes whiche accused hierusalem whiche obediente moyses seruant whome ounde hee lorde moyses scarcely woorthy bee seruaunt yet doth comanded bound charged vnder pein damnation first simple playne doctrine wherin example christ put remembrace dutie cosider great obediece may pricked shame concernyng lewd nature refuse obedient owne necessarye cause behofeof fyrste borne doctrine preferment first born yt god hath ordeined hym suche hygh degree called sonne god proper god great honor great priuiledge wherof iewes litle prowde disdained brother though comparison selues numbre pleased god many euident exaumples redy declare true wher none degendre kind first borne none dyd lesse behaue selues contentation parent myndes coulde knowe measure selues pryde thought selues onely holy god despised reste neither coulde tyme suche preeminence refrayne like statelynesse wee maye perceaue maners monkes could haue thing declare preferment honour say truly ar holye sonnes god priuiledge haue worde ordinance glorious wold seyng nowe take muche vppon stinkyng coules sakethe first begotte pride waxed worst lucifer cayne pride ruine ouerthrow first borne lucifer chief angel cain also first begotten therfore thought hymselfe happiest doth eue declare name gaue hym borne euen shold loke gaue hym name garnyshe hym diademe kynges robe though shold promised heroicall persone come euen lucifer made deuil cain made wicked princeismaell also small pride ismaell whiche could suffer brother isaac house persuaded hymself head suche pride part thoughe onely holye one lord residue estemed vnderlynges wherfore god coulde spare esau fyrst byrthes preeminence thought become chief god prouided otherwiseesau whe thought priuiledge birthright yt mighte without lette oppresse neglecte brother pleased god take hys ryghte frome hym put hym besyde blessyng euen dyd ismaell cayn profe matter example iewes passeth al otherthe iewes good right haue bene fyrst begottten kyngdom god churche gentile theyr yonger bretherne waxed stoute proude would plucke vnto thinges due birthrighte god cast trusted much selues despised wher ben mete cause gentil kynd obediet pride reiected god gentils receaued dauid god request preferred kyngdomdauid salomon yongest elder brother exclude prouocations pride chosyng dauid kingdom maner god sent samuel prophet anoint sonne iesse kyng saule first cam eldest whose pride appered cruelly rated brother tent though counted bondma lord answered vntil seuen son iesse passed pro phet fain aske whether sonne besides father though thought likelihode dauid answered litle sonne fedyng shepe iesse could thinke yt god wold auanced yongest sonne chief fortune state1 reg god accepted fyrst begotten pleased god saith samuel iudge outwarde shewe beholde hearte carnall prerogatiues ought applied prydebut shall say cause god greatly neglecteth first birthright whiche ordeined hym self aduanceth dauid kyngdom yongest amongest brother wheras yet god ordinance right kyngdome belonged fyrst borne ueryly hys entente purpose persuade priuileges bodily thinges regarded respected god neyther wyll vse priuileges giftes shold referred suche ende therby spryng pride statelynes contempte god would haue child sober lowly proude loftie therby take occasion disdainfull arrogant although thervnto aduanced god yet soone broughte downe agayne wherefore angel cain ismaell esau elia iewes waxed proude applyed theyr preeminence priuiledge geuen vnto knowledge god goodnes thereby fyrste priuate pleasure commoditie oppressyng reprobate cast god fauor notwithstadyng fyrst birthright outlawed god kyngdom kyngdome deuyll practise god described psalme psal lyke vnto lorde oure god hath dwellyng high yet humbleth hymselfe behold thynges heauen earth raiseth symple durst lifteth poore myre virgin mary songe hath put myghty seat hath exalted humble meke luc god maner wholly resysteth proude neyther doth hee enryche beautifie menne gyftes1 pet therby shoulde become extorcioners oppressours lest seme ouercome proude aduanceth nowe basest person high honor contrarywise throweth kyngs throne bryngeth hedlong extreme calamitie whereout neuer escape wherfore among iewes fyrst borne hadde great priuileges priesthode kyngdome due god ordinace proudly abused honor gen god dyd alwais ratifie lawe ruben also firste begotten cursed father iacob obteined birthright neither kyngdome priesthode abraham also men thynke youngest amonge brethre god bestowed hym due brother may ye learne many example first borne dyd part degenerate cause pride whiche thought first begotten wherfore priuiledge chiefe house god holy one peculiar good wherefore lette manne proude yf excelle gyfte god thou endewed wyth gyfte learnyng vse gyfte goddes glorye profyte thy neyghbour boast thy selfe muche thereof though thou receauedst passe holynesse beautie rychesse gyfte lette hym beware thys muche hee woulde death chalenge thyngs cast hym selfe god kyngdome commyttynge sacrilege god fyrst moste excellent auncient patriarkes hath declared howe greately offended pryde statelynesse part degendred iohn baptist continued accordyng fyrste birthright almost none el part suche intollerable arrogance obteyned chiefe commoditie thys renoume vntyll laste iewes theyr fall ruyne gaue vp ryghte v gentile nowe byrthryghte churche god consisteth ciuill corporal matter pope boasteththey beleue christ first gotten countyng himselfe chiefe bishoppe wheras scarsly dreame priuiledge churche baptisme worde god although bodelye corporall birth maketh greate diuersitie v yet baptisme equall borne churche whiche vndefiled virgin spirit hath pure worde god sacramets church pregnant great child alwaies bringeth forth christian first frutes proper good god one man god haue v acknowlege honour renoum baptisme borne sonnes god proper goodes nation shewed iudgements mercie grace whether turkes sarasens regard priuileges first begotten neither hear see thinges make v first borne god muche obtaine honour god grace christian like ought fault behaue selues thinges geuen cofort wicked shold pride destructio greatest renoum christ churche mother baptisme worde faith bringeth forth christian mebers church wherfore thing christia men haue respect birth condicion shal haue occasio proude whatsoeuer cometh grace god baptisme faith worde equallie belongyng christian men makyng man christian god mercie god priest kynges renoum neither turke sarasyn boast yet renoum graunted ambition corrupte seduce pope doth vsurpeth supremacie ouer christendome without commandement god instinkte ye deuil continual vnchangeable rule among christias taught parable hired laborer man dignitie worthines prefer hymselfe math one baptisme wher must nedes teacher pastours yet ministration office ephes haue power make child god baptisme worde fayth worde causeth v child god first borne god hateth pridewherfore well set foorth churche doctrine example firste borne olde testament pride shoulde teache v god suffer pride wolde safe daunger must nedes humble submitte hymselfe tale well tolde deafe man worlde abuseth folishe vaine thynges pride muche worlde wise folowe better councell godly wyll amen second sermon simeon temple pthe gospell luke ii aand beholde man ierus lem whose name simeon man iust godlye loked consolation israell holy ghost hym answere receyued holye ghoste concernynge childe iesu pertayneth vnto reuelations openynge child worlde especially make knowen amonge owne people fyrste reuelation made marye aungell second ioseph also aungell luc math luc thyrd elizabeth iohns mother wha receued mary great child child sprang wombe fourth zacharie iohns father although named person yet declareth euidetly christ come time messias borne wheras god midful holy couenaunt performeth reuelatios whiche fel christ byrth folowed whe christ newe borne luc firste angell vnto shepherdes watchinge flocke shepherd also kepte priuie math spred abrod sermon angell euery yt made reuelation starre vnto wise men luc last al two reuelations testimonie simon anna prophetesse bare record temple child comforth israell whiche shall helpe worlde againste synne death first let v accordyng description euangeliste consider matterthe reuelation simeo came holy ghost concernyng simeon saieth texte righteous man godly suche one feared god lokyng consolation israell hauing ful hope god would shortly fulfill promesse send christe sure token pefect hope faith reueled vnto shold see death sene christ anointed lord faith vaine opinio rashlye conceaued men commonlye imagine matter fall chaunce fortune holy ghost touched heart doubtles god worde considered prophecie genesis gene christ shold come time sceptre taken iuda foreiners likewise caste count duly numbred time touchyng weekes daniel prophecy co pared tymes semed plainlye time come wherin christe shold reueled motio minde wrought ye holy ghost peculier operation shold liue vnto time see christ lord anointed eye wherfore singuler procurement holie ghost marye ioseph came temple present childe lorde redeme hym offeringe simeon also commeth temple chaunce custome motion holy ghost put minde houre wherin might behold ye borne messias temple whome hitherto loked wherfore toke doubtful deliberation matter saw child went forthwith toke armes shewinge therwith maner ioye myrth accustomed shewen suche greate comfortable matter pronounceth suche hartie thankes geuinge vnto god teacheth truely estemeth gyfte certified also great matter appered especially priest custome simeon semed haue right wittes done litle estemed chyld beyng yonge parent poore nothing estimation simeon nothing moued poore shew neither regardeth iudgement behalfe boldly frelye affirmeth child whome god hath ordayned succour saluation iewes gentils also men man shoulde demaunde simeo howe knewe wher appered tyme hym notable thynge wher ben many time likelye person whiche magnificence might seme apte purpos might haue iuste cause haue done wherfore merueilous case causeth parent ioseph mary wonder see man simeon without externall signes perceaue inwarde light childe wherby acknowledgeth christe notwithstandynge hid poore shewe parent certifyed child angel neither could thigs appeare opened reueled simeon flesh bloud certain token church congregation god tyme certayne confirmed reuelations god chief ierusale high priest herod scribe leuites phariseis dyd muche regarde scripture promise touchyng messias mindes bent encrease power dignitie authoritie rich amonge litle number despised vnknowen faythfull mary ioseph zacharie elizabeth sheppeherds simeon anne prophetesse hope fired wordly thing promise touchinge christe looked fulfilled comforted themselues obtayned trusted wheras hye priest suche lyke sent awaye emptie lyke maner ye state church tyme alwayes people poore hungrye whiche hath god worde falsegarde doth regard without anye carethe state christes churche worlde poore miserable wheras pope adherentes meane time named holy churche knoweth nothing god christ worde regard esteme thing worlde boaste themselues christian men rich power common sorte congregation wherfore must beware part yt ye seduced hie priest execute ye administration yet ye true church pope ye bishop take vpo gouernance ye church yet ye church wold persecute word rather reueretly extoll contrary part mary ioseph simeo without al nobilite ye comon sort therfore vnknowe like know christe whome dwelleth ye holy ghost gouerneth yt may encrease ye knowledge christe saued part saied ye must beware ye stuble toke ye true church yt pope vsurpeth administration pope neither may gather herof yt erre deceaued yt must nedes god people appeareth false first history christ ye cotrary part ye litle flock therfore despised neither ye felowship god light taken awaye beare worlde abiect person maner god kyngdome earth eue neglected abhorred wise aduaunced set forth poore truely reueled put trust worldly ayde leane al power rich councels decree c let sufficient touchyng first part historie wherin simeon holye ghost acknowlegeth childe iesus annointed lord wil take vpon entreat sermon wherby signifieth great helpe thynges surely knoweth come child furthermore office greatest thing worketh worlde herby example may knowlege christe saued euagelist described simeon receaued answere holy gost sholde die seen annointed lord promesse nowe fulfylled temple beheld eye child iesus toke hym armes pronounced wordes ioyfull spirite saying lorde lettest thou thy seruaunte depart peace accordyng thy worde wil gladly without refusing yelde selfe naturedeath maketh harte feare flesh blood hath kynde speache knowe well howe goeth time muste departe worlde sorow without hope conturbation trouble anguishe minde death desperation lamentable cry c neither naturall man otherwise see exaple brute beastes wheras naturall death men called death syn rom death enioyned v syn feare despaire commeth synne fele experience wherfore mannes death muche greu ous thynges law destinie appointed die must abyde wrath iudgement god ioyned death neuer hath ende thynges accompanied death wold terrible thing die litle grefe commeth departyng thinges delectable dere vnto v wheras must therwith leaue wife child frends suche lyke yet passeth al greife fele sinnes dreade god iudgemet opprest death without wayes escape wherfore worlde singe songe simeon death commeth beginneth rather synge morneful verse lord giltie codemned sinnes wherfore suffered departe peace minde trembleth shaketh see helpe offered knowe thinges must depart tel thynges shall haue hereafter excepte sure goddes wrath damnation suche man minde towards death neither fynde nature reason anye helpe remedie suche feare therfore must nedes cosideratio death fall despeire wherfore lesson doctrinesimeon learned way dye man put forth v example simeon man witte drew death without tremblynge despeired saued maner knewe olde olde men haue longe continuance life feleth strength decay perceaued necessary course nature also owne perill time nigh wherin frame sholde disolued yet dismayed therby euen desireth wisheth resolution therof especially old men wold wish neuer come appeareth marueilous helpe syth went death suche strength mynde ioyfull courage ben could neuer haue ben glad beholdynge death thynge shall say wherwith armed shall saye man without sin therfore feared god wrath maner obtaining saluation light vttereth plainlye felt himselfe synner man danger god ire wrath syth goeth men synners peace old man boasteth wordes shewe euidently sence felyng peace cold hindred neither man fraile estate neither contagion syn thinge ought well marked man sinner also may surely truste herby may comme passe synners maye obtayne peaceable quiete myndes agaynst death see simeon indued greate vncredible confidence truste hard shold see death perceaueth vnperformed couenant yet thought good vse anye vnluckie wordes saye must die seinge hath obtayned gotten hym lorde lyfe peace wherfore expoundeth death licence departyng peace souldiers battaill licensed retourne home vnto frendes acquaintance nowe let v learne hym kynd wonderful exposition gentle free instructer sheweth louingly ful reason meanyng opinion iudgement without askyng wheras sayeth min eye hath sene thy saluation speaketh childe iesu namynge saluation sauynge health sauiour therfore whether alludeth name childe whiche knew learned mother whether knew yet properlye toucheth thynge meant name consenteth point angell math whiche brought diuine name heauen causynge hym named iesus shoulde saue people synnes simeon calleth saluatio lord whome lorde himselfe ordained sauiour touching name haue spoken childe iesu wheras god hath ordayned maiestrate parets necessary office sauiours corporall temporall affaire phisitions sycknes lawyer expoundynge euery man right yf chylde come kynd saluation simeon could neuer haue suche great confidence matter expound death licence depart salfe conducte go peace could neuer haue regarded synne death lyghtlye wherfore sith simeon confesseth shall depart peace life bycause hath sene saluation god defineth plainly sauiour againste sinne death colde el haue suche sure confidence peace sauiour man description lightlye regarded coprehendeth great wayghtie matter fewe wordes one child simeon nameth wherfore herby euidently proued whatsoeuer beside childe seme neuer commendable name outwarde shewe therof yet haue power bring saluation put awaye death synne whosoeuer suffereth applied vnto hym saluation worketh owne damnation wher simeon worde mindeth abolishe derogat ritesthe law good workes ca nothing sin death ceremony obseruations lawe man shold put hope saluation whosoeuer trusteth lawe workes shall neuer obtayne saued wheras notable praise calleth child saluation god easye gather therby ayde remedie againste death remaineth onely hym wherof commeth hope iewes put suche trust law workes meaneth pope adherent highly extoll mass pilgrimage pardon though saluation came syth name child neyther may geuen communicat thyng creature besydes worlde ordaineth sauiours besyde christthe wordes simeon may taken argument wicked persuasion opinion mine eye saith hath sene thy saluation say euen thou almightie father hast ordayned hym saluation synners worlde must nedes finde saluations againste sinne iewe thinketh saluation obserue law monke religious man thinketh saluation bynde himselfe certaine kynd life vowe chose certaine sainctes patrones defender synne hell thinke purchasyng saluation cosisteth maner lyuing number workes procede me tradition idolatrous seruice popedome wherin consisted chiefe hope saluation yf well considered verse simeon shoulde haue perceaued ought haue ben auoyded haynous sacrilege robbing god dewe honour wold haue ordained sauiours tha determined saying simeon wolde haue suffered hym onlye haue glory god appointed whome man trusteth disapointed ende came child purpose sent god euen bring saluation vnto v wherfore saluation whiche god hath prepared suche store sauing helththe saluation god canonly saue conscience may therby haue perfect quiet neuer dreade crueltie death violence synne ragyng tyrannie deuill muche hath sauing health god prepared redie almightie euerlasting saluation whiche lacketh kynde succoure helpe saue v againste synne death geue v abondance lyfe rightuousnes let v simeo embrace child stycke vnto hym true faith maye conceyue sure comfort hym surely printed heart child prepared saluation ordained helpe v againste synne death doth ensue therof suche peace coscience syn death skeareth v vaine sauiour redye helpe v sauiour saiethand entreat large saluation commeth child let v take record iohn baptist discribynge hym thus behold lambe god taketh awaye synnes worlde wordes described sacrifice vpon crosse syn iohn conqueringe death resurrection iustifie v make v rightuous wherfore obtainment saluation death resurrection geueth v helpe sin death albeit christian man must omitte good workes yet saluation obtained therby neither remission syn obedience due vnto god god requireth performe deliuered sinnesgood work disobedience true way obtayne euen seeketh howe deliuered syn death sholde whollie flee saluation prepared v god might take synnes vpon hym make satisfaction deliuer v doth may say simeon whatsoeuer feare dreade death peril set v sure comfort againste thou lorde lettest thy seruaunt departe peace trusteth anye thynge shall steade peace fynde anguishe extreme miserie suche tyme shall haue sauynge health death damnation shall perishe neither muste make anye suche difference betwene v simeon thoughe myght boldlye truste saluation power take childe armes beholde hym haue suche power touchynge effecte matter bodely presence auaylable hath great importancesimon hath prefermet saluation haue many iewes doubtlesse dyd time beholde christ yet obtayned saluation therbie effectuouse simeon furthered hym saluation thorowe inspiration holy ghoste embraced childe whiche nothynge differed child reason sence onlye sauiour whiche promised father abraham dauid christian men equal simeon christe offered worde gospell saluation simeon coulde wayes knowe saluation worde wheras behelde hym wyth eye gyfte god proper hym v yet obtayned saluation therby geuen vnto hym saued beleued worde touchynge child able saue thee simeon cause simeon rehearseth verse folowynge whome saluation belongeth least shoulde seme pertayne vnto fewe sayinge whiche thou haste prepared face people christ saluation menthis child saluatio death syn maketh simeo departe peace moued consideration sauinge health open vnto al geuyng euident commendation purpose god hath prepared saluatio saluation saith ordained sake many belong vnto felowshipe fruition sauing healthsimeon putteth difference betwene iewe gentile god hath prepared saluation face people child sauiour neither mother sauiour saluation men simeon sayinge large great pronounceth sauiour nation well iewes notwithstandyng great difference betwene reason moses lawe diuine ceremony cosidereth child make difference haue like nede saluation deliuered therby death sinne obseruynge lawe nothing preuayleth deliueringe synne death sauiour saluation prepared gene sauiour suche one came god hath prepared sayth saluation face certayne face people whiche sentence one promesse made vnto abraham promiseth blessynge kyndredes sede neither iewes excluded fro tribe neither people blessed blessed liued god curse wherfore meaning otherwise taken saluation people none saued whiche lacketh saluation one thinge simeon maketh men equall pronouncyng well iewes gentile suche shold damned synnes excepte obteyned saluation sauyng healthe second thynge well consider pythe wordeswhat reason thynketh conceaue delectation comfort cause spryng misery conscience denye hyde cloke synne synne muste nedes abyde god wrothe peinfullest styng death fear iudgement god denie sinner must abyde punyshment perceuerance felyng dreade hope pardon grace thoughtes well considered heynous count god cruell vnmercyfull iudge remyt part rigour lawe execute extremitie thus conceaue opinion god thus ouerladen heuynes burthen opprest rodde taskemaister beaten shoulder wande esai accordyng saying prophete simeon doubtles hauyng respecte sayenge description prophete touchynge chylde describeth god maner man conscience wont conceaue thynke hym wyl god punysh sinner extremitie without grace fauour vayne thynge truste mercye shewed sauiour nowe woordes simeon playne god hathe prepared saluation face people wherein men may bee saued wherefore hereby maye bee euidentlye perceaued god accordyng paule tim euen god would haue men saued onely bodily saluation1 timo euerlastyng saluation prepared agaynst synne death ende saluation ordeyned god hath prepared people therefore woulde dreade godthe cause saued woulde tremble iudgemente seynge declareth openly wyll shoulde saued seyng hath prouided thynges necessary saluation wher many peryshe damned obteynynge thys saluation god fault therof stubbornes mannote well whiche despiseth god wyll careth saluation god whiche ordeyned god saue men remedy prouided succoure reliefe beggers nedye folke yet woulde vse benefyte remedy prouided faulte prouided sustetation haue receaued like maner goeth men world saying simeon true god hath prepared saluation face al people yf iewes iudge selues vnworthy receaue yf pope turke despise thou canste fynde thy heart accept cometh passe thou damned ye blame none youre selues refused saluation grace god saluation seemeth agreable thy reason thou mayst searche thy self may hadthere saluation christ alone thou shalt fynde saluations worlde succour agaynst synne deathe yf thou let passe saluation wherefore thou carest earnestly thy saluation imbrace chyld know suretie god mercyfull vnto thee pardoneth thyne offence chyldes sake shalte thou well perceaue thou art saued saluation agaynst synne deathe way saluation pleaseth thee accuse thyne stubbornesse whiche causeth thee thou canste escape god wrathe damnation god faute god hath prepared saluation sure tokengod author mannes damnation would haue mercy synners delyuer v destruction hath prepared onely also proffered people myght remembre theyr saluation consysteth therein onely marie paule simeon peter people ought trust hym soeuer hath nede helpe agaynst synne death herein may haue sure hope thereof thus hath god mercyfull father prepared ordeyned wherefore hynder thy selfe stubborne refusynge hym shalte thou make thy selfe voyde comforte healpe whiche god hathe onely promysed also performed faythfully symeon testifieth least small credence shold geuen wordes shortenesse thereof addeth thervnto euident exposition wyl god touchyng saluation sayinge bee lyght lyghten gentile bee glorie thy people israell nowe hee vttereth matter playnelye might vnderstande people god haue receiued fyrst therfore saith thou knowest whiche people bee gentile iewes let man come mystake wordes thou maist know whose saluation myseries euyls must vse consider gentile drowned ignorance darknesse syth without goddes worde haue certayne knowledge godchrist giueth lyght gentile put difference betwene god deuyll feare deuyll well god destruction yea haue hope deuyl god taught example ignorance procede synnes idolatrie blasphemye many vice suche gentile god prepareth saluation gentile wer deliuered darknes shold find saluation euer doo wherefore sauing helth helpeth ignorance darknesse geuynge gentile lighte knowlege god word saluation thinges geuen gentile idolater filthy synners christ appointment wil god may louing liberall bounteousnes god father estemed flee hym feare wrathe crueltie christ saith god loued world yt gaue begotten sonne many beleue hym shoulde perishe haue lyfe euerlastynge wherefore doone greater dishonour god iohn thynke hateth v synnes shall peryshe synnes yet thought causeth gret trouble heartsa syngular comfort al synners lyght god mercy scarsly kindled therin combred euyll would suche fearful desperate heartes whiche dare scarcely aduersitie trouble looke vnto god word put trust therin hereby euident simeon bestowed great study readyng prophetsthe diligent study simeon prophetes conceaueth thing himselfe marked tyme prophecie iacob daniell knew promise made abraha saluation appoynted people kynredes earth hereby shold saued malediction curse gen dan esa defended syn death learned also prophet esai chylde shoulde lyghte gentile thus sayth lorde prophet esai small matter saieth vnto christe thou shouldest seruant stirre vp tribe iacob turne remnant israel haue geue thee lyght gentile thou myghtest saluation vttermost partes earth lyke simeon exercised hymselfe well vnderstandyng sentence forasmuch applieth fitly short sermon wherfore ye gentile haue great gyft chylde lyght open vnto ioyfull tydynges set vp kyngdome saluation cause prepared brought foorth god iewes behalfe preferred gentile rom god comitted vnto lawe prophet named people wherefore iewes haue greate prerogatiue preeminence gentile christ therfore necessary iewes haue therfore nede saluation sayd saluation belongeth howbeit lyke state condition healed saluation iewes suche synners gentile paule putteth difference epistle galathians yet forasmuche iustified workes theyr lawe galat haue glorie god wherfore christ become glorie although god hath greatly glorified people cofirming seruice word geuyng many excellente thynges priesthode kyngdome c yet could neuer obteyne purenesse hearte thereby whereby myghte bee delyuered frome synne deathe thys dyshonoure suche presence almyghty god coulde neuer obtayne trewe gloryous herytage god thereby wherefore symeon sayth furthermore iewes glorye foolyshe vnwise synners gentile yet greatte dishonoure theym haue lawe yet iustified lawe saluatio prepared also myght bee iustified faythe iesus christe obtayne glorye coulde obteyne woorkes lawe soo myght heyres god kyngdome saluation christes sake thys veryly playne euidente sermon christe shewynge sorte saluation shall geuen shoulde saued hym onely sauiour shoulde wyth ioyefull hearte constaunte mynde ouercomme assaulte deathe suche myseryes belongynge therevnto thorough hym thys meanynge shoulde hystorye thys feast bee handled especially simeon exaumple layde v sheweth waye teacher beholde pope hys stage wyth hys hallowed candels thyshalowyng candels praye necessarye geare haue leaste christian man depart without blessyng holy candell thus hathe dyuell papistes mocked goddes churche congregation shoulde haue extolled thys lyghte glorye gentile euen thys chylde iesvs haue steade thereof ordeyned thys triflyng custome halowynge candels congregation beynge kepte occupyed thereby myghte regarde thys trewe necessarye lyghte looke saluation ordeyned thys chylde god haue taughte bee hallowed candell haue ordeyned also pompe wherein euery man must beare burnyng candell meanes ye papist passe ouer daye wyth shewes triflyng game yet cloke al theyr doyng wyth holye pretence goddes seruyce wyllynge shoulde bee taken memoryall commynge ioseph marie wyth chyld churche make dyuers exposition also candelles shoulde sygnyfye man shold demaunde themthe papist borowe parte religion iewes gentile doo thynges doubte answere maner gentile calendes februarie cary fier brandes city townes pope sergius ordeined turned gentile ceremonie christian ceremonie ye maye see welle doo learne gentile howe honor god ordeyne christianitie therby part seruice grounded suche foundation either folow lyke ape law moses el go correcte abhominations gentile ordeyne lawe churche greater abhominations euen well rewarded foolyshnes would heare simeon preachyng saluation lyght synners glorie righteous conuenient v haue respecte lyghte geue god thankes always myndfull doctrine simeon touchyng chyld god heauenly father blesse gyft lyghte graunt v saluation therby amen sonday called quinquagesima p gospell luke xviii iesus tooke vnto hym twelue sayde vnto behold go vp ierusalem al shalbe fulfylled written prophetes sonne man shalbe deliuered vnto getiles shalbe mocked despitefully intreated spitted haue scourged hym wyll put hym death thirde day shall ryse agayne vnderstode none thinges saying hyd perceyued thynges whyche spoken cam passe come nigh hierico certayne blynd man sate high way syde beggyng heard people passe asked meant sayd vnto hym iesus nazareth passed cried saying iesu thou sonne dauid haue mercy went rebuked hym shoulde holde peace cried muche thou sonne dauid haue mercy iesus stode styll commaunded hym brought vnto hym come nere asked sayeng wylt thou doo vnto thee sayd lord myght receyue syght iesus sayd vnto hym receiue thy syght thy faith hath saued thee immediatly receyued sight folowed hym praisynge god people sawe gaue prayse vnto god exposition two partes gospell first prophecy wherin christ sheweth disciple passion come wordes whiche repeted angel woman christes sepulchre wheras said remebre said vnto galilee luc sonne man must deliuered handes synners crucified ryse agayne thirde day iourney christe galile ierusalem crucified second part miracle restoryng syght blynde disciple christ vnderstande christthyrdely euangeliste saythe disciple vnderstoode prophecie christe suspected allegorie oughte bee taken otherwise thenne spoken coulde meanes beleue wordes bee trewe hee spake gathered myracles whiche christe wrought raised vp deade gaue sight blynd god surely kyngdome semed hereby become shold lordes duke earles kyngdom vnder hym daunger ye world case would put downe suche mighty man coulde worde take awaye death euyll neyther could thynke fellowshyppe vnitie coniunction betwene god hym therfore hee coulde forsaken god euyll shoulde haue vpper hande hym man ignorant greate secretes god coulde iudge otherwise mean time herby signified nature al good worksthe workes god vnderstanded thei passe shewed come passe passe man capacitie ar fulfilled ar perceiued appeare open sences thus dothe iohn oftentymes reherse disciple christe perceaued afterwarde christ spoken vnto wherefore faythe necessitie required worde god god speaketh dothe manerfaythe requisite suche wyse hys wordes suche thynges farre oute capacitie naturall reason longe faythe requisite vntylle thynge bee fulfylled whyche spoken example word god teacheth v resurrection fleshe reason vnderstandeth take reason guide wise world doo mocke scorne christen men consente article soone life likewise seme nothyng agreable reason god shoulde become man bee borne virgine marye thynges receaued faith vntill lyfe comme shall felte perceyued dede semeth great foly reason water baptisme god grace fauour shoulde obteined without desert merit remission synne geuen absolution preachynge gospel counteth christen men folyshe poynt thynkest thou sayth reason shalbe done small tris e thou must rather thynges comendable god peyn greate trauayle muste bee taken doynge theym nede goe farre proue pope doctrine tendeth wholly ende make menne obtayne remission synnes workes semeth fable reason men made acceptable god meete god kyngdom baptisme word self despysed thing professoures therof weake synners shold reason therfore thynke madnes commyt lyfe rich thyngs el worde may thank reason notwithstanding great knowledge light word yet beleue multitude hateth doctrine pernicious erronious thyng though sette men libertie kynde mischief lyue without regard honestie godlynes neyther reason iudge otherwise therefore doctrine faith set foorth christian thyngs set foorth worde agreable naturall capacitie yet count worthy beleued god worde whiche wyll tyme come bryng passe shall haue perfect vnderstanding passeth capacitie example dauid scripture full example dauid fought goliath beleued shold ouerthrowe kyll huge myghtye gyaunt declared saule lorde saith delyuered hand lyon hand beare shal delyuer ye hand philistine1 reg lykewise sayeth agayne vncircumcised philistine shall one reuile hoste lyuyng god agayne saythe philistine lorde shall geue thee hande shall strike thee cutte thy head wordes bee spoken mouth dauid yf dauids wordes onely wordes god neuer haue taken effect god dauid beleued came passe wherfore afterward toke effect maketh matter thoughte foolyshe enterprise therefore coulde beleue come passe dyd afterward semed impossible dauid beyng yonge man shoulde suche little stone ouerthrowe suche greate gyant dauid beleueth dothe dede matter appered certayne fayned came fyrste spake worde reason iudged vayne foolyshe enterprise maner dyd reason counte dauid yong shepheard without knowledge feat warre nowe gothe forthe vnarmed staffe slyng though would fyght dogge gyant harneissed commeth shielde speare wherfore crieth oute sayth thou foolyshe boy takest thou vpon thee none hoste durste take dauid hym selfe sawe reason beleued euen god woulde reuenge blasphemie saue hym came passe short maner good wordes workes donebaptisme resurrection dead seme impossible yet take effect ar come passe seme easy reason done belonge reason faith washed sin baptisme shall rise agayne death last day reason shal neuer vnderstand especially sith saintes godly men haue diuers chance wherof cast pray vnto wyld beastes foules ayre burnt ash cast flood crueltie vsed pope agaynste holye manne iohn husse constantia reason thynketh howe god recouer body agayne nothynge woorketh god worde wherefore man oughte count impossible although seme syght bee nothyng vnpossible beleue al effect ende matter lyeth god power whych almightie maketh thynges nothyng hundred yeare agone chylde borne thirtie fortie yeares vsgod almyghty doo wyll wherfore sythe god maner make thyng nothynge muche make agayne somewhat wherefore godly must consyder whether thyng possible whether god hath sayd shalbe done neuer vnpossible syght althoughe appere math luc yet god hym self maketh thinges impossible possible nothing thynges wherfore calle god worde tryall reasonreson ought iudge god work woorthy bee abhorred god able rayse deade power wherefore lette euery man esteeme greate wyckednesse trye ponder goddes power worde reason carnall iudgement yf thynges myghte bee vnderstande comprehended oure reason god neded shewe foorthe hys worde muche geueth word token bee thynges whiche reason conceaue comprehend learne experience word god aboue agaynste reason shewe thee remission synnes absolue thee commaundemente christ math iohn thou hearest woorde thou hast hearde receaued absolution yet thou doest perceaue howe great familiaritie thou haste thereby god angelles thou knowest nothynge great ioye whereof christe speaketh howe greately angelles heauen reioycethe vppon one synner luc doothe repente whenne thou arte nowe baptysed appearethe thy fleshe fourme pray thee absolution baptisme therefore strength thynke hyghly esteme belongyng administration goddes kyngedome commaunded word wherefore muste faythe surely beleue wordes sake thynge thou shoulde neuer perceaue trewe thy sence reason faith touchynge great beneuolence god towarde hym selfe surely perswaded beleuynge father taketh hym sonne christ brother angelles greately reioyce prosperous estate please pope beleue v god shewed haue respecte vnto theym esteeme hys woorde thynke woorthye bee beleued euangeliste poynteth example suche faithe blynde hee perceyued reasone noo lykelynesse matter susteyneth vncurable euyll soone woorde christ soundeth eares looketh vp beleueth luc thyng came passe worde selfe pronounced effect appered eye blynde yet open forthwith word beleued folowed effecte vnderstandyng matter easye blynde lyke maner goeth wyth disciple place christ reherseth vnto hystorie thinges done hierusalem vnderstode toke truth suspected anye vayne talke christe thought woorde haue ben taken otherwise word god deceueth although seme impossible fyrst part gospel euen beleue christes wordes boldely withoute wauerynge pope ignoraunt faythe must knowe christian fayth heare woorde god wherein promysed remission synne meanes doubt beleue constantly assent promyse although neither reason sence vnderstandeth perceaueth thynge matter fayth hearte alwayes requisite god worde faith whersoeuer bee fyrste sure afterwarde take effecte obey worde shall say happie went frome faith maner pope turkes iewes shall curse selues stubborne agaynst woorde god shall perceiue pride foly owne reason shall late hope saluation paste therfore doctrine yt go fro god word reason offended although seme without reason contrary iudgement vain vnpossible let v sticke sure inuincible argument god haue said itnote thyng certayn demand whether possible whether god hath spoken god hath spoken mighty true promise may counted done soone spoken wherfore word god forthwith bee beleued hee beleueth blasphemer god first comandement requireth suche faithe god word god meanes myght religiously deuoutly glorified v beleue constatly ther nothing speaketh commeth passe worde doth god speake vnto v euery lord supper baptisme absolution gospel absolueth v receaue bodie bloud sonne must beleue constantly thynke true wtout doubtfulnes firste part gospell second part euangeliste example blind teacheth v crafte beggehowe must praye euen shold lay syde al shame vnprofitable beggers neuer cease crauyng earnest shamfast colde weak hearted sone dashed countenaunce vnapte oratour spoke must ashamed god requireth make sute vnto hym bold importunat taketh delight haue glory knowen may geue bounteously may vnderstande moste acceptable vnto men loke hade yt looketh timewe must instant prayer wherin maye worthy receaue god gyftes shall neuer mete pray wherfore ther better way lay syde al shame boldly confidence open oure griefes trouble god beggers behalfe haue nede precepte owne accord troublesome vnto men god counteth trouble paine men taketh rather renoum stirred vnshamfast beggers exercise great liberalitie haue exaple importunitie vnshamfastnes blind man sute obtaine sight wherfore whe seeth ye multitude passe first asketh meant assone heard iesus neuer spareth criyng iesu dauid haue mercy vpon yt went rebuked put silence crieth rebuke wareth earnest prayig blind set forth importunat vnshamfast suter wherwith god greatly delighted wherfore ought take exaple bolden v come vnto christ pray hi lord sinner graunt yt thy kyngdom may come vnto forgeue dettes helpe place praieth earnestly sorte doth wel god accepteth thakefully tedious god vnto men troublesome v called muche vpothe praier blynd god couteth glorious thing whe trust liberalitie goodnes suche prayer greate force impel god heare v maner necessitie entreat lord thy glory belogeth ye honor thy name aske thee wherfore cosider vnworthy muche nede haue thy helpe prayer vnto thee thy glory also necessitie maner crauing almost impudent prayer acceptable god appeareth blind man assone begynneth prayer christ commandeth brought vnto commanded make rome nether blind afrayd goeth boldly vnto christe asketh wilt thou vnto thee herby declared great redines ye blind put choice benefite wold aske christ nether doth ye blind take loge deliberatio maister sayeth may see ye light christ answereth looke vp therfore christ hath greater wil heare ye blid aske boldnes vsed al men prayer pope reigned teaching magnifying prayer euer put trust men prayer rusticall shamfastnes ought farre christian whensoeuer perill danger riseth must prolonge doubte muste go solitarie place shewe forth destresse necessitie aske helpe god forsaid coditio yt although vnworthie yet yt haue nede god succoure yt behoueth god see owne glorie must iudge agreable office christias regard lawe ceremonie shafastnes prayer god see saluatio profit iohn promesse euidet whatsoeuer ye aske ye name iesus shalbe done vnto sticke costatly offeded wt importune beggyng crauing possible yt feruet earnest prayer shall hade obtaine wher contrary wise cold weake prayer longe preuaile feruent prayer impelle enforce god geue spedie helpe cause trust coming christ farre hece yt spedily approche putteth forth exaple ye wydow yt called often yt iudge last ye iudge feared neither god maprayer prouoked god ouercom sayd least wydow shold alwaies troublesom vnto wil reuege quarell wil trouble hereafter shold god sayeth christ reuenge electe luc crie vnto day night yea though differre say vnto soone take vengeace though shold say prayer cry maketh god prolog differce ye matter el wold padueture fruite prayer euen obtayne quickly shold otherwise comme slowlye yea rather ther obtaine wher without prayer nothinge shold haue ben gotten wherfore example lightlie regardede admonisheth v great matter pray god ashamed put foorth request boldly sorte synner graunt yet therfore count selfe desperat case certaine thinges moue prike conscience count nedie thinke also thou art redie geue whatsoeuer shal necessarie either bodie soule therfore whe thou hast prayed ben instante god answere thee dyd blynd man wilt thou thee loke vp thy faith hath saued thee praye beleueprayer faith mockyng god mocke god faith stayeth onely point god mercifull v christe sonne sake therfore heareth defendeth v reuengeth deliuereth v whiche thing iesu christ sauiour graunte v amen fyrst sonday lent gospell math iiii iesus ledde awaye spirite wyldernesse tempted deuyll fasted xl dayes fortye nightes last hungred tempter came said thou sonne god commaunde stone made bread answered sayde wrytten man shall lyue bread euery worde proceadeth mouth god deuill taketh vp holy citie setteth hym pinacle temple sayeth vnto yf thou sonne god cast thy selfe downe headlong written shall geue angelles charge ouer thee theyr handes shal holde thee vp least tyme thou dashe thy foote stone iesus sayde vnto hym written thou shalt tempte lorde thy god againe deuill taketh hym vp exceading hygh mountayne shewed hym kyngdomes worlde glory sayeth vnto hym wyll geue thee thou wylt fall downe worship sayeth iesus vnto hym auoyde sathan written thou shalte worship lord thy god shalt thou serue deuyll leaueth hym beholde angelles came ministred vnto hym exposition gospell ye heare three temptation christ whiche chanced vnto hym forthwith baptisme fasted fortye dayes nightes desert description luke sheweth luc temptation cotinued day day space fortye dayes fortye nightes eche wrasteled certaine dayes peraduenture order mathew describeth gospell large matter applied bodye whole church whiche alwayes tempted hunger persecution heresy last also kyngdom worlde christ meanyng meette entreated scholes congregation comon people wherfore coueniet first learne euery christiantemtatio christian assone baptised ought knowledge ordained fyght continuallye deuill looke state longe liueth enemie eger fearce come purpose temptatiosdiuersitie temptation plucke fro christian kyngdome god endeuoreth meanes possible consume wast awaye persecucio dispatche whollie worldehowe must stad sure tempted purpose christ peril belongeth christian deadlye hatred ye ennemie canne meanes pacified laboreth hand foote make men fall christ baptisme vnto desperation presumptio famine persecution heresy false interpretation scripture preuaileth nothing falleth vpon v wt death sleeth v wherfore exaple christ knowen learned yt may armed enemy may preuaile v teptatio shal obtaine faith trust god worde yt hath two weapos vseth well salfe fro deuil ought cause christian gladly heare worde god diligetly learne put practise meane time slacke nothing prayer desyre spedie cominge kyngdome may lead temptation deliuered euil fatherlye goodnes euangelist beginneth historiechrist lead spirit yt christ ledde desert ye spirit holy ghost sith superiour lord commande obedient comandement holy ghost wherby called desert euangelist speaketh without singuler meaninge euen willinge therby men beware owne inuentions imagination christe came desert owne councell wrastle deuil manie doth institute diuers thinges without spirit word wheras forbidde must take thinge vpon hymnote well go forth pilgrime place serue god except know suretie god hath commanded eyther worde men whiche hath power god shew v god byddeth v doe take thynge vpon withoute vocation monkes nonnes went cloister seruice god offende also greuouslye contrarye obedience owe god wherfore example christ verye worthie remembraunceour proper imagination without worde nothyng wheras came desert owne mot commanded holye ghoste folowynge christe shoulde institute nothinge owne witte oure doinges maye boaste take nothynge hand entent obey god commandement nowe doctrine muche vsed v first thinges take hande haue respect god commandement nothynge contrarie therto touchynge common workes charitie loue nede new commandement commanded ten comandements ther doth god commande heare worde loue god call vpon obey parent kyll abstaine fornication ordinance god god commandementes wherfore ought inquire commandementes holy ghost put v forth speciall commandements mariage suche lyke commandement geuen alredie wheras monkes folowe traditios kepe cloister faste xl dayes abstaine certaine godly hymnes gloria excelsis alleluya let haue commandement god worde maintaine doinge ground faith without synne wherfore doinges abhomination god rom math god seruice nowe let v consider temptation order fyrst deuill saieth christ perceauing hym hungryethe first teptation shoulde haue trust god thou son god speake stone may comme bread temptation sight semeth sore thinke haue ben preiudiciall christ tourned stone bread sith afterward wrought greater miracle yet temptation sake withstandeth deuyll perceaueth ende deuill tended deuils wil much prouoke christ worke miracle purpose appeareth wordes christ take christe trust goodnes mercie god make hym beleue god forgotten hym cared hym set litle hym wolde muche prouide litle bread hym wherfore christ answereth saying deuil matter thou woldest make beleue man lyueth bread euery worde procedeth mouth god man may gather touching purpose deuill wold christ shold thinke nothinge bread shold beleue nothing cam god bread temptation endureth yet time wher deuill byddeth v reason wise thou sonne god god angrye thee therfore seeke thyn aduantage applie thy selfe wholly thy gaines exercise crafte get substance perill doinge thou canst synne thou art sonne god would denie food clothing howe shold dutie god father wold haue mercie goodnes knowen reason men enticed wickednes wel countrye city townes geue selues ouer couetousnes thynke god despleased therwith expedient thynke get lyuing house child must prouided deuill saying thou art sonne god daseleth eye see synne though shold say thou canst offend syn ther many example herof worlde man thinketh offence regard lightly worde god set al theyr care get bread lyuelode wherfore temptation alwayes worlde wherin deuil defaceth worde driueth men power set substance worldly welth worde must consider temptation maye ouercomme must example christe diligentlie marke crafte deuill whiche goeth make despised contrarie wise mynd stablished maye feare hunger lacke liuing come danger losyng god worde one must nedes put
