danger yet better bodye perish preserued meate soule perish cast hell herby saluation confirmed yet without great conflict perill deuill withstandeth force power employing diligence make v haue regarde corporall life esteme worde god necessary profitable hideth also cloketh vngodlines guile sonnes god father wolde haue v vnprouided bread liuelood christ admonisheth v example beware serpent lyeth hyd grasse temptation deuill temptation taken iudged christ appointethtwo sortes bread man helth saluation preserued two sortes bread firste worde god sent downe heauen second corporall bread whiche commeth earth wherby maintain present lyfe first whiche better lackyng vnto v whe suffer taken fro v second whiche corporall witholden v stone shoulde turned bread truste god worde sholde destitute bread regarde heauenlye bread hauinge onlye respecte corporall bread haue desyre nowe muste die cleane destitute treasure good yet spend selues according psalme psalm shall leaue vnto rich lyfe lyue muste ware preposterous maner wherfore muste take diligent hede vnto temptation deuill casteth among v persecution penurie famine misery play man suffer boldlie hunger christ thou perceauest thou artmoued spirit therto euen applie thy vocation laste thou shalte fele angel come serue thee fulfill thy desyre euangelist maketh mention christ belongeth first temptation iohn esteme worde highlye suche bread meat eateth beleueth ye word hath euerlasting life thing must prited depely ye heart pithie matter present bread whiche men diligently busely trauaile endureth ye ende life yt shal folow euerlastinge famine wt eternal distructio secod teptatio isthe second temptation make trust god worde requireth ye deuil taketh iesus holy citie putteth vpo pinacle temple comandeth cast himselfe downe without peril hurte ye sone god promisyng yt angel shold come serue hym rather shold stuble wt foote stone hard gostly spiritual temptation wherin endureth bring hym fro grace faith fauour god euen studied syn desperation wrath god trouble hym deuil able make v despayre fall hope saluation goeth way worke proueth right hand preuayleth lefte make ful false trust presume muche god fauour temptation brynge hym feare god first bryng trust god helpe despayre flee god god word second worketh crafte gile bringe fayth wherwith christe surely stablished temptation presumption put fro hym feare dread god vseth waye tempte christe againe christ vsed ouercome firste assaut thou requirest worde god thy guyde thy doinges psal god worde god shall geue angel charge ouer thee shall holde vp handes thou dashe thy foot stone wherfore caste thy selfe downe proue whether thou trustest god dede promesse sake mat place ought infirmitie christ co sidered wherin godhead lieth hid humblenes manhod euen dyd also crosse desired helpe cryed succour though ben forsaken also wilbe nothynge man infirmitie deuill conceaueth good hope shold easye hym tourne faith presumption make hym tempte god miracle necessarie alleageth texte psalme neuertheles feare bewraying purpose rehearseth part lettyng passe thy wayes authoritie deuil goeth bleare christes eye cause hym forget vocation charge folowe wherof hath charge commandement christe nowe man takyng case miracle godly power sustaine ouercome thynges whiche synners shoulde haue sustayned ben ouercome without christe prophete sayeth ought man knoweth infirmitie wayes doth christe walke deut deuill appointeth hym glorious wayes miracle necessary belongyng christ office christ repelleth hym saying written thou shalte tempte lorde thy god steppe stayer comme downe therfore nede attempte vnused vnwonted waye god shold cast selfe perill without god commandement without vrgent cause wheras ther common waye go downe doctrine lightly regarded beynge necessarie herby may learneto tepte god tepte god whiche regarde commandement appointed wayes seke straunge deuice wt worde commandement religious kyndes choseth wayes liuynge owne voluntarie motion maintayne doinges christe sayinge go sell thou hast folow bare reason also scripture alledged confirmation therofthe deuill vse h scripturesmath deuil vseth scripture allure men therby deceaued marke wherin deceipt consisteth alledgeth hole perfect sentence reciteth maketh purpose letteth passe profit anabaptistessuche crafte also anabaptistes alledge many scripture men must put trust creature ioyne therunto baptisme creature say water therfore must trust baptisme beleue grace god baptisme feele handes alledge scripture yet trulybaptisme word god yt sayeth except man borne water holy ghost see kyngdome god wycked thing thinke ye grace god baptisme water iohn worde god sure euidet beleueth baptised shalbe saued marc faith baptisme word water must ioyned gether mad braines persuaded whe angel defedeth v notand thus doth christ also withstande deuill answereth walke god comandemet know wel defeded angel kepe child doth duetie obedietly parent seruantes applie vocation knowe suretie yt copassed wt perill danger god angel defendeth maintaineth whe walke wayes haue promesse holpen angel deuils power may vexe pleasure wtout owne desert meet folow new strage wayes nothing tempting god teptation perceaueth excepte feele first stirreth desperation second presumption wayes beside god worde comandemet must christian man kepe midle waye neither despaire aduersitie trouble neither waxe proud god gyftes prosperitie presumig tepte god thing vnlawfull simplye cleaue worde true faith feare shal neuer destitute angel helpe succoure thirde temptation ful impudencie ye otherthe third teptation make cast awaye true religion rich poore wheras deuill taketh vpo chage kyngdomes though christ shold receaue kyngdome worlde deuil geue vnto ye deuil kyngdome god temptation set forth art logicke rethorical amplification externuations sheweth hym kyngdome worlde glorie power beautifieth greate gyfte magnificent wordes assayeth ouercome hym grosse matter coulde fyne subtile meanesriches corrupted religion worshippynge hym selfe idolatrie maketh light matter could worke guyle assayeth brynge passe power might redier waye destroye peruerte truth geue setter foorth therof rule worldly dominion example pope sheweth great strength force temptation hath wheras estemed greatly occasion take kyngdome vpon yt hath euer sythens behaued himselfe obedient seruant point deuil must needes yt appointed beare office ye kyngdom god come vnto dignitie power excepte haue certayne kynd lyfe appointed deuill maketh roome kyngdomea change spirituall kyngdome wordly wordlie spirituall maye lyke wise make roome deuill kyngdome god muste crepe vp kyngdome pretence religion worshipping deuil religion pretended yet done applied outward holines hypocrisieworshippyng deuill well allowed reason doinge performe two thinges first paye deuil rewarde kyngdome obtaineth greate authoritie reason beawtiful shewe cou terfet religion subtiltie deuil temptation setteth forth kyngdome worlde wayghtie thinge profferyng apon coditio may worshipped great peril temptation goeth worke religion hereby may seme beautifull reason worthie kyngdomes highe renoums promotion eyther religion thus transformed great patrimony kyngdomes thinges maye retained kept deuyllishe condition worshipping wherefore necessarie haue redie oure eye description godly worshipping holines often moued stirringe deuil thinke true religion shold fashioned might please reason haue profittes commodity wordly thinges ioyned therwith vexed troubled kyngdome deuil may haue recours true maner worshippinge perceaue ther appeareth sight greater praise commendation mennes tradition obedience geuen god word wher counted holy thyng maried person fynd maintaine child houshold busines shew obedience fidelitie therin weare wede dwell lyue eate flesh friday kepe vigil prescripte fastes visite saincts relikes c obseruation tradition beautifull glistring sight head world emperours kinges loue highly reuerence pope suche seruice inuented man tradition rose renome secte yt might better called trym true religionthe pope religion rather trymme true neuer haue rysen power ye true seruice god pure doctrine sincere godlynes made loke vp vpon went aside abbey forsoke world say applied selues god seruice laying side al worldly care ye co madatios ye monasticall lyues although know yt nothing brief diuellyshe temptation religion came god comandemet neither ye true seruice worship god yet neuertheles worshipped serued christ saith whe ye worship geue god forthwith falleth turneth worshyp diuel rewardeth worshyppers promysed christa general admonition geueth comodities lyfe fat prebend lordship suche lyke wyl worshyp god let folow comaundement word child let honour father mother seruants let dutie seruice familie diligence fidelitie master housholds let beware kynd offeces let dutie cause seruats al person familie diligently apply mind godlineswhat worsh ppinge god seruice due god word diuers person word playne wherin commaundeth thynges done therfore whatsoeuer name ye world office duty haue yt done father mother master housholdes neighbor child citezes counted god seruice co manded god word saith thou shalt loue thy neighbor shalt thy outward work declare office dutie loue vnto pope regardeth comandement appointeth certain peculiar worshippings god deuised brayn wearyng coules necessary vse certain meates oile fyshe bee eaten steade fleshe butter suche triflyng tradition altogither diuelyshegod ought worshyped accordynge word me tradition agree comandement god yea make muche vnto true iustice god doth vnto building substancial house child make house paper reason worshyp geuen vnto god agreable worde therfore comandement god worship god frewyl alone foolyshe fancye vnto suche worshipper god saith ask thy reward hym thou seruest commanded thee obey thy parent higher power loue thy neighboure thou regardest doest whiche neuer commanded yet wylt thou taken true worshyppyng bee thinges euident pope playne idolater worshyppers deuyll dothe onely despise word also persecuteth yet wyl counted good religious man outward worshyppynges hathe deuised shauen crownes coules vowes fastynges meates massyngs lyke yet wickednes meanes brought cause diuell hath shewed promised kyngdomes worlde cause mocketh v doctrine woorshyppinges god wee mainteynynge true religion lyue pouertie hunger thyrste daily suffer persecution pope extollethe woorshyppynges euen vnto heauens sucketh theym small profite lucre aduantage meanes hath gotten greate richesse estimation authoritie rule power hath brought kynges emperoures vnder subiection herof doth appere greatly deuyll hath ouer come pope tentation duetie feare god stoutely manfully resyst deuyll tempteth v answere deut christ sathan written thou shalt worshyp lorde thy god hym alone shalte thou serue haue speciall regarde word god obey alone without admit worshyppyng god long lyue wee shall neuer fre thre temptation christ lord hath ouercom make v strong wee also thorowe hym maye ouercome obteyne euerlastyng saluation amen seconde sondaye lent pthe gospell math xv iesus wente thence departed coastes tyre sydon behold woman canaan whiche came coastes cryed vnto hym saying haue mercy lorde thou sonne dauid daughter piteously vexede deuyll aunswered nothinge disciple came besought sayinge sende away shee cryethe v aunswered sayd sente loste sheepe house israell came worshipped hym saying lorde helpe aunswered sayde meete take chyldrens bread caste dogges answered said truth lorde dogges eate ccummes whiche fal master table iesus aunswerede sayde vnto woman great thy faith vnto thee euen thou wylt daughter made whole euen tyme exposition dignitie excellecie gospel notable great dignitie gospell present sondaye treateth chyldysh trifling matter ut moste graue weightie thyngs battail conflict faith agonie death god wherin learne nothing ought fray v pluck v away callyng crauyng god although god selfe seme vtterly contemne despise v prayersthe deuyl moste buly hower dea h lye poynte deathe haue experience matter tyme deuyll laboreth vttermoste power persuade v bryng v opinion yt god neyther beholdeth v regardeth v heareth v miserie excedeth man capacitie namely horrible dreadfull cloudes god anger doo shadowe sonne god grace fauour vtterly remoue sight suche conflict batail described sette foorth vnto v gospel concernynge womanthe woman cananee diuersly tem ted whiche commeth vnto christ entreat daughter onely reason also circumstance euyll none worse first all1 cananite woman cananite hethen creature thyng doth greatly hinder cause forasmuch kynrede stocke abraham hath right aske thyng christ stranger one thyng force might easily take away hope obteyn thyng hand christe math heathenyshe woman obteyne iewe yea suche one sente vnto iewes suche blocke layde waye woulde surely take awaye v hope pray neyther maye thynke matter lyttell purpose conscience answereth v thou arte number oughte praye thou belongest vnto christ let peter paule c praye whiche maye laufully doo ita greuous stomblynge blocke thou haste nought doo matter god wyll neuer heare thee thou arte synner thou hast fayth peraduenture thou art number god elect chosen people thou arte mete man take great matter hande stande god aske thynge god suche thyngs one enter man hert easy thing dyuell cast hym desperation tormet passyng al torment done great daunger must learne example woman see behaued self great myghty conflict headlong without considerationfaith obteyneth al thynges christ gentile christ iewe blynde shee mynde commeth boldly vnto christe fearyng nothynge myght lette hindrance vnto faythe christ greate doubted nothynge wolde healpe wyth thys faythe shee ouercame onely gentilitie also whatsoeuer otherwyse myght lette hyndraunce vnto hauing fayth coulde neuer haue doone woulde haue thoughte thys maner thou haste none accesse vnto holy man thou shalt pray vayn muche thou art synner hys people maye pray vnto hym straungers haue right doo beleueth praye thynges moue woman nothyng shee reasoneth thys manner selfe thou belongest vnto thys famylye common wealthe thou arte heathen vtterlye banyshed felowshyp company iewes yea suche one worthy treade vpon god ground hard perillous tentation whe deuill putteth v mynd sayth wise vnto v meanest thou thus pray pray neuer muche yet arte thou myne leaue therefore pray curse god thou wilt thou shalte neuer saued hope saluation vtterly barred thee thoughtes imagination wold easily take away yonglynges vnexercised souldiors christ campewhy historie sette foorth hope confidence praying yea throw desperation finally damnation therfore sake consolation comfort storye set foorth may bulwark vnto v fyry dartes sathan thou arte christian thy prayer purpose leaue geue ouer take heede thou bee perswaded subtile suggestion subtile sathan rather answere maner soeuer care although neuer euyll yet christe good rightuous neyther ceaseth thorow wickednes righteous mercyfullall thynges must asked god alone christes sake wyl therfore cal vpon hym wyth stronge stoute faythe admytte thynge shoulde le te vnto nowe tyme dispute predestination woman prayed regarded gentilitie hynder may also pray suche thyngs haue nede shold aske thynges god alone heauen christes sake sonne sauiour hard greuous conflict meruailous found cananite heathen woman saith story cried oh lord2 christ answereth nothing thou sonne dauid haue mercy humble right worthy maner praying precedyng earnest feruent faith praier maketh noble confession faith concerning christ yt promysed messias sauior world come born ye sede dauid office putteth remebrace openeth nede vnto saying daughter miserably vexed diuel crye christe well heareth yet answereth worde thys greuous temptation feleth god suche one towarde euen selfe say stranger ethnicke vtterly estranged common weale israel therfore pertained vnto none inheritance neither could claym fruite god gift liberalitie cause whe foloweth christ maketh intercession vnto speaketh nothyng though pertained thynge vnto hym strongest might haue ben dismayd two block cast way howe coulde otherwise thinke self soeuer heard christ gentlenes toward people yt came vnto hym nothinge el mere vanitie vtterly false though say man hathe ben commended vnto mercyfull tymes ready heare helpe many come vnto hym farre see proue heareth whome wyll hearewe must continually prayr cease wyll haue nede helpe yet poore woman suffereth selfe falle hope remayneth styll constant stedfast callyng christ muche disciple christ euen weary continual cry muche dispatche spake vnto christ appered greater clemencie mercye towarde woman christ neyther semed commende hym hardnesse inhumanitie vngentlenes therfore thei make intercession vnto christ oh lorde say graunt woman request sende awaye otherwise wyll neuer make end cry notable exaple declare ought cease praier diligently continue tyll haue obteined desyre taulerus writeth certayne place must sometyme geue ouer prayer men ought teache geuyng ouer prayer commeth soon inough yea soon euen owne accorde ought rather styre vp affection vnto prayer example testifieth sufficiently ought meanes geue ouer prayer go forthe continue say womannote practise time dispute whether good badde worthy vnwoorthye haue leysure consyder thynges haue greater necessarye matter hande daughter greuousely vexed deuyl haue nede counsayle healpe suche feruente desyre mynde stoppes hynderaunces soone dispatched put waye nowe commeth thirde stomblynge blocke3 christ denyeth helpe torment grief christ saith vnto sent vnto lost shepe house israel thus reiecteth casteth away intercession disciple neyther woman labor one heare thys myght haue ben vnto sure token christ hard mynd would meanes entreated seyng wold heare whyche beyng desyred behalfe made notwithstanding intercession truthe christ euangelicall storie sette foorth hard vngentyl personthe constancy woman vnto poore woman notwithstandynge woman geueth ouer suite neyther dismayde still stoutly goth forward purpose thrise greuously strike yet noble warriour hath many tymes ben assaulted cometh stoutely vnto battaile nowe alone cry intercession profited nothing mark saith entred house marc whether christ repaired importunitie may seme bewray impudencye vnshamfastnes strete crieth vpon christ christ hath gotten house auoide importune suite entreth house cotinueth sute falling himcontinue prayer writte yt may know greatly pleaseth christ whe praier oftentimes denied notwithstanding still continued wil mean receaue repulse4 christ recou teth woman dog sayd nay yet yt thyng obteined hym requested heare aunswereth woman good take bread child giue vnto dogges suche answer wold haue ben dismayd would haue thought verily bene hope helpe loked hand wonderfull hard answer whe cast away hath place among child counted ethnike also moste spitefully called dogge much harder ben called heathen pagan muche though haue sayd thou art vtterly estranged kyngdom god neither hast thou portion therin therfore get thee hense matter yt hand belong nothyng vnto thee tentation passynge tentations peter paule spoken suche word vnto vtterly haue dashed countenance shall thynke wordesfaith god thyng exc llent christ spake simple poore woman therfore notable example consider wherin may euidently see great thyng faith fayth euen christ moste angrye taketh christes wordes vnto beste turneth vnto owne commoditie makyng angry woordes moste comfortable wordes denieth wordes christ graunteth trewe thou sayth callest dogge grant doggefaithe interpreteth thyngs best neither doo desire better case dogges let child haue thinges fyne plesant daintie onely lette haue crummes fall frome table regarded child shall right well suffise snareth christ owne woordes meanes commeth passe whyche dydde humble selfe compared vnto dogges nowe receaued christe amonge child singular notable example sette foorthe vnto v declare ought waueryng constant faythe iohn continually call vpon yea may speake euen make wearye christ oure prayer leaue tyll haue obteined oure desire lette v moued nothinge contumelious reprochefull woordes dogges ethnyckes paynymes c dogges wythoute maysters neyther wythout theyr meate heathen also haue god rom thys harde holde stronge fayth womanby fayth prayer christ ouercome lorde christe taken ouercome aunswereth saythe woman haste thou muche strengthe thee resyste suche many great tentations uerily great thy faythe vnto thee accordyng thy desyre faithe semed vnto hym rare thynge seldome founde touchyng iewes knewe ryght welle offended streyght wayes euen one worde sayd must eate fleshe el could saued ohn thys woman withstandyng vnkynd wordes ouerthwart answer christ continued styll promyse nothyng doubtyng surely beleuyng last obteyn desyrewhy christe shewed hard woman one thyng passed ouer meane cause christ shewed selfe hard woman ueryly end would healpe graunt requeste meanes woman fayth myght proued sette foorth vnto example iewes whych chyldern heyres myght learne thys cananite whyche heyre howe shoulde beleue christe repose theyr affiaunce confydence truste hym thys thynge christe requyrethe wherein also hee chiefly delyghteth therefore hauynge triall thys woman faythe coulde longer hyde kepe secrete hys mercy louyng kyndnes sayde go thy way bee vnto thee accordyng thy desyre meanes makethe daughter whole also owne free promiseth moreouerfaithe obteyneth thynges god geue vnto euer shee wille desire yea geuethe vnto also dignitie right sede abrahamperseuerace prayer thynges brought passe thorough faith yt become daughter abraha holy woma herof may lern though god somtyme pray vnto hym make delay grauntyng v desyres yet weary continue still prayer faythfully beleuing wyll laste graunt v requestes abundantlye satisfie desyres although seemeth sometyme outwarde apparance neglect respecte regard prayer yet heart beareth alwayes heartie good wyll toward v whiche tyme wyll openly declare bryng thynges vnto good effecte cease pray vnto geue ouer suite may se onely example woman also many ioseph beyng prison xiii yeres cryed vnto god helpe cried gen worse wente hym soo goeth nowe adayes christian haue long cryed called vpon god feele reliefe ease paynes longer worse euen came passe iosephgod tria faythe sometyme deferreth helpe god sooner delyuered ioseph ben greate ioye comforte iacob father shoulde dignitie ioseph neuer haue ben greatly beautified auanced abode longe pryson abundantly recopenced long emprisonmet made myghtiest lord greatest gouernour lande egypte nexte vnto king neyther rede holy scripture subiect captiue came vnto higher dignitie vnder hys prince ioseph euen ouyngly fauourably wyll god deale v although heareth streight way prayersgods promise apprehended strong co stant faith granteth v requestes let v holde faste promyse constant faithe lette v waxe wearie praying stylle contynue supplication prayer vntyll haue mercy v wyll last vndoubtedly come perfourme promyse thys hys worde must always abyde true whatsoeuer ye shall aske father name iohn geue nature abyde delayes woulde haue oure prayer hearde graunted handegod geuethe dare aske must therfore enarme selues strong faith suche tentations let god long tyme semeth denye requestes maketh delayes great number yeares yet must diligently take heede wee meanes suffer oure faythe hope taken away promise end wyll wyll geue v haue asked may see storye woman hadde asked mo thynges without doubt christ wold neuer haue denyed vnto ephe example therfore taughte alwayes profite praye streight wayes heardean extremity god heareth oure hande greatest danger almoste paste hope god heareth v hande peryll drownyng daunger ennemies taryance made peryll destruction hande matter maye deferred lette v knowe god doothe exercyse trye oure faythewhen god eferreth heare abacuck yet hee wyll tyme come healpe prophete abacucke saythe lorde make tariance see thou paciently abyde commynge wyll surely come tary oure dayes also seemeth make delayes suffereth pope turke doo wyll agaynste v crye lament heareth maketh though knew v meane season myserably handeled though god matter wyll one daye otherwise falle outethe pope turk extreme enemy churche christ therfore lette v moste certainly persuade selues cause moste true moste vndoubted christ lorde god father although appeareth nowe god careth v thyng deuyll haue vpper hande ouer v treadeth v vnder foote triumpheth agaynst v rather assure thou thy self say know certaintie god wil forsake churche wyll euer hand helpe defend diligent feruent prayer call vpon hym ayde succour state condition certaine good promise whatsoeuer ye shal aske father name wyl surely geue wherfore wyl dispute whether electe woorthye praye iohn wyll moste certaynly perswade selfe promyse certayne sure mooste vndoubted soeuer praye constant wyll deale whole churche accordyng word promise doctrin nobly notably set forth gospel worthy al time diligently consydered describeth liuely setteth forth faythe wyth exerciseprayet made fayth obteyneth thynges god whyche last obteyneth thynges hande god faint example woman although diuersly proued tried fainted faith neyther ceased feruent continual praier call vpon christ euer persuading selfe euen middest stormes christ gentill louyng mercifull last wold vndoubtedly helpe geue desyre thyng ye haue herd obteined lord god bee mercyfull vnto v geue v grace folow faith woman holde fast worde promise without wauering doubting continue vnto ende amen thirde sonday lent pthe gospell luc xi iesus casting deuil dumb cast deuil dumbe spake people wondred som sayd casteth deuils beelzebub chiefe deuyls tempted required signe heauen knowyng theyr thoughtes sayde vnto euery kyngdome deuyded agaynst selfe desolate one house doth fall vppon another sathan also deuided agaynst hym selfe howe shall kingdome endure ye say caste deuylles beelzebub helpe belzebub cast deuylles whose helpe chyldren caste therefore shall iudges fynger god caste deuyls doubte kyngdome god come vpon stronge man armed watcheth house thynges possessethe peace str nger commethe vpon hym ouercommeth hym taketh hym harnesse wherein trusted deuydeth goodes gaynste gathereth scat ereth broade vncleane spirite gone man walketh drie place seekyng rest fyndeth none sayeth wy l returne agayne house whence came whe commeth fyndeth swept garnyshed goeth takethe hym seuen spirites worse hym selfe enter dwell en e man worse beginninge fortuned spake thinges certayne woman company lyfte vp voyce sayde vnto hym happye wombe bare thee pappes whiche gaue thee sucke sayde yea happy heare worde god kepe exposition gospell present sonday setteth forth vnto v ye story certain man possessed dumme deuill christ cast healed man dumbe spake vnto greate admiration meruellynge people presentchrist ouercometh deuill gospell many thinges contayned vnto greate consolation comfort oure cheiffe principal cosolation christ casteth deuill meanes may certainlye knowe christ hath greater power deuil kyngdome worke corporally done doth yet ceasse shalbe cotinually exercisedchrist daye casteth deuils worde sacramets churche endure thing yt geuen curch christ baptisme lordes supper worde absolution declaration merciful promise god vnto penitent synners thynges pertayne vnto ministery worde instrumentes prouided vnto ende kyngdome deuill may destroyed agayne menne maye receaued satan kyngdome kingdome god fine deuil may put men written prophet esay worde shall returne voyde withoute fruite raine falleth vpo grounde drie without fruite grasse blade come forth thinges ware grene worde god alwayes fruitful holy ghoste worde worde lighteneth kyndleth purifieth heartes meanes deliuereth tyranny deuill although man reason coprehend howe deuil cast maketh matter ye worlde worthie see much sparcke god power remaining darcknes cursse blaspheme thinges belong vnto god vnto christ receaue embrace ye worde ought know coforte selues herewith god hath geue v power vpo earthbaptisme whereby may cotinually cast ye deuil let v take exaple ye child new borne euery child yt cometh ye world iohn borne deuils kingdom thorowe sinne lord ruleth exerciseth kynde tirany whe child according ye comademet christe brought vnto baptisme whereby sinner borne ye kigdom god christ saieth except borne newe canot see ye kingdom god yt borne fleshe flesh rom borne ye spirit spirite must deuill nedes geue place child deliuered kyngdom baptisme ye grace god promised geuen child baptised ye death christthe declaration god mercy penitent sinner like maner may said yt haue troubled conscience ye deuil haue snarled made vnquiet thorow sinne offence men thus troubled tormeted cosciences mindes come vnto vnto chistia lament miserable state declare greif paine math iohn mat desire instructio cofort behalf may bicause ye co madement christ yea boude cofort stregthen brother declare vnto grace fauoure mercie god thorowe ye merites christ yt greued heauy loden burden sin meanes ye deuil cast also sinner ye wordthe supper lord leaste vnto v christ earth likewise thou art troubled thy mind disquieted thy coscience yt thou cast sufficietly receaue cosolatio stedfastly beleue yt god merciful vnto thee wil forgeue thee thy sin resorte thou vnto ye lordes supper math marc luc cor iesus christ lord hath instituted ye sacramet body blod vnto ende yt whe thou holy misteries receauest body blod yu sholdest dout certely suaded yt bodi betraied blod shed thy sin wher faith ther ye deuil driue copelled seke restig place luc thus worke castig deuils cotinually ye church christ thorow worde ministration sacrament church thorow christe heade euermore fighteth striueth serpent maine impugneth force violence lesse christ himselfe lorde selfe sayth iohn verely verely say vnto beleueth shal workes yea greater shall go vnto ye father reason church hath larger office christe taught amonge iewes streight place small circuite conuerted fewe taught also fullye fowre whole yeares church thorow helpe heade right hade god cotinually office preacheth gospell colos distributeth sacramentes euermore reproueth wyckednes deuill driueth place yt place suffreth hym haue reastea christiane must cotinually fight agaist satan doinge thys thorow worlde wheresoeuer ye worde preached ye sacrament truly ministred yet haue driuen neither pointes free set libertie hym muste dayly fyght asmuche sainct peter sayeth goeth aboute lyke rorynge lyon sekynge whome maye deuoure1 pet continually beware hym resiste deuil sayeth sainct iames shall flee greatlye greueth deuill therfore cast thorow ye doctrine worde sacrament iac likewise leaueth nothing vnattempted cannot vtterly subdue v yet leaste take lyues v thorowe persecution thus hath bene shalbe vnto verye ende world chaunced vnto christ droue deuill desiered hym deuill sought reuenged therfore moued iewes crucifie hym last death dispatche hym waye yet neither deuill iewes ouerhand christ ouercame iohn concernynge iewes cast countrye hope returne deuilchrist hym christian haue gotten victory ouer deuill worlde whiche prince worlde iudged condempned shall last daye christian accompanied christe head caste heauen earth shall neuer trouble christ hath onely driuen deuyl man gospel present sondaye maketh mention hath appeared iohn sayth shoulde destroye workes deuill1 iohn deuyll hath power ouer beleue beleue christe remayne vnder power deuill must last come vnto destruction iewes papecie deuil thorowly stablished ye knowe kyngdomethe papecie set meruelouslye greate wealth rich dignitie somuche although thorowe singuler mercie grace god remained holy sacramentes worde yet true knowledge either sacramentes worde al men herof beare witnesse yet papecie deuil founde thinges mete kingdom euen ministration baptisme cast outthe wickednes minister hindereth dignitie ye worde sacrament nothing infantes baptised name blessed trinitie brought vnto god nothing make voyde promes god neither holye ghoste therefore lesse power worde sacramentes althoughe person wycked without holy ghost whiche ministreth worde sacramentes therfore indebtedly bounde render vnto god hartie thackes singuler goodnes towards v whiche hath geuen v suche power strengthe againste moste cruell enemy extreme foe deuil though buffeteth v merueill abyde miserable sinner disquiet hym beinge proude myghtie spirite worde haue place rest therfore maketh v euer raysinge vp euerye place persecution tentations v thyng ought seme greuous vnto v hope wee knowe shall onely dryue hym oute shall also last daye toforesayde iudge condemne hym vnto hell fyre euermore thinges well diligently considered ought haue great estimation honour worde god sacramentesthe worde sacramets oughte greate reuerence vilelye thincke speake many commonlye nowe dayes speciallye wise prudent worlde sacrament graunt outwarde ceremony eye see worde also externall thynge whiche receaued eare redde eye christian also bodely menne thinges therefore despised reason christen man handleth worde god accordyng commandement christe power present whiche deuill abyde therefore worde sacramente outwardlye appeare homely base ought dispise rather geue thanckes vnto god hath geuen greate vertue power strengthe weake instrumentes poore men respect deuill therfore power repressed godes power worde c able somuche one moment howre stand againste hym doth god kyndleth poore litle strawe thorowe worde heauenlye fyrethe worde god driueth awaye satan maketh suche lyght brightnes worlde deuill knoweth wheare abide must daye flee place morowe another place vtterly last driuen consideration wherof sainct paule calleth gospell rom power god whereby men obtayne euerlastynge saluation saye suche might strength named power god restoreth man synne vnto righteousnes death vnto life hell vnto heauen deuils regiment vnto kingdome god thing must christian learne thancke god highly esteme holy worde blessed sacrament moste precious reliques iewels vnfaithful worthye behold greate power maiestie god word according saying tollatur impius ne videat gloriam dei let vngodly taken awaye yt see glory god esay saide iewes ye shall heare vnderstand ye shall see perceyue therfore muche bounde vnto god haue knowen felte greate maiestie power worde esay behalfe ought greatly reioice although poore beggerly synners yet endowed suche power deuill able abyde thus see worke amonge christian perpetuall meane caste deuilles make dumbe speake deaffe heareit greater miracle driue deuil men heartes bodye althoughe done corporally matter greater wayghte excellencie caste deuill men heartes driue hym body sytteth faster heart body christ driueth corporally also eye maye beholde power soner beleue driue also place muste stedfastly syt meane hearte yea playne homely thinges worde baptisme sacrament body bloude c singuler gyftes noble grace hath god geuen vnto v therfore ought wee continually thancke hym vse vnto oure comforte againste deuill wee meanes maye dryue hym oure heartes dismayde thoughe suffer v haue rest worlde continually heape vpon v affliction trouble persecution hatredes men tormentes tyraunts laste death thinges shall paide home last daye without anye returne shall euer caste hell fyre worldes without ende remayne fyrste part oure gospell whiche moste endebtedly bound geue vnto god moste heartie thankes reioyce nowe followeth gospell worlde iudgeth greate waightie matter set forth vnto v gospell three kyndes sortes menne three sortes people iudg miracle first meruell worke whiche diuersly take miracle christe firste best sorte meane whiche maruell worke christ without doubte geue thanckes vnto god fewe nomber suche reputacion whose eye opened see glorie power god worde knowe thinge semeth vnto suche greate merueill ynough worde quicklye easely turne many men power caste oute deuill cause heare matter ynoughe besydes two sortes heartes hardened seing see nothyng neyther perceyue thorowe mightie power god dumbe deaffe wel nowe speake heare man whiche wont madde wittes hole mynde doth thynges soberly quietly good order let v nowe consider ij sortes people seuerally euery one selfes firste ij sortes beholde noble worke maruelous miracle christe blyndethe second blaspheme madde doltyshe maner spyders gather poyson flowre whereof spake afore gathered good swete hony men onely interpret castinge deuils certein arte singuler gyfte god also boldly pronounce worke god deuill done arte magike shoulde miracle saye yea worke deuill done nicromancie stockblinde hard hearted cannot see wonderful worke god ascribe altogether deuill setteth forth insolent arrogancie excedynge greate pride call prince deuilles beelzebub soundeth english toge huble beebeelzebub englishe great flye howe ye deuil despised haue good opinion owne holynes spirite copare deuil flyes together uerely esteme deuill lyghtly2 cor neither could paule calleth prince god worlde good holye folke thincke despise deuil shal make art christ casting deuils despised great matter saye yt greater flye casteth lesser thus blaspheme worke christ although haue nothinge saye againste truth consider selues haue legion deuils full blasphemy murder lye deceauinges c fulfyll deuils wyll vnto vttermoste thincke deuill hath nothing danger euen thus goeth nowe dayes also gospellthe godly reioyce ye gospell vngodly blaspheme god thancked time taughte purely syncerely quietnes modestie comforte good men truly receaue doctrine glad wonder great mercie goodnes god heartely thacke contrariwise fele swetnes preaching gospel therfore blaspheme persecute euen vnto vttermost aduersaries selfes graunt worde godthe aduersaries graut many thinges true yet go forth persecute ye sacrament body bloud christ shoulde ministred kyndes yt christ forbid neither mariage meat yet condene thinges heresie wonder sonne waxe darcke earth doth open swalow vp teacher blasphemy yet go stoutly wtout al feare yt true christias feare ye deuill feare nothing christias haue learned experiece yt deuil able corrupt eue ye righteous destroye worke god permitted therfore call beelzebub2 cor wt paule cal prince god worlde haue experience power wyse hath made man captiue bonde slaue hath caste errour heresie holdeth faste clawes hardly infinite sermon called fro errours vnto true persuasio christen religio hold captiue hath lincked bodes fornicatio adultrye wrath couetousnes enuyethe power deuill set lyght hatred like vice holdeth fast yt almost hope time escape perceaue yt fewe bondes suffise putteth moe vnto therfore ye christias set ye deuil naught nether make light hi nether cal hi fly mighty lord price god world whiche filleth ye whole world wt murder warres error heresy scismes dissecios desperatio trouble misery c ye pope secte beleue althoughe see haue daily experiece ye wherefore meruelous thing forgotten yt phariseyes blaspheme christe worke hereof doth appere although body possessed deuill poore man yet spirit deuil much power ouer themthe papistes persecuting true christias thincke god great seruice seing maner papistes vnderstand worde also moste slaunderously blaspheme cruelly persecute notwithstandyng troubleth nothyng persuade selues haue done well iohn christe sayeth time shall come whosoeuer kylleth shall thincke doth noble seruice vnto god thinge seth forth vnto v teache v determine caste deuilles teache worde god loke better thinges chauced vnto christ place shall maruell shall iudge doctrine vngodly deceauing people leadinge diuers errours shal condemne heresie doctrine deuils nowe ought well fortressed fensed againste sclaunders offendicles stomblyng blockes greate greiffe vnto heartes papistes blaspheme doctrine yet careles care deuill flye suche fortune christ also highest miracle dyd thorow fynger power god dyd caste deuilles fell vnto suche blasphemy sayd battel flyes deuill wrought christ thirde seke signes heauenafter come thirde sorte moche better laste wyckednes ope fayning would beleue christe wold worke suche miracle pleased lacke miracle beholde see one plainely eye iudge earthly base true signe would looked haue authoritie shoulde shewe heauenlye signe shoulde make newe moone newe starres suche like meruelous wise take vpon prescribe appointe god signes wonder miracle ought woulde haue like iuglar satisfye fansye suche miracle please though god nothinge serue theyr lustes folishe desire shal find also oure dayes specially among kynges prince ruler worldthe wise world offeded word preacher therof homly poore creature talke haue wise worlde amonge shal receaue doctrine whiche sorte poore beggarly felowes professe first taught gospell dede vnlearned fyshers nowe sorte fugitiue runnagate monckes swarme periured priestes coulde right well allowe doctrine pope emperour kinges prince noble men teache embrace men also appointe god howe behaue himselfe set forth suche doctrine may please yea suche suche sorte thyncke good god must pleaseth appoint yea founde euen among professe gospell oure dayes many seme gospeller maye founde courtes prince also city whiche shame appoint preacher must preache teache yea ende prophet sayeth may speake pleasaunt thinges maye delight offende preacher accordinge office reproueth sinnes vice whereof certaine persones gyltie streight way crye thing matter tending vnto sedition meanes suffered maiestratthe glorious worldlinges abyde reproued wycked lyuing gospell maye preached without spitfull raylinges vpon menne preacher speaketh truth rebuketh synne muste counted straightwayes rayle vpon maiestrat moue sedition men puffed vp wyth muche pride whiche sawe miracle yet regarded nothynge excepte christ would worke suche miracle selues appointe growne vp vnto suche madnes swell pride thincke sufficient haue realmes subiection rom pet exod except also haue iurisdiction rule power ouer worde god holy misteries ye meaning whe scripture saieth ye higher power ought honour spoken euil rayled vpo though teporal maiestrate aboue god worde ruler lesse bounde obedient god wordeteporall ruler owe lesse obedience god hys worde subiectes tha subiectes obeyed frely spoke agaist althoughe losse life shold folow therof gospell spareth reproueth sinnes men generally without exceptio therfore let pastor preacher diligently consider greatnes wayght office remebring yt must geue accoute therof ye great day iudgemet esa iohn frely speake men without feare rebuke thinges yt worthy reproued ye persones hye low degreepreachers haue authoritie rebuke ye sinnes men without exception shold preacher thy cause thou maiestrate cast selues daunger serue thy lustes cotrarie office worde neither office serue thy tourne men hyred thee teach thing maye please thy fansye ye preacher may neither wyl yet ought yt willing heare thingespreachers may p easers gala let seke yt may serue lustes ministery free wherunto god hath geuen authoritie power rebuke sinnes yea ye sinnes men ye three kindes men christ noble miracle hath censoures iudges first praise allow meruel secod hate blaspheme third wolde haue miracle wrought appoint neither timesmarcke well thou preacher ye gospell preached ye worlde therfore preacher behalfe must christ dispute reason coted aduersaries meanes suffer wincke stoutly valeauntly defende lord christ cause worde soeuer aduersitie foloweth regarde thoughe seme labour vaine profite fewe haue done dutie haue disclosed blasphemy heare farewel vnderstand haue done haue contemned despised set naught blasphemed rayled vpon christ first al answereth sayde cast deuils helpe beelzebub prince deuilschrist confuteth aduersaries cofuteth wt reaso reasonable deny kingdom saieth deuided selfe must nedes come desolation therfore one deuil cast foloweth deuilles together eares amog selues must kyngdom come naughte truediscorde yt euen family housholdes discorde maketh hauocke al thinges man wife variance amonge selues stryue one hurte one speake euill must familie housholde nedes perishe come naught example teache discorde weakeneth maketh feble vtterly destroyeth whole empire kyngdomes cittes comon wealthes house family therfore phariseyes scribe vtterlye besyde selues clene wyttes wantyng iudgemet spirit also reason aduersaries also papistes madde vtterly estrauged reason whyle contemne condemne manifest trueth althoughe scripture yet able defende matter confounde euen reason helpeth nothyng al labour loste styffnecked vncircuncised heartes eares aduersaries papistes kyngdo deuilland worthy noted christe sayeth deuill hath kyngdome suche kyngdom greatly agreeth selfe defendeth matter high concorde perfecte agrement whosoeuer prouoketh one deuill prouoketh stirreth vp hurteth one maketh residue enemy otherwise lyued suche concorde shoulde plucke awaye many mo papistes vnto oure side beleue receaue wordewhy fewe receue worde cause kyngdome deuil mightie defendeth thinges diligent coniunction coupling together consentes myndes kyngdom doste thou disturbe greue thou receauest baptisme hearest worde god receauest sacrament body blood christwhy deuyl preuaileth agaynste god electe deuill doth ouercom thee deuils kyngdom hygh agremet likewise kingdom christ true concord singular linkyng together myndes therefore deuill assaulteth thee goeth vexe trouble thee hath also ennemy hym sitteth right hand god father euen christ thyne heade saide vnto paule saul saul persecutest thou act taken myghty strong defence yea inuincible fortresse meane christen man seynge haue myghtie kyngdome v yea shoulde certaine helth saluation one moment houre oure helpe sure certain grace god god assist v present v thorowe holy spiriteobiection may obiection made christes confutation exorcistes co iurers although wicked kinde peopleexorcistes cast deuils also uerily al cometh god deuill reade man possessed many deuils yet certain priest coniurer vsed sorcerie bold put ye man mouth possessed thing one deuil cast answer paul saith deuill latter day shall worke wonder miraclesanswere yet shall true miracle fained counterfait false ii thess ii worketh miracle aduance ye gospell christthe deuyll worketh miracle confirme vnbeleuers vnbelief sette forth glorie god bryng men true faythe caste headlong kynde idolatrie haue bene certain sainctes wont calle lady ipswiche lady walsingham roode rest roode grace peter iohn shorne c wont tyme past sende possessed deuyll myght bee made whole manye tymes came passe deuyll therfore caste though coulde longer haue remained content gladly depart confirme superstition vnbeliefe deuill also hath many tymes fainedthe subtiltie deuyll afeard halowed candell salt palmes holy water holy bread holy fyre c notwithstandynge dyd ende encrease superstition banishe true faith religion driue men lyuyng god vnto dumbe beggerly ceremony whiche redy snarled bondes idolatrie superstition might holde strongly same2 cor confirmed lest tyme begyn leane truste vnto woorde god mercy laste bee saued suche miracle sygnes wonder wrought deuyl ar lying false vntrue paule termeth ii thess ii yea nothyng el playn sorcerie iuglynge deceaue vnfaythfull would embrace truthe myght saued thynke thou true signes miracle wherwith christe apostle word cast deuil yt wil copelled depart ther daliance neither declared frewil go awaythe ende true miracle miracle ye deuill enforced geue place word god yt vnto end yt glorie god might set forth christen religion confirmed stablished dothe deuil gladly therfore agony conflict strife deuill cross halowed candels holy water trifle good deuils profitnote enlargement confirmation kyngdom superstition idolatrie false religion wickednes c put meanes wycked worlde may receaue punyshemente frowardnes wyll call vppon christe depely drowned superstition possible deuyll suffer himselfe expelled caste suche wicked persones sorcerer necromancer witch lyke thys done ende gospell maye aduanced truthe knowen errour may confirmed authoritie may geuen monkerye inuocation sainctes pylgremages uigiles mass suche lyke trumperie mayntenance thynges wherwith glorie god obscured truthe holye word hindred deuyl wel content geue place suffer himselfe caste oute castyng deuyll done end fynger power god may sene kyngdome god may stablyshed deuill resysteth wrastleth sheweth selfe vnwilling depart maintaineth abode long luc christ teacheth parable strong armed man therfore let v neuer forget great exceding mercy singular goodnes lord god humbly hertily thanke hym hath sente sonne helper vnto v deuil cast hym hath geuen v worde wherby euen nowe also worke done meane kyngdom deuill destroied kyngdom god set vp encreaced grace god mercy euer kepe v dere sonnes sake iesus christ lorde alone sauior god faand holy ghost glorie euermore amen fourthe sondaye lent pthe gospell iohn vi iesus departed ouer sea galile whiche sea tiberias greate multitude folowed saw miracle whiche dyd diseased iesus went vp mountayne sat disciple easter feaste iewes nye iesus lyfte vp eye sawe great company come vnto hym sayde vnto philip whence shall bye bread may eate sayde proue hym hym selfe knewe woulde philip aunswered two hundred penyworth bread sufficient euery man may take lyttle one disciple andrewe simon peter brother sayeth vnto hym lad whiche hath fiue barlye loaues two fish monge many iesus sayde make people sit downe muche grasse place men sat downe number fiue thousande iesus toke bread geuen thankes gaue disciple disciple set downe lykewyse fyshes muche would hadde eaten ynough sayde vnto disciple gather vp broken meate whiche remayneth nothyng lost gathered together fylled xii baskettes broken meate fyue barley loaues broken meate remayned vnto eaten men sene miracle iesus dyd sayde trueth prophete shoulde come worlde exposition gospell learne sauiour christ hath syngular special care folow math seeke kyngdom god rightuousnes thereof sette theyr chief delectation pleasure hearyng worde god practisyng shall want good thyng necessary theyr lyuynge psalm shall haue abundantlye euer needfull farre ofchrist prouideth neede despayre goddes prouidence behalfe though ledde wyth care towarde theym theyr necessity thys doctrine wicked worldlyngs couetous carles woorthy heare muche lesse beleue seyng theyr myndes otherwyse sette dede heare christe bounteously wroughte thys great miracle doo beleue christe wylle doo theymworldlings therefore together gyuen worlde scrape rake together euer gette hooke crooke ryght wrong laufull vnlaufull meanes declaryng theyr doynges haue good faithful persuasion god prouidence christe neyther wyll deale dyd people oure gospell maketh mencion yea maner epicure thynke god bee carelesse god regarde hys people sytte ydell heauen gasing tell vpon therefore thynke bee charge duetie carke care aforesee prouide thynges necessary selues suffer hunger colde c suche men yea rather monster men christe regardeth embrace word christe conforteth placethe faithfull shall want good thyng fede theym wordes dedes euen thinges necessarie let v doubt thynke compasse mynde psalm nouryshed lette v put whole confidence christ whiche confydece without al doubt shal deceaue v bryng vnto v lesse bounteous blessynge men receaued christ alway hande helpe succour iosue psalm pet relieue faithfully put theyr confidence truste hym cast thy care vpon lord saithe psalmographe shall nouryshe thee yea christ suche powerthe blessyng god maketh thynges plentifull remayne fiue loaues yet soo blesse shall suffise fiue thousand men besydes woman chyldren moreouer theym also leaue muche shall farre excelle quantitie former stoare fyrste scarcely halfe baskette full remayned xii basket full whereof wee taughte yf beleue word god doubte nothynge thereof framyng lyues accordynge god wyll vndoubtedly care prouide v abundantlye sende v euer necessarye lyuynge maye see hystorie although godlye came vnto christ yet earnestly geuen godlynesse sought woorde god carefull bealy therefore christe careth theymthe prouidence god bryngeth passe bee fed thought nothynge matter though shoulde saye fyrst whatsoeuer thou seke kyngdome god beleue math lyue accordynge thy vocation thynges leaue care vnto mee thoughe thou haue excesse thoughe thou haste thousandes yet thou shalte haue sufficiente wyll prouyde golde syluer money c meete bee eaten thou haste nede breade whyche commethe oute grounde thou haste plentie hereof oute earthe thou hast ground lande possession c onely beleue folowe thy callyng shalt thou want breade dayely experience mynistrethe vnto v exaumples thys thyngelabour hee begynnynge poore scholer beynge dylygent office thorow blessynge god becommeth greate doctour mayde seruant beynge diligent seruyce studiosly lookyng vnto thynges house fauour god cometh vnto suche mariage made maystresse housholde hauyng substance goodes rychesse plentie thynges greate abundance suche exaumples age contrarye parte feare god care hys woorde negligente theyr officeidelnesse ydell geue theym selues sluggyshenesse fall myserie pouertie beggerye yea though haue muche lefte vnto theyr parentes frendes yet commeth naught wasteth away snowe agaynste sonne therfore many yong men daysidelnes ye chief mistresse vice geuyng selues rather ydlenesse labour wyckednesse godlynesse forsaken god thys meanes fall kyndes mysery lewdnesse eyther dye battaylle come hangynge ell haue somme shamefull ende whyche thynge bee vnderstande also many feare god faythfully walke vocation neuer base homely must nedes accursed god ouerwhelmed myseries well worthy asmuche loue godlynes beleeue christe folowe hys woorde walke theyr vocation c thys shoulde haue god affaire moste sure defender tutor patrone prouider encreaser c shoulde lacke good thyng learne therfore gospell beleue christ wyll conserue kepe v prouyde thynges necessarye v wyll applye oure selues godlynes loue christ word though say thou godly fearest god loke thou thy meate hande moste certainly despayre though thy lyuynge smalle blesse thy stoare prouyde abundantly thee yf thou folowe way ar wicked vngodlye thou falle miserie meruaile neyther blame thou god thy selfe yea thoughe thou haue gotten goodes worldethe absidace prosperitie vngodly shall long continue yet thou bee vngodlye shall surely prosper thee shall sodeynly consume come naughte thou mayste well assured whych despiseth word god obeyeth god comandement shall neuer pleasured hand god thys thyng doth christ teache v miracle fyue loaues fedeth fyue thousand men besydes woman chyldren whose numbre peraduenture equall filled yet remayned muche thus doynge christe setteth foorthe bare worde dothe syxt chapter mathews gospell hee expresseth acte geueth example therof though saye ryche easily fede thee onely see thou behauest thy selfe godly folowe worde god kepe touchyng thy foode laye care therof vpon backe doctrine faith christ setteth foorth miracle vnto v faithfull vnderstande vnfaithfull regarde rather laugh scorne doo mystery god besides doctrine remaining two thyngs euangelist doth diligently set forth first christ asketh question disciple answer thinke goodthe cause incredulitie co cernig liuing second commaundeth gather vp fragmentes nothyng perishe nowe concerninge ii disciple philip andrewe euidently appereth cause although prouoketh v vnto faythe vnloked blessyng yet founde v true ryght perfect ought bee letteth v also impediment disciple meane onely consyder howe muche wee haue nede haue noo regardephilip howe muche christe able dooe wyth blessynge philyppe leaueth reason sayeth two hundred peny worthe breade sufficient euery manne may haue litle morsell count taken people compared summe money philip nameth semeth lytle dede fyue thousande men math also many woman chyldren mathewe saythe whiche numbred philyp foloweth rule resonreason euyll counsailer matter god accordynge vnto maketh accompt euen go worke reason altogether ruleth v caste accomptes much haue nede necessary dayly yerely expences perceaue goodes fayle v countenance fall desperation thynke verily shall neuer bee able susteyne selues familie euen thus goeth andrewe also perceauyng good wyl christ toward pore peopleandrewe wold gladly relieued therfore telleth christ prouision boye fiue barley loues two fish notwithsta dyng remembred great copany hungry folke considred sclender prouision counted nothing saith among many streight wais considering nomber casteth away faith thinketh possible yt multitude holpen relieued litle quantitie bread fishe comune fault among v al think liuing also trouble daungers run streight wais help vnto resonnote well yf reason se help hand fall vnto mourning lamenting vtterly despairing confort much better cast al care vpon god fall reasoning necessary thinges meanes shold one incomoditie miserie shold chance thorowe care doubled yet nothynge amended care maketh man richecare pro fyteth nothing yea rather bryngeth disease body disquietnes mynde two great pestilence man lyfe example behalfe want therfore seyng reason otherwise bee occupied thynges haue nede shewe selfe carefull necessary thoughe whole wealthe depended carefulnesse deuise whiche directly faithe euangelist wold let passe thing vnremembred exaple disciple may learne leude wicked toyes reason namely christian whiche oughte onely depend christe worde rule reason philippe andrewe iudged truely neither possiblethe worde god reason considered man onely ledde reason otherwyse thinke haue better iudgement christian may looke vppon reason vppon woord god therfore ought subtilly reason constantly stedfastly beleue reason faileth lean vnto worde god faith diligently cosider noble faithful steward christ christianes geue wee haue iohn saith christe gaue loaues fyshes muche hand muche would neyther thoughte dyd one hensforth wyll doo among hisgod tymes beneficiall sayde example miracle publyshed sette abrode tymes onely concernyng foode god respecteth healpeth nedye without comforte also necessity misery almyghtye hath promysed v healpe defence therfore oure power onely thys3 reg reg reason suffiseth shoulde make matter vp faythe prayer vndoubtedly beleue also god vnto v whiche onely able wyth blessyng amplifie encrease lyttle haue dyd hony oyle wydowe sarepta also able nothyng make thinges consolation confort ought diligently consyder onely christ sayth respecte thys fyrste seeke kyngdome god rightuousnes therof math thyngs haue nede lette v cast care vpon heauenly father whyche wyll geue vnto euen slepe psalm psalmograph sayth saye shall blessed prouyded yet shal vnderstande howe whence commeth wee maye playnely see thys myracle soone christ toke bread handes added therto blessyng streight wayes perceaued multiplied encreased fyshes also christe distributed theym commaunded delyuered people encreased meruailous greatly thus woulde christ haue v bothe perceaue beleue meanes myghte attribute secrete inuisible richesse god present reason storethe misery thys tyme miserable face worlde ennemies euery syde v discord debate strife encreaseth dayly men money decay daylythe wickednes byshop rome common wealthe come vnto lamentable ruine thynges go hauocke generally neyther ther hope amendment pope also ydell neither sleapeth seketh meanes possible disturbe realmes set prince together eares bring desolation countreys resyst tyrannye caste awaye intollerable yoke refuse wicked doctrine despise diuelyshe decree ydell inuentions crooked constitution vnwritten verity c embrace beleue professe true liuely gospell oure sauiour iesus christ turk hateth name christe pope dothe abhorre gospelle professe therefore seketh corner studyeth meanes may bee take awaye gospell v restore vnto v olde abhominations thyngs christen man dothe remembre otherwyse greue nowe reason begynneth compasse selfe best done prouysion may bee made wythstande great euyls reason deuyses counsayles seeth way howe brynge passe hath imagined el deuyse apte counsailes howe eyther preuent dyspatche greate malice displeasure falleth confusion last vnto desperation neither reason frustrate purpose free fro sadnesse desperationmarke practise fleshe blood otherwyse doo thenne nature requyreth christian farre better case reason fayleth lay hande word god stedfast fayth beleue receaue healpe conforte hand god iohn accordyng promise commaundement word beleued suche extremitie difficultie thynges math uerily euen christ hath ouercome world gate hell shall preuayle agaynst churche psalm eye lorde vpon rightuous eares attent vnto theyr praiers shall hurte saithe peter ye followe good1 pet withstandyng ye suffer righteousnesse sake blessed ye lorde knowethe howe delyuer rightuous tentation reserue kepe store wicked vngodlye day iudgement vnto condemnation euerlastyng payne2 petr peter place bringeth loth sodomite example faithe worde worketh constacie hearthe sort setteth word promyse god holdeth theym faste wyth stronge faythe hym reason worlde though shoulde fayle dismay cause hym despayre dothe knowe lorde aboue whyche ruleth myddes hys ennemye therefore contented wyth thynges exod maye gloryfye name agaynste theym aduersaries worde vexe churche god make neyther ende measure god hys woorde euen pharao egyptian dydde helpe word christian thoroughe faythe haue mooste certayne sure hope reasone seeth hope reason perceauethe healpe bee hande despayreth streyghte wayes lord sheweth trewe healpe yf wee holde faste followe godlynesse geuethe hys mynde wyckednesse synne careth conscience thoughe neuer muche defyled spotted abhomination yet thynketh enioy promyse comfort therof vtterly deceaued shall brynge nothynge vnto good effecte thys faulte disciple wyth reason well instructed respect vnto healpe fayth neyther dyd consyder lorde christe elles phylippe would haue tolde tale sorte two hundred penye woorth breade sufficient greate multitude euery one myght haue lyttell morsell case good ynoughe muche thou arte wyth v whyche art able fulfyll make good euer doo lacke muche wee suche place prouysyon canne bee made thou haste power knowledge whyche haue andrewe also wold haue spoken otherwyse thus boye hathe fyue barley loaues twoo fyshes shoulde haue distribution theym woulde scarcely suffise two persones forasmuch thou art present put thy helpynge hande vnto shall suffise manye ynough inough agayn great portion left would word faith haue taught reason carefulnes word faith vanyshed away meruayl though could remember thingnote thys counseil therfore rule obserued thou louest ye name christ notwithstanding thou leanest vnto reason vnto deuises therof beyng compelled necessitie yet see woorde god beare chiefe rule haue vppermoste place alwaies thorowe faith thou depende wholly vpon god promyse otherwise thy helpe wil vncertain yea wyl nothing cursed man saith prophet putteth trust hier maketh fleshe strength suffreth heart go lord christ hathe moste noblye declared hys blessyng among vsthe worlde abuseth gyfts god thorowe riot may forget commandement christ gaue disciple concernyng gatheryng vp suche bread fyshe remained nothynge myght lost reason tyme necessitie nothing recken acompt compasse thinges serue ned away faithe yet constantly cleaue promyse god lykewise blessyng god plentuous world neither rightly thankfully vse many abuse blessynge god vnto excesse prodigally wastfully spende naughte experience teachethe v bee good wyne yeare plentie wyne fall people drinkyng gullyng glosyng quaffyng vnthankfully abuse precious good gyfte god though god yere sent suche abundance wyne onely ende people shoulde drinke dronke blessing god ought vse abusein time wealth prouid death haue preset necessitie requireth ought diligently gathered gether laide vp store may supply ye lacke necessitie come ioseph coucelled pharao king egipte yt ye greate plentifull encrease seuen former yeres prouide seue dere yeares yt shold followe gene meanes mighte store grayne lande like maner god sendeth artificer men occupation good yeareartificers ware well solde haue good vtteraunce thinges occupie maye therfore abuse blessing god wastefully spede away gaynes must kepe store warely laye vp yt time come may serue ye lacke yt lyke followe forasmuch many sped faste get spare nothyng necessitie yt come therfore time nede lacke god withdraweth blessing mete whiche abuse gyftes god riotously wastfully spend away time lacke yt meanes maye learne neglecte regarde blessing god much wastfully consume good gyftes god ye cotrary part som abuse hourdyng vp niggardly kepyng yea vnto ende yt dearth come may haue ye gayne thoughe vnto vtter vndoinge poore neighbour may see couetous cormorantelyke cornemongerscornemongers whiche hourde vp corne time cheape time dearth maye sel dearer vnto profit selfes vnto disprofit bringe forth blessyng god comoditie ought suche time maye serue couetous desire reape greater profit prou salomon sayth hourdeth vp corne shall cursed people blessynge lord shal fall vpo heades bring forth sel reasonable price catarpillers comon wealth whiche seke owne priuate lucre whether corne cattel otherwise spitefull kinde people hated god godly mennote ye riche men touching christ comandeth fragment suche thinges weare lefte gathered vp comanded end yt shold serue couetous lustes couetous worldlinges hauing store might able helpe nedye hungrye carnall reaso saith hourde vp thou maiste richer although meanes beggered though god gaue blessinge vnto thee serue thy couetous affection rather yt thou sholdest serue time comon necessity meanes cometh passe gredye gryffes lokyng continually gayne worke accordynge blessing god profit selues also thorowe couetousnes take pleasure vse thinges professethe misery couetous men couetous man lacketh well hath hath therfore yt beleue worde god although lacke yet shal encreased goodes shall haue god plentie ynough euen vnto vttermost lykewise yt abuse giftes god vnto owne couetousnes prouoke againste selues curse greatest abondance nedie miserable misery couetous worldlinges lesse griefe vnto distribute laye goodes get scratch together calamitie mischance happeneth many time come passe goodes haue misfortune corne eate vermine wyne waxe sower c vexed mindes payne worthie suche sinne plague worthely cast vpon losse greue neuer man man dede rather monsture man rather haue litle feare god quiet mery conscience haue greate abondance god anger disquietnes minde namely certen suche vnmercifull mammonistes haue god enemie conscience continuall vnrestfull accuser good men aduersaries poore men cryers cursers desyerers vengeaunce fall vpon also haue deuil hande whiche wytcheth maketh suche doltes see good right lifte vp mindes muche one thankeful god blessinges yet consider purpose geue god remaine blindnes minde yt know none god mamo rich good world log abide safe safe one decay hope gone thorow suggestion sata many fall vnto desperation hange vp selues drowne selues cut throte otherwise rid selues waye last abusynge blessing god vnmercifulnes haue porcion deuill haue long serued lake burneth fyre brymstone apoc payne sacrilege blessyng god turned vnto pray man couetousnes blessynge god caste awaye riot prodigalitie kepte muche made maye helpe tyme necessitie thorowe better prouision maye made poore neither hourded vp lyberally brought forth vnto sustentation nedye maye seme haue receaued god gyftes vayne rather vnto ende hath appointed saye vnto owne necessarie conforte vnto reliefe poore nedye written hath dispersed abrode geuen poore psal therfore righteousnes abydeth euer euer thus gospell haue heard confortable doctrine howe necessity must haue eye vnto lorde christe vnto worde altogether depende vpon loke blessing hand nothing doubting whatsoeuer hath mercifully promised v wyl bounteously performe geue vnto v lord power rom abundantly riche many call vpon yea graunt v dare bolde aske ephe suche greate mercy vnto faythfully beleue hym god geue v grace blesse v maye dayly encrease godlynes seke kyngdom god righteousnes therof beleue holy worde liue accordyng vocation calling necessity misery affliction trouble whether concerning foode otherwise cleaue vnto gracious promise alwayes lokyng helpe merciful hande thorow lord iesus christ whome father holye ghoste honour glorye worldes without ende amen fyueth sondaye lent pthe gospell iohn viii whiche rebuke sinne say trueth ye beleue god heareth goddes wordes ye therefore heare ye god aunswered iewes said vnto saye well thou art samaritane hast deuyll iesus aunswerede haue deuyll honour father ye haue dishonored seke mine owne prayse one seketh iudgethe ueryly verylye saye vnto yf man kepe sayinge shall neuer see death sayde iewes vnto hym know thou hast deuyll abraham dead prophetes thou sayest yf man kepe sayinge shall neuer taste deathe art thou greater father abraham whiche deade prophetes dead makest thou thy selfe iesus aunswerede honour selfe mine honour nothinge father honourethe whiche saye god yet ye haue knowen hym knowe hym yf say knowe hym shallbe lyer lyke vnto knowe hym kepe sayinge father abraham gladde see daye sawe reioyced sayde iewes vnto thou art yet fiftie yeares old hast thou seene abraha iesus sayde vnto ueryly veryly say vnto ere abraham borne toke vp stone cast hym iesus hid hym selfe went temple exposition gospell present sonday full matter ministereth many thinges considered handle present time suffer therfore chose onely principall pointthe worde god diligetly heard namelye christ sayth ought gladly heare worde god heareth worde god god contrariwise heareth word god god wordes symply plainly spoken christ man wil thincke great weight muche estemed knoweth thinges truly searcheth pondereth earnestly meaneth god god shal soone perceaue thinges wherof christ speaketh greate waight singuler importaunce certen haue greater faulte layde chargenot od ye greatest miserie neither suffer anye greater infamye reported god displeasure chaunce man life neuer greuous many compared christ fewe wordes sayeth iewes ye god therfore matter cosisteth thingthe despisers god worde bonde slaues sata heare worde god kepe euidet thorow whole story gospell wil worde god speake euil blaspheme folowe deuil obedient vnto caryeth whyther wyll vseth purpose lysteth lenger worse maye see gospell present sonday firste iewes angrye christ begynneth preache afterwarde begin speake euill spiteful wordes hym callynge samaritane sayinge hath deuillthe enemy god worde procede wickednes wyckednes might seme wycked ynough withstandynge procede go forwarde wickednes ware still madder madder makest thou saye thy selfe shorte geue ouer themselfes greatly vngodlines mischife last bende selues vnto murder take vp stone kyll christe horrible wyckednes fallen despise worde god blaspheme god worde speake euil lorde christwhat deuyl ye see deuil verely heare worde god blaspheme true god speake ill go murder sorte dayes stubborne disobediet child wil obeir paretesstubborne child despise comaundementes afterwarde go forward wickednes curse parets rayle although execute acte murder vpon yet wyshe parentes dead el selues lyue vngraciously parentes wyshe selfes rather dead lyue come passe wycked child wil heare worde god endeuour selues kepe thus goeth thorow worlde heare worde god frame selfes liue accordyng therunto may see euill speaker lyars blasphemer fighter ruffins suche wicked person whiche go forward dayly wickednes tyll last come shamefull ende matter haue also experience papistesthe tyranny ye papistes whiche longer continewe worse madder rayle speake euill curse blaspheme worde preacher thereof neuer ceasse fro furious madnes mad furie till condene worde heresie professours thereof heretikes scismatikes aprehending casting prison afterwarde moste cruelly murderyng fyrethe despising god worde greatest synne sweorde halter water uerely contempte despising godes worde greatest synne may synnes man offendeth may reproued taught better giltie acknowledge confesse fault synne worde god contemned blasphemed professours therof miserably entreated last cruelly murthered possible auctours abhominable wickednes suffer selues one admonished faultes persuaded euill yea thincke well doinge please god god hye seruice doctrine condene saye playne heresie iohn touchinge professours thereof wicked heretikes wers newe doctrine deceauers poore scismatykes apostatas forsakers tetes israell enemy mother holy churche troubler comon weale laste whome destroye vtterly take awaye face earth farre estranged rule reason iudge moste reasonable lawfull acte prou thus please selfes wickednes reioyce haue done euill ioye synnes farre ashamed euill synnes comonly contrarye founde therfore commeth deuill heare worde god blaspheme persecute preacher wyckednes papistes aboue thing must eschewed hope parte god kyngdome otherwise nothinge loked hande god anger indignation laste death damnation harde greuous worde christ speaketh iewes ye heare worde god therfore ye god god deuill opprest greatest plague pestilence deuised man wishe vnto greater euill redy fall lamentable consider great abhominable synne nowe comon almost among statesthe despiser worde abyde reproued meane contempte hearinge god worde specially amonge greate authoritie man saye vnto thou doest well thou comest ofter sermon doest thou set naught thinge sheweth euidentlye thou art god greatest part wil answer maner haue sermos knowe selfe trow best done thou importunat vpon tell must take waie el saued thou shalte fynde litle litle exasperate moued rayle vpon thee threaten displeasure thou hold thy peace suche horrible wyckednes greuous synne maketh christen heart tremble shake feare seinge damnation hangeth vpon christ sayeth heareth worde god god sonne deuill namely frowarde wicked iohn wil well wyll also defende euill iewes gospell saye saye well thou art samaritane hast deuill ye deuil chalengeth vnto hym honour god desiereth counted holy meanes suffreth reproued one parte whosoeuer heareth god worde god deuill vnderstande thoughe deuill made geuen mouth eyeswhat deuill reason forth nay suche thinges godes creation gyfte therfore muste man make difference betwene thinge vse thereof man whiche lyeth deceaueth good tonge geuen hym god abuse tonge deuill geueth tonge vnto deuill abused euen blaspheme god holy worde lykewise god geueth hole good eye abuseth vnto contemplation beholdynge vayne fylthy vnhoneste thynges cometh deuill lyke maner hearte thincketh vncleane cruel thinges hearte selfe owne nature euil god euil vse thereof deuill cotrariwise vnderstad god eares put vse heare worde god contented reproued amisse also tonge occupied prayer teachinge edifyinge confortynge suche eares tonge god without faulte put vnto vsewhat god god made like maner whe heart thincketh honest pure chaste godly thing howe neighbour maye edifyed offended howe godes glorie may set forth hyndred suche hearte creature god eares tonge lykewise doth right wel please god therefore named god wolde mebres shold thincke speake heare anye thing shoulde againste god chance time fall speakynge euil beinge angry c yet returne confesse haue done amissethe propertie god child whe offend aske forgeuenes cometh sometime passe thorowe euill behauiour chaunce somtime aware repent v hereof make haste come right waye ful purpose neuer fall lyke againe deuilles child stubburnely go forth styll doinge euil yf reproued stoutlye arrogantlye answer care disobedient styfnecked child corrected parentes deuil become daily worse worse deuil suffer rest quietthe property deuils child fyrst despise worde afterwarde blaspheme curse speake euill last maner iewes take vp stone go murder property deuils whealpes knowen murtherer calumniatour iohn accuser pycker quarelles despiser god worde euen beginning therfore let doctrine defence vnto againste moste abhominable synne ye also despise worde god gladly heare diligentlye exercise youre selfe meditation study therof night daye psal learne frame lyfe accordyng shall sonnes god child deuill haue lost worde lyfe righteousnes bonde slaues deuil neither thing helpe great power riche synne stycketh pope euen vp harde earesthe pope enemie god worde complices euer worde god persecuteth formenteth christian cruelly turke doth may ye know deuill belongeth vnto deuil gladly heare worde god god nowe god murtherer creatour maker fro lyfe cometh deuill neuer made man gaue hym lyfe therfore god lyuing god lykewise lyfe hym heare worde doth christ confirme notable saying worthy euer remembredthe worde god deliuereth drath berely verely saye vnto man kepe worde shall neuer see death thinge kepe ye worde god neuer departe fro beleue whatsoeuer christ hath promised v gospel concernyng forgeuenes synnes euerlastynge lyfe truewhat kepe word god remayne faith hope vnto ende doth thys saith christ hath euerlastyng life neither nedeth feare sinne hell laste iudgement suche one grace mercie death dede shal assaulte faithfull flea body themdeath yet shal fele whiche vnder power deuil dye without worde god die vnwillingly spurne deaththe death wycked take though madde rore lyke lyon refuse death wold meanes dye yet dye must yea possible wolde leape thorow thousand fyres escape death shall sayth christe disciple heare worde kepe lye vpon bed muste dye shall haue suche troublethe death godly turmoyle disquietnes shall haue ioye peace heartes towarde god confortyng selues hope better lyfe come hope persos fallen sleape swetely departe without feare tremblinge although death shall corporally flea yet shal death apalled made force shall felt euen though man swetely fall sleape vpo softe pillow many time see suche offence condempned die go suffer wel instructed worde faithfully beleuinge offer selues gladlye willingly mery chearefull hearte dye feare neyther treble fele consolation conforte ye worde feleth death armed worde god death terrours madde wode frantike fareth though desperationwhat comodities haue hearynge worde god yea possessed deuil cosider therfore dearely beloued great treasure precious iewel ye get ye diligently gladly heare word god firste ye know ye ye god haue ouercome ye deuil al infernal armie yt neither sinne damnation hath power ouer moreouer soeuer shoulde obiected againste hyndraunce saluation preuaile againste ye shall easely ouercome contrariwise worlde leaste trouble yt cometh waxeth madde impaciet falleth vnto vtter desperation christian vndoubtedly worlde haue many trouble ye worlde deuil hate extremely therfore al time daunger lifethe true christian neuer free crosse good fame al yt euer haue shal fynde meanes suffer thinges paciently verely none otherwaye holdinge faste worde cleauinge harde saying let go wil go world god world yt worlde wolde deale otherwise rather thousand time yt worlde hate persecute loue fal fauour good god minde thus affected setled trouble aduersities yt worlde passe awaye cloude byrde swyfte wynge shewe selues litle vnto v straight way gone let greate singuler consolation euen life ye fele power worde specially whe death cometh thorow ye faith ye haue worde eue swete pleasaunt slepedeath faithfull swete pleasaunt sleape walketh darkenes perceaueth ye theaues soner oppressed ouerthrowen yea yt befor ware eue goeth wt faithful deuil theife mur therer hath sworne bodely death yt ca escape notwithstading enarmed worde holde faste yt shal scasely fele deaththe worde god strong bucklar ag ist aduersitie payne therof worde setteth men ioyeful quiet state maketh cosciences chereful mery gladde despaire aduersitie come neither make busines whe loose promotios lyuinges kepe pacience kinde aduersitie yea death come embrace ioyefully receaue without feare al onely conforte christes sake haue merciful father heauen learne word without ye word learne nothing non cause desyre knowledge god word learne ought take dayly cobrances aduersities chaunce vnto v might worthely seme cause sufficient nothing comparison ye last miserie cometh death cocerning euident sap helpe phisition thinge christe alone lord helpeth v also ought estemed v al thing worlde goeth v whe offereth v helpe remedie yea bringeth home owne dores despise set naught therfore chaunceth vnto v worthely afterwarde god litle litle dayly fall greuous sinnes become worse worse sufficiently sayd suche point dye fynde neyther helpe councel
