remayneth suche lamentation feare tremblyng horroure yollyng roring yea desperation damnation therfore principal point doctrine contayned gospell present sonday diligentlye embrace worde gladly heare faithfully beleue ye shall ye ouercome synne deuyll death hel c althoughe death shall take lyfe yet shal ye fele payne hym shalbe vnto moste swete pleasaunt slepe worde god suche conforte present helpe bringeth vnto v quiet lyfe mery coscience euerlastyng saluation vngodly suche despyse worde god mischief wyshed vnto suffer redy seing heare worde god god vnruly childe whiche despyseth commandement god careth parentes spoken vnto reproche sonne deuill god lightly regarded set naught better bonde slaue turke barbarous cruell tyraunt captiue bondslaue deuyll accuser calumniatour picker quarels murderer seketh mean possible cast v vtter destruction take hede mischiefe dilygently consider self gret reuerece estimation ye ought haue woorde god none reskue help remedy euerlasting death deuyl sinne hell c hold fast word christ say beleue promise thorow faith worde haue sure hope euerlastyng saluation christ saithof word christe speaketh wyll kepe woorde shall neuer see deathe meaneth lawe god gaue iewes moyses whiche lawe although bee trewe holy profitable doctrinethe lawe moyses yet seyng vicious corrupt nature obey doctrine become vnto v ministerie deathe alwaies reproueth accuseth condemneth sinne god therfore haue nede word may delyuered synne iustified god nowe woorde christe sayth beleueth methe lawe gospell shall neuer se deathe worde muste apprehended layde hande strong faithe may mean doubt true christ promyseth refuseth worde taketh counsell owne deuise shal fynd death life therfore agony death according yt fancie according heare word must iudge saie see must die heare promise word christ lorde thorow hym shall haue life touchyng sinne whiche must nedes suffer death vtterly taken awaye hymsynne cause death god deathe resurrection wyll mercyfull vnto geue euerlastynge lyfe truely kepe woord christe harde thyng haue faythe fleshe blood otherwise bee persuaded fele proue peruers froward reason must striue aske god hys holy spirite may stablishe heart throughe wordefaithe gyft god may retaine keepe true faith cause worde christ great efficacie myghte power christe hym selfe sheweth ende gospell thys poynt greatly moueth iewes stirreth vnto anger ready stone hym vnto deathe troubled iewes christe said worde preserueth defendeth euerlastyng death forasmuche sawe abraham moyses holy men greately commended holy scripture wer dead thought christ muche inferiour matter worthy laughed muche bragge boast sette worde christ answered abraham desired see daye sawe reioyced say abraham kept word dyed euerlastyngly ben damned euer abraham saith christ thus muche say almightie euerlasting godchrist god man onely sa eth wil deliuered synnes escape euerlastyng deathe come vnto euerlasting life must holpe seke help none others myn alone could neither moses prophet speke truly selues men christ god man therfore able geue life euerlasting saluation none alone great consort sure confirmation faithe confesse yt christ true euerlasting god haue like testimony thing many diuers place euangelical history yt whole trust shold hym word none ye word god mean deceue v soeuer speaketh certain sure neuer void sure god word made heauen earthe nothing lerne diligently thankful heart knowledge inestimable benefit pray yt god holy spirite may kepe ye truth word receiue euerlasting life christ sonne father holy ghost honour glorie euer euer amen sonday next easter comonly called palme sondaye pthe gospell math xxvi came passe iesus hadde finished sayinges sayd vnto disciple ye knowe two dayes shalbe easter sonne man shall bee delyuered ouer crucified assembled together chief priestes scribe elder people vnto palace high priest whiche called caiphae healde counsell myght take iesus subtiltie kill hym said holy day lest vprore amonge people iesus bethanie house symon leapor came vnto hym woman hauynge alabaster boxe precious oyntment powred head sat boorde disciple saw indignatio saying wherto serueth wast oyntment might haue ben well sold geuen poore iesus vnderstode sayd vnto trouble ye woman hath wroughte good woorke vppon ye haue poore alwayes ye shall haue alwayes hath caste oyntment body bury ueryly say vnto wher euer gospell shalbe preached worlde shall also tolde hath done memoriall one twelue whiche called iudas iscarioth wente vnto chefe priestes sayde vnto wyll ye geue wyll delyuer hym vnto appointed vnto hym xxx piece syluer tyme foorth sought oportunitie betraye hym first daye sweete bread disciple came iesus saying wylt thou prepare thee eate passeouer sayde goo citie suche man say vnto hym master saith tyme hande wyll kepe easter thee disciple disciple dyd iesus hadde appoynted made redy passeouer euen come sat downe twelue dyd eate sayde ueryly saye vnto one shall betray exceadynge sorowfull beganne euery one saye vnto hym lorde aunswered sayd dyppeth hande dyshe shall betraye sonne man truely goeth writen hym wo vnto man sonne man betrayed hadde bene good man yf bene borne iudas whiche betrayed hym aunswered sayde master sayd vnto thou hast sayde eating iesus toke bread geuen thanks brake gaue disciple said take eate body toke cup thanked gaue saying drynk ye bloud whiche new testament shed many remission sinnes say vnto drinke hense forth fruite vine tree vntyll daye shall drinke newe father kyngdom sayde grace went vnto mount oliuete saide iesus vnto ye shalbe offended night writtene wyll smyte shepherd shepe flock shalbe scattered abrode risen wil go galile peter answered saide vnto hym thoughe men offended thee yet wyll offended iesus saide vnto hym uerily saye vnto thee night befor cocke crowe thou shalte denye thryse peter saide vnto hym yea though shoulde dye thee yet wyll denye thee lykewyse also sayde disciple thenne came iesus theym vnto farme place whiche called gethsemane sayde vnto disciple sytte ye whyle go praye yonder tooke hym peter two sonnes zebede beganne waxe sorowfull heauye saide iesus vnto soule heauye euen vnto deathe tary ye heare watche wente littell farther felle flatte face praied sayinge father possible let cuppe passe neuerthelesse thou wilte came vnto disciple founde slepe sayde vnto peter coulde ye watche one houre watche praye ye enter temptation spirite willyng fleshe weake wente awaye one praied saying father cup may passe away except drinke thy wyl fulfylled came found sleepe agayne theyr eye heauye left wente agayne prayed thirde tyme saying wordes commethe disciple sayde vnto sleepe nowe take rest behold houre hande sonne man trayede handes sinner ryse let v goyng beholde hande doth betray whyle yet spake loe iudas one number twelue came hym greate multitude swordes staues sent chief priest elder people betrayed hym gaue token saying soeuer kysse holde hym faste forthe came iesus sayde hayle maister kyssed hym iesus sayd vnto hym frend wherfore art thou come came layde handes iesus toke hym beholde one whiche iesus stretchede hande drewe sworde stroke saruaunt hye priestes smote eare saide iesus vnto hym put vp thy sword sheathe take sworde shall perysh sword thinkest thou pray father shall geue euene nowe twelue legion angel shall scripture fulfylled thus muste houre sayde iesus multitude ye come thiefe swordes staues take sat dayly teachyng temple ye toke done scripture prophetes myght fulfylled disciple forsoke fled toke iesus led caiphas hye priest scribe elder wer assembled peter folowed afarre vnto hie priest palace went sat seruants se end chief priest elder counsel sought false witnes iesus put hym death founde none yea many false witness came yet found none last came two fals witness sayd felowe said able destroy temple god buyld agayn thre day chief priest arose said vnto answerest thou nothing doo beare witnes thee iesus held peace chief priest answe red said vnto hym charge thee liuynge god thou tell v whether thou christ sonne god iesus said vnto hym thou hast said neuerthelesse saye vnto herafter shal ye se sonne man sytting right hande power commynge cloudes skye hye priest rent clothes saying hath spoken blasphemye nede wytnesses behold nowe ye haue heard blasphemie thynke ye aunswered sayde hee woorthye dye spit face buffeted hym fistes smote hym face palme handes saying tell v thou christ smote thee peter sate without court damosel came hym sayinge thou also wast wyth iesus galilee hee denyed saying wote thou sayest gone porche wenche sawe hym sayde vnto thys fellowe also wyth iesus nazareth agayn denyed othe sayinge know man whyle came vnto hym stoode said vnto peter surely thou art euen one thy speeche bewrayeth thee beganne curse sweare knewe man immediatlye cocke crewe peter remembred woorde iesu whiche sayd vnto hym cocke crowe thou shalt denye thryse wente wept bytterly mornyng come chiefe priestes elder people healde councelle agaynste iesus put death broughte bounde deliuered vnto pontius pilate deputie iudas whiche hadde betraied seing condemned repented hym selfe broughte againe xxx plate siluer chiefe priestes elder sayinge haue synned betrayinge innocent bloode saide v see thou caste downe syluer plate temple departed wente hanged hymselfe chiefe priestes tooke siluer plate saide lawfull put treasure price bloode tooke counsel bought potter field bury stranger wherefore fielde called acheldema fielde bloud vntill day fulfilled whiche spoken hieremye prophete sayinge toke xxx siluer plate price valued whome boughte child israell gaue potter fielde lorde appoynted iesus stode deputie deputie asked sayinge art thou kinge iewes iesus said vnto hym thou sayest hee accused chiefe priestes elder aunswered nothinge saide pylate vnto hym hearest thou howe many witness laye thee aunswered neuer worde somuche deputie meruailed greatly feast deputie wont deliuer vnto people prisoner would desire notable prisoner called barrabas therefore gathered together pylate sayde whether wyll ye geue lose vnto barrabas iesus whiche called christ knew enuy thei deliuered set downe geue iudgement wife sent vnto saying haue thou nothing iust haue suffred day many thing slepe chief priest elder persuaded people aske barrabas destroy iesus deputie answered said vnto whether twaine wil ye let lose vnto said barrabas pilate said vnto shall iesus called christ said vnto let crucified deputie said euil hath done cried saying let crucified pilate saw yt coulde preuaile nothing busynes made toke water washed handes people saying innocent bloud iust person se ye answered people said bloud v childre let barrabas loose vnto scourged iesus deliuered crucified souldiors deputie toke iesus comon hal gathered vnto copany stripped put purple robe platted crowne thornes put vpon head reed right hande bowed knee hym mocked hym sayinge haile kyng iewes whenne hadde spytte vppon tooke reede smote hym head hadde mocked hym tooke roabe hym agayne putte hys owne rayemente hym ledde hym away crucify hym cam found manne cyrene named symon hym compelled beare hys crosse camme vnto place whyche called golgotha say place dead mennes skulles gaue hym vineger myngled gaulle drynke whenne hadde tasted thereof woulde drynke whenne hadde crucifyed hym parted hys garmentes dydde caste lotte myghte bee fulfylled whyche spoken prophete parted garmentes amonge theym vppon vesture dydde caste lotte satte wacched hym sette vp ouer hys head cause deathe written thys iesus kynge iewes twoo theeues crucifyed wyth hym one ryghte hande lefte passed reuyled hym waggynge theyr heades sayinge thou destroyedst temple god dyddest buylde three dayes saue thy selfe thou bee sonne god come downe frome crosse lykewyse also hye priestes mockynge hym wyth scrybes elder sayde saued hym selfe saue bee kynge israell lette hym nowe comme downe crosse wyll beleue hym hee trusted god lette hym delyuer hym nowe yf wyll haue hym hee sayde sonne god thieues also whych crucified hym caste hys teethe frome sixthe hower darkenesse ouer land vntyll nynthe hower aboute nynthe hower iesus cryed wyth lowde voyce sayinge ely ely lamasabathany saye god god haste thou forsaken stode hearde sayde thys manne callethe helias streyghte waye one ronne toke spunge whenne hadde fylled full vineger hee putte reede gaue hym drynke sayde lette bee lette v see whether helias wylle come delyuer hym iesus whenne hee hadde cryed agayne wyth lowde voyce yealded vp ghoste beholde vayle temple dydde rent two partes frome toppe bottome earthe dydde quake stone rente graues dydde open manye bodyes sainctes whiche slepte arose wente graues hys resurrection came holye citie appered vnto many centurion wyth hym watchynge iesus sawe earthequake thynges whiche hapned feared greately saying truly sonne god many woman beholdyng hym farre whyche folowed iesus frome galilee mynistryng vnto hym amonge mary magdalene mary mother iames io mother zebedes child exposition daye redde churche ye haue hearde storye paynefull passyon dreadefulle death louynge lorde swete sauioure iesus christe although passion christ oughte tymes euery dayeby passion deathe christ deliuered frome power sata dylygentely bee remembred v euery christian seyng onely alone precious treasure whereby wee delyuered sette lybertie frome power helle sathan synne deathe damnation c yet aunciente father christes churche tymes paste haue well prouyded shold haue euery yeare certayne peculiar tyme appoynted purpose whyche myght doo exercise eyther priuately publykely meanes shall passion christ dilygently inculked beaten youthe also bee surelye engraffed memorie elder sorte people nowe forasmuch passion christe hathe tymes paste ben meruaylouslye abused vayne meditation cogitation superstitious ignorant hypocrite wyl present leaue suche vanitie declare howe passion deathe christ oughte trewely profytablye bee consydered weyghed pondered vnto oure synguler consolation comforte also vnto amendement lyfe conuersation thys shall bee brought passe wee dilygentlye expende weyghe ponder consyder principall poyntes followyngethe contetes sermo fyrst passion christe secondly prouoked moued hym suffer thys passion thirdly christ bothe outwardly inwardlye suffered fourthly fruite profite hath procured gotten v passion fyrst passion christ none thing vnmeasurable dolour sorowe torment paynewhat passion christ whiche singular vnoutspekable loue toward v synnes hee myghte purge vtterly put away thorow satisfaction outwardly body inwardly soule susteined suffered tyll laste died crosse shalbe opened declared playnly herafter secondlythe cause moued christ suffer fyue cause moued christ suffer dolorous peinful passion first synne could none otherwise clensed purged put away passion death christ second cause greate vnoutspeakable charitie loue fauor christ heauenly father bore toward v men whiche charitie coulde abyd shoulde perishe damned synnes third cause euerlastyng councell prouidence god wherwith determyned meanes shewe loue deliuer mankynde frome synne gen fourthe cause trewe faithfull promise whiche made tymes paste oute whiche afterwarde foloweth blyndnes indignation iewes whiche fyfte cause touchyng fyrst cause mean synne holy prophete esaie speaketh manerthe fyrst cause wounded euen vnto death synnes broken piece wickedness esa wordes prophete declarech wherfore christ euyll handled greuously punished verily owne synne onely begotten derely beloued sonne god neuer committed synne neither euer found guyle mouth1 pet yea synne thyn myne iniquitie wounded broken peces therfore saith prophet sinne saith synne men suffer die whe one take vpon infirmity disease must also die sinnes wickedness esa prophete saith afore recited chapter lord hath laid iniquitie v vpon hym lytle prophete speaking person god sayth synne people haue striken smitten ende chapter saieth bare synnes many paide transgressor dauid like maner complaineth certayne psalm speaking person christ saith rebuke whiche rebuked thee meaneth heuenly father fell psal litle afore paid thing neuer toke haue greuously offended god dishonored holy name greatly obscured glorie must christ pay satisfie make amendes it1 pet therfore saith peter fyrst epistle christ suffred one synnes iuste vniust herof doth folow iewes whiche lyued tyme neither souldiors yet pilate herode c gilty passion deth christe rom also sort v whyche without exception haue synned oure synnes christ slayne nayled crosse neyther wee better thenne crucified hym althoughe iewes dydde knowe hym sonne god otherwyse would haue crucified lorde glorye yet euen malyce enuie agaynst hym cor layde hand hym gyltlesse manne accused hym flewe hym hadde neuer come poynte synnes ben whyche hee stryken esa wounded slayne lykewise made hym serue oure synnesour syn cause christ deth hym much sorow iniquity therefore lette v bee angrye myserable caytife iudas pylate herode cayphas anna c maner heretofore hathe bene yea rather lette euery man angrye wyth selfe accuse hym selfe impute fault hym selfe vnto hym whych synnes dyd cast christ innocent lamb god horrible intollerable payne te seconde cause excedynge great charitiethe seconde cause loue mercye god whyche shewed vnto v miserable men wicked synners without merite desert behalfe rom wherwyth heauenly father beyng prouoked spared begoteen sonne sainct paule sayth v delyuered vp euen vnto death1 iohn declareth saint iohn epistle saying thyng hath loue god appeared sente onely begotten sonne worlde myght lyue thorough hym thys loue loued god loued v sent sonne make satisfaction oure synnes christe hym selfe saythe iohn god hathe derely loued worlde hath geuen hys onely begotten sonne ende beleue hym shoulde peryshe haue lyfe euerlastynge thys charytie loue moued christ alsoo obeye hys father thys behalfe came world toke oure synnes vpon hym prophete esaie saeith loue fauour hath redemed esa rom paule saith god setteth forth loue meruailously towarde v yet synners christ dyed v christ hym self saith man hath greater loue thys iohn manne shoulde geue lyfe frendes place holy scripture tofore alledged appeareth euidently seconde cause death christ loue god towarde mankynde whome oure miserable wretched state greatly moue strike tender compassion sent onely begotten sonne whyche also loue towarde man philip obeyed hys father wyll euen vnto deathe moste ignominious spitefull death ye crosse worlde gaue hym ouer handes synners death passion myght delyuer v euerlasting death damnation wherof may learne loue one bee mynded one christe mynded towarde v epistle thyng dothe iohn admonyshe teache v epistle saieth haue knowen loue gaue lyfe v ought geue liues brother paule also epistle philippian exhorteth v example christ shold humble selues serue one euen christ serued v thirde cause euerlastynge councelle prouidence god act vnoutspeakable wisdome determined euerlastynge delyuer mankynd death sonne world made peter sermon testifieth wher many wordes crucifying christ saith thus hym christ haue ye taken handes vnrighteous persos deliuered ye determinate councel foreknowledge god haue crucified slayne christe himselfe gospell telleth aforehande many place geueth disciple forewarning passion death shal chaunce comme vnto euerlasting councell decree heauenly father iohn said also vnto pilate thou shouldest haue power ouer excepte geuen thee aboue fourth cause faith trueth godthe iiii cause councel determined euerlasting god wold haue kept secret make open many time promised sauiour many place scripture holy prophetes paule testifieth epistle promes wolde god ye euerlasting truth performe rom according promes sende sauiour suffer crucifyed slaine witnesseth peter ye chronicle ye apostle actes writte blessed luke god saith hath performed thinges act whiche declared mouth prophetes christe suffer c christe also speaketh thus resurrection two disciple iourneying towarde emaus necessarie thinges shoulde fulfilled luk written lawe moises prophetes psalmes testimony passion christ scripture olde testament ye may easelye see euagelicall historie passion death christe whiche wolde wyshe diligentlye note confirmation faith behalfe last cause induration excecation andthe v cause blyndnes ye iewes thorow great cotumacie stubburnes thorow impenitecie vnrepetaut heart forsaken god punished blinded yt heare vnderstad see eye discerne nothynge esa iohn act written scripture meanes flewe sonne god prouoked fyerce vengeance hote wrath god apostle sayth wrath god comme euen vttermost althoughe god euerlastinge determined sonne christ shoulde suffer dye could none otherwise god decreed yet iewes excused founde cause death hym act although know sonne god yet knewe certentie godly innocent man whome mere enuye malice slewe pilate againste hym selfe testified saying fynde cause death hym therfore sought thyng iohn god whiche appointed sonne suffer dye sufferance death myghte deliuer beleue synne death deuill hell resurrection myght glorifyed become moste worthie renoume satan mebers scribe phariseyes sought thyng euen slea christe bringe christ shame vtterly roote hym remembraunce hym doctrine might mention made hym wicked iewes thorow enuie blinded heart vngracious coucel executed contrary theyr wyll deuice decree determination heauenly father wherby thorowe mercie christ dying health saluation chaunced many beleue yea vugodlye iewes worthelye blynded deceaued purpose aduaunced christ whome determined vtterly destroye vnto glorie written lorde bringeth councell heathen naughte psal maketh deuices people none effect councell lorde shall endure euer thoughtes hearte generation generation earnestlye consider cause shall see miserable damnable synners verely euen suche coulde none otherwise saued christe v saluation muste neees dye yea ignominious spitefull death crosse shall see moste brenninge heart incomparable fyre loue heauely father sonne christ hauing regard synnes yet enemy died v shold perishe synnes moreouer see faithfull true god isgod performeth euer promiseth wordes promise take place procede violence force power strength crafte suttiltie deuill worlde heauen earthe shall sonner fall perishe come naughte one iote title god worde shalbe founde vntrue false first learne lawesynne haynous sighte god howe greate horrible thynge synne eye god maiestie abolishing wherof onely innocent sonne god must scourged dye bytter ignominious spiteful death yea onely take awaye mennes synnes second learne gospell louing gentle mercifull hearte god toward v whiche v saluation sent begotten sonne incomparable treasure world suffred nayled crosse third learne assuredly truste beleue promise god feare vngodly wicked persecutours forasmuche see hath faithfully abundantly performed sonne euer promised hath confounded brought shame deuill child worlde hath made frustrate voyde deuices councels imagination muche thought worke vtterly kyl confounde extinguish christ haue moste aduaunced christe vnto great honour glorie meanes brought passe faithfull shall receaue saluation crucified christe howe could satan stifnecked phariseyes thincke christ death vnto life buriall vnto resurrection ignominie contempt vnto glorie honoure shoulde brought made king ruler ouer creature heauen earth mightie lorde god performe promise confounde worlde god deuill doth shall euen vnto ende worlde followeth third thingof christes paynes inwardlye outwardly ought consider passion christ howe great paine affliction christe suffered inwardly outwardly ye externall passion outward suffring haue abundantly euagelical history rede taken spitted whypped beaten crowned thornes last crucifyed put death inwarde passion suffrynge hearte conscience must striue death eye hell deuill luke writeth gospell maner luc agonie prayed longer sweat lyke droppes blood tricklynge downe grounde whiche wordes excedyng greate horror torment whiche christ suffered conscience may estemed iudged horrible sight death sinne toke hel deuil hym seing sweate contrary al reason nature bluddye came hym againe cofortour creatour worlde cast necessitie feare father sent angel vnto conforte luke aforesaid place doth also testifye stryffe death fearefull beyond measure taketh awaye strength nature see condemned person whiche sodenlye taken put vnto death meruelous torment anger appeareth til nature hath made selfe captiue death payne death selfe may iustly seme nothyng comparison great agonie trouble feare excedyng greate vnmeasurable christe bloudy sweate came doth manifestly declare whiche thing neuer done hearde calamitie fearefulnes afterwarde wonderfully encreased hanging vpon crosse forsaken disciple frendes mocked scorne spitefully rayled enemyes somuche suche agonie cried vnto heauenly father sayinge god god hast thou forsake wherof may rede large xxij psalme dauid whiche psalme prophete hath exactly painted set forth bytter complaintes afflicted conscience christe miserable forsaken psalm also thou shalt fynde angore affliction synnes let v lerne sayde highe hatred greate displeasure extreme wrathe god beareth synne muche woulde spare begotten dearely beloued son yet forgeue seinge toke vpon cause men sin may see prophete esaye paule sayeth esa rom spared onely begotten sonne signified christ also spake woman wise moyste tree shall done seare drie tree though say learne luke whiche beare men syns selfe innocent righteous holy punishmentes ye haue deserued shall chaunce vnto nature synners wycked nothing good therfore christ warneth woman wepe vpon selues sinnes deserued payne punishment nowe must suffer consideration wherof peter sayth1 pet righteous shall scaslye saued shall sinner vngodly appeare god hath plainly euidetly set forth eye christ anger wrath displeasure sinne seinge suffred highe goodnes innocencie wisedome iustice euen onely begotten sonne come thereof extreme pouertie paine contempt ignominie though ye greatest enemie god hath suche one worthy liue groud yea god shew self toward thoughe geuen ouer euer euer wold neuer reconciled vnto christe miserablye complaineth xxij psalme al came passe men sinnes whiche christe tooke vpon horribly shal god auenge sin naturally prone bent vnto sinnesynners cane none otherwise sinne wickedly seing declared seuerely sonne notwithstanding singuler delight great pleasure howe greuously shall punishe math whiche confesse sinnes yea whiche wilbe counted holye righteous wyl meanes receaue christe sufficient sauiour perfecte redemer purge put away sinneshippocrites rather cleaue owne righteousnes owne workes merites intercessios therfore let true faithfull christian diligently cosider matter study labour beware sinne wrath god seing coste sonne god price lyfe seinge also aduoydinge enforced suffer greuous payne greate bytter sorowe laste moste ignominious shamefull death crosse meanes mighte apeace wrath god kyndled againste man synne delyuer man synne reconcile man heauenly father make enheritour euerlasting glorie fourthly let v consider fruites profites passion death christ ioye comfortethe fruites christes passio death verely greate infinite innumerable diligently large wayghed pondered considered christe true wheat corne iohn wherof himselfe speaketh gospell iohn sayinge verely verely saye vnto except wheate corne fall groude die abideth alone dye bring forth much fruite many fruites declare yea cheife principall knowen perfectly beleued man shall lyghtly wauer conscience yet despaire thorowe pusillanimitie wekenes minde shalbe conforted lyfted vp sure hope merites christes passion alwayes stand firme constante assaultes enemie first fruite christes passion christe god man death hath redemed deliuered v curse lawethe firste fruites christes passion seinge hearte man nature euil man doth good sorte v iudgement god synners lyars curse lawe meanes cometh vpon v condempneth v despisers transgressours lawe gene psal rom psal deut saith cursed euery one abideth thynges written boke lawe maye curse iudgement lawe hath christe deliuered v hath taken vpon cause satiified lawe many put confidence faith truste shoulde make free suche cursechrist passion hath deliuered v curse lawe sentence iudgement lawe death hath redemed deliuered v lawe condemne v gala sainct paule testifieth epistle galathians sayinge christe hath deliuered v curse lawe whyle became accursed sake nowe howe christe became accursed deut paule declareth large sayth written cursed euery one hangeth tree sentence lawe generall ouer crucified put death crosse among christe also came esa outwardly suffered ignominie curse lawe reputed taken iudged malefactour wycked person christe suffrynge vnworthely outwarde curse condenatio law ouercame vtterly put away ye inward curse codemnatio law yt euer ca bynd v hurte many beleue christ although outwardly wee cursed euill spoken despised condemned chaunced vnto christe muste nedes likewise come passe v must made coformable like vnto christ bearing crosse yet inwardly free blessed rom curse lawe preuaile againste v galat neither lawe selfe accuse v condemne v god thorowe christ v againste v lykewise reade sainct paules epistle galathians fulnes tyme comme god sent sonne made woman made subiect lawe might deliuer bounde lawe christe sake fel lawe saye payne lawe might deliuered obtaine portion enheritaunce e whiche due sonnes god wherof prophete esaye also sayeth ye frely bought ye shall frely bedeliuered peter also sayth1 pet deliuered precious blood christ innocent lambe god second fruit profit passion christ made free sinnethe second fruit christ passion maner one first free fro lawe also free sinne synne offend synne imputed vnto v brought againste v law therfore saith blessed iohn epistle blood christ maketh v cleane synne1 iohn paule epistle hebrues sayth blood christ purgeth conscience deade workes serue lyuing god heb corinthian sayeth2 cor god made hym knewe sin synne sake might made righteousnes whiche alowed god christe sake made sinne say sacrifice oblation synnedeliueras fro syn passion christ meanes hath reco ciled v vnto god made v god vnrighteous righteous sinneful wicked perfect good third frut christes passionnow forasmuch free curse lawe sinne foloweth also free safe death deuil hel whiche thirde fruite profit christes passion seing death stipend rewarde synne rom apostle sayeth synne abrogated taken awaye v passion death christedeliuerance fro deathe deuill hell foloweth death also taken awaye hath power againste v therfore doth christe threaten death prophete ose sayeth death thy death seinge christe true lyfe iohn could ouercome death ye noble coquerour valiant victoure death toke awaye stynge death flewe hell christe selfe saith aforesaid prophet osee wil deliuer hel death wil make safe satan also cast iohn christe sayth gospel iohn execute v paine hell death1 pet al comme passe christ hath fulfilled law v purged sinnes sprinklyng blood fourth fruite profite passio christ isthe fourth fruit christ passion deliuered law sin death hel deuil also thorow ye merites christ passio receaued grace fauour god hath satisfyed father v hath reconciled v vnto paule testifieth sayinge rom yet enemy reconciled vnto god death sonne again2 rom god hath reconciled v vnto hym iesus christ one god father hath deliuered v power darcknes coll hath translated v kyngdome welbeloued sonne yea death christe reconciled set one god fatherwe reconciled god father ye passio death christ also wyth angel heauenly spirites father thorowe sonne fauoreth v mercifull vnto v al creature thorowe concorde perfecte agrement v paule saith pleased father fulnes shoulde dwell hym coll reconcile thynges vnto hymselfe pacifying blood crosse thing heauen earth ye time farre enemy minde thorow euil workes hath nowe reconciled body fleshe death shoulde make holy blameles without fault sight many place declared reconciled set one father made heires kingdome heauen thorowe christe fyfte fruit profite passion christe newe testamentthe fyfte fru christ passion whiche promiseth vnto v bequethe vnto v remission synnes sealed confirmed death blood christe written mediatour new testament thorow death whiche chaunced redemption transgression firste testament heb whiche called mighte receaue promesse eternall inheritauncein newe testament confirmed death christ bequethed vnto v remission sinnes whersoeuer testament muste also death maketh testament testament taketh authoritie men dead value long made liue wordes euidently appeareth newe testament wherin haue remission sinnes sealed ratifyed death christ mat cor therfore doth christ cal cuppe cuppe newe testament bloud shedde remission sinnes vi fruit christ passionlast christ death passion hath goten vnto v fruite profit crosse suffrance pleaseth god cursyng payne holy blessynge mortifying olde adam wicked fleshe meanes tribulation persecution death holy acceptable sacrifice vnto godour suffrings please god comme passe thorow merite christ death paule sayth romains whiche knewe rom also ordeined shoulde lyke fashioned vnto shape sonne might firste begotten sonne among many brother sacrifice christ death pure acceptable sacrifice god psal likewise death al christian shalbe holy sacrifice god dignitie selfe christ whose fulnes haue receued eue grace grace forasmuch knowe fruit profite also whole worke iohn christ hath broughte passe passion death let v nowe last learne also howe maye made partaker fromhensforth frame oure lyfe compose maners agreable therunto maye folowe christe oure sauiour knowen lyke vnto hym yea disciple uerely shall partaker benefites christ fruites profites passiohow may made partaker frutes christ passion whe beleue damned synners againe christe euen mery loue fauour vnto oure profit singuler comoditie without merite deserte suffered euer suffered item none mediatour worke christ alone merite saued rom passion death resurrection life righteousnes innocencie christ euer hath oure owne frely geuen vnto v oure heauenly father wherfore sainct iohn sayth gaue power made sonnes god iohn euen many beleue name certen sure none sonne god except holy godlye righteous selues oure owne strengthes workes therefore sayth christe geueth vnto v foloweth christe haue receaued neither could deserue haue oure workes whereby chaunce vnto v verely faithby fayth made son god iohn saith gaue power made sonnes god eue many beleue name power haue yt beleue owne workes righteousnes name christ iesus saye sauiour euen shoulde beleue alone true sauiour without nothinge iohn without whose merites workes although neuer holy good damnable cursed thus faith thinges faithfaith christ obtaynethe good thinges hande god yea fayth alone obtayne euer christ hath partaker innocencie holines righteousnes wysedome perfectio kingdome heauen euerlasting lyfe faith worcke therefore nobly recompensedthe nature faythe hande organ instrument wherewith take laye hande christe oure sauiour thinge prepared geuen purchassed v fayth doth take embrace benefite cleueth surely vnto doubteth christ hath obtayned performed al thing christ frely geuen vnto v sauiour rom ye father hath set forth vnto v mercistocke whosoeuer wil haue enioye euerlasting saluatiother saluation fayethe christ alone must haue enioye christ none therfore ought laye hand strog vnshaken faith wil laye hand receaue one alone omni sufficiet sauiour sticke owne workes righteousnes wtout faile shalbe da ned euer euer iohn ende haue christ geuen v god father oure sauiour haue power made sonnes god meane al suche beleue name denie forsake selfes workes ioye reioyce glory name christe wyshing desieringe name made holy acceptable presence god maiestie haue thus thorow faith confidence christ challenged vnto v christ meritesthe lyfe maners christe folowed true christian fruites commodity profites gat eyther hys lyfe death oure owne proper goodes let v also endeuour oure selfes set christ afore v example whose lyfe conuersation whose actes dedes oure lyfe conuersation actes dedes ought folowe although heard afore deserue nothyng oure workes yet maye wythout good workes lifechriste sauiour example therfore let v frame oure lyfe euer example chrsit whome scripture setteth foorth vnto v two maner wayes fyrste sauiour principall parte righteousnes secondlye example rom wyth hym shoulde mortifye slea olde adam sainct paule sayth manye v baptised christe baptised death saye shoulde crucifye wyth hym oure fleshe wycked lustes suppresse geue place lewde appetite fleshe declare selues true christian apostle sayethe galat belong vnto christ haue crucified fleshe affectes lustes therof truly knoweth synne wrath god synne howe dearely christ boughte v thereforethe propertie true christian payde oure raunsome might deliuered wil vndoubtedlye hate synne verye botome hearte shall able resiste wil maruellously trouble yea wil inwardly sory study meanes possible maye represse synne able tame restrayne wicked fleshe truly beleue howe louinge merciful getle god hath shewed hymselfe toward thorow christe sauiour god hath pleasured hym frely without deseruing shall greatly prouoked styrred vp laboure study math maye serue please god againe sake loue neighbour whome god hath commended vnto hym onely frende also though vtter ennemie rom christ receaued passion death saued hym euen enemie galat doth true diligent earnest consideratio passio christe worke v true fruites good workes saye mortifying crucifying olde adam paule saieth haue put christ meaneth faith or2 cor christ haue crucifyed fleshe withall concupiscence yea man christ newe creature passion crosse death olde man rom made like christe passion death hath god ordayned thus breifly haue declared ought trulye consider passion christ fruites cause therof passion deth ar deliuered sathan synnethe benefit haue goten passion death christe curse law desperation death hell wrathe god euerlastyng damnation translated remoued vnto heauenly countrey glorious kyngdome moste glorious god last opened vnto ought faith take chalenge vnto v moste singuler inestimable benefites forme frame conuersation lyfe example christ may outwardly appere thankfull disciple christ faithful louing child heauenly father muche doo owne strengthe power let v moste humbly pray vnto god christ iesus sake may geue v strength spirite may liue pure faith vnfained loue great day lord appere fautlesse among dere welbeloued child god heare mouthe suffered dyed v moste swete comfortable saying1 cor come ye blessed father possesse kyngdome whych prepared begynnyng worlde lord christ alone sauiour perfect redemer god father holy ghost moste swete conforter honor glorie praise euer amen gospell easter day iohn xx fyrst day sabbothes came mary magdalen early yet darke vnto sepulchre saw stone taken away graue shee ran came simon peter disciple iesus loued sayth vnto haue taken away lorde graue tell haue layde hym peter therfore went forth disciple came vnto sepulchre ran bothe together disciple dyd outrunne peter came firste sepulchre stowped downe sawe lynnen clothes lyinge yet went came simon peter folowynge hym wente sepulchre sawe lynnen clothes lye ye napkyn head lying lynnen clothes wrapped together place selfe went also disciple whiche came fyrst sepulchre sawe beleued yet knewe scripture shoulde ryse agayne death disciple went away againe theyr owne home exposition muche thys daye accordyng auncient commendable custome christ church celebrate laudable feast worthy memorie moste noble victorious resurrection oure sauioure iesus christthe true kepyng holy dayes mete conuenient speake entreate present true sanctifying halowing feastfull day consisteth true worshippyng god none thing praiers thankes geuing one done exercise worde bothe preachyng readyng therfore tyme wyll make conference according tyme glorious resurrection moste louyng lorde swete sauiour christe iesu conference firste consyder maner resurrection risyng agayn christ frome death vnto lyfe declare vtilitie profyte fruicte goodnesse moste victorious triumphant resurrection christe hathe broughte vnto v haue fore shewed passion deathe touchynge fyrstethe resurrection christ lette v thynke resurrection christ common resurrection frome deathe resurrection lazarus besydes thys iohn christe rose agayne fleshe corporallye also spiritually became lorde deathe ouercame broughte hym euerlastynge lyfe beleue risen agayne hym haue ouercome deathe resurrection hath onely obteined temporall life also spirituall lyfe temporall deathe crosse dyd slea vtterly abolyshe spirituall deathe synne hell lykewise resurrection hath recouered broughte agayne temporall lyfe quietnessechrist rysen two maner way also euerlastynge lyfe perpetuall ioye wherof wee may learne christe rysen agayne twoo manner wayes fyrste fleshe whyche resurrection made hys deade body quicke despised body glorious weake feeble body mightie stronge naturall body supernaturall spirituall resurrection reade many place scripture math marc luc iohn act among paule hath wordes chronicle apostle actes speaketh maner shewe vnto ye promise whiche made vnto ye father god hath fulfilled child euen vnto v raised vp iesus written first psalme thou art sonne day haue begotten firste epistle corinthias saith christ resurrection sene fiue hudred brethren1 cor moreouer shewed xii many brother maye see playnly written euangelistes secondly christ also inward spirituall resurrection escaped horror death hell syn wrath god came vnto euerlasting ioy life health peace gladnes glorieth speaketh ye mouth prince like prophet sayinge thou haste made wayes lyfe knowen thou shalt fill ful gladnes thy countenance psal againe thou hast turned heuines ioye thou hast put sackclothe girded gladnes psal ar gratulations reioycinges thankes geuynges god heauenly father hath deliuered sonne christ ye horror hell death also faithfull christian whereof shall speake largely hereafter resurrection christ according historie rose easter day betymes morning sonne vp howe woman found sepulchre emptie howe conforted aungell admonished resurrection diuers thing appertaining vnto resurrection christ ar diligently written foure euangelistes ye selues haue hertofore heard red therfore time speake nothinge matter rather declare set forth vnto profites fruites christ hath gotten v glorious royal resurrection ope vnto ought enter newe lyfe christ come vnto matter let v speake somwhat innocencie godhead christe whiche myghtily brake chawes hellchriste innoc nte free synn braste piece paunche death valiantly victoriously triumphantly rose agayne frome deathe nowe muche christ poyntes pure innocente vtterly wythout synne deathe hell coulde meanes ouercome hym rom seynge death rewarde synne apostle saythe christe hadde synne doothe ryghte well followe death power ouer christ assaulted hym wythoute cause therfore deathe loste hys ryghte wythoute cause hee abused christe beynge innocente free frome synne innocencye therefore christe cause deathe hell onely haue power ouer synners rom synne entred deathe worlde coulde retayne holde deuoure hym hee muste needes retourne vnto lyfe ryse agayne frome deathe besides innocencie christe also thischriste true naturall god true naturall sonne god therfore coulde bee retained holden deathe yet helle kynde myserie hee hym selfe glorieth reioyceth thys power sayinge hathe power geue ouer hys lyfe also take agayne ioan man takethe hys lyfe frome hym geueth ouer hym self whiche none thyng yf saye god lord death lyfe handle selfe lyste therefore saint paule hys epistle romaine writeth thys declared bee sonne god rom whenne rose agayne frome deathe manne escape deathe dauid saythe manne shall lyue psal heb see deathe saincte paule hebrues sayeth menne muste needes one dye commeth iudgement seyng christe onely man also god creator lyfe geuer creature ioan yea lyfe selfe hym selfe testifyeth gospell sainct iohn possible deathe helle retayne ouercome hym peter recordeth chronicle apostle actes saying whome meaneth christ god hath raysed vp act loosed sorowes death impossible shoulde bee holden seyng holy one god could abyde helle neyther coulde fleshe see corruption psal peter strongly proueth dauid easye thynge aunswere question howe maye passion deathe christe syght infernall damnation wherin christe short tymequ stion could sufficient satisfaction synnes whole worlde notwithstandyng seuere iudgemente god ought haue ben punyshed euerlasting payne endles damnation aunswere satisfaction incomparable forceanswere might strength power hath meruailous energie perfection person christ seing christe true god true man god head manhode ioyned one person yet toke vpon worke redemption peynthe sufficienc christes sacrifice christ god man suffred ought worthily iudged taken suche excellencie dignitie great inestimable price ought estemed dede sufficiently great large inough vttermoste synnes whole world synne man wherwith noble maiestie god cotemned dishonored ought punished perpetuall euerlastyng painenote well like maner ye punishmet ye sonne god toke vpon ought vndoubtedly sufficiente full perfect al yt beleue seke saluation blessed glorious name deuine maiestie great glorie yt worthily al offend suffer euerlasting pain cam great ignominie torment supplied duty shold haue euerlastyng ioy gladnes enioy world without end ephe seing christ iesus ye true son god one substace glory ye father hath offred oblation swete smelling sacrifice god death passion hath satisfied sinnesthe sacrifice christes dethe abydeth ful str nght euer reason yt worthynes person god man shold also euerlasting sufficient euermore consider great worthye hygh infinite euerlasting person susteined pain great worthy high infinite euerlasting worke redeption satisfaction wrought christ must endure remaine euer euer full force strength many repent beleue name forasmuch wee know christe innocencie godheade rose agayne frome deathe vnto lyfe wyl briefly reherse fruicts profytes benefites hath purchased gotten deserued v victorious triumphaunt glorious resurrection soeuer christe hys deathe passion hathe gotten deserued v dydde hee afterwarde receaue hys resurrection broughte wyth hym fruites christes resurrectionthe fruites christes resurrection doo muche differ frome fruites hys passion wee wylle therefore speake entreate theym brefely presente muche wee haue somewhat largely spoken handeled passyon christ sauioure fyrste fruitethe fyrste fruicte profyte christes resurrection wee haue remyssion synnes althoughe feele vsremission synnes vtterly free frome christe dyed v yet remayned deathe whyche muste needes haue comme passe yf hee coulde haue satisfied synnes followethe hee hys resurrection broughte wyth hym remyssion synnes gaue vnto v blessed paule proueth hys epistle corinthians1 cor sayenge christe bee rysen agayne frome dead thenne faythe vayne stylle youre synnes agayne nowe christe rysen agayn deade beynge fyrste fruites wer fallen sleape manne came deathe man commeth resurrection dead adam dye lykewyse christ shall receaue lyfe1 cor osee heb afterwarde apostle mocketh death saieth deathe thy stynge stynge death synne power synne lawe thankes bee god whyche hathe geuen v victorie thorough lorde iesus christe herof euident christ death hath slayne synne hearde sermon passion hys resurrection hee hathe broughte hym remission synnes faythfull wyth hym rysen agayne frome synne frome hensefoorth synne hurte theym althoughe whyle thys wycked mortall bodye free christ brought wyth hym oute hys graue remission synnes seconde fruicte foloweth fyrste thisthe second fruite christe resurrection hathe abrogated lawe saye hathe delyuered sette libertie conscience itabrogacion lawe hath geuen heartes peace tranquillitie quietnesse seynge christ resurrection hath slain deathe whyche stypende synne rom hathe brought hym vnto v remission synnes necessarily foloweth yt hath also abolished strength synne whyche lawe accuse v therfore sayth paule1 cor lawe spirite saye gospelle whiche quickeneth hathe delyuered frome power synne death quickenyng gospell rom gospelle quickeneth makethe alyue hathe hys strength power efficacie resurrection christe christe hadde rysen agayne1 cor oure preachynge faith ben vayne third fruict christ resurrection isthe thirde fruite resurrection deliuered death consideration whereof paule glorieth prophet osee saying deathe swalowed vp victorye1 cor osee though saye glorious victorious resurrection christ hath swalowed vpdeliueraunce deathe deuoured abolyshed death death hensforth doo nothyng v cruel terrible sight none thyng hornet stynge whyche looketh terribly wynges maketh great dreadfull noyse yet hath lost styng pricke hurt wounde man sauior christ sayth resurrection life beleueth mee although dead ioan yet shall lyue lyueth beleueth shal neuer dye whiche wordesdeathe faythefull thin geelles sleape christ signifieth deathe faithfull nothyng ell sleape sleapeth lyueth may ryse agayne lykewise beleueth although dye corporally yet abydeth deathe returneth vnto lyfe yea death vnto gatenote well wherby passeth oute thys myserable sorowfull lyfe vnto trewe euerlastyng lyfe raysed vp frome thys sleape euer waketh3 reg reg act abydeth alyue worldes without ende therefore holy scripture callethe corporall death faithful sleape rede many place old new testament dauid ezechias stephen holy sainctes fourth fruitethe fourthe fruict christes resurrection deuastation destruction helle nowe free safe frome euerlastynge pestilence curse1 cor yf christ saieth sainct paule rysen agayne whyche fallen slepe christthe distruction hell vtterly loste whyche wordes foloweth blessed whyche sleape christe muche hee rysen agayne frome death therefore dothe bothe prophete osee blessed apostle sainct paule mocke helle osee cor saye helle thy victorie apostle streyghte waye addeth thankes bee vnto god whyche hathe geuen v victorie thorowe iesus christe christe remayned deathe perished apostle sayth muche remayned death therefore loste hym escaped helle made ioyfull blessed fyfth fruicte profite christes resurrection isthe fyftefruite christ risynge agayne frome dead hathe gotten v victorie ouer sathan kyngdome membres also written heb christe deathe hath expelled whyche hadde lordshyppe ouer death sayuictori ouer satan kingdom deuyll hee myghte delyuer theym whyche throughe feare deathe theyr lyfe tyme subdued vnto bondage christ resurrection hathe taken away power sathan exercyse hys tyrannye againste elect chosen people god christe hathe taken hym prysoner luc taken hys weapon awaye hym bounde hym vtterly weakened hee hathe power thys hys victorye dydde hee hys resurrection myghtylye declare ledde awaye captyue ruler helle saynct paule sayth coloss hath spoyled rule power hath made shewe theym openly hath triumphed ouer owne person victorie sata recorded certen psalm dauid wher comaded psal yt ye gate dores shoulde bee sette open kynge glorie maye come ruler prince hell demand saye thys kynge glorye prophete aunswereth sayenge lorde hostes kynge glorie victorie christe also speakethe certayne parable sayenge stronge manne armed watcheth hys house thynges hee possesseth peace stronger hee commeth vpon hym ouercommeth hym luc hee taketh frome hym hys harneys wherein hee trusted deuydeth hys goodes lykewyse deuyll possessed world shewed hys powera declaracion ye parable mainteynynge false worshyppynge god dyuers kyndes idolatrye thys hee stablyshed hys kyngedome greately encreased swarme wycked damned persones vntyll christ whyche stronger thenne hee inuaded hys kyngedome tooke frome hym hys harneisse armour weapon saye synne deathe wherewith ouercamme whole worlde made spoyle theim meanes deliuered faithfull electe people god oute kingdome sette theim free tirannie power sixt fruict christes resurrection preachynge gospellthe syxte fruite althoughe dydde preache gospell hys disciple hys countreymenne iewes hys deathepreachyng gospell yet gaue hee oute noo commyssion shoulde bee generally vniuersallye preached nation tyll resurrection therefore saieth gospell mathewe power geuen vnto bothe heauen earthe math go ye therefore throughout whole worlde teache nation baptising name father sonne holy ghost shal beleue mar baptised shalbe saued shall beleue shall damned moste noble gyft whiche man able sufficietly expresse esteme hadd ben frustrate voyde yf ben publyshed set foorth abrode rom howe could beleue christe whome hadde hearde wrytten howe shall heare without preacher fayth commeth hearyng hearyng commeth worde god therefore christ suffered victorie ouer death hell also glorious gospell published whole world nation thorow preachyng holy apostle godly doctours teacher inuited bydden called vnto seuenth fruict christ resurrectionthe seuenthe fruite christe wyth rysynge agayne frome death hathe iustified v thorowe faithe hee deathe hath abolyshed put awaye synneiustificacion euen hys resurrection hath brought vnto v ryghtousnes paule saieth rom christe betrayde oure synnes rose agayne oure iustification blessed peter sayth blessed god father oure lorde iesus christe1 pet whyche accordyng abundant mercy begate v agayn vnto lyuely hope iesus christ rose agayne deathe inheritance immortall vndefyled perysheth reserued heauen ar kept power god thorough faythe vnto saluation thus hath christe resurrection made v godly ryghteous thorowe fayth shold onely hym made free frome synne also become holy righteous hym peter saith beleue god thorough hym raised vp dead gaue glorie vnto hym myght haue faith hope toward god eyght fruicte christes resurrection glorious blessednesse eternall lyfe soulesthe eyght fruite whyche foloweth iustification faythe wherof holy apostle paul speaketh hys epistle ephesianseternall lyfe ephe sayenge god whyche ryche mercye hys greate loue wherewyth hee loued v euen whenne wee deade synnes quyckned v together christ grace ye saued raysed v vp together hym made v sytte togyther wyth hym amonge heauen osee prophete osee also saythe shall make v alyue twoo dayes thyrde daye shall rayse v vppe wee maye lyue hys syghte hereof commeth peter calleth christe lorde lyfe confesseth wyth hys mouthe beleueth wyth heart god raysed vp christe act saued thys lyfe euerlastynge saluation christe hys resurrection hath purchased geuen vnto v rom therefore christ sayde mary magdalene shoulde telle hys disciple ioan yt would go vp vnto father father though shoulde saye nowe haue common inheritaunce one father one kyngedome euerlastynge lyfe common v hee sanctifyethe heb sanctifyed one nynte fruitethe laste fruite christes resurrection glorification dignitie mortall body christe resurrection dydde caste awaye frome hym weakenesse mannes bodyethe resrreccion glorificacion bodyes hensefoorthe shoulde bee mortall weake hungrye thyrstie haue infirmity immortall withoute infirmitie weakenesse shall mortall body bee lyke vnto hys glorious bodye resurrection deade shall euer remayne glory honour worldes without ende phil thys speaketh sainct paule sayenge conuersation heauen whens wee looke sauioure euen lorde iesus christe whyche shall transfigure chaunge thys oure vyle bodye hee maye make lyke owne glorious bodye accordyng power wherwyth able make thynges subiecte hymselfe place paule reioyceth wyth christians2 cor haue euerlastyng dwelling place heauen although oure corruptible body destroyed put awaye yf beleue iesus dyed rose agayn1 thess shall god bryng hym fallen sleape iesus shall bee glorifyed christe glorified hys resurrection made hys mortall bodye immortall brought vnto glorie also gaue shewe matter hys disciple mount thabor face dydde shyne sunne math hys garmentes made whiter thenne snowe desyreth heare matter lette hym reade xv chapter saint paules first epist corinthias shall abundatly find christ rose manyfold great fruict hath purchased gotten v glorious resurrection nowe forasmuche haue hearde perfectly knowe great singuler benefites haue receaued victorious triumphant resurrection lorde sauiour iesus christ hath ouercome synne new lyfe death deuyll hell hath made v free safe frome also holy godly rightous thorowe fayth shall haue hym euerlastyng lyfe glorified body becometh v thankfull child christ take vpon v new pure syncere vncorrupt fautlesse lyfe paule exhorteth v epistle romains saying buryed christe baptisme dye rom likewyse christ raised vp death glorie father euen also walke newe lyfe nowe thyng new lyfe eschew sinne doo whiche good godly paul saith foresaid epistle gal ought hensforth serue synne epistle hee sayth christ dyed ende menne whyche lyue shoulde hensefoorth lyue selues hym died rose agayne lykewyse doothe paule reioyce lyueth christ hym exhorteth corinthian cor forasmuche faith christe holye righteous yet remnantes vncleane fleshe synners vnrighteous would purge olde leauyn know ye saith litle leauen wreth whole lumpe dough purge therfore olde leauen ye may new dough ye swete bread christ passeouer offred vp v therfore lette v kepe ioyfull feast olde leauen neyther leauen maliciousnes wickednes wt swete bread purenes trueth whiche wordes paule doth euidentlye expresse require leaue olde vnpure lyfe whiche haue adam spirite begin exercise newe spirituall lyfe vnto whiche christe hath brought v tyme tyme anye olde leauen wyckednes fynde selues purge vtterly cast awaye v euer profession lykewise conuersation maye new doughe swete bread therfore seing risen againe christe colloss let v seke thinges aboue christe sytteth righte hande god saye let v forsake earthye transitorye thingesan exhortacio vnto good life aspire labour forewarde vnto heauenlye euerlastynge thynges resurrection christe benefites therof whiche ye haue heard may fruitefull full efficacie power v newe lyfe christen conuersation maye shewe oure selues thankfeull vnto god proffitable oure neyghbours without enemy christian trueth maye thorowe oure godly honest behauiour conuerted turne idolatrie vnto worshippynge god superstition vnto god pure religion corrupt wicked maners vnto holines purenes lyfe meanes god oure heauenly father maye glorified v whiche vnto ende hath geuen v holy spirite pointes body soule holy righteous luk maye serue hym euen lorde oure god holynes righteousnes day lyfe whome christe lorde holy ghoste prayse honour glorye worldes without end amen first sonday easter pthe gospell iohn xx daye nyght whiche firste daye sabboethes dores shutte disciple assemblede together feare iewes came iesus stode middes sayde vnto peace vnto sayde shewede vnto handes syde disciple glad sawe lorde sayde iesus agayne peace vnto father sente euen sende also sayde wordes breathed sayde vnto receyue ye holy ghoste whosoeuers sinnes ye remit remitted vnto whosoeuers sinnes ye retayne retayned exposition albeit gospell present sondaye manye thinges contained concerninge glorious resurrection oure sauiour christ iesu worthy treated called vnto remembraunce yet forasmuch sonday laste spake abondatly matter sufficiently ynough confirme stablishe oure faith article christ resurrectio haue thougt good present speake matter specially handle wordes christe wyshed peace disciple shewed handes side confirmation fayth resurrection spake vnto said father sent lykewyse send c wordes sauiour christ notable worthy remembred wherewith gaue disciplesthe office preaching committed christes disciple successours committed vnto office teaching preachinge meanes vse fruite death resurrectio cause therof might also knowen obtaine euerlasting saluation matter ben chronicled published set abrode preaching wherfore done commoditie cometh therof faithful beleuers howe coulde haue ben greatly profitable see kingdome pope touchynge historie nothinge wanteth nothing desiredthe scripture oughte preached people preachinge papistes thinges handled christ comandeth matter vnprofitable maner none thing man tell historie kyng alexander iulius cesar great turke suche like therfore ye whole matter cosisteth ye history ye death resurrectio christ brought vnto ye righte vse cometh passe maner christ determineth saieth send father sent father sent christ esaye ye prophete declared log saying e spirit ye lord vpo lord hath anointed sent preache glad ioyefull tydings vnto pore might binde vp wounded heartes yt might preach deliuerance captiue open prison bounde might declare acceptable yere lordechriste sent father preach gospell lykewise faithfull minister commandement wherewith christe sent sayeth maner sendeth disciple sent geueth vnto ministerie office exercised shold teache sorte taught commandement referred vnto doctrine disciple sholde declare christ whiche declared hymselfe maner doctrine esaye describeth setteth forth goodly euident wordes saye christ anointed sent vnto end conforte feareful contrite broken heart poore spirit c doctrine agreable doctrine christ neither hath christ commanded doctrine lawe moyses doctrine moyses isthe doctrine moyses yt suche troubled fearefull shold driuen vnto trouble vnto feare doctrine christe conforte weake heartedthe doctrine christ preache glad ioyfull tydings sorowful brought vnto bryncke desperation behoued christe comme newe commandement doctrine workes whiche also new like neuer sene worlde meane sonne god suffered rose death esaye prophecied doctrine christe euen doth christe sett forth also wordes christe rehersed euangelist breathed vpon saying take holy ghost whose synnes ye shall forgeue forgeuen whose synnes ye shal retaine retayned haue ye right spiritual regiment doth lesse differ ciuile worldly regimenta double regiment spiritual corporall heauen distat earth spirituall regiment righte kynges right prince right lordes haue also regiment consyder marke learnethe spiritual regiment hath synn farre regiment goeth howe wyde stretcheth forth selfe uerely wordes sounde eue wyde brode worlde yet hath nothinge sinne touchinge golde syluer richesse worldly substaunce temporall possession lordshippes farmes parkes dominion suche lyke hath nothinge thinges pertayne vnto worldly ciuile regiment handled temporal ruler emperours kynges prince lordes c appoint shall thoughte moste conuenient mete mayntenaunce conseruation publique weale spiritual regiment ecclesiasticall power apppointed synne wher matter sinne hath regiment power place otherwise hath nothyng muste greatly take headethe minister god worde ought medle temporall affaire make confusion ij regimentes pope byshoppes haue done whiche haue abused spirituall regiment yt haue also gotten vnto temporall regiment ciuill power become temporal lordes yea power make emperours kynges prince lordes c subiectes yea slaues christ gaue neuer commandement disciple neither sent forth medle temporall matter kyngdomes worlde appointed vnto ministerie wordethe office spirituall minister regiment sinne office nothyng el preache gospell christ declare remission sinnes suche penitent broken hearte troubled minde disquieted conscience c retaine holde bynd synnes impenitent stubborne go forth sinne without repentaunce conuertion vnto better lyfe retayning binding sinne hath pope also miserably abused peruertedthe power bynding lo sing synnes wickedly abused pope yea farre otherwise ment appointed ye ministery hath interpreted handled matter though power vertue therof make lawes ye church also ciuile regiment pleaseth meaning christ minister sent christ preach ought prescribe vnto houshold preceptes ploughinge carting maryeng ordring thy famely housholde c god hath geuen reason know thou shouldest behaue thy selfe thynges thou doubt worldly matter iuristes men lawe worldly councellers ciuile wise men lyke right wel supply thy lacke geue good profitable councel behalfe comission committed vnto regiment mine aucthoritie power concerning sinne teache thee thou shalte euer perishe thy sinnes damned excepte thou beleue christ heb iohn embrace strong fayth thine alone sauiour redemer alone hath purged thy conscience dead workes clensed thee thy sinnes precious blood therfore whole somme doctrine perfectly know sinne synne signifieth lordshippes rich kyngdomeswhat synne housholde matter lyke sinne called burden greueth troubleth hearte conscience man god loketh nothyng worlde el fearefull anger god euerlastinge damnation speake true earnest synnes whiche god counteth sinnes iudgement seate deserue euerlastinge damnation fayned forged synnes brought pope byshoppesthe breaking men tradition synne god man kepe faste lawe haue commanded man eate fleshe day haue forbidden moncke weareth monastical cowle rather lay man garment prist marieth wyfe cotrary popyshe folishe booke suche lyke synnes pope god neither ca condemne man forasmuche god lawe neuer forbid synnes deuised antichrist pope antichristian member transgression breakynge whereof ought trouble christen man conscience speake heare synnes whiche synnes dede fained man hath inueted wherin weare borne lyue euen synnes directly againste comademet god whiche god precept beareth witnes tradition men sinnes saith lord shall ye apostle minister ye worde medle either remitte retaine ye gouermet worldly corporal teporall thinges pertayneth nothing vnto neither ought vsurpe iurisdictio behalfe leaue thing holy fully teporall rulersin preacher mouthe sette lyfe death apostle preacher mouth lye synnes worlde power deuil tormentes hell thou arte impenitent wilt repente thee thy sinnes rather delight go forth prouoke maiestie god vnto anger thorowe thy wyckednes retayne thy synnes geue thee ouer deuill euerlasting da nation parte set also euery apostle preacher mouth passion death resurrection christe fruites saluationnote well heauen euerlastyng lyfe respect owne person sentence iudgement pronounce vpon thee whiche deuill himselfe abide commaundement christ thy synnes remitted forgeuen thee thou repent beleue christ suche power suche dignitie authoritiethe word christe minister one lyke power comparison power worlde nothinge euery apostle true disciple christ hath authoritie power geue iudgement whole worlde concerninge eyther remitting retaynyng synne sentence iudgement great force strength thoughe christ hymselfe pronouced wordes place testifie father sent send one thing ecclesiasticall power regiment ouer synne synne called corporall worldly thinge greife disquieting conscience whiche accuseth condemned v god whiche thynge serueth ende deceaued folyshe counterfaite synnes whereof spake discerne whiche synne dede fro whiche syn god thou sholdest desire released folishe doltishe synnes transgression men tradition though thou haddest offended obseruing shoulde also folowe obeying kepynge thou wouldest seke iustified whiche high abhomination god transgression men tradition preceptes codemneth likewise obseruation saueth worshippe vaine sayeth christe math tradition commandements men therfore must marke well diffinition synne whiche lawe god reueleth therefore accuseth condemneth synne lawe god popishe synne vnknowen godwhat synne properly therfore regarded onely synne lawe god forbyddeth thus may see many lye weltring great notorious synnes couetousnes whoredome adultery theafte vsurie anger enuy glotony drunckenes bannynge cursyng blasphemy suche lyke styll remayne frowardly without repentaunce without anye conscience wycked vngodly behauiour sinnes care onely desire may synne perceaued knowen suche sinnes forgeuen vnto belong byndinge retayninge second power whereof christe speaketh suche synnes retayned diuersitie synnestherefore difference made true sinnes diuided sinnes v god god v wil knowledge sorie desire god remission forgeuenes psal dauid saith thee alone haue synned thee haue done euil ioyned together forasmuch dauid knowledgeth confesseth hath done euill knoweth doth displease god thoughe saye verely know fele synne remembre also fele synne able yea feale power strength synne cruel torment intollerable burden accuseth god goeth plucke vnto death vnto deuill rom paule sayth romains without lawe synne dead lyued somtime without lawe though saye synne alwayes vsthe lawe openeth synne lawe commeth though buried sleape disquieteth v vexeth v tormenteth v hereof commeth heape dayly sinne vpon synne make conscience thereof otherwise woulde repent cease synne thonderbolte meane lawe god stryketh conscience pearceth thorowe begynneth synne man wolde saye waxe alyue againe begynne knowe mightie thing synne whiche taketh god awaye v casteth v downe hedlong vnto deuill hell fyre rom therfore sayth paule lawe came synne waxed alyue dead commandement vnto life founde vnto vnto death sinne2 r g sin god may see dauid committed adultery bethseba sin greued nothing sinne dead natha prophete one came cast thonderbolt thou art man beganne syn waxe aliue dauids hearte threatned death nathan conforteth sayth thou shalt dye thus sewe apostlike regiment aucthoritie power ouer politique ciuile temporall matter ouer suche synnes alone yt world accuseth codemneth iudgeth punisheth ouer synnes whiche thou thy consciece god righteousnes count sinnes thys meanes syns whole worlde subiect ye apostle minister church yea time requireth christian thou maist certenly persuade thy selfe thou hearest thy pastour absence christian thy sinnes forgeue thee name christ true iuste certen also lesse power though christ spoken angel heauen declared vnto thee commandement christ comission power geuen apostle minister church shoulde thereby auaunce themselues setforth owne honour waxe proude exercise tyranny ouer congregation god onely geuen ende therby serue thee thou mayest defended agaynste thine enemye whiche stronge thee therfore wonderfull incredible power wretched man whiche synner also dryue deuyll power otherwise hole worlde coulde expell driue sayth christ soeuer ye losen earth math shal losened heauen whose synnes ye shall forgeue shal forgeuen rehersed gospell father sent lykewise send wordes plaine euident man ought doubte heareth wordes remission sinnes pronounced vnto hym lykewise shall receaue enioye cause admonishe often seinge christe hath geuen suche great power churche ye shoulde vse meanes despise vnto ende hath christ ordeined ministerie wise synnes worlde shoulde forgeuen taken awaye sinnes dede repentaunt fayth faithful repentaunce knowledged confessed counterfaite forged synnes pertayne nothynge vnto matter must sinnes dede trouble vexe disquiet heart adam fyrste booke moyses preached sayd son cain gen sayth thou haddest done well haddest ben good thyne oblation shoulde haue bene accepted asmuche thou arte euill thy synne lyeth doressecret synne wyll one com lighte though shold say thou standest nowe arte synner thou dost yet fele thy synne lyeth troublesome vnrestfull place therfore se vnto wyll one day awake comme light shall otherwise go thee thy synne lieth lurketh vnto ende shoulde euer rest kepte secrete comme light may torment trouble vexe byte thee thou shalt know whether turne thee therfore moued sin haue notwithstandinge synnes dede yet suche venial remissible able forgeuen therefore sinnes retained holden boude haue luste desyre forgeuen would repent leaue synne doctrine papistes whosoeuer wold haue remissio sinnes firste confesse theyr synnes priestthe doctrine papistes concerning remission syn contrite sorie receaue penaunce priestes hande afterward folowed absolution remission synnes meanes forgeuenes sinnes afterwarde grounded contrition possiblea godly practise auncient churche behalfe folowed example elder pronounced absolution man except first cofessed synnes shewed outwardly manifest signes token sorie sinnes right ought notwithstandinge gather hereof suche sorowe contrition deserueth remission synnes false erroniouscontrition deserueth remission synne co tritio merite selfe synne truly fealte heart power kyngdome synne neither remission sinnes grace grounded suche contrition synne cured although synne present yet lurckyng dead sinne adam sayde cain waxeth aliue sleapeth truly fealte perceaued tormenteth fraieth heart man iustly truly call meritorious worke paule calleth right liuing sinne wil saye synne deserueth grace rom therfore men ye papacie miserably deceaued seduced asmuche put hope remission sinnes cotrition though good meritorious worke selfe deserued sin forgeuen therfore pope bulles indulgence pardon put wordes contritis confessis saye contrite confessed contrition confession sake shall haue absolution pardone sinnes true contrition iscontrition wyth fayth helpeth nothing vnto saluacion none thing kyngdome power regiment sinne deserue remission sinnes faith geuen commandement christ word whiche pronounced commandement name layde sure constant faith faith contrition commeth forgeuenes sin cotrition self none thing lyuing feareful makyng synne vpo grounded remission synnes vpon worde christ suche contrition felynge synne doth none thing plucke v fro faith make v flee christ fearde stirre vp sinnes make greater horrible dede none thinga sim lytude synne wont outragiousnes euils may encreased syn maye heaped vpon synne none otherwyse theife conuicte theafte condemned vnto punishment theafte hath done theafte nowe addeth mo synnes vnto hys theafte hateth iudgement lawe maiestrate yea god also author iudgement lawe maiestrate wysheth neither iudgement lawe maiestrate yet god might go forth sinne frely without punishment rom thing doth sainct paule lyuely expresse saith synne thorow lawe commandement measure synnefull say lawe one commeth worketh force synne beyond measure knowen synne dede nowe wheare synne doth worke one synne infinitie sinnes madewhat papistes call contrition synner fynde rest reason synnes haue papistes called contrition suche contrition sorowe remayneth alone saye faith hope god mercie lyke also iudas traytour foloweth floweth nothing plaine desperation math christe muste also comme confortable worde commaundement concernynge remission synnes preache hearte sinner saying thou art ful sin goest loger fall awaye shall therfore forgeue thee thy synnes oh naye thou must dede haue contrition sorowe thy synnes without thou canst neuer hate synne frome thy hearte neuer heartelye desire remission sinnes nowe way shalt thou walke vnto saluation thou make haste vnto worde heare beleue shalt thou haue remission forgeuenes sinspenaunce enioyned papistes taught papistes enioyned theyr penitetes ghostly child call go pylgrimage say many orysons prayer c make satisfaction theyr synnes concernyng worde commandement christe make mention worde commandemet christ whose synnes ye forgeuein word christ remission sin sought thorow faith shall forgeuen whose sinnes ye retaine shalbe retained hearest thou man ought seke forgeuenes synnes wordes lorde christe whosoeuer seketh shal neuer fynde hath profited holpen yt haue tormented selues greatly wt fastig singing praying watching massinge c might obtayne remissio sin great wickednes lamentable thinge heare haue taught v loke remissio sinnes thorow contrition notwithstandyng earnest stronge nothing el plaine synne vertue worke contrition confession suche greate nede worde christe end serueth commandement place behalfe differ nothynge turkes iewes whiche also beleue shalbe saued although haue christ pope worser turke iewe mainteyne wickednes abhomination false corrupt doctrine without shame abuseth name christ therfore let v diligently marke christ includeth forgeuenes synnes worde pilgrimage mass almose dedes workes soeuer name called therfore desireth forgeuenes sin lette hym go vnto hys pastor learned worde god heare hym glad ioyful tydyngs gospellthe waye obtayne remission synnes heare ye worde god beleue faithfully beleue may sure haue hys synnes remytted forgeuen hym thys certayne sure ouercome synne woorke whatsoeuer able doo though torment selues neuer muche altogether vayne nothyng purpose hadde experience pope kyngedome hadde euyll conscience therfore gote selues monastery became cloysterersfayth worde onlye quieteth conscience tooke vppon workes myght deliuered synnes haue quiete conscience last compelled graunt neyther garment monasticall order prayer fastynges mass pylgrimages anye kynde paynefull dedes coulde appease quyete griefes tourmentes theyr conscience synnes neyther retayned remytted waye worde haue tofore hearde therfore soeuer embraceth word wherin alone remission synnes muste nedes vnder worde wherein synnes retained none waye meane forgeue synne worde therfore whatsoeuer man dothe yet shall synnes retained excepte commeth worde lorde god hath sette forgeuenes synnes worke thys one onely worke christ hath suffred rysen agayn deathe worke woorde hath putte mouthe hys apostle preacher yea mouthe christen men nede require may distribute declare remission synnes many desire thou wilt fetche forgeuenes thy sinnes then thou shalt deceaued thy purpose co mandement christ hand synnes shold forgeuen thou wylt fetch forgeuenes thy synnes then meane word god thy synnes shall styll retayned holden doo thou wylte hath bene many tymes sayde wythout worde remission synnes christ hath put thys woorde mouthe apostle mynisters yea tyme nede mouth also al christian declare vnto comfort troubled conscience fetche beleue worde shall dye hys synnes doo wyll commaundement strong sure lord taketh away whole worlde work forgeuenes synnes repose onely word hangeth matter onely vnderstanded absolution preachyng worde sayde begynnynge christe comprehendeth whole ministerie commandement remission synnes declared distributed faythfull bothe worde sacramentes ende gospell preached menne may knowe theyr synneswhy ye gospe preached afterward thorow faithe bee iustified euer leade godlye vertuous lyfe also ende baptised oure synnes forgeuen v thorough death christewhy baptised agayne sayde christe hath ordeyned holy supper vnto ende shoulde beleue body betrayde vswhy christe ordayned hys supper bloud shedde v wee shoulde doubt remyssion synnes faith myght constant sure throughely perswaded oure synnes forgeuen v thee whole worlde whole worlde would repent beleue amend christ hath ordeyned one shold baptised receaue lordes supper euery one baptised receiue lordes supper self require priuate absolutioneuery man ought receaue sacramentes hym selfe sufficientely confirmed comforted publike preachyng man ought thyng doubt hee heareth remission hys synnes name iesus lykewise hee dooth receaue vtterly made free frome synnes god heauen therefore woorde sacramentes separated christe hathe ioyned worde sacramentes togetherthe worde sacramentes ought go together wythout woorde sacramentes brynge consolation confort yea withoute woorde coulde knowe sacramentes vnto ende serue therfore great blyndnes erroure also moste greuous myserie papistes prate muche forgyuenes synnes yet vtterly forgette worde wherin whole matter consysteth telle people tale tubbe muste gette remssions theyr synnes theyr owne workes theyr owne inuentions seyng oure lorde sauiour christ iesu hath placed forgeuenes synnes worde hath often ben sayde hath commytted apostle minister woorde yea christian tyme necessitie bee pronounced declared foloweth must beleue forgiuenes sinnesby faythe alone christ freely iustified saued forgeuenesse synnes commeth vnto v onely faith geuen worde promise christe foundation oure doctrine freely iustified saued faithe alone christe man denye word christe whyche put mouthe disciple comprehended gryped handes yet woorkes fastynges prayer almosse dedes pylgrimages soeuer kynde work besideswhy faith alone iustifieth without workes faith alone laieth hand worde receaueth heart true cheast wherin word included shutte playne euident iustifyed fayth alone seyng remyssion synnes onely comprehended woorde worde otherwyse bee apprehended layd hand faithe alone knoweth pope sectary neither doo vnderstand doctrine christe yea blockyshe doltyshe mad farre estranged knowledge christen doctrine neither vnderstande blynde wyll meanes se yea stubborne styffe necked wyse wyll receaue beleue itin pope churche faithe worde neglected therfore bothe faithe worde neglected nothyng regarded pope churche people taught commanded trust merites righteousnes woorkes god confounde sathan antichriste pope sectary wyth wycked doctryne woorkes laboure obscure yea
