vtterly extinguyshe glorye god merites christes deathe resurrection iustification faythe c shall therefore tymes bee mooste necessarye conueniente wee conferre pope doctrine wyth whyche trewe sounde doctrine neuer forgette abhomynations whyche hee hathe broughte churche chryste wyth fyre faggotte sweard halter drownynge kynde force tyrannye goeth foorthe defende bee ledde agayne oute trewe waye seeke remyssion synnes owne woorkes contrary woorde god lord christ doothe instructe v woorkes woorde whyche putteth mouth disciple sendeth euen sent father nowe forgeuenesse synne actes heartes saincte peter saythe purifyed faythe good purifyed hearte shall vndoubtedly issue flowe foorthe abundance plentie good christen work faythe ydell holy ghoste accordynge hys nature propretie alwaye mouethe prycketh forwarde faythefull vnto obedience goddes holy wyll gal vnto mortification flesh synne god christ gyue v hys grace may beleue truly fele heartes amen second sonday easter p gospell iohn x christe said vnto disciple good shepheard good shepheard geueth life sheepe hired seruaun shephearde neyther sheepe owne seeth wolfe comming leaueth sheepe fleeth wolfe catcheth scattreth sheepe hyred seruaunt fleeth hyrede seruaunt careth sheepe good shepheard knowe sheepe knowen myne father knowethe euen knowe also father geue life sheepe sheepe haue whiche folde also muste brynge shal heare voyce shalbe one folde one shepheard exposition gospel likewise workes christ may handeled two maner wais first cocerning faith secodly touching charitie doctrine faith teacheththe doctrine faythe christ alone shepeheard christ alone shepherd none dieth shepe vnto work yt christ dieth v saint yet ang mete might restore man slain yt deuil paradise thorow synne shold ye proper work shepherd christ none able compare none workes dyd behalf meane making satisfaction sinnes creature imitated gene rom folowed expressed therfore speake wordes himselfe christ pronouceth place iohn good shepherd good shepheard geueth lyfe shepe wordes allureth v vnto hym teacheth v shoulde beleue none like vnto hym accomplishyng work redemption whyche broughte passe passion deathe moyses prophet men great authoritie singuler excellencie whiche taughte truly ought beleue yea suffered many thynges doctrinethe saynctes god nothynge worke redemption yet concernyng worke wherof christ speaketh meane dye shepe mercenary hirelynges neither defende shepe agaynst wolfe without doubt moyses prophetes taught longe tyme done thyngs aswell yet able recouer selues death could able ye shepe wolf whiche deuill death verily euen christ saith hirelingthe wolfe deuyl death ye shepherd shepe belong seeth ye wolfe coming forsaketh shepe fleeth ye wolf catcheth scattereth ye shepe ye hireling fleeth hireling shepe pertaine vnto therfore yt perill desireth without ieoperdy rent torne ye wolf must diligetly take hede yt put cofidece ye law good work ther help lawchriste helpethe agaynste wol e yea law rather v accuseth condemneth v neither good workes helpe thyng behalf therfore trust concernyng owne righteousnes good workes must vtterly caste awaye rom cor g la lerne true faith resorte vnto alone saith good shepehearde geue life shepe fleeth wolfe neither afraide yea rather offereth himselfe wolfe rent torne piece ioan one shepe perishe decay therfore dager must resort flee vnto alone one thing muste stedfastly beleue selues nothyng behalfe christe good shepheard alone doth worketh good thynges v commandeth v embrace sure faith stedfastly beleue second doctrine act shepherd set forth vnto v example peter witnesseth1 pet sayinge christ hath borne sinnes body vpon tree dead sinne might lyue vnto righteousnesse whose stripe ye healed ye sometime shepe runne astraychriste good sheparde setforth vnto v ensample ye turned vnto shepheard curate soules doctrine faythe whiche afterward applieth vnto charitie saying christ hath suffred v leauyng vnto v example ye shold folow steppe christe died v worke myght redeme v without worke synne euerlastyng deathe bounde one helpe confort soeuer man beyng daunger hath nede helpe confort folowe example christe euery christen man also shoulde good shepheard although death redeme death synne worke thee alone true shepheard christe iesu ye haue tofore heard yet may geue life thys example may allured vnto worde brought vnto knowledge christ ioan iohn saith haue knowe loue god gaue lyfe v bound also geue lyfe brother right well knowe howe great hatred world deuil word god specially ye pope laboreth mayne oppresse word yea many true pastor preacher therof therfore haue nede faithful good teacher whiche seyng redemed deth christ ought also selues imitate folow example christ also die sheepe geue life wordsaluacion comethe deathe christe death redemeth saluation cometh death christ notwithstadyng confirmeth god glorified blood death neighbor mean co firmed faith although deliuered death done deathe true shepherd hath ben oftentymes sayde also come mercenary hirelynges woluesmercenaries hyrelyngs former doctrine faith yt mercenary moses law prophet al men counted neuer rightous man able defend hym selfe may let thyngs passe agaynst wolfe say deuyll sinne thys doctrine charitiewolues wolues false teacher tyrantes persecute condemne doctrine gospelltrewe shepardes true godly man afrayde whenne seeth wolfe yea rather wold cause man offended fall away word true knowlege christ wyl ieopard hed lyfe euer hath exaumples apostle holy martyr abundantly declarewhat required preacher god worde afrayd cruelnes wolfe shold one flee ought nowe professeth self teacher god word shepherd lordes flocke great sinceritie required hym onely seke glorie god saluation neighbour carefull thing hunteth owne commoditie profite wyll abyde comming wolf wil either cowardly flee forsake shepe ell wyll holde peace suffer shepe runne astray without foode say without worde god hyrelynges whiche teache owne priuate lucre aduantage content god geueth sufficient theyr dayly foode ar ministerie ought require meate drinke cloth apostle saith hauyng foode rayment1 tim minister ought require meate drynk cloth let v contente brought hynge worlde neyther shall wee carie thyng require hyrelynges care shepe contrarye parte trewe teacher safegarde shepe putteth head life goodes euer hathe ieopardie thys seconde doctrine cocerning example good true shepheard christa general doctrine pertaineth onely vnto ministerie also vnto al christian men ought confesse truth rather lose lyues forsake worde imbrace idolatrie knowe haue shephearde whiche ende gaue lyfe althoughe also bee enforced geue theyr lyfe yet shall receaue agayne neuer lose luc myth christe goeth foorthe maketh mencion hys shepe putteth difference betwene shepe doothe purpose make diuersitie betwene doctrine heresy doctrine saying good shepherd knowe shepe shepe knowe father hath knowen know father geue lyfe shepe though say thus goeth matter ye wyl shepe knowledge dede youre shephearde shall ye withoute perill daunger therfore true teacher ought sette foorth none thyng vnto men christ alonechriste onlye ought preachede ye people maye truely knowen geueth man turne asyde worde alone taken true good shepheard geueth lyfe shepe oughte sette foorthe vnto menne maye knowe theyr shephearde therfore doctrine bee receaued ensample christ dyd suffred thynges v likewise shold gladly suffre al thing wordes sake whyche twoo thynges bee taughte churche hee heareth vnderstandeth thynges christes shepe hym selfe sayeth sheepe heare voyce hee teacheth trewely good shepehearde thys one thynge excepted hee canne geue hys lyfe sheepe suche sorte sauiour christ dydde heare thys doctrine wyll sette foorthe sheepefals teache esch wed deuyll sheepe christe neyther trewe shepheardes dede hyrelynges yea rauening wolues suche herd eschued deuill sorte goeth doctrine pope full errours heresy setteth forth wordes christ sincerely purely sayeth good shepherdthe pope hyrelynge wo f e geue lyfe shepe pope teacheth thus safe wolfe say deuyl deathe must owne shepheard loke help owne work ye know thyngs taught popedome sacrifice masse purgatorie pilgrimage vowes monasticall lyfechrists voyce hearde folowed workes supererogation c therfore true christian muste folowe shepe whiche knowe voyce shephearde take hede vnto stranger voyce knowe neyther wyll heare therfore ought send away v word know thy voyce heare wolfe goeth pluck away flock christ away hence woluysh houling wil folow shepherd heare voice saith christ shal heare voyce litle said folow strager flee hym know voyce stranger possible yt shepe whiche hath begunne beleue hath herd yt voice shepheard receiued shold allowe doctrine whyche contrary voyce christe shepe heareth commaundementes emperours kynges prince maiestrates c knoweth thynges pertayn vnto saluation thys worketh saluation politike ciuile obedience declared shewed whe teacher commethe foorthe doctrine saythe thou wylt bee saued thou thy selfe muste satisfy thy synnes thou must cause mass sayd thee thou must geue almes thy sinnes may forgeuen thee thou must put francis coule thou dying beynge buried mayst saued c case shepe heareth sayth know voyce voice shepherd wolfethe property shepe thus report beast say shepe hath nature propretie amonge beastes none hath quick eare sharpe redy sense hearyng shepe hath experience declareth neuer many crye call regardeth refuseth excepte owne shephearde hys voyce shee knoweth heareth unto goeth maketh haste lyke maner yong lambes euen greatest flockes euery one knoweth bleatyng owne damme foloweth long tyll last hath founde christ hath respect nature shepe compareth christian wyth theym also maner moste diligently hearken voyce shephearde deceaued meanynge voyce christ shepe allured moued geue earehowe shepe folowed herein geueth v playne commandement shepe muste haue fyne picked eares whiche may discerne voice christ frome although voyces seme neuer clere pleasant swete therfore place bee learned wee geue diligent attendance heare word god yea alone none thorowe maye able sette oure selues agaynste subtilties ennemie whyche craftily gothe conueye heartes also beware false corrupte doctrinea fals teacher neuer trusted woolfe euer wolfe neither geue ouer nature hath hys purpose false doctrine doothe inwardly imagine disceit thorowe pestilent poysonfull thoughtes must thou followe shepe saye care thys voyce voyce wolfe shepheard voyce shephearde good shepheard gaue lyfe shepe thou woldest bryng poynt shoulde despaire haue hope saluation shepheard flee hym thus maist thou haue healpe comforte agaynste tentation wherwith deuyll goeth dismaye thee take away thy courage driue thee erroure make thee sorowfull brynge thee vnto desperationthe loue christ toward v must therfore aboue thyngs diligently heare certainly knowe voyce oure shephearde thys meanes shall bee betweene v mutuall knowledge loue howe hate v bestoweth lyfe v taketh awaye v death synne euyls freely geueth v euerlasting life thynges come v none voyce lette v therfore much diligently embrace make muche moreouer greately oure comforte christe thys sermon calleth hym self shepheard tearmeth v whyche haue heare voyce sheepe meanes christian hath cause complayne hee destitute wantethe shepheard may want money substance health c may appere left confortlesse shepherd among wolues math christ also sayde disciple behold send shepe mids wolues daily se none thing miserable face church redy bee deuoured antichriste euen shepe wolfe psal semeth though shepherd careth v yet neyther sleapeth slombreth kepeth israell thus muste nedes bethe voyce shepheard christe cofort churche shold loke none cofort voice shepherd wherof christ saith shepe heare voice heareth voice christ foloweth may behalf glory truly knoweth shepheard shepheard also knoweth regardeth word foloweth deuill hurte soeuer chanceth concernyng lyfe goodes wife childre c kepeth alway freshe memorie voyce shepheard thou arte shepe thou hearest voyce knowest knowe thee cogitation meditation studye exercise altogether woorde faythe nothyng el christe hym selfe sayeth knowe sheepe euen father knoweth know father christ sonne god earth shewed none power yt though ben free choise deuill wicked men deale hym euen selues lusted god seemed vtterly forgette hym euen thoughe neyther cared hym knewe hym christ hanging ye crosse coplained said god god haste thou forsaken mee math dyed crosse buryed deuyl maner persuaded christ god thenne euidentely declared father knewe hym hee dydde delyuer hym frome hell deathe sayeth christe shall matter goe lette thys trouble thynges shall comme passe though dydde knowe youa christen man thys lyfe alwaye subiect crose christen man thys worlde muste assaulted combred calamity cross myseryes affliction trouble wyth kynde aduersities shall appeare difference betwene hym vngodlye outwardly lyfe deathe bothe manner one yea intollerable harder seemeth outwardly condition state christian manne god worse thenne state ethnicke infydelle hee troubled oppreste wyth many mo tentations affliction let moue thee holde faste toothe nayle sayth knowe shepe christe knoweth hys ye myddest troblesbut thou hearest deuil reason making obiection howe god haue care thee seyng thou arte myserably afflicted troubled answer thou thus knowe knoweth neither dothe thys make faythe faynt dye suffer trouble know voyce truste vnto shepheard vnto hys shepeconstancie tyme trouble decl rethe true christiane putteth forth voyce vnto whyche ryght well knowe sayth thy shepheard dyed thee gaue life thee worde heare beleue sure token vnto knoweth know hym agayn although nowe feele perceaue otherwise christe speaketh yet shal make fainte plucke fayth worde thinges full crosse worlde christen man trouble shorte transitorie continuance againste thynges word teacheth shal haue euerlasting life although feele death rom cor cor cor must nedes dye beleue christ voice shepehearde whiche maketh doth highly conforte beleueth sayth shall neuer dye euerlastingly geue lyfe shepe therfore doubte moste faithfull shepehearde christe iesu knoweth iohn knowledge therfore thus hydde kepte secret maye exercise triall fayth otherwise straightwayes baptisme shoulde comme cleane righteous immortall shoulde nede neither worde faith asmuch worde remayneth necessarilye requireth fayth1 cor iohn neyther shall oure matter haue altogether good successe great daye iudgement shall se oure shepehearde face face euen beholde matter without fayth therfore doubted sone man baptised chaunceth vnto hym high glorie vtterly without synne endued perfect euerlastynge righteousnes marc saith christe beleueth baptised shall saued perceaued sences neither reason attaine ther vnto yet true iudge worde determine according voyce shephearde wherfore remaineth holde fast worde meanes cast awaye til al thinges reueled brought light euerlasting lyfe come heare worde beleue life life come differ impossible true feling experience thinges sholde chaunce life felt perceaued life comme therfore matter greate waight knowe christen man yea perfectly knowen lyfe man saye euerlasting lyfe notwithstanding must confesse child vexed death sinne kynd misery point euerlasting lyfe appeareth immediatly baptisme biginneth worlde euerlasting life howe commeth thing passe iohn nothing sene neither doth thing appeare besydes olde accustomed lyfe yet aboue accustomed defyled lyfe god hath ordained euerlasting lyfe wherin also liue accordynge worde faith although yet se feele knowe true christian iudge hym iudgement reason man vnderstandinge voyce worde shepes lyfe voyce destitute shepeheardes voyce escape danger wolues without shepeheardes voice kept order safetiethe word god conforteth ye true christian heareth safe without perill one lost danger euery side maner goeth christian worde lost remayneth conforte worde safe beholde christ shepheard euer maketh saluation thorowe christe say forgeuenes synnes euerlasting lyfe therfore hauing assured hope true christian serueth vocation doth worke eateth dryncketh yea middest crosse trouble ioyefull merye altogether geuen heare voyce shepheard accustometh hym selfe iudge sence course reason accordinge voyce worde christ sayth knowe shepe shepe know father knoweth knowe father geue lyfe shepe thing must learne diligently consider heartes offended forsake voyce shephearde though christian afflicted troubled yea dye alone knowledge christian ca saye concernynge outwarde life see difference betwene godly vngodly yea many time state christian harder intollerable incombred mo misery worde greate difference namely christian vngodly haue much diuersitie betwene cocerning outwarde thinges christian heare voyce theire shepeheard ethnickes infidelles heare yet turkes iewes papistes shepe christ touching external thinges difference wheras christ speaketh shepe must also broughte maye one shepehearde one flocke began immediatly brought passe sending holy ghoste math marc gospell preached thorow worlde minister word yet practised shall vnto ende worlde meanes men without exception shall conuerted vnto gospell deuill neuer suffer worlde also moste extremely hateth worde abyde reproued therfore hope varietie religion taken awaye one shepehearde one flocke god doth accept many euer receue gospell sonnes christes sake whyther iewes gentile alone true religio folowe shepehearde christ heare hys voycewhat true religion obedient whiche thynge graunt v true shepeheard byshop soules iesus christe father holy ghoste whome glorie honour prayse euer euer amen third sonday easter pthe gospell ihon xvi iesus sayde disciple whyle ye shall see agayne whyle ye shal see go father sayd disciple betwene selues sayethe vnto v awhile ye shal see agayne awhyle ye shall see go father sayde therefore sayeth awhyle tell sayeth iesus perceyued woulde aske hym sayd vnto ye enquire betwene selues sayd whyle ye shal se againe whyle ye shall see uerylye verylye saye vnto ye shall wepe lament contrary wyse worlde shal reioyce ye shal sorow sorow shalbe turned ioy woma whe trauayleth hath sorow houre come assone delyuered chyld remembreth anguishe ioy man borne worlde ye nowe therfore haue sorowe wyll see agayne heartes shall reioyce ioye shall man take exposition gospell parte longe sermon whiche christe made vnto disciple conforte confirme waye trueth last supper suffered conforte tendeth specially ende shortnes tentation chaunce vehemet disciple reason christ passion death despaire good conforte courage forasmuche would absente hym selfe litle would comme againe vnto resurrection make ioyeful mery euer ioye ende euangeliste iohn maketh many wordes behalfe oftentimes repeateth samea naturall man vndersta deth spirituall thinges disciple vnderstande christe ment saying lytle although christ declared mind behalfe yet vnderstande written disciple iohn wolde signifye wherof haue dayly experience1 cor able well truly cosider saying free fro thing greatly hinder vnderstandinge disciple tentation hande ignominious spitefull death christ troubled al wittes could cosider lytle ment heartes astonyed thought christe vtterly vndone shortly also comme point christes sake lyke maner moste miserably handled sorowe tentation continew past two three day lorde christ rise death vnto euerlastyng lyfe helpe worlde againste worlde deuill synne death laste geue moste ioyefull euerlastinge lyfe worlde comme yt vnderstode neither though possible therfore iohn afterwarde gospel declareth disciple hyd selues kepte secret feare iewes neither wolde beleue iohn christe rysen although woman peter two disciple declared vnto luke short coulde beleue whiche christe spake vnto lytle whyle thought christ shoulde haue remayned death still men otherwise woulde neuer haue bene weake fainte hearted lustye courage stronge hope woulde haue looked resurrection maruell infirmitie weakenes disciplestrouble dismayeth weake christeans yet al assayled lyke tentation daunger ouerwhelmed waues like aduersitie forget also litle whyle caste awaye hope confort thincke oure vexation trouble continewe long lyue persuaded meanes trouble cotinue lytle while2 cor god tyme wyll geue fortunate ioyefull ende oure euilles misery mean tentation clene courage vtterly dismayde fallyng lamentynge wepinge thoughe god wolde helpe v rom pet math regard vnto v withstandinge blessed apostle paule commandeth v ioye reioyce trouble onely assured deliuerance whiche muste nedes chaunce faithfull rom also crosse trouble moste certein sure tryall made whereby knowe sonnes god heires euerlastynge lyfe shall large declare hereafter gospell therfore contayneth moste noble notable doctrine confortethis saying lytle ought diligently trouble remembred onely disciple christe also christian tentations affliction shoulde euer haue eye remember lytle whyle diligentlye consider althoughe reason man wytt see howe deliueraunce maye come yet shall left succourles oure euilles without helpe confort shall shortly haue ende againe steade ioye gladnes shall comme continually abyde v confort ioye gladnes maye better perceaued v wyll present speake altogether crosse affliction reason iudgeth crossemannes witt reason thinketh iudgeth wyse god regard vnto v godly shold neuer great misery trouble therefore aryse diuerse trouble diuersely vexe v mynde thynketh straight wayes god hath eyther vtterly forgotten v hateth v regarde v otherwise coulde neuer lacke defence helpe thoughtes imagination reason muste get v ayde helpe worde god lest suffer matter disputed iudgemet reason ought referre whole iudgement behalfe vnto worde god iudge thinges without worde iudgement shall false nothing purpose sayeth worde fyrste sayth somuche heare head shall fall grounde without wil godhow thee worde god iudgeth ye crosse worde followeth math luc although kingdom deuill worlde mightie stronge kyngdome yet nothing al christian man farre god doth permit suffer christ sheweth also saying one litle sparowes shal fall vnto groud father price sparowe lytle solde halfe farthing yet christe sayth god hath care muche shal care godly whiche better many sparowes therfore suffer deuil worlde pleasure good soeuer hindraunce shall chaunce godly thorow deuill worlde without prouidence godthe deuill world agaynst people god god appointeth suffereth neither rage god appointeth surge sea maruelous sayeth dauid lorde hye maruelous lord hath appointed set deuill worlde limites beyonde go psal worthy noted euer remembred thou thine affliction persuade thy selfea good lesson yt soeuer aduersitie chaunceth vnto thee commeth fortune chaunce singuler prouidence councell determinatio god yea vnto thy greate comoditie althoughe semeth otherwise thy blinde carnal reason nowe riseth also greater difficultie yf must thus persuade selfereason se affliction co meth good wyll god towarde v aduersities trouble whiche suffer come prouidence god iudgement reason maye gathered councell determination god concernyng myne affliction vnto destruction damnation health saluation maye loked paynes plague punishmentes great greuous affliction otherwise persuaded god euen displeasure hatred againste v doth plague punishe v greatly encreaseth sorowe maner bringeth v desperation god doth punishe v thing cause oure plague trouble would greatlye greue v woulde thincke helpe conforte remayninge god towardes v case therfore must haue recourse vnto worde god heare obey iudgement sentence reason heare beleue shall surely fall desperation yea vtterlye detest abhorre god worde whiche behalfe conforteth openeth vnto v god paule sayth1 cor wolde iudge oure selues haue bene iudged iudged lorde chastened daned worlde sentence apostle euident whome god wil haue condemned worldeaffliction co meth v fro god proffite preserued kept vnto euerlasting life correcteth punisheth neither ought counted token hatred rather signe fauour loue good although afflicted troubled sentence affliction diligently considered remembred one hath crosse hath whereof woulde gladly easedhowe wee behaue selues trouble euery wold thincke maner saye selfe thou restrained byt aduersitie thou thus correcte thou wouldest surely shold worke thee greater displeasure ye cause euil god doth send thee aduersitie yt thou sholdest damned worlde hereof take occasion amend thy life call thy selfe vnto repentancenote well feare god call blessed name thancke benefites c euery man trouble wold thus thincke himselfe would angry god laying crosse vpo thincke doth hatred displeasure rather fauour good wil towarde yea would loue praise god affliction sheweth token fauour good toward meanes preseruinge eternall damnation vnto euerlastynge saluation heb prouerb unto ende also doth paule hys epistle hebrues alledge sayinge salomon prouerbes sonne despise thou chasteninge lord neither faint thou arte rebuked hym lord loueth hym chasteneth yea scourgeth euery sonne receaueth ye endure chastening god offereth vnto vnto sonnes sonne ye father chasteneth ye vnder correction wherof partaker ye bastardes sonnes therfore seing haue father fleshe whiche corrected v gaue reuerence shal muche rather subiectio vnto father spirites lyfe verely fewe dayes nurtered v pleasure nurtereth v profite intent may minister holines vnto vsthe ende christen me trouble euerlastinge ioye maner chastising preset time semeth ioyous greuous neuerthelesse afterward bringeth ye quiet fruite righteousnes vnto whiche exercised therby sentece holy apostle doth testifieaffliction token god fauoure owarde v discipline correction god laieth vpon v token anger displeasure againste v also manifeste signe euident argument fatherly frendly good wil toward v let v therfore thinke whe corrected punished god angry v set naught v cause corrected v sonneswhy god pvnisheth v loose oure enheritaunce time put worde doth preach declare vnto v crosse affliction lykewise set forth examplesexamples affliccion dare say god father hated onely begotten sonne christe iesu yet yf thou considerest lyfe death weighest matter iudgement reason shall appeare great signes god loue towarde hym yea rather signes hatred loue vngodly wicked iewes regarded god christ hadled pleasure entreated woulde accordyng saying prophete esa hath nether beautie fauour looked vpon hym fayrenes luste hym despised abhorred menne reckoned vile hyd face hym yea despised therefore regarded hym dyd iudge though plagued cast downe god christ hymselfe sayth ye psalmographe psal worme man scorne men outcaste people see laughe scorne shote lyppes shake heade c gape vpon theyr mouthes ramping roaring lyon math marc luc c yea iewes hanged crosse mocked saying sonne god let comme downe crosse c god handle owne derely beloued begotten sonne christe iesu earth euen wil handle al christian worlde christ hath fore saide seruant greater maister haue persecuted iohn wil persecute likewise sayde moste trimly truly epistle hebreues heard afore ye vnder correction heb wherof partaker ye bastardes sonnes thus see wonderful certein consent sentence example taught god euill good displeasure fauoure correcteth v middest trouble knowe good wil god certeinly persuaded god although affliction neuer great doth hate v set naught v rather correctio assured signe loueth v taketh v child seinge doth louingly correcte chasten v nowe must also learne knowe cause god doth correcte punishe childrenthe cause god correcteth child cor paule setteth forth wordes corrected lorde sayth damned worlde dauid sayeth highly profite yt thou hast corrected mighte learne thy righteous ordinaunces psal esay prophete also sayeth vexation geueth vnderstanding certen god wold serue fansies esa accomplishe desire neuer send v aduersitie troublethe profites come affliction become altogether secure carelesse neither shoulde tyme call synne vnto remembraunce care worde geue oure selues vnto prayer thinges appertayne vnto v assayled aduersitis misfortune haue iuste nedeful cause fal vnto prayer also remeber sin former wicked life cosider yt suche plague punishmets chaunce vnto v syns therfore ought fro hensforth liue warely lay aside sin feare god fram life according blessed c mean god seing couersion may either take awaye paine fro v el mitigate ease semeth best godly wisedo paule saieth epistle ye hebrues heauely father nurtereth v profit intent may minister holines vnto v heb therfore may despaire ye crosse rather thincke maner wt selues signe token perceaue right well yt god merciful vnto fauoreth loueth nurtereth sonne aduersities afflictios pleasure put remebrace sin cal vnto repentance meanes may amend misse fromhensforth auoide sinne offend heauenly father yt doth vseth crosse right neither doth murmur god aduersitie yet thorowe impaciencie brought vnto point fleeth vnto supersticious idolatrous wicked artes released trouble paciently quietly abideth helpe god feruently prayer desireth ensueth fourth parte matter yt thorowly persuaded nothing chaunce vnto v without god god pleasure aduersitie trouble chaunce vnto v saluation thus afflicted troubled must also assuredly assure selues thing god wil geue fortunate ende trouble prosperously deliuer v paule saith god faithful1 cor whiche shall suffer tempted aboue strength shall middes temptation make waye ye maye able beare vnto confort thinges cheifly pertaine christ speaketh lytle doctrine lytle two thinges first whe opprest greatnes vehemecie afflictio troublethe crosse semethe intollerable appeareth none thinge yt crosse wil haue ye vppermost hand nothing far reaso iudgeth preuayle haue example king ezechias whe rabsakes ye captaine ye hoost ye king ye assirias required yt citie ierusalem yelded geuen ouer vnto hym esa ezechias sent vnto esaye prophete embassage day trouble plague blasphemie child comme place byrth power bring forth christ also vseth similitude woman goeth trauayle iohn appeareth great peril mother child ye afflictios small set forth certein psalme christ self crieth maner saue god water come euen vnto soule psal sticke faste depe myre grounde comme depe water fluddes runne ouer secodlythe crosse semeth haue ende whe se waye howe escape great dauger straightwayes fal desperatio nether ca beleue yt matter litle vnto ende specially belonged similitude woman trauaileth child iohn whiche chrsit vseth peril semeth infinitie vnmeasurable endlesse yet sodeinly commeth greate ioye lyfe springinge death man borne worlde mother also beinge safe daunger consideration wherof al sadnes turned gladnes thinges chaunce dayly time ende suche trauaile gladnes chaunceth seldome common trade christ saith sodenly vnlooked sounde ful true perfect ioye foloweth sorow sadnes psalmographe sayeth heuines may endure night ioye commeth morning would christe haue disciple learne psal tossed troubled waues cruell aduersitie maye thincke remember saying lytle paule sayeth hebrues maner chastisynge present tyme semeth ioyous greuous heb neuerthelesse afterwarde bringeth quiet fruite righteousnes vnto whiche exercised thereby fyrste called lytle ye sodayne vnloked mutation chaunge whiche chaunceth soner looked secondlye affliction called lytle short trouble shall turned euerlastinge ioye sorowfull transitorie lyfe ioyefull perpetuall lyfe christe sayde disciple iohn ye shall sorowe sorowe shall turned ioye thought al time wherin lazarus paraduenture ten twentie yeares miserie affliction respect tyme whiche afterward euerlasting lyfe sayth paule rom suppose affliction thys lyfe woorthy glorie whiche shall shewed vppon v agayne2 cor tribulation whyche shorte lighte prepareth excedynge eternall weight glorye vnto v looke thing sene thinges sene thinges whiche seene temporall thing sene ar eterna l1 pet blessed peter saith also ye reioyce thoughe season ye heuines thorow many folde tentations triall faithe muche precious gold perisheth might foud vnto praise glorie honor appearing iesus christ ye haue sene yet loue hym euen though ye see yet doo beleue reioyce ioy vnspeakable glorious1 pet receauing ende faith euen saluation soules god grace hath called v vnto eternall glory christ iesus shal owne selfe ye haue suffred lyttell affliction make perfect settle strength stablish youfaythe hellpeth greatlye affliction coulde thus beleue thus certainely persuaded saying lyttell whyle fynd great consolation hys affliction wherwith shold bee able staye hym selfe therefore matter standeth thys one poynte wee surely truste lorde christ counte hys woorde moste certayne trewe although troubled afflicted yet shall continue lytle may comfort selues crosse comforte woman trauayleth chyld namely shall haue good lucke bee delyuered payne haue fayre chylde great ioye comfort possible shoulde great gladnesse sorowe sadnesse hath ben thorowe importunitie reason kepte myserable bondage whyche alwaies putteth v mynde affliction commeth fauour anger god shall perishe neuer deliueredwhy affliccions sente vnto v god matter farre otherwise sorowes paynes doo therfore chance woman trauailyng chylde infant may borne likewise oure affliction therfore sent v god meanes may obteyne trewe glorie euer saued impaciencye desperacion eschewed afflictionthis also passed ouer silence christe interpreteth maketh playn disciple ioye shall chaunce vnto sayth wyll see agayne came passe daye resurrection sawe hym new euerlastyng lyfe christe therfore seeth v also hert reioyceth meditate consider resurrection oure sake hathe ouercome synne deathe deuyll thorough hym myght liue euerlastyngly true sound perfect euerlastyng ioye whyche changeth sadnesse neyther shall tyme taken away v lette v therefore beware take hede impaciencie desperation trouble comfort diligently bee retayned kepte faste although wee suffer beare crosse yet shall bee litle christe rysen dead sytteth ryght hande god father may represse keepe vnder deuyll euyls geue v euerlastyng saluation whiche thynge oure faythfull god mought vouchsafe bestowe vpon v sonne christ iesus sake oure lorde alone sauiour father holy ghoste honour glory prayse worldes without ende amen fourthe sonday easter pthe gospell iohn xvi iesus said vnto disciple nowe go way hym sente none asketh whither go haue said suche thing vnto heartes full sorowe neuerthelesse tell truth expediet go away go away comforter wyll come vntn depart wyll sende hym vnto come wyll rebuke worlde sinne ryghteousnes iudgment sinne beleue ryghteousnes go father ye shall see iudgement prince world iudged alredy haue yet many thinges say vnto ye cannot beare away nowe come sprite trueth wyll leade trueth shall speake hym selfe whatsoeuer shal heare shall speake wyll shewe thynges com shall glorifie shall receiue mine shall shewe vnto thinges father hath mine therefore sayde vnto hee shall take mine shewe vnto exposition noble excellent gospell entreateth specially high necessarie article wee called christian therfore although redde euery yeare among v yet canne wee thynke speake sufficiently entend truely haue profite fruite commeth must diligently exercise selues meditation therof also part sermon christ made laste supper parte euen restall saluacion comethe deathe christe tendeth also end disciple may enarmed agaynst sclaunder offendicle stomblyng blocke christes passion death shoulde onely heauy also iudge matter truthe right well perceaue saluation bothe synners dothe onely consyste deathe lorde christe wherfore euen late set foorth vnto v consolation conforte concernynge shortnes small continuance affliction trouble perpetuitie ioye gladnesse soo lykewyse dothe declare matter setteth foorthe cause passion goe sayeth vnto hym sent mee saye morowe shall crucified slayne yet none asketh whyther goe entend departure haue spoke vnto hertes ful sorow tell truth expediet yt go away shall go away ye coforter shal come vnto prince worlde shall bee iudged shall go awaythe death christe getteth vnto v holy ghoste victorie ouer satan send comforter vnto christe woulde haue well beaten men heades offended wyth passion death taken matter sadnesse rather vse vnto confirmatio faith vnto cosolation comfort conscience muche meanes tiranny deuyll destroyed holy ghoste gotten geuen vnto v holy ghost shall doo shal bring shall declare techethe office holy ghost doth christ expresse wordes holy ghost saith shall come rebuke worlde synne rightousnes iudgement christe woordes comprehendeth many great thynges saieth holy ghost shall rebuke small company certaine kyndes men certayne nation people whole world nede well fenced armed take vpon hym haue whole worlde world soeuer hath growne vp adam hytherto monarcheswhat worlde emperor kynges prince man vtterly hyghest degree excepted muste rebuked synne apostle minister worde motion holy ghoste holye ghoste preacher shall rebuke theym synne righteousnes iudgement none neither high low excepted hierusalem holines rome wisedome c must receaue correction rebuke holy ghost may saued al men euer haue vnder kyngdome deuyll neither theyr righteousnesse holynesse yet theyr good workes suche force vertue healpe anye thynge agaynste damnation thys office holy ghost wyll doo worlde apostle menne beggerly reputation euen rebuke worlde synne small thynge matter weyghty great importance rebuke worlde hygh great matter hath office rebuke world synne righteousnesse iudgement seynge thynges full synne righteousnes iudgement worlde shall remayn whole world therfore together condemned sermon wyth ryghteousnesse openly sayde one aspire come vnto kyngedome god excepte delyuered synne holye ghoste iustified meanes escape euerlastyng damnation suche lyke sentence also many holy scripture rom galat ephes ioan paule saythe god hath comprehended thynges vnder synne againe nature chyldren wrathe christe hym selfe saythe except man borne agayne see kyngdome god truely sermon holy ghost thus rebuke worlde synne synne robbe kyll commytte adulterie c synnes dede chiefestsynne whyche holye ghoste rebukethe manye whyche gyltye outewarde synnes synnes whereof holye ghost preacheth gyltie otherwyse coulde rebuke worlde synne bee shorte beleue christ synne worlde knoweth nothyngein credulitie ye greateste synne roote synne whole alone doctrine holy ghoste worlde counteth synnes onely whyche forbydden seconde table moyses christ knoweth nothyng muche lesse knoweth synne beleue hym shoulde wyth manye woordes rebuke ignorancye worlde seynge euen schooles amonge learned incredulitie infidelitie vnbeliefe taken synne namely originall synne belongeth science teach incredulitie synne holy gost doctrine maketh whole worlde gyltie synne many tymes worlde able proue externall iustyce outwarde ryghteousnesse thys therefore doctrine holy ghoste shoulde reproue whole worlde synne manne excepted worlde hathe bene accustomed vnto suche vnwonted kynde doctrine neyther knoweth thynge bounde beleue christe thus thynketh wyth phariseye noo murderer adulterer noo vnryghteous persone ynough worlde requireth holy ghoste preacheth otherwyse sayth knowe well amonge men concernynge outwarde bodyly righteousnesse one better thys chiefe principall synne bee subiecte vnto beleue christ iesus luc thys syn man excepte hath learned holy ghoste seeth knoweth perceaueth therefore thou bolde thus saye whatsoeuer faith synne monkery prayer fasting almose dedes thing el faith christ iesus thou hearest holy ghost rebuke rom sinne neither way delyuered synne beleue christ iesu nothyng playne euidente wordes arethe iuglynge ye papistes yet pope complices away notwithstandynge haue nothyng say faithe inuent comment glose speaketh de fide formata per charitatem say faith formed framed fashioned charitie conferre thou interpretation text man deny christe speaketh syn expoundeth syn beleue hym wherof muste nedes folowe soeuer babble de forma de bonis operibus yf fayth christ man good workes vertue damnable synner escape rebuke holy ghoste therfore incredulitie vnbelefe principall greatest synneunbeleif greatest sinne fauntyne euyll fountayne whyche synnes vice doo issue sprynge incredulitie heart men beleue christ immediatly foloweth yt worde god regarded either despised el vtterly reiected cast awaye heresye lye though deuyl author folowe synnes disobedience towarde parentes maiestrates ruler minister goddes worde c neglectyng theyr vocation callynge wicked synfull lyfe besides moste greuous vyces either shame feare punishment dare leaues yea hole tree incredulitie whiche spring rootes whiche holy ghost rebuketh world neither suffreth thyng resist withstand office beleueth christ hath holy ghost neyther thynke godly thinge aright although doth thatthe world deuyles bondeslaue owne nature vicious wicked agreable commaundementes god yet dothe seruant onely feare frely shew obedience god worlde euen suche one lyke bondslaue ledde deuyll neither speake thinke thing good godly iohn saith1 ioan world altogether set wyckednes reason hereof incredulitie fountayne welspring euyll exactly throughly desireth describe worlde may well saye manerwhat worlde worlde multitude men beleue christ therfore hate curse blaspheme worde whiche inwardly heartes outwardly dedes workes steale robbe kylle commytte whoredome bent kynde lewdnes wickedly abuse good gyftes god suche sayth christ place shall myne apostle minister ye worde haue euermore aduersaries suche muste haue doo rebukyng worlde shall taken away laste daye shall bee continuallye taught whatsoeuer worlde beleueth christ pertayneth vnto kyngdom christ vnto deuyll notorious outward syns also principall moste greuous synne meane incredulitie vnbelefewhere vnbeliefe worke please god neyther dothe profite thyng thou keepest monasticall rule thou doest woorke longe incredulitie presente thou arte damned synner neyther canste thou auoyde damnation longe thou remaynest state one alone waye escape damnation geue ouer thyne incredulitie beleue christe holde fast confort agaynst synne deuyll deathe concernyng faithe vnknowen vnto youwhat faythe ye haue many tymes heard faythe onely knowe beleue hystorie christe true faithfully persuaded euer christe dydde doone thy sake thy comoditie wealthe thy health euerlastynge saluation ac deuyll also knoweth christ dyed doothe certainly beleue papistes worlde beleueth christe dyed hym saluationtrue faythe gyfte holy ghost thys fayth speake christe dyd done sake saluation onely gyfte holye ghoste hee hath thys faythe saye christe dyed galat myghte delyuered synne euerlastynge deathe vngodly appertayneth vnto kyngdome christ neyther hath remoued synne whatsoeuer good work dothe taketh neuer soo muche imaginationsdelyuerauns ro synne cometh workes faythe christe moreouer soeuer haue taken vppon v ende maye obteyne remission oure synnes lette v laye hande holde faste trewe faythe christe thynges thys ryghteousnesse lawe righteousnes chiefe thynges worlde philosopher haue prescribed rule preceptes office dueties righteousnesse vertues menne myght lyue honest ciuile lyfe neyther canne thys worlde monumentes bookes one syllable rightousnes sette foorth theyr bookes whyche kepeth tenne commaundementes dothe nothyng agaynst honestie publique ordinance lawes custome c good honeste righteous man christe speaketh one worde ought doociuile righteousnes leaue vndoone speakethe symply onely owne worke saye goeth vnto fatherchristes goinge vnto father righteousnes shall see hym righteousnes none thyng therefore doo determyne get v true ryghteousnesse maye go obteyne owne workes owne righteousnes maketh nothyng vnto matterthough good workes iustifie yet may left vndone comma dementes sake become monke watche faste praye c whole pythe summe matter consisteth delyuerance frome synne obteyned thou knowest christ gone vnto father although good workes may left vndone thou arte commanded god tenne commaundementes doo diligentely exercise thy selfe good dedes commaunded god prescribed hys holye woorde thow mayste adde thys vnto theym thou sekest bee iustified made ryghteous theym thys righteousnesse onely bee goten christ gone vnto father thys alone waye none whereby wee delyuered frome synnes iustifyedwhat christes goinge vnto ye father christes iourneye goyng vnto father none thynge thenne hee hathe suffered dyed crosse deathe gone awaye oute worlde vnto father ascended heauen sytteth ryghte hande god father gouerneth kyngedome wee see thys beleue thys whole matter whereby iustifyed ryghteousnesse bee imputed strengthe power iesus christe hee goeth vnto fathernote well yf wee wylle speake wyth playne woordes thus muche saye man iustified saued delyuered synne onely iesus christ hath suffered dyed risen agayne goyng christ iustifieth thee none thyng nowe marke howe doothe agree wyth thys doctrinethe wycked doctrine papistes concernyng iustificacion papistes teache wyll saued say must bryng passe owne workes dede godly truely sayd christen man must lyue worlde godlye iustly holyly shall bee made righteous holy good workes false playne goynge christe vnto father worketh onely assured certayn true infallible righteousnes wherof worlde knoweth nothynge holye ghoste onely reueleth openeth mysterie papistes obiecte thys saying christe agaynst v thou wylte enter lyfe math kepe commaundementes thys hathe maner meanynge appearethe euidentely papystes knowe keepe commaundementes yf dydde woulde otherwyse expounde sentence christ christe alone ryghteousnes therefore sayenge abydethe sure certayne none ryghteousenesse euerlastynge lyfe v thenne thys lorde christe iesus gone oute thys worlde vnto father holde faste thys doctrine lette deuyll meanes plucke awaye frome thee deuyll maye feare trouble conscience oure owne strengthes wee able preuayle agaynst hym wayin christe ouer come deuyll christe goeth thoroughe hyghe obedience towarde heauenly father hym saye christ shall deuyll neuer bee able make vnryghteous synner althoughe thoroughe synne hee hathe hygher hande mefaythe therefore lette thys bee oure assured truste synguler great conforte stedfastely beleue christes goyng vnto father wee haue ryghteousnesse euen remyssion oure synnes euerlastynge lyfe faythe necessarie embrace thys woorke oure sauiour christechriste hathe perfectly wroughte worke redemption goynge worke christ certayne christe hath fynyshed whole matter soo nowe remaynethe nothynge elles embrace thys woorke christe wyth sure vndoubted faythe conforte selues therewyth doest thou beleue haste thou doest thou beleue itwithout faith saluation haste thou nothyng thys doone shoulde vtterly caste awaye owne ryghteousnesse whyche altogether spotted vnpure prophete saythe oure ryghteousnesses polluted defyled clothe esai sette oure faythe hope truste confydence onely vppon christ alone vppon worke goynge vnto hys father may tymes certayne sure reste whome seeke saluation yf oure righteousnesse dydde consyste owne woorkes satisfaction oure owne confession contrition preached yet pope church heartes neuer quiet neither shold tyme bee certayne sure saluation whenne shoulde knowe sure haue bene sorye ynoughe confessed doone penaunce ynoughe made satisfaction ynoughe therefore hathe christ taken matter frome vsour saluacion christ certen layde vppon hym selfe wee shoulde leaue hym alone moste stedfastely beleeuynge hys goyng vnto father hys deathe satisfaction oure ryghteousnesse behalfe bee vncertayntie ioan pet cor ioan persone suche euen christe iesus sonne god whome faulte canne founde dothe thys worke whyche ordeyned father hym myght haue healpe agaynste synne deuyll deathe consideration wherof ioan iohn baptist calleth lambe god saying beholde lambe god taketh awaye synne worlde thys therefore moste perfect determination thys oure gospellegood workes ryghteousnesse consisteth eyther doo leaue vndoone thys christe goeth vnto father whyche ryghteousnesse whenne thou haste one gotten fayth thou also good workes apply thy self vttermost thy power shew thy e obedience whyche thou owest vnto god thou haste embraced christe wyth certayne sure faythewhere fayth good work thou canste doo noo good woorke christen ryghteousnesse therefore mooste synguler excellente ryghteousnesse whiche hearte thynke reason wysedome conceaue matter knowen learned holye ghoste neyther though heare neither though heare otherwise perceaued faith alone christe sayth go vnto father yea shall se say ye must beleue iohn otherwise shal ye neuer coprehede worke iustification christian righteousnes whiche holy ghoste alone teacheth righteousnes ye world philolosophers lawyer expositours lawe teache parentes also familie christen man knowledge maner sciencewith faith thinges synne wherof worlde knoweth nothing namely without faith thing sin yt true euerlasting righteousnes consisteth christ goeth father se third part holy ghoste also rebuketh worlde iudgement maner iudgement christ sheweth wise prince world saieth iudged therfore holy ghoste doth rebuke worlde hath sinne asmuch beleueth christ yt hath righteousnes knoweth neither hath conforte therin christe gone father psal likewise doth rebuke iudgement knoweth nothing hereof therfore feareth nothinge feared wolde heare receaue worde extreme miserie lamentable plague haue syn righteousnes besides knowe consolation conforte againste sinne death euilles also sayth christe office holy ghost preach iudgementthe holye ghoste rebuketh world iudgement procure pronounced set forth gospel prince worlde iudged therfore hurte beleue christ put co fidence goinge vnto father maye vexe diuerse tentations neuer preuaile againste although prince worlde iohn luc pet yet prince iudged spoiled pallace armour chaines darcknes peter speaketh bounde christ cause christen men feare kyngdome prince iudged world also whiche kyngdome muste nedes iudged depriued power vngodly knowe therfore althoughe somtime heare worde math begynne beleue yet sone worlde rageth goeth persecute straightwaye frayde fall awaye christ worde christ saith parable sower parte whose sede fell vpon stone christian constant stand stedfaste lyke stronge inuincible bulwarckethe true chritians abyde constante stedfast tyme persecution voyce whiche rebuketh prince worlde alwaye heartes eares sholdest thou feare shouldest thou faint hearted geue ouer tentations knowest thou prince worlde iudged lordethe deuyl preuaile agaynste godes elect prince thou hast lord mightier euen christe iesus whiche hath ouercome bounde prince therfore let hym threaten bragge boaste let madde luste yet feare thou shal hurt thee cruell beaste whose violence crueltie repressed restrained stronge mightye chaines ac thou wilte beware thou comest nighe vnto hym willyngly cast thy selfe daunger thou nedest feare thou arte without peril shall thee harme wherfore required christias make light enemie kepe selues feare godmarke wel diligentlye praye enemie iudged shall neuer hurte contrariwyse wyll take hede secure carelesse shall sone caste hedlonge diuers perilles prince although iudged cofirmation strenghtening haue moste nedethe worlde abyde rebuked instrumentes holy ghoste worlde rebuke synne righteousnes accusation worlde le beare synne whiche thing haynous righteousnes hath none publique accusation ought yt world waxeth wode maketh hurly burly attempteth kinde violence tyrany againste minister worde holy ghost iudgemet setteth forth cosolatio ye preacher could neuer endure againste ye violece world must nedes feare tremble cause specially holy ghost called paracletus holy ghost called conforter yt say coforter aduocate aduersitie trouble stadeth preacher coforteth encourageth boldly stoutly cofesse ye truth forasmuch heare prince worlde iudged doctrine office ye holy ghost euen misteries worthie matter shall declare specially set forth vnto men worlde christen man knoweth moste excellent misteries also knoweth doth set goodes worlde thinges transitorie passe awaye thinges euerlastingethe goodes worlde transitorie shall neuer decaye paule sayth gospell power god vnto saluation many beleue going awaye therefore whereof christ speaketh greatly estemed reioyced moste singuler benefite rom whiche bounde dayly geue god oure heauenly father hartie thanckes desire feruent prayer maye churche instruct concerninge suche matter christe self fore taught whiche reason carnal iudgements could vnderstad attaine vnto knowledge therof new doctrine ye doctrine yt christ tofore taught shall holy ghost teache christ declareth plainely wordes shall speake selfe euer shal heare iohn shall speake shewe thinges comme shall glorifye shall receaue mine shal shewe vnto conforter whiche holy ghost whome father sende name shall teache thinges iohn bring thinges remembrance whatsoeuer haue said vnto holy ghost openeth lightneth darke mindes apostle golden glisteryng beames godly influence maketh plaine vnto vnto whole church true doctrine christe concerning sinnethe doctrine holy ghoste righteousnes iudgement maketh haue righte iudgement christes kyngdome whiche looked carnall glorious kingdome worlde instructeth touchinge conuersion getiles receauing nombre god people whome iudged dogges caste awayes teacheth gospell belongeth le gentile iewe respecte person god euer beleueth worketh righteousnes welcomme vnto hym enformeth worlde shoulde looke wealth glorie rich ease fauour men c crosse trouble affliction persecution losse goodes act banishment imprisonment last death father day shall ye aske name saye vnto wyll speake vnto father father hym selfe loueth ye haue loued haue beleued came god went father came worlde againe leaue worlde go father disciple sayde vnto lowe nowe thou talkest plainelye speakest prouerbe nowe sure thou knowest thinges nedest man shoulde aske thee question therfore beleue thou camest god iesus aunswered nowe ye beleue beholde houre draweth nye alredy come ye shalbe scattered euery man owne shall leaue alone yet alone father wordes haue spoken vnto ye myght haue peace worlde shall ye haue tribulation good chere haue ouercome worlde exposition gospell daye ye haue heard singuler notable exhortation vnto prayerthe comend cion pray ministerie worde highest seruice christen men vnto god euen cal glorious name feruent prayer exhortation vnto prayer christe made last supper vttered parte sermon whiche ye haue fore hearde tolde aforehand shoulde sadde departure notwithstanding litle whyle asmuche wolde shortly comme againe see turne sadnes gladnesin trouble must fa l prayer consolation foloweth nowe exhortation vnto prayer followeth aptly conuenient place christen men affliction trouble perilles daungers haue none helpe staye selfe praier crye vnto god helpe doth christe teache disciple place tyme sadnes shoulde haue refuge vnto prayer vttereth maruelous pithyly great vehemencie wordes shoulde worke stout courage iac stronge fayth meanes dysmayd sayth say vnto shal pray father father himselfe loueth ye haue loued haue beleued come god true christ sitteth right hande father rom maketh intercession v paule saith knowe prayer made laste supper churche poore sinner iohn heb afterwarde crosse hearde yet stil suche efficaciethe vertue christes prayer hys churche strength mighte power remaineth styll full force euen vnto worldles ende sayth christ ye haue nede suche prayer make ye able praye father neither doubte ye prayer heard father therefore loueth ye haue loued vnderstanded though prayer christ vnto v neither conforte helpe set owne prayer naught forasmuche loue christgod hearethe prayer true christian certein thing earnestly beleued fauour loue christe father hate yea prayer none otherwise heare nowe papistes haue inculked set forth vnto v inuocation sainctes greater force auauncement setting forth prayer christ death departure worlde vnto father hath gotten vnto v entrauncewee maye praye al place wee shall heard loue christe wheresoeuer temple house secret place feilde shoppe christian loue christe maye bolde come god talke praye vnto hym craue hym whatsoeuer haue nede vnto suche prayer nede nothinge suche hearte saye heauenly father knowe thou louest loue thy sonne redemer christ iesu boldnes wil pray vnto thee holy righteous knowe thou gladly geuest thinges thy son sake iesus christ name nowe come vnto thee praye doubt thou wilt heare prayer whatsoeuer euery man must diligently take hede thiswe maye differre praier till found worthy selues praye long differre prayer till shall thincke selfe pure cleane ynoug apt praye deuill sometime put man mynde saye thou arte nowe apte mete praye thou arte sinner god heareth synners ohn worke fyrst afterwarde thou felest thy selfe pure without sinne fall prayer geueth place suggestion satan suffrethsatan seketh hinder prayer himselfe troubled suche idle imagination shal finde lettes plenty withdraw plucke hym awaye prayer deuill sutle craftie seketh meanes possible let v prayer must therefore get v certein present helpes maye remoue subtilties fro v whe soeuer thy necessitie requireth praier thincke time whe thou oughtest pray differre tyme lenger fall straightwaies hande prayer thou thy selfe apte worthie praye god make apte worthie thincke verely thy selfe god loueth thee christes sake thou art righteous holye otherwise neuer loue thee heare thy prayer founde righteous holy sight iob psal child one daye olde yea angells heauen pure enter lorde iudgement thy seruant saith dauid none yt lyueth shal founde righteous thee god hath wrapped thinges vnder sinne might haue mercie al sayth paule requireth christ place diligently praye rom galat meanes neglecte prayer wicked persones wont scoffingly saye said lordes prayer great whyle yet haue good stomacke meate drincke euer lyfe thou christen man chalengest vnto thee nameepicures let neuer suche worde come thy mouth thou saye lord prayer ofter lest say morninge thou rysethwe muste praye contynually meate also thou goest bedde night christian bounde pray alwayes whiche mouth time done prayer heart heartes ye faythful ought wyshe continually luc thess eccle name god may sanctified kyngdome maye come wil geue v peace seasonable weather sounde body good health c doth euery christen man inwardly wishe time although doth euer thincke yet continuall desire spirituall prayer prayer hearte haue nede prayer tymesa christen euer danger therefore ought euer pray christen man muche moment houre safe without ieopardie deuill owne fleshe lest ca hedlong diuers sinnes vice heart likewise mouth ought praye maner prayer ought christ teacheth sayth aske name againe ye father loueth youbecause ye haue loued haue beleued yt haue come fro god man instructed beleueth christevery christen man priest true priest furniture neither wanteth thinge may boldly open mouth lippes declare matter hymselfe saye lorde haue nede hath neighbour nede geue v christes sake c time suche nowecause pray neuer want necessarie cause pray calamity publique misery plentie peril daungers copasse v rounde cause euils deuill murtherer lyar iohn lying goeth oppresse worde god commotion insurrection murtheringe one troubleth ciuile state publique peace pope turke tyrauntes enemy worde god helpe deuyll also forwarde matter yea also priuatly euery one v haue oure priuate incommodities affliction haue cause sufficient moue v vnto prayer aptly expresse prayer haynous greuous euylles let take vnto lord prayera short declaration lordes prayer whiche containeth seuen petition wherin coprehended abundantly thinges haue nede praye first petitio halowed thy name pray ye ministery true ministersthe first peticion againste heretikes vngodly personnes againste iewes infidelles turkes againste pope papistes blaspheme name god dishonoure god represse confound send faithfull workemen haruest math conserue kepe worde sincere pure againste heresy second petition thy kingdome come desirethe second pe icion kyngdome deuil death may decaye come naught ample large petition comprehendeth al deuils kingdome god maye make ende vtterlye destroye set vp owne kingdome v menne thorowe worde holy ghost thirde peticionin third petition thy done earth heauen praye wyll whiche cotrary mercifull god may restrained hindered maye take place prayer deuill impes abide yea prayer preserueth kepeth v safe many incommodities combraunces deuil worlde would dayly attempte bring passe againste vsif letted petition fourthe peticionin fourth petition geue v daye dayly breade praye maiestrates parentes wyfe child fruites earth seasonable weather peace thynges necessarie present life euery man according vocation calling wil please god prosper thinges defend euil fyfte petition forgeue v oure trespassesthe fyfte peticion forgeue trespasse v desire yt god wyll merciful vnto v turne awaye wrath v haue iustly deserued deale v accordinge sin wil forgeue v trespass geue v grace may waxe daily better better shewe beneuolence good wil one toward one v forgeue great soeuer offence sixte petitio leade v temptationthe sixt peticion aske ye god specially helpe afflicted conscience perishe tentation may deliuered worde holy ghost seuenth petition deliuer v euill pray blessed prosperous endthe seuenth peticion may deliuered al sinnes calamity lyfe brought vnto glorious euerlasting lyfe remayne god kyngdome euermore thus see lord praier contayned abondatly al thinges necessarye prayed whether deliuered thinges euil holpe thinges good thinges necessarie daily prayed great plentie necessity peril first publiquely afterwarde priuately euerye man owne busynesseswe oughte feruentlye geuen prayer onely one thynge greatly lamented colde slouthfull vnto godly exercise prayer neyther resorte vnto wyth suche earnest desyre fayth ought commandement set forth byddeth v pray also promes yt shal vndoubtedly heard shold lack page duplicate page duplicate nothing might furder v behalfe christe aforesaide prayer hath prescribed appointed vnto v certein forme maner praying math psal asmuche oure indignitie vnworthynes reasone synnes doth alwayes trouble v eyther praye nothyng el whe pray doubt whether shalbe heard notwe muste praye name christ must encourage confirme heartes christ commandeth v expresse wordes shoulde aske praye name promiseth certeintie yt whatsoeuer aske name shall surely receaue haue wordes vtterly remoueth worshipping god prayer creature either heauen earthprayer made name christ prayer vnto onely person iesus christ therfore prayer made name christ prayer worshippinge god monckes praye god haue mercy fraunces sake dominickes sake benet bernardes sake wil graunt petitio owne workes sake fasting almose dedes prayer c prayer made name christe name fraunces dominicke benet c theyr owne name suche prayer iewes turkes infidelles yea papistes wil haue name christ prayergod hearethe prayer made name christ adde vnto also name mary apostle sainctes concerning idolatrous prayer end god heareth please rather displease god honoring rather dishonoring god although hipocrites many tymes obteyne aske yet muche better themnote well neuer obteyn sorte wherby confirmed hardened impietie vngodlynes godly praye despaire theyr owne name neyther wyll tyme praye forasmuche knowe ioan god mercyfull christes sake haue commandement shoulde praye name christ encourageth theym althoughe confesse synners deede yet approche vnto god boldely speake vnto hym maner father wee thy chyldren lack haue nede dyuers thynges oh bee mercyfull vnto v beholde oure synnes thy sonne christe iesus hys name come vnto thee oh heare v truely sayde sainct augustine prayer made thorowe christe psal say name christe doothe put awaye synne prayer selfe made synne sainct ambrose also saieth christ alone mouthe whereby speake father libro de isaac etamina eye wherby see father right hand wherby offer vnto father whyche christe excepte maketh intercession v neither saintes haue thyng doo godwhat praye trulye praye truely prayer made onely name iesu christ therof doth folowe whatsoeuer aske name faithfully truly shall surely obteyne whiche thynge ought moue prouoke v gladly praye heare soeuer aske name christ shal neuer cease tyll come vnto throne god obtayne required consideration suche promyse christ sayth vnto disciple hytherto ye haue asked nothynge name trusted onely hys healpe hee prayde theym euen menne countrey thynke nede praye theyr parishe prieste dothe christ commaundeth hensefoorth selues shoulde praye maye receaue themselues ioy may perfectprayer onlye r dressethe mesiries suche commaundement ought diligently consydered accordyng thervnto oughte earnestly prepare selues vnto prayer myseries trouble affliction cross c shall neuer want world redresse wherof ought continually praye therfore desyreth full perfect ioye delyuered peril euyls let hym embrace prayer christ dothe comend neyther let hym doubt shall obteyn soeuer asketh name christ vnto glorie god vnto saluatio great incommoditie vnto v knowe rom paule sayeth howe ought praye hereof commeth many praye delyuerance certayn myseries doo obtayne god knoweth best profitable v paule hymselfe also prayde god woulde delyuer tentation sayd christe2 cor grace sayth sufficient thee strength made perfect thorough weakenes lykewise may come passe nowe day thou desirest deliuerance troublegod dothe thynges ye beste god knoweth better v still trouble therfore taketh awaye affliction miserie v delyuered frome shoulde peraduenture falle wycked vice insolencie pride negligence securitie wantonnes gluttonie vnclennesse c therfore prayer concernynge dayly breade math petition touchyng wyll god wherin wee praye oure wyll god may done math marc luc christ praied garden said thy done prayer ought tempereda good lesson set v wil god thynges preferre owne example leapour lett v doubte god wyll geue v thynges math whiche vnto glorie vnto saluation yet incommoditie god healpe geuewe maye appoinc god oure prayer whe hee shall helpe v soeuer aske name sonne christe iesu moste certayne true notwithstanding maner tyme may determyne howe hee muste healpe geue v reason ceasseth make importune suite haue good successe hande streyght way despaireth helpe lykewyse concerning tyme iudith healpe cometh vnto v within many howers dayes yeares caste awaye hope helpe neyther small tentations wherewith faith vehemently impugned enfebled therfore necessary sure faith apprehende laye hande worde god esa thren silence hope pacience loke healpe god promised v name christ soeuer done concernyng tyme way maner c contrary expectatio according ye wil god cause called helper incouenient tyme psal nowe asmuch owne nature impacient thynke always high tyme healpe god deferreth matter longe thus prescribe appoint god shall doo wee must auoyde eschewe thys arrogancye pryde oure faythe may fyrmely constantly fixed sette vppon promysegod wyl help co ueniente tym pray vnto god christe sonnes sake wyll healpe v conuenient tyme euen shall make moste hys glory healthe saluation doctrine concernyng prayer whereof haue great nede dayespraier onlye staye thys worlde neyther haue healpe worlde christe declareth sayth aske ioy may perfect ioan prayer bee trewe sounde perfect full ioye place thereof commeth care sorowe trouble disquietnesse cforget englad didde proue bee trewe many yeares paste yf geuen myndes earnestly faythefull prayer pope wyth hys tirannye greatly preuayled realme prayer diligently exercised pope tyrantes worlde rage persecute worse goeth wyth theyr wicked deuises haue also lerned experiece tyme therfore let v loke wel v diligently apointed v first let mini ters word diligently teach truthhow ye church christ maye safly preserued fro ye deuil antichri ste let fal praier yea let many loue glory god practise selues cotinually holy exercise prayer thys meanes shall church christ safelye preserued frome deuyll antichrist yea tyrantes worlde therfore loueth church faithfull congregation god desyrous see prosper lette hym thynke ought laboure vnto vttermost power maye bee conserued safely kepte commeth passe onely prayer thou prayest name heauenlye father maye sanctified kyngdom may come wyll may done contrary part deuyls name may cursed abhorred kyngdome maye destroyed wyl hys counsayles deuises may come naughte made vtterly frustrate voydeuery christe man souldiour ephe thou doest doest thou stande thyne armoure lyke good trewe souldiour fielde valyantly defendeth churche christe agaynst deuyll pope worlde euery christen man warriour myghtyly fighteth agaynst power darknesse defence god people preacher wyth doctrine godly people wyth prayer yea preacher people oughte together fyghte agaynste antichriste wyth prayer two thyngeswith preaching praier kingdome antichriste ouercome wherewyth deuyll pope turke whole power darkenesse ouercome meane preachynge prayer surely deuyll hys kyngdome otherwyse bee ouercome2 corin preachyng prayer oure heauenly father wyll shoulde thus fyght striue agaynst enemy holy congregation nothynge doubte thoroughe oure prayer counsayles deuices oure ennemies vnsatiable bloudsuppers neolike tyrantes haue bene disappoynted coulde haue successean exhortario vnto prayer wee wyll haue churche christe prosper flourishe yea bee free danger enemy let v earnestly heartily fall vnto feruent prayer lette v esteme prayer thyng vile reputation rather iudge thing high price maiesty lord god therfore exercise prayer meanes neglect although ye thinke selues vnmete vnworthy yf shold respect dignitie worthynes neuer pray let v cast burdeyn vpon men backes pray let euery christen man pray thinke thus himselfe forasmuche prayer acceptable vnto god profitable congregation comon welth wyll go vnto congregation pray vnto vttermoste power sure shall spende tyme vayne lose labour meruailous dangerous imagination thynke maner let praye shouldest thou prophane person bee occupied holy thynga wicked imagenacion yea rather think thou thus thy selfe haue christ worde rather loose euer haue worlde thenne denye christ thus dothe folowe father loueth wyll heare prayer christe hathe promysed therefore wylle make delaye ceasse frome prayenge leauynge vnto thys promyse christe uerily veryly saye vnto iohn euer ye shall aske father name wyll geue wyll goe vnto heauenlye father craue hym name christe suche thynges haue neede either conseruation body saluation soule nowe touchynge thys lorde christe sayeth afterwarde thynges haue spoken vnto prouerbes bee vnderstandedchristes kingdom spiritu thoughe hadde spoken obscurely darkely vtterynge one thynge meanynge woordes playne euidente open math luc act muche disciple yet hadde experience thys matter neyther dydde knowe christe shoulde haue spirituall kyngedome saye rule hys woorde spirite looked temporall worldly kyngedome euen iewes thys day swoorde pollaxe seemed vnto soeuer spake obscure darke sayenge matter vttered strange tongue whyche vnderstode sayth matter shall bee otherwyse tyme shall comme wyll speake wyth prouerbesthe holye ghost teacheth praye wyll openly playnely shewe vnto father whenne holye ghoste commeth kyndleth oure heartes wyth trewe faith goodnesse mercye god thoroughe christe foloweth heartye good wylle feruente desyre praye without holye ghoste possible manne haue faythefull couragious mynde praye therefore holye prophete zacharye callethe holye ghoste spirite grace zacha prayer bothe muste bee ioygned together faythe whiche maketh v knowe god mercyfull fatherfaythe gyft god muche hathe geuen v hys sonne gyfte god whyche holye ghost worketh v gospell thys spirite grace foloweth spirite prayer also rom necessity trouble calle vppon god healpe thys certayne persuasion assured hope god wyll heare v geue v healthe saluation sonne christes sake therfore saithe christ daye shall frankly freely shewe father teach holye ghoste ye may knowe father truely ye shall aske name prayer shall frustrate vayne howe father denye thynge seyng hee loueth haue loued beleued came frome godpraier without faithe prayer oute suche faythe muste trewe prayer nedes come otherwyse prayer althoughe bee made neuer fyne pyked woordes god oure deare louynge father hys greate mercye synguler goodnesse moughte vouchesafe hys sonne christes iesus sake sende hys holye spirite oure heartes wee oure trouble aduersities maye praye perfourme seruice god worlde maye delyuered temporall myseries worlde come enioye trewe pleasure heauenly ioyes whiche shall neuer haue ende amen sermon feast ascension christe made vpon epistle daye actes former treatise deare theophilus haue spoken iesus began teache vntyll daye taken vp holy ghoste geuen commaundementes vnto apostle chosen also shewed selfe aliue passion many token appearyng vnto xi dayes speakyng kyngdom god gathered together commaunded depart ierusalem wayte promise father wherof sayth ye haue herd iohn truly baptised water ye shalbe baptised holy ghoste fewe dayes therefore come together asked hym sayinge lorde wylt thou tyme restore agayne kyngdome israell sayd vnto know tymes season whiche father hathe put owne power ye shal receyue power holy ghost come vpon ye shalbe witness vnto lye ierusalem also iewrye samaria euen vnto worldes ende spoken thinges whyle behelde taken vp hye cloude receyued hym vp syght whyle loked stedfastly vp towarde heauen went behold two men stode whyte aparell also sayde ye men galile stande ye gasynge vp heauen iesus taken vp heauen shall come euen ye haue seene hym goe heauen exposition daye celebrated kepte holy feast ascention christe maye better instructed concernynge thys article christen faythtwo thinges speciallye taught sermon ascended mysterie christes ascention hath done dyd ascende profyte hath brought churche faithefull congregation hys meruailous glorious ascension concernynge hystoriethe historie christes ascension blessed luke hys chronicle apostle actes dothe diligently describe set foorthe maketh mention daye place persones present maner lord space fortie day shewed hymself aliue disciple resurrection act spoke vnto
