gospelle thorough worlde hadde spoken thynges whyle behelde hee taken vp hye clowde receaued hym vp oute theyr syghte whyle looked stedfastly vp towarde heauen went beholde sayth luke two men stoode theym whyte apparell whyche sayd vnto ye menne galilee stande ye gasing vp heauen thys iesvs whyche taken vp frome heauen shall come euen ye haue seene hym go heauen act historie ascention christ described sette forth blessed luke hystorye fyrst miracle woorthye obseruedthe state glorified body lorde christ hys disciple caryed vp heauen cloude taken oute theyr syght whiche manyfeste declaration vnto v state glorified body generall resurrection shall bee naturall propretie men body caried vp notwithstandyng shalbe condition glorified body moment maye go place without impediment thyng example christe teacheth whome rose agayne death vnto lyfe stone graue could hynder hym afterwarde doores shutte coulde kepe hym pearceth thorow thyngs maketh hym selfe vysible wyll agayn inuisible pleasure felicitie blessed state shall body also haue resurrection body shall immortall subiecte infirmity nowe thys lyfe wherein combred many disease necessity thynges shall speake tyme whenne wee shall treate article resurrection deade lette v nowe come vnto principall poynte whole matter wherunto also angel speciall respecte called agayne waye disciple gased rather consider christe ascended heauen beyng littell afore seene nowe seene nomore doctrine apostle thynges moueth specially poynt consider vnto ende actes christe doone example rom referre christes deathe vnto sinnes resurrection vnto oure iustification likewise sorte muste nowe also see christe ascended heauen commoditie profyt haue ascension christ ascension declareth ye kyngdome thys worldeand fyrst lette v behold nature state kyngdome gone vp heauen declareth kyngdom worlde administration shall maner worldly kyngdomes disciple demaunded christe tyme woulde restore kyngdome israell opinyon iohn christes kyngedome shoulde corporall worldly kyngedome ascension taught otherwyse thynke kyngdom saye worldely kyngdome oute great richesse dignity promotion looked actes rather spirituall euerlastynge kyngedome whyche hee shoulde geue spirituall gyftes vnto menne therefore lette manne become one christes flocke ende wyll gette temporall goodes worldely possession come vnto great honour thynges found kyngdome baptisme ministerie worde lordes supper instituted teporall thinges neither shold christ euer haue ben reueled worldwhy christ came heauen bene graue weighty cause euerlastyng saluation rightousnes came heauen therfore higher greater matter sonne god either descende ascend verily might prouide v euerlasting goodes fauor god remission sinnes gift holy ghost righteousnes euerlastyng lyfe gyfts must loke christes hand continued life wet euer stinge life euen heauen hath begun spirituall inuisible euerlasting kingdome whych thing longe prophecied dauid certaine psalm psal ephe paule reciteth epistle ephesian interpreteth ascention christ spirituall kyngdome word thou art gone vp hie thou hast led captiuitie captiue receiued giftes men yea euen thyn enemy lord god might dwel among sentence short comprehendeth many thynges euery one oughte dilygently weyghed pondered consydered first worde paule hymself handleth lyke apostle saith ascended meaneth also descended fyrste lowest partes earth descended euen also ascended vp aboue heauens fulfyll thynges paule hys wordes dothe exquisitely handle bothe descension ascension christe thys meanes maye knowe whense many greate gyftes came haue receaued ascension christ let man thinke owne woorkes rightousnesse holynes lyfe wyth thynge hathe deserued receaue noble gyftes christes ascension christ himselfe hath deserued geueth gyftes phil came downe humbled hymselfe sake became manne v dyed crosse gyftes dothe paule signify wordes interpreteth mynd prophete putteth christes descension ascension muche holy ghoste prophete speaketh thus christe thou wentest vp hye foloweth herof came made lowe whych altogether doone sake therfore paules interpretation agreeth wel woordes christ ioan whiche ye lately hearde expedient go except go way comfortour shall come go waye sende hym vnto go way wyl prepare place ioan sayeng thou art gone vp hye maketh differece betwene christ ascended heauen enoch taken vp vnto god gen helias wente vp fyerye charette christ went vp heauen ascended owne power hee also hys owne power rose agayne frome deathe vnto lyfe without healpe thyng great diuersitie shall rayse vp oure selues laste day4 reg iohn christe shall rayse v vp christe hymselfe rose frome deathe vnto lyfe owne power sayeth gospell iohn iohn father loueth geue ouer lyfe maye take man taketh away geue ouer owne selfe haue power geue ouer haue power take agayne peter chronicle apostle actes sayth act impossible hym bee holden deathe lyke maner difference betweene ascension ascend vp heauenthe differenc christes ascension oures christe draweth v vnto hym christ hym self went vp heauen owne power sayth gospell iohn manne goeth vp heauen oan came downe heauen say owne power diuersitie betwene christes ascention oures dyd holy ghost shew long thys myghte teache v christ almyghty euerlastyng god whome oughte saye wyth embracynge armes receaue psalme sayth moreouer thou wentest vp hye none thing sayd christ pronounced pilate kingdome worlde ioan therefore althoughe worlde occupied matter houshold policie yet seynge wee christian kyngdome christ worlde oughte lyfte vp myndes vnto heauen maye aboue thynges embrace spirituall kingdome looke vnto part v dothe contrary greate number v bothe body mynd able ar altogether drowned swallowed vp present thing worldthe maners thys world discribed seketh goodes possession therof though shold liue euer neuer depart regarde litle nothynge christe gone vp hyethoughe bodyes ye earth yet myndes ought heaue holy ghost wold haue lewdnesse amended v therefore diligently putteth v mynde christ gone vp hye hath left forsaken earthy thyngs although vpon earthe oure bodie yet hearte mynde sholde alway haue desyre vpward trouble herts care world christen man wise behaue hymself let body occupied necessarie thyngs present life let hys mynd haue delight pleasure meditation study trauaile exercise heauenly supernall euerlastinge thynges paule saith coloss seke thinges aboue christ sitting right hand god thynges earth christ go vp heauen busines hath matter dothe psalme make mencion saying thou art gone vp hie thou hast led captiuitie captiue description great glorious triumph christ maner appeareth christe hadde respect psalme luc putte foorthe parable stronge armed manne whyche kept palaice al thinges quietsynne hath made v bond slaues deuyll deathe tyll one stronger came vpon bounde hym toke awaye weapon wherein trusted made spoyle wee wretched caytiues synne vnder tyrannye deuyll death whych dothe hold v captiue escape thys tyranny deuill vttermoste hath dominion ouer v deathe kylleth v pleasure selues able nothyng agaynst christ whiche farre excelleth strength cometh firste thorow greate humilitie betrayde crucifiedchristes humilitie death satisfieth sinnes whole worlde innocent lambe thinges ioyned great humilitie appeareth nothinge moste highe infirmitie weakenes therfore hanged crosse may dye synne put awaye deathchristes glorious tryumph ouer synne deuill hell weake christ buried graue nowe hop cometh forth meruelous great power glorie alyue quick heard daye christes resurrection holy ghoste sayth ledde captiuitie captiue say hathe destroyed kingdome deuil death hath spoiled power deuill fromhensforth hath power ouer christian death kill euerlastingly rom neither synne condemne therefore thinges turned cleane contrarie holdenby christ made free synne deuyll death damnation vnder captiuitie synne perceaued deuill reason oure sinne cruell tyrant againste v coulde meanes escape moste bytter payne death looked yea worthely euerlasting damnation cruell tormentes hell fyre fromhensforth shall sowhy christ ascendede heauen christe vnto ende ascended heauen shoulde holde bondes slaues power synne death deuill fromhensforth exercise tyranny againste v tofore haue done attempt violence v chaunce best behalfe synne ceaseth prouoke v rom synne meanes may enforce v thing againste god make v haue gyltie conscience infirmitie great resiste sin ought dauid great man holy2 reg yet throwne two greuous haynous sinnes nowe deliuered fro sinnes2 reg forgiuen cause beleued yt blessed sede promised come shold destroye power synne make bonde prisoner therfore oppresse dauidall thinges worke best vnto loue god cause also prayeth feruently circumspecte doinges euer thus fallen psal neuer made moste godly swete psalme miserere deatheand likewise matter concerning death refraine violence v neither otherwise tremble feare beholdinge therof cometh passe death none thinges entendeth death taken prisoner bounde yt nowe hurt kyl euerlastingly faithful1 cor styng therof taken awaye christ selfe vtterly subdued ouercome osee christ selfe saith prophet death wil thy death therfore whe death sheweth selfe moste fearce vttereth greatest violence yet doth true christian cause flee vnto worde god maye exercise selues diligently confirme selues otherwise wold haue done terrours death bene euen may spoken concerning deuil sutle deceiptfull craftie cruell enemiethe deuyll time lyeth waight christian meanes may make hope frustrat vaine1 pet christ lord ouer shal onely bring passe entendeth also christian assalted himnote well ye ware circumspecte doth make prouoke diligently geue mindes prayer meditation studie god worde comit selfe wholly tuition defence god euermore calling helpe succour without sutle craftie enemie wold become careles negligent stand feare suche aduersarie nowe watch circumspecte take hede fall daunger al thinges therfore profit christian whiche corrupt pernitious nature plague pestilence confusion destruction chaunceth christian christ ascended heauen hath meanes made prisonerssynne death deuyll taken prisoner christ ye christian wold pleaseth christ suffer appoint synne wold gladly condene v death wold faine kyl v deuil altogether desirous cast v hedlog euerlasting damnati obut wold forasmuch although enemy yet captiues bond slaues christ although cruel fearce v yet hurt v noble fruit singuler comoditie christes ascentio greate enemy synne death deuillthe fruite christes ascencion whose captiues bonde slaues nowe imprisoned christe holden bondage meanes free tyranny purpose dyd go vp heauen sytteth right hande god might defende churche christ hath receued gyftes menit foloweth psalme thou hast receaued gyfts men saye suche gyftes thou wilt distribute vnto men thorowe gyftes helpe cofort maner gyftes god prophet ioel declareth saying poure spirit vpon fleshe ioel sonnes daughter shall prophecie olde men shall dreame dreames yong men shal se vision yea dayes wil poure spirit vpon seruantes maydens wil shewe wonder heauen aboue token earth beneth ye gospel iohn christ saith thus iohn go away wil send confortour vnto shal come rebuke ye worlde sin righteousnes iudgemet peter also saith sence christ right hand god exalted act hath receaued father promes holy ghost hath shed forth gyfte whiche ye nowe see heare two thinges principally whiche holye ghost workeththe workes holye ghost firste leadeth v thorowe gospel vnto true knowledge christ maye beleue haue remission synnes name maye bringe forth worthy fruites repentaunce resiste synne mortifye earnestly begin obeye god newnes lyfe afterwarde taketh place oure soule bodye heart al partes v although sinnefull body neuer free sinne shall vtterly without synne rom psal yet sinne remaineth v imputed v layde charge christes sake neyther doth condemne v firste thynge holy ghost worketh v secondly holy ghoste also maketh instrument thorowe worde preachynge therof maye brought vnto knowledge grace psal ephe consideration wherof paule interpreteth psalme ende thorowe ascention christ giftes chaunce vnto v hath made apostle prophetes euangelistes shepheardes teacher edifying saintes worke ministration euen edifying body christe till come vnitie fayth knowledge sonne god vnto perfect man vnto measure ful perfecte age christ se daily experience howe cruell enemie deuil worde specially dayesenemies godes worde calleth vnto hym helpe turke pope tyrates worlde coming gether hurly burly speares iauelinges handes lord annointed psal may put waye worde god make hauocke churche christ pope turke shewe furie crueltie churche christe holye wordepers ecutyon maketh worde god florishe doth prosper florishe daily getteth victorie ouer enemy whiche doubte shall shortly come confusion gate hell math sayth christ shall preuaile church congregation whosoeuer falleth stone shall broken peces math whome soeuer falleth shal al grinde baptisme lordes supper worde tyrantes worlde take awaye yet destroye congregation whiche exerciseth faithfully truly lytle fruite smal commoditie christes ascention ende went vp heauen might sende holy ghost set forwarde ministerie gospel worlde god defedeth churchemoreouer also called giftes god gouerneth defendeth churce conforteth aduersitie preserueth persecution kepeth trueth defendeth errours moueth vnto prayer godlye exercise christe faith ye gospel iohn day ye shal aske name man without helpe holye ghost shorte whatsoeuer haue receaue al giftes christ fruites ascention1 cor iac purpose christe ascend heauen shoulde stablishe suche kingdome make vnto hym selfe thorowe holy ghost churche euen suche churche gate hell shall neuer able preuaile math luke doth luke aptly signifie euangelical historie recordeth christ redy ascend heauenchriste blessed disciple lifted vp handes blessed disciple popishe byshoppes wont wagginge fyngers ouer people kneleth downe praied wished wel ministeriewhat christes blessing math marc enioyned preache gospell euery creature say kynde men nation people gospell commanded preached plantes stone byrdes fish c men reasonable creature said beleueth baptised shalbe saued marc stone tree beleue therfore pertaineth vnto neither preaching baptisme faith baptisme belong vnto men therfore doth preachinge gospell pertayne vnto alone christ vseth figure maner speach sayingwhat preach gospell euerye creature preache gospel euery creature may comprehende al degree condition men emperour kinge prince mightie must heare beleue receaue gospel el thinke himselfe dede damned commandement doth christ lyfte vp handes blesseth saye doth wysh may prosper haue good successe execution office signifieth also yt helpe defende present ministerie geue good encrease ye saith ye prophet worde yt cometh mouth esa shal turne againe voide vnto shal accomplishe wil prosper thing wherto sent therfore wheresoeuer gospel taughtwhersoeuer gospell preached blessinge christe christe lyfteth vp handes bringeth forth blessinge maye bringe forth fruite returne vayne without doubt great conforte christ tyme ascend lyfteth vp handes blesseth ye disciple euidetly declarethwhat christe mente blessing disciple ascentio bringeth vnto v swete cosolation cofort great helpe syn deuil death hel diuerse noble giftes vnto edifyinge god church fynally blessinge good wil fauour yea also transitorie life euerlasting life immortall glorie vnoutspeakable ioye ende christ haue geuen louinge gentle token louing gentle good toward v lifting vp handes blessyng v borne v good wold haue suffred v haue place kingdo seing lifted vp handes wysheth well newe enioyned ministerie moste euident argument sure signe manifest token beareth singuler good towarde v desyre euer partaker blessing receaue therof greate consolation conforte thorowe preachinge gospell whiche power god vnto saluation manie beleue rom thus haue sett foorth vnto rticle christes ascension wherby ye vnderstande full swetnes conforte great singuler profite cometh v ye haue hearde forasmuche oure owne fleshe bloude euen sonne god sytteth right hand god synne death deuill without power haue greate libertie strength yt hurte v although oure capital cheife enemy seke meanes possible destroye v yet enemy prisoner boude slaues ye haue hearde also yt thorow ascension christ holy ghost geuen vnto v may lede v truth defende v againste errours conforte v affliction praye v moue v prayer finally garnishe v maner spirituall heauenly gyftes cause christe ascended heauen sitteth right hande god paule sayth maye fulfyll thinges saye geue graunt v thinges whatsoeuer haue nede vnto saluation euerlasting lyfe therfore let v follow example apostle luke sayth luc let v worship lord christ iesus yea great ioye geue huble entier heartie thakes heauely father desyre hym yt conserue kepe v grace ye last geue v ioyeful enheritauce moste glorious kingdome iesus christ sonnes sake alone sauiour alone redemer alone aduocat alon mediatour alon lawfulfiller alone peace maker god father god holy ghost honour glory praise nowe worldes without ende amen sonday ascension pthe gospell ihon xvi comforter come wyll send vnto father euene spirite trueth whiche procedeth father shal testifie yee shall beare witnesse also ye haue ben beginninge thinges haue sayde vnto yee shoulde offended shall excommunicate yea tyme shall come whosoeuer killethe wyll thinke doth god seruice thynges wyl vnto haue knowen father neyther yet thynges haue tolde time come ye may remember tolde exposition gospel specially considered two thingesthe holye ghoste almighte euerlasting god first cocerning holy ghost second persecution whiche shall come confessours professours gospell ye worlde touchinge holy ghost confesse almightie euerlasting god christ calleth special name euen conforter declareth true godlines without crosse affliction nede conforter troublesthe misery true christian thys worlde outwardly inwardly persecution christ describeth setteth forth ye persecutio godly shal slaine whiche haynous offence also shal counted people verye aduersaries open enemy true religion godlines therefore meanes suffred iudgement men taken earth cruel death deuised pestiferous person intollerable heretikes hated god man yt punishment christian shal excede somtime also troubled conscience thincking haue ben muche vehement haue gone farre might haue done spoken circumspectly warely shold lesse danger haue chaunced haue liued longer done good thus ye christias troubled outwardlye tyrantes world inwardly weakenes consciencewhy holy ghost called conforter consideration herof doth christ call holy ghost conforter though saye know great trouble miserable affliction blouddy persecution vnrestful griffes ye shall fall howe whole worlde euer shal againste wil prouide helpe se ye shall stick myre left confortles yea appeareth confort al helpe succour ye selues also thorow weakenes co science shalbe troubled inwardlynote well w il send vnto holy ghost conforter may cofirme make strog mindes yt ye despaire encourage abide shal say vnto two maner cosolatios co fort one worldly coforttwo kyndes conforte vncertein vaine cofort dependeth altogether rich power glorie frendship good wil prince great men saith christthe conforte worlde none al shal disciple haue yea thinges shall wt notwitstading let dismay yt ye finde cofort ye worldes handes yt coforte great waight neither cotinuace therof long som sode mischauce displeasure great sicknes agewe plague pestilence misfortune maketh sone end worldly coforte saith wil prouide conforter euen spirite truth shal cofort confirmethe conforte holye ghoste strengthen ye shall combred opprest terrours fear infirmity misery calamity outwardly worlde inwardly mynde cause hath holy ghost name yt called coforter accuser troubler sadnes perturbation token holy ghoste conforter also called spirite truth coforteth ye world doth nothyng sure costant cosolation confort perpetual euerlastig able destroie scrupule doubt conscience answerethan obiection thou speakest muche conforte fele fele rather contrarie worlde mery ful pleasure ihon christias mourne euer vnder crosse iohn baptiste beheaded math mar luc herode harlotte herodias frolike mery euen goeth v worlde enuieth v bytte breade euery man thincketh whatsoeuer mischiefe doth christian well done meane ye pope cardinallesantichristes disciple better case world disciple christe christes humilitie bishoppes hate gospell lyue pleasure iolytie reaste peace idlenes heartes ease without affliction trouble therfore conforte christ answereth conforte must make distinction betwene confortes worlde also hath coforte could neuer secure careles mery without care confortethe answer whiche cometh spirite truth deceitfull confort maye sodenly come passe thing wherin worlde reposeth conforte stayeworldly confort vncerten may founde cofort helpe holy ghost conforter christian spirite truth whiche inwardly conforteth v certein sounde sure consolationthe conforte ye holy ghost certen sure therfore although iohn haue conforte herode whore hath caste prison lieth miserably afflicted withoue consolation tyll laste looseth head yet holy ghost conforteth cofirmeth secretly hearte speaketh vnto maner good courage iohn let aduersitie dismaye thee neither thou disconforted yu art miserably vniustly caste prison wycked worlde doth hate thee reuile thee thou knowest worldly thinges continew long hath ouerhand tyranny therof shall longe endure1 iohn worlde tyranny shall shortly vanishe awaye euer plagued hel fyre contrariwise thy affliction shall endure long euerlasting ioye shall come place thereof momet houre better thousand yeres lyfe although worldly ioye entermedled greife sorowe consolation confirmation doth replenish iohns hearte ioye doth feare death also geueth god thankes meanes deliuered body synne translated remoued vnto euerlasting lyfe whence hath holy ghoste cofort iohn father saith christ holy ghoste procedeth father noble notable sentence confirme article trinitie holy ghoste procedeth fatherthe holye ghost god must nedes folowe euerlastinge nothinge procede father owne nature essence substance therfore god sonne euerlasting begotten euerlastinge father god beget nothynge like hymselfe also necessarie consequence holy ghost whiche procedeth fro god euerlasting article leaue preset whe time requireththe rewarde godlye lyfe speake largely doth holy ghost co forte saith christe shall beare witnesse though shoulde saye worlde loke nothinge el persecution emprisonment losse good last death rewarde true christian lyfehow holy ghost coforteh faithful inwardly dismayde holy ghost shall come vnto thee conforte thee shall testifie shall put thee remebrance shall encourage thee enflame thee loue thou shalt feare tyranny worlde nothinge shal encrease vaine richesse worlde doth shall beare witnes although thou shouldest loose al euer thou hast thy wife thy child thy lande thy possession thy houshold stuffe c yea thy head life yet thy confort yt christ iesus remaineth vnto thee safe sounde vntouched thy sake thy health saluation thy comoditie profit came heaue made man died rose ascended heauen according article ye christen faith true nothing true sholdest thou feare thus speketh holy ghost dayly ye heartes afflicted christias vnto great encouragemet cofort verely yt died sake hate v beare euill v loueth v shold feare though loued v yea shold cotent suffer lose yt may obtaine christ richesse phil ye apostle saith thicke al thing losse excellencie knowledge christ iesu lord whome haue couted thing losse iudge vile may wynne christ foounde c yt christ saith shal beare witnesse testimonie witnes consisteth ye whole confort therfore wordes worthie writen letter gold diligently obseruedthe holye ghost teacheth newe doctrine wordes able assure v holy ghost bringeth new doctrine neyther setteth forth vnto v moises thing coforte conscience christ alone worde nothing coforte conscience testimonie witnesse bearing christthe wytnes bearinge christe co forteth ye troubled weak conscience death resurrection thinges trouble fraye conscience whatsoeuer name called lawe good workes pilgrimage worshippinge saint c god selfe deale withoute christnote terrible neither finde fauour conforte hande anger wrath displeasure christ sayth waye truth lyfe iohn lib de isaac et anima man cometh vnto father hereto agreeth saying ambrose christ alone mouth whereby speake father oure eye whereby see father right hande whereby offer father whiche christ excepte make intercession v neither saintes haue thing god doctrine setteth forth christ bringeth true consolation maketh heartes men mery bring afflicted conscience conforte disconforte lyfe death saluation damnation therfore matter cosisteth one point yt thou truly rightly certeinly know consolatio confort mayste thou bolde saye beleue iesus christe whiche died know holy ghost whiche called conforter wil bring none testimonie confort alone shal testifie beare witnesse christ alone non admitte receaue conforte better surer holy ghost wolde also haue brought doth nothing elles testifie christ doth christ vse worde testifyinge bearing witnes galat epist iohn ende diligently attende marke worde certein true worke holy ghost inwardly hearte yet administer worke otherwise outwarde worde paule also saith fayth co meth hearyng wordethe holye ghoste confortethe worde therfore christe calleth holy ghost witnesse nowe doth beare wytnes mouth word apostle preacher whiche sincerelye purely set forth gospell christ therfore desireth conforte may tarye rom tyl holy ghost come personally preache christ vnto speake vnto fro heaue geueth forth witnes openly worde ther sought loked tyll ye worde thou outwardly hearest touche thy hearte inwardly thorowe workyng thou felest testimonie christ inward witnesse cometh except outwarde witnesse worde goeth wherin declared christ oure sake became man crucified died rose summe gospel entende christianswhat christias shal loke world maye lyfe loke richesse dignity renowne glorie c rather thincke certeinly profession shall haue world enemy persecute v besydes vexatios synne deuill death therfore tormentes ryse vp breaste christian thynkethe maner hymselfe ala haste thou doone thou myghtest welle haue bene christian yet neuer haue comme myserie daunger thou art come thys poynte thoroughe thyne owne faulte c nowe suche horrible example come also mynde putteth v remembraunce howe greuously greate vertuous menne haue tymes paste fallen coulde escape tentation sayeth christe tyme comforter comevnconfortable thoughtes deuyll whyche without doubte longe tarye awaye wyll spedylye come teache suche greuous fearefull imagination thoughtes hym deuyll reason suche thoughtes bryng trouble disquietenesse yea dryue vnto desperation holy ghost maketh afrayde comforteth encourageth handleth matter testifieth beareth witnesse haue ouercome worlde prince god euen deuyll therfore thoughtes brynge heauynes sorowe discomfort deuyll holy ghost bryngeth geueth confortable ioyefull thoughtes muche beareth wytnesse haue bestowed lyfe dyed synnes rose agayne iustification rom thys testimonie wytnesse ye maye easyly gather hate doo entende condemne saue whole substace thys matter therfore resteth point shal beare witnes principally obserued diligetly noted sectary false teacher surely determined holy ghost shall bryng foorth comfort shall doo testimonie witnesse christ may stablish print christ hertes wher contrarywise deuyll goeth plant heartes men feare wrath god syn death damnation wicked spirite dothe holy ghost testimonie resist word speaketh heartsa swete conforte sayth ah man dost thou canst thou doo none otherwise alwayes thynke death synne damnation turne thyne eye greuous terrible sightes loke vpon doest thou know man whiche called christ iesus hym thus written conceaued holy ghoste borne mary virgin suffred vnder pontius pilate crucified dyed buried descended vnto hell rose agayne death thyrd day ascended vnto heauen c wherfore doone thynkest thou doone purpose meanes thou shouldest comfort thy selfe againste deathe synne therefore leaue cease thus feare trouble thy selfe thou haste cause doo christ christe doone thynges thee shouldest thou haue iuste cause feare sadde christe thee rounde thee hym self saith euer euen vnto ende worlde math moreouer hee hath suffered deathe thee sytteth ryghte hande god hys father comforte defend thee agaynst thyne enemy doctrine soundeth voyce wytnesse worde holy ghoste euer soundeth maner neuer fyne pleasant may bee witnesse moyses rather subtill satan hypocrite heretikes whyche seke saluation peace reste conscience workes trouble che conscience menne dryue theym desperation wytnesse christ yet voyce holy ghoste god mercy sake kepe v defende v agaynste witness voyces sathan pope ye turk hypocrite sectary heretikes scismatikes wycked vnto laste ende conserue v thys holy witnesse holy ghoste amen fyrst part gospel concerning comforter holy ghosteof crosse affliction howe hee comforteth christian nowe lette v come vnto seconde part touchyng crosse affliction muste note specially sayenge christe hys disciple luc shall excommunicate synagoges wordes declare euidentely whyche excommunicate christian driue theyr synagoges maintayn title doo greatly glory synagoge true churche yea wyll also counted suche alone true woorshyppers god handlyng christian wyse doo god great true faithfull seruice ell needed christ haue spoken wordes houre commeth soeuer kylleth shall thynke doothe acceptable sacrifice vnto god hygh greate seruice therfore necessarie al tymes make difference betwene true false churche false churchethe true false churche whiche chalengeth name called yet withstandynge trewe churche true churche suffered bee called churche yet trewe churche dedethe pope hys secte true churche harde thyng discerne two church thys hyndreth greatly false churche also hath office mynisterie seene frankely frely confesse pope sect trewe churche therfore condemne theim synagoge satan notwithstandynge baptise ordeyne pastor confirme maryages fynde fault wyth thynges ministerie wordes sake confesse theyr baptisme trewe therfore doo baptise chyldren agayne whiche baptised whyche thynge notwithstandyng cyprian dyd foloweciprians erroure mynde thought baptisme ministred heretikes ryghte true baptisme therfore chyldren whiche baptised ought baptised againe thoughe hadde neuer ben baptised reason heretikes saythe vnitie christen churche therfore haue christen ministerie true mynisterie person ar discerned differece put betwene notorious synner also vnitie churche yet hys mynisterie hee hath churche bee despised reason thys mynisterie hys christes woulde go aboute alter breake comandement christ wold otherwise baptise preache minister lordes supper christe hymselfe hath appointed comanded sufficient cause men depart baptisme preachynge ministration lordes supper c alter change institution commaundement christe soeuer bee although neuer synfull wycked persone yet hyndreth nothyng ministerie therefore wyll ryghtly truely discerne two church maye onely haue eye ministerie false churche also may haue mynisterie yet true churche false churche lyke maner vsurpethe name god glorieth maye therfore beleue exod deut thyrde commaundement chargethe v take name god vayne aske fyrst petition lordes prayer math name god maye sanctifyed doothe also argue name god prophanated dishonoured many therefore false churche vnder name god churche curseth condemneth thee nothynge purposethe excommunicate curse ye false churche feared neyther nedest thou feare thyng theyr curse codemnation streight wayes make thou difference betwene trewe false churche saye heare well name god churche vngodly also vsurpe excepte shoulde haue nede thys commaundement wee shoulde take name god vayne wherefore muste fyrst consyder thys whyther vse name god hys church aryght vnto matter dothe rule greatly helpe whyche christe prescribeth thys placehow false churche maye knowen ryght colour poynteth setteth foorth fals churche true churche doothe vsurpe power swearde temporall punyshement false churche chalengeth power moste cruelly persecuteth trewe churche christe prophecied come passe thys mayst thou well knowe whyche fals church yet certayn argumet christ saith thing shal neyther knowe father also false churche paynted sette foorthe right colour ordinarie power may cloke theyr matter name god churche bleare eye vnwyse symple theyr manner doo yet theyr fayre shewe glorious pretence christe sayth neither knowe hym hys father know christ father say massewhat knowe god shaue crown wear typpet long gowne cladde monkes coule vowe pouertie chastitie obedience appoyntement antichriste absteyne frome fleshe enforce bealy kynde daintie fyshe lyue idelly cloyster men labour iohn c knowe christe beleue christ lambe god taketh away sinnes worldewhat knowe christ whyche sake became man dyed v crosse rose agayn dead ascended heauen c wyth full persuasion assured hope god wyll mercyfull vnto v sonne christ iesus sake know fatherwhat know ye father throughly persuaded son christes sake haue mercy v impute synnes vnto v frankly frely forgeue christes sake knowledge true churche knowledge true churche although ministerie name god therfore muste haue respect knowledge aboue thynges true churche may certainly knowen scisme dissention nowe dayes churche offendeth manye telle parte shoulde ioyne themselues thys fayle theyr duetie wyll consyder rule thys doctrine god nothing preuail synne deaththe doctrine true churche alone death resurrection christ soeuer doth truly beleue saued whosoeuer beleueth soeuer workes dothe besydes saued nowe foundation confirmation probation haue doctrine scripture olde newe testamente doo abundantly declare hath ben sette foorth afore vnto many tymes hath folowedthe doctrine false churche doctrin pope church cruelly persecute v excommunicateth pronounceth killeth v heretikes doctrin soeuer loketh saued hymself must make satisfaction sinnes christe saieth satisfied onely originall synne soeuer wee offende baptisme muste euery make amendes good workes recompence pacifye wrath god howe agreeth thys doctrine knowledge christ thys good consequence christ hath satisfied oure synnes able make satisfaction good workes ar left vndone must purpose make satisfaction sinnes deserue euerlastyng lyfe themwhi ought good workes euen shew obedience god holy comaundementes sette foorth glory heauenly father stoppe mouthes aduersaries declare faithe christe vayne idle dead mortifie olde adam profite neighbour wyn vnto trueth gospell c thus see rule christ whyche right true churche notwithstandyng caste synagoges excommunicate pope sect repose set righteousnes acceptation god christ deathe resurrection nowe pope hys churche chalengeth vnto saluation theyr owne workes merites satisfaction euidente argumente neyther knowe christ father forasmuche well assured certain know christ aright papistes knowe christ ought trouble moue v thynge although suche church neither knoweth christ ye father dothe excommunicate v pronounce v heretikes church deuil let rather confort v know sonne father nothing care pope doth greatly auance set forthe himselfe v name church whe dede church nothing el synagoge satan let v meane season looke iudgement apoc men lewde iudgement god hym selfe shall truely iudge make voyde force pope excommunication shal last day god angel declare v true churche none otherwise lyfe christe sayeth shall two church one shall excommunicate meanes one abyde dwell together excommunication neuer publikely exercised true churche agaynste false churche false churche hathe euermore moste parte sworde hande able defende selfe tymes suche fauoureth may see pope moste sure argument true churche concernyng true churche thys gospell playnly declared shalbe excommunicated vngentilly intreated miserably handled shall saythe christe caste synagoges yow disciple apostle christ shall kyll saythe euen call theym selues churche thus also goeth matter euen thys present daye therfore thys excommunicatyng murderyng whyche pope hys churchethe token true churche vseth againste sainctes god whyche trewe churche ought make v afrayde rather take ioyfully paciently learne thing right token manyfest declaration true christen churche yet lykewise aboue thynges true knowledge christe hys father anabaptistes sectes suffer persecution also haue knowledge christe father brynge sette vp newe kynd monkery thorough thys looke saued haue god mercyfull vnto contrary wyse true churche knoweth christe hys father saye beleueth trusteth onely goodnes mercye god christes sake fayth confidence hope gladly suffreth persecution whatsoeuer chanceth vnto itthe true chureh taketh trouble pacientlye thankefuly grudgeth paently take knoweth christe prophecied tolde afore hande thynges come passe therefore well contente quietly beare tyrannie pope beyng gladde thys knoweth christ hys father pope adherentes althoughe bragge neuer muche church neyther know christe father rather persecute haue thys knowledge wherfore gladde heart wyllynge spirite suffreth kynde persecution wyth sure hope thys lyfe shall reygne christe lyue hym euerlastyngly kyngdome father whome christe sonne holy ghoste moste swete comforter honoure glorye euer euer amen sermon epistle vvhitsondaye acte ii fiftie dayes come ende one accorde gether one place sodaynelye came sounde heauen ben commyng mightie wynde fylled house sat appeared vnto clouen tongue like bene fire sat vpo eche one fylled holye ghost began speake tongue euen spirite gaue vtteraunce dwellynge ierusalem iewes deuoute men euery nation vnder heauen noysed multitude came together astonyed yt euerye man hearde speake hys owne language wondred marueyled sayinge amonge theym selues beholde whtche speake galile howe heare euery man owne tongue wherein borne parthian medes elamite inhabiters mesopotamia iewry capad cia pontus asia phrigia phamphilia egipte party libia whiche beside sirene straungers rome iewes proselites grekes arrabians wee haue heard speake owne tongue great workes god exposition vuhitsonday whiche grecian called pentecostepentecoste signifyeth doothe sygnifie fyftie dayes whitsondaye fyftie day number daye christ rose day celebrate kept holy amongest iewes also high feast remebrance fiftieth day eaten pascall lambe departed egipt receiued ye law mount sinai ye continuace benefite setting forth law making couenant people feast ordeined god might neuer forget holy obligation bande exod hystorie seconde boke moyses xx chapter doothe declare truely doothe appere hystories olde testament witnesseth sainct paule also epist corinthian whatsoeuer befell amongest people iewes figure thynges1 cor shoulde declared v newe testament wherfore euen newe testament haue pascall lambe better olde exod blood lambe egypt anoynt doore postes angel myght hurt body kil fyrst borne therin blood lambe christ shed crosse entent myght delyuered throughe hym oute true egypt cor heb tyranny deuyll synne deathe newe testamente haue better whitsontide penthecost olde testamentthe petecost iewes iewes olde testament dyd receaue mount synai tenne commaundementes whiche doctrine good profitable necessarie maye worthily embraced great benefite haue sure succoure aide againste kyngdome deuill rom synne death rather helpe lawe declared greuous sinner owne conscience accused god proued gyltie iohn muche doo whiche lawe commaundeth v doo exod cor euen dreadfull sight mount god spake thynges troubled thunder lyghtnynge hyll smoke semed moued alwayes propretie law worketh effectuously hearte terrifie fearethe lawe accuseth dryue man desperation hearte remayneth deuice escape daunger surely man know god requireth2 cor feele perceaue hathe power must nedes occasion great feare dreade inwardely herof doth folow man thinketh condemned alredy god death orels shall forthwith suffer paynes deathe wherfore pentecost iewes remembraunce great necessarie thyng yet consideration therof pleasant acceptable exod example people dothe declare thys mysterie woorketh inwardly desyre moses mean betwene god thought necessarie theyr heart haue meane yet could fynde might meane mediatour god hym selfe hathe promysed mediatour whyche prophete lyke vnto moyses c deut thys doothe declare shoulde bee whytsontyde newe testamentethe whytsontide pe thecost christian fulle comforte swetenesse ioye peace thus sayeth euangeliste rehersed daye pentecoste whenne iewes dydde kepe holye feast theyr lawe tyme apostle disciple gathered togyther sodeynelye camme sounde vehemente wynde fylled whole house actes appered vppon clouen tongue hadde bene fyre holy ghoste opened bothe syghte eye hearynge eares sounde hearde seene fyre luc act math christ hadde promised iohn baptist prophecied shold baptised fyre spirite thynges haue theyr signification meanyngewhat fyrye tongue signifye tongue doothe sygnifie office preachynge whiche thenne shall woorke effecte holy ghost worketh therwith yt therby maye enkendled newe lyght inwardly forthwith sounde fyry tongue sytteth eche dothe inflame heartes blast motion perceth vnderstandyng momente hower knowe bothe god sonne iesus christ vnderstand scripture waxeth bold heart dare openly professe true knowlege god thei speake language knewe owne esa sion behoued lawe shoulde procede woorde lorde oute hierusalem math marc afterwarde gospell shold heard al laguages forasmuch ye gospel shuld publyshed iury also worlde therfore holy ghost dothe instruct apostle language myght bee vniuersally sette foorth throughout earth whitsontide pentecost new testamentwhy apostle speake diuers language wherby trewe knowledge god ordeyned feare dreade ioy peace whereby ryseth suche conscience length turneth god abydeth thing christ sake apostle theyr example doo shewe act act christ laste supper prophecieth whitsontyde also prophetes dauid esaias hieremias ioell zacharias wherfore shall lose labour psal esa hiere ioel zachar rather bestowe tyme well yf certayne appoynted tyme enstructe men holye ghost teaching propretie nedefull v doo also maye obteyne spirite fyrst muste thynke holy ghoste firste congregation neuer beforethe holye ghost hath alwayes ben churche hee god eternall almyghtie christ sayth cometh father wherfore one substance nature father many euident testimony holy ghoste hath always bene effectuous men hath lightned iohn broughte waye christ hymselfe peter also sayth holy ghost spake prophets2 pet luc euangelistes doo testifye anna zacharia elizabeth iohn baptist holy ghost wherfore must thynke beleue none thyng holy ghoste wee beleue christechriste sonne god hath ben euer forthwith fyrste promyse made paradyse exercised office stode battaile deuil began breke head serpent gen worke long agone began sonne man euer diligently done laste fully accomplyshed tyme became manne dyed crosse thyrde daye rose agayne deade therfore workynge holy ghoste therewyth holy ghoste alwayes worlde gouernyng men heart stirryng vp faith word kyndled lyght cofirmed brought truthe yet dydde lengthe perfectly absolutely fulfylle thys greate woorke vppon thys whytsondayethe reuelacion holye ghost whitsondaye wherein hee secrete priuie hee hee declared hym selfe openlye dyd see myghte perceaue confesse holy ghoste present amongest theym thys place iudged woorkynge holy ghoste dronkennesse doone aduysed purposed madnesse proued false theyr owne reason wherby may knowe diuers language commeth dronkennessewhy holye ghost opened whitsonday newe wyne shoulde make muche oure matter consyder reuelation holy ghost deferred vnto daye euen delyuerance old people folowed immediatly couenant betwene god people delyuerance whyche commeth thorough christe doothe pledge holy ghoste ensue whereby myght made certayne confirmed concernyng couenant betwene god v fyrst mete deliuerance shoulde made confyrmed thoroughe christ christ receaue holy ghoste entreate father sende v holy ghoste hym onely made parte taker thys greate gyfte psal wee sayde daye ascension prouynge thre score eight psalme hee ascended hye receaued gyftes men act thus doothe peter also expounde saying sermon daye saieth wherfore christe beynge exalted ryght hand god receaued promise holy ghoste father dyd shedde foorth see heare fyrste worke hath bene alwayes worlde wyth dewe administration workyngethe holye ghoste god euerlastyng yet daye laste dyd openly declare hymselfe shewed foorth hymselfe greate vertue strengthe reuelation maye knowe greate thynge christ hath wrought brought passe v thorowe death resurrection secondarilye noted scripture geueth peculiar name vnto christ calleth hym worde god doth also geue proper name sprite callynge spiritus sanctus holye ghoste whiche grace doth sanctifye heartes whiche vnholy defiled synne name bringeth greate conforte good christian men perceaue weaker deuill vnable time resyste hys temptation verye sorowfull fele euyll spirite sore sette agaynste put good hopewhy spirite god called holye ghoste christ obtayne holye ghoste whiche pardoneth theyr synnes styrreth obeye god truly howe holye ghoste dooth bringe thys passe shewed iohns gospell holye ghoste shall reproue worlde synne iohn iustice iudgement property trinitie discerned article faithdiuers propertis trinitie god father gaue v bodye lyfe made v kyngedome oure parentes became firste synners vnder death danger also enheritance succeded vnto synne forfetthe proper office holye ghoste sonne god made man thorough death restored v loste deliuered v sinne death deliuerance doth holy ghost set forth gospell instructe heartes men beleue therin haue sure confort therin christ died maye doubt reconciled god father death wili remember synnes forgeue christes sake doth signifie sanctifiynge heartes purifying fayth peter speaketh actes apostle act wher suche remission synnes faith despaire althoughe diuers sinnes remaine take sure conforte thorowe death resurrection christthe seconde sanctifying holy ghost foloweth lenght second sanctifyinge holye ghoste wherein oure bodyes also sanctified holye ghoste geue ouer oure selues sin delighted therwith abstayne ephe studie thynges please god paule teacheth stole set hym steale rather let hym labor owne handes good maye haue geue nedefull c propertie holy ghoste begin v newe true obedience towarde god maye resiste synne mortifye fleshe obtaine remission oure sinnes faith sanctifying parfect first fyrst second coulde muche preuayle fleshe bloud full infirmitie deuill excedynge mighty v haue receaued onely firste fruites spirite wherefore obedience parfect sanctifyinge attayne vnto ryghteousnes god euerlastynge lyfe sanctifyinge fayth wherof spoken thereof dependeth whole matter wheras second sanctifyinge hath done confesseth owne vnprofitablenes stycketh onelye sanctifyinge whiche commeth god grace mercie hereof plaine holye ghoste called doth make holy sanctifye word stirreth vp v fayth towarde christ thereby maye obtayne remission oure synnes besyde office sanctifyinge zach holy ghoste hath office hath name scripture zacharie calleth hym spirite prayerother office holye ghoste encourageth heartes truste surelye god call vpon hym necessity also christ calleth hym conforter whiche helpeth oure heartes stirringe v take paciently thynges iohn shoulde feared misfortune combrance worlde also calleth spirit truth withstand lie heresy iohn confirme pure word true faith alwayes bent wheras contrariwise deuill reason false doctrine woulde caste v hedlong errours lye proper office holye ghoste besyde garnisheth heartes faythfull diuers vertues gyftes suche conforter bydeth v alwayes worldlye conforte tyme laste forsaketh vshow holy ghoste may obtayned seynge holye ghoste dooth worke suche greate thynges v also learned whiche waye attaine suche greate gyftes howe maye begynne growe v luc maye receaue holye ghoste thereby sanctifyed saued touchynge thynge christ hymselfe doth teache vsprayer luke xj wheras sayth wise seynge euyll geue good thynges youre sonnes howe muche youre heauenly father geue holye spyrite vnto aske hym yt sentence worthy rehearsed teachynge fyrste god woulde holye ghoste shoulde obtayned prayer hym geueth wyth humble prayer desire father wherefore thou haste desyre thy mynde obtayne holy ghoste god continewe prayinge doubte thou shalte obtayne redye waye obtayne holye ghoste christ hym selfe dooth teache thee doothe holye ghost obtaynede prayer call vpon god father often holye ghoste prayer prayer muste made also name iesv suche wyse muste praye god christ sonne sake wyll geue v holye ghostewe muste pray name christ attainement thereof haue greate helpe christ ascended father cause receaue gyftes father geue vnto v wherfore prayer doubt onely commanded god shoulde praye holye ghoste also promised shall obtayne also wil redie geue muche christ therfore sitteth right hande god father distribute amongest v gyftes also receaued father writent lxviij psal hymselfe men psal geue vnto besides prayer thing also necessary obtayninge holye ghoste muste haue feruent studie read heare worde god vse often sacrament thinges ioyned gether may make ope way holy ghost decreed holy ghost worke v worde sacramentes therfore litle regarde thinges shall holy ghost never come entent baptised receaue supper lorde heare worde god know thinges instrument whiche holye ghoste doth accomplishe operation v example doth shewe three thousand sol whiche conuerted daye sainct peter neuer ben conuerted hearde worde act heard worde heartes therby moued came baptisme christ commanded math marc chamberlain quene aethiops could obtaine holy ghost without worde whiche philippe spake interpretinge scripture act heart touched preachynge philippe behoued hym also receaue baptisme holy ghoste myghte worke therby wherefore thou desirous haue holye ghost first thou must pray father thou muste geue diligent hede worde preachinge thou must often call minde thy baptisme god promised thee maner couenaunt hath made ther thee thou must often come lord supper worde sacrament holy ghost doth kendle oure heartes new light fayth maye onely heare worde harde hearted iewes dyd heare maye vnderstand also therby may become new men get v new heartes furthermore must beware let holy ghost worke fylthy shamfull liuinge caste hym v wanton sinfull maners one place serue holy ghost deuillthe lyfe godly ordered therfore deuill tempteth couetousnes wrath lechery synnes flee straight waye prayer thou woldest anker tempeste god maye preserue thee temptation kepe obedient vnto hym necessary abstayne fro sinne workes fleshe eyther holy ghost may remayne thee styll thou hast receaued hym thou mayst obtayne hym neuer thee infirmitie thou chaunce fall thou mayst ryse retourne ye newnes liuing specially shal perceaue holy ghost must nedes take place v helpe v deuil death hell wheras contrarie wyse continew voluntarie synnes willinglye lytle lytle fall deuils power liue repentaunce neuer part taker holy ghost whose proper office sayd first sanctifie v thorowe faith remission synnes helpe vnto v sinnethe office holye ghoste may shewe obedience god saide receaue first frutes holy ghost fleshe bloud doth yet remaine v shall longe liue abide worlde herof whiche haue receaued holy ghost neuerthelesse weake doth fal often let man offended thinke anabaptistes whiche opinion man fal haue receaued holy ghost opinion shold true euery man would folow holy ghost alwayes shold neuer fal possible craftes giles deuil offence worlde infirmitie ye fleshe wherfore alwayes necessarie praye lord wil take spirit v wil goodnes kepe v grace math dayly encrease v gifte holy ghost forgeue v trespass pray lord prayer psal holyest yt liue without trespass yet fayth christe pardoned hurt v ye haue hearde therfore true whitsontyd pentecost whiche much glorious whitsontide iewes holye ghoste shedforth vpon fleshe gospell may knowe god maye sanctified iustified holye ghost bodie spirit fulfil office true religion prayer hearynge worde bringing forth true fruites spirite whiche thing holy ghoste graunt v thoroughe iesus christ lorde whome father holy ghoste glory euer amen second sermon whitsonday pthe gospell ihon xiiii iesus sayde vnto disciple yf ye loue kepe commaundementes wyll pray father shall geue another comforter may abide euer euen spirite trueth worlde receyue world seeth hym neyther knoweth hym ye know hym dwelleth shalbe wyll leaue comfortlesse wyll come yet lytle whyle worlde seeth ye see lyue ye shall lyue day shall ye knowe father hath commaundementes kepeth loueth loueth shalbe loued father wyll loue hym wyll shewe myne owne selfe vnto hym iudas saiethe vnto iudas iscarioth lord done thou wylt shewe thy selfe vnto v vnto world iesus aunswered sayde vnto hym man loue wyll kepe sayinges father wyll loue hym wee wyll come vnto hym dwel loueth kepeth sayinges worde ye hear mine father sente thinges haue spoken vnto beyng yet present ye comforter whiche holy ghoste father wyll send name shall teach thinges bringe al thinges remembraunce soeuer haue saide vnto peace leaue peace geue vnto worlde geuethe geue vnto let harte greued neyther feare ye haue hearde said vnto go come againe vnto ye loued ye would verily reioyce sayd go vnto father father greater nowe haue shewed come come passe ye mighte beleue hereafter wyll talke many wordes vnto prince worlde commeth hath naughte world may know loue father father gaue commaundement euen exposition gospell part christes sermon whiche made disciple suffred cause ought greatly estemed christ setteth forth singuler doctrine lessonthe dignitie gospel whereby teacheth reason superfluous attainement knowlege god take first foundation loue christ taught thinges vncertaine wauering strength eyther taught imagined god comprehended knowen meanes loueth christe farre brought loueth father also cause worde doth make mention loue speaketh olde customable maner saying beleueth loue cause saluation faith wher saith man loueth like efficacie power stregth thou canst loue christeto loue christ beleue hym one thyng except thou beleue dost put thy trust hym certain sure faith worde faith somwhat euident wheras declareth muste withholde eye thinges fasten christ iesu nature loue embraceth yt thinge loueth thinge doth set al felicitiethe nature loue therwith satisfied careth nothing besides suche maner loue doth christ require v shold embrace hym oure hearte whiche thynge done fayth wherfore sentence maketh nothynge againste faith spoken entent nature condition fayth proper vertue efficacie might better vnderstanded cause worde christ dyd perceaue receaueth worde purposeth kepe without greate endeuor industrie diuers temptation chaunce whiche rebuke embrayde suche hath entered profession godlines folie rashnes wher reason wise selfe ala haue done whan tookee vpon office teachynge might haue holde peace thought wyth selfe god woulde haue set foorth might haue come shoulde haue better successe matter nowe doubt onely litle profit put selfe also perill lyfe ouercome suche kynde temptation worde maye surely maintained onely succour must especially vseit necessari christ beloued christe sheweth loue christe put hole delight professours gospell al good may thus conforte selues whatsoeuer cometh let pleasure god whose cause glorie man sake begon god wherfore must endure looke wher loue ther endure saith christe geue good golde euerlastinge lifeloue doth thinges wherof possession taken life life wherfore matter resteth herein ye loue loue ye wil kepe saing contineue constantlie although ye perill life ye loue ye wil kepe wordes ye shall haue many danger calamity affliction shall make faint put desperation knoweth christe truly beleueth hym loueth himloue procedeth fayth troubled aduersitie thinketh surely christ dyed buried v rose againe wherby suche gather surely christ doth greatlye fauor loue procedeth faith afterward able withstand peril danger neither doth feare greate threatnings wrath worlde setteh christ worde threatnings displeasure men saith loue wil kepe wordwhat christes wor word death resurrectio worde moyses ten commaundements worde caste awaye nother thing done contrarie therto god commanded worde fulfilledthe lawe god obeyed worde ioyned consolatio worde conscience therby made quiet therby know disobedience toward god much dread feare wrath indignation god worde iesu christ fondation pillar thinges hath saith christ neither suffereth hymselfe plucke fro thencehow god knowen ought doubt father doth loue peculiar phrase iohn whiche hath proper kynde speache beside euangelistes first ioyneth men christe thorough christ bringeth father order proces matter christ teacheth first must know christ loue hym take one desirous saluation profitnote well haue suche trust loue toward christ foloweth also sure confidence father also loueth v although none confort eye perceauinge vnderstanding nede feare crueltie wrothe yre god yet sufficient certifie v nede feare synne deuill god loueth v loue christe great confort tribulation beleue constantly god againste vsa great cofort louinglye embraceth v loue christe kepe worde stedfastly tyme tribulation oure heartes hardlye thus persuaded thinke rather contrariwise god hateth v hath regard v goeth rather prouide punishmet v thinges false christe doth lye whan sayth yf procede farre loue hym count abhominable hate hym muste doubt father doth loue v declare hys loue toward v deut wyth sonne holy ghost haue abyding v greate matter singuler confort rom righteous man fayth doth say heart ascended heauen c whatsoeuer place bewhat heauen whether ierusalem rome felde citie taken heauen god father sone holy ghoste doth come vnto hym haue abydinge hym thing haue heare lyfe worde fele inwardly fayth thinges shalbe felte dede lyfe come haue god dwelling v lyfewhat haue god dwellyng v none thynge thinges saye thinke suffer acceptable vnto god al thinges eate drinke worke slepe wache praye reade singe learne c alowed hym felicitie selfe esa act cor cor yf wyse consider beholde true eye wyth sure faith glory godly doth herein passe glory heauen god sayth heauen dwel thus sayth heauen seat earth footestole heart godly habitation wherin god dwelleth much apprehende christ beleue surely suffred died v benefit loue thinges consistinge loue christ rest cause man greatly feare loue shal make thinges easie tollerable whatsoeuer shal chaunce hym worde sake contrariwise without loue thynges shall seme intollerable aboue men power christ sayth wordes folowing man doth loue loue maketh thynges lyghtehe kepe worde christe loued also certayne father christes sake doth loue againe doth onely loue v commeth vnto v christ holy ghost maketh dwellyng v thing great yt consider well could patiently suffer thynges chauce vnto v christ sake loue christe wheras men receaueth gospell ententspollers church good maye inuade churche goodes make hauoke therof owne profite commoditie serue owne lustes fashion worlde thynges seke owne vantage profit ther worde christ long kepte necessary haue loue man wyll constant trouble profite gaines doth nothyng helpe case wherefore loue godlines dede wold depart golspel must vse thinges may saye name lord iesu christe begon commandement wherfore case harde moue v take thing well worth god sendeth cause styke vnto worde constantly shold geue place anye danger perill surelye christe sayth furthermorethat christ keth god spea speakethe worde speake myne father whiche sent maner doth christe often time speake pyth christ speaketh ye receaue embrace worde promesse ye sure true god hath receaued neyther must ye thinke besides god ye shall find god wher el worde reason worde speake mine worde father ye receaue worde ye receaue father ye beleue ye beleue father wherefore nowe easie iudge howe worlde stande mahumet turke pope iewes crake much god praye muche affirme selues true worshipper god matter plaine mahumet turke pope iewes fynde father neither knowe anye thynge hym haue worde christ christes father wherfore christe wordes geueth sure doctrine beware thoughe shoulde saye yf ye heare god haue hym ioyned vnto ye must tourne awaye eye eares case heare ye heare god see ye see god decreed eyther must ye heare god neuer heare wherof muste reason folowe christe vttereth bountefull worde hole godhed doth alow neyther deuyll worlde make frustrat false reason christ word father saith wordes ye heare mine father sent wordes simple plaine nothyng simple plaine wherfore whan men yt worldly wyse chaunceth vpon word thynke wordes coldlye slenderly spoken great wayghtie matter woulde haue vsed earnest pythye wordesvexacion geueth vndersta dynge howbeit great matter included wordes basse slender doth appeare great perill feare hande wherfore christ maketh ende sermo saith thinges haue spoken whan byding holy ghost conforter whome father send name shal teache thyngeswyth warde teachynge holy ghost warde doctrin profiteh lytle shall put remembrance thinges whiche haue spoken vnto man shoulde bestowe neuer manye wordes yet holy ghoste shoulde lackynge matter coulde perceaued nowe whatsoeuer remaineth gospell conclusion whole sermon christ chapter made disciple good confort troubled offended spiteful death shoulde suffer dismayd forasmuche shold therby obtayne saluation dyd speake tofore therfore nowe wilbe cotent doctrine haue taught christ doth cheifly entreate part specially shall kepe worde shall go feare perilwith christ good thinge cometh v loue god onely waye make god loue v come nighe vnto v dwell v goeth god waye loue christe fleeth frome god neuer come nygh vnto hym whatsoeuer dothe suffreth loste labour vayne wherfore seyng lord saith wordes spake father men ought take diligent hede beware receaue doctrine worde commeth foorth mouth surely perfect waye seke god deceaue otherwise god sought foud meanes chanceth nowe day chaunced amongest iewes hadde mercy seate tabernacle dyd pray trusted certaynly heard el dyd refused place god appointed theym chose selues certaine place thought good theyr owne eye commeth passe euen christ saith ye purpose serche god bee desyrous make hym loue fyrste come vnto loue receaue worde doth pope doo anabaptistes iewes turkes suche lyke lay asyde christ worde applye theyr myndes men tradition pope trusteth mass vowes absteynyng mariage anabaptistes theyr streight kynde lyuyng homely apparell vndefenced trauaile iewes turkes haue theyr order also thynges must wee diligentely eschewe christ word onely imbraced god commaundement heare christ saieth wordes speake myne father wherfore vnpossible math dothe loue christ herken hym shoulde heare god come vnto hym nowe mercyful father graunt v grace may loue christe kepe woorde maye holy ghoste constantely cleaue therto come euerlastyng lyfe amen sermon vvhitson monday pthe gospell iohn iii god loued worlde gaue begotten sonne whosoeuer beleueth shoulde peryshe haue euerlastynge lyfe god sent sonne world co dempne world world hym myght saued beleueth condempned beleueth condempned already hath beleued name begotten sonne god condemnation lyghte come worlde men loued darkenes lyght theyr dedes euyll euery one euyll doth hateth lyght neyther commeth lyght leste dedes reproued dothe trueth commeth lyght dedes may knowen howe wrought god exposition gospell one notablest manne fynde newe testamente woorthy commended kynde commendation least men myghte set count thing moste necessary yt might learne also ye text heart rehearse dayely theym selues maye come vse true knowledge therof woordes suche ease mynde troubled restore lyfe agayne soule dead yf beleue stedfastly forasmuche possible man shold sufficiently expresse thys sermon christ wordes fyrst lette v call vnto god wyll expound woordes playnely heartes oure wordes interpretation hee wyll enkendle make theym playne conscience may receaue conforte peace thereby amen pythe excellent sermon god greatly loued world deliuered begotten son men shold dye haue euerlastyng life though christ shold say beholde wyll shew thyng thou neuer heardest put forthe thee ensample thou neuer hast sene heard geueth ye gift receaueth gift geue profit gaines great man word expresse fyrst let v se geuer mencion made kyngsgod geueth prince mighty personage ye world god set forth incomprehensible almyghtie made thing wordgod deserued still dothe preserue aboue al comparison al thing create heuen earth al therin dust geuer respect prince kynges gyftes nothing comparison oure heartes myght worthely bee lifte vp exalted godly pryde haue suche geuer shoulde chance vnto v liberalitie might counted price comparison thyng sette v magnificent excellent god almightie god whiche infinite vnspeakable geueth suche sortgods vndeserued liberalite passeth also thynges geueth geueth wage desert recompence wordes dothe sounde mere loue wherfore gyft wholly proceding god excedyng diuine beneuolence goodnes saith god loued worlde noo greater vertue loueloue refuseth perell may hereby wel vnderstand loue thyng sticke put lyfe danger uerily great vertues pacience chastitie sobrietie c yet ar nothing compared vertue compriseth includeth self vertues good man dothe man wrongloue excelleth vertues geueth euery man hys owne loue men geue owne selues ar redy heart thei christe saith also god geueth v right merite greate vertue loue ought encourage heartes abolysh sorow exceding loue god commeth mynde might truste therto beleue stedfastly god boutifull great geuer gifte procedeth great vertue loue loue encreaseth gyftthis sort geuing whiche hath spring loue maketh gift excellente precious kynde louynge syncere mynde geuer acceptable giftes geuynge contrarywise men perceaue mynde geuer regarde gifte muche lesse yea gyftes sclender faultie thynge maymed halfe blynd hath fault yet come loue fatherly mynde one eie case one foot acceptable many eies fete without condition ye word christ playn god loueth vsbaptisme lordes supper wherfore loues sake ought greately esteme thynges geue v especially gyftes whiche ordeyned geuen hym v saluation confirmation oure faithe baptisme supper lord c worlde doth regard thyngs yet ought estemed oure chiefe felicitie myght put asyde sorowe ioyful heart forasmuche thinges fatherly loue beneuolence ordeyned saluation wherfore christ place sheweth father geue v thingegod geuethe v thinges loue also describeth way father geue v fatherly godlye loue hytherto wee haue spoken geuer louyng mynde gyfte selfe lesse estemedchrist gyfte god geuethe god geueth rich kyngdoms creature geueth onely begotten sonne lesse father wealth prosperitie causeth ioy howe great ioy ought gift geuen vnto god geuer excedyng great loue also wherof gyfte procedeth gyft geueth onely sonne geueth hym selfe wholly gyft paul saith romains seyng god hath geuen v sonne geue v thynges also rom sinne death hell heauen rightuousnes life al sonne gyft also rom thynges wherfore beleue truly receiue moste excellent gift faith must nedes euery creature fautie fautie muste geuen comoditie saint paule saith place al thing ar ours1 cor whether paul apollo cephas either ye world life deth ar christ christ god cosider gift well shal perceiueincredulitie misbeleue passeth either heauen earth respecte wherof goodes world wer graine doth incredulitie misbeliefe trouble vswe desyrous worldlye godlye thynges christ dothe afterward complayn also incredible darknes ignorace whe heare great gift yet beleue word great matter goeth one eare runeth neuer perceth ye heart men conceiue hope purchasing possession bying landes neuer haue heart rest feruent care gredy desyre obteyne declared god hath geuen vnto v sonne mere loue slouthfull sluggyshe without desire receiue cause sette lyghtly suche hygh gift embrace worthily ought doo deuyll truly whiche casteth myste ouer heartes care worde promise touchyng gifte meane tyme bestow care worldly thyngeswhy sett lyghtlye god gyfte wherfore beginnyng sayde woordes oughte dayely rehersed vsed rise morning go bed nyght might print heart geue god thankes great benefite thing great greater giuer loue geuer gift selfe geuen v mere loue merite geuen remaineth v borowed lent recompensed whiche also nothing geuen agayne neither thinge required therefore thou shouldest ioyfully embrace declare thy mynd ala vnworthy thynge neither heartes neither handes receaue gyfte proffered christ shold remayne v euer vnto euerlasting lyfethe vnthan fulnes worlde herein chaunceth leude greuous thing yt gift offred although thei haue great nede therof yet regarded refuse receiue riche man shold proffer gift nedy begger yt might therby liue welth ease yet yt riche wold require nothing poore wolde receiue excellent gift gladly begger suche vnthriftie person yt wold take gift wold set owne miserable state gifte might ye count worthily deserue yet greater wretchednes tha beggerly world ye void al life saluatio profered ye son god god demadeth nothing el v receiue take madnes yt although starke beggers yet think scorn prouided iudge thou therfor greuous syn vnbelefe agreable man nature agaynst oure owne profite gaines receaue proffred hereof appereth madde worlde hath ioy felicitie gift godthe worlde neglectethe hys owne saluacion putteth great blame wil receue take vse proffered neuer little gold proffred woulde ready receaue bothe handes yea al lymmes body also wher ye sonne god proffred gift al men ar doubt whether may embrace hym beare themselfe hande haue nede hym wherfore hath proper name geuen hymthe worlde gyfte proffred called worlde worthy hated specially bee compared gyfte littell dothe deserue loue gift god nothyng againste god nerer vnto deuyll worlde yet testimonye witnesse christ saying god loued worlde gaue begotsonnewhat worlde print thyng well thy mynd thou haste heard god gift geueth freely mere loue learne thynge also worlde truely great multitude men hath faith thinketh god vnfaithful promise yea blasphemeth curseth persecuteth worde whiche also disobedient father mother murtherers aduouterers traitours theues wicked person c dayely example shewe v playnly world full periurie blasphemye odious beast monster extreme enemie godo loue passyng loue geueth god sonne pure loue gift god specially commended hereby god dothe let spare doo good great wickednes frowardnesse soeuer done comitted rom regardeth name worde blasphemously handled stubburnesse vsed agaynst commaundement gift excedyng geuer great geuer might good reson offended frowardnes receaueth god ouercommeth hym selfe putteth syght synnes work eyther fyrst seconde table moses synnes myserie wherwith synners encombred encombred could neuer escape without help god doth god put foorth loue bestoweth gift freely vpon vsthanckefulnes god hys benefites sheewed mercyfull lorde therfore worthy bee loued ought put whole confidence hym forgeueth v synnes yea synnes world doth recken themgod forge uethe worlde hys synnes although innumerable seyng sinnes one man infinite numbre syns whole worlde yet sentence trewe certayn god forgeueth worlde synnes wheresoeuer loue god also remission synnes shoulde haue ready hertes haue diligent meditation loue wher god geueth world enemye euen owne selfe shold loke thing hym mere grace mercy whatsoeuer chace lyfe yet shold hope loue faith remain constant mercy god christ suche thoughtes must nedes full great ioy many godly protest haue liued kind abhomination idolatrie haue ben defyled dyuers syns vngodlynes hath god punished v deseruyng hath declared loue hath gospel opened sonne geue world may heare holsom doctrin vnderstande god angry worlde loueth gaue sonne ala howe execrable ingratitude excedyng dulnes vnderstadyng thisthe ingratitude worlde yt consider great goodnes god wold truly consider ther shold rise v affection ioy wold onely shewe highe obedience vnto god would also gladly suffer thynges sake may thank vnbelefe regardeth great ioye meane setteth pleasure worldly trifle seketh vain daliace thus farre haue shortely rehersed fower thyngeswhat hathe hytherto bene taughte geuer gifte howe geuen whome whyche thynges great man expresse sufficientely wordes foloweth entent wherfore god gaue gift truly eate cloth selues get liuyng therby muche lesse shold vnto v poyson pestilencewhy god gaue sonn teache also baptisme lordes supper al thinges might counted wholsome vnto v appereth plainly geuen entent beleue hym shold perishe haue euerlasting lyfe iohn declared playne woordes matter respect vnto rich worldly desire myght therby delyuered death synne mighte perishe onely busynes father mere loue hath enioyned sonne euen ouer come deuyl hell deliuer v eternal death whiche fel headlong sinne cause entent gift geuen wherin haue iust cause beleue trust stedfastly heare mouth christ yt hymself geuen vnto v power diuell weakened ouerthrowen power pacifie troubled conscience restored v attainment euerlasting life saluation death shalbe abolished al ioy shal rise sure faith wherwith beleue god merciful vnto v loueth v loue gaue son vnto v shold perish haue euerlastig life word yt sufficiently coprehended wt thought wherfore christia must daily pray yt god spirit wyl make word swete pleasant hertes kendle inflame myndes suche kind teaching discipline might easily make true doctor diuinitie teach v truly christ iudge al doctrine abyde thing murmuring yt shal please god lay v heare doctrine yet care whether take roote v whether bring forth fruite ala neuer better doubte damned latter iudgement shall chiefely confounded theym selfe thys faulttdamnacion cometh despysyng godes worde despised thys preachynge dydde regarde nowe lette v go foorth see waye come gifte thyngs lyke force obteyne gyfte christ dothe shewe playnly worde saith yt beleue shold perishe haue euerlasting life euident profe onely fayth trust grace mercy god faythe obtaynethe christe hond god good lesson hand wherwith must take vnto v thys gyft euen god geueth loue mercy take receaue faith receue otherwise thy merite doyng hath place workes nothyng requisite obteinyng gyfte onely necessary shew selues ready faith euen geuen god loue ought receaue faith christ example heare god merciful redy forgeue doth declare loue charitie towarde v sendeth begotten sonne fleshe layeth sinnes hym accordyng sayinge iohn beholde lambe god iohn whych taketh away synnes worlde gyft loue oure heartes may confirmed synne bytyng worme conscience forasmuche god water christe comparison synnes worlde soone touche christe soone gift receyued faith synnes quite consumed abolyshed euen drye stalke hot fier thou hearest worde christ god loued worlde gaue onely faith purchaseth gyfte wherfore lette aduersaries withstand sentence neuer muche lette rayle neuer muche agaynst yet sentence sure inuincible beleue shall haue euerlasting lyfe shall perishe se thou put nothyng hereto take nothyng lest thou shouldest seme take vpon thee correcte christes iudgement excellente woordes wordes lyfe god graunte v hys grace print heartes hath wordes surely fixte hearte feared neyther deuyll synne helle wyll quiete heart say withoute feare haue sonne godnote well god hath geuen vnto loue word god ye gospel certifieth therof thy word lord thy son iesus wil deceiue alone put truste marc l c thynge weake faith grant yt grace yt may beleue stedfastly besydes haue healpe thys euident gyfte loue god shold lyttell lyttell beleue gyft faith requisite thou hearest christ stronger fayth greater ioy pleasure securitie felt risyng mynd mynd prone readye doo suffer thynges whyche knowe god doothe requyre v wylleth v doo knowyng louyng vseth nothynge loue towarde v thou wylt say peter paule saint mary gift would confortable vnto saintes therfore doubtlesse saying pertaineth vnto howe synner meanes vnderstande pertaine vnto methe temptacion vnbelefe must ouercome whiche haue often offended god synnes haue made hym enemie thoughtes auoyded hearte kynd preaching reasonyng beholdeth self considereth syns must circuspect ware least laying aside god word geue selues long tyme thoughtes forthwith must returne wordnote thys thy conforte order oure iudgement accordynge thoughtes ar nothyng el incredulitie vnbelefe goeth withdraw v swete gospel trewely vnbelefe ouercome meanesgods worde puttethe awaye vnbeliefe receaued worde god preacheth christ wee shoulde doubte thys woorde sayenge father trewe eternall god heauen dyd loue worlde delyuered begotten sonne sure world dothe signifie mary peter paule onely worlde signifieth mankynd therefore thou takest thy selfe mankyndewhat world signifiethe thou doest beleue compare thy self mortall men thou mayst vnderstande thou art man shouldest thou suffer thy selfe thys name seyng christ plain wordes saieth god gaue sonne onely mary peter paule worlde shoulde receaue hym sonnes men yf thou wold receaue hym though dyd appertayne vnto v truely would consequently folowe christes wordes true saith geuen deliuered worlde wherfore hereof appeareth contarye therto moste assuredly trewe gift belongeth well vnto thee peter paule forasmuche thou also art man portion worlde god maye iudged worde thought rise heart thynkyng wise knoweth whether also number sonne god geuen eternall lyfe promised muche make god vntrewe promise wherefore whenne thys thoughte commeth vpon thee suspecte thou wouldest suspecte deuyl least thou therwith deceaued say thou neyther peter paule god woulde haue geuen thys gyft haue ben founde worthy wold haue geuen angells sonne vnto mone pure vndefyled creature whyche alwayes obeye god neuer doo declyne swarue frome hys preceptes thys truthe matter hee gaue hym worlde worlde woorthyer thereof sayde wherefore although neyther peter paule yet wyll suffer selfe bee putt besyde thys gyfte wyll challenge muche thereof part dydde dauyd holy apostle dauyd dydde trespasse heynously greuousely also apostle synners vnworthye wherfore lette man folowe thys reason saying synner iust holy peter wherfore dare bee bolde chalenge gyfte myne rather reason thys wyse soeuer yet god bee taken vnfaithfull promyse portion worlde wherfore wold take gift myn owne shoulde make god vntrue whi god speketh generallye speciallye one alonebut thou wilt say dothe shewe alone wold beleue thynk surely apertained vnto great cosideration god speaketh generally intent verily manne thynke excluded promyse gyft doth exclude selfe must geue count dothe wyll iudge sayth shall iudged mouth gyft geue world vnbelefe mistrust god word receyue yet man consider well shall perceaue baptisme also communion body bloud christ ordeyned intent euery man take gift free franke owne thus muche haue spoken generally vnderstandyng sentence whiche neuer sufficiently declared perceaued principall doctrine faith whereof dye obteyne saluation whiche christe doothe describe plainely oure worlde howe bee made partaker grace onlye thorough fayth christe sayth beleue hym haue euerlasting lyfe doctrine workes iohn whiche fayth ought ensue power holy ghoste placed matter christian ought obedient sonne god one shewing himselfe kinde mindeful great gyfte eternall lyfe loue godthe doctrine workes touchyng say christe teacheth nothynge place wherefore nowe entreate farther matter saued mercie god obtaine grace faythby grace saued thorow faith vertu without merit without workes whole matter requisite necessarie gertinge euerlastyng lyfe remission sinnes altogether fullie comprehended nowe workes holy ghostethe workes office holy ghost plainely also described gathereth together churche language ioyneth together vnitie fayth doth sanctifie remission synnes doth enkendle hope remission sinnes saye beleue remission synnesthe workes trinitie resurrection fleshe lyfe euerlastyng comprised verie properly crede three person one diuine substance yet neuerthelesse euery person set forth ornamet owne office propertie father attribute geuen creation sonne redemption holy ghost power sanctification makyng holy doth distribute pacifie confirme remission synnes transpose v death vnto euerlastyng lyfe man wolde say certaine markes difference person may confusely put together distinctly discerned act father creatour christe becometh man holy ghost cometh wyth tounges like fire
