pacifieth men heartes workes god accordyng distinction office property must make distinction also person god father made man sonne dyd shew forth himselfe fyerie tounges ye proper workes sonne holy ghoste wherfore article deliuered vnto v made know also history god hath defended article great plague hath punished heretikes went ouerthrow great punishement wherefore must nedes sticke constantly vnto forsake word neither must reason dispute thing matter thus saieth hystoriecherinthus heryetike denied godhead christ iohn constreigned write gospell especially heretike cherinthus sake whiche dyd denie christ godhead blasphemed hym chanced iohn wer entred bathing house saw cherinthus washyng ecclesi hist lib cap disciple went hast saying withall let v flee wt hast possible fro blasphemer say long bathe fell hymexamples god anger denied godhead christ slew cherinthus enemie truthe end arrius heretike muche better head author great disturbance tumult church endured church foure hundred yeres much euen sparkle vngodlynes queched extinct myndes common sorte dydde graunt christ borne god creature yet creature neuerthelesse farre better worthier wher faithfull byshoppes euery place dyd meete resyste thys blasphemie many variance discentions dydde ryse thereof pleased constantinus emperour quenche flame whiche nicea gathered together councell many learned men godly byshops condemned error arrius yt long constantinus dead sonne constantine whiche fauourable arrius made emperor arrians laboured power restore arrius agayne excommunication arrius certayne day commyng churche receaued agayne congregation waye taken great griping bealye thereby fayne go way comon place easementan nde worthy heritike set downe bowells gut gushed draught gaue vp goste let blasphemer therfore beware article trinitie fyrst approued scripturethe article trinitie proued manye wayes disputation apostle holy father laste also miracle defended diuell world shall yet defended mainteined god grace beleue one god whiche called father sonne holy ghost might certayn confused thing cocernyng thre person one person therfore operation propreties distincted father maker sonne redemer holy ghost sanctifier common sort christian maye know difference betwene persones yet distincte diuide substance godhed thyng wont taught day christen men onely beleue thinges seme contrary reason paule saieth hath pleased god1 cor make safe foolyshnes preachyng beleue reason neuer make forme argument proue three one one thre god manthe blindnes reason baptised blood christ washed fro syns ye sacramental bread eate body lorde mysticall wyne drinke blood spiritually obteyne remission oure synnes1 cor article counted fable folye amongest wyse world therfore doothe paule name foolyshenesse preachyng yet beleue shall get euerlastyng saluation whiche thyng god father graunt v holy ghoste sonnes sake iesus christe lorde alone sauiour whome honor glorie worldes without ende amen sermon trinitie sonday pthe gospell iohn iii man pharyseis named nicodemus ruler iewes came iesus nyght sayde vnto hym rabbi knowe thou arte teacher come god man coulde suche miracle thou doest excepte god hym iesus aunswered sayd vnto hym ueryly veryly saye vnto thee except man borne aboue se kingdome god nichodemus sayde vnto hym howe man bee borne olde canne enter mother wombe borne agayne iesus aunswered ueryly veryly saye vnto thee excepte man borne water spirite enter kyngdom god borne fleshe fleshe whiche borne spirite spirite marueyle thou sayde thee ye must borne aboue wynde bloweth lusteth thou hearest sounde thereof thou canst tell whence commeth whyther goeth euery one borne spirite nicodemus answered sayd vnto hym howe thinges iesus aunswered sayd vnto hym art thou maister israell knowest thynges ueryly veryly say vnto thee speake know testifie haue sene ye receiue witnesse haue tolde earthly thinges ye beleue howe shall ye beleue yf tell heauenly thynges man ascendethe vp heauen came downe heauen euen sonne man whiche heauen moises lyfte vp serpente wyldernes euen muste sonne man lyfte vp whosoeuer beleueth hym peryshe haue euerlastyng lyfe sermon trinitie sonday pthe gospell iohn iii speciall good gospell declared true way euerlasting lifethe dignitie excellency gospel appereth apointed ye feast trinitie maketh plaine distinction difference betwene person setting forth ye high work god yt god worketh amog v men whe iustifieth saueth v certainly pronouced touching ye father yt loued ye world gaue vnto begotten sonne ar two distinct person ye father son ech hath propre worke father loueth worlde geueth sonne sonne become gift christe saith iohn sonne geueth hymself lift vpon crosse serpent exalted moses desert n mer beleue perishe haue euerlastynge lyfe worke also commeth thirde person holye ghoste water baptisme doth enkendle faithe heart regenerate v vnto kyngdome heauen doctrine full swete confort ought fyll v great truste god see thre person al godhead tendeth end preserue v deathe deuill iustice euerlasting lyfe kyngedome god myght prepared made redy v cause shold haue therfore feare ye presence god syngods good wyll towarde man doubt good toward v ben willyng condemne v synnes always feare father would neuer haue geuen v onely begotten sonne father sonne would neuer haue called v baptisme lauer regeneration vnder gouernaunce holy ghost thinge notifie concerning testimony trinitie touching article doctrine thervnto belongeth haue spoken former sermon plentuously therfore wil entreae order gospel partes therof christ entreth long disputation nicodemus chiefe phariseis among iewes matter nicodemus coulde vnderstande doctrine therof semed strange vnto lacke custome thertonicodemus louer christ accustomed kynd doctrine nicodemus beyng euyll man declareth bothe word dede highly estemeth christ setteth much companion hate extremely commeth vnto hym albeit night testifie openly christ acknowledgeth ye power god doth condemne conscience dyd phariseis scribe neither counted blame worthy man doth acknowlege christ man god thinketh worthy receiued men sent god ye cause christ doth seme receaue man vngentyll sort gaue suche excellent praise concernynge christe uerilye verye deadly error man whiche ought ouer passed christ least seme consent nicodeme great matter wherof yet blamelesse touching knowlege god shewed perfect certain pronounceth knoweth yt christ sent god teacher toke miracle christ dyd workes god christ doth declare answere wherein reproueth nicodemus opinion touchyng kyngdome god knowledge preuayleth nicodemus therefore thynketh knoweth kyngdome god bycause knowethe god vnderstandeth al thing wrought gouerned hym true knewe god well muste nedes knowe hys kyngdome bycause firste false christ rebuketh laste yt knoweth kyngdom god thynketh doth wherfore disputation standeth poynte kyngdome god dothe see know nicodemus neuer opinion tyme kyngdom god description lawe might vnderstande holynes sanctitie god whiche ought performed fulfylled yf wold liue god holy kyngdomthe opinion nicodemus touching ye doctrine saluacion neuer thought ye synne take away lawe lawe testimony declare v synne myght begynning hygher knowledge concernynge god hys kyngdome v ignorant kyngdome grace ignorant bothe god also kyngdome wherfore muste haue respecte iustice workes vnto remission synne thou woldest know god truly kingdome kyngdome god doth consyst reuelation promise sonne god iohn iohn sayth also begotten sonne bosome father hath declared vnto v christ therfore setteth error belongeth nicodeme al seke way kyngdom heauen saluation remission syn ordeyned sonne god renuyng olde man sufficient bring v kingdom god behold law god comandements reasoning nicodeme workes therof obey god therby muche lyeth power thynketh sufficient god requireth v doubtlesse papistes mounkes worthy theyr trifle numbred nicodemethe ryghte papistes comparable ryghteousnes nicodemus amongest suche iusticiaries suche goeth get righteousnes accordyng god law papist folow dreames man tradition euen appointed forme worshypping set forth god howbeit law god dothe nothing diffre man traditio whe applied forgeuing sin god luc dede applied ye pharisei luke glorieth rightuousnes god thoughe kingdome god hys workes sake whiche dyd according lawe christ teacheth god requireth maner thyng seyng kyngdome thou shouldest thynke thou myghtest purchase righteousnes lawe occasion openeth vnto hym rom high mysterie gospell god lawe hath concluded vnder synne might haue mercy men might bring kyngdom mercy hath kyngdom men newe strange saying christ touching kingdom god troubled nicodemus greatly could tell whether gowhy nicodemus came christe better way make playn matter copare together nicodemus came christ bee instructed knowledge kyngdome god shewe hym stubborne companion kyngdom god loketh thynge christe bee allowed wisedome hee coulde thinke hygh reputation christ christ setteth nothyng frendshyp nicodeme instructed hym suche doctrine myght perceaue errour onely foolyshe ignorant phariseis also wisest touchyng iustice lawe beginneth disputation wherewith endeuoureth confute nicodeme true opinion kyngdom god enstruct concernyng true iudgement thynges holy othe saying uerily verily say vnto thee except thou borne new aboue thou canst see kyngdome god dothe christ call question whiche nicodemus neuer thought moue wherfore sodeyn demandyng contrarying vnknowen matter abashed could tell answerethe ignoranc nicodemus muste nedes declare ignorance wher knoweth nothyng concernyng synner must regenerate newe born kyngdom god consyder well pithe christes sayinge pronounceth man beholde see kyngdome christ except borne newe plainly determined soeuer borne fleshe bloud parent power farre man power goeth al reason wil doings law study discipline exercise endeuors fact work escape damnation hereby doth appere ouerthwart shewe vtterly though taught kyngdom god saluation yet touching new birthe speake nothingthe corrupte doctrine pope concernyng saluacion euident pope enioyn workes tradition folowe thereby may get saluation nothing agreyng christ doctrin teach plainly thou born thou shalt saued thyng belongeth nicodemus pertaineth great vertues actes example gentile concernyng modestie loue towarde parentes countrey iustice liberalitie c aduoutrers fornicator theues sluggish people notable woorkes vertues surely discipline therof despised muche god hathe greate respect regard thervnto ten comandements come especiall matter trie way kingdome god way bryngeth saluation saying christ playne thinges worke death damnation without new byrth regeneration new birth chalenge inheritance rightousnes saluation kyngdom god paule sheweth euidet word galat saying christ iesu neither circumcision vncircumcision onely newe creature gathering conclusion reason diligently marked least deceaued resoneth wisereason stealing murder aduoutry doth displease god must nedes folow pleasyng god absteyne thynges denied pleaseth god auoyd syn accordyng law therby good workes doth promise geue reward workes merit yet se kyngdom god workes lawe onely regenerate newe borne luc god dothe hate phariseye luke robber aduouterer vnrighteous wer fasteth payeth tithe god would allowe thing wer done trust obteyn rightuousnes saluation god therby wherfore thinges diligently distincted teachyng must disproue reason willworkes saue vertuous sayinges law neither preceptes maners honest liuing thing taken gift god entreat matter must come kyngdom god doth none thinges preuaile neyther reason lawe good woorkes thys thing stregth borne wher lacking hope come kingdom godan obiection concernynge good workes power lawes preceptes efficacie strength thou wilt say rather doo good worke take muche peynenote order obteyne nothynge therwith kyngdome god thynke saye euident token vngodlines wherfore fyrst see diligently lawe woorkes know thy self synner thou canst thy workes escape damnation turne thy selfe doctrine christ hearken hee preacheth kyngdom god hath declared old man enter kingdome god nicodemus perceaueth straighte iudgement christ without newe byrthe hope kyngdom god soone reformed persuaded carnall byrth healpethe nothynge thereto therefore asketh howe newe byrthe might christ doth redyly shew notable doctrin therof saying wise uerily verily say vnto except man bee borne agayn enter kyngdom god whatsoeuer borne fleshe flesh soeuer born spirit spirite second sentence first byrthe shewyng carnall synful encouraged obteyne kingdome god though say thou demandest whether thou shouldest otherwise borne thy mother wombe although thou borne thousande tymes thy mother wombe yet thou shouldest bee borne kyngdom god ther nede father mother kyngdome god also selues fleshe nede haue water spirite hath ben borne agayne new man shall come kyngdome god doctrine nicodemus neuer learned moses learned doo preceptesthe lawe bringeth man vnto perfection touchyng new creature learned nothyng muche dreame wherfore confounded graunt lerned nothyng wordes sentence ar lyghtly passed ouer sentence perfect good work must done obedience geuen lawe seyng kyngdom god cometh hereby come seyng therof good workes newe man requisite thereto doone carnall mannewater place baptisme water spirite verye parentes mete bryng forth new chyld god water nothyng el baptism marc saith christ last marke beleueth baptised shall saued thys strength water owne nature water water say elemet creature whiche change hert wash away syn water wherof christ speketh call water baptisme water naturall water worde promyse god two thing ioyned together water word ioyned together sundred thou sunder water worde baptisme thou sunder word water neither baptismethe worde elemet maketh perfect sacramet word water ar ioyned together water whiche holy ghost come vnto thee regenerate thee kyngdome god whiche much say forgeue synnes bryng saluation sentence therfore lyghtly regarded especiallye anabaptistes whiche holde opinionanabaptistes confuted baptisme infantes nothyng woorth yet christ place applieth water regeneratio new birth ioyneth cause therof holy ghost child therfore haue nede new byrth see kyngdome god without seynge baptisme ordeyned christ cause muste bee newe borne onely vnmercyfull thynge also violence kyngdome god playne tyranny exclude baptisme kyngdome god whome christe dyed decreed rom benefite free newe borne myght baptised dye hym borne agayn wherfore newe byrth also necessary child may see kyngdome god titus although water dothe nothing profite without holy ghost yet holy ghoste water regeneration muste woorke v paule dothe ioygne bothe together accordyng mercy saith saued v water regeneration renuyng holy spirite shed vpon v abundantly lauer washyng without regeneration renuyng holy spirite wherfore errour detestable certaine place dyuers preacher doo baptise chyldren without water requisite baptisme haue word spiritechristes ordinaunce maye altered also haue water christ ordein man hath power change lawe institution baptisme water seene eies worke regeneration new birth whiche wrought holy ghost inwardly sene therfore outward ceremonie water baptism may omitted priuie inuisible administration holy ghost christ sayth furthermore vnto nicodemus meruail sayd vnto thee thou muste borne aboue wynd bloweth wher thou hearest soud therof thou canst tel fro whence cometh whether gothe euery man born spirite wordes simple ceremonie selfe estemed reason infant aged man offered make confession wise foloweth behold yoke synne deuyll great helpe remedy whether chyld man baptised washed water name father sonne holy ghost must rather marke christ sayth biddeth v rather consyder done priuie operation open ceremonie outward signe worke holy ghost priuie hyd eies wherfore must beleue set forthe worde thou shalte neuer perceaue eies chanceth wynd sound therof heard neither declare risynge slackyng therof newe byrthe outwarde ceremonie commeth water vnto eye word heard woorke done name iesus vnto absolution remission synnes regardeth worde spirite vertue thereof seketh sorte christe hath appoynted shall bee deceyued nothyng el requisite getting newe birth spirite thou must baptised water take diligent hede word newe birth kyngdome god way wil sectary say crake spiritethe spritish sectary meane tyme lay asyde baptisme sacrament worde wherfore christ doth teache sheweth plain demonstration baptisme word doth admonyshe v content vse water word shall haue nothing holye ghost neither shall euer atteyne new byrth wherfore let v haue diligent regard baptisme word chief part saluation know suretie kepe new borne vnto kingdome god doctrine must new borne must come ye kingdom god strage heard world yet true vnfallible contrary part doctrine deceaue seme neuer good iudgemet world reason life phariseis rule monkes deuotion single shauelings fantasticall work vertue ten comandements little comend yt haue yet none al thing doth regenerate water spirite doth worke thinges spirite otherwise knowen v felt wind knowen sound heareth sounde beleueth marc baptised new borne shalbe saued nicodemus deepely drownde vp phantasticall imagination law good workes coprehend doctrine doth also chaunce papistes moste wittie hindreth alwayes think thus nothing please god fast pray geue almes wherfore christ hadleth hym austeritie yt wil beleue knowledge ye true doctrine saith art thou master israel knowest thinges though say doest thou thy dutie maister israel seinge thou knowest way true saluation doctrine newe byrth regeneration doctrin ye prophet necessarie saluatio art thou ignorat yt thou doest knowe vice oure nature whiche hath neede bee abolished regeneration purpose reprouing maister israell uerily preacher religion true saluation may know learninge without doctrine regeneration naught false faulte teache good workes adhorte men therto doth lawe god doth wel therby herin blamed beside doctrine teache men nothyng el though nothing el requisite euerlastinge life euident place although lawe good workes done yet profitte nothynge attainement kyngdome god muste nedes new byrth water holy ghost spirite water worde doth make new men lawe workes change neither men neither ye workes wherfore yt thinketh himselfe might bring men saluation let haue respect ye newe byrth christ hath let beginne good workeshowe saluacion taught let hym laye fundation thing make new heart let hym lead men baptisme spirit ye word whiche holy ghoste doth worke men heartes winde nothing knowen sounde holy ghost nothyng perceaued worde must ye kepe surely looke operation holy ghost nowe maner worde holy ghoste doth make sounde christe teacheth man goeth vp heauen came fro heauen euen sonne man heauen begynninge sermon wherof christe sayth ye beleue speake earthlye thinges wil ye beleue speake heauely thing vnto sermon inueted man begotten sonne bosom father hath declared vnto v sermon saying ther two partes fyrste somwhat harde iohn certainely decreed man ascendeth heauen yt came downe thence meaning wherof one saying except man new borne ca see kyngdome god man sauedno man hys owne strengthe ca saued obtaine remissio sinnes rightousnes neither law neither good workes reason free wil yt hath thing although neuer good daned haue hope saluation euident plaine sentence whiche iewes papistes wold beleue wold make forsake al trust haue owne workes righteousnes man hath birth heauen none first adam eue sonne mary christe saith therfore none shal enter vp heauen yt came downe fro heauenby fyrste byrthe damned plaine yt men borne parets ascend heaue go vp heauen place cotinew earth death therbe going vp heauen man escape damnation iudgement christ touching worlde man excepted whether adam eue abraham moyses dauid enter heauen ascedeth heauen came fro thence preuaile good workes merit ye law free wil thing strenght bring v heaue thou wilt say al condened al wtout saluatio sentece al neither otherwise asmuch belogeth al whatsoeuer coditio state one way heaue ope make son god doth speaketh christ immediatly saying moses lyfted vp serpent desert much sonne man lifte vp beleue may perishe haue euerlasting lyfe ye secod part celestial heauely sermo ye soud ye holy ghost mitigateth ye sharpnes first sermo word horrible fereful sayig yt shal go vp ito heaue get saluatio spoke ye intet yt shold learne yt first birth al sinful ther nothing foude v yt may seme worthy euerlasting life yt put prid carelesse liuing shold tourne huble selues god aske grace ye beginning ye true gospell yt according former sayigby faythe christe saued eue ascedeth ito heaue yt yu maist know yt al yt beleue christ shal perish haue euerlasting life swete voice soud yt ye holy ghost may felt perceaued doctrine necessary ye cogregatio first sin corrupt naturethe doctrine bothe lawe ye gospell necessarye taugh churche christe yt might despaire workes al thing shal neuer go vp heaue sake whe heartes terrified abashed wordes must cofortable worde put forth iesus christ ye son god desceded fro heaue came world tooke flesh blood died sin yt might free fro syn get ye inheritace euerlasting life yt beleueth sayinge purposeth surely sticke therto saued shal forsake christ nether life neither death shalbe take vp vnto hi heaue sermon heauenly thynge sufficiently set forth commended vnto men especially nicodemes thynke law must obserued vnto iustification sufficient vnto saluatio knowe firste doctrine sinne although lawe iust rom holy good yet corrupt euill naturall vice obey lawe although syght good workes furthermore muche lesse know must ascend heauen man sonne mary came fro heauen cometh ignorance thynke yt shalbe saued owne righteousnes god also persecute righteousnesthe doctrine iustificacion faythe alone impugned papistes cometh faith iesu christ see example papistes suffer nothyng lesse doctrine striue againste nothyng much teache iustified faith saued therby good workes compare doctrine doctrine christ ye shal fynd diuersitie fourth booke moyses ther hystorie numer people israell werye suche thynges wildernes murmured god moses despised manna light meat sinne trespas dyd god punishe sorte sent amogest ferye serpetes styngyng followed swellynge inflammation body fel heapes died came moyses said haue trespaced haue spoken againste god pray hym wil take away v serpetes lord spake vnto make brasen serpent put hym vp signe stong loketh vpon shal liuechriste figured brasen serpent christ maketh mention historie applieth himselfe must lifte vp also serpent yt looketh vpon beleueth hym shal perish haue euerlasting lyfe first let v learne cause dreadfull iudgement whiche christ hath pronounced twise againste men yt man go vp heauen sonne man came downe heauen except man borne againwhen ou e damnacion comethe se kyngdom god wherof came great misery man thrust heauen owne desert perish euer came thing old serpent deuil dyd byte hurte first man gen corrupted infected hym syn danger euerlasting death get remedie type figure iewes doth shew also whosoeuer stonge died al v also rom reward sinne death looke wher synne ther must death nedes folow much al men gen soone borne sinner iudgement geuen must dye god name doth threaten adam eue whatsoeuer daye ye eate tree ye shall dye death doth god shew mercie casteth awaye men miserie infected damned death euen figure tipe brasen serpent put forth comandement serpent point lyke serpent sauing poyson remedie poyson doth procure yt son shold lyfte vp crosse looke sholde perishe escape danger death get euerlasting lyfe yea himselfe crosse forme poysonful serpent yet hath poyson lykelines therof although christe fleshe bloud heb pet yet fleshe bloud without sinne yea strength deliuereth v poyson sinne voyce sound holy ghost whiche beginneth newe byrth oure heartes faith may conceaue serpent true faith may syght geue saluation sight christ regarded folishe reason lyke chaunced also ye iewes wold brought beliefe yt ther great vertue sight dead thing wold sooner beleue yt ye poison might sooner expelled medicine doth profite saith reason saue life man beleue christ commandementes lawe must fulfilled also synne must auoyded ther hope saluationby faythe christ comethe saluation therfore men perceaue meanes come saluatio doth depende hereof beleue christ som made monkes fast pray c euery man seeketh saluation lyfe meanes syght faith christ place marke perfect sentence corruption contagion ingendred thee deuill greater thou mayst deliuered euerlastynge death thy owne power might neiher mayst thou deliuered greate euill meanes syght thou beholde christ lyfted vp crosse died thee offred owne lyfe thee rom death satisfied thy sinnes reconciled thee god thou beleuest baptised doubt art thou newe borne holy ghost kyngdome god yd new byrth sorte nothynge open beside sounde saye must sticke sure worde beleue constantly plaine doctrine gospell first al sinner damned eternal death deliuered eternal death whe behold man iesus christ crosse made satisfaction v vanquished death brought v one god made v partaker euerlastinge lyfe doctrine forgeth new men new heartes may say sin death although deadly stog old serpet deme yet thing maketh haue sure hope saluation man christe iesu great vertue loke vpon crucified get therby sure deliuerance sin death deuill wherfore nothing feare bytting deuil neuer great defileth thinges neuer somuche matter blacke poyson christe crosse doth confort righteousnes blacke wan woundes set health looke wher confort hearte againste continuall poyson forthwith ther ensue maner lyfe euen obtaine saluation christa newe lyfe lykewyse redie seke sauing men geuing helpe succour councel confort defence c although christian man hurte yet goeth reuege rather hath pitie seeth cause thing come bytinge poyson deuill whiche thinges could perishe remedie prouided christ wherfore leaueth nothynge vndone seketh alwayes possible bringe men felowship companie saluatio may deliuered poison deliuered doctrine spring fountaine wherout floweth al vertues confort ioy tranquillitie almightie god mercifull father preserue v thorough iesus christ sonne doctrine graunt v therin daylye encrease syghte may neuer fall syght true fayth christ maye deliuered eternall death amen endeth fyrste part postille pthe seconde parte appostell beginnyng firste sondaie trinitie sondaie vpon gospell luke xvj certain riche man whiche clothed purple fine white fared deliciously euery daie certain begger named lazarus whiche laie gate full sore desiryng bee refreshed crummes whiche fell riche mannes borde man gaue vnto dogges came also licked sore fortuned begger died caried aungelles abraham bosome riche man also died buried beyng hell tormentes lift vp eye sawe abraha farre lazarus bosome cried said father abraham haue mercy sende lazarus maie dippe tippe finger water coole tongue tormented flame abraham saied sonne remember thou thy life tyme receiuedst thy pleasure contrariwise lazarus receiued paine comforted thou art punished beyonde betwene v greate space set thei whiche would go hense neither maie come thense v saied praie thee therefore father sende hym father house haue fiue brother warne least thei come also place tormente abraham saied vnto hym thei haue moises prophetes let heare saied naie father abraham one come vnto theim deade thei repente saied vnto hym thei heare moises prophetes neither thei beleue though one arose death againe exposition historie rich historie singuler example like wherof founde al scripture touchyng iudgement life shall come neither necessarie v dispute whether bee historie parable seyng christ th name persones describeth life bothe also bothe endes riche tormented fier lazarus comforted semeth requisite beleue chaunced deede yea maie bolde also saie councell christ sure faithe shall likewise befall chaunce suche like condicios riche man lazarus christ declareth wheras putteth forthe example terrifie feare couetous phariseis put forthe generally twoo example whole worlde one hym riche worlde poore without ende poore world blessed salfe euer euery manne might folowe state thynketh beste pouertie discommodities ioyned godlines bee refused thou maiest thereby come saluacion contrarie wise prosperitie putteth man suche safetie though neede feare vngodlinesse rather rich wealthes sake man suspecte perill idolatrie vngodlinesse least couetuousnesse whiche worshippyng idolles ephe v crepe manne beware let v entreate example self first allwhat putforthe v lazarus example exaple lazarus teacheth v iudge godlines without fruite painefull life kyngdome heauen whereto godlinesse would v haue chief respect condicion bee life without persecution affliction christian man ought thinke hymself vexed god therefore careth hym forgetteth hym maner god loueth chastineth thei chastment maie lesse licenciouslie sinne whereas punishemente thei would liue carelesse prouer iii hebre xii apoca iii haue lesse regard flie synne wherefore godlie manne ought thinke affliction euill token let rather gather thereby god loueth hym careth hym saieth wise man soonne father loueth chastineth wherefore menne herein greatly deceiued whiche present fortune iudge god deede giftes blessyng god housholde stuffe rich health perfite sens c thynges immortall length must departe thei v hence greatest perill ioyned thereto riche worlde trust liuing god timo vi fraile rich length thei departe voide godlines haue rich like giftes god occasion synne bee waie auoide perill either thei iudge self el suffer god iudge diuers tribulacions least thei become voide duetie dooyng godlines praiyng faithe studie wordethe spirituall true blessyng true perfecte blessyng god whereby god goodnes maie ought perceiued onely present thynges also eternall rich god hath called man gospell wherein learne god mercifull soonnes sake pardoneth synnes saue v euer meane tyme whilest bee defende v goodnes deuill tyrannie worlde doeth consider gift truely although destitute temporall thinges although bee nedie sicke despised otherwise troubled c yet shall thynges seme light vnto hym comparison eternall thynges thei verie small lacketh money yet sure god mercie bodie bee sicke knoweth called euerlastyng life promised bothe worde baptisme teptacions whatsoeuer chaunceth inwardly thus doeth comfort endure tyme best come whiche taken fro misfortune god mercifull christes sake whiche also father put euerlastyng enheritaunce coforte miser lazarus lacked sense paine bodie wheras mourned ofte wepte yea hearte also prickynges whiche broken discoraged whe sawe oppressed many burden sickenesse pouertie contempte whereas riche manne store thynges also brast moste greuous tormente al costrained heare testimonie god lawe hym moste calamitie makyng wealthie riche manne thoughtes troubled hym sore thus reasoned harte thou haddest doen thou shouldest haue liued therein riche man hath liued therein therefore hath doen aucthoritie god voice lawe greate temptacion isthe comfor lazarus none knowe thei hath proued sure co fort saied thus hearte se god meanes mortifie sinfull fleshe seyng knowe shall longe continewe within fewe yeres come ende thynges shalbe better case lorde shall take waie manifolde trouble iuste deliuer theim therof promesse sure god mercifull vnto christ sonnes sake doeth pardon synnes riddeth theim cursse take theim mercie grace putte trust hym wherefore although presente state hard yet paciently take men care finde heart geue leauynges whiche thei wonte deny dogges yet comfort god mercifull vnto suffereth lacke eternall goodes meane tyme bide hard bitter thynges vntill due tyme better case shall come like lazarus suche thoughtes first man may gather name lazarus hebrue eleazar name lazarus signifieth signifieth god helpe man trusted god onely also token thereof whereas euangelist saieth lazarus carried angelles bosome abraham nothyng el lazarus embraced suer faith promes made vnto abraham blessed seede thereof tooke hearte grace state holde accursed al worlde yet doubted obtaine blessyng blessed seede maner saith caused death bee carried vp bosome abraham christ would v looke diligently example christian men must looke suffer neede trouble lazarus without comfort haue pacience yet despaire last nature fleshe reason chaunged excepte helpe worde god studie thereof thus dooe menne thinke alwaie aduersitie god forgetteth v regardeth v el would helpe v succour v suche wisedome myndes comforte selues hope come wherfore riseth murmuring god iudgyng hym whereof lengthe ensueth blasphemie desperacion laste fall fro god hate hym looke saluacion hande ioyning present misery eternall paine also example lazarus put forthethe historie lazarus diligently considered ye tyme crosse godlie defende selues thereby daunger descripcio christ moste wretched suffereth promesse christ taken mynde loketh stedfastlie euerlastyng life meane season obeieth god poinctes gloriously recompensed tyme stede little paine obtaineth euerlastyng pleasure comfort example lazarus whiche christian men al crosse trouble ought beholde thereby thei maie admonished beste theim doe example riche manthe riche man whiche life liued prosperitie desier life come miserie paine muste wee consider certaintie christes testimonie putt foorthe example speciallie carelesse coueitous hypocrite might knowe miserable ende life come wherefore ought consider truthe matter eye howe riche man horriblie tormented flame suche wise written penne expressed wordes chiefe speciall cause tormentes paine isthe cause riche ne danacion bicause beholdeth felicitie lazarus despised disdained neither haue asmuche droppe water coole burning therewith furdermore constrained suffer paine perpetually without hope remedie cause miser caste suche pain without ende rich neither apparelleth hymself liueth gooddes giftes god bee measure vsyng wasted riotously thinges vsed feare god thankes geuyng god disalowe cause riche manne hath store goodes clotheth hymself liueth riotouslie yet hath respecte life come hopeth longer life life come ende careth becommeth life care studie geue self pleasure pastyme life though nede nothyng el christ doeth admonishe gospell heartes ouerladen surfet drounkennes luke xxi care worlde one cause damnacionto haue respect poore mane nede foloweth regard worde god neither thyng moued either promise threatninges life maie bee defrauded luste desire second cause sawe lazarus nede face yet accordyng prophet openeth hand nedie rather euangelist dogges shewed humanitie miser riche man thought great pletie geuen hym thentent help needie like vnsaciable gredie gutte esaie lviii luke xvi loued greate heapyng thynges together yet nothyng moued men lacke nede sinnes crieth vengeaunce god little pleasure life maie haue euerlastyng punishement example doeth christ setforthe v might beware iudgement synne might geue selues without care surfetting life though life come forget poore hath suche plentie goodes maie helpe poore math xxv iames ii yet doeth shall laste daie suffer greate paine tormente tyme shall see poore despised face greate ioye felicitie owne greate sorowe riche manne lazer contrary wise hath helped many doen good shall take greate pleasure thereof life come harde case riche man heate burnyng denied droppe colde water wherefore let v forget poore nediethe poore must regarded let v helpe succour onely accustomable maner geue halfpenie beggers suche like euery man able degree almose shall bee moste acceptable euery man power vocation doeth maintaine commo felowship euery manne vse tourne crafte gaines euer occupieth suche purpose man deceiued man defrauded loketh onely owne vantage deceiueth man waight measure vnknowen craftes guile emo gest fell daie little expresse fraudes vsed certaine occupation gaines wherefore vprightlie doen yea leaste contractes bargaines maner almose deede contrarywise doen fraude deceite plaine theft thei shall iudged otherwise theues god iudgemente whereas couetous riche shall behold lazarus thei haue deceiued many way bargaininges hath spoiled goodes maner riche man thei shalbe punished euerlastyng paine sort maie euery man make craft occupacio almose pleasyng god onely temporall blessynges shall therof ensue christe saieth luke xvi shall gette v frendes life whose testimonie shall profite v life come worlde bee brought vnto beliefe hath stocke nothyng diminishe thereof rather encrease hath none studieth al make hymself heape substaunce caryng come wherefore god plague worlde vntill last hell maketh ende yet worlde ameded neither plague neither threatnynges greatest madnesse prouide perilles suffer hunger scarcitie victual doe take hede case whereas offende shall ensue eternall paine iudgemente muche greuous bicause neuer chaunged beyng one dooen remaineth hope remedie abraham lazarus thou hearest onely vnwillyng coole heate little water also vnable ouerthwartnesse little regarde greate daunger seke rather remedie itthe greate blindnesse men light trifle life doe sore vexe v se dignitie suche bee maie make prouision theim commodity life men haue gotten thynges thei labour farther though thei gotten thei haue thei endeuour studie care come thereby meane season thei haue regarde thyng moste necessarie vntill thei fall sodainly snare euen iudgemet damnacion cause christ putteth forth example riche manne withdrawe v care thynges present timo vi make v geue hede euerlastyng life rich man geuen ouer heart worldly prosperitie rather trusted liuyng god neuer come place tormente destruction contrary precepte god drowneth vp rich forgetteth state come applieth thynges onely desiers lustes suffer thyng come mynde contrary teacheth christ watche least suffer riche man euerlastyng death recompence little ioye luke xxi twoo example suche neuer ought fall memorie firste tyme trouble might haue suer trust comforte also prosperitie world fall daunger euerlastyng death also doeth belong christ speaketh riche manne perceiuyng owne cause bee paste remedie yet careth brotherne desireth lazarus might sente father house least thei continue olde conuersacion thei also fall like punishemente abraham denieth hym saieth thei haue moises prophetes let heare theim riche man proceded alledged ensue muche profite message deade goe preache theim liue abraham answered thei heare moises prophetes neither thei beleue come deade riche man vnderstandeth escape hath neede repentaunce perceiueth maie chauce chaunced hym although worde god preacher thereof abide men worlde yet doeth moue neither repentaunce neither amendement life wherefore thinketh beste bretherne one fro deade could tell thinges inuisible come vnto theim neither would seme v also wise matter requireth suche prophet come emongest men abraham perswaded allowe therefore saieththe woorde god muste onely take hede vnto escape paine muste haue respecte nothyng prophettes onely waie escape daunger eternall damnacion heare neither moses prophettes vaine one rise dead angell god preache suche would neuer bee brought beleue high praise worde god ministerie thereof whereas men necessarily bound thei ought thinke meane auoide pestilence destruction doeth moises prophetes teache two thinges specially first thei shew promised sede woman breake serpentes head depriue strippe deuill power make good damage taken paradise unto seede sonne god doctrine moises prophettes bryngeth diuine power righteousnesse v yearth bothe moises prophetes whollie applied thei teache commaunde cometh gospel preached men heare geue credite gene iii sorte heareth moises prophetes firste despeire owne workes power trust onely seede onely blessed seede dooeth restore v accursed blessyng gene xxii faithe christe iesus onely true waie whereby maie deliuered synne death get saluacion faithethis sauiour comforte regarded riche man tooke wealth end felicitie sure token owne righteousnestemporall prosperitie sure token god fauour men wont gather aduersitie god angrie like wise whe thei prosperitie thei take token god fauour whereas yet temporall blessyng great weight commonlie chaunceth vngodlie fortunate godlie thou canst heare geue thee good councell beware thou trust thy rich trust onely hym moises prophettes speake el thou shalt haue none ende riche manne whiche moises prophettes yet beleued good worksthe seconde thyng moises prophettes teache forasmuche al trust righteousnes saluacion consisteth promised seede shewe obedience god dooe biddeth flee forbiddeth muche feare god kepe commaundementes rather obeye owne lustes god lawe glorie soonne god careth god rather neuer without care wherein feareth least god come sodainly iudge hym emong damned twoo thynges must nedes ioyned together faithe obedience toward god faithe required deliuer v synnesfaithe obedience toward god required euery christia make v child god obedience charitie workes also required might shewe suche obedience belongeth child wee prouoke god wrathe synnes wee haue good conscience whiche thei haue continewe still open synne without repentaunce finallie feare god keepe commaundementes yet truste righteousnes god onely trust iesu christe shalte thou perill suche faithe onely able preuaile sinne death muche god hymself hath commaunded obedience doeth alowe although vnperfite alone self ioyned faithe whiche wee pardoned lackyng obedience moises prophettes bee heard maie learne thereby faithe christ true obedience riche manne wherefore punished euerlastyng damnacion thei whiche heare moises prophettes yet obey worde thei heare beleue beleue christ knowe god mercifull vnto v sake imputeth synnes vnto v geue v saluacion feare god obeye deuill fleshe looke god thei belong lazarus bosome abraham shall saued lazarus euer whiche thyng god graunte v sonnes sake iesu christe holie ghost amen ij sondaie trinitie sondaie gospell luke xiiii certaine man ordeined greate supper badde many sent seruaunt supper time saie bidden come thynges readie thei one began make excuse first saied vnto hym haue boughte farme muste needes goe see praie thee haue excused saied haue bought fiue yoke xen goe proue theim praie thee haue excused saied haue maried wife therefore come seruaunte retourned brought master woorde againe thereof good man house displeased said vnto seruaut goe quickly streates quarter citie bryng hither poore feble haulte blinde seruaunte saied lorde doen thou hast commaunded yet roume lorde saied vnto seruaunte goe high way hedge compell come house maie bee filled saie vnto none menne whiche bidden shall taste supper exposition gospell parable taketh occasion miracle luke xiiii christe healed man sicke dropsie pharisies house euangeliste saieth thei watched trap christe wherefore christe geueth sharpe sentence rebuketh ambition pride thei striue sit chief roume vntill laste beginneth reproue hoste tellyng call feaste riche wealthie recompence hym poore whiche reco penny hym life come wordes one geastes stepped forth willyng declare deuotion saieth blessed eateth bread kyngdome god though greatlie regarded god kyngdome christe perceiueth hypocrisie putteth forth plaine description thereof wyng maner deuotion man suche haue thei regarde neither god neither kyngdome heauen thou saieth shewest outwardly thou haste greate desire come manne saie thou art sort geastes whiche bidden feaste greate loue gentlenes thei businesse goodes come man specially touched taunte whiche stept sorte declare deuotion though saie thou saiest happie eateth breade kyngdome heauen thou wouldest marke thou saiest thou shouldest perceiue thou art one sorte whiche come thei called saiyng greuous hainous man consider well math iii christe hande moste wicked hurtfull generacio adder whiche satte doune hym table learne marke thei could take hym meanes trippe beginnyng parable certaine manne made greate supper sent seruauntes bidde geastes whiche excusyng selues refused come vnto supper first saied bought farme must needes goe see saied bought fiue yoke ox saied maried wife maister supper despised laughed scorne muche maister beyng greatly moued vnworthie behauior prouided lame blinde beggers c bee brought constrained come supper concernyng saieth wise thei shall tast supper gospell maketh verie greuously iewes gentile prosecute parable order made supperthe manne made supper god whiche sumptuous riche feaste maker hath rich maiestie prepared supper whiche called great muche respecte maker thereof whiche god albeit might worthelie called greate supper cause onely meate self also magnificent greate gospellthis supper gospel yea christe hymself whiche gospell sette v feede synnes thorowe death hath made satisfactio hath deliuered v eternall death helle wrathe god damnacion doctrine concernyng christ greate supper whiche calleth geastes maie sanctifie baptisme comforte confirme theim sacramente bodie blood nothyng lackyng requisite necessarie greatnesse magnificece plentifulnes thereof gorgious gentle intertainemente geastes cause maie well bee called greate euen sumptuousnesse delicates whiche dressed prouided man sufficiently expresse togue thinke heart meate drinke thereof eternall whiche followeth neither hunger thirste satisfieth theim quencheth thirste continuall ioye ensueth supper onely inough one manwhy called greate supper sufficient worlde muche bigger larger gospell saieth beleueth christe sake made man borne virgine marie crucified sinnes ascended heauen sitteth right hande god father c beleueth doeth liue euer farre wise mannes meate hounger daie putte awaie yet morowe retourne againe meate euerlastyng neuer consumed doeth declare hypocrite present supper sorte set yet thei suche malice wickednesse although thei prate muche therof yet thei proudely despise god bountifulnes euerlastyng life saluacion meane season set muche thynges followeth texte called many many called iewes people israellwho geastes whiche abraham tyme specially called prophettes seede promised patriarke abraham whiche blessyng bee gotten supper first shewed vnto hym chief father thyng prophettes entreated largelie therof gene xxiixxvi xxviii brought people poinct diligence god nothyng could lackyng thei sufficiently called wherefore paule epistle alwaies putteth iewes rom iewes firste grecian saieth time come feaste tyme come christe borne dye rise againe deadewho wer seruauntes seruauntes went forthe ihon baptiste apostle said people israel bidden hetherto hath callyng supper supper set table messias borne dead risen againe wherefore come season ye maye receiue parte gorgious supper ye maie receiue blessyng promised deliuered cursse damnacion obtaine health saluacion message specially shewed chiefe people whiche spirituall ciuill administracion thei take message thei began make excuse geastes present reproued specially masterlike fellowe whiche christe craked kyngdome god meate thereof blessed eateth bread kyngdome god christe doeth interprete man saiyng thou saieth carest happie thou art say vnto thee supper set table iho baptiste come apostle doe call supper ye doe onely refuse come also imagine excuse ye come meanes sinne double ye despise gospell shewe cause ye doe fearyng least ye lese opinion holines rightuousnes wisedome herein ye synne specially frowardnesse passe synnes muche geue credence god worde contempt ioyned thereto yea wickednes compted rightuousnesse truely passeth synnes papistes folowe example iewesthe stubb ne iewes papistes gospell yet doe thei still stubburnly defende doynges touchyng one kinde lordes supper vowed chastitie abhominacions yea thei condemne v also punishe v banishe v consente abhominacions let theim haue owne peraduenture thei make rod owne taile also excuse iewes receiue doctrine priesthode law whiche god gaue v moises muste see preseruation countrie first laieth excuse farme seconde ox bothe theim thinke excuse lawfull thirde proude newe maried wife therefore despiseth supper three thynges doe containe descripcio kyngdome god breade whereof maisterlike felowe hypocrite made mencion christ take paine tell hym mankinde thei seme outwardly haue greate desire kyngdome god eternall bread yet thei thinke farre otherwise godlines thei shewe openly thei knowe onely kyngdome god whiche consisteth corporall blessynges thei called supper eternall blessinges thei regard kyngdome god bread psal xviii psalme calleth straunge childre whiche thinke godlines onely gaines vauntage thynges might described selues bicause parable belongeth iewes hypocriticall kinde shewe meanyng farme ox wife firste iewes laye excuse moises lawe ceremony apostle teache bee nede temple lawethe farme signifieth bicause greate high priest iesus christ reueled tribe iuda thei hope saluacion onely hym sacrifice thei could brooke doctrine decreed rather forgo christ lawe hereof chaunceth yet thei looke commyng messias trust restore againe bothe priesthode kingdomethe error iewes dauides tyme geue theim store plentie thynges doeth christe reproue buiyng farme saieth goe see farme haue bought priestes doe labour goe harueste gouerne people christe call teacher workemen math ix sowe gospell must care priesthode wherefore apostle doctrine contrary thei condemned false supper could allowed yet thei thought owne iudgemet thei iust excuse doe seconde also bring excuse whiche ciuill gouernaunce oxenoxen thei signifieth ox doeth signifie gouernours people many calues haue compassed many ox hath besieged saieth dauid psalm xxii v saie thei kyngdome politike order committed must depart followe doctrine shall put thynges hasarde wherefore teacher muste bee ridde waie thirde saie gospell doctrine forbiddeth coueteousnessea wife signifieth commaundeth men caste heade life goodes money perill christes sake wherefore come possesse house familie without daungerto marrie wife c marie wife doeth signifie dishonestie dooe thynges whiche belog housholder meanes founde encrease goodes famelie aduauncement therof procured whether doen honestie dishonestie iewes thought vpon thei fulfilled rightuousnes lawe thei haue blessyng moises promised blessyng corporall thynges cattell golde wiues psal cxiiiii child wherefore thei loked onely thynges store house might full therof flowyng ouer thereby thei thought self rightuous cause blessed god papistes loth receiue gospellso doe papistes also excuse theim selues thei saie doctrine true yet thei muste departe swarue holy churche leaste rise sedicion scisme yea thei selues also feare thei receiue doctrine owne churche power decaie perishe whereas neuerthelesse onely gospell maketh true churche god dooeth represse vniust power sedicion furdermore couetuousnes cause impedimente thei receiue gospell bicause thei see gospell defended verie simple garde pouertie persecution ende suche iewesbeholde beware thei defended lawe priesthode kyngdome rich longe stubburnely vntill laste thei ouerthrowen loste thei liue emong straungers banished persones sure nothyng come felowship supper lorde purposeth bid geastes bicause despised despiseth also foloweth good man house displeased saied seruaunte goe quicklie streates lane citie c though saie ye set muche farmes ox wiues ye care supper ye holde faste priesthod kyngdome richesse ye put side gospell tel ye shal loose together meane season prouide geastes wherefore thou seruaunt get thee streates lane citie bryng hither poore maimed weake chaunceth iewes prince priestes chief emongest people despised gospell cause aboue rehearsed god receiued humbe fisher whiche poore despised sorte paule saieth corinthian cor looke brother vocacion god hath chosen many wise men fleshe many mightie many high degree hath chosen foolish thinges worlde confoude wise weake hath god chosen confounde stronge obscure worlde hath god chosen abiectes reputacion bryng naught thynges reputacion c accordyng sentence whatsoeuer thyng people preeminence holinesse wisedome power rich reiected bicause thei despised gospell contrarie wise christ receiued simple obscure peter andrewe simon bartholomewe c whiche fisher verie poore men manne thought worthie execute smallest office chief prince priestes thei wer outcaste esai saieth dragges moste excellent wine excellentest people priestes riche heades noble glorious caste awaie vnbelief euen tunne good wine remaineth onely dregges christ dooeth call poore weake blinde doeth christ poinct kyngdome god pharasei whiche doeth faine thei set greatly kyngdome god bread thereof christ dooeth declare suche hypocrite doe meane ye would saieth haue farmes ox supper kyngdome god ye care wherefore supper belongeth onely poore saied poore receiue ioyfull tidynges gospell math xi ruler holie wise despise supper vnworthie thereof could haue spoken geuously iewes specially man craked breade kyngdome heauen yet vnderstoode kyngdome consisteth farmes ox present thynges life region might depriued priesthod kyngdome whatsoeuer becommeth christe gospell thus thought nede christ attain thereby kyngdome god god would saie hym iewes come ye iewes high priestes ye holie men ye prince ye excellent citezens breade supper prepared saieth thus goeth matter ye called ye dooe regard ye excuse selues affirme excuse lawfull wherefore reiect refuse receiue vile multitude lame weake blinde halte poore c thus farre gospell belongeth iewes speaketh lame weake streates lane citie calleth people iewes citiewhy iewes resembled citee bicause people well ordered ruled thei lawe ceremony rite temple priestes kynges thynges ordained god written moises sendeth seruauntes high way commaundeth theim bryng geastes wheresoeuer thei maie bee yea beggers sitte hedge c lorde saied vnto seruaunte goe high way vnto hedge constraine theim come house maie full callyng gentilesthese lye hedge wee gentile whiche dwell citie whiche haue forme seruice haue idolatours knewe neither selues neither god wherefore haue maie well called open fielde thynges lye open deuill owne goe thither saieth constraine come alwaies frowardnes world resist gospell brooke doctrine thereof yet neuer lesse feast maker would haue supper often vsed bestoweth coste charge maie lacke men merie make good chere hym although bee faine raise theim stone cause god made worlde large widewhy god spareth worlde whereas yet late hath sufficient cause mannes sinne make bothe mankinde lesse narowe doeth bicause yet hath geastes sufficient furnishe supper wherfore wheras seruauntes bryngeth gospell v also token v baptized beleue pertaine also supper iolie felowes liyng hedge saie blinde poore lame gentile moste desperate compellyng come vnto supperbut dooeth god constraine v whereas nothyng doen compulsion seruice allowed sorte dooeth compell causeth woorde preached vnto v beleueth baptized shall saued beleueth shall condemned wherby setteth v bothe heauen helle death life wrathe mercie math vxi ephe ii psalm li first declareth vnto v synne greate corruption nature maie feare heare borne child wrathe kyngdome deuill deede compulsion constrainyng greate feare wrathe god thereby driuen call helpe brought passe preaching gospel heartes dread muste proceade doctrinenote well yet synners fall desperation synne although thei haue neuer iuste cause despaire let rather folowe councell god bicause thei baptised let heare gospell preacheth iesu christ died v made satisfaction synnes crosse death thou beleue thou nedest feare wrathe god death euerlastyng thou true geaste hast roume magnificent glorious supper art therby fedde made fatte good likyng compellof maner compellyng whiche pope vseth make manne afraied synne compell pope dooeth curssyng booke bell candell doeth cause true feare conscience teacheth truly synne magnifieth owne trifle cursseth hym kepe ceremony mennes tradition gospell openeth synne wrathe god heauen none excepted doe liue synne vngodlie thyng doeth god commaunde shewed vnto v gospell rom whe saith apostle go preache repentance repentaunce preached openyng wrathe god luk xxiiii men thei full vnbelief contempt god synnes wrathe ought terrifie make coscience quake feare thei maie compell theim selues saie lorde muste dooe auoyde miserie shall saied hym sit doune supper eate many table full meate yet voyde geastes thou art christened therfore beleue iesu christ hath satisfied thee thou hast none remedie destruction baptized beleue shall wrathe ended greate plentie grace mercie remission sinne sent doune heauen vnto thee thy greate ioye sing ler comfort compellwherefore compell nothyng el preache repentaunce remission synne shewe wrathe god vpon synners mercie vpon theim beleue wrathe repentaunce causeth great thrist desire grace true waie supper one churche madethe beleuyng iewes gentile one churche bothe iewes gentile generally called poore nedie lame weake feare conscience thei gladly embrace gospell desire mercie thei refuse doe thei neuer prudent wise haue sentence giuen theim thei shall taste supper wrathe god shall remaine vpon thei shall damned vnbelief god saied hath respect riche wise holie thei wherefore bee thei neuer carelesse thei neuer sure selues yet shall thei proue experience sentence vainly spoken christe concludeth thei shall taste supper receiue feare synnes doe despise grace god whiche offered vnto v gospell christes sake shall obtaine wrathe grace synne eternall rightuousnes eternall death eternall life sore iudgement day appereth moste euident emong iewes turkes whiche haue saueryng gospell yeathe iewes turkes papistes abhorre supper rather thei muche abhorre thei finde heartes muche see heare chaunceth also likewise papisticall high priestes bishop whiche little filled supper thei scarslie taste smell whiche peculiar grace god set middle light gospell filled well fedde become lustie strong glad supper lorde graunte v continewe therein vnto ende amen amen christes intent therefore parable exhorte v haue gospell high estimacion ioyne selues theim whiche haue high stomackes reason prudence wisedome power holinesse sentence giuen touchyng castyng awaie damnacio theim thei shall tast supper thei caste awaie people iewes onely vnpure dragges wer reserued shall chaunce v also set farmes ox wiues spirituall ciuill dignity temporall possession doe gospell speaketh greuous verie terrible thyng plaine simple wordes thei shall taste supper though saie supper despised higher price farmes despise thei neuer muche although thei set farmes ox wiues thei doe shall come time thei muste depart thynges farme oxe fro wiues thei would faine taste supper shall saied vnto theim math vii knowe ye lacke geastes let farmes ox wiues comforte yougreuous threatninges againste despisers supper shall giue better supper muche ye despised supper cared greate prouision coste made supper althynges semed vile vnto good fare delicates goe god name spare lette onely saie vnto ye shall haue part supper thynges shall bee dreadfull daie god shall plaine wordes call supper life euerlastyng farmes ox eternall fire shall chaunge sentence thing thei shall neuer taste supper thei shalbe voyde hope saluation wherefore woordes lightly estemed whiche declare euerlastyng wrathe housholder propertie greate men thei earnestly moued thei speake many wordes thei speake ponderous weightie thei thinke greuously inwardly thei speake outwardly muche dooe brief woordes signifie vnspeakeable wrathe god whiche man pacifie yet esteme little though gester skoffer might worthely despise spoken theim though god spoken thynge sporte neither doe heare se wordes texte god angrie v thei proceade greate anger wrathe neither foole childe lorde god aboue thynges doe tremble quake psal cxiiii scripture saieth mountaines foundatios sea floodes flie face god onely man stiffe necked feare rather despise god mocke hym preacher excused exhorte diligence ye regard set supper rich goodes wherfore daie worlde shall beare v recorde confesse blamelesse set forthe doctrine earnestly studiously aduersaries doe heare condene heresie muche discontet thei dooe hereby doe thei confesse thei haue heard read seen haue dooen message haue holde peace haue taught earnestly diligently yea preached muche aduersaries saie vehement let man iudge whiche commaunded v doe lette hym defende condemne v doe refuse iudged haue true god true christe true churche part matter shall plain hidde thynges shall made open meane season lette v praie god preserue kepe v stedfast suche doctrine faithe holy ghoste doubtles shall welcome supper thyng heauenly father graunte v iesus christes sake holie ghost amen iij sondaie trinitie sondaie gospell luke xv resorted vnto hym publicanes synners heare phariseis scribe murmured saiyng receiueth synners eateth theim put forthe parable vnto theim saiyng manne emong hauyng hundred shepe lose one theim dooeth leaue ninetie nine wildernesse goeth whiche loste vntill finde hath founde laieth shulders ioye assone commeth home calleth together louers neighbour saiyng vnto reioyce haue founde shepe whiche loste saie vnto likewise ioye shall bee heauen ouer one synner repenteth ouer ninetie nine iuste persones whiche nede repentaunce either woman hauyng tenne grotes lose one doeth light candle swepe house seeke diligently till finde hath founde calleth louers neighbour together saiyng reioyce haue founde grote whiche loste likewise saie vnto shall ioye presence aungelles god ouer one synner repenteth exposition gospelles reade yerea gospell singulare greate comfort moste comfortable whiche christe teacheth office shepherd maketh inquisition synners restoreth theim thei maie plucte piece wolffe deuill occasion sermon christe kynde synners publican drewe nigh vnto christe heare worde scribe phariseis seyng laied christes charge crime vsed companie kinde men god thei beloued god could haue nothyng doe declare farre vnlike god christ answereth alledgeth iuste cause doeth nothing otherwise common maner men yea inferiour matter chief care tymes recouer loste daunger hereby might reproue vntolerable frowardnes arrogance phariseis wheras thei giue iudgemet vnshamefastly matter thei vnderstande matter maie better perceiued questio whether place synners kyngdome god christes worthely reproued whereas professeth hymself bee sonne god yet companieth theim kyngdome god phariseis scribe deceiued iudgyng christes doyng bicause thei knewe truly kyngdome god yet thei thought theim selues moste perfect thereof cause false iudgementthe iudgemente lawe concerning sinner thei knewe moises prophetes cotinuall readyng studie vnderstandyng woorkes lawe muste doen doeth theim allowed rightuous god doeth theim banished outlawe god vnderstandyng thei iudge christes doyng place bicause god lawe hath put plaine determinacio kyngdome whiche synners excluded aduersaries god kingdome ought taken otherwise god determine hymself synners bee admitted receiued emong suche god verie iudgement reason also sone riseth sense synne naturally respect vnto wrathe godthe iudgemente reason cocerning synners whiche alwaies dread looked synne thei iudge haue hope mercifull god stireth hym wroth synnes adam eue maie example gene iii sone thei transgressed precept thei could abide owne conscience thei seke hid dare come sight yong child also declare true thei faute thei seke corner nature synne make hearte afraiedsynne nature thereof bicause dooeth alwaies feare wrothe punishemente contrarie wise conscience pure fautlesse trusteth well self although mennes iudgementes neuer muche theim like reason therefore synne doeth naturally flie god vpright honest behauiour wont haue confidence god phariseis comparison selues thei thought iuste exclude synners thei see thei directe againste lawe god doynges therfore thei also pronounced plainly thei ought haue place kyngdome god thei suspect christ also doth god bicause doe wt consider thou thy selfbefore god lawe menne synners case matter come synners excluded god kyngdome phariseis thinke although thei suppose kinde men liueth without synne yet god lawe knoweth none suche although euery manne committeth adulterie slaughter thefte yet god manne without synne yea synnes greuous thei fall manne hath wisedome strength resist phariseis iudgement true god doeth tourne awaie synners maketh muche selues lawe onely reproued sinnes publicas synners also owne others followe men haue place kingdome god phariseis proceded farre ignoraunce thei fore giue thei moste greuous sentence selues ouersight riseth bicause thei knowe god lawe giuen neither corruption synne men thynges one errour bringeth also kyngdome god doe hypocrite knowe nothing whiche must nedes set vp god grace goodnes christ groundyng reason true principle openeth misterie gospell vnknowe naturall witte followe rightuousnes lawe god hateth sinner willeth death declareth christ sent worlde bring home againe foldes shepe straye flockes intent hath onely respect fulfillyng gospell iere esaie lxi luke iiii loste stray maie chiefly regarded god might hereby bee declared gospell opened poore plainly kinde doctrine doctrine lawe phariseis whiche taketh seede roote nature brought heauen sonne god saith ihon man hath seen god time ihon onely begotten soonne whiche bosome father sheweth hym forthe man knoweth god angrie sinner damneth synnes receiueth rather grace saueth knowe contrary wherefore feare wrothe god naturally ioyned synne christe teacheth v gospell luke xv god otherwise mynded towarde synners angrie mercifull angelles heauen reioyce synners repent amende doctrine must better marked bicause semeth contrary reason maie confirme conscience suche temptation followeth reason iudgement goeth hedlong deuill remedie desperation wherefore goeth matter must agree surely christ contrary reason al thinges although synnerswhy god refuseth sinner yet christ must reuoked called againe shepe goyng straye vnto place saluacion christ setteth forth plaine parable place declaracion moste excellent office diuers place doeth gospell declare god casteth awaie synners ihon iii third ihon god suche hateth worlde loueth giueth onely begotten soonne recoueryng thereof worlde maie haue confidece sacrifice sake maie despeire synne although god might haue helped v otherwise yet purposed doe soonne haue cause doubte deliueryng redemption moste truenote well god pacified death sonne offended synnes furdermore cause set forthe christe god casteth awaie synners sheweth sinner portio god substance whiche fell yet god hath suche respect matter regardeth greatest thynges hath vntill loste recouered waie recoueryng sette vp christe hymself saieth place wherfore ought seme maruell make searche synners straye god houshold bryng home againe sent cause bryng home synners againe dooe otherwise phariseis appoinct hym could execute god commaundement tender affection christe toward sinnersbut verie comfortable see affection christe toward synners whiche described tipe figure careful studious shepherd whereas followeth straye shepe takyng care meane season reste findeth beateth handleth ge tly though blamelesse taketh shoulder retourne maketh ioyfull gratulacions frendes whiche declareth greate bounteousnesse loue christ toward man whiche bee well co mended set forthe nede long sermone declaracion loue resteth chiefly hym loste weake perill men doe testifie suche thynges thei loueloue loue vncertaine sure trust aduauntage daunger yet care daunger safe naturall true loue yet maye bee compared shadowe greate affection christe searcheth themof marueilous loue christe towarde penitent synners greuously hurt shepe goyng stray though thei wer peril without owne fault findeth put shulders thyng maie man inuent comfortable swete whereas followeth fugitiues owne fault seke owne destruction ioynyng theim selues deuill god aduersarie stoutly defendyng parte holdyng god enemie deuill againste god kyngdome pursueth theim saie hurtfull enemy searcheth miserable shepe peril endeuoureth wholy hym self recouer theim woulfe oppresseth theim thei dye synnes shepherd doeth alwaies crie shepe goyng straye death synner exe xxxiii rather repent liue despaire thy matter bicause thy synne knowe god mercifull sonne iesu christ hath sent vnto thee shepherd bestowe life thee laye thee shoulder bryng thee againe folde saluacion thynges ought considered fullie perfectly wee maie vnderstande howe greate loue care god hath saluacion man abide se hym made praye deuill maketh sute synners owne right least repelled sinne though right appoint shepherd whiche hath right recouer synners straye shepe seeth thei able retourne againe followeth theim bryngeth theim againe vpon shoulder merciethe lawe bryngeth man saluacion lawe moises whereon phariseis grounde determinacio kingdome god could neuer ordeined suche recoueryng loste lawe dooeth onely entise vnto straunge shepe also driueth furder sharpe cruell wordes lawe preuaile synner saiyng thou cleane without sinne thou maiest obtaine place kingdome god otherwise knoweth truly woorde god christe onely saueth tell dooe commaunded ascende heauen vnderstandeth place synners heauen wherfore except commeth shepeherd heauen vnto straiyng shepe beareth shoulder againe kingdome god doctrine beside sheweth kyngdome god neither councelleth preuaileth thyng theim come thereto onely doctrine commendeth setteth forthe shepherd sheweth redie waie dooeth onely declare man entereth heauen excepte descended then deniyng saluacio vnto synners lawe alwaies synners saiyng thou descededst therfore thou shalt ascende sheweth also sonne man come doune heauen become shepherd loste shepe thei maie borne heauen vpon shoulder thei could neuer haue come thither owne power christ ihon saieth ihon iii sonne man therfore bee exalted beleue hym perishe haue euerlastyng life synners straunge shepe recouered shepherde exalted crosse might beare theim vp heauen shoulder make partaker kyngdome heauen whence descended sinner might thither ascende whereby appereth right god hath challenge sinner owne familie greate errour also phariseis scribe suche measure kyngdome god rightuousnes workes declared god allowe commede honour hym onely lippes requireth true nigh hearte whiche except recouered shepherd shepherd esai xxix math xv bryngeth hym againe shoulder maketh heart full hope confirmyng holy ghost maie call boldly god kyngdome without distruste maie earnestly embrace hope saluacion doubt bestowe present life al hath life euerlastyng wherefore ioyneth hymself shepherd onely disioyned hym yet deliuered bodie sinne yet liueth corporall life bestoweth hymself whollie heauenly conuersation bryngeth forthe suche workes spirite hypocrite pharisie monke bryng yet alwaies hauing minde first condicion state recoueryng trusteth onely shepherd shoulder god glad shewe hym obedience yet taketh hede copare christ shoulder kingdome god described christ wherein place synners yet none enter thither true earnest confession synnes yet thei partaker shephearde bringyng againe flocke thou shouldest aske phariseis scribe papistes monkes kyngdome god thei would aunswere beware companie synners doe good woorkes faste saie ordinarie praiers giue almose make satisfactio thy synnes c manne put onely trust shoulder shepherd thei co fesse thei doubt thereof yea thei compte contrary kyngdome god phariseis doe place hitherto hath christe taken part phariseis hypocritesin heauen also place synners thei repente beleue defende sentece moste true synners haue place kyngdome god publican sinner excluded god kyngdome sainctes gouernaunce order kyngdome consisteth mercie nedes must abide losse cast awaie thynges naught gaines christ maie coplete whole phil iii diuers sortes synners although christe came call synners repentaunce yet doe repent thei heare worde earesdiuers kindes sinner thei chauge nothyng old condicions maners thei giue theselues owne sensualitie pleasure declare plainly life doynges thei haue regarde eternall life cometh thereof nothing el although thei christes shoulder yet thei fall againe begin stray perill euer thei vntill length thei without recouering caught deuilles snare thei neuer ridde selues coueteousnes lecherie vngodlie opinionswhat sinner shall haue place kyngdome god sinner belong kingdome god thei onely thei haue heard voyce shepherd doe repente mortifie woorkes fleshe thei perceiue course al thynges thei christe iesu truste shoulder shepherd must walke fleshe rom viii gala v must kill slea concupiscence woorkes fleshe suche synners doeth christe beare againe vnto flocke foloweth also thei flie farre tourneth awaie eares woordes neither done theim goodimpenitent synners whilest thei obstinate thei deliuered fro straiyng lengthe thei shall torne plucte piece wolues wildernesse wherfore comfort gospell sinner ought lightly estemed bicause christ shepherd seketh theim taketh vp straye shepe furdermore doctrine also necessarie knowe duetie shepherd euen heare voyce tourne vnto historie publican synners maie example vnto v thei conuerted woorde christewhat worde god teacheth woorde teacheth nothyng el god mercifull vnto synners saue christes sake thei doe harden heartes voyce shepheard delight longer wanderyng straiyng thei haue heard voyce thei caste selues christes shoulder whiche hath satisfied synnes reconciled god father without great synne seyng god hath purchased deliueraunce dearely despise set naught must greate studious labour worship reuerence worde shewe selues worthie companie sainctesthe woorde god defendeth againste desperation wherefore worde ought greatly studiously regarded may defended strogly armed deuill owne hearte least suche opinion god hateth synners suche sence felyng mennes myndes helpe god woorde bee preferred shepheard doeth proclaime woorde openly worlde intent stray shepe maie heare tourne againe vnto hym wherefore thou dooest knowledge thou art straie shepe synne art banished farre kyngdome god despaire haue respecte woorde christe touchyng shepheard set forthe thy sake suche like thee thou maiest beginne repent thou maiest haue trust god christ walke worthie god kyngdomedeferre thy conuersion god neither thinke thou haste long respite take councell matter whe voyce shepherd commeth vnto thee tourne thy self forthwith vnto hym embrace hym whiche thing thou doe thou art saulfe giuest angelles greate cause ioye whiche verie desirous thy companie kepe defende thee perill cotrariwise vnpenitent tourne angelles mournyng therefore faine bee without helpe defence christe contente one parable putteth vnto secondewe ought example christe seke vp lost synners concernyng woman loste grote doeth intent folowe example vtterly giue vp synners hunt bryng repentaunce first parable belongeth onely christ sauiourthe parable shepehearde belongeth co christ parable woman perteineth congregacion christ whiche onely true shepherde embraceth straye shepe true saluation vestoweth life thei maie deliuered destruction defended againste deuill seconde parable woman perteineth congregacion ministracion office synners might called repentaunce deliuered eternall death damnacion obtaineth euerlastyng saluacion reioyceth also euen doeth shepeherd findeth grote lighteth ca dell euen god woorde swepeth house teacheth rightuousnesse comforte god mercy sake christe iudgement god doctrine commeth loste grote light vertue god wordand true glorious commendacion god woorde whiche onely hath suche vertue taketh waie synne infectio came thereof death damnation deuill helle wee synners enemy god suche aungelles heauen sainctes yearth reioyce wherfore worthely magnifie word highly esteme teacher thereof ende might achiue get greate benefite therby deliuered wanderyng deuilles daunger saued euer thyng moste bountifull louyng shepherde soules ihon x peter ii lorde iesu christ graunte v holy ghost amen pthe iiij sondaie trinitie sondaie gospell luke vi ye mercifull father also mercifull iudge ye shall iudged condene ye shall bee condemned forgeue ye shall forgeuen geue shalbe geuen vnto good measure pressed doune shaken together runnyng ouer shall menne geue bosomes thesame measure mete withal shal men mete againe put forthe similitude vnto blinde leade blinde doe thei bothe fall diche disciple aboue master euery man shalbe perfecte euen master seest thou mote thy brother eye considerest beame thyne owne eye either canst thou saie thy brother brother let pull mote thine eye thou seest beame thine owne eye firste thou hypocrite caste beame thyne owne eye shalt thou se perfectly pull mote thy brother eye exposition gospell christ teacheth disciple vsa newe life required euery true christian one beleue become christian men therby bicause sure deliuered death synne euill christ necessarie liue newe sorte fro henceforthe shewe selues obedient vnto hym newe life doth christ comprise one worde saiyng ye mercifull father mercifull knowe merciewhat mercie truly suche affection whiche conceiueth sorowe verie hearte man seeth neighbour troubled either body soule stirred helpe hym christe requireth suche minde men suche mercie betwene light lende persones suche mercie extendeth farder emongest felowes leudenes tarieth longer thei haue power leudnes experiece declareth thefe mercifull stealeth would robbe man mercifull onely hym stealeth mercie euil doer math v rom xii christian muste mercifull euen heauenly father onely frendes men yea theim hate v offende v semeth vnworthie good benefite great displeasure anger whiche wee declare bitter hatefull woordes ouer come saie shall medle suche knaue sore hurte hym slaunderyng tongue vnknowen helpe truely full magottes could finde heart doe good lesso nature teacheth v touching lende mercie whiche onely hath respecte companion riotfelowes abhorreth v vtterly shewe mercie christ seketh remedie fault requireth v math v doe good enemy theim hurte v suche mercie saieth mete christian father heauen hath without ye sonnes brother whiche haue redemed blood synne deathe doubtlesse ye haue offended heauely father manifolde way haue broken commaundementes poinctes god hath iust cause sinne saiethe exceadyng greate mercie god toward synners giue sone suche vnthriftes yea rather let die thei haue deserued thei sweare selues thei slaunder thei giuen coueteousnes adulterie thei leaue kinde wickednes vndoen let goe leudnesse leudely perishe thei deserue maie god saieth christe laye doeth yea rather iniuries ye doe vnto hym hath mercie vpon doeth good giuing onely bodie life foode familie wife child liuelode also owne sonne life euerlastyng suche mercie also must vse one haue hurt offeded thee respect thou hast offended god often greuously wherefore god mercie greate giueth sonne enemy deliuer death synne hym also giueth thynges beside life bodie soule substaunce yea hath rather occasion take vengeaunce punishe plague put thee exaple thou maiest saie thus although man hath hurte greuously maie seme worthie misfortune hande yet reuenge el mercie christian like like gentile hath doen wrog perchaunce haue otherwise deserued hath nede helpe requit euill euill se hath nede helpe power helpe hym thus dealeth heauenly father c proued true cornemongersit euidently seen full wickednes wrong husbande menne people countrie thei could sell vilest thyng thei haue moste highest price thei would feare doe tounes men citezens also hath corrupt maners thei scrape together substace right wrong thei care thei liue riotuously thei deceiue defraude many euer thei might well moue stomacke doyng deny theim helpe thei aduersitie christian hath precept cotrary whiche remember displeasure doen vnto hym saith thei wicked leudea goodly similitude shall giue vp therefore purpose well doyng yea doe rather maner good tree whiche man plucke beate shake doune fruicte bringeth next yere paine doe haue doen good thee thou shewest thy self vnkinde dooest shrewde turne yet hereby compelled forsake well dooyng thou art thornie bushe canst doe nothing pricke yet become like vnto thee life rather shewe self fruitfull vinegod father sette forthe v exaple bring forth swete grape doeth heauenly father geueth wicked people vnthriftes housholde stuffe liuelode clothyng goodes bodie soule peace seasonable weather thynges necessarie giueth v light sonne whereas rather haue deserued brimstome fire heauen yet haue math v bee made churle vnkindnes sake saith disposed bee naught yet forsake naturall goodnesse giue bothe sonne water heauen good euil example
