christ appointeth v followe also likewise maie mercifull prouoked malice mennes malice maner worlde reuengeth pursueth right maie christian menne doe yea math v rom xii rather thei ought praie foe god make profitable fruictfull plantes whiche wilde thornie baren bush mercifull father heauen mercifull whiche also moste bountefull euen enemy must put caueat place beware wee take doctrine mercie although kynde reuengyngall reuengemente forbidden disanulled hereby diuers persones one christian man christian disciple christ doeth reuenge diuers description office father familie iudges shire magistrate citie erles erledome kynges kyngdome office bee without reuengyng thei theim offende thei punishethe magistrate beareth swerd vaine suche thynges dooen common wealthe commau dement god must thynges performed rom xiii whiche ordained god preseruation commonaltie offender bee punishedfolishe pitie marreth citee breaker order restrained manne would exercise ouerth warte mercie would euidently appere poincte would come foolishe mercie shewed fewe shall tourned vtter vndoing many first thei betrayed vntrue mercie shewed ensueth breakyng discipline rule without whiche worlde consiste safegard wherefore god requireth gouernours ouerseers order accordyng office thei vse straight punishement thei cease doe let theim knowe thei shall giue accompt thereof high magistrate whiche god hymself wherefore commaundement christ consisteth certaine respecte order sonnes god saie christias followe example mercie father whereas god garnisheth v also personesa good lesson ruler maketh v father lordes magistrate iudges prince emperor c must thinke lawe mercie belongeth vnto v performed diligence see office straightly yet must nedes dooen seueritie straightnes hath gouernaunce mercie nothyng doen satisfie owne lust sight therefore doen woorke greate crueltie sharpnes deede maie well bee coumpted acte mercie clemencie ioseph accuseth brother father duetie gene concernyng leude doynges although euill spoke blab emong brethre yet hath regard truthe owne office whereas vnderstandeth al wer houshold yea brother also bounde doe thei hide enormity familie conceall fautes neighbor citezens c hath certaine office seueritieto punishe euill doer great work mercie behoue common wealthe although thei seme sightfull vnmercifulnes yet deede thei woorkers mercie maister father mercifull thei punishe disobediente stubburne magistrate mercifull wicked put execution prince whe thei resist wrongfull violece power armes thei maintain innocent tyrantes mercie chiefest intent al thinges cruell sight doen least thynges lye open deuill make hauoke al men ca holpen sharpe correction yet must bee seen mennes saufegarde wealth brought hasarde leuitie mercie wherefore necessarie sette forthe office nexte precepte mercie leaste vnder pretece vntrue mercie deuill destroye gether yea vnder pretence religion godlines greate subtiltie deuill againste moste necessarie office mercie inuenteth name blab traitour tyraunte termegante spoyler c manne ought feared duetie true mercie let hym dooe rather profitable saftie man deede semeth sight wherefore youth must diligently instructed touchyng office thei maie learne doe good first yeresyouth ought brought vppe knowledge god misteries afterward thei ripenesse age shall attaine waightier office require seueritie thei maie knowe vse alwaies true mercie emongest citezens bothe house kepyng also common office neither let withdrawen tyme guile desimulation true vnderstandyng thinges thei doe muche hurte commonaltie either congregation city family doe suffer good order decaye vntimely mercie thou must therefore take diligent hede ende precept mercie giuen first thou regarde commaundementes god specially made vnto thee shewe thee thy duetie yet ought mingled mercy remember thou take paciently al wro ge withdrawen therby thy well dooyng thou haste euidente example sonne whiche greued adulterer vsurers guided light let take hede whiche doe abuse mercie god giftessynne scapeth vnpunished euer paciece christian thei shall haue good ioyfull ende heapeth vp daie daie wrathe vpon wrathe selues thei escape vnpunished greater shall punishement hereafter example stubburne childre declare thei refuse ruled parentes thei fall handes hangman god suffreth pacience long mocked dalied withall maie retourne purpose appereth precepte christes councell euen earnestly embrace godlinesse doe suche workes emong selues true vnfained wherfore commaundeth v mercifull heathe whiche shewe mercie vnto thei loke helpe one hande washe othermercie bee shewed onely frendes also foe father heauen whiche sheddeth thinges plentuously necessary v sufficient men gather onely good could dispatche one daie also euill god doeth suffer goodnes wither awaie bicause many euill vnkinde yea rather poincte euill better prouided example saieth christ put forthe professe name onely doe good frendes vertue maie bee also gentile also enemy ye se heauenly father grudged man light sonne asmuche theues robber adulterer vsurers whiche worthie looke moste beautifull creature take benefite hym yet thei shutte neither doeth good father suffer goodnes withdrawen housholde leudnes wicked doe saieth likewise suffer pacience taken bee lesse beneficiall mennes faultes worlde wonte craketh thinges full ingratitude churlishenes manne neuer doe little true greate thyng helpe frendeschristes exhortacion christian gentile longer dooe good thei looke like wherof hope farewell good doyng hereof appereth benignitie commeth fountaine charitie groweth drie place sone wither awaie little blast impatience christian must dooe good perfectnes yea owne enemy loking like kindnes requityng thus must ye thinke meane season thei vnkinde yea god hath greate power punishe vnkinde diuers instrumentes water fire stone c wherefore seyng sure thynges shall bee punishedthe loue christias differeth gretly loue gentile purposed kepe accustomable liberalitie mercie christian minde loue whiche gentile whiche good lenger thei mete kynde men doe like lackyng charitie also continueth contrariewise charitie christian men doeth good without ceasyng although many benefites cast awaie vpon vnkinde yet ceaseth well doyng doeth christe procede deuideth mercie diuers partes iudge ye ye shall bee iudged condemne ye shall condemned forgiue shall forgiuen christe would haue v godlie deede crake faithe gospell wordes moste parte doeth boaste selues bee gospeller prate muche christe matter well tried thei dissemblars greate part deceiueth selues perishe hereby hypocrisiethe heauenly father iudgeth v neither ought wee iudge hypocrisie would christe gladly restraine wherefore putteth forthe v straunge vnknowen example father doen profite fele goodnes humanitie shew selues beneficiall high mynded toward daunger god iudgement damnation synnes hath heauenly father doen would iudge condemne thee might forgaue thee thy synnes tooke thee hell damnation receiued thee mercie example put thee applie thy self thereto bee thou likewise vnto art thou true christian whiche beleuest christ neither condemnest thou thy neighbour forgiuest hym gladlie thy hurte thou wilte dooe rather dooe like leude seruaunt math xviii math xviii thou declarest thou canst receiue mercie god shewe life thou art christian man rather god exclude thee mercie appoinct thee iudgemente damnation depriue thee benefites wherewith hath indued thee require debtes remitted forgaue thou nedest doubt commaundement iudge ye ye shall bee iudged ye cease iudgyng god shall iudge also common practise sheweth harde inibitio assone iudge selues hurt forth vse iudgement good vnkinde haue holpen hym often dooeth onely like like dooeth shrode turne good offende helpe vnkinde often vnmercifull mercie painfull helpyng thei iudge bicause thei obtain like appereth gregorius saiyng true true iustice hath doen compassion vntrue double iniquitie man giueth croune thought go make bondman thereby wherfore assone thyng doen saied pleaseth obsequius forth embraideth haue doen thee requitest suche kindnes truely nothyng el serue iudge gentile doe maie recompensation good waie thou doe good acknowledge doeth euill good thou maiest admonishe doe least offende god greatly yet hast thou iust cause hate hym iudge condemne hym giue hym vp iudge thou knowest god doe hym whither amende hym amended god hath officer sufficiet reuenged hym suche thinges chance daily rise sodain tempestes stubburne onely beware thou iudge thinke thus god hath cruelly dealte haue killed long gone synne liued filthy idolatrie hypocrisie likewise also beware thou dooest condemne thy duetie chide tell one faut dehort declare iudge condemne lawfull thou haste doe mercifull thou maiest iudge thou maiest condemne thy neighbour obstinatly set thee hurt cease yet thou oughtest bee willyng forgiue hinder profite goe reuenge rather furder helpe thynges harde doe remember thou art christian perfection required thee thou earnestly embrace name euen example heauenly father plainly declareth v thou dooe good thy neighbour vnkinde doeth requit thee euill doubte god laye charge resigne giue ouer thou vengeaunce vnto thou thy duetie god doth reuenge thynges tyme wherefore commit thou thynges hym deut romo xii execute commaundement thou reuenge mercifull followeth gospell giue shall bee giuen vnto good measure filled vp shaken together yea runnyng ouer shall men giue bosome measure ye meate vnto shall measured vnto againe christ hath comprised preceptes properly laboureth specially cause v fulfill true workes charitie wherefore hath commaunded synners mercifullie gentlely handeled gently handled hym iudge condemne theim committe vnto god praie theim god commaundeth doe good giuyng helpyng counsaillyng c doubt god requite liberalitie bee neuer greate minde maie abounde charitie alwaie neuer bee ouergrowne thornes vnkindenesse cease thereby well doyng gentile doe whiche abstaine iudgyng condemnyng assone thei thinke selues hurt thei forgiue thei humblie asked forgiuenesse thei giue thyng thei loke gaines benefite wherefore thei neuer escape iudgemente god neither thei iudged worthy god benefites mercie grace faute must eschewe doe neighbour heauenly father doeth v slacketh straight iudgement pardoneth v cruell codemne v although vnkinde enioyneth v likewise also wee putteth v dreadfull ende shall loke serued hym serue measure saith shall measure haue measured deny god hath giuen v good measure would haue giuen v desertes might haue plagued v wrathe plague pestilece euill put v death assone borne rehearse manifolde way haue offended hym life sinnes might worthely giuen v measure eue death hell doth god putteth awaie haue deserued saie wrathe indignation iudgement death hell c bryngeth v heauen grace libertie quiete mynde condemnation lawe euill conscience riddeth v al penurie blame giueth v good truely large plentifull measure whereas thou deniest measure thinke like measure shalbe giue thee god thou giuest thou wer fortunate bicause helped thee measure grace shalt thou haue suche measure thy vnkinde craftie behauior deserueth teachyng marueilous whereby appereth god requireth earnestly thy duetie towardes thy neighbour towardes hymself touchyng hymself pardoneth synnehow god measureth v faithe reken soeuer offende hym contrarie vnmercifull neighbour god neither bee pleased v neither forgiue v thyng wherefore rate measuring appointed doen faithe thou haste faithe god dealeth thee thy desert mercifull vnto thee opened thee waie worde promised thee remission sinnes first measure giuen v whe began beleue measure receiued giueth commaundemente measure likewise doeth lette hym looke doen vnto doeth vnto cruell let hym looke mercie god iudge shalbe iudged damned wherfore measuryng hath beginning faithe god requireth greatly thy duetie towardes thy neighbour threatnyng reuoke grace mercifull neighbour wherefore thinketh earnestly serue god let hym doe good neighbour let doe god doeth let iudge let hym condemne forgiue giue gladly let hym shewe hymself beneficiall liberall maie el shall chaunce otherwise chaunced seruaunte math xviii mere mercie shewed vnto hym math xviii lorde let hym goe scotfree forgaue debt would forgiue neighbour hundred penny neither tary tyme vntill able paie whole free quitauce tenne thousande talentes wer forgiuen stoode hym none effect deliuered iailers vntill paieth whole surely possible alwaies folowe rule forget mercie oftentymes whereas mercie requisite wrothfull speake gently cursse psalm iiii ephe iiii although chaunceth thus vnto v infirmitie place dooe contrary christes commaundemente yet let v beware least sinne phariseis continue therein without remorse conscience thei doe might quickly amende let v put v example doe father heauen hath doen v shewe selues forgetfull wronges slacke cease well dooyng iniquitie worlde vnkindnes men forgiuenes synnesconfession faulte necessary vnto forgiuenes synnes necessarie confesseth fault must forgiuen vnpossible forgiue pope enemy god woorde synnes reason thei knowe theim selues synners thei persecute doctrine thei would confesse folie professe repentaunce would deny theim remission synnes must nedes synnes reg xiii thei forgiuen denieth synne defendeth rightuousnes saul samuell mannes synnes forgiuen doctrine christian mannes life whiche christ putteth forthe example father heauen doctrine doeth christ earnestly setforthe similitude moate beame though saie se hard doe owne dammage greueth grief thereof sone taken awaie assone ye se aduersarie remeber wronge anger waxeth rawe againe thynges come stomacke freshethe similitude moate though thei wer dooen wherewith hath hurted v greate desire also reuenge yelde ouer selues saieth christe wrothe indignation although hath diuersly hindered thy profite defaced thy good name yet sonne moate thy eye comparison thou haste dooen god beame respect thynges whiche thy neighbour hath doen v wherefore many thynges requisite hym iudge condemne matter thus teacher muste better learned learner el shall able teache hym nothyng kinde maister canst thou professest thou wilt teach art ignoraunte faultie thy scholar thou takest thee teache ought doen suffered emong men muche lesse suffered kyngdome god blamed wherfore get thee practise parable whe thou hearest seest sufferest thyng greuous vnto thee thou maiest alwaies saie patience synne little comparison myne god hath many obiect haue wherefore gladly winke god winke mine rubbe old sore worlde neuer bee perswaded rebuke moate brother eyethe moate euer beholde beame regarde consider beame owne thou hast one quarell thy neighbour hath god infinite cause thee seyng thou neuer keptest preceptes haste transgressed manifolde way thou forgettest therfore meane season thou fallest hatred thy neighbour little woorde thou canst haue suche quicke sight thy brother little faulte dooest thou ponder thy owne beame also wherfore christia man must vse waie seeth moate brother eye let first retourne vnto begin iudge shall finde suche hugeous beame haue little luste iudge neighboure maie haue god mercifull synnes wherefore first goeth take awaie owne beame doyng findeth muche busines sone forgetteth brother moate remebreth owne disobedience toward god man synnes whiche ridde dooyng daiely first therefore condeneth owne ouerthwart reckenyng wheras letteth scape owne elephante eager neighbour gnat wherefore christes intent put v minde example father heauen whiche suffereth greate beames lye hidde wee paciently abide moate brother eye iudge hym thereforewhy god co cealeth synnes man therefore would bee moued bee mercifull promisse whereas god laiyng side iudgemente damnation would gladlie forgiue v wee would forgiue one iudge maie obtaine grace goodnes profered vnto v escape death hell contrariwise hereby put feare cease iudgyng condemnyng findeth moate brother eye god raise vp beame owne tell bee able moue hym bothe partes either hope well feare ill great stubburnes reproue greatly little thyng neighbour thereby hinder owne waie escapyng damnacion vnspeakeable promesse god stirre vp euerlastyng iudgement god foolishe saucines owne iudgement therefore rather folowe example worlde fleshe heauenly father aboute goeth el get god wrothe steede mercie haue god greuous sore againste hym whereas might haue hym mercifull great perill ought bee thought vppon wee might order life godly menne bothe frendes foe might perceiue v sure token christian men haue suche minde whiche fountaine floweth suche charitie neuer faile decaie whiche thyng father whiche heauen graunte v holy ghost lorde iesu christes sake amen pthe v sondaie trinitie sondaie gospell luke v came passe people preassed vpon hym heare worde god stoode lake genazereth sawe twoo shippes stande lake side fisherman gone theim washyng nettes entered one shippes whiche perteined simon praied would thrust little lande satte doune taught people shippe lefte speakyng saied vnto simon launche deepe lette slippe nettes make draught simon answered saied vnto hym maister wee haue laboured night haue taken nothyng neuerthelesse thy commaundement loose foorthe nette dooen thei inclosed greate multitude fish nettes brake thei beckened felowes whiche wer shippe thei come helpe theim thei came filled bothe shippes thei sonke againe simon peter sawe fell doune iesus knee saiyng lorde goe synfull man astonied hym draught fish whiche thei taken also iames ihon sonnes zebede whiche parteners simon iesus saied vnto simon feare henceforthe thou shalte catche men thei brought shippes lande forsoke folowed hym exposition luke signifieth historie peter reste came apostleshippe miracle fishe holy ministerie gospell well applied appostleshippe takyng many fish christ declareth power gospell worlde wheras shall drawe vp great multitude synners kyngdome deuill god kingdome last christ expoundeth wheras pronounceth peter iames andrewe ihon become fisher men euangelist beginneth historie rehearseth many followed christ heare hym preache intent hauing eye example may come worde god desirously heareth woorde diligently obtaineth twoo thynges thereby whiche otherwise could come bywhat fruite commeth woorde god first knowe hereby god toward v bothe life life whiche without woorde god wee could knowe wee rather conceiue contrary mynde wrathe god toward v punishement worde teacheth v shall heare hereafter god although synners angrie v mercifull might deliuered synne get euerlastyng life one thyng get worde second woorde learne order trade externall ciuill life allowed sanctified worde god true worshippyng god hath nede become monke frier serue god maie waite owne vocation doe owne office diligently whether bee maiestrates office kinde life true pleasyng seruice god shall neuer destitute voide blessyng god doctrine necessarie true information conscience men maie knowe suretie vocation set forthe god woorde thynges whiche thei doe doe maie confirmed god commaundementes certainly suche conscience maie withstande deuill temptacion thinke surelywhatsoeuer dooen faithe pleaseth god hath doen suche thynges yet doeth concerning whiche god hath giuen sure precept thynges otherwise dooen synne displease god paule saieth whatsoeuer faithe synne hath god giuen v woorde plentuously whereby maie trie deedes saiynges gather certaine testimony god worde beleueth rom xiiii embraceth god grace true faith whiche hath bestowed v christe soeuer dooeth either appartainyng commonaltie housholde nature manne pleaseth god wholly persone thynges procede pleaseth god faithe christ sufficient god euery manne comfort hymself worde god hath put forthe sticke vnto faithe serue god ioy mirthe whatsoeuer dooen faithe neuer little pleaseth god moste excellent woorkes doynges god woordebut also necessarie co mon life whereof commeth congregation god euery man maie certaine touchyng doynges degree wherfore also doeth god put forthe sure woorde commaundeth obedience toward parentes wherefore whatsoeuer worke office child seruauntes housholde sanctified worde thei doe thinges familie maie well boaste sure commaundemente god worde officer maisters householdes blessed sanctified thei minister common life wherein god would haue tranquilitie quiet continuaunce congregation touchyng honor god hath put forthe lawes thei might accordyng honour behaue selues office bee sure dooynges lawe thei doen accordyng god woorde commaundement conscience maie established whiche followe god woorde doyng hath worde haue sure ground sticke vnto tossed hither thither euery little blaste like moueable rede wherefore ought highly esteme god worde prophet speaketh old age youth correct waie kepyng god wordes age al kindes office function might haue wherto thei might psal cxix vprightly order life onely trade life hath asure quiete conscience neither turke iewe gentile monke papist obtain greate thyng science belongeth onely good thei maie knowe suretie bothe inwarde iudgemente outward action procede accordyng god woorde wherefore thei set matter without waueryng feare although thei bee perilous thynges belongyng vocation sette forth god commaundement neither haue thei thing wherein thei ought feare vngodlines doctrine ought chiefly taught vnto christian men thei might knowe sette thynges bryng theim passe god worde shall thei soner beware tyme life supersticious wicked perswasions monkes folowed trade thei neuer fallen greate vngodlines preceptes mennes tradition neither doe apostle care thyng propound plaine simple worde god commaundement touchyng iustification god residue life passed ouer godlines thei followe obedience worde put beside saluacion although thei either warfare countrie doyng daungerous charge vocatio chaunce die reason thei serue vocation obeie god knowe suretie thei doe thinges according god commaundement might life bee passed ouer men godlie vertuously thei would onely order tenne commaundementes faithe christ deuill withstandeth withall might least worde god come mynde doinges neither rise goe bedde eate haue care thought god worde maruaill thei thei ware oppreste wicked worlde christian men must haue regard great necessary thyng thei maie sure tymes god kyngdome thei maie haue god worde testimonie whiche sanctifieth thynges al matter thinges doen alwaies greate glorious moste part common bothe ethenike christiansa difference betwene woorkes christian infideles greate difference onely christian hath god worde leader wherby workes sactified god example paule saieth seruauntes obey bodily maisters feare trembling singlenes heart againe child obeye parentes lorde worde faithe sanctifieth woorkes thei maie pleasaunte vnto god whereas emongest vnfaithfull thei bee acceptable lacke worde faithe ephe vi nothyng holy yearth besides god name faithe thynges sanctified sanctified onely name worde god surely worde fifte commaundement mannes life exod xx bothe gouernement commonaltie also houshold blessed faithe lacketh thou doest euery thyng obediently name god lette sufficient admonishe maye vnderstande example christe put forthe intent many folow christe prouoked stirred studiously diligently heare worde god whereas setforthe onely psal cxix thei maie bee confounded thei looke commaundementes muste needes abide confusion bicause thei haue light god worde doynges therfore intended beginning let v come historie wherof twoo partes firste doctrine touchyng corporall life god also prouide necessity bodie spirituall life leaue v destitute hope synnes sake bee mercifull vnto v recouer v destruction bothe doctrine necessary profitable worthy learned diligence godly comfort corporall life resteth herein christ commaundeth peter caste nettes peter obeieth taketh great scull fish good steward man could make hym ouersear businesse nothyng could lacke present euangeliste declareth sufficiently christ doe al men theim onely night laboured vaine afterwarde heard god woorde helpe righteous poore felt nede christian life hath many trouble temptacions thei tempted yet sticke constantly vocation worde christ ready helpe one comfort put forthe v place wee maie retaine faithe although pouertie lacke thynges necessarie yet despaire vnpaciently murmure stande good hope blessyng shall long cease chaunceth likewise peter fellowes spende whole night vaine take nothyng afterwarde commeth christ first putteth worde maketh christian commaundeth launche forthe caste nettes draufte peter obeieth hath purpose doe owne matter also god giueth v beginnyng thynges plenteously giue v sone christianed receiued catholike churche would thinke came hymchriste helpeth v pouertie commeth wherefore sendeth v pouertie tyme ignoraunt trouble one almoste faine despaire lackyng thynges tell doe whiche way take also perill famished case mercifull steward christe bee hande saie sette thy heart reste knowe lose forthe thy net cease labour looke blessyng although thei nedie yet must thei despaire deny christ murmure god trust god time sende thinges necessarie suffer ouercome doyng labour vocacion christ giueth peter fishe wisewe muste cease fro hope labour thei leape boate muste launche forthe shippe prepare nettes dooe thynges fisher wont doe although became christian first muste commit successe thereof god hande must also walke euery mannes vocation thou labour maintenaunce housholde art officer aucthoritie apply thy vocation diligently thy religion thou maiest doyng doe acceptable god peter v charge rare caste god nourishe thee finde thee thinges necessary despaire bicause thou must striue nede pouertie remaineth time inough wherin thou canst tell thyng blessyng shall chaunce thou seest remember onely thou must kepe constauncie continuaunce least thou ouerthrowen impacience content doe casteth awaie nettes assone looseth purpose forsaketh vocation fall kinde life marueill man hath good prosperous chaunce life first doctrine discoraged vexed pouertie necessitie fele god blessyng nede muste require god fulfill desire whe bee thou lothe take labour vaine paciente thou muste refuse lose nightes labour thou maiest thereby hope heauely father helpe thee tyme blessyng accordyng common saiyng dat deus omne bonum sed non per cornu taurum labour pacience requisitegod giueth good thinges yet giueth bull horne thou maieste looke god blessyng thou forget first poincte lende thy shippe christe peter sittyng therein maie teache heare worde diligently learne exactly specially bee marked peter examplepeter obeyeth ye word suffereth nothyng hinder hym casteth hym frowardnes vnbeleuers goeth wholly god worde maie well vnderstande greatly peter feared god common practise woorkes vsed also god draught wheras pointeth matter first doen triflyng sort commonly waie fishyng looke greate praie water middaie night fitte gain fisher wont fishe main nigh bankes christ regardeth common trade fisher commaundeth peter launche forthe depth whereas thei taken nothyng night place biddeth middaie lose nettes draught semeth absurde foolishe thyng peter seeth christ knewe arte fisher well yet answereth manerly lorde saieth haue laboured nighte haue taken nothyng wee followe preceptes occupacio haue great hope praie yet proue thy woorde helpe loste laboure peter would haue shewed reuerence towarde christ might haue spoke vnto roughly bicause ignorauce wisereason doth alwaies correcte god woorde presumeth man taketh hym teache fisher crafte whereof ignoraunte put ower mannes bote one thyng bee teacher fisher christe teacheth ought bee heard teacheth fishe heare hym thus would perchaunce answere christe alwaies wont doe bee wiser christ peter wiser laieth aside suche thoughtes thinketh thus soeuer craft despise woorde embraseth hearte letteth passe bothe science reason suche like marueilous touchyng faithe peter whiche could folowe christes commaundement laye side owne thoughtes sticke surely woorde euident common experience men well pleased whe commaundementes doen although come little successe thereby contrariwise thei greued maister commaundeth seruaunte obeyeth thinke owne way better owne matter ca abide suche menne yet wee shewe selues suche alwaies toward god settyng muche owne reason obeye god worde vntolerable arrogance thisgod requireth obediece worde god controlled worde abide seruaunt stande proudlie maisters commau dement thinke owne reason better wherfore god iudgeth specially worshipped shewe selues suche toward hym worde peter although otherwise entised yet let v bridle selues maie preferre worde god al reason holdeth worde sort pleaseth god angelles congregacion could obtaine could encombred sedicion would sectes heretikes congregacions perfectly agree touching doctrine sound faithe thei perswaded hereto bicause euery man trieth opinion religion measure reason mannes wisedome commeth passe thynges full errours discordewe muste despaire succede true ca without teptacion chaunceth v peter labour night take profite thereby take vnpaciently goe lay aside depart ought ouercome temptacion sticke vocation stedfastly caste care lorde haue knowen often tymes experience obedient child familie hath misfortune contrariwise disobedient stubburne good fortune laste hard case good commended wicked euill ende wherefore chaunce likewise thee thinges goe well constaunt strengthen thy self thou ouercome temptacion better misfortune obedience good fortune wickednesse reason god laste casteth awaie disobediente prosperitie bee neuer greate exalteth huble meke great renoume example peterthe example peter studiously bee followed hath respecte onely worde followeth nothing moued thoughtes whiche surely would greatly haue troubled v doubtles thei minde also commaunded aswell peter labour serue vocation taketh holde vocation suffereth self withdrawen purpose although doeth slowly prosper blessyng log comming yet must doubt prosperous ende god otherwise length haue respecte obedience although differreth tyme proueth v whether regarde commaundement wherefor manne ought weary hath laboured night without profite peter gone draught night would haue imputed cunnyng labour neither would haue thought thyng el requisite suche successe whereas fisheth nighte taketh nothyng christ first ministreth woorde biddyng hym assaie againe hath peter sure triall good successe came fishyng labour god worde blessyng lette suffice concernyng firste doctrine whiche corporall pertaineth bodily liuelode christe present laboure blessyng suffer perishe hunger second doctrine spirituall thus doth followe historie peter astonied draught fishe cometh knowledge christe onely man whereas acknowledgeth hymself synner falleth doune christes feete saiyng departe lorde synner spirituall matter fewe vnderstande semeth hereby peter certaine religion desired reuerence departe christe meanyng consciece casemarke well god commeth grace promiseth remission synne life euerlastyng frely christes sake grace large thinges seme greate v neither dare approch nigh thereto greatnesse thereof easie beleue god good mercifull imbraceth v greate mercie heart made beleue men thinke wer pure rightuous marie virgin sainct peter sainct paule would couple self also grace sinner worthie grace rather wrothe commeth deuill inlargeth sinne muche thy heart thou maiest see nothing thy vnworthinesse thou canst wonder amased greatnes exceding grace spirituall temptacion whereof prophane rude wee bee almoste haue perceueraunce vnderstanding learned experience onely otherwise wherefore greatest sort liueth wise thei thinke muche either sinne grace god true christian men doe alwaies tremble feare muche god doth owne behalf saie thei lorde god thou bryngest thus farre worthie greate mercie god herevnto belogeth christ comforteth peter without feare bicause goeth iudge peter synnes deliuer hym sinne sette hym suche office maie bryng also grace comforte maie bee applied wee chaunce haue suche thoughtes put like feare encourage v resiste theim giue place vnto themchriste hath mercie synners christe came driue synners hym came yearth sake wherfore comforteth peter suche thoughtes biddeth hym feare saieth also place feare little flocke math ix luke xii father giue kyngdome place christe talketh also suche thinke canste thou come heauen eternall life canst thou obtaine fellowshippe angelles thou holier cause thou shouldest despaire thou art thy hope vaine christe answereth otherwise feare saieth dooe hath pleased father giue kyngdome owne free whereas vnworthie beyng synnersgod giueth vnworthie mercie mercifull giue grace mercie wherefore feare receiue ioyfully gladde hearte god would giue v vntill wee worthie wee neither haue meate drinke haue respect worthinesse merites nede owne goodnes mercy cause giueth v onely thynges requisite bodie also euerlasting life suche temptacion peter also encombred perceiueth greate goodnes christe casteth mynde howe vnworthie thereof therefore beginneth despaire place saieth thee v couple thy self rightuous synner christ comforteth hym sheweth hymself farre vnlike peter thought commaundyng hym bee good chere take heart grace matter concernyng fishe little comparison make hym fisher men thou art fisher giue thee office enter water take fishe men heauen maie haue store suche fish saued thy shippe full fishe finde thee nette draught gospell shalt thou take elect thei maie bee baptized beleue haue euerlastyng life one place worlde thou maiest tourne faithe one place citie whole people spirituall comforte whiche god putteth forthe disciple onely satisfie hunger gouerne spirituall administration sende worlde kynges prince gospell although deuill withstandeth fisher might yet vertue fishyng restrained worde breaketh thorowe getteth many christian enuieth deuill neuer muche gospell baptismea nette spiritual fish lordes supper instrumentes matter whereby waie euerlastyng life opened vnto v greate thyng appoincted euerlasting life thing hard beleued consider contrary part great thing burne hell fire might escape punishement god giueth vnto v worde sacramentes whiche nettes prepared draught suche fishe wherefore christ comforteth saieth feare consider whether ye hee worthie father ye perishe synnes haue deserued wherfore cleaue onely come baptisme vse lordes supper shewe selues obedient gospell shall perill haue intreated twoo doctrine example god woorde might greatly studied first although pouertie lost labour tyme yet god helpe v length blessyng seconde helpeth v sinne maie damned cause giueth v worde maie certified selues bee soonnes god whiche thyng heauenly father graunt v iesus christe sonne lorde amen pthe vj sondaie trinitie sondaie gospell matth v iesus saied vnto disciple expcepte righteousnes exceade righteousnes scribe phariseis ye enter kyngdome heauen ye haue heard saied vnto old tyme thou shalte kill whosoeuer killeth shall bee daunger iudgemente saie vnto whosoeuer angrie brother vnaduisedly shall bee daunger iudgemente whosoeuer saie vnto brother racha shalbe daunger counsaile whosoeuer saieth thou foole shalbe daunger hell fire therefore thou offerest thy gift aulter remembrest thy brother hath ought againste thee leaue thyne offeryng aulter go thy waie first reconciled thy brother come offer thy gifte agree thyne aduersarie quickely thou art waie hym least tyme aduersarie deliuer thee iudge iudge deliuer thee minister thou caste prison uerely saie vnto thee thou shalte come thence till thou haue paied vttermoste farthyng exposition gospell vnderstande christes counsaill purpose teache christian thei beleue baptised hath obtained glorious name christian besides diuerse good thynges spirituall giftes order life soberly righteously godly whiche procede truetrue godlinesse hypocriticall trade neither shewe vnto v fained grace whiche semeth grace sight euen synnes fained deadly felenous grace counterfeited forged true sincere deede wherefore must also endeuour selues doe fained woorkes towarde neighbour true hartie euen god wrought woorke saluation verie deede cause christe taketh hym gospell expounde first precept putteth forthe v example beware saiyng except rightuousnesse exceade rightuousnesse phariseis scribe ye enter kyngdome heauen sentence shorte must haue rightuousnesse pharisie aspireth kyngdome god rightuousnes phariseis blamed thei liued honest sober life refrainyng selues sinne c god requireth v commaundemente thou shalte kill thou shalt commit adulterie thou shalte beare false witnesse obeieth thereto dooeth well blamed phariseis thei thought theim selues rightuous woorkes thei fautlesse lawe requireth though thei whollie accomplished least haue suche opinion christ warneth v place although doe woorkes lawe liue blamelesse sight yet arrogant thinke ourselues iuste god therefore perfecte obedience christ saieth although manne hath killed hande yet maie murtherer breaker lawe god reason god hath forbidden anger heart euery wrathfull worde angrie signes face commaundement rightuousnes phariseisso phariseis rightuousnes signifieth outward rightuousnes kill commit adultrie thinke rightuousnes holinesse consisteth therein lawe hath nothyng v haue fulfilled haue neede god mercie although heart inwardly full suche sinne concupiscence rightuousnes saith christ place heauen rather helle woorkes fulfill lawe heart requisite thereto whiche pure voide ire hatered enuie lecherie concupiscence doe muche sure rightuousnes long sinne concupiscece mortified slaughter hath stil motion although thei procede effect worke yet beware thou think thy self rightuous heauen ye haue neede rightuousnes saieth christe ye enter kyngdome heauen rightuousnes phariseis scribe greater perfecte iusticewhat greatest rightuousnesse truely woorke heart rightuous fulfill woorde god onely hande doeth kill heart also without ire desire reuengyng thou onely adulterer worke thy hearte also pure without luste thereof likewise preceptes lawe requireth onely dooe woorkes heart also pure agreable poinctes god worde lawe thou wilt saie maie suche hearte founde uerely neither neither thou haue store se sone fall wrothe sone also sensualitie riseth heartes yea otherwise wee thought willed yea purposed contrary hate selues therefore must dooen haue suche perfect rightuousnes cleane heart yet heare sentencethe rightuousnes required phariseis rightuousnes hath place heauen truely must doe must followe scribe phariseis thinke selues rightuous woorkes rightuousnes soeuer dooe muste shewe suche submission humblenesse god wee maie saie lorde synner thou mercifull vnto enter iudgement thy seruaunt touchyng workes deale accordyng thy mercie grace whiche thou haste promised performed v christ doctrine tendeth ende specially spirituall pride maie therby restrained wee meanes come vnto knowledge filthy hearte moste corrupt nature laste brought hope god grace fauour mercie rightuousnesse obtaineth inheritaunce kyngdome heauen whiche hath foundation workes although thei ought good godly remission synne grace god although preuaile som labour offende bodie leudnes studie muche wee accomplishe god yet greatest fault remaineth still wheras hearte vnpure full sensualitie wickednes psal xxxii rom iiii obtaineth remission sinnes rightuous owne power grace forasmuche synnes forgiuen hym father sake christ wherefore peter actes apostle saieth heartes purified faithe actes xv purifiyng suche wise though euill thoughtes vncleane concupiscence felt heartes neuer come passe bodie synne bee laied grounde passage made vnto euerlastyng life shall hearte cleane deede pure owne nature long life endurethwherein christian purenesse consisteth purenesse faithe woorde god christes sake impute sinnes v punishe v rather remit pardon forgiue neuerthelesse must followe therof afterward help holy ghost begin leade pure holy godly life shewe god due obedience saied vnperfect obedience therefore whole rightuousnes god consisteth onely remission synnes true meanyng wordes math v christ saieth excepte rightuousnesse excede rightuousnes scribe phariseis ye enter kyngdome heauen wordes vnderstand though phariseis dooe naught nature pharisie gospell luke boasteth vnrightuous luke xviii robber adulterer againe fasteth twise weeke paieth tithe possesseth thinges euill would wish men wer suche euen vnto liues ende maiestrates iudges parentes suche like haue lesse businesse herein fault outward rightuousnes sake pharisie boasteth rightuous god errour phariseis neither thought neede god mercie remission synne obtainment true perfect rightuousnes christ resisteth leude persuasion wee trust suche rightuousnes god make inquisition better determine haue hope heauenly inheritaunce putteth forthe vnto v sixt commaundement example wee maie learne rightuousnes phariseis beware exposition sixt co maundementthe sixt commaundement ye knowe thou shalt kill phariseis persuaded selues thei onely abstain grosse murder thei neded care thei fulfilled commaundemente againe nothyng el required behalfe christe requireth greater thynges woordes commaundement thy handes shall kill thou shalt kille saie thy hearte thy mouthe thy tongue power thy sens soeuer thy bodie besides whereby murder committed thou shalt auoyde thou doe onely eschewe grosse murder thinges hearte minde woorde gesture countenaunce c whiche manne would saie waie preparatio vnto murder saiyng thou shalt killwhat kille christ doeth nakedly expounde signifie slaughter onely whereby mennes body slaine depriued life soeuer doen besides wherby murder ensueth thou hatest man wilte condition helpe hym luke xvi art affected toward riche glotto toward poore lazarus suche thy faulte might perishe art thou precept giltie murder ambrose saieth thou hast fedde thou haste slaine committed murder ihon iii ihon saieth hateth brother murderer ye knowe murderer hath euerlastyng life dwellyng hym therefore purposeth kepe commaundement must onely refraine handes harte also muste voide wrathefower maner way sixte commaundement transgressed broke neither shewe churlishe countenaunce giue cruell woorde haue deserued euill tourne hande yea mennes iudgement christ saieth plainly commaundement transgressed broken fiue maner way firste hearte1 hearte moued anger displeasure thy neighbour secondly2 gesture hearte betraieth self outwardly sheweth externall gesture angrie deede passe man tourne awaie face theim salute v one giue answere muche louyng looke worde racha pertaineth specially racha disdainfull angrie mocion anger iudged eye countenauce croked worde thirdly wrathe procedeth heart3 mouthe mouthe raile vpon man obscure good name slauderous wordes fourthly whiche moste grosse wicked4 hande thynges come together wrathfull hearte angrie mocion leude tongue fearce hande c violence doen slaughter committed least doe plainly declared math v albeit emong thynges greuous christe hym self declareth diuersities punishementes yet well little synnes greate commaundement offendeth againste leaste murderer god call thy self rekenyng proue whither thou hast doen comaundemet sincerely perfectly thy life tyme yet canst doe required thee thou shalte easely finde neither haste thou doen neither possible thee tyme doe must doen knowe punishmet appoincted transgressours worde cursed saieth moises euery one abideth thynges deut gala written booke lawewhat doen concernyng fulfillyng sixt commau demente maie doe theim dooe christe biddeth place scribe pharisie thinke thy self rightuous thou haste dooen murder thy hande looke rather thy hearte thy mouthe mocions thou perceiuest thou art enuironed besieged compassed round ire wrathe straight way tourne thy self god saie lorde synner haue offended thy sixt precept haue giuen place wrathe haue vsed angrie token woordes neighbour forgiue great sin enstruct trespasse thee one thyng thou oughtest doe whiche phariseis must thou adde also thou temperate thy self meanes suffer wrathe rule thee although thou canst vtterly expell put thy hearte yet confesse thou thy synne aske forgiuenesse thereof euer stoutely fight residue thy ire gette vnder daunger mebers countenaunce mouthe tongue handes eye c meanes laste thou maiest represse thy wrathe subdue thou maiest onely angrie thy neighbour also shew vnto hym gentlenes whiche thyng thou shalte finde thy neighbour hand meanes shalt thou little little driue al wrathe thy hearte make vanishe awaie smoke phariseisthe pharisaicall rightuousnesse thei wrathe hearte malicious signes countenauce railyng wordes mouthe yet tooke thei thynges synne propertie vice shewe outwardly doth nothyng without iuste cause saie thei shal suffer vnworthely prouoked shuld sufferaunce giue occasion doe worsse maie giue place wicked thei maie thereby waxe licentious thei wrathfull nature enkendled sette fire thei perswaded cause iuste vntill deuilles helpe flame increaseth muche wrathe must nedes ended violence therefore christe admonisheth v bee prouoked vnto euill opinios scribe phariseis required christian menthe christia righteousnes either thei doe good el confesse synne desire god forgiue theim create theim newe heartes sort exerciseth hymself preceptes god thought shall haue tymes sufficiente causeconfession synnes god necessarie confesse synnes desire forgiuenesse exercise faith applie hym self studie woorde bothe night daie confession necessarie either wrathe cocupiscence hath oppressed v wee deny excuse must nedes confesse god haue synnedpraier also muste wee praie vnto god forgiue v giue v grace henceforthe better doe praier must faithe also bee ioynedfaithe meanes doubte god forgiue v bothe synne christes sake papistes interprete lawe rightthis true practise lawe neither must thou seke woorkes rite worshippe god pope complices dooe whiche whollie giuen rightuousnesse phariseis saiyng touchyng precept testifieth necessarie saie thei put aside rancor signes rancor thou art hurte beware thou angrie therfore speakyng vnto fliyng co panie maketh matter synne therfore thei coumpted commaundementes vile doctrine whiche prophane persones ha dle selues thei haue founde workes worshippynges god excellencie greater price thei thinke would kepe well tenne commaundementes haue declared sixt haue enough muche doe farre needed deuise seruices worshippynges god christe maketh doctrine matter greate necessitie willeth christian wee continually excercise selues suche woorkes sentence graue waightie greate importaunce whe saith first math v excepte rightuousnes excede rightuousnesse scribe phariseis ye enter kingdome heaue likewise doeth earnestly ende conclude deuideth partes dissention wrathe twoo partes one whiche hath hurted doen vniustly whiche hurtin dissention two party suffered wrong concernyng whiche cause anger hath hurte christe teacheth hym good lessonwhat partie ought doe hath doen hurte commaundeth hym diligently take heede ye meddle god thyng belongeth vnto god till agreed aduersary saith thou offerest thy gift alter doest remember thy brother hath thing thee leaue thy gifte altare go thy waie first recociled thy brother come offer thy gifte thou dooe thyne oblation shalbe vaine neither shall please god euer thou offerest woordes christ tareth reproueth thoughtes fansies phariseis imagined thei bleare eye god perceiue see enuie hatred hearte neighbour thei bee coumpted rightuous men christ saieth thus gene iiii thou deceiuest thy self god firste beholde hearte affected towarde neighbour spie enuie hatred heart thinke thy oblacions leuii xix math xxii marke xii luke xx rom xiii giftes sacrifice please god god gaue thee commaundement thou shalte loue thy neighbour thy self requireth first thee obedience commaundement whiche excepte thou doest shewe vtterly reiecteth thee thou doest leude maner thou shouldest offer oxe vnto god slea thy brother wer offer vp halfpenie steale awaie infinite talentes thus becometh thee doe thou wilt worshippe god right firste prouide hatred thy hearte thy neighbour otherwise thou canst meanes please god euer thou dooest hereof cometh passe many displeasure borne neighbour abstaine sacrament meanes giue selues prayer peticion maketh aferde thei saie math vi forgiue v trespass forgiue trespasse againste v thei feare thei forgiue thei giue sentence selues desire god also maye forgiue true eccle n ither ought thei thinke otherwise thou wilte forgiue neither god forgiue thee therefore consider well daungerous state thou standest whe thou receiuest anger thy heart thy neighbour wilt meanes put awaie fro thee neither shall profite thee thing al thou praiest receiuest sacrament yea thou art muche worse thou wilt praie thy self thou maiest come vnto suche godly praiers god findeth thee iudge thee therefore best counsaill euen hande bee one god follow counsail reconciled thy neighbour caste awaie anger wrathe displeasure otherwise thou hearest thou maiest medle god againe euer thou dooest vnto hym regardeth consideration wherof christ saieth leaue thy gifte altare shall profite thee nothyng math v one parte whiche giueth thee cause anger partie bounde onely humble god confesse hath doen euillnote well also ought mekely come vnto neighbour desire hym forgiue hym synne euen would bee forgiuen god christes sake partie hurtewhat ye partie ought doe hurte whiche thinketh hath iuste cause bee angrie christ also chargeth partie redy vnto reconciliation meanes shewe hymself harde vntoward matter great ieopardy saieth christ thou differ thy good thy aduersarie commit cause iudgethe iudge god god heauen saie maner lorde haue doen ought dooe thou forgiuest menne forgiue therfore commit whole matter thee bee dooen sentence shalte thou receiue thinkest thouthe sergeaunte angell prison helle uerely euen forasmuche thou wilt forgiue shall deliuer thee sergeaunt thou shalt cast prison whiche thou shalt goe till thou haste paied vttermoste farthyng luke vi saie thou shalte neuer forgiuen christ saith loke measure ye meate shall bee mette againe therefore doeth christ require bothe partes thei suffer selues intreated giue ouer displeasure co content one reconciled frely euen verie heart one forgiue euer maie bee betwene theim heartie good cotinuall amitie otherwise haue sixt commaundement v whiche accuseth v proueth v murderer god shalbe sure escape vnpunished doctrine kinde life muste christian maintain emong diligently exercise selues otherwise run daunger god superiours maie lawfully punishe endours without ende procure vnto selues damnacion onely body also soule christ threateneth notwithstandyng men priuate persones publique officer iudges sheriffes conestables c goeth matter otherwise rom xiii peter ii ciuill maiestrate temporall ruler hath commaundemente angrie punishe malefactours iniurious wicked doynges parentes likewise haue peculiare commau dement concernyng childre familie thei wincke lasciuious wanton behauiour child vngracious leudnes familie reproue according desert punishe god commaundeth thus doe thei doe thei obeye god neither dooe thei satisfie office commaundement god suffered thefe saie iudge punishe writte sixt commaundemente thou shalte kill thus maie saie priuate persones office maiestrate hath commaundement vse swearde punishe euill doer neither tollerable maide seruaunt whe negligence hath suffered thinges go wracke spoiled house saie maistresse maie bee angrie beyng christian woman forbidden sixt commaundement christe deede forbiddeth manne angrie neighbour saieth euer doeth guiltie iudgemente power persone bicause comaundement god maie reioyce yea punishe negligence vntowardnesse familie psalm iiii ephe iiii accordyng merites anger againste christianitie againste god worde father maister housholde directly againste christian profession thei regarde vocation neglecte domesticall discipline suffer familie liue owne lustes without good godly order kyngdo christe worldewe must therefore diligently consider discipline kyngdome christ place anger gentlenes loue verie hearte maie bee quiete without bitternesse towarde men neither mouthe hande offende hurte manne kyngdome worlde matter policie thynges housholde neither hande mouthe restrained maie lawfully vse instrumentes reuenge accordyng euery mannes vocation office aucthoritie place lenitie mercie vengeaunce behalfe would neglecte vengeance giue occasion god high iudge punishe sinnes offence men matter worse case god punisheth punisheth greuously men doe doctrine gospell presente sondaie lorde god helpe v holy spirite giue v grace sonne iesus christes sake worlde maye liue godly rightuous sober life titus ii euery manne accordyng vocation office worlde come enioye fruicion presence sight moste blessed glorious trinitie god father god sonne god holy ghoste three distincte persones one true immortall euerlastyng god power glory honor bothe euer amen pthe vij sondaie trinitie sondaie gospell matth viii day verie great companie nothyng eate iesus called disciple vnto hym saied vnto theim haue compassion people thei haue three dayes haue nothyng eate sende theim awaie fastyng owne house thei shall fainte waie diuers theim came farre disciple answered hym manne haue breade wildernesse satisfie asked many loaues haue ye thei saied seuen commaunded people sitte doune grounde tooke seuen loaues giuen thankes brake gaue disciple sette theim thei sette people thei fewe small fish blessed commaunded also sette thei eate suffised thei tooke vp broken meate lefte seuen baskettes full thei eate aboue fower thousande sent awaie exposition miracle christe twise midde lent sondaie like historie sette forthe fiue barlie loaues twoo fish fed fiue thousande menne besides woman child yet remained many fragmentes filled twelue baskettes full gospell ye heare seuen loaues fewe little fish fedde fower thousande lefte many fragmenteswhy gospell redde church tyme yere filled seuen baskettes appereth suche appoincted gospell bee redde consideracion tyme seyng miracle set foorthe fruitfull tyme yere men maie learne vnderstande thynges whiche wee receiue take grounde come vnto v blessyng god god euen presente daie worketh v miracle whiche tyme wroughte wildernes saiyng fewe nourishmentes slender prouision able also blessyng minister foode many yea thousandes thousandes people daily doeth although many time tempestes fruictes yearth haue good successe yet wee knowe chief help comfort consisteth blessyng god abundance foode blessing god feedeth suche naturall frowardnes vnfaithfull worlde seeth present store victuallthe incredulitie worlde yea also enough straight way beginneth despaire though hand perishe honger thei haue great plentie victuall corne wine c thei vtter none thei bee able make moste sell dearely possible leude personesthe coueteousnes wicked worldlynges reproued suche knowe nothing god blessyng neither doe thei beleue el thei would behaue selues thei might haue christ thei neuer doubt blessyng bothe able also would make little store great abundance sende plentie thynges miracle teacheth vswhat miracle teacheth cause doubte good christe prouide abu dauntly bothe soule bodie soule spirite worde faithe bodie meate drinke clothe lodgyng c although sometyme suffereth suche beleue vexed greued penurie scarsenesse pouertie contept thei greatly hated world neither doeth worlde thinke worthy feddechristes blessyng pertaineth regarde worde liue yearth yet thei doubte christ euen greatest tyme penurie thynges bee moste scarse deare plentifully prouide theim thinges necessary present life notwithstandyng christe ministereth blessyng accordyng rule whiche prescribeth gospell matthew seke ye first saieth math vi kingdome god rightuousnes thereof al thynges shall caste vnto eua geliste declareth people taried christ three day cause long abode christ easie conceiue uerely heare worde god mouthe cause afterward carefully moued make prouision coumpteth office see thei lacke nothyng leaste thei perishe honger bee speciall doctrine v first haue singuler regarde woorde god practise life conuersacion afterward touching thinges apperteining vnto liuing caste care vpon christ hath taken vpon hym make prouisio v meanes suffer v perishe honger stone shall soner made bread thei seke kyngdome god rightuousnesse thereof psalm shall lacke good thyng psalmographe saieth feare lorde ye sainctes thei feare hym lacke nothyng lion doe lacke suffer honger thei seke lorde shall want maner thyng good psalm haue yong old yet sawe neuer rightuous forsaken seede beggyng breade rightuous euer mercifull lendeth yet haue child god blessyng inough math vi saieth blessed marke sixt chapiter gospell muche people came flockyngly together diuers city tounes village vnto christe sone behelde inwardly moued mercie towarde thei shepe without shepherd began teache many thyngesthe greate miserie lacke god worde foode soule first chifeste miserie whiche christe good doctour teacher considereth people scattered shepe euen also vnder kyngdome pope one called vppon barbara vpon catherine third vpo george doctour teacher sette forthe true doctrine inuocacion thynges ouerwhelmed idolatry errours supersticions c appereth sainct marke people iewes greate miserie blindnesse forasmuche thei shepe without shepeherd wer priestes leuites office teache people commyng christ gracious mercifull kyngdome thei thei became shepheardes rauenyng wolffes worde god thei taught thei sette forthe people owne dreames vnto greate daunger perill miserable shepe chaunced also vnto v papacie vnder pope man knewe god would bee mercifull vnto v christes sake forgiue v synnes doctrine reco ciliacion christe vtterly vnknowen although owne woorkes necessarily required vnto saluacio onely waie vnto eternall life first principall calamitie miserie christ noteth people therefore moued feruet compassion toward preacheth vnto long sermon though saie priestespriestes giuen priuat lucre consider cure greate multitude people thei would gladly learne true religion god manne teache papistes thei occupied aboute owne profite sacrifice therefore marke saieth thei shepe without shephearda shepe shepheard extreme miserie shepe without shepherd reason shepe beeyng weake vndefensed beaste ieopardie wolfe noysome beast without shepherd dogges folde dau ger euen v looke worde god taughte doctrine gospell preached hath wolffe saie deuill full power ouer people pro xxix salomon saieth preachyng god woorde faileth people perishe goe hauocke haue inough doe kepe v fre satan assaultes euen also moste earnestly either hearewhere word god taught people sone seduced rede teache gospell giue selues moste feruently prayer yea true teacher shepherdes soulles present thought whiche lacke thynges suche maie easely persuaded one become monke frier third chanon c one call vpon sainct vpon one trust vnto good woorke vnto bee brought manifolde errours heresy laste become praie wolfe psalm eye lorde iesu christ must nede bee shinyng bright eccle xv hebr iiii seyng thei pearse breastes menne moued greate feruent affection toward theim bicause thei daungerously walke straye abrode shepe without shepherd consideration wherof although christe reste quietnes sake sainct marke saieth went deserte marke vi yet beyng wer waken stirred vp miserie dispersed people firste hath consideration spirituall famine honger thei hauechriste firste regardeth soule afterwarde bodie therefore falleth hand teache euen gospell euangelist sheweth people continued christe three day thei without doubt feruent studie heartie desire thei heare sermos christ oh infinite treasure giuen sermon thei might euangelistes minde onely describe set forth worke miracle first part christ aboue thynges carefull soulles miserable dispersed people math ix luke x therefore praiyng vnto father sende workemen haruest yea embraceth selie simple soulles teacheth theimthe louyng affection christe towarde people seeyng sheweth suche heartie affection towarde people countenaunce thinke ye beholde last daie negligent shepheardes whiche regarde office occasion people fall errours looke vpon prince rulars whiche compell subiectes vnto idolatrie suffer true woordethe punishment haue brought people vnto ye true knowledge christ sincere doctrine god bee taught vnto shall bishoppes saie whiche boaste bragge muche title honour holinesse grace c crake office vttermoste god hath appoincted theim bishoppes ouerseers mennes soulles yet thei doe nothing el euen set purpose kepe people still idolatrie neither suffer thei one aspire come forward vnto true knowledge god vnto true worshippyng greuously punishe torment thei consente idolatrie walke tradicions men againe shall parentes saie whiche labour vttermoste power bryng vp child familie true doctrine christ either priuate teachyng home el publiquely set soorthe congregacion god without doubt shal saiyng god ye father housholdes ye kynges prince ye bishoppes spirituall shepherdes many soulles wer committed se thei bee brought vp true knowledge woorde thei worship haue commaunded holy lawe haue ye dooen ye haue suffered theim liue kinde wicked ignoraunce defiled maner idolatrie walke tradicions menne according worde require reuenged whiche wer parentes gouernours prince ruler bishoppes ouersears yet haue ye dooen diligence youre seruauntes childrenwhy prince set aucthoritie subiectes parisheners bee truely godly instructed broughte vp parentes prince c onely sette aucthoritie body sake necessitie temporall life also thei helper prophete saieth esai xlix lx nurse congregacion god family subiectes maie brought vnto true knowledge worde feare god become rightuous godly conuersacion laste obtaine euerlastyng saluacion therefore highest woorkethe highest seruice doe god bryng men knowlege worde moste principall seruice doe vnto god worlde euen bryng suche committed charge vnto true knowledge god blessed gospell seeth earnestly deuill labour partly sectes partly tyrauntes stoppe procedinges gospell kinde age maie come vnto religio feare god maie speake nothyng laborious painfull thyng bryng people vnto true knowledge god suche seruice god suche almose people soulles doeth christe firste declare come vnto saie first fedeth hongrie soules worde god truely sanctifie sabboth daie meane preache heare woorde god muche thei whiche doe please god thei offer hymnote well greate mountaines golde therfore must also followe example verely prince paretes gouernours housholdes c would dooe thei might deserue heauen office saie thei doe vnto god moste high acceptable sacrifice asmuche thei vtteryng poore labour doe true diligence soulles whiche committed vnto maie brought vnto true knowledge god sonne iesus christ deliuered kyngdome deuill bee made inheritours euerlastyng glory christ fedeth body alsoafter spirituall refection meane preachyng god woorde followeth seconde refection almose christ also taketh care bodie christ came worlde destroie either soule bodie mat ixxv luke xix saue bothe therfore carthusian monke charterhouse went right waie worke whe thought greate abstinence longe praiers hindered health bodie bodie subiect labour idle yet must dooenthe bodie much labour destroid bodie loose healthe destroieth bodie monkes many tymes enfebleth selues weaken strengthes loude syngyng long fastyng tedious praiyng doeth nothing el murder self muste bee auoided moste greuous synne iesus sirach prescribeth fodder whippe burthen belongeth vnto asse meate correction worke vnto seruaunt saieth doe muche vnto hym wise without discretion doe nothyng body mortall therfore hath nede meate maie healthe also put vnto labour waxe wanton imagin euill moreouer hath nede correction discipline thereby maie prouoked excited stirred vp vnto labour waxe idle negligently thinges doen yet thynges must measure meane bodie alwaies labour must somtime haue rest cause hath god appoincted onely daie vnto labour also night vnto slepe reste middaie serueth v eate god murderer deuill whiche deuill laboureth ende monke maie vtterly kill hym self immoderate exercise fasting watchyng praiyng c god none haue measure kept thynges measure merie meane thei vse saie seconde comfortpetturie feared christian goe right waie worke aboue thynges seke worde god whiche fall euen desert wildernes therefore daunger famine yet lette v despaire dismaied eue lorde v moued necessitie also carefull v yea muche better able care selues care proue x psalm bryng nothyng vnto good effecte christe careth must nedes greate plentie thynges though nothyng el worlde highe penurie moste miserable lacke se apostle also take care care sothe whens shall gette bread wildernes maie fede people care suche goodnesse cometh christ one taketh care people appoincteth hym self fede although present onely vii loues fewe little fish yet blessyng thei made great plentifull thei suffice fower thousande menne yea remain fragmentes seue baskettes full woman child nombred whereof thought also greate nomber tell man certain sure go farre dooe asmuche one pece golde riche manne doe many thousades would wishe one pece golde cast side care mery frolike riche man thousandes riche man boaste auaunce hym self bicause rich would poore man mocke hym saie thou hast cause proude thy rich although thou hast muche yea yet art thou better case one pece gold muche thy heape golde thee neither thy many thousandes lenger indure one pece golde therefore good state little thou thou hast c come passe christian least coumptedhow christian ought behaue selues euery kynde fortune dooe poinctes behaue selues neither wealthe pletie waxe proude yet penurie scarsenes faint dismaied despaire earnestly diligently seke worde god shall bee perill scarsenes christ carefull v neither shall want good thyng nothyng purpose whither wee haue muche little altogether christe maye blesse haue putteth blessyng vnto little thou hast shalt thou onelychristes blessyng enricheth lacke thyng also blessynges sake thou shalt haue remainyng thou haddest beginnyng would truely earnestly beleue doctrine onely without carefulnes also represse couetuousnes whiche maketh v almostecouetuousnesse persones besides selues wittes suche wickednesse ruleth reigneth heartes coueteous people thei haue couite yea couetuous man dooeth well lacke hath hath moste parte couetuousnes doeth blinde eye falleth al kinde mischief fearyng neither god manne would consider miracle right minde meane would neither plentie bee bolde trust muche yet penurie despaire vtterly dismaied knoweth whiche hath christe hath suche dispensatour stewarde able make muche little contrariwise christe absent blessyng thinges hade must nedes come naught thei neuer great plentuous paraduenture seuen loaues fewe fish christe disciple seyng christes maner oftetimes go desert solitarie place praie fight satan thought disciple prepared victuall purpose therefore sone christe taketh breade handes straight way increased maie bee perceiued although distributeth thereof yet remaineth handes still arte connyng christ knoweth gladly exerciseth sake whiche loue embrace worde yet lacke perceiued felt math vi psalm timo vi peter v therefore desireth haue blessyng let hym bee greued though suffer penurie little tyme embrace thou worde constantly liue accordyng thy vocation doeth christe require thee care caste vpon shall nourishe thee man hath euer either heard seen christian man hath perished died honger thei haue afflicted caste prison thei haue receiued fatte almoste worde god thei haue founde meate sufficient neither haue thei lacked good thing neither ought moue christian managainst delicate fare thing hath suche great deinties riche worldlynges haue christ ouer deintely fede geastes bread fishe meate water drinke setteth many dish varietie precious pleasaunt wine maner rich men men power haue pletie superfluitie al worldly thinges willeth meane meat drinke shuld fare world therwith ought content requirest thou thou maiest represse slake honger preserue thy health therfore content herewith fare daintely thei haue cause thake god take heede thei doe abuse abundaunce large blessyng god make occasion wickednes experiece teachethsumptuous fare health bodie seldome agree deintie fare agree men good health delicious foode haue seldome concorde betwene bread salte water prosperous welfare good health wished al deinties worlde sickenesses disease tormetes bodie haue example diuers riche menne whiche rather followe beastly pleasure naturall appetite feedyng thei receiue reward foolishenesepicures thei would liue soberly temperatly accordyng desire nature thei bothe haue health better also able good semely order doe suche thyngeshow greate euilles come excesse eatyng drinkyng belong vnto vocation callyng please god man oppressyng nature muche ingurgilatio excesse surfettyng dronkennes thei doe onely make selues vnapt vnto seruice god neighbour selues also thei fill infect myndes body eccle many synnes disease yea haste death vnto theim selues naturall tyme wiseman saieth excesse meates bryngeth sickenesse glotonie cometh laste vnmeasurable hate thorowe surfette haue many one perished dieteth hymself temperatly prolongeth life moreouer moche delicate fare varietie dish poore people defrauded porcion rich glotons spende thus wastfully vpon theim selues lesse haue thei bestowe vpon poore yea thei moned nothyng pitie compassion toward nedie people maie see voluptuous epicure luke xvi gospell luke whiche faryng deintely euery daie hymself disdained geue vnto poore beggerly lazarus muche cromes fell table farre shewed obediece commaundement god esai lviii breake thy bread hongrie nedie waifaring men leade thy house thou seest naked man clothe hym despise thyne owne flesh cormorantlike epicure little regarde suche like commaundementes god therefore makyng prouision owne belly thei spare coste vnto maintainauce poore euer thei geue worthe god mercie ought therefore haue speciall regard simple fare whiche setforthe greatly garnished moste comfortable blessyng god therewith content seyng philosopher saieth liue eate eate liue nature content little god gaue people manna wildernesse daiely foode exod xvi suche thakfull godlie minded receiued onely moste goodly noble meate thei also thought sufficient corporall necessitie neither required thei kinde meate varietie dish delicate belligoddes nume xi cor x could meanes suffice whiche desired rather retourne egipt sitte emong greasie fleshe pottes reward holie scripture doe manifestly declare patriarche iacob departyng fro countrie praied vnto god gen xxviii asked hym foode raiment god gaue helias prophet angell iii reg xix loafe broiled bread vessell water tyme fedde hym rauen twise daie bread fleshe iii xvii willed hym drinke water brooke cherith varietie dish iii xvii delicate wine daniel ananias misaell asarias thei might haue eaten dronken daniel meate wine kyng nabuchodonozor eate drinke refused dooe chosed rather stede princely fare eate potage drinke water yet wer thei better liking fatter thei whiche eate kynges meate dani xiiii meate whiche god sent daniell beyng prison babilon abacut prophete potage broken bread god giueth deinties necessary people whiche thei shall neuer want loue hym timo vi sainct paule saieth hauyng nourishement clothyng saith hauyng delicious fare sumptuous apparell let v contet math vi luke xi nothing brought worlde neither shall cary thyng therefore sauiour christ praier whiche taughte disciple saie commaundeth v praie deinties varietie pleasaunte dish breade saie necessary foode wherof presetly haue neede giue v daie daiely breade moste wise noble kyng salomon prou xxx desired god onely necessary liuyng lorde saieth giue neither pouertie richesse onely graunt necessary liuyng least full deny thee saie lorde least beyng co strained pouertie fall vnto stealyng take name god vaine frugalitie therefore simple fare accompanied blessyng christe practised good godly men beginning ag ought moue v eschewe al kindes voluptuous dilicious fare content selues thinne necessarie diete auoidyng excesse superfluitie onely synne displeasaunt vnto god also pestilent noysome hurtfull healthe life alwaies hauing eye luke xxi saiyng sauiour christe take hede heartes bee ouercome surfettyng dronkennesse saincte paule saieth rom xiii make prouision fleshe fulfill lustes thereof ende meanyng gospell acknowledge confesse iesus christ lorde nurse father prouider steward whiche giueth vnto v thynges abundantly enioye whiche notwithstandyng hath moste speciall care foode soulle maie get aboue thynges knowledge god woorde true godlinesse obtaine euerlastyng life againe math vi many seeke kyngdome god rightuousnes thereof despaire concernyng corporall sustenaunce necessity flee vnto christes blessyng faithfully beleue christ lesse feede theim take care theim fiue thousande gospell maketh mention although reason se thing maie brought passe taught made twoo partes saie soulle bodie likewise doeth christ make prouision bothe neither suffer suche trust hym wat good thing either soulle body giue theim thynges liberally psalmographe saieth feare lorde psalm ye sainctes thei feare hym lacke nothyng lion dooe lacke suffer honger thei whiche seeke lorde shall wante maner thyng good maie obtaine twoo blessynges god father christ accordyng moste swete comfortable promise saie foode bothe soule bodie necessarie liuyng sustentacion mortall life worlde euerlastyng glorie worlde come bothe soule bodie let v tymes diligently praie assistaunce god moste holy spirite maie breath v suche heauenly spirituall motion maie aboue thynges seke kyngdome god rightuousnes therof depende whollie faithfull prouidece alwaie thankfull hym benefites daiely inricheth v sonne christe iesu bothe euer bee glorie honour amen viij sondaie trinitie sondaie gospell matth vii beware false prophetes whiche come shepes clothyng inwardly thei rauenyng woulues ye shall knowe fruictes doe menne gather grape thornes figges thisties euen euery good tree bryngeth forthe good fruites corrupte tree bryngeth forthe euill fruites good tree bryng forthe badde fruites neither badde tree bryng forthe good fruites euery tree bryngeth forthe good fruite hewen doune caste fire wherefore fruites ye shall knowe euery one saith vnto lorde lorde shall enter kyngdome heauen dooeth father whiche heauen shall enter kyngdome heauen exposition gospell part long sermon whiche sauiour christ made mountaine described blessed euagelist matthewe v vi vii chapiter gospell almoste latter ende aforesaied sermon occasion woordes maie right well seme bee lorde christ knewe right well accordyng englishe prouerbe euer god buildeth churche deuill builde chapell iuste saiewith sede god word heresi alwaie groweth euer woorde god truely sette forthe sincerely preached deuill ceaseth tare wicked heresy false doctrine hinder lette yea obscure deface good woorke math xiii maie se gospell fewe none maie receiue profite thereby least kyngdome bee diminished spoiled praie therefore gospell christe admonisheth warneth chargeth v beware false prophetes though saie haue set forthe worde vnto diligently taught ye ought doe ye rightly truely vnderstande tenne commaundementes praie faste beleue god giue almose c remaineth ye diligently take hede ye meanes suffer selues plucked awaie doctrine neither subtile suggestion moste subtile satan craftie conueighaunce fleshly perswasions antichrist adherentes sende forthe emong angel math x emog wolffes neither dooe sowe emong wheate emong tare therefore take hede diligently ye deceiued allured waie truthe vnto rockes errours heresy ought diligently aboue al thinges holde fast word godwherefor christ gospell chargeth v aboue thynges wee holde faste sincere pure worde god suffer selues muche breadth naile bee plucked awaie whatsoeuer contrary coumpte euill deuill plaine abhominacion euer aucthour thereof gala ii ioan epi ii kyng kesar pope patriarche heard wheresoeuer worde sincerely preached wolffes hande streight way subtelties deceiptes craftie immaginacions haue experience hereof diuers example also bothe matter churche affaire common weale housholde businesse wolffe thrusteth hym self place maie plucke v fro worde occupie place hym self churche haue woorde god laboureth deuill vttermoste plucke awaie fro vssectaries come deuill stirreth vp one sectarie teache newe thyng baptisme lordes supper yea christ hym self whiche neuer heard suche greate foolishenes inconstancie leudnes hand desirous newes immediatly cast awaie woorde haue singulare respecte vnto aucthour newe doctrine notwithstandyng dooeth nothyng elsnewe faugled gospeller goe aboute deceiue destroye v vnto ende saie bee seduced suche wolffes doeth sauiour christe specially direct admonicio though saie ye shall wante wolffes whiche shall come vnto goodly visars holy shewes ye shall thincke ye neuer life heard godly excellent preacher thus except ye take hede ye shall bee deceiued fall daunger ye beware shall faulte surely whiche warne take hede ye selues whiche heare woorde haue yet kepe holde faste c christian man circumspect hauyng regard himselfthe cathechisme necessarie bee knowen al degree owne saluacion cathechisme saie tenne commaundementes article faithe lordes praier wordes christ concernyng baptisme lordes supper euen thynges onely might defende hymself heresy errours seing greate negligence hearyng woorde fewe delighte wholle heartes marueile though deuill take place theim throwe theim hedlong kinde wicked vngodly doctrine greate daunger christe would haue v well enarmedthe woorde god defese deuill minister strongly defensed circumuented beguiled yea deceiued destroied wolffes whiche shalbe caste waie securitie negligence fortresse selues manly valiauntly worde god setteth v certain deceiptes wolffes craftely thei goe beguile nede therfore diligetly take hede therefore saieth christ wil bee saffegarde sette free rauenyng tethe moste rauenyng wolffes let holde faste woorde whiche true light whereby maie clerely moste cleare glasse beholde se ephe vi perceiue slye subtlety subtle satan whiche also armour defende v againste fierie dartes deuill although approch vnto v neuer craftely euen cladde garnished simple apparell moste simple shepe greatest ieopardie deuill cometh cometh owne habite taketh vnto hym holie religious garment pretendeth muche deuocion godlinesse sort came vnto christe wildernes math iiii whe saied vnto hym fall doune worshippe giue thee thynges woordes mete woordes deuill moste high maiestie god lone worshipped alone hath right power kyngdomes worlde giueth vnto pleaseth hym therfore christ rebuketh hym saieth hen satan though saie thou camest vnto apparell god knowe thee thou art deuill therefore shepes clothing ought moue man maie sone deceiued receiue heare deuill steede god like maner deuill cometh vnto v sectary schismatikes heretiquessectaries schismatikes heretikes ii cor xi first putteth vpon goodly countenauce apparelleth hym self like angell lighte maie none otherwise appere impostores iuglars deceiuers moste holy moste religious moste feruente god cause moste zelous matter true godlines yet deuill haue plentle example arrians anabaptistes dauidians swenckfeldians c shortecarnal securitie openeth waie deuill enter harte deuill findeth idle carelesse heartes crepeth theim serpente menne slepe grasse fele nothyng maie therefore neglect caste awaie sette naught faithfull admonicion warnyng christe least negligence deceiued glistering hypocrite bee caried aboute euery winde doctrine ought rather diligently heare woorde haue meditacion embrace high constancie expende weigh discerne iudge al doctrine soeuer aucthours theim would thus doe deuill haue greate power deceiue v regimentes common wealthes wee maie beholde examplenegligence prince bryngeth destruction common wealthe picture ecclesiasticall matter prince carelesse idle doe office diligently earnestly thei ought lande full flatterer thei beleue generally al men euer thei heare thei thinke straight wayes truenote well cause thynges go hauocke country subiectes bee moste miserably polled pilled maie speake nothing owne incommodities loss vndaungerous commit handlyng waightie matter men prince selues nothyng al regarde thei selues presente doyng suche matter knewe accoumptes officer would beleue
