thei knewe certainly true go better common wealthe doeth present negligece housholders bryngeth destruction housholdesand euen likewise family householdes whe suche gouernours house idle carelesse commit thynges houshold loss chaunce soner thei loked deede true ought despaire generally mennes fidelitie right vp behauiour oftentymes chaunceth manne perceiueth trusted sheweth hymself negligent doyng duetie loue loue faithe also bought faithe trust trust notwithstandyng matter bee handled measure discrecion shall rashly without good aduisement commit thinges men neyther tymes place men trusted withstandyng shall thynke father houshold hath also hymselfe eye thynges wyll easily perceaue thynge doone amysse suche trusteth hath house negligence maisters many tymes occasion seruantes negligente geue selues licencious retchelesse lyfe notwithstandyng householde seruantes ought carelesse studiously obey wyll commaundement theyr maisters suffer theym selues meanes thorough counsayle wycked bee broughte vnto lewdnessedisobediente seruantes good successe thynges canne maysters commaunde one thynge seruauntes neglectyng theyr maysters commaundement thoroughe wicked aduyse certayne naughty persones contrarye yea geue theyr myndes idlenesse play pastymes dycyng cardynge drynkyng whooryng c yet many theyr lewde doynges wyll beare faire face outwardly thoughe nothynge amysse thynges wellethe disobedience seruauntes vnto master com th deuyll yea though dydde theyr office accordynge theyr bounden duetie yet seynge disobedience shewed theyr maisters must nedes come deuyll whatsoeuer doo behalf many tymes seruauntes dwell suche maysters meanes abyde suche neglygente lewde lyghte behauioure commeth deuyll hys subtilties craftye deuices whyche somme naughtye packe goeth persuade suche seruice myserable bondage therefore oughte caste awaye captiuitie seeke libertie whyche shall easylye greater profyt fynd conuenient place awaye therfore olde maisters seeke newe vnwise seruantes thynke thys good councell come louyng frendly hearte towarde theym therefore bothe obeye disobeye dyuell obeye god disobeye ephe coloss tit pet whyche hathe commaunded obeye theyr bodyly maysters thynges yea simplenesse hearte symple soone deceaued specially frendeshyp pretended thynges vttered delite foolyshe fancie men make many woordes wolfe redy tymes weightie slender mattersthe deuyll abyde god ordinance thynges trewe diligence good mynde oughte bee doone churche commune wealthes householdes deuyll meanes canne abyde office ordeined god hee goeth aboute hynder lette yea vtterly subuert destroy whyche ordeyned vnto conseruation bothe thynges presente thynges comme maye euyll spoken goodnesse maye ensewe thereof muste therefore dilygentlye take heede marke deuyll tymes goeth aboute leaste wyth hys fayre face pleasant countenance deceaueth v bryngeth v erroure suche wyth whome wee haue doo syncere relygion manye hypocrite doo pretende relygion godlynesse haue one poynte trewe relygion wherfore harde knowe wolfe thoroughly except diligent circumspecte discrete thys thynge moste daungerous grienous churche scismatykes sectariesscismatikes sectary heretykes heretykes comme wyth suche pretence though earnestly euen frome verye hearte dydde regarde saluation mennes soules hadde feruente zeale greedy desyre sette foorthe woorde god truthe thereof whenne symple sely shepe behold theyr shepishe garmentes suspect euyll deceit crafte subtiltie streyght way embrace trewe godly teacher woulde greatly regarde suche noble professoures god woorde truthe christian must knowe thys deuyll also wont bragge boaste truthe woorde god lesse godly therfore ought enstructed myght say maner truthe woorde god loue fulle derely notwithstandyng wyll regarde man authoritie mucheall men doctrine must tryede worde god wyll conferre thys woorde speakethe catechisme wyth doctrine whyche haue hytherto hearde circumspecte moued wyth euery newfangled fancie hath respecte vnto worde without danger neither deceiued dothe otherwise possible must fall bothe errours heresy seduced truthe worde eue paradyse example thys matter deuyls oration vnto moste pleasaunte full sugred eloquence gen paynteth foorth god gentyll meke knoweth anger meaneth saieth hathe god geuen gardeyn power ye shoulde doo wythall ye wylle enioye commodity therof owne luste pleasure howe vnsyttynge hee shoulde denye one tree whych greatly hurt benefyte thereof ye shall gette wysedome comparable wysedome god honylyke mete deceaue wordes whiche able dede easyly seduce eue myghte fall away forgette commandement whych god geuen husbande although hadde forgotten yet beganne doubte came myserie fyrste whenne deuyll assaulted behaued selfe wysely gaue deuyll repulse vertue che commaundement whyche god geuen vnto sathan went way woorke hadde good successe former enterprise broughte matter thys poynte commaundemente concernynge tree true god muste nedes malicious full enuy whyche woulde also grant lyke wysedome hym thenne hand casteth awaye woorde plucketh apple eateth eatynge whyche apple myserably ephe rom yea disobedience moste iustly caste kynde euyls nowe lyke peryll also shold deceaued suche sorte christe warneth v saythe beware false prophetes though say ye bee deceaued hereafter faulte shalbe myne haue delyuered vnto woorde whole pure see fortresse conforte lyghte onely prouide ye lette lyght go eye holde fast wordthe word god sufficient armour agenste deuyll antichriste whe word brought vnto agreeth thys worde say deaffe lyght sort verily god hath sufficiently prouided v agaynst deuyll antichrist theyr complices hathe geuen v worde excused neyther putt faulte hym excused holde faste worde folowe woorde wolfe daunger damnation body soule oughte admonishe v shoulde heare suche voyces gen rom voyce suche ennemye onely seeketh oure destruction declared paradyse concernynge fyrste parentes adam eue threwe headlonge theyr posteritie synne deathe wrathe god whyche myserye oure moste mercyfull god heauenly father hath delyuered v hys sonne myght enfranchised synne deathe nowe second tyme enemy layeth wayt agayn v yf mean pluck v grace throw v agayn old myserie therfore must diligently watche mayn hold fast word god otherwyse meanes free daunger thus muche haue spoken concernyng one sentence gospell wherein christ commandeth v beware false prophetes straighly chargeth v holde fast woorde meanes suffer selues drawen whatsoeuer contrary word flee deuyll pestilence shall suffise tofore said foloweth lyght suffereth departe frome hys eye may sure saued christ shew carefull v saluation contente generall commaundement also prescribeth christian two rule ought folow may easily eschue perillthe first rule fyrst bee deceaued shepes clothyng iudge accordyng vnto wolues oppressed hunger practise barkynges doggesthe nature wolffes meanes may deceaue either man beaste lykewise doo false prophetesshepes clothynge regarded beare godly face outwardly pretende true prophetes preacher god man ought reste alone least deceaued one rule diligently consydered matter great weyght clothing garmet signifieth false prophete commethshepes clothyng signifiethe plainely openly declareth sub iltie fals doctrine hyghly commende sette foorth theyr good wyll towarde flocke christ flattiringe wordes zeale towarde kyngdome god moued enforced preache agayn meanes suffer greate iniurie doone pore people kepyng longe tyme blyndenesse concealyng truth god word c wilie sleight word simple people perceaueth therfore thinke matter euen say pretende thynke seductours deceauers beare heartie good affection toward commyt selues tuition beynge ready beleue haue receaue euer doctrine teache meanes myserable poore ignorant people moste miserably deceaued christen man must beware hathe tofore ben said dyuel sheweth hymselfe owne likenes terrible blacke foule2 cor euil fauored c pretendeth certain godly maiestie chaungeth selfe angell light wolues likewise com wolues put shepes clothyng whiche knowe wold thynk dede symple innocent harmeles shepeoffice voc cion title c moreouer shepes clothynge signifieth office vocation glorious title also haue proued experience pope byshops herein haue done much harme yet bragge boast office therfore would traditios shold great authoritie although life deceiue man yet hath great shew goodly outwarde face math yt haue ministery church comitted vnto christ also reporteth scribe phariseys yt sit chaire moses ca make leaue bostyng must nedes grant haue yt ministery office owne nature true wold vse wel truly forasmuch pope ye bishop crake office therfore require herd erre christen must take good hede saye knowledge office shepes clothing christ commaundeth content thatmarcke well shepes clothyng commeth foorthe also searche boult see whether vnder garment lurketh lyeth hyd rauenyng wolfe lyke maner also shepes clothyng false prophetes shewe outwardly great holinesse lyfeholynes lyfe anabaptistes haue anabaptist exaple vse vayne wycked worldly talke swear vse simplicitie theyr diete apparell speake muche god worde pray continually suffer persecution paciently renenge soeuer doone suffer man lacke theyr profession haue al thynges common among time apostle c thynges owne nature euyll bee wyshed men suche thyngs act according christen profession doctrine iudged trewe thynges contrarye christes counsell vnder shepes clothyng wolfe maye hyde hymselfethe errores heresy anabaptistes maner monkes put theyr truste workes make god lyer baptised twise cast away theyr first true baptisme vnprofitable wicked naught teach corruptly lordes supper though nothyng el bare bread bare wyne agayne receauynge thereof exercyse yong lynges vnperfect folke christen congregation suche perfecte ancient christe burden christen men thyngs necessarie disturbe whole housholdes make husbande forsake wyfe wife husband ioyn selues wicked damnable religion take away proprietie owneshyp worldly goodes possession would haue thynges common contemne condempne politike ciuile power prophane vngodly professe theym selues dede ennemies congregation god ciuile power gouernement family householdes faire face also set vpon rule monkes nonnes also whole worlde maner deceiued iugglyng vttered word god nowe wolfe whyche lurked vnder sheepes clothyng come lyght knowen men moreouer great gift lykewise ar shepes clothing wherof christ speaketh gospellgreat giftes shall come name prophecie tel thing come shall cast deuils worke greate miracle thynges also oughte preiudice christian though ought therefore make inquisition truthe doctrine woorde muste bee consydered without respecte prerogatiue persone wolfe alwayes feared suspected vnder sheepes clothynge ye first rule whiche christ prescribeth christian diligently take heede beware shepes clothyng although speeche fayre curteous office true outward life fautlesse besides great number excellente vertues yet ought mystrust lest vnder crafte falshode deceyte lye lurkyng forasmuche vnder faire sugred speche may lye hyd deadly poyson vnder true office corrupt vsyng therof vnder religious lyfe fraude guile deceipt vnder great giftes great wickednes therfore soone thou seest shepes clothyng thynke thou must take good hede beware christe hymselfe geueth warnynge wolfe haue suche clothynge hyde selues wherfore thou muste diligently searche theyr craftes subtilties may knowen howe shall doone ueryly second rule teachethe seconde rule whyche thou shalt let passe outwarde face fayre shewe wherof haue hitherto spoken thou shalt consider fruitesthe fruites considered fruicts saieth shall ye know theym putteth forth similitude none sayth madde wold gather grape thorn fygs thistle fruit grow tree orchardes also men iudge fruictes apple tree good tree wher nothing iudg contrary trade doth christ also put forth v iudge false teacher deceaued first blushe although wolfe cometh clad neuer goodly godly shepes clothyng first fruit true prophet teacherthe fruite true preacher prophet wherby muste knowen wolfe true shepe truely outward life office title yet noble gift christ dothe testifie experience techeth men oftentimes deceaued true fruict christ sheweth ende father whiche heauen noted christ speaketh generally cristians onely prophetes teacher trewe men ought heauenly father therby also get saluation father ten comandementes meanes declare obedience godwhat wyll god seyng perfectly lyfe impossible v affirme haue god haue power selues obtein saluation kingdome god workes also moste specially proprely ye god christ saith gospell iohn euery one seeth sonne beleueth hym iohn haue euerlastyng life raise hym vp saieth cnriste last daye waie whiche teacher scholers muste walke wyll come vnto euerlastyng saluation christ speaketh specially techers prophet whose propre true fruict isthe fruite true prophet teacher set forth teache wyll diligently god gentill merciful willeth death synner hee repent lyue god hym selfe declared mercye hee sente onely begotten sonne worlde become man therefore receaueth hym beleueth hym hathe hope truste hym god mercyful vnto sonne christes sake forgeueth hym synnes geue euerlasting lyfe c setteth forthe doctrine syncerely purely bringeth vnto christ alone mediator betwene god v man true techer doth god true fruicte whereby deceiued wer possible ye diuell shold teach doctrine could false whiche doth beleue surely obtein whyche promyseth fruict whiche trewe proper certain meanes deceaue also followegodly lyfe teacher say lyfe agreable contrarie doctrine seconde fruicte counted true first say doctrine christe presente possible doctrine may faultlessenot lyfe doctrine preacher chefelye consydered notwithstandyng lyfe euyll sclandrous therfore must looke specially lyfe doctrine mean shall certainly know whether wolfe shepe commeth v shepes clothyng therfore trie pope churche let hym take beginning first fruict say doctrine shall fynd pope doctrine remission synneshowe pope hys churche tryed saluation onely directed vnto christe vnto maner workes vnto vowes monkes vnto syngyng mass vnto pardon merit sainctesthe doctrine lyfe pope hys churche prickyng hurtefull thornes whiche come foorthe figge tree vyne secondarily lette theyr lyfe also consydered shall founde pope cast asyde due obedience god theyr prince pope complices doo moste extremely hate worde god true professor persecute moste spitefully punish cruelly soeuer laye hand lyue moste filthyly abhominably labour vnfruitfully waste spend away lyke belly god epicure goodes church short nothyng lyfe worthy commended looke therefore two thynges say lyfe doctrine naught thynk surely thornes thistle thou seeke grape fygges thou shalte onely fynde thou shalte also departe losse thys ought offende manne vyne yll fauoured woodde fygge tree weake contrarywise whiche belongeth thornes beautyfull syghtly yea swete rose comme fayre syghte pleasaunte looke bee consydered matter fruict commoditie commeth thereof applye thynges poynt none nowe shall punyshement false prophetesthe reward false prophetes christe sheweth similitude rotten tree euen cut downe cast fire shall bee ende suche teacher also theyr scholers whenne regard true doctrine yet fruites therof therfore lette v highly esteeme woorde god diligentely heare marke endeuour selues vttermost oure power brynge foorthe good fruictes false doctrine wycked lyfe eschue auoide deuill pestilence lorde iesus christ thoroughe holy ghost geue v grace continue vnto ende amen ninthe sonday trinitie pthe gospell luke xvi page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate iesus sayde disciple certayne ryche man whiche stewarde accusede vnto hym wasted goodes called hym saide vnto howe heare thee geue accoumptes thy stewardshyppe thou mayst longer steward steward sayde within selfe shall maister taketh awaye stewardshyp dygge begge ashamed wote put stewardshippe maye receyue house called maisters detters together sayde vnto firste muche owest thou vnto maister sayd hundred tonne oyle sayde vnto hym take thy byll sitte downe quickelye writte fiftie saide another muche owest thou said hundreth quarter wheat sayd vnto take thy byll write fourescore lorde commended vniust stewarde done wysely chyldren worlde theyr nation wyser chyldren lyght say vnto make frindes vnryghteous mammon ye shall haue nede maye receyue euerlastinge habitation exposition gospel sermon good workes maketh specially couetousnes yt shold abuse rich good help nedy poore christ ende expresse plaine wordes saieth make ye frendes wicked mammon saye healpe poore suche necessytie wyth youre rychesse thys woorde mammon signifieth richesse englishemammon signifieth doctrin dothe christ set foorth parable maner people might ye better beare away warneth v folow example vnrighteous steward stewarde perceaued aforehande must nedes geue vp stewardshyp haue nede men helpe therfore tyme wealth prouideth hym self one forgeueth half debtes fourth part shall haue nede may fynde kyndnes liberalitie hande christes meaning shold study vnrighteous deceiue one geue almes meaneth folow forsight prouidence circumspection prudence wisedome bestowe rich fruict thereof may redounde v lyfe wee make v frendes wycked mammon steward made hym frendes wicked mammon fyrst learned christ calleth mammon vnryghteousneswhy called vnryghteous mammo goodes wrongefully gotten muste restored paide home agayne neyther oughte bee conuerted turned vse almose esa prophet esai saith lorde loueth iudgement hateth robbery sacrifice therwith asmuch say man sacrifice geue almes worshyp god money let hym owne el leaue vndone ought suche thyngs men goodes restore home agayne trewe owner doth agree whych christ sayth yt shold make v frends ye mamon vnrighteousnesse healpe poore christe calleth vnryghtous wicked mammon vnrighteously wyckedly gottengoods wrogfully gotten restored sayde thynges vnryghteously gotten must restored man vseth mammon well godly excepted whyche lyue feare god accordynge tenne commaundementes vse theyr goodes vnto ryottous lyuyng delicious fare without regarde poore whiche ought bee succoured theyr rychesse cause thys fylthye name geuen mammon shoulde bee called vnrighteous wycked howe greatly abuse richesse displeaseth god ezech maye easily bee gathered prophete ezechiel sayenge behold saieth iniquitie sodoma thy syster pryde plentifulnesse breade abundance idelnesse systers reached foorthe hande needy poore agayn hyghe mynded wrought abhominations saieth lorde ioyned together ydlenesse abundance doo knowe howe liue dissolutely enough kynd excesse wantonnesse yet notwithstandyng haue regarde poore corrupte order commonlye practised worlde therefore called mammon iniquitie hurtefull money robbery yea although bee gotte neuer iustlynote well hys owne nature hurte bee moneye thynges whyche appoynted necessarye vse manne thoroughe faulte suche dooe welle rightely vse therfore doctrine gospel tendeth specially point couetousnes may repressed true vse worldlye goodes receaued frendes maye made whiche god geueth v dye haue nothyng leafte leaue thinges behinde v may fynde frendes receaue v euerlastyng tabernacle whatsoeuer benefite bestowe poore last daye shall onely beare recorde v haue shewed christen charitie shal also abundantlye recompensed shall poore come forth diuerse witness one shal say holpen coate money bread house rome harborow yea written gospell christ hymselfe shall come foorth declare heauenly father glorious angel blessed sainctes good selues haue done howe haue declared fayth true vnfayned doyinge good workes shall haue helpe frendes shall promote v kyngdome frendesbehold ye oppressor poore shalbe accompanied also many enemy whiche shall accuse iudgement seate god suche worlde vniustly oppressed durst much one hysse againste ryche vnmerciful worldlyngs bought thinge gaue much worth euill example dyd lyke hyre house greater price vttered victual dearer solde marchandise ware excessiue price could necessarie v many v fel extreme necessitie miserably died lacke sustenance shal ye daye complaintes onely men also christ againste couetous men shall accuse wicked mammon math howe shall matter go sentence shall pronounced vnmerciful people ueryly euen thisget ye hence ye cursed euerlasting fyre prepared deuill angel haue ben hongrye ye gaue meat haue ben thirstie ye gaue dryncke iac c iudgement sayth sainct iames shall without mercie hym hath shewed mercie shal escape vnpunished geue nothinge shall done thincke ye haue hurte wronge regardyng nothynge owne gayne commoditie profite howsoeuer come yet persuade themselfes wronge sermon therfore couetousnes teaching christen man ought redy take geue act bounde wyllingly liberally helpe ye poore muche able seruice god also wyll abundantlye rewarde whereas serue deuill nothyng increase owne also geue eyther nothynge litle man shall haue due rewarde deuill sainctes specially daye shall testifye againste saye men nothynge lyfe tyme scrape together could enlarge possession either hooke crooke right wrong cared howe great nede helpe nothing wolde geue v scarsely wold aforde v good word much lesse wold succour v money suche prosopopaeian personall action doth christ imagine place v c said moreouer christ parable maister housholde prayse vnrighteous steward takenhowe master praised vnrighteous st eward thoughe alowed vnrighteousnes prayseth prouidence wisedome stewarde commandeth v folowe good cause vse lyke care diligence steward vsed euil cause owne comoditie although damage losse maister euen prayse harlotte setting foorth selfe euen vttermost owne gaynea similitude lucre aduauntage behalfe fault golde thynges woman doth abuse yet example tendeth ende may admonishe thee seinge woman litle aduauntage taketh greate payne deckinge trymminge vp selfe please louers thou muche oughtest sett worke lymmes thy bodye attaynment euerlastynge lyfe thou mayst please christe thy louer vnderstanded though filthynes dishonestie semed worthy folowed care diligence set forth example induce thee vnto better thyng goeth worlde christ pronounceth horrible sentence saith child worlde prudent forecastyng circumspect wise generation child lyght matter plaine hope game aduantage howe doth child worlde carcke care swyncke sweate moyle turmoyle spare labour diligence payne trauaile howe great combraunces perilles danger robber theaues afflicted vexed care pensiuenes ceasseth neither night daye pursepickers stealer whoremonger adulterer c haue paine labour sweate litle gratifie pleasure deuill satisfye wicked lustes contrariwise christen men lye oppressed dead slepethe sluggishnes christeans secure carelesse wtout thought shold workes charitie serue god thincke al thing much either suffer thyng god cause commoditie neighbour whereas worlde bestoweth greate payne purchasing hell pleasing deuil muste christian vrged drawen beare stake dutie although god knoweth slenderly slowly therfore goodly trymme example christ setteth forth vnto v haue consideration dutie nede fetche example farre borowe bookes monumentes let euery man consider owne famely housholde diligently marcke howe diligent paineful child seruauntes mischeife worke acceptable pleasant deuill may example vnto v shoulde like diligence care embrace worde god thinges yt belog vnto euerlasting life seing careful euil wicked thing ought much careful painefull good godly thinges let v thincke meanes suffred wicked lymmes deuill shold make haste hel wil counted christian stande still lyke dastardes go nothing may v vnto kingdome heauen vnto euerlasting life worlde doth helpe v notably well holsome example concernynge businesan example acouetous man wherof christ speaketh place set thee som man yt geuen couetousnes thou shalt see take reste neither night daye desire care money doth tosse hym sea vnquiet inuenteth suche subtile wayes get good witty men none otherwise greatly marueille doinges shorte let scape much farthing hope come drie iawes gredy wide gaping ye litle greate al fysh yt cometh net couetous miser miserable mammonisie wycked worldlyng ought moue v hys examplenote well hath vnsaciable desire vnto getting money likewise shold haue gredy mynde feruent desyre wel willing hearte obtaine get euerlasting lyfe christian study thus dutie muche delighted helpe neighbour nede wyth lytle money euery man accordyng habilitie couetous man delighted see stocke money encreased eyther vsurie vnlawful meane notwithstandynge couetous man getteth may speake nothing shame dishonestie transitorie soon passeth away cometh naught looke thing get christen liberalitie good poore member christe bringe euerlastinge fruites comodities thus sayth salomon pitieth poore pro lendeth lord looke layeth shall paid hym man nedeth feare losse stocke gaynes thereby promised shall loose nothing whatsoeuer bestoweth vpon poore shalbe abundantly recompenced hym wil take place among v neither beleue deuil sences iudgements vnfaithful hindered letted perceaue haue mynde gayne aduantage whiche farre surmounteth passeth worldly lucre profite wherfore worthely punished oure madnes seinge set thynges present although frayle tran itorie ye thing heauenlye euerlastynge synne couetousnes also make mammon author destruction damnation bodye soule therefore christe concludeth truly sayth child worlde wyser generation sonnes god deuill receaueth hundred time child god doth yet must ceasse teachyng admonishyng men neuer sluggyshe madpreachers must duty preachinge wh ther people amende must alwayes spurryng prickyng forewarde vnto study good workes oure importune labour may brought vnto goodnes euen subtle suggestion deuill ye wicked councelles naughtie packes moued brought vnto kynde lewdnes although oure matter procede slowlye enterpryce yet stay leaue vnto child lyght kepe name diligentlymarke well go knowledge light althoughe thinges perfectest done ye greatest prouidence forecaste matter childre lyfe yet excluded possession glorie light haue beginne take hand ye workes godlines may nombred among called child light certein sure prouision thynges shall neuer lyke diligence child worlde long liue therfore ought discourage v though oure olde man go slenderly forward vnto godlines wheras child world runne spedily without stay vnto hellwee oughte daylye encrease waye godlynes neither let v suffer selues obstacle lettes drawen ye waie rather let v go forwarde dayly somwhat modestie lenitie softnes gentlenes mercie compassion suche workes godlines thou haste one begune good hope halfe ye matter done one well begunne although thou procedest slowly yet geue ouer neither go thou waye styll folowe example paule phil meanes thou mayste comprehend wherin thou arte comprehended christe iesu bringeth forth child light comprehended christ iesu phil reconciled god father thorowe hym calleth also chapter goeth christian great lightes worlde concernyng lyghtes thus putteth forth example one thing sayth forget thinges behinde endeuour selfe vnto thinges whiche accordyng marcke appointed preace rewarde high callinge god thorow christ iesu therfore coforte wil condene v made child light grace god christ rom child worlde whiche ronne hedlong vnto hell although yet weake asmuche alwaies striue thuttermost power labour obtaine rewarde high callyng god although might well worthely reproue v beinge child light ronne slowly course yet grace forgeuynge v synnes doth supply lacketh v whiche grace wyde heauen extended ouer lyfe lyeth hydde imperfection poore state vnder heauen god mercie grace continually stycke fast exercise tyranny truth god worde faithfull professours yet theyr sake good hope amendment answere somwhat doubte question firste papistes selues must nedes graunte frendes whome christ speaketh frend able also wil geue v heauen christ without paraduenture poore beggers whome haue holpen good worlde shall ryseth question whether almose good workes able deserue heauen euerlasting lyfe question sone answered paul saith whatsoeuer faithwhyther oure good workes wee deserue heauen rom synne foloweth therfore god doth allowe thee almose vnfaithfull geue heauen euerlastynge lyfe beleue christe afterwarde declare fayth theyr workes workes please god faith sake also rewarde suche workes lyfe come yet doth herof folowe euerlasting life geuen v workes sake annexed vnto faith gospell doth oftentimes testifie beleueth sayth shall neuer see death waye truth lyfe iohn iohn god deliuered sonne beleue perishe haue euerlasting lyfe true certein sure solution paules sentence iohn rom heard galat thorowe iesus christe lorde alone sauiour whome father holy ghost honour glorie euer amen tenth sonday trinitie sonday p gospell luke xix come nere ierusalem beheld citie wept saying thou haddest knowen thynges whiche belong vnto thy peace euen thy day thou wouldeste take heede nowe hyd thine eye dayes shall come vnto thy enymies shall caste banke compasse rounde kepe euerye syde make euen grounde thy chyldren whiche thee shall leaue one stone vpon another thou knoweste tyme thy visitation wente temple began cast solde therein boughte sayinge vnto written house house prayer ye haue made denne thieues taught daylye temple exposition gospell ought diligently reme bred weighed considered al christias also hereby maye learne feare god history contayned gospell luke moste terrible fearefull horrible ought worthely moue v yt might neuer forget gospel mentio made great anger vengeance god shewed citie ierusalem inhabitant incredulitie disobediece certein sure doctrine vnto vsan example god wrath agenst despisers worde yt obstinate secure carelesse sin despysing ye iudgement god shall euen finde hand god ye anger vengeaunce yt shal neuer escape noble goodly beautifull citie spared hauyng worde god repented let men thincke moste certeintie except repent time amend lykewise shal neuer escape dreadful displeasure whote vengeance god christ marueilously troubled concerning ye heauy destruction great noble citie wysheth yt wold call selfe remembraunce well consider aforehande wrath come addresse selfe vnto amendement mourne wepe lament desire god merciful vnto forgeue tourne awaye plague worthely hath deserued although christ speaketh ierusale yet willeth commination commonition saye threatning warning shoulde vnderstanded pertayne vnto many haue worde god yet heare without fruite yea despise shoulde carelesse thincke themselfes god wil forgeue fault punishment shall surely chaunce suche god lyueth therfore let v repent tyme cease sinnesthe dispysyng god worde horrible synne specially sinne despiseth worde god tyme visitation heare sermon yet truly tourne vnto godlines goeth forth kynde wyckednes whatsoeuer preached taught contrarie paine therfore taken awaye differred time set v terrible example fearce horrible iudgement god citie dearly loued counted holiest citie world people god chosen peculiar himselfe nation vnder heauen citie house dwelling place god people therof owne familie housholdierusalem next vnto heauen ierusalem holiest place god angel dwelte al seruice god appointed done almost patriarch lyued buried also christ sonne god walked fleshe died buried rose sent holy ghost citie holynes passed city worlde neyther lyke euer founde earth neither shalbe vnto worldes end yet thinges nothyng regarded seing receaued word god obeyed god seuerely punishe offence honour worde woulde rather haue citie one tenderly loued extirped plucked vp rootes wolde suffer worde dishonoured glorie therof defaced god delt thus best beloued citielet v repent betymes bee thought spare city kyngdomes nation hath dwelt people therof ar nygh vnto hym citisens kyngdome therfore example ought monument god anger despise woorde god let v vse talke wont doo peace peace ieopardie thynges well anger god neuer great v tushe wil neuer punishe v dyd city ierusalem inhabitantes thereof brother let v deceaue selues suffered holy citie wherin great delight earth destroyed vtterly subuerted one stone lefte vppon wickednes heard worde rom yet dyd repent amend verily ought think spare v offend inhabitant citie dydde like synne lyke punyshement citie destroyd yt ther remained somuch print token house god dyd chiefly thus plague citieat tym ierusalem destroyed howe greate multi ud people great multitude came thither vnto feast passeouer history report citie iii hundred thousande stranger besydes inhabitantes therof god determination make generall plague moste frequent populous company beyng gathered togither verye place punyshement romaine shoulde punyshe theym alyke thus wryteth iosephus whole tyme siege occupiyng citie slayn ten hundred thousand people consumed death agayne ledde awaye captyue seuen nynty thousande despysed counted thynges naught thirty wer sold one peny recompenced christ hand whome bought iudas traitour thirty penny moste noble excellent people whome god meruailous great signes wonder delyuered egypt broughte lande chanaan yea hee father vnto reueled vnto word handled louyngly gentilly yet despised worde would heare hym made hauocke cause christe euen weeping teares saith thou dyddest know thyngs belong vnto thy peace euen thy daye thou woldest take hede hyd thy eye thou goest foorth carelesse though danger ye matter alwais stand case breake tyme euen handewhy god differrethe hys plage although yet hyd thou seest wyll somme manne saye doothe god deferre punyshement doothe shewe anger streyght wayes falle plaguynge without delaye ueryly god deferreth hys plague ta thys ende euen declare shewe hys longanimitie paciente sufferynge see whether wee wyll amende rom holy apostle sayeth despysest thou rychesse goddes goodnesse pacience longe suffryng knowing kyndenesse god leadeth thee repentaunce lykewyse sayth saynct peter2 pet lord paciente v warde muche woulde haue manne loste wyll receaue men repentaunce yf god shoulde streighte wayes punyshe v oure synnesnote well shoulde lyue verye lyttell whyle therefore god deferreth plague geueth v tyme space repente amend oure lyues woorke wyche greatly setteth forth goodnesse god hyghely commendethe excedynge great mercy towarde v deuyll beynge angry spirite doothe thys yf coulde kyll man fyllyp woulde doo god mercyfulle therefore doothe deferre hys punyshemente yet wyll forgeue excepte repentaunce come wycked men greately abuse lenitie longe sufferyng god meanes becomme carelesse doo onely amende also become dayly worse worse wee haue adulterer vsurers theues suche lyke exaumple whiche hand punished lyue without feare perswade theym selues shall longe continewe yf thou bee wyse bee ware eschewe daunger betymes thou heareste god vseth deferre punyshement conceale wynke faulte tyme yet payne auferred beecause deferred neyther punyshemente taken awaye made delay thereof therfore returne ryght waye betymes repent amende christ saith hydde thyne eye though saye paine hydde lette deceaue thee thou shalt kyll thou haste kylled prophet nowe dissemble matter suffer beare thynges thys y cause thou thynkest shall alwayes go thus thee therfore manne earnestly goeth repente amende knowe thou thou haste escaped punishement thou couldest onely beleue thou wouldest deuise howe escape payne forasmuche thou doest beleeue thou arte secure carelesse neglectest tyme thy visitation wherin thou art moued repentit moste greu u synn dispise worde god wherein also thou myghtest restored vnto fauour god art thou nothyng moued perill lieth hydde synne wrath vengeance god shall fall vpon thee vtterly destroy thee marke howe diligentlye therfore place syn god recouteth greatest christ gathereth syns one yt say sonnes perdition regarde word god let go sermon admonition thoughe deafe meane season thynke theyr matter wille falle oute euyll goe foorth without repentaunce synne ierusalem citie full bloudrepente england amende euen englande also tymes paste yea late yeares haue ben ful bloud manyfold persecution word besydes sin many ierusale fornication adultery vsery couetousnes theft spoilyng ye poore oppression widow fatherles gluttony dronkennes c nowe saieth christ mynde reproue thynges worde ye might amende eschue wrathe god cause sent vnto prophetes iohn baptist myne apostle yea self taught among wrought miracle left nothyng vndone requisite necessary amedement saluation sinnes shold easily forgeue ierusalem shold remayn ye wold know tyme youre visitation come vnto swearde armour meke gentyll lyke sauiour teache cry repent repent amend iere amend heare obediente vnto god anger waxe whote manne quenche thus visite profite nothing ye heape synne vppon synne yea extremely ye haue regarde tyme visitation neyther ye abyde therefore muche ye refuse good counsell good help shal forsake wyll surgion wounded man whiche would go aboute destroye body surgion whiche seketh health sort ye iewes god procureth remission synnes shoulde declared wil mercifull god vnto agayne pardoneth forgeueth al thing clerely though ye neuer offended onely desyre nowe last ye ceasse frome synne receaue word ye blaspheme ye say haue deuyll ye condemne doctrine heresie ioan fully determined put death yea vile ignominious spitefull death crosse muche beastlynesse god dothe determine onely forgeue synnes also geue great abundaunce bothe heauenly worldly benefites turne backes churlishlye refuse yea blaspheme grace sette naughte hys mercye forasmuche matter come poynt nowe remayneth nothyng may appease wrathe god pain plague punyshement must nedes procede suffer ye muste psal refuse peace muste nedes haue warre ye woulde haue blessynge god curse therfore muste nedes fall vppon men abyde remission synnes fauor god hope saluation principall cause anger god fierce great iewes coulde abyde eyther see heare worde god lykewise god afterwarde vtterly refused theyr crienges prayer sacrifice thynges neither coulde anger pacified tyll citie vtterly destroyed pulckt vp rootes neither man neither beast yet lest part citie remayned whereby place situation citie might discerned souldiors laboured vttermost power nothing myght remayn neither citie yet thyngs appertainyng vnto citie horrible terrible example whiche euangelist setteth foorthe gospell present sonday admonyshe warne v wee despise worde god let passe tyme visitation moste woorthy consydered christ saieth nowe thys thynge hyd frome thyne eye mooste parte commeth passe men neuer remember plague punyshement hande god long suffryng sake deferreth payn loketh amendmet world thynketh wyl wink matter regardethe theyr synnes christ sayth although ye doo thynke pain ye see yet knowe ye shall moste certainly come god hath prepared many plague peines punyshementes snare fetter manicles locke boltes stockes cheynes c wicked ye meanes escape first hathe appoynted parentes gouernours housholdesparetes householder hath committed care charge vnruly youth family gouerned ruled power muste delyuered maiestrate correct punyshe hym deuyll remayneth whiche thou canste yet tamed hath muche power thorough sufferance god punyshe thee pestilence famyne drownynge burnyng c man ought thynk preuayl agaynst god shall escape vnpunyshed thou regardest thyne office wilt heare obey word god thou shalt haue hangman deuill thy maisters gouernors whiche shall discipline thee vttermoste bryng thee low thou shalt neuer able rise againe one lift vp thy heade therfore receaue ye doctrine tyme ye maie discerne iudge betweene hidde open payne peyn sinne euer certaine yet hydde hydde dothe deceaue menne salomon also sayeththe plage certen yet hydde ye wycked good profitable men punyshed hand god doth long wink matter meanes kynd mischief encreaseth wicked waxe daiely worse worse thiefe whiche hath daye good lucke hys theftthe delaye punyshement hur eth greatly common wealthes goeth foreward morowe neither thynketh haue worse chance hadde tofore whiche notwithstandyng laste bringeth hym gallowes whyche thynge considered geuen ouer stealyng tyme myght haue escaped vile shameful death lykewise goeth whoremonge adulterer vsurers synners better successe haue beginnyng doyng theyr wyckednes bolder desyrous proceede theyr euyl dede cosyder sentence although payne hid tyme differreda sentence hy remembred yet certayne surely laste come accordyng englishe prouerbe long goeth pot water tyll laste commeth home broken therfore take hede diligently euer remember sayenge though payn hyd tyme deferred yet certain wyll surely last come heathen experience taught sayd god commeth punyshe goeth shoe wolle may vpon wycked plague aware lerne thou thys cease careles although god cometh streight way thunderbolte vtterly destroye thee thy wickednes sinne yet beware aforesee mischiefe come stande feare god vengeance repent betymes garded waited many minister angel hath power many plague warres famyne pestilence c thou canst neuer escape vnpunyshed able sende downe fire frome heauen flame therof vtterly consume thee vnto ash able tempestuous shower rayne otherwise water suffocate smother thee vp able poyson vntymely vnsauery fruictes kyll thee short number plague punyshementes whiche god hath store synners wicked person therefore cause christe carefully monysheth weepeth saieth consyder nowe thy perill hierusalem thynkest thou plague punyshement come vpon thee hyd deferred tyme thou arte greatly deceiued payne hyd end thou shouldest escape free vnplagued thou mayst certayn sure come vppon thee muche thou consyderest tyme thy visitation therfore thou wylt abuse delay long suffring god make one ende synnyng embrace woorde shalt thou prouide well thy selfe thou wilt thou shalt surely perishe come naught maner dothe peter also preache sayinge suppose2 pet longe sufferyng lord saluation say thynke saluation done youre sake ye shoulde damned god shold always punyshe accordyng deserte synne none v shold lyue long world notwithstandyng god doth long suffryng paciently abydeth conuersion deferreth punyshement understande sayth peter thyng done youre saluation ye maye thus saye lorde haue synned diuers way often yet punyshement therof hath folowedgods plage differrede greuous deferred notwithstandyng dothe signifie verily none thyng yt although payn hid yet last surely come yea much greuous differred therefore mercyfull lord forgeue synnes geue grace repente amende offende peter teacheth shoulde vse pacience long suffering god vnto confort saluation god desireth destruction menne neyther deliteth death synners therfore saluation god hideth peyne deferreth punyshment waie good synners daye wrath heape vp wrathe goyng forthe syn god longer deferre plague seyng hope amendement rendreth wicked accordyng wickednes daily experience teacheth theues cease stealing last come gallowes hanged whoremonger adulterer also goyng forward theyr vnclennes last taken brought shame punyshed thus dyd christ plainly declare hierusalem although god yet hyde peyne deferre punyshement yet would laste come miserably plage stiffenecked disobedient people therfore let euery man feare god let thynke lyttel great olde yong synne wyll cease repente punyshement wyll laste come ende exaumple hierusalem plinius lib cap holy beautyfull citie sette forth vnto v whiche citie ethnike history also report goodliest citie easte partes destroyed vtterly brought naught cause subuersion vtter ruine therof made ende synnyng neither would receaue woorde god rather hate persecute suche example dothe christ set forth v gospell wee maye repente amende ell knowe wyll repent shall surely bee plagued althoughe peyne tyme hyd tyme punyshment cometh al praiers supplication vnto god shalbe frustrate vain god saith mouth salomon haue called ye refused haue stretched hand regarded counsel haue ye despysed set correction naughte pro therfore shall also laugh destruction mock thyng ye fear cometh vpon euen thing ye afrayde falleth sodeinly lyke storme youre miserie like tempest yea trouble heuines cometh vpon shall call vpon wil heare shall seke early shall fynd hated knowledge receaued feare lorde abhorred counsayle despised correction therefore shall eate fruites theyr owne way fylled inuentions turnyng away vnwise shal slea prosperitie fooles shalbe owne destruction euen thus didde god handle iewes tyme siege longe euen frome easter vntill september tyme sacrificyng praying syngyng vttermost vayne god shutte vp eares reason hyd deferred punyshment myght heare word repent amend knowe tyme theyr visitation thyngs dyd good indurate hard herted styffenecked people therfore publyshed punyshement hyd hym selfe coulde bee founde place oseas prophete thretnethe also kyngdome israell osee shall come shepe bullockes seeke lorde shall fynde hyme gone theim example therfore ought neglected set naught asmuche god hath suche place store wyll tyme bryng lyghte let v feare hym forasmuch doth take vengeance synnes hande geueth v day respite may repent amende let v loue hym moste mercyfull father saye lord knowe thou wylt suffer synne escape vnpunished notwithstandyng lord endue thy grace holy spirite maye amende escape punyshement peyne thy moste fierce anger thus repenteth easily obteyneth mercy forgeuenes without doubt hierusalem continued vnto thys daye iewes woulde haue knowen tyme theyr visitation mekely haue sayd vnto god lorde haue offended haue done wickedly synnes moste heynous haue slayn thy seruauntes prophetes notwithstandyng thou hast geuen v thy gospell helpe confort ye humbly thanke thee thou mercyful vnto v geue v grace repent amend amysse may become newe creature serue thee holynesse ryghteousnes dayes lyfe iewes done roman although neuer stronge myghtie hadde neuer bene able doo thynge agaynste yea neuer moued warre agaynste seynge remained continued theyr synne obstinatly without repentance saide tushe ieopardie god cast away citie wher dwellyng place wherin also alone honour worshyp maintened neuer come passe vain bosting vnrepentance god plagued citie ther one stone left vpon vtterly destroyed brought naught made example obstinatly synne wyl amed lyke peynes plague shall also chaunce receaue word god repent comfort doctrine may lern god hydeth payne peace god forgeue synnes cease nowe wickednesse returne vnto god meruayle though synnesynne defende oure synnes obstinatly perseuere continue thys meanes god abyde hee wyll rather make hauocke togyther namely commeth gracious visitation woulde gladdely call v vnto repentance thys citie therefore vnhappiesecuritie destroyeth citie neyther dyd thynge destroye glorious noble title called citie god house dwellyng place god thys made iewes carelesse thought maner shold citie come naught neuer com passe god cast away therefore though kyngdomes worlde came shold neuer preuayle god wyll suffer citie dwelling place destroyed title made bold redresse synfull lyfe regarded visitation worde meanes god compelled forasmuche refused visited vnto peace shoulde visited vnto deathe destruction englishe men also present daie speciall grace mere mercie visited god worde euery condition shewe selues vnworthy syngular goodnes god impugne manifest truth god worde bothe wordes writyngesremember englande beware betyms abuse god worde vnto maintenance couetousnes pride vnclennesse excesse moste greuous synnes therfore feared excepte spedily repent great plague wyl sodeinly fall vpon v whether pestilence hunger ciuile warre inuasion foreyne enemy therfore let v forget example ierusalem miserably destroyed receaued word god despised mai lern gladly hear word god though sinne yet repent amend first part gospell euangeliste maketh mention christ wente temple cast byers seller sayde house house praierthe seconde parte gospellr ye haue made den theues dyd christ meruailous great power reckned miracle able folow except ben without doubte many myghtie marchantes occupier easily ben able withstand christ shold geue place vnto alone without weapon whip euangelist saith toke weightie matter hande gaue place made resistence sheweth euidently christ spake wordes vnto iewes dyd iewes gardein fell backward vnto ground thys act christ christian shall folow therfore let man vse storie ende thoughe eclesiasticall minister corporall temporall iurisdiction christ exerciseth power christ farre excelled power man hee alone agaynste many coulde haue done muche may haue great respect vnto work vnto cause expresseth christ wordes saieth house house prayer ye haue made denne theues cause christe speake suche fierce harde sentence iewes without doubte dyd robbe steale temple matter money changer money dyd exercise bying sellyng shepe ox doues c ye sacrifice euery iewe could bring hym home woulde sacrifice priest deuised thing owne auatage ye papistes time blindnes yt alwais hande plentie cattall peraduenture money also offer ye teple also money history shew semeth thing worthi praise dispraise seyng god appointed commaunded seruice durst bolde condemne thisthe priestes sought glorye god theyr owne gaynes forasmuche thynges made auance sette forth seruice worshipping god myght moste glorious goodly matter priestes dede made pretence dyd thynges sette foorth seruice god wold greatly haue regarded great profite therfore euer dyd dyd god cause theyr owne lucre gain couetousnes moued theyr doctrine commended nothyng sacrifice monkes priestes commende theyr sacrifice massemasse synnes put away grace god obteyned made people swarme goyng masse though ben flockes shepe mean season sought owne priuate commoditie doctrine extolled missall sacrifice vtterly omitted left vntaught true seruice acceptable worshipping god whiche feare god beleue god kepe worde meanes encouraged men go foorth theyr wicked lyfe great securitie without remorse conscience eue played iewishe priestes taughte peoplenote dyd kyll sacrifice muche al thing shoulde goe well theym maye gather prophetes whyche cause spake muche agaynst sacrifice great synne deede suche robbery committed body soules slayne euer whe men taught put confidence trust owne workes grace mercie god thus could christ meanes abide neither ought suffer word god resiste vnto vttermost power without waie vnto saluation men must brought fro owne workes merites vnto sacrifice merite christ vnto mercie god afterwarde must exhorted vnto godly lyfe folowe owne imagination worde god frame selues pointes according vnto yt doth vseth temple ministerie aright doth otherwise abuseth theif murderer soules oseas prophet also calleth priestes kyngdom israel theaues armed saith osee waite passeth waye councell priestes one agreed coucell murder cruelly kepe waye yea dare vnspeakeable mischeife wordes ye prophet describeth great slaughter made amonge people false doctrine wheras duetie comend set forth people sacrifice christ comeded sacrifice beastesthe false doctrine iewishe priestes yt aduatage made kitchin smoke alwayes portion sacrifice meanes men polled pylled money also daunger soules saluation christ meanes could abide therfore made hauocke temple cast bought sold temple threwe downe topled ouer table money chaungers c wold rather thing suffer suche thefte murder maintayned yea vnder pretence god seruice christ ye time miracle exaple exercised diligently iudgement god schismatikes vngodly bishop priest monkes whiche couetousnes worldly thing defende wicked sacrifice masse ydolatrie shall shortly feele zele whote indignation god whe shalbe worthely cast temple contempt men muche haue spoken gospel god father mercy christes sake mought vouchesafe raise vp holye spirite heartes vnto feare faith loue mercifully kepe v worde defend v euil bodely ghostly glory blessed name amen xi sonday trinitie sonday p gospell luke xviii christe tolde parable vnto certayne whiche trusted selues perfect despised two men went vp temple praye one phariseye publican pharisey stode prayed thus hym selfe god thanke thee men extorcioners vniust adulterer publican fast twise weke geue tithe possesse publican standynge farre woulde lyfte vp eye heauen smote breaste sayinge god mercyfull sinner tell man departed home house iustified euery man exalteth hym selfe shalbe brought lowe humbleth hym selfe shalbe exalted exposition christ gospell teacheth v humble lowlyhumilitie becometh true christian vertue onely none grace fauour god obtayned described set forth v two men say phariseye publicane phariseyes amonge iewes euen monckes nonnes amonge v tyme papistriephariseys ware apparel contrary comon fashion certein day appointed fastinge prayinge pretended suche holynes life conuersation al men comparison counted sinner therof name phariseye hebreue tong asmuch say englishe man exempted deuided nomber people suche one meanes abyde counted lyke publicanes officer v gather tributepublicanes tolle custome c people hyred office certein summe money afterwarde pollynge pilling suche craftie iniurious wayes made moste could deuise vnto greate greuaunce therfore reported men couetous person synners naughty packes asmuche suche office polled pylled could get wrongfully vexed people takyng dutie haue therfore lyke righteous also iudged amonge phariseyes ther none euill christ iudgeth farre otherwise pronouncing publican righteous phariseye synnerchristes iudgement phariseye publicane yea greuous sinner luke prosecuteth description meruailous odiously doth bytterly reporte matter man would maruaile thus beginneth parable certein men trusted selues righteous despised two moste fowle filthie vice luke describeth phariseyes content one sinne trusted selues sinne hainous ynough also despised consider thou wt thy selfe fastynge praying profite moster whome ye deuil hath puffed vp th suche pride spiritually corporally doth glorie himselfe owne workes merites also despyseth though saye shoulde testifye mine owne righteousnes vaine looke equitie sinceritie god cause great often fastes almose dedes prayer c residue ye iewes able compare pay faithfully truly tithe could defraude deceaue priestes duty wold vnrighteousnes ther thig two greuous synnes phariseyein holy man god wil finde said two moste haynous vice incomparable pride haultines minde contempte despysynge yea suche great counteth extorcioners vnrighteous person adulterer c poore publican specially namelye pointeth setteth foorth saying publican standeth hereby deceaueth men polleth pylleth men catcheth snatcheth taketh raketh come fyshe co meth nette suche sorte god thackede righteousnes holynes moste absolute consumate perfect comparison moste vile spitefull vice yea iudgement men vse comenlye sayeto despysed ther great synne thou wilte onely despise comparison odious howe muche abhominable synne god synne god detestethe abhorrethe pride haultynes mynd gospell may moste cheifly seme appoynted ende christe fygure shadowe describe set forth vnto v true righteousnes maye discerned knowen counterfaite false pharisaicall hypocriticall righteousnes thoughe shoulde saye peraduenture thou maiste chaunce man whiche outwardly representethe holynes angel fasteth praieth geueth almose fornicatour committeth none adultery hurteth man heareth sermon diligentlye commeth oftentimes vnto lordes table c howe canst thou otherwise thincke one good righteous man saye vnto thee thou desirest know thorowly thou muste looke vpon outwarde visare onely hipocrite also may haue thou muste consider righteous god concerning outwarde apperaunce euen phariseye righteous wyshed many worlde sufficient therfore diligently take hede thou doste trust vnto righteousnes god thou learnestpride abhorred god howe haynous synne abhorred god prid namely lurcketh lyeth hydde vnder glorious beautifull righteousnes pride cause iob esa pet gene deuill tombled hedlonge heauen downe hell fyre pride also brought destruction paradise first parent howe could phariseye proud hypocrite nombred among people god must fast muste praye must paye tenthes must kepe selues faithful true wyffes may extorcioners may hurte must al thinges truly according worde god notwithstanding thing cotaminated pollutedvayne glorye pride corruptethe good workes defiled thorow pharisaicall pride yt nothig vile god nothing abhominable seing yt worldly matter couted greuous man become slaue thorow benefites yt hath receaued according como prouerbe nothig derely bought yt geuen god alow yt righteousnes auaunceth bosteth setteth foorth selfe case holines made double wickednes doth hipocrite wt god god sayth doste thou see good righteous thou hast world ful extorcioners brybers theaues vnrighteous persos epicure whoremonger adulterer c good holy vertuous righteous myrroure goodnes holines vertue righteousnes fast pray geue almose whatsoeuer thy law requireth lorde greatlye arte thou indebted vnto greate rewarde layde vp heauen consider thinges god remember lyke men intollerable pride proude hipocrite suche pride doe euer lawe god requireth euen vtter moste yea thoughe shoulde geue hymselfe burnt glorie god yet could please god shoulde hym moste greuous synne playne abhomination god abhorreth pride sainct peter saith1 pet lowlye humble heartes god resisteth proude geueth grace humble lykewise saith sainct iames humble selues sight lorde iac shall lyfte vp sauiour christ sayth euerye one exalteth hymselfe luke shall brought lowe soeuer humbleth hymselfe shalbe exalted therfore saith christ ye counted righteous embrace true righteousnes euen whiche agreable word god aboue thinges take hede pride let pride ioyned righteousnes holynes although sainctes holye men diuerse wayes offende many tymes fall moste greuously rede noe lot dauid peter magdalen c yet god doth heauely take doth lyue moste holyly proud bragge boaste yea contemne condemne comparison selueswhat christen humilitie christe therfore concludeth gospell maner exalteth hymselfe shal made lowe humbleth himselfe shall made highe euery man maye learne humilitie despise man christian humilitie man esteme hymselfe apostle sayth let man stand hye owne conceate rom becometh esteme himselfe iudge hym selfe yt modest sober geuing honour go one item high minded make selues equal ye lower sort wise owne opinion magnifieth himselfe lifteth vp brystles learning beauty richesse holines righteousnes c like phariseye beholdeth fasting considereth true paying tenthes meanes standeth greatly owne conceat doth christ forbyddethe publican example true humilitie poore publican see suche thing thinges humble lowly bosteth nothyng lamenteth bewayleth former wycked lyfe humblenes hearte besecheth god mercifull vnto forgeue synnes learne ye also sayth christ yt ye may say glory nothing although would glory knowledge richesse power1 cor wisedom righteousnes holynes c yet god may answer saye hast thou thou hast receaued therfore gyftes doest thou bragge boaste doest thou reioyce thing right reioycing mine whiche geue thee gyftes thyne receauest thy dutie rather know gyftes may taken fro thee moment thou proude bragge boste mightest thou well reioyce triumphe deuill saye confesse haue worde god haue bene alwayes redy hande helpe wretched synners suche daunger desperation confortyng teachyng monishing shoulde also deny good haue geuen large liberal almes poore necessitie thinges deuill thou canst reprehend disalow thus may christen man iustly without offence god reioyce triumphe deuill gyftes whiche vse god whome haue thinges whome euery good gyfte euery perfecte gyfte cometh may meanes reioyce towarde hym vse humilitie lowlines hearte bodye mekely reuerence confessinge gyftes god therfore ought boste seke oure owne prayse glory exercise alwayes magnifye liberalitie lyberall geuer moreouer neighbour also despised ought rather thincke maner asmuche gyftes haue properly god thynges procede come although haue moe giftes neyghbour hath yet god one worde able sodenly make change inuerte thing neighbour one vertue shalbe commended god luke euer haue reade gospell poore wydowe caste treasury onelye two mytes riche men put greate somme money therfore praised christe maner trueth saye vnto poore wydowe hath put shoulde glorye reioyce uerily ought rather feare many giftes god endowed lest shoulde abuse vnto dishonour god hinderaunce neyghbour damnation soule ought alwayes thus thincke god geueth gyftes creature according good pleasure one geueth much lytle possible whiche hath lytle may haue god mercifull vnto hym hath muche reason hath muche shall render accompte muche hath lytle accompte shalbe slenderer madde dotyng proud phariseye doth contrary ashamed saye menne yet lyke publicane geue tythes polleth pylleth deceaue noman spoileth many short opinion phariseye himselfe passeth al men faultie nothing contrariwise yt publicane al naught worste one good qualitie hipocrite rather haue said maner pay tithe faithfully truly fast al dare trust workes whatsoeuer haue thy gifte lord possible publicane doth please thee would haue set publican least iuste would haue saide matter standeth point whether man hath receaued much litle whome god merciful shold proud despise seing yt al thing consiste mercy god gyftes euery hath receaued doth arrogat proud phariseye glorieth reioiceth owne righteousnes standeth praieth god wil christe therfore proude righteousnes man also ought despaire though circumuented deceaued deuill fall synne haue one god stretcheth forth garment mercie vpon v euen vpon righteous synnersall glory ought god alone vpon learned vnlearned vpon riche poore god therfore glorie ought taken awaye thinges onely reposed mercie god meanes al maye humble selues maiestie god haue respect whether haue receaued muche lytle god maye mercifull hym hath lytle hym hath much worlde necessarie yt difference persones office gyftes suche difference v god seing accepteth v fauour man glorie boste auaunce hymselfe god without exception muste nedes humble selues maye know although ther difference among v worlde yet god one neither one better none otherwise loke vpon hath muche vpon hym hath lytle meanes maye learne embrace grace mercye god righteous synners riche poore stronge weake c whatsoeuer haue come god haue nothing themselues synne sinne man cause pride rather humilitie feare whatsoeuer goodnes remaineth altogether god gyfte hath cause glory giftes thou thy parte dutie vse gyftes god reuerently thanckes geuing god meanes abide pride boasting also thou felest ye fearcenes thy sinne thou doste therfore despayre rather truste mercie saye haue muche yet haue god yea hym mercifull god therfore wil take good parte looke vocation calling euen muche diligence labour power god hath geue wil despyse man wil proude thynge haue suche haue neuer enuie disdaine ynoughe haue one comon god god therfore wil vnequall worlde vnequall unto hath christ respecte cocludeth parable sayth exalteth hymselfe shal made lowe humbleth himselfe shalbe exalted though saye whe haue gotten suche sainctes holy person referre thinges howe muche humble abase selfes muche geue haue therfore proude puffed vp wil take lytle lytle tyll last anger cast downe hedlonge euerlastyng damnation phariseye ben proude humbly rehearsed gyftes vnto god sayd lord thou hast geuen muche thou haste geuen strength resiste synne thy gyfte glad therof yet proude therfore thou maist take awaye thy good pleasure shalbe phariseye say done god wolde haue increased gyftes dayly towarde asmuche gyftes hath abuseth vnto owne pride glorie therfore iudgeth condemneth haue lyke gyftes reiected god remayneth nothing worthie prayse comendation iudgement christ publicane went home righteous phariseye saye phariseye vnrighteous damned geuen ouer alredy deuill hell fyre profite hath bosting gloryinge publicane sayth god mercifull sinner made saincte congregatio accordyng desire hath god merciful vnto hym christ wil haue doctrine v al may know haue thou endued richeshowe god gyftes vsed strength health bodye house lande worldly goodes gyfte appertayning vnto body soule vse thanckes geuer enuy god shall encrease giftes thee auoide pride despise man though gyftes excellent thin remember thinck thou seest man haue thou haste notwithstanding maye haue god mercifull thou hast therfore despise neither disdaine thou haue nighe vnto thee shall god glorified moreouer hipocrites dishonoure god greatly although mouth openly yt would iudge according ye wordes phariseye must nedes say yt euil spoken yt phariseye saith thack thee god wordes yt true sainctes vse prayer sence meaning geue thanckes god thyng cofesse yt haue receaued gyfte benefite god phariseye thincketh el wold haue said thus adulterer extorcioner vnrighteous persone c ascribe none lord thee alone co cerninge selfe thy grace assist lyfe better mennes lyke neyther one iustly reioyce againste phariseye minde cleane contrary saith thancke thee men chalengeth himselfe wholle power though author righteousnes god thought wolde haue added wordes thy gyfte lord cometh selfe saith wordes declareth euidetly himselfe copious abundant good workes able also geue vnto god therfore geueth thanckes god dede although nameth hymselfe owne reason freewill strengthes hath done much true whosoeuer hath thynge geuen god must acknowledge geue god thanckes absurdititie thou shouldest denie thy selfe wyser better learned asse brute beast lyke maner hath goodes rich geuen god ought playe dolte shold saye begger hath nothinge ought euen heartie thanckes confesse ye gyftes benefites god helpe necessitie hath done dutie wel serued diligently office calling hath holpen neighbour substance councell geuen almes poore c ought saye haue done good lewde folishe humilitie vsed giftes god acknowledged celebrated magnified yet true humilitie shewed must say thigs thine lord mine thou gauest el shold haue haue therfore thy giftes render vnto ye humble heartie thackes ye true waye humilitie good giftes god couted thing nothing extenuated abased matter smal reputation acknowledged set forth ye vttermost yet may proud despise haue oftentimes said must speake maner say lord thy giftes thou gauest vnto hath hurteth hindereth nothing hath thee merciful god vnto haue oh shold despise humilitie doth christ require gospel yt aboue al thigs shold eschew pride disdainfulnes arrogacie hautinesse mide one decreed yt exalteth himselfe shalbe brought lowe god forgeue owne peculier people suffred destroyed pride sake many greate kyngdomes also haue fallen come ruine faulte lucifer pride caste downe highe heauens vnto depe dongeon hell fyre adam eue vice cast paradise therefore consider diligently thy parte thus saye lorde whatsoeuer haue thine thou mayst take whatsoeuer tyme pleaseth thee meanes shalte thou eschewe pride cease despise leane sure ancker truste vnto whiche vncertein despiseth order lyke madde man goeth forth bragge boste himselfe though whatsoeuer hath owne came god heareth iudgement god take gyftes hath geue portion lake burneth fyre brimstone whiche lorde defend v god mercy sake geue v grace acknowledge gyftes humilitie thancke praise hym worlde walke worthy kyndnes worlde come maye enioye lyfe euerlastynge thorowe hym whyche true lyfe euen christ iesus lord whome god father holye ghost honour glorie praise euer amen xij sonday trinitie sonday p gospell marc vii iesus departed frome coastes tyre sydon came vnto sea galile througe myddes coastes tenne city brought vnto hym one deafe impedyment speach prayed put hande vpon taken aside people put finger eares dyd spitte touched tongue loked vp heauen syghed saide vnto hym ephata saye opened strayghtwaye care opened stryng tongue loused spake playne commaunded tell man forbadde muche greate deale published saying hathe done thinges well hath made bothe deafe heare dumbe speake exposition gospel easie nothing hard forasmuche onely conteyneth myracle whyche christe wroughte dumme deafe manchriste alone sauiour concernyng suche lyke miracle ye heare oftentymes yeare christ meanes hath declared sauiour helpeth defendeth v agaynst violence deuyll therfore oughte geue thankes vnto god whiche hath geuen vnto v suche sauiour owne mere grace tender mercy alwais hand redy assist v againste suche pernicious hurtfull thynges sathan imagineth deuiseth v touchyng myser wretched creature suche miserable wretched state vse naturally neither tonge earesthe deuyl author euyll plage stroke satan iudgement men thoughte naturall vice men know deuyl author many calamity misery maketh men lunatike madde tormenteth body also soules beyng vtterly dismayed may thynk confort loked fall desperation fyne vnto damnation uerily nothing el stroke plague deuil author sorowes misery hurteth many oft therfore moste indebtedly bounde god ought tymes geue hym humble heartie thankesan whole healthefull bodye gyfte god hauyng pitie v hath sent sonne christ iesu oure lorde thys worlde healpe onely thys wretched creature v also mercyfully keepe defende v bee afflicted lyke euyls disease thorough violence tyrannye deuyll thys muste thynke eye eares handes feete c beynge wholle sounde chaunce naturally reason iudgeth gyftes god notwithstandynge menne beleue thynke vile base thinges comon geuen lyuyng creatureswhy god fulfrethe deuyll hurte v god euen necessitie compelled many tymes geue deuyll lybertie take away frome certaine menne vse theyr eares eye handes feete c yea sometyme also kylle theyr body menne maye learne done deuyll thorow permission sufferaunce god meanes may bee earnestly moued geue god thankes great mercy defendeth preserueth v agaynst fyery dartes euyll ephe euen deuyll thys lykewyse worke deuyl hee blyndeth heartes men thorowe false doctrine see receaue truthe2 cor thys cometh god whyche good1 timoth author goodnesse whyche wysheth man peryshe men come vnto knowledge truthe commeth deuyll whyche euyll author euyll whiche wysheth also men perysh neuer come vnto knowledge truthe therfore god geueth libertie dothe muche myschiefe deuise euen tree bryngeth forth good fruict afterwarde wormes come destroye itnote well fault herof god whyche made tree good neyther faulte tree fruicte woormes whyche hurte thynges good wyth v menne therfore must learne euer aduersitie myschaunce doothe happen vnto v commethe plague stroakes deuyll namely wee bee christianes seeke glorye lorde oure god deuyll greatter ennemye vnto christian tothe infidells vndoubtedlye horrible maketh euerye part man shake considergod helpethe v agaynste deuyll hys sonne enemy deuil hath muche power harme hurt contrary part gospell conforteth v see iohn saith sonne god hath appered ende1 iohn destroy workes deuyll seyng deuyl presumed go paradyse destroy workes god make righteous holy persones speake adam eue disobediente wicked people semed good agayne god reuenged enemie gen therfore recouereth maketh whole agayn whatsoeuer destroied deuyll destroyeth agayne deuyls workes say synne death hell see gospell deliuereth tonge oute bondes wherwith deuyll bounde tyed openeth eares whiche deuyll stopped christ came doo woorke dothe styll continually among christian shall herafter heare thus muche miracle worke christ wherby hath declared hymselfe healper suche myserie wyll heale euyls affliction whiche deuyll heapeth vpon v yea vtterly putte hym awaie frome v moreouer christ would also shew vnto v two thynges specially appertayn vnto christianchristen men must haue theyr eares opened theyr tonges losened saye eares bee opened tongue losened exercyseth worke diligentlye congregation church agaynst deuyll concernynge corporall benefite eares tongue vse geueth also heathen spirituall benefite onely amonge christian openeth eies loseneth tongue certaine sure rom iacob saluation commeth v onely worde god otherwise coulde knowe christe sacrifice holy ghost wyl god c wherfore alsogladly heare worde god gyfte god euen dayes excedynge great miracle moste hygh benefite god geueth man eare gladly heareth worde suche tongue dothe blaspheme blesse glorifie god aduersaries papistes muche miserable aworse case dumbe wasthe papistes deaff dumme eares stopped although heare worde god yet heare meane vnto profite edifying heare iewes christ excellently preached forgeuenes sinnes euerlastynge lyfe vnderstode nothyng delyted sermon christ contrarywyse vtterlye madde blasphemed christ doctrine suche wyll heare worde god deafe dumbe farre worse case miserable man gospell maketh mencion doo nothynge ell tongue blasphem spitefully rayle vpon worde god excellent precious iewelle gladdely heare word god vnto whome christ saythe sayd dumbe man ephata sayegod openeth eares hys worde opened haue benefit hearyng healpe geuen dede deuyll god hath opened vnto v none way vnto heauen word holy gospell gladly heareth diligentely kepeth hath hys chiefe delyght safe without danger one miracle whiche euen daye churche among men eares whiche deuyll thorowe synne hadde stopped made open word may heare worde god doctrine saluation toucheth tongue maketh speake rom paule saythe hearte beleued vnto righteousnesse mouthe confession made vnto saluation beleue christ obteyn therby remission sin thiswe muste bothe beleue confesse worde necessary also confesse open speache felt beleued heart maketh christenman workes doo possible monke may faste watche wearye bodye thenne christian hee made christian manne thys one thynge fayleth yet deafe dumbe wyll heare worde muche lesse confesse christen manne heareth beleeueth afterwarde confessethe two thynges make christian manne thus christ exercysethe hys woorke dayely congregation spiritually woorde wroughte thenne corporally hee myghte testifye howe hee geueth healpe agaynste vniuersall myschiefe deuyll specyally agaynste spyrituall wyckednesse sathan deuyll wee myghte stedfastely beleue put oure whole truste hym nowe muste consyder thys also christe meaneth thys ceremoniewhy christ vsed many circumstaces restoryng thys man hys healthe vseth thys deafe dumbe persone people broughte thys wretched man vnto christe desyred hym lay handes vppon hym christ taketh hym asyde people putteth fyngers eares spitteth touchethe hys tongue hee looketh vp heauen mourneth sayeth ephata thys muste sygnifye speciall matter seyng christ vseth suche circumstance doyng miracle passyng wrought nowe therfore muche haue declared dumbe deafe lette v consyder also meruaylous ceremonye thys christ woulde specially vse thys miracle neuerthelesse hee myghte haue doone wyth one woorde thys moste euident playne euer christ spake worde streyght wayes woorde tooke effect ueryly christe soo exquisite ceremonye hathe respecte spirituall miracle thys wyll shewe harde matter restore deaffe theyr hearynge vnto dumbe speache hee rayseth vppe lazarus one woorde iohn math manne sycke palsey hee sayde ryse walke immediatly made whole wyth thys manne whyche deafe dumbe pleased hym vse suche speede hee doothe vse syngular kynde proceedynge order woorkynge thys myracle puttethe hys fyngers deafe mannes eares hee towcheth tongue wyth spetle hee looketh vppe heauen mournethe last saieth ephata thou opened might signifie vnto v yf escape bondes deuyll haue redy tong speake open eares heare must done external outward worde ministerie agayn outwarde signes sacramentes hath appoynted bee vsed hys churche worde fyrst hearde baptisme lordes supper must ioyned thertonote thys well vnto whyche thinges holy ghost commeth deliuereth eares tongue frome bondes may lerne auoyd sectary despise outward word sacramentes loke tyll god talketh inwardly christ saith thys fynger euen outward worde thys oughte sounde men eares spettle wherewith tongue muste touched made moyste shall woorke well prosperously procede ye may see outward word sincerly taught christian wher taught none therefore lette euery man prouide followe steppe let hym gladly heare worde god god wil shyne geue glorious lyght gospell thy hearte except thou firste heare woorde thou bee desirous see knowe hym must done onely worde sacramentes without holy ghoste wille procede workynge god hymselfe euen heauens protested vnto v whenne hee sayde derely beloued sonne greatly delyte math heare hym christ also gaue commandement disciple go worlde teache baptise nation agayn mat marc luc heareth heareth dothe christ open mouth comaunde gospel shold preached men baptised comandement sheweth true way vnto saluation none heareth saith heareth therfore thou wilt heare worde god heare thy father thy mother thy preacher pastor finally thy prince magistrate c saye thou hearest thou hearest god except executynge office commaunde thynge contrary worde god heard must obey god men act must fyrst word god congregation afterwarde menne one case excepted soeuer thy pastor curate thy parentes magistrate saye thee saieth god vnto thee must thou remember receaue obey hee amonge v woulde take long iorney go vnto suche churche wher might heare god preache men would glad heare know voyce christe saieth wyll brynge passe nerer home thou shalte nede trauayle farre heare thy pastor thy parentes haste thou hearde disciple thou hearest wil sound thy heart ephata thou opened deafe person thy eares maye opened thy tonge set libertie thou hensforthe may deafe thy heryng dombe thy speaking thou wer afore goeth ye world child housholde although heare theyr parentes maystersdisobediente child seruauntes yet woulde doo least thynge commaunded theym except compelled suche stubburnesse disobedience reigneth nowe day heartes theym oughte moste humble moste obediente family lykewyse common welthes men negligent slow obey officer soeuer ordeyne realme citiedisobediente subiectes ye shall fynde fewe amonge greate multitude wyll trewely syncerely execute commaundement magistrate subiectes shewe disobedience towarde hygh power time theyr great knowledge dydde tyme darkenesse ignorancie blyndnes suche wyckednes ingratitude oure moste wycked ingrate worlde apparant also howe fewe whiche true zeale feruent desire heare sermon whyche euidentely knowen onely fruictes also thys moste specially men townes village yea city also moste vnworthyly handle theyr minister pastor onely railyng vnreuerently themthe vnreuerent handling spirituall minister dayes also takyng awaye vniustly suche tythes dueties publyke order apoynted vnto therfore worthy payne foloweth euen worde god pronounced parent minister churche magistrate neglected nothinge set deuill litle litle shold stop eares tye theyr tongue streyghter afore set suche case abyde either heare speake worde god parte maketh eares wide open heare dotyng dreames sectariesthe wycked worlde heareth gladlyer robyn hood word god false diuellyshe doctrine agayne heare baudye balades fylthy fable triflyng talke whorish wordes suche lyke corrupte bothe bodye soule loseneth setteth libertie also tong blaspheme god slaunder theyr neyghboure lye backbyte rayle scoffe ieste c maye offence good godly men rewarde worthy suche ingratitude vnthankfulnesse vngentylnesse yea playne churlyshenesse worthely chaunceth vnto theym sorte wyshe bee none otherwyse shall bee ende uerily thynges shall go hauocke woorde god shall taken awaye v seynge wee haue noo delyghte therein wrytten would none blessing psal therefore shall bee farre frome hym oure sauiour christe sayeth condemnation lyghte comme worlde iohn menne haue loued darkenesse thenne lyght woorkes euyll place woorde shall wycked decree antichriste bee thruste churcheo englande take hede tymes saye thou art warned countrey shall oppressed diuers kyndes plague pestilence famyne tempestes c oure common wealthe shall tourned common wo myseries yea mooste greuous intollerable shall ouerflowe oure countreye insurrection commotion rebellion conspiracy tumultes ciuile warre murderynge one c al thing except repent tourne vnto god heart gladly heare word tong magnify ye vttermost yea frame fashion lyfe couersation according doctrine therof shal realme spoile foreyne nation hath ingratitude worthely deserued whiche beyng prouoked often many benefites hand god wyll notwithstandyng onely repent also ought procede faith faith vertue vertue go vice vice syn synne cease daily heape whote wrath horrible vengeance god vpon v destruction countrey vnto damnation selues body soule cause christ loketh vp heauen mourneth one greatly troubled saith ephata opened greatly greueth sauior christewhy christe lokethe vp heauen mournethe good pleasure mercyfull wille god delyuer v frome bandes sathan thorough woorde wee people without reason refuse oure owne saluation thorowe contumacie stubbornesse haste vnto selues euerlastynge damnation prouoke
