wrathe vengeance god fall vpon v therfore let v consider well miracle folowe example good mengod praysed hys gyftes whiche glorifye commende prayse magnifye christ affyrmynge openly confessyng hathe doone well hee greate mercye infynyte goodnesse hathe made deaffe heare dombe speake thys dooth sauioure christe fynger spetle euen thys houre yea continually worlde eares deefe maye bee opened tongue dumbe losened outewarde woorde whyche heare churche pastours mynistersthe word god christes fynger spettle home oure parentes thys woorde holye ghoste woorketh myghtely v none thynge marke welle soo muche studiously diligently embrace thou word thys next certaine waye eares may opened oure tongue losened selues laste obteyne euerlastyng saluation whyche thynge oure lorde sauiour christe iesu graunte v hys mercy sake whome wyth god father holy ghoste honour glory prayse dominion worldes withoute ende amen xiii sonday trinitie pthe gospell luke x happye eye whiche see thinges ye see tell manye prophetes kinges haue desired see thinges whiche ye see haue seene heare thing ye heare haue heard behold certaine lawyer stode vp tempted saying maister shall inherite eternall lyfe sayde vnto written lawe howe readest thou aunswered saide loue lorde thy god thy harte al thy soule thy strength thy mynde thy neyghboure thy selfe sayd vnto hym thou hast aunswered right thou shalt liue wyllyng iustifie selfe saide vnto iesus neyghbour iesus aunswered sayde certaine man descended ierusalem hierico fell amonge thieues whiche robbed hym rayment wounded departed leauynge hym halfe deade chaunced came downe certaine priest waye sawe passed likewise leuite went nye place came loked passed certayne samaritane iourneyed came vnto hym sawe compassion went bounde vp woundes powred oyle wine sett hym owne beast brought hym common inne made prouision hym morowe departed toke two penny gaue host said vnto take cure soeuer thou spendest come agayne wyll recompence thee whiche nowe three thynkeste thou neyghbour vnto hym fell amonge thieues saide vnto shewed mercye hym sayde iesus hym go thou lykewyse exposition thys gospel long therfore wyll selecte chose one two partes thereof whyche wee maye remember fele fru ct swetnesse thereof fyrst part christ greatly extolleth auanceth hys woorde gospellthe fyrste parte gospell turnyng hym selfe vnto disciple sayd vnto blessed eies se thing ye se say vnto many prophetes kynges woulde haue seene thynges whyche ye doo see haue seene haue hearde thynges whych heare haue heard christ mynd confirme strengthen v agaynst miserie whiche see worldethe worlde despyseth gospell christe asmuche nothyng vile despised wicked worlde gospell worlde abyde heare doctrine lye heresy gospell wyll neyther see heare yea worlde blasphemeth persecuteth moste cruelly vexeth kynde tormentes professe hath bene great store example certaine yeares pitie realme englande yet dyuers place worlde thys seeth christe therefore hee comfortethe disciple sayth world blasphemeth gospell hee wyse heare hathe blessed happy eares indebtedly bounden geue god thanks therfore made partaker thereof may worthily magnifye whyche worlde dothe contemptuously handle spitefully entreate moste certayne ye happier blessed dauid kynges thys al theyr desyre myghte lyue tyme myghte see wyth theyr bodylye eye beholde myracles heare sermon theyr desyre coulde obtayne full tyme god hadde appoynted frome euerlastynge yet come spirite eye theyr faithe sawe mee commynge fleshe byrthe passion deathe resurrection ascension c greately reioycednote well vnto geuen see fleshe beholde myracles also heare sermon therfore see ye thankfull god suche felicitie chaunced vnto ye may heare see state miserable specially without gospellthey miserable whiche haue knowlege gospell lytle litell error crepe yea errour vpon errour heaped ther almost ende errours heresy muche hardly many tymes canne defende oure selues agaynst ala sorowe experience hereof muche tyme papacie last matter came poynt deuyll taken preacher credite geuen vnto hym whatsoeuer fayned busy wicked spirites moste vayne lyeng preacher touchyng masse pylgremages purgatory pardon suche lyke trumperie euen place soeuer worde errours lie receaued beleued opinion also yt way vnto saluation dede leadeth streyght vnto hell dyuell contrarye parte gospell present great madnesse reigneth world fewe receaue therfore maye well truely saye state v men moste myserable harde god denyeth v worde without destruction oure soules geue v world refuseth beste men god woulde haste commynge vnto iudgement shortly make ende wicked wretched synnefull worlde thys vnthankefulle worlde neuer better whether god sendeth vnto punyshementes benefites truely sayd iohn1 iohn worlde sette vpon wyckednes fyrste thynge wherof christ complayneth offereth geueth worlde worde remission synnes yet worde despised set naught therfore turneth hymselfe disciple sayth ye blessed whiche haue worde god heare ye dyed reueled brought light say vnto moste mightie puissant kyngs worthie prophetes also would gladly haue liued time haue sene heard thinges yet wickednes worlde whereas may haue plentie abundaunce noble thynges regardeth let wickednes worlde trouble behaue selues ye voyde greate grace ye maye take fruite therof christ place manifestly appeareth intendeth commende set foorth worde make men desirous contemne despise maner worlde see degree highe lowe persecute gospell despise lessest parte worlde receaueth thanckes geuinge amende liues thus onely blessed happy haue blessed eares eye whiche great merciful gyfte god firste part oure gospell parte christ putteth foorth fruite gospell good workes whiche ought ensue god worde preached doth describe wyth playne example certaine man whiche descended ierusalem chaunced vpon robber whiche beaten robbed lefte halfe dead chaunced prieste wente waye whiche seynge hym passed nothynge moued helpe hym lykewyse leuite came prieste regarde vnto hym laste came samaritan whiche holye name gentile neyther kyn al wretched man iewe came stocke prieste leuite dyd stranger seeth miser greued misfortune goeth downe beaste poureth oyle wyne wondes byndeth vp putteth hym beaste walketh fote hymselfe carrieth wonded man inne wheras could tarrie longe ther busines committeth hym hoste geueth monye ouersee hym vntill retourneth maner men gospell makethethis second picture christ peinteth frutes worde christian charitie worde doth make suche men samaritan gentle mercifull whiche despise men calamitie see bestow goodes helpe speake poore nedie lewde part beggar purpose seketh gaynes sorte take monie serue eyther helpe sycke anie thyng must nothing geuen wheras nedie persones dede doth christian minde behaue hymself example samaritan thinketh poore man neyghbour man made bodye soule yea hath god haue wherfore nigh vnto kyn brute beast ye deuil wherfore wel forsake hym embraceth hym brother leaste shoulde perishe without helpe taketh compassion father ye true saint stonie hearted saintes hath naturall pitie toward wretched men excedynge great chorlishenes thincke god therwith delighted serue therfore thinke yt bounde helpe prieste doth holy one office kyn doth christe pronounce euen sawe miserable man passed bythe opinion holines puffethe men vp pride makethe vnmercifull truly mischeuous holy one seeth neighbour perill may helpe yet wherunto lyke truste maintaine pride truely thynge owne holines wheras thynke haue sayde masse done sacrifice songe suche lyke haue done ynoughe nede ynche theyr prescripte suche stonie sainctes yea rather deuelishe sainctes whiche seme counte god dettour owe nothynge man againste monsterous kynde sainctes maketh parable christ place moued example proud hypocrite steppeth foorth declare howe greate godlines thyncketh surelye himselfe christ knewe righteousnes woulde speake worde suche matter presence thinge meaneth saith maister shall obtayne euerlastynge life christe aunswere hym sayth aske thy selfe written lawe howe dost thou read lawyer hath foorth answere sayth thou shalte loue god wyth thy hearte c thy neyghbour thy selfe counteth thinges easie matter christe sayth thou shalte lyue lawyer confounded bold saye done wherfore commeth foorth question sayth neyghbour though saye knowe man whome owe succoure rather know many whiche ought seruice holy man laweyerbut doth christ rise hym vehemence parable wounded man sayth prieste sawe hym passed also leuite iuste thy example samaritane moued mercie helpeth miserable man tel thou therfore ye neighbour wounded man lawyer answered shewed mercie vnto yea pride despised ye name samaritan doth christ reuenge hym saith go like wise though say thou art holy exaple priest leuite thou hast pitie thy neyghbour althoughe perill lyfe yet thou askest thou mayst get euerlasting lyfe thy nedie frindes miserable men thy neyghbours miserie wretchednes ynough worlde yet dost thou beyng great doctour doubt thy neyghbour away trifeling yf thou wilt counted holy samaritan dyd setteth foorth boster well colour plaine meaning nothing el lawyer yet come degree holines samaritan attained vnto wherefore matter hangeth thiswhat loue god learne man loue god neighbour himselfe loue god hard sayinge hath nede seruice yet person present woulde euidently appeare ynough loued woulde put himselfe al danger sake sheweth v person see vse seruice presently men conuersant v wherfore thou wilt know loueth god consider child honor parent howe seruants obey master howe minister churche handled shal ye vnderstand loueth god doth child haue commandement worde god honor thy father mother say let passe father mother honour loue thee exod art god heauen god saye thou hast commandement set forth wherfore thou loue thou must loue honour thy parentes also obey thing true louing god child would haue parent awayeto loue god kepe commaundementes might lyue masterlesse wherefore must nedes true loue god also kyndes life prince hath office officer charge deutie diligently thou aske whether loue god say yea haue cause hate god well graunt answer shewest thou obedience fidelitie thy kynge thou louest god thy hearte thou wouldest faithfull vnto thy kyng wouldest thy office diligence seruaunt house farre paste shame suffer sayed hym hateth god loue hym doth louing god signifie doth signifie kepe god commandement worde christ also saith man loue shal kepe worde thou louest god thou canst despise commandements commandement geueth god seruats doth seruantes promise maisters doth god require promise also meat drynke wage iohn cause maketh couenant shold faythfull doynge suche seruice belonge house shew obedience seruice cause also called seruants serue housholde seruice helpe haue family labour seruice suche housholdes yea rather almost greater disobedience negligence pride amongest suche ye let passe pickynge stealynge many wherfore loue god hate god care worde el woulde shewe diligence seruice last shall rewarded theyr vngodlines lyue tyme lyfe curse god miserie beggerie touchynge pastours minister churche nede place make longe rehersall matter plaine howe handled ruler husbandman neyghbours craftes men courtyers almost kepe hogges set commandement god straight shoulde counted worthie loue honor nothynge denied dewe vnto appeareth malachie malach matth luc christe hymselfe sayth also euery workeman worthie wage wherfore thou maiste denie thy seruant wage euil must thou defraud thy pastour curate euill god commandement moue thee thou sure punishement thy corne beastes thing shall proue ill thou shalte louse therby euer thou tokest thy pastor minister whereby euident worlde onely loueth god full hatered towarde god condition semeth almost tollerable loue god would hate hym deny crime dede hatynge god thou art stubburne thy parent lordes officer thou doste god commaunde thee commaundement thou shouldest obey obedience honour commandement doste thou hate thou canst find thy hearte thou doste refuse hear hit say thou hateste god al men crake loue god wher heare commonly god commandement flee couetousnes exercise vpright bargeining auoid auarice thinges beaten comon sermon muche stuburnely go againste nede prieste care say goodes take vpon rule belongeth vnto prieste belongeth god wil surely reuenge shall see time pestilence famine mischeifes fyre water c shall take thee neither shall knowlege benefite therin wheras thou thou christian mightest get fauour god man fele perceaue thy goodes encrease wherfore cometh passe pope byshoppes tyraunts also townes men rustikes noble men yomen heare also moue persecution againste god worde ought geue honour vnto god worde obey fynde minister churche dew vnto redie catch haue geue stande owne conceites though well wherfore lesson ought borne wel awaye hath worde ought also loue god ought know workes god requireth hym obey hym say lord iesu christ thou hast opened mine eye see know howe thou hast deliuered men death syn thy death hast made heier kyngdome heauen euerlasting lyfe geue thee thanckes great grace gladly thou requirest thou commandest thy precepte shall honour father mother gladly heart thou gauest charge shold serue master faythfully heart worke diligently obedience refuse thy comandement thou haste made mother houswyfe ouer familie well regard thy precepte rather bestow lyfe regard child familie see al diligence seduced fruite ought procede wo de possible god must nedes rewarde christian mento loue god loue thy neyghbour let euery man trye inwardly hymselfe greatly loueth god loue god consisteth thoughtes monkes beleue loue god christe sayth place loue thy neyghbour sayth god thou wilt loue sake thy father mother child wife husband lord require thee consider diligently whether thou dost shalte thou fynde whether thou louest god hate christian men hath worde god loue christ say gladlye heart neyghbour thou hast commanded shall preuented anger impacience like please amende christian thisthe vnkindenes worlde christian wherfore must nedes true citizen husbande men child seruantes officer subiects commonly belonge vnto deuill hate god care commandement wheras made gaue bodie soule founde liuinge gaue begotten sonne whiche greatest al synge hym song eue hatred could would thrust hym heauen suche loue beare god worde go bost thy loue towarde god worde wher thou art ful hatred contrariwise louest shewest obedience vnto whiche v cause death sinne whome thou hast also thy hole delight vtterly disobedient god wherfore worlde generally doth shew obedience deuil cheifly delighted hatred god wha done god hath comanded enemie maketh v subiect sin death could present houre corrupte vitall wold gladly yet obediet suche enemie much geue seeke destruction meane time suffer yt voide frustrat put forth v god yt gaue v thinges especial son euerlasting lif cast away comademet therfore may praise god righteousnes minister v disobedient kinde plagesthe samaritan loue towardes god wherfore leaue loue god samaritan loueth god geueth thinge helpeth miserable wonded man power saith god thou wilt loue serue thy neyghbour hath nede haue nede wherfore samaritan redie serue god whiche heauen monie beast wine oyle god nedeth owne person doth god doth neyghbour therfore taken done god god commanded commanded go pilgrimage rome sainct iames buylde monastery suche lyke thynge helpe one nede saith seeke rome thou shalte finde home thy wyfe child familie lordgod euery place lyke present maiestrate also thy neyghbours house stretes market place euery wher howe make hymselfe nighe vnto thee deuill casteth darke myste ouer worlde see loue god hate deuill wherfore muste learne diligence samaritan loke care woulde haue done beneuolence would haue shewed owne bodye lyke perill doth neyghbour hath dew comendation loueth god neyghbour must learned entent thou also fruite muste nedes folowe haue worde folowe christian men dede priste leuite whiche sainctes without felynge affection passeth neyghbour passeth god wherfore beware example worlde hateth god neyghbour men ye god wil surely recompence thou wilte loue god passe thy neyghbour perill thou shalte escape vnpunished doinge whiche thinge thou sure second doctrine gospell christ parable woulde signifie also benefit hath bestowed v men may tast true frute therof miserable men haue fallen vpon moste cruell robber sin wherby death deuill hath power vpon v hath spoyled rifled v spiritual giftes god gaue v hath also beaten wonded v saye synne cast hedlonge kynd misery rom gal iobn might perishe helpe haue prieste leuite passe geue helpe miser lawe man iustified made righteous neither deliuered sinne last cometh samaritan euen christ iesus lord whome owne people would receaue counted hym samaritan moued mischance washeth wondes wyne poureth helthfull oyle grace taketh cure oure sinnes beareth bodye bringeth v true inne holy church ther chargeth host take cure v minister teacher worde manie appeareth pope byshoppes suche like regarde charge litle churche may hostrie inne steward wherof lewde without faythfulnes humanitie sicke men coursly handled teache worde god persecute shold brynge men christ might deliuered fro syn drowne depely synne yet know christ doth whollie caste awaye hostrie inne yf pope byshops teache vprightly let owne peril thei shal fele last yet meane time christ raiseth vp certein person low degree despised abiecte professe worde take cure poore miserable may recouer health may obtaine gospel remission sin euerlasting life without worde vnpossible gete great thing wherfore maye well geue thanckes vnto god great benefit pray preserue continew v grace saue v euer amen xiiii sonday trinitie sonday p gospell luke xvii chaunced iesus went ierusalem passed samaria galile entred certayne towne met ten men leper whiche stode farre put forth theyr voyces sayde iesus maister haue mercy v sawe sayde vnto go shewe selues vnto priestes came passe wente clensed one sawe clensed turned backe agayne aloude voyce praysed god fell downe face feete gaue hym thankes samaritane iesus aunswered sayd ten clensed nine founde returned agayne geue god prayse saue straunger sayde vnto aryse go thy waye thy fayth hath made whole exposition ye heare howe christe gospell day setteth forth notable example faith thy fayth saith hath saued thee ascribeth glory sauyng samaritan hymselfe shold haue done sayed restore thee thy helth faith whiche thinge done christ entent also shoulde encoraged example beleue boldly thynke surely thorow christ shall obtainefayth obtayneth thingges whatsoeuer beleue beleue remission syn euerlastinge lyfe faith shall deceaue v beleue god fauorable mercifull fauorable mercifull thynges wise referred faith god dede worketh thynges men maye learne whansoeuer lacke anie thynge woulde haue wherof haue nede fault god selfe beleue otherwise beleued surely haue beleueth obtayneth nothingand firste doctrine gospell beleue shall sure thynges hope loke god constante fayth beleueth neyther hopeth thynge god let truste obtayne thynge iac heb iames saith first chapter epistle maketh sute god asketh thynge hym ought doubt saye knoweth whether god wyll graunt whether worthie ought sayde ratheran apte similitude know god wyll graunt soeuer aske hym although doth sorte yet wyll tyme sorte wauerynge hearte beleueth stedfastlye thynketh surelye shall obtayne obtayneth nothyng god geue hym nothyng would lyke vessell man handes moued hyther thyther wherin nothynge poured whatsoeuer poured falleth besyde vessell loste also vnbeleuynge heart god redie geue make oure selues vnapte receaue muche profer nothynge receaue gyfte withall greatlye offende god doynge wheras redie shewe liberalitie yet wauerynge cause place v receaue god gyftes contrarily hym wheras wauerynge minde still fayth geue gladlye willingly appeareth ten leaper crie iesu master haue mercie vpon styll doubte christe wyll helpe beleue done vnto must learne truste stedfastly mercie wauer heart stil truste desire whether health liuelowd prosperitie wisdom righteousnes seconde doctrine vnkindnes part horrible example wheras ten beleue healed nine go faith geue christ thakes benefit ought referre exaple ende yt may learne hereby thanckefull auoide wicked sin vnkyndnes god doth worthylye challenge glorie hymselfe yt render thanckes gladlye willingly thing great labour difficultie labour requisite yf thou tourne thee god saye lord hast geuen sound eye hades fett c thancke heartely thy gyfte lykewise hard thinge geue thanckes thy parentes master lordes neighbour thee good done onely maye vnderstande benefite wel bestowed also doth samaritan retourneth lorde geueth thankes required coste charge fewe wordes yet pleaseth christ maruelously acceptable men also take greate pleasure therof prouoked afterward good ethnickes saide vnkyndnes greatest synunkindnes greatest synne therfore man called chorle iudged greatest reproch proue experience vice greueth thee parentes muche bestow childrens sake thinges bodye life good faine al thinges recompence child make moste parte chaunceth seldome fynde amongest many one thankfull commeth nothyng elles dyuell lykewise also chaunceth wherefore thynke thys suretie vnkyndnesse greatest fylthyest vyce wherby springe stopped vppe oute whiche procedeth beneficence liberalitie amongest men chaunceth throughe greate infirmitie weakenes men greuously taken healpeth benefites getteth nothyng therby vnkyndnes wherfore men mynds discoraged fro doyng good ar lothe cast away kindnes vpon vnkynd unkyndnes cause neuerthelesse men oftentimes fele wherfore ye regard godlynes earnestly se ye thankfull fyrst god father heauen geueth preserueth body lyfe afterward geueth thynges belongeth euerlastyng life parentes frendes neyghbors haue bene good v ye maye knowledge geue thankes although ye able requite seyng suche harde thyng amongest men obteyne thankes howe much harder itthe maner monastery make requite recompence maner monastery yonger taken gifte quill elder shold haue declared hymself thankful woordes blessed god giftes euyll maner doone youthe myghte accustome selues receaue thyngs thankes geuyng bothe god manne wherfore although always done heart yet vse wordes good psalm shall render lord saith dauid al geueth psal wil take cup saluation cal vpon name ye lord praise hym glorifie geue hym thankes confesse hath ben beneficial vnto god answereth sonne inough bountifull father obtein fewthe world vnkynde god great part dothe persecute word thinkyng nothyng haue thynges hym grace small thynge hang crosse begoten sonne whiche hath sent gift v agaynst syn euerlasting death world wer well worthy great madnes cast cleane god sight yet god doothe presente euery goodnes helpe wherfore must onely lerne office propretie kyndnes must put practise also vertue propre office whych made werie well doyng vnkyndnes sake peculiar vertue god true christian example inough testifie world chorlishnes doth make men cease wel doyng amongest gretians noble men whiche done muche good countreis put goodes hasarde theyr countreies sakethe actes certayne gretians soone felt vnkyndnes receued fruit industrie laboure also peryll became vnpacient defended countrey agaynst enemy fled afterward enemy assaulted theyr countrey moste spitefull myndes wherefore christian must ignorant herof vnkyndnes ensueth excellent merites good men lest therby discoraged wel doyng christian vertu true fruit faith yt thou hast declared thy study great loue toward also haste proued recompece vnkynd world wont make yet thou shouldest dehorted well doyng therby christian behaue themselues exaple god doth good ye vnkind doth requite recopence yt good amogest men regarded christanis dutie therfore good vnkind yea yt euil good according salomos saying hepe cole fire vpon head thou maiest take world exaple matter pro rom doth clean co trary perceiue vnkindnes think al lost cast away neuer bestow benefit father heauen yt teache truly math ye day suffreth son rise vpon ye good yt geue thaks vpon ye euil geue thaks yea rather thei misuse god gift god self also might wel say many yeres haue geue thee ye light ye son haue found vitallwe muste learne kynd god nature christen charitie kind goodnes ther cometh litle thanks wil make end good wil deny liuing ye vnkind world ye merciful father doth suffreth goodnes ouercome vnkindnes world men thankful wil punish herafter vnkindnes must also wyll christian men nature christian charitie suffer abyde thinges made vnpacient therby bee fewe endued thys charitie wherfore also fewe christian neuerthelesse wyll christian muste ready doo good neyther ought example worlde geue vp oure studious zeale doynge good bycause vnkyndnesse thou haste ben beneficiall thys daye manne hee morowe shewe hym selfe straunge vnkyndnesse greued therewith appoynted tyme shall suffer due punyshment faulte thou onely continue saye benefite caste awaye vpon thys man wyll studye doo good thy benefitte neyther well bestowed hym despaire thyrd foorthe thou also myghteste saye soo christ saith tenne made cleane nine becomme christe hath lyttell thanke benefite yet hee content tenthe retourneth geueth thankes yea woulde haue made mention hadde ben thys wee myghte learne dyd wyckedly declareth thys inquisition vnkynde shall escape vnpunyshed beecause thankefull god hys benefites veryly shall knowe howe greately offended theyr wycked vnkyndnes wherfore example christ must also care nothyng mennes vnkyndnessethe vnthankfull shall escape vnpunished matter playne many benefites god receaue dayely frome hym receaueth colde slender thankes wherefore lette thys thynge moue v lette v thynke sufficient yf one amongest tenne whome benefyte welle bestowed shall feele proue experience theyr tyme appoynted woulde beleue nowe oure warnynge shall escape vnpunyshed god requireth faith seconde two moste beautyfull vertues kyndnesse pacient sufferyng vnkyndnes mennes handes samaritane hys exaumple teacheth v kynde thanke bothe god man benefyte receaue exaumple christe dothe admonyshe v bee vnpaciente neyther ceasse frome well doynge althoughe oure benefyttes prosper well although receyue theym vnkynde maner worlde thoroughe vnkynde person beneficiall vnthankfullye entreated discouraged frome well doyng afterwarde one chorles sake manye fare worse yf thou bee christian doo althoughe nyne deceaue thy hope contente tenth founde thankfull christ himselfe founde geue thankes suche greate benefite wylt thou looke bee better case wherefore take greuously losse nyne thou shalt haue losse thereby thenne christe hadde shall turne greate losse wycked person shall destitute good successe theyr matter thynges make trewe christian fyrst haue sure confidence faith goddes mercy thanke rendred vnto theyr benefites receaued theyr handes suffer theyr pacience ouercome theyr vnkyndnesse christian must looke better case christ himselfe muste doo beste euer men yet loke suche vnkyndnesse scarsly one amongest tenne founde thankfull possible may founde kynde woorthye benefite whome thoughte leaste woulde kynde samaritan lorde god haue mercy vpon v grant may beare away lesson vse well amen amen xv sonday trinitie sonday p gospell math vi man serue two master eyther shall hate one loue el leane one despise ye serue god mammon therefore say vnto carefull lyfe ye shall eate drinke yet body raymente shall put lyfe worthe meate body value rayment beholde soules ayre sowe neyther reape carry barnes heauenly father feedeth ye muche better takyng carefull thought adde one cubite vnto stature care ye rayment consider lillie field growe labour neyther spinne yet saye vnto euen salomon royaltie clothed lyke one wherefore yf god clothe grasse fielde though stande daye morowe caste fornace shall much ye litle fayth therefore take thought saying shall eate shall drinke wherewith shall clothed thynges gentile seeke heauenly father knoweth ye haue nede thynges rather seeke ye fyrste kyngdome god ryghteousnes thereof thynges shallbe ministred vnto care morowe morowe daye shall care selfe sufficient vnto daye trauayle thereof exposition matter gospel large conteynyng longe sermon auarice couetousnessethe whole worlde set couetousnes whiche god dothe hate aboue al vice ther vice doth hynder gospelle thys hurtefull christian men yet see world oppressed therwith theyr myndes day nyght vppon theyr lyuyng auarice dothe specially stirre men thys man shoulde content lyuelode hath geuen frome god men couete desireth higher degree fayre house woulde haue tower palaices yet theyr couetousnes gapeth greater thyngs auarice pride haue inough neither shoulde nede great pensyuenesse scratchynge catchynge christ wold remedy wickednes sermon setteth forth matter hardlye straightly man saith serue two maisters eyther shall hate one loue cleaue vnto one despise hereby appereth whole care lorde true seruice worshyp hyndred kynde temptation causeth christ geue thys precept gospell youthe hath yet care lyuyng houshold stuffe neuer aske market goeth thys thynke suretie shall lacke lyuynge sermon appertaineth specially housholdersthis sermon appertayneth householder preacher procurer furthermore belongeth preacher worde haue scant lyuyng worlde constreigned pouertie nede seke meanes fynde familie men dothe christ comfort specially studieth ryd care commaundeth beholde birdes ayre syth god prouideth theym plentyfully preacher shall lacke theyr portion shall dye hunger wherfore sermon belongeth v perceaue lyfe bee perill lacke lyuynge whiche compelled prouyde lyuynge bothe selfe also least whyle go office preachyng fall vnlaufull vnhonest shyftes forasmuche christe sayth precisely man serue godwhat serue mammon necessarye v learne serue god serue nothyng el comon maner speache doo thou arte commaunded much saye serue maister maister commaunde seruice maye seeme referred muche person worde commaundement maisters haue nede housholdes fedde wyth meate drynke theyr seruants selues haue store plentie inough therof haue nede seruantes dooe execute theyr woorde commaundement seruant seeth another matter regardeth maisters commaundement careth command veryly seruyng two maisters maner also must learne serue god seruynge god thynge heare sayeth gladly heart dothe god commande v thynges byddeth v heare christe hyghly esteeme gospellwhat serue god onely trewe acceptable seruice whiche maye doo god haue assured commandement dothe commaunde chyldren honor father mother father mother nourishe bring vp instruct child wyfe loue husband se familie husband prouide sustenance defence c wherfore chyldren honoure parentes serue god thereby goddes commaundement lykewise seruantes housholde doo commaunded theym diligentlye dooe seruice onely maister also god worde commaunded also concernyng kyndesall god seruice cotrary worde god seruice yf woulde onely discerne cause shoulde bee sayde serue god consisteth worke worde commaundement god counted great thyng worlde monke doothe renounce thyngs entreth abbey lyueth hard lyfe fasteth watcheth saieth prayer c lackethe worke lacketh commandement god neuer commaunded worde wherfore neuer counted seruyng god contrarily semeth lyttle thynge whenne handmayde doothe woorke belongeth householde washyng swepynge c commandement god touchyng workes neuer smallwhat true seruice god yet haue name god seruice passeth farre holy deuout monkes nunnes monkes haue commaundement god commanded parentes shold honored housholde businesse done generally true seruice god god commanded eschue god forbyddeth foule corner maye bee full god seruice onely church temple also house kytchins shoppes cotages c may done citizen men go plowe tylle field woulde esteme matter vprightly certaine god commaunded onely ecclesiasticall ciuile administration also guydyng housholdes shold preserued wherfore dothe helpe therto first parentes chyldren laste seruantes neighbour doo serue god commaundement reason well pondred woulde certifie men well high lowe touching busynes myght know although must doo house small yet serue men god busines therfore peynful vnto al vnderstande theyr worke acceptable god deuyll hyndreth men iudgement haue suche ioye doyng theyr worke vocation hee causeth euery man may haue singular peyne doynge office executyng god commandement bothe may spoyled defrauded commoditie men redy glad god seruice myght purchased money man myght receiued order colledge wher myght sure god seruice done men would gladly bestowe haue myght come poynt meruailous thynge monkes meane wold serue god rule sayd thyng wantyng chief matter thou demaunde comanded go cloister say god commaunded must nedes say thought myght please god worthye euyll theyr rashenesse euen much commaunde seruant fet meate meane season make readye horse shoulde muche please doynge thys speciallye yf woulde defende dooynge boaste thereof thoughe hee hadde doone harde piece worke brydelyng sadlyng currying horse lykewyse matter mounkes crake seruice yet god gaue commaundement doo whefore thou purpose serue god truely applye thy vocation neuer lowe first hearken god worde churche worde thy maiestrate maisters parent true seruyng god must learne therfore beare well away god seruice euen doo god commaundeth preacher parentes maisters thou doest thy heart may rest god neither shall thy worke labor thou doest painfull pl aseth god god trewe seruice thou doest thy house muche euen thou hadst done god whych heauen furthermore chief renoume wherewith man adorned aboue creature whiche dothe obey god also sonne moone earth thinges behaue theim selues god commaundement lykewyse water hath commaundemente bryng foorth fyshes gen saieth god fyrst boke moses water dothe euen among men men hynder god blessyng theyr synnes creature beautified serue god thorow obedience christ saith salomon glorie apparailed one lily fielde dothe lylie commaundement hath may bryng foorth shewe beautyfull fauour savour colour god doth much praise floure great renoume thynkest thou founde commaundement obedience god maydens decked daunce toy trifle chief renoume whe applieth worke vocation seeth diligentlye maysters chyldren suche seruice doeth psalme extoll christian saieth thy honoure commeth daughter kynges psal honour euident christian poore nedie despised spirituall honour renoume gold perles purple tissue commaundement god honour shyneth brighter sonne god honour walketh god commaundement walketh honour god goe emperours apparell mayde apparell great quene wold counted meruailous noble thynge worlde deede thinges toyes mocke ape nothynge comparison spirituall ornature whenne mayde goeth gaye obedience god maister respect suche ornature common gorgeous thinges nifles trifle trewe ornature comelynesse whiche called god worde god commaundemente god obedience crowne verye ouche pro salomon calleth fyrst prouerbes sayeth sonne heare discipline thy father lette go lawe thy mother grace maye bee geuen thy heade chayne thy necke thys lyfe thys ornature seemeth thyng greate valuation lyfe come shall bee moste excellente whenne god shall saye come sonne thou haste doone thy duetie thy vocation thenne shall appeare obedience towarde god hys woorde yea althoughe small matter geueth renoume may magnificent sufficient firste part may know surely god seruice bonde seruice mammon may hynder v greater seruice wee bounde doo nowe lette v see conforte consolation touchyng thisnowe couetousnes maye auoyded howe may cast auarice couetousnes v firste saieth christe man serue two maisters geueth bothe theyr name one god true lord master whome wholly bounde serue honoure mammon true maister christe forbyddeth v doo hym seruice say carefull lyfe howe maye get lyuyng body howe may apparailed applieth sermon end yt shold caste away suche care vnprofitable wherof haue nede wherby nothyng preuayle hyndereth god true homage seruice wherfore muste beware see diligently wee serue god persuade selues certaynly doth nowe knowe haue nede wyll fynd v gladly onely require handes healpeth muche attainynge thys faith call mynde thinges god hathe geuen v without helpe made v selues gaue v body lyfe let world iudge psal yf sustenance wer cast together heape would esteme lyfe lykewise body regarded apparell worlde great madnes foly worthy goddes wrothe confesse haue receaued thynges chiefe god yet doubt whether wil geue v base vile thynges might well iudged contumelie reproche one hathe felte ryche man liberalitie great thinge would truste littell thing lykewise god handled v mystrust whether god fynde v foode pleaseth god christ declareth straightly comaundeth doo least commyt idolatrie may know condition body lyfe membres god bounteous liberall hath geuen v many thynges hath christ also set v example creature whereby may learne truste god caste care hym byrdes ayre eye element oure greate reproche excellenter creature yet geue great honour god byrdes nyght take theyr rest theyr nestes without care mornyng flye foorthe cherefully sytte vppon boughes tree make goodly sweete noyses prayse geue thankes vnto god seke lyuynge fynde abstayne frome thys cursed execrable care byrdes haue landes barnes storehowse spence yet doo synge doo prayse god reioyce bee ioyefull bee sure thys one whyche prouydeth theim name heauenly father thenne doo lykewyse whyche neuerthelesse better poynte wee woorke gather harueste laye vppe barnes reekes preserue necessarie v yet abstaine frome care wherefore oughte neuer forgette exaumples byrdes merye cherefull without care shold take thought care seyng haue god theyr nourysher whose store greate bee conteyned worlde wherfore hathe prouender foode hande euerye suche one saieth christ woulde father heauen toward v ye wolde geue place liberalitie thorough faithe doo see experience world fylthy synke moste filthy couetous men whyche truste god serue god serue mammon onely endeuoure increase theyr substaunce deceyued theyr hope gladde yf theyr substaunce bee theyr mynde sorowfull vexe selues consumed nyghte daye wyth care thou dooest thynke thys yf ryuers flowed golde yet wee lacked lyuelode meate drynke lyfe could preserued golde lyue golde thys shamefull worshipping golde whyche ethenykes mocked also fable midasthe fable midas hadde great desyre golde wyshed touched myghte made golde obteyned petition meates thynges whyche hee touched purpose tourned golde punished couetousnes shoulde nedes die hunger thynges changed golde wherfore let euery man flee auarice abhorre asmuch neither golde syluer perle suche thynge hath power nourishe yet madnes worlde greate beside liuelowd require also golde siluer thoughe nede god gyftes haue nede rather geuen therfore christian let hym se diligently vnto hymselfe oppreste auarice let hym learne put trust god whiche hath declared muche v also creature wyll prouide v wil leaue v destitute good thynge psalme also maketh notable mention concerning yong crowes whiche geueth meate psal ordinance god wheras geueth life suffereth thinge sustaineth lyfe lackyng doth catle beastes howe muche rather v christian whome hath onely geuen lyfe bodie also onely begotten sonne maye lyue onely also kyngdome god woulde christ shoulde learne shoulde forsake execrable incredulitie distrust auarice stirreth vp foolishe thynge man woulde solitarie place make hymselfe bare leaue might adde somewhat stature man mockynge stock doth world sayth christ vexed pensiuenes gettinge rich man shall waxe riche caregods blessing care maketh men ryche consisteth herin god maye blesse care ther blessynge ther substance ynough although ther neuer muche yet vse fruite substance lackyng example declare ought iuste cause driue v fayth onely care hindereth faith also causeth great tormentinge yet preuayle nothyng therby manifest signes auarice care vnbeleife alway ioined gether woulde vse reason behoued v hate vice auoyde addeth besyde confirmation may perfect againste couetousnes byddeth v also consyder thinges whiche come oure eye walke countrie ther flower kyndes whiche shewe selues vnto v moste beautifull swete coulours doth almoste speake vnto v adhort v trust god syth decked magnificence apparell mightie kynges compared flour muche doth god take care appareling deckyng owne maye thynke apparell comon sorte doth thoughe thinges went chance christ place doth pronounce wyth plaine speache god sayth doth appareill grasse felde byrdes fyndeth lyuynge chance father heauen fedeth geueth euery one portion also concernynge lyly god wisedome cause could like gether colour leaues number leaues rootes forme c wherfore sith bestoweth great care vpon flower pleasure beastes might lyue therbie vncredible incredulitie mistruste doe yet doubte whether also shall haue appareill god haue preferment birdes tyll grounde mowe gather barnes prouide certayne tymes wher birdes suche thinge yet fedde saith christe also v haue preeminence also apparelynge muche flare hempe suche like herbes brought foorth tillyng also greate multitude shepe manie weauers spinner c euery wher great madnes thinke part therof belongeth vnto v especially whan spare labour place muste put difference labour onely forbed also enioynednot laboure carefulnes forbydden shoulde thynges moste studiously diligentlye vtterly flee slouthfulnes slouggyshnes aboue thynge care lyuynge appareill vtterly forbedden suche care sure token haue muche truste god fede v prouide thinges v wherfore care appertayneth god dishonour blasphemie two thinges may ioyned gether first thou thy worke diligentlye spare labourlaboure fayth must go together dyd god commande man paradice wold eat shold labour second thou christia beleue beleue put thy trust christ parent knoweth haue nede wil geue v thynges liberallie plenteously care agree fayth assone care taketh place faith departeth wherfore christe forbyddeth sayth ye therfore carefull labour ye haue commandement let care alone mine may father also somwhat preuaile ye wherfore attempte thynge vaine ye content reuled councell knowe ye ye worshipper worshipper mammon ye loue ye hate hym ye cleaue ye despise example worlde ther occasion time aduantage thou shouldest finde manye woulde rather let passe sermon regard aduantage leaste wise differ tune therof vntill sermon mammon moueth muche fele time neuer returne againe tyme sermon nowe matter plaine whatsoeuer done worde god done godhe despiseth word god despyseth god hym selfe despiseth preferreth monie despisynge contempte therof belongeth god place glosis worde speache euident ther thynge gathered wherfore sermon belongynge christian pensiue saye shall eate drinke clothynge shall weare gentile sayeth christ inquire therof knowe beleue tha haue father heauen ye haue father heauen whiche gaue bodie soule yea son knoweth wherof ye haue nede touchynge whome ye great iniurie thynke hard vnmercifull vnto though would denie lyuelowd sustenance ye must nedes die hunger wherfore behaue selues example child euening goe bedde without care take thought morow know parentes prouide ye also lykewise sonnes sayth christ haue respecte vnto father heauen thynges shall geuen vnto beware care signe ye haue truste heauenly father el ye would caste awaye care would good hope wherfore christ concludeth sermon saieth seeke first kyngdome god righteousnes therof al thing shal cast vnto necessary doctrine excellent promisse worlde seeketh owne kyngdom hath nede rich monie yet suretie contrariwise god kyngdome eternall must christian make search kyngdom sayth paule amongest v nothing el heare worde beleue trust vnto god truely knowledge hym father looke wher suche fayth ther god present forthwith foloweth righteousnes remission sinnes let saith christ firste care ye worde heare diligently exercise beleue ye haue wise made searche god kyngdome righteousnes care ye let euery busines vocationot idlenes labour becomethe christian becometh christian men idle labour shall thinges geuen vnto ye goodnes god great finde al thing abundatly euill serue moreouer persecute word blaspheme possible suffer forsaken yt loue heare word gladly set forth much ye put trust wherfore ye doctrin christ tedeth end yt shold embrace word beleue folow godlines lay aside care beleue yt god wil finde v al thing sufficietly great part careth word rather geueth self play pleasure pastime sport watonnes hearyng holy sermon whiche must nedes folow vnholie bestiall life necessitie subiecte diuers curse pouertie euils manifold discommodities cometh ther also disprofite many slouthful sluggishe haue regard labour labour graunt selues time voyd labourryotus person yet spend riot measure oftentimes spend one holyday yt gathered gether hole weke god forbiddeth wel prodigalitie idlenes whatsoeuer gotenprodigalitie idlenes forbydden yt shold preserued studiously therfore sayth byrd doth mow gather barnes though say ye must done ye labour lay vp afterward ye gotte may saued necessarie v hym doth faulte ther god busines lacketh successe thou mayst blame thy owne negligence slouthfulnes wasting god wold geue gladly thou wouldest embrace godlinesnote e yue poyntes heare god worde beleue put awaye care fal labour sayth thinges shall geuen vnto thou doest refuse thou shouldest heare sermon thou fallest slepe doste trifle thou shouldest labour thou art idle c muche foule hath meat without labour findeth neaste doe thou also lykewise feare god labour diligently let god care residew wil finde thee thy liuing yet sayd beware beware couetousnes rake vp muche god abyde doctrine gospell lorde god graunt v throughe holye spirite maye earnestly embrace godlines heartes maye inclined testimony couetousnes dauid sayth amen xvi sonday trinitie pthe gospell luke vii fortuned iesus wente citie called naim many disciple went hym muche people came nye gate citie beholde dead man caryed whiche sonne mother widowe muche people citie lorde sawe compassion sayde vnto wepe came nye touched coffen bare hym stode styll sayde yonge man saye vnto arise deade set vp began speake deliuered mother came feare gaue glory vnto god saying great prophet rysen vp amonge v god hath visited people rumour hym went forth throughout iewry region whiche lye rounde aboute exposition many thinges spoken touching gospell howbeit haue chosen twoo thinges therof one ought take confort death touchyng christian pitie mutuall affection comon euills ye heare miserable widow whiche first lost husbande sonne solace al trouble counted cheif myserie people haue sonne heyre familie trade commonaltie suche al appointed heyre wherfore widow miserable pointes great aduersitie muche semed sure token god displeased againste yt tooke awaye first husband son marueill caste away hope trust god christe hath respecte woman hath pitie vpon restoreth ded chylde lyfe turneth greate sorow great ioye hystorie therfore marked vsa comfort agaynst deathe christe may confirme faith christ doth busines woman studieth certifie v weake thinge death feare thinges pacient mynde suche wise maye put feare death anye thing haue prince ayde v hath present redie helpe againste euill death yea example declareth soone put awaye death would haue thought dead yonge man carried foorth buried coulde haue reliued christ coming vpon matter past cure speaketh yonge man say thee arisechrist lorde death dead rose began speake wherby ye may vnderstande death christe euen lyfe one whether liue dead although dead yet dead destruction reason one worde cal lyfe put away death hereby may well vnderstade christes saying true euen god god lyuynge dead although abraham isaac iacob holy patriarkes dead v yet alyue god muste learne gospell widowes son great god declare power last day christ one worde call men life againe geue beleue euerlasting lyfe shall done moment nede doubt thinges christ power declareth also wil gladly euident proufe example therof widowes son deade voyde sence felynge soone christ speaketh heareth wonderful thynge heareth nowe heareth liueth nowe liueth yet ther nothynge el done christ speaketh worde byddeth arise worde suche force might putteth awaye death restoreth lyfe asmuche knowe christ soon rydde v death restore v lyfe let v se also redie willing none amongest desire moued miserie widow goeth vnto without askynge restoreth son vnto alyue wherfore let v thinke example belongeth vnto v feare deathwe must feare death done sake though shold say vnknowen vnto yt feare death put awaye feare power haue maye make feare prouide sauegard yt ye may iudge according sense verie cause feare haue ye respect vnto also euen easely raise death wont rayse slepe wil gladly desirously lacke neither power neither therto wherfore foloweth therof buried graues slepe lightly iohn body possible thou deade slepe although thou called ten time yet thou cast heare dead awake one word christ ye see example yonge man lazarus wherfore death god called death v death calledthe deathe christen men swete quiet sleape god quiet light slepe yt nothing lighter wold christ haue wel beaten v yt shold feare ye pestilence death selfe taketh v shold bold minde answere thus thy greatest might tou layst greuous matter thou puttest great feare thou wil execute punishmet like tormeter wil cosider god ye contrarie part wil whe hast slaine feareth thee neyther care thy outragiouse furie iesteth rather vpon ye saying death wil thy death hel wil thy destructio thou killest christian kil thee restore life ye cofort yt christe setteth forth gospell yt although christia men dye yet dead slepe slepe yea yt light slepe yt christ awake wt litle fingar litle praise death whe doth worste yet rage cast slepe christ may raise vp wt one worde written hower cometh dead graues shall heare ye voice sonne man shall come forth iohn haue done wel resurrection lyfe haue done euill resurrection iudgement hope haue christian turkes iewes haue neyther papistes knowe must die remaineth iudgement hell haue truste christ seeke helpe diriges mass trentalles pardon fastes thinges take christe iudge whiche hath onely office iudge condemne greatest wickednes imagin christe crueller death wherfore heare day iudgement afraid tremble quake heartes christian men know christe day shall iudge beleue whiche receaue worde beleue therfore boldly say baptised beleue iesu christe lord dyed synnes resurrection hath gotten righteousnes euerlasting lyfe shold feare therfore mine enemie frend patrone father wherfore although laste day draweth nigh death chanceth vnto anye meanes al shall put beside state lord iesus christ holdeth himselfe stil time iniuries death doth vnto death thinketh wholly opprest holden slepe lyght slepe christe scarselye speake worde heare rise vnto euerlastyng life let seme necessarie lesson v may feare neither death laste daye christ cometh iudge condemne v commeth came place widow dead sonne rayse v death may heare see speake thynges sorte come v beleue saue v beleue iudge wherfore must accustome selues looke sauiour beleue hym litle litle may certified oure hope saluation may feare neither death neither laste day feareth foloweth fleshe olde man christe worde matter playne christ shall come rayse v death christian body reaste sepulchre slepe vntil christ come knocke sepulchre saith arise arise shall rise quiet swete slepe shall lyue reioyce christ lord euer thus ought christian haue thoughtes tha turkes iewes haue whiche vtterly confounded feare yea papistes moke dismayd heartes chaunceth vnto worthily come learne lesson beleue christ helper beleue iudge beleue thou art christian hast hope christ take away helpe succour saluation thee deliuerance defence shal requisite thee death deuill thou trustest helpe el despisest helpe pope teacheth doth dede looke christ iudge thou art seruant ye deuil minister death takest thee worke deuill hell hate christ care kyngdome wherfore iudge good put truste wil procure peace saluation euer euer lesson doctrine called doctrine faith must learne also christ ye doctrine pitiepytie compassion merci compassion ye heare often time yeare touchyng charitie shold remember one v bound helpe pitie thing somwhat greater greued men misery calamity lesse owne haue neighbour nedie sycke ought redie helpecharitie issuethe faythe must sorie miserie heart though min owne euil put forth v christ place foreiner stranger seeth miserie widdow asmuch greued though owne sonne geueth confort helpe ye exaple charitie ought folow faith doth alwais folow faith true faith yt ought behaue self ye exaple certein mercilesse people hath stonie yron heartes laugh neighbour misery greued prosperitie affectios christian men ought otherwise ought greued men misfortune glad prosperitie paule saith yt may greued greued rom reioyce yt ioyfull propertie enuious person glad men hurt greued euery ma wealth sauing owntoo sortes compassion pitie two sortes pitie spiritual corporall corporal bodilie euils muste succour helpe al yt defece wha see yt poore haue nede helpe helpe selues spiritual euil whe ye soule perilspirituall pitie reprouethe synne wha see yog voyde al holines caryng nothing religio holy doctrine ignorat ye principle religio liueth wtout discipline order fearce stubborne obstinat ye office pitie speake faier gentle wordes vnto chide sharply rebuke yea rather beate stricke ther greater peril whe ye soule diseased wt euils tha wha ye bodie sicke disease wherfore must let nothig passe touchig pitie yt euilles may wt wordes stripe wandes remedy restrained yu saiest yt cruel pitie vexe ye bodie wt stripe yea necessitie causeth beste pitie case physitions must nedes shewe crueltie vpon part bodie hole bodie maye saued also concernynge pitie suche chastisement done see thee thou mayst deliuered tyranny deuill kingdomeapte proper similitude yt almost drowned floude taketh wronge plucked heare although done great grief payne wherfore thou doest refuse bodilie euiles suffer litle payne auoydynge greate perill shouldeste thou dangerous perill soule euerlastynge lyfe take greuously suche chastisement requisite necessarie truely worke pitie stubburne child obstinate seruantes sharply stripe put remembrance deutie spiritual medicin disease soule rebellyng againste parentes maisters wherfore worke mercie mannes miserie consideredfolyshe petie marrethe citie helpe geuen pitie ought parent cheifly regard familie maiestrates communaltie beware diligentlie neither yt sufferer impaciens neither negligence make geue vp pitie commeth passe oftentimes would pitifull wil dissemble winke syn commit two kindes crueltie towarde neyghbour fall god high displeasure wherfore thou must seeke prayse gentlenes pitifulnes dissembling winkyng sina good lesson maiestrates euerlasting perill dependeth therof neither must thou loke time wil come amende owne accorde thou must cut snare deuill sharpe discipline touchinge sorte pitie wil intreate largely place example christ put forth v pitied miserie woman therby taught v true pitie shoulde remember precepte set forth v thinke surely yt oure duetie helpe yea lssoe oure goodes neighbour bodily necessitie truly shewe office pitie whiche thynge afterwarde hath great renoum comended though done neyghbour also god hymselfe whiche promiseth also requit reward contagion disease spiritual say syn child familie stubburne negligent wanton doinge saying must shewed pitie cruel sight yet dothe thynges best past tamyng amendement geue vp thyng past cure hand minister officer matter scape vnpunyshed counted parte pitie punyshe suche case extremitie death paste grace bee restrayned meanes woulde destruction well theyr selues yf thys office pitie exercised vppon swordeto punishe wycked greate mercie wherfore punyshementes workes pitie seme neuer cruell bytter man syght punyshment sharp correction could cominaltie ciuile felowshyp mainteyned wherfore let euery man vocation shewe pitie affection also discretion let helpe bodyly euyls onely muche rather spirituall euyls two doctrine gospel wherof one belongeth vnto faith shoulde without feare myddest euyll specially feares terror deth come sight let v thynke almightie healpe saluation sette christ wherefore despaire hym without hurte helpe man v vayn represse deth death valyant agaynst muste haue trust god sonne iesu wee oure selues haue helpe yet hath wherwith helpe v ready doo heart matter playne wher mynd beleueth constatly christe dothe true seruice requireth despayre hate hym doo acknowledge hym god ell would haue theyr comfort hym second example example christ haue respect necessitie neighbor pitie lord god haue mercy v may learne bothe lesson men maye glorifie christ hys benefite amen xvii sonday trinitie sonday pthe gospell luke xiiii chauncede iesus wente house one chiefe phariseis eate bread sabboth day watched beholde certayne man hym whiche dropsie iesus aunswered spake vnto lawyer phariseis saying lauful heale sabbothe day helde theyr peace toke hym healed hym let go aunswered saying whiche shall haue asse oxe fallen pitte wyll straight way pull hym sabboth day coulde aunswere hym gayne thinges put forth also similitude geastes marked howe preacede highest rowmes sayde vnto thou art bydden weddyng man sit downe hyghest rowme lest honorable man thou bidden bad hym come say geue man rowme thou begyne shame take lowest rowme rather thou art bydden go sit lowest rowme bad thee cometh maye saye vnto frende sitte vp hyer shalt thou haue worship presence fit meate thee soeuer exaltethe hym selfe shalbe broughte lowe humbleth selfe shalbe exalted exposition thys gospelle two question fyrste belongeth seruice god whyche ought done vnto god secod one oweth betwene selues ryseth question whether better god kepe sabboth helpe thy neighbour doo hym good phariseys hadde matter proue marke christ would doo touchyng man diseased dropsye healpe myght bee reproued hard hearted yf helpeth wycked kepeth hys sabboth maye reproued hee obeyeth god worde therfore soeuer christ doth taken haue euery place turne vnto amongest iewes ceremonie sabboth moste holy wherfore keepe straightlye doothe christ beynge belayed euery syde thought wayes scape vseth fewe wordes maner confuteth aduersaries folyshenes summe matter saieth plainly vnderstande sanctify sabboth thys thinke saith kepe sabboth wer idle good interpretation leude sanctifying saboth signifieth hear god wordwhat sanctifyeng saboth serue thy neyghbour muche thou canste god dothe highly esteme holynes sabboth would peryll neyghbour shold therfore litle regarded wherfore helpe neyghbour althoughe doone labour yet hereby haue sanctified saboth truly haue done godly woorke therin doctrine ought chiefly referred ende may lerne therby kepe sabboth nothing ydle sermon must heard must respect workes charitie doo sermon teache al thynges therof tende ende shold loue one diligent doyng good one dothe god require thou shold heare learne sabbothheare wherof foloweth thou muste doo also sabboth thou wylt truely sanctifie wherfore christ sayeth phariseys grosse doctours ye saye sabboth broken good doone sabboth chiefe doctrine sabboth haue mutual loue loue thyng done thynkyng true effectuous affection whiche stirreth vp tong handes membres wherby good dedes done iohn saieth chyldren lette v loue woord tongue dede truth thys hath god saieth christ commaunded thee sabboth1 iohn yea ordeined sabboth thou shouldest heare learne thys thou sholdest declare al beneuolence word dede toward thy neighbor whensoeuer hath nede wherfore christ reproueth ouerthwart kind saint depraue corrupt word god boast kepe sabboth wher yet charitie bestowe worne garment couerynge poore naked man false writhers inuerte change word god worde god commaundeth loue thy neighbour best hym euer thou canst answere doo least violate sabboth christe confuteth god procureth thyng preached sabboth thou mayst loue thy neighbor care helpe thou canst playn example man thynketh breakyng sabbothe delyuer hym meanes possible vnreasonable waye excuse danger brute beast affirme greuous offence doo lyke manne peryll least worke charitie done vnto hym saboth yea thus mete stumble whiche take vpon iudge geue sentence god doinge might entangle selues betraye foolishenesse phariseis take vpon place presume christe maye haue hym daunger trippe hym whether helpeth may seme violate sabboth whether helpeth may reproued neglectyng charitie christ doth defend mainteyne doynge agaynste also layeth crime charge sanctifying sabboth heare god wordewhat sanctifye sabbothe doo holy workes loue thy neighbour help hym necessitie shewe obedience mercyful help geue councell conforte breake breade hungrie c ought done sabboth requirethe noo counterfaited seruice wee exercise day syngyng temple example papistes worde heard comanded therby shoulde perfourmed deede excellent saying osee wyll haue mercy sacrifice osee knowledge god burnt offerynges knowledge god nothyng el heare god worde reason worde man know thyng touchyng god word pronouced saieth lorde thy god whiche sente sonne deliuered hym slayn thee mercy vpon baptisme c suche worde knowledge god communicate vnto v fauorable mercifull whiche thynge reason neuer perceaue know owne strengthe fur hermore foloweth sithe knowledge god commeth woorde thys god seruice sanctifyeng sabboth worde god put practise peruerse ouerthwart phariseys neglect heare word god care commandementes yet wold counted violate sabboth doth al papist kyngs prince resist god word hear mass euery day neuer heare preaching worde yet would named excellent name christian serue god yt desireth knowe serue god let learn thing place euen heare word kepe comandementsto christian euery daye sabboth wherfore euery day sabboth day v christian must euery day heare god word order lyfe thereafter yet people sake sonday ordeined entent yt shold chiefly hear yt day ye word god liue six dais ar left euery man doo busynes first part gospel ye true keping sabboth worshipping god whe ye word god herd comandements regarded wherfore whe thou comest sermon redest som gospel ye worshipping god acceptable seruice vnto himthe seconde part intreateth humilitie sacrifice osee saith second part teacheth humilitie dothe christe expounde parable ende exalteth hymselfe shalbe brought lowe humbleth himselfe shall exalted thus vnderstanded men also onely god vse hate proude none lyghte persones wicked doo hate humble lowely geuen nature men loue suche handmayde sheweth selfe humble obediente doyng busines familie maistres canne hate shorte nature selfe causeth men fauor humble lowly hate proude sone parent perceue disobedience pride child seruants two vice always ioyned together answer proudly ar bound obedient euery word parentes abide seeke meanes restreigne thys fiercenesse yf wyll bee ruled caste theym oute house lykewyse doo officer magistrate callyng among subiects prowd stubborne tame punyshement howe chanceth man abyde pryde god worde cause whiche saieth labour may represse prowde stubborne1 pet thys appeareth kyndes afterwarde ryche menne learned wyse beautyfull stronge myghtie soone began proude forget modestie cast downe hedlong god written god resisteth proude hath aduersarie meanes scape fallyng1 pet contrarily sober mynded obteyneth fauour bothe god man god wyth angel highly esteme men hath hym great estimation singuler renoume example doo declare yt oftentimes poore men child com high renoume yt prince fayn haue honoure wysedome councells sake wherof commeth felicitie uerily herof god bee lackyng sober mynded lowly psal psalme sheweth god dwelleth hygh hathe respect vnto lowly heauen earth raiseth vp symple duste lifteth poore myre may set hym prince euen prince people thus dothe god deale humble theym prowde refrayne excesse ouermuche agaynst setteth hym selfe indignation neuer ceaseth vntill throwe downe ought admonyshe v behaue selues soberly chyldren seruantes shew selues obedient thinke god requireth shoulde obedient shold proude walke lowly thys wyl neither wyll care suche lowe base state condition knowe doo duetie god regard care may bryng better state thus came passe saulesaull whiche obscure keper mule thoughte hym selfe lowest stocke beniamyn hee aduanced suche honoure prophete samuell receaued commaundement god make hym kynge ouer israel long humble god presente hym mercye grace puffed vp pride began hygh mynded despise god worde perceaued god lesse mynde caste hym downe hadde mynde aduaunce hym vntill last dispeired vtterly killed hymselfe kynne destroied example dauid belongeth matter alsodauid appereth myght doctrine excellent yet therfore proude high mynded folowed state shepehearde obeyeth father commaundement vntill samuel comme annoint hym kyng yea hystorie maketh speciall mention seuen proude stately brother whiche despised hym yongest god saieth samuell let passe stately persones annoint hym kyng shewe vnto thee wyll none dauid nowe exalted god stately ben haue ben reiected god example saul muche sheweth modestie lowlynes although put besyde kyngedome yet dothe recouer agayne also aduaunced great renoume god hee promiseth christ shall procede stocke kynred thynges written declared sermon intente wee shoulde vse humilitie beware pride saye maner stately canne abyde thys drudgerie lette v couete lyue gentylmanlyke whenne thou thynkest thus thou arte certayne nothynge god made thy aduersarie therbygod abyde pride thys trewe god abyde pride loftynesse haue exaumples proue thys euery thyng thynkest thou cause great trouble world suche multitude rustikes barbarous rude wretched men delited theyr youth pride licetious liuyng wherfore god counteth worthy regarded hym neither euer waxe thriftie kynd lyfe surely decreed euer exalteth selfe shall brought lowe contrarily soeuer humbleth self god chose exalte moste hearty thankes bee vnto god whiche hathe shewed forthe v day doctrine graunt v grace may shew selues obedient doctrine iesu christe amen xviii sonday trinitie sonday gospell math xxii phariseis heard iesus dyd put saduceis scilence came together one whiche doctour lawe asked hym question temptyng hym sayinge master whiche greatest commaundement lawe iesus sayde vnto hym thou shalt loue lorde thy god thy heart thy soule thy mynde fyrst greatest commaundement seconde like vnto thou shalt loue thy neyghbour thy selfe two commaundementes hange lawe prophetes whyle phariseis gathered together iesus asked saying thynke ye christe whose sonne sayde vnto hym sonne dauid sayde vnto howe doth dauid spirite call hym lorde saying lorde sayd vnto lorde sit thou right hand till make thine enemy thy foote stoole dauid call hym lorde howe sonne man hable aunswere thing neyther durst man day forth aske mo question exposition gospel two thynges marked aboue one yt scribe demandeth greatest commandement lawe howe christ demaundeth phariseis touching christ whose son shold dauid spirit calleth lord first question declareth yt ignorance blindnes ye iewes great yt forgotte ten commaundementes child wont learne heart wherfore easy thyng chylde geue answer first greatest commandement thou shalt haue god phariseys scribe take greatest fallen suche foly call question commandement one saieth sacrifice geue almes fast vse peculiar kynd apparell c see come passe men fall god commaundement worde ordeyn sette vp workes selfe owne inuentyng came passe oure religious men also became cloysterers made profession propre goodes therwith forgat also faithe charitie religion called afterwarde state perfection perfectbut chyld able declare state perfection monkes reason haue syght rule profession christen man saieth perfect signifieth feare loue god profite thy neighbour wt al kynd benefit god gaue comaundement last matter came poynte ceremony inuented whiche appeare pleasant full pompe dayes vesture meat chosen wherin diffre ye multitude moueth eye rude turneth selues mean tyme principall workes commandementes god commaunded loued thy neighbour bee holpen cleane left side example phariseys scribe euident place wherfore thys notable exaumple suche notable learned menne great blyndnesse knewe whiche greatest smallest precepte yet man may say truthe doctours whiche oughte make declaration people howe god worshypped truely oure religious menne bee also man shoulde demaunde touchynge good woorkes doone woulde putte foorthe tenne commaundementes aunswere must become religious man bye mass go pilgrimage faste c nothyng el withdraw men fro true comandements vnto trifle reward haue length theyr error folow man doctrine sett foorth suche workes touchyng whych god gaue commaundement suche menne deceaued haue respecte tenne commaundementes doo let wholly passe yf would haue ben harde answere greatest precepte god commanded phariseys scribe priest monkes knewe wherefore erroure bee auoyded owne foolyshe deuotion alwaies eschued contrarily catechisme christian discipline lightly regarded yf menne woulde instructed know theyr duetie doo doo learne god bee loued muste haue god oughte preferre nothyng loue god rather lette thyngs passe suffer thynges sake thou art state perfection thou doest thys say duetie euery common christian doo peculiar thyng euery man doothe whiche rise nyght whiche eate fleshe apparailed common sort bestowe nyghte holye seruice eate fyshe vse kynd apparaile selues laste matter commeth poynt man tradition kepe occupied haue respect god commandementes wherfore small doctrine christ saieth chiefest precept loue god second lyke fyrst loue neighbour hym selfe two depende thynges maye taught touchyng good workes fountaine ought thinges procede ought referred agayne decreed thou thynkest thou mayst serue god done meanes thou loue god thy neighbour doctrine cause straight iudgement last day done papacie euery manne knoweththe blyndnes seruing god papecie would serue god became cloysterer went rome saincte iames prayed thys saincte dydde serue hym eyther feastyng fastynge tyme called god seruice telle thys trewe thou seruest god thou doest thou art commaunded wherfore serue god thyngwhat serue god doo god hathe commaunded whiche ye thynke beste youre selfe hath god commaunded truely christ reherseth thou thinkest doo god seruice thou must go farre cause bestowe great coste charge loue god thy neighbour howe god seruice nere vnto thee bee done better cheape meanes thou louest thy neyghbour doest kynde benefite hym god accept thoughe doone hymselfe verily meruailous doctrine seruice god done god whe thou doest good thy neighbour said shalbe cause harde greuous iudgement laste daye thus saith christ wycked shall saye math dyd see thee hungry thirstie christ shall answere ye haue doone leaste myne haue ye doone mee soo thow mayest bee sure hereof whenne thou healpest poore christian wyth rayemente meate seemeth bee doone vnto christ euen one thys greuous thyng wee lette passe suche easye ready occasion serue god think yf coulde tell christe myght found would gladdely doo bestowe wee coulde nede thynke wee heare seconde precepte lyke fyrste canne bee noo meanynge thereof thenne god wyll take done vnto hym selfe soeuer doone neyghboure thow wylte saye god heauen maketh matter also earth wherfore whenne thou seeste christian perylle thynke christe suffreth hath nede thy healpe saieth hymselfe laste daye make suche complayntes haue cared hunger thyrst common facion popedom olde souldiours ben horsmen fotemen warre also lawyer like thought haue liued prophan vnholy kynde life wold say yt serued world hitherto euer wold serue godmonkery charitie true seruice god thei wet som monasterie wher wer made monkes heremites fals peruers way yt wil serue god must seke solitarie place corner must conuersant amongest men help seruice doone vnto god comanded monkerie god seruice fulfilled thing vncomanded god also al ye trade therof charitie true seruice god wherof christ place speketh nothynge vsed also amongest iewes hurted neighbor diuersly thoughte offered muche burnt offerynge thyngs pleased god highly saieth god also psal wyll argue thee thy sacrifyces thy burnte offerynges alwayes syghte wyll take calues thy house neyther kiddes thy heardes myne wylde beastes woddes thousand beastes thousandes vppon mountaynes place sayeth also hee hathe noo nede theyr golde temple yf thou studyest true seruice go thy waye vnto thy neyghbour thou haste wyfe chyldren famyly neyghbours ruler lordes maisters many state shall fynde busines inough therin seruice ther stubburne thy familie child wynke see duely punished thy neyghbour nedie sorowfull sycke helpe hym se vnto hym conforte obey thy gouernour thinke done vnto greatly lamented thinges meanes moue v whatsoeuer haue trespassed god doth god forgeue v owne free wil beneficiall vnto neighbour thing god wil take though done vnto himselfe therfore ignorant worlde howe handleth god might learne hereby thing al men degree wantonnes folie daylye buffet god treade vnder fete men desyre may waxe riche selues may heape vp owne caring nothing goeth neyghbour could thinke himselfe surely soeuer doth neighbour done god might worthelie abhorre treble fashion maners worlde ther man thinketh true christ saith also wicked shall say last day lord math saw thee hungrie thirstie shal nothing preuayle christ sayth second like first shal say ye haue done one least mine haue ye done vnto first doctrine gospell god graunt maye moued therewith let euery man consider neyghbour doth hym good god may take done vnto hymselfe ther nothyng worlde vile base god may serued seruant stable mayde dayrie kitchyn child schole yea shoulde lordes seruantes worshipper woulde diligently god commande shoulde house made church nothyng kepte god seruice man ca persuaded care man serue neyghbour men endeuer serue selues seke owne commoditie wherfore euen good neyghbour may worke thing acceptable god world doth alway gratifie please deuill regard charitie toward neyghbour ende therof sorowfull please god wher god hath ordayned seruice done nigh felde within house whersoeuer thou doest workes thy vocation thou art occupied holy temple wher moste acceptable seruice may done god yet regard despise rather serue deuil hym wherfore learne geueth benefite neyghbour doth neyghbour heauenly father also sayinge place god take done vnto euen though done hym heauen math el woulde christ haue sayde second lyke first brought beleifethe benefite done oure neyghboure earthe done god heauen maye heauenly thynges earth may fynde euery temple let hym get hym deuill euen thou mayest make thee paradise heauen thou doest good thy neyghboure therin thou doest good god whiche heauen thou doest good thy neyghboure thou makest hell damnation thy selfe thou doest gratifie deuill whiche appointed hell neither doth skyll thou doest yet see fele tyme shall come thou shall fele see thou shalte accuse thy selfe thy stubburnes great folye wherfore necessarie v learne exercise oure selues doe good vnto neyghbourswhy god geuethe v hys gyftes ende thynges geuen v god entent hole perfect sens rich vnderstandynge suche myght therby obey commaundement hym seruice doctrine concernynge loue god neyghbour belongeth present lyfe second doctrine whiche teacheth whose sonne christe doth teache v howe maye obtaine euerlastynge lyfe lyfe shall obtayne euerlastynge lyfe knowe howe god oure neyghbour ought beloued v althoughe begyne performe dede diligence phariseyes dyd suppose whiche thought moses neded christ sheweth heretoo knowe christe necessari vnto saluacion preuayleth vnto obtayninge euerlastyng lyfe must clyme ascend hyer steppe learne perfectly christ whose sonne pharise e knewe son dauid christe requireth place reason christe sonne dauid must nedes die dauid dyd haue corporal kyngdome christ hath eternall kyngdome dauid father calleth hym father spirite howe doth agree christ dauides sonne lorde question whiche phariseyes make answer neither iewes present time answere therto question nothing beloging thy neighbour charitie good workes intented euen teache v know christ learneth wander fro kyngdom heauen euerlasting life sufficient euerlasting lyfethe knoweledge lawe sufficeth vnto sal cion know law reason also required done thing wont procede slowly wherfore necessitie required euen know perfectly christ wherfore christ doth put forth question byddeth make answere whose sonne christe flesh dauids sonne muche dauid calleth son lord yea lord sitteth right hande god god wil make enemy footstoole questio christ mindeth stirre vp iewes v haue hygher iudgement christ beholde maner eye suche see hym son dauid dauids lorde also man also god borne eternallie father el would dauid haue called lorde ben man byn dauids sonne dauid excellent holy man learned kyng yet calleth christ sonne lorde though say openly confessemy son passeth farre kyng beare name father yet lord lord sitteth right hand god god commandement beareth rule ouer enemy wher man easie iudge maner enemy hath euen deuill death paule gathereth psalme psal cor deuill death ought made footestoole sonne dauid might lord must nedes folowe godly power sonne dauid without vertue coulde nothyng death deuill men meanes doth christ bringe v true meaning declaring way euerlasting lyfe law profitable necessary doctrinethe lawe sheweth ought please god serue escape punishement sinne doctrine belongeth present lyfe much life must come lyfe euerlastynge doctrine lawe preuayleth nothing ther vnto reason hope lyfe excepte whollie ridde deliuered fro sinne although law geuen ende sinne might restrained yet synnes therby layde syde wherfore haue nede doctrine aboue lawe syth perfectly fulfill lawe law causeth v haue euil conscience feare god wroth synnes sake wherfore doctrine tendeth ende thou sholdest learne christ hath done nowe voyce onely son dauid iewes beleue also dauids lord euerlastinge verye god dothe putteth asyde hym forme god paule sayeth becommeth man phil taketh vpon hym deathe crosse uerilye sonne god saye sacrifice synnes worlde dyed rosse agayne thyrde day death vnto euerlastinge lyfe iohn sytteth ryghte hande god must learne beare awaye touchinge christ holdethe faste safe holdeth shall perishe vnder synnes reason rom synners lawe doth deliuer v oure synnes maketh v greuous synners agaynst god accuseth v god greate daunger fynde wayes escape doe sinnes conceaued borne psal longer oure lyfe oure synnes encrease burden put v burden may put downe cast cleaueth mary bone secret part v neuer suffereth v reast ca denie wold cosider wel proue stregth remedie learne christ assone thou knowest doth way come vnto saluation reason thou sinner haste sinned muche againste god haue respecte god sendeth christ suffer synners make satisfaction synnes debte trouble whiche riche christe hath taken vpon hym pay yea hath payd allredie wherfore remaineth thou embrace true confidence fayth death crosse christe vnknowen mandeathe death dewe v man haue hope priuilege contrarie dead vndone helpe selues consider wherof commeth death sinnes sake nowe haste thou heard wher thou muste set remission thy synnes euen death thy lorde iesu christ christ whan deadechrist lorde ouer deathe remained death arose fro death lyfe sure profe yt lord ouer death wherfore euen thou hast remission syn hym thou hast euerlastyng lyfe yt shall rayse thee vp againe thy flesh bodie ye last day true knowing christ know whose sonne euen ye son dauid yet neuertheles ye lord dauid sitteth ye right hade god hath footstoole enemis sin death hel wherfore nedeth helpe enemy must require moses ye law worke righteousnes let require ye son lord dauid wheras shalbe sure find doth ye idle kind phariseies know wherfore care christ cotent wt yt know ye law god neighbour loued wheras yet possible god shold knowen speake loue except christ knowen firste saith math math man knoweth father sonneno man loue god except knowethe christe son openeth cause christ occasio moueth preset questio though saye ye know god loued ye shal neuer loue god heart wyth soule mynde excepte ye knowe christ well perceaue otherwise knowe grace mercie god hath geuen vnto v smale thinge god hath made v geuen v bodie soule thinges vse thinges litle time lyfe iohn rom herein appeareth moste especially rich great goodnes mere mercy god wheras spared begotten sonne deliuered hym vnto death ye crosse sinnes deliuered sinne obtayne euerlasting lyfe hym euerlasting infinite incomprehensible loue grace whiche man know
