excepte know christ therfore neuer loue god truely without christ wherfore appeareth hereby phariseies scribe get question euen verely openly conuicted christ al talke much loue god vnderstande yet perceaue leaste part therof truely wheras knowe god whiche hath bestowed great benefittes liberalitie vpo shall loue neyghbour hath nede helpe recompence nothynge pouertie wherfore let v highly esteme doctrine let v geue thankes god oure heart deliuered vncredible darkenes vnder popedome euen like darkenes iewes haue pure doctrine christ wherby knowe howe ought deliuered saued sin receaue holy ghost whiche doctrine moueth oure mindes farre may begin loue god neyghbour whiche thing lord iesus christ graunt v amen amen xix sonday trinitie p gospell math ix iesus entred shipe passed ouer came owne citie beholde brought man sicke paulsey lying abedde iesus sawe faythe sayd sicke paulsey sonne good cheare thy sinnes forgeuen thee beholde certayne scribe sayde within selues man blasphemethe iesus sawe theyr thoughtes sayde wherefore thynke ye euyll heartes whether easier saye thy sinnes forgeuen thee saye aryse walke ye maye knowe sonne man hath power forgeue sinnes earth sayeth sicke paulsye aryse take vp thy bedde go vnto thine house rose departed house people sawe marueyled glorified god whiche hath geuen power vnto men exposition ought especiallie marke gospel word grace god hath communicat geuen among v might pronounce amongest selues thy synnes forgeuen thee might merueil present geue god heartie thankes hath geuen man suche power doubtles great power wher christian men may say one otherman hath power forgeue sinnnes brother mine feare god merciful vnto thee beleue ye promise whiche pronounce name iesu matter shall sure though god pronounced himselfe thy sin forgeuen thee power began christe haue heard afterward remained v men specially yt minister howe neuerthelesse euery christian man hath power thou felest desperation sinne say vnto thee art thou sorowful christian man say vnto thee thou doest wrong thy selfe god angrie thee wordes ought haue lesse estimation greued christe hymselfe pronounced heauen neyther ought thyng lesse estemed person pronounceth effecte consisteth herein thy hearte shoulde apprehende beleue promisse thinke moste certaine god mercifull vnto thee christes sake example man sycke palsie christ doth first adhort man fayth good confort saith doubt thy synnes forgeuen thee soone sycke palsie beleued worde synnes without doubt forgeuen hym doubtelesse obtayne remission synnes congregation minister christian saith vnto thee god angrie thee beware thou wronge thy selfe hath forgeuen thee thy synnes iesus christ sonnes sake thy duetie beleue promise thy heart rather suffer euill harme doubt thou boubte absolution doth thee good althoughe god hymselfe angell pronounce ouer thee wher fayth god reproued light vaine person though true promiseth god saue v suche vnbeleife mistrust whiche greuouse sinne deuil subtill craftesman brynge v might counte god lyer shoulde loth beleue god promise heart doth embrace promise god glorified greatest glorie whiche pleaseth affirmed true deceaue although promise thinges vnpossible wherfore pleaseth christ speciallie man therfore speaketh gentilly vnto sonne thou art vexed wyth syckenes deuill hath endamaged thee palsei god thy sin hath suffered done ther ensueth vpon also dread euill conscience thou thynkest christ angrie thee thou hast way escape naturallie geuen punishment god man feare dread conscience thou must geue place feare thou must thynke god hath regard thee thou canste tell whether wyll haue mercie thee sinner ought brought god al thoughtes wycked thou muste haue respect sinne punishement synne christ speaketh euen thy synnes forgeuen wherfore sycke palsie must thinke althoughe suffereth palsei sin yet sinnes forgeuen fayth hindred neither palsei neither disease wise ought faith worde ioyned getherthe worde faythe muste ioyned together none without beleueth hath word beleueth turke iew doth thinke god merciful fauorable lacke promesse christ god mercifull man hath worde without faith also worde efficaciegods mercie found christe alone faith word knit gether suche sure knot yt sundered meanes phatasticall person beleueth ende world shal within moneth counterfayted faith without worde turke beleueth may hope saued mahomet lye ther worde profe therof pope beleueth christias may get righteousnes saluation owne workes fayned faith worde promesse possible fayth worde therfore true fayth christian lacke worde haue pure syncere worde fele want fayth beleue word ought doth deuill original sinne worke v withdraweth v word vnto lie naturallie borne sin glad geue credence lie wherfore hard pece worke shake vnbeleife although haue worde present fleshe deuil withdraweth v alwaye word cosider thou thy selfe could trulye perfectly beleue christe speaketh sycke palsie also spoken euery one v baptisme absolution also common sermon ther wrath god feared indignation lefte dreadded thinkest thou would excedyng ioye vnto thinges shoulde seme full ioy pleasure much sure tokennote well olde man deuil continually hinder faith wherfore thinke suretie necessarie first worde must heard must also beleued without al doubting much possiblewith worde easye thing beleue lye al must thinges hoped gospell promiseth necessarie either spiritual temporall lyfe haue worde may easelie beleue reason vice geuen nature glad beleue lie heart proue therto meanes pope sectary beleue constantly masse seruice intercession sainctes monasticall vowes ceremony fastes c false fayned fayth reuerence ful whoredome baudrie heart full fornication false faith causeth spiritual whoredom contrari part thankes vnto god haue pure chaste spowse word doubtlesse sincere true beleue constantly wher neuerthelesse sholde beleue costantly beleue constantly seing haue worde cause therof oure olde man deuill thorow originall sinne depart worde truth vnto lye thing learned gospellout gospell must first learne haue nede worde embrace sure faith afterwarde doth therof ensue remission sin euerlastyng lyfe yt surely ridde difficulty danger life life euerlasting worde lackyng ther faith also anabaptistes arrians turkes iewes papistes haue fayth faith without worde ingenerat v nature fall adam lying fayth nature may kepe surely worde god christe preached sicke palsye forgaue sinnes scribe thinke christ blasphemeth god forgeueth sin part necessarie also greate wayght euident example phantasticall person errour know howe synnes forgeuen demaunde pope doctours add tell thee absolution doth popedome holdeth fast doctrine surely holden vp therby grace powred yt would obtaine hath nede contrition confession satisfaction demanded office absolution key answere exterial administration obserued ye church saye anabaptistes also shall baptisme preuayle obtayning remission sinnes sith litle water spirit requisite short secte maker monke priest could see remission sinne power geuen man gospell wherfore learne thou say know god doth onely forgeue sinne confesse yet also knowen may certifiedgod alone forgeueth synne minister certifyethe conscience ther worde synnes forgeuen meane whiche sinnes forgeuen say desire remission sin must go corner say god forgeue sin loke som angel god shold send vnto thee say math marc thy sinnes forgeuen god promiseth come vnto v baptisme may amonge v word holy might said baptise thee name father son holy ghost beleueth baptised shall saued thou sayste baptisme water onely true water alone god worde therfore come minister whiche hath peculier commandement god christian desyre remission synnes doth minister pronounce stede god declare vnto thee iesus remission thy synnes mayste thou surely truste thy synnes forgeuen baptime worde deceaue thee dyd teache popedome neither doth preacher vnderstand wherfore geue thankes god benefite light learne diligently god alone forgeueth sinne verely otherwise hath geuen men power christ begynneth place afterwarde geueth commandement fro henceforth shold alwayes obserued kepte congregation vnto ende worlde repentaunce remission sinnes sholde preached name remission sinnes amongest men required worde wher el luke ther may founde suffereth thee ascend heauen therfore whe thou desirest remission synne receaue baptisme thou yet christined thou see thou doest call minde promesse harde belife go also one thy neyghbour aske absolution thou hearest remission sinne pronounced vnto thee name iesu beleue thou shalt obtaine thy desire baptisme absolution publike worde sacrament maye seme lyght thing vnto thee remission sin may asked required therby intent god hath called ordained thy pastour curate math thy father mother thy christian neyghbour hath put word mouth thou shouldest aske confort remission syn maye counted commandement ordinance god shold geue credence wordes men according christes worde commandement vse ministration office wordes men god wherfore wordes beleued constantly despised minister baptiseth childe accordyng christes commadement thou hearest wordes pronouced man math iohn wordes god neither must thou take otherwise god pronounced theym hymselfe whenne thy synnes forgeuen thee absolution thou mayest doubte yf god hadde spoken theym hymselfe god hym selfe pronounceth sentence thy synnes maye forgeuen thee wherefore learne place waye howe aunswere phantasticall person crie wyse water water know thys alsoof water baptisme note ignorant hereof worde god ioyned suche water wherfore longer pure water diuine water whyche mynister geueth hymselfe god commaunded geuen intente myghte haue new byrthe enter kyngdome god remyssion oure synnes god geuethe worde whyche hys oures dothe hee geue also faythe vnto worde bothe gyftes god faithe wordefayth worde gift god wherfore remyssion synnes woorke god although god woorketh man thus must remission synnes required worde put man mouthe sacramentes whiche ministred men el found ell vnderstande woorkes farre otherwyse whyche doo worde woorkes god madnesse thenne moueth papist attribute remission synnes theyr workes wherefore whenne laste daye shall comme foorth workes christ shall aske theym saye worde ordeyned congregation baptisme sacramente body bloode absolution open preachyng word men myght obteyne remission synnes partaker grace haue ye vsed way trade might ye haue sure way remission synnes workes certayntie wherfore must marke doctrine diligetly proprely remission sin may assured therof wherof muste aske receyue itin true churche christe remission synnes ell uerily ye must haue respect vnto ye holy church wher word sacrament ther found heauen phariseis thynk supposyng christ blasphemeth god remitteth syn beware thou say god hath bestowed remission synne baptisme math worde yea hath put euery christian mannes mouthe conforteth thee sheweth grace god thou mayste receaue beleue otherwyse yf christ hym selfe pronounced hys owne mouthe pronouncethe man sycke palseye wherefore heretikes greately deceaued sunder woorde frome remission synne thys myght doone yf woorde man god worde god water goeth take frome man defraude hym takethe awaye frome manne also remission synnes neyther remedye agaynste wherefore anabaptistes heretikes loose also remyssion synnes baptisme sacramente holye congregation christian woorkes caste awaye worde heare theyr mynister care yf voyce beast god spake one asse yf yet speake oxe beast ought hearde preuayle men speake commandement god althoughe thou doest heare voyce manne yet doste thou heare god receauest suretie remission thy synnes frome god thou embrace onely faithe numer thought good make mention matter thys place ye myght make stronge selues agaynste sectes ye myghte bee prepared agaynst theyr assaultes said popedom knewe nothyng lesse doctrine thynk popedome baptisme came ende nowe longe agone haue nede remission synne contrition confession satisfaction requisite thus dydde describe penaunce thys diuinitie suche dyuell canne well awaye therewith hurteth hys kyngedome trewe contrition requisite must sorie synnes obteyne remission synne thereby remission synnes commeth onely hereby yf haue respecte worde promyse god embrace stronge faithe inuert turne vp syde downe omytte worde regarde minister pronounceth commandement iesu christ haue respecte onely theyr contrition penaunce meanes lese bothe christe benefyttes neyther possyblecontricion shoulde conforte solace much one troubled conscience lette passe woorde whiche onelye remayneth hope saluation bryngeth menne contrition rightuousnesse lerne concernyng remission synnes conforte youre selues also muche god baptisme absolution open preaching word sacrament doth talke v minister al christian must credence geuen suretie obteyn remission synnes whiche remission popedome dead buried touchynge woorde mentioned pope bulles onely make rehersall contrition referre remission synnes vnto thus haue remit synne let v briefly touche hystorie sycke palsey example synners propretie diseasethe propertie palseye member office man goeth aboute drawe fete handes hym farther falle frome hym wherefore aristotle ethikes compareth suche man wylde fierce youthe whyche meanes tamed wyll wel vnderstande disease muste take spoken hypocrite wyll iustified theyr woorkes labour drawe nyghe vnto god pacifie hym farther ar cast thynke hym moste pleasure displease hym haue faythe therfore coueteth ridde euyll let hym come man deliuereth wise saith sonne good comfort thy synnes ar forgeuen thee worde strengthe restored membres maye healpe one remission synnes shall ensue true good workes sinne taken away christes especial meaning ye sick ye palsey laye downe sicke bed disease woulde suffer hym otherwise killed hog vnprofitable mebers christ biddeth rise riseth strong lustie wont caried home beareth home owne couche wold christ herof shold take behold example signe hath power earth forgeue synne speaketh playnely earth shold loke heauen pope taught hope remission syns purgatorie men workes merites place remission synnes power geuen men earth baptisme ministryng sacramente absolution open preachyng contrarywise whatsoeuer bound excluded baptisme sacrament worde bounde also heauen power men earthe doo lose bynd sinnes god spoiled glorienote well neyther ar made god therby prophane wicked mynded men doo oftentymes say matter haue ministerie office wherfore god hath coupled v together ministerie alwaies one v shoulde conforte confirme shoulde thynke hym selfe bounde beleue farre worde purely preached vnto hym say remission synnes name christ bryngyng vnto god remission syns dieth thys beliefe dieth saluation hee dyeth taught popedome confidence trust intercession sainctes dyeth euyll destruction hee lackethe defender whiche god ordeyned agaynst violence death trewe pastor pure worde absolution great miserie deuyll brought pope yea nowe begynneth bee author infection sectary abyde worde offendeth eye wherefore pope toke clean away place brought monkes rule mass pilgremages pardon suche dyuel well away hyndreth kyngdom nothyng anabaptistes furder matter speake contemptuously water baptisme swenckfeldians also mooste vilely wickedly contemne outward preachynge worde haue loste worde wherfore auoyded learned remission el woorde woorde baptisme supper lorde absolution publike preachyng wherfore remission synne also let hym accursed sayeth otherwise wher word faith requisite membres begyn fastned syck ye palsey could moue mean loke wher worde palsey neuer taken away vnpossible true mouyng ioyn membres together wold earnestly dryue pope sectes author suche great disorder congregation pope bryngeth neyther worde sacramentes sectary speake contemptuously worde sacrament nothynge preuayleth holy ghoste knowe thys holye ghoste wyll doo hys worke without woorde sacramentes wherfore despise woorde sacramentes wyll obserue chiefe thynges haue god graunte grace maye preserue pure doctrine continue end saued amen xx sonday trinitie sondaye pthe gospell math xxii iesus sayde disciple kyngdom heauen lyke vnto man kynge made maryage sonne sent forthe seruauntes call bydden weddyng woulde come agayne sent forth seruauntes saying tell bydden behold haue prepared dinner mine ox fatlynges kylled thynges redy come vnto mariage made light went wayes one farme place another marchaundise remnaunt toke seruauntes intreated shamefully slewe kyng heard thereof wrothe sent forthe men warre destroyed murtherers brente vp theyr citie sayde seruauntes maryage dede prepared whiche bydden worthy go ye therefore hye wayes manye ye fynde bydde theym maryage seruauntes wente foorthe hyghe wayes gathered together many coulde fynde bothe good badde weddynge furnyshed geastes kynge came see geastes spyed man whiche weddyng garment saide vnto frende howe camest thou hyther hauyng weddynge garmente euen spechelesse sayde kynge minister take bynde hym hande foote caste vtter darknesse shalbe weepyng gnashynge teeth many called fewe chosen exposition gospel ye heare kingdom god lyke vnto mariage vnto whiche many bydden onely come regarde also reuile kyll seruants call must first learn word kyngdom heauen signifieth euen worldly kyngdom kyngdome heauenwhat kyngdome heauen signifyethe god onely kyng doo call holye churche whiche nowe christ dothe therfore vse parable mariage beyng kynges sonne taketh churche spouse wherfore kyngdome heauen taken suche wise earth yet politicall earthly kyngdome spirituall eternall state christian lyfe suche halfe kyngdome god soule spirite theyr fayth wherfore thou heareste kyngdome heauen thou must loke heauen thou must seke earth amongest men world soeuer gospel beleued true vse sacrament ministred yt proprely ye kyngdom heauen nothyng el kyngdom christ kyngdome gospell faith whersoeuer gospell christ wher christ holy ghost kyngdome whiche true kyngdom heauen cause haue word sacramentes beleue continue christ faith heauenly prince sonnes god onely remayneth god moue away half wall put betwene die shall thynges heauen saluation therfore must lerned first kingdome heauen kyngdome christe worde faith kyngdome haue lyfe hope cleane synnes free death hell sauyng body synne lefte whiche yet abolyshed yet shalbe abolished al thinges shalbe lyfe saluation heauen mariage sayeth christ god hathe called iewes people dyuers tymes commynge holy prophet office specially bycause comanded iewes waite mariage put people sure hope christ would set foorth gospel throughout worlde procure remission synnes euerlastyng life shold preached name ought men exhorted shoulde waite gospell trust myghte saued christ christ saieth wold come iewes desert would haue returned egypt sent seruantes tyme christes comyng whych shold open hymself teachyng myracles great wonder iohn christes disciple sayd thynges ready nothynge lackyng make selues redy mariage could persuaded messenger comme regarded saythe christ one went farme busynesse merchandise c vnworthye thyng despise feaste euen remission synnes euerlasting lyfe yet hope saluation woulde neuer gredilye haue gone farme merchandise vtterly set naught noble mariage alwaies state gospel often preached world waxeth worse vsed suche merchandyse soone callyng gospell set vp falle merchandyse wyth theyr studye canne bee otherwyse wherfore lette manne offended present maners geue selfe couetousnesse bothe citie also countrey bee insolente prowde handle shepheardes curate whyche call theym feast vnwoorthily handle men lett man thynke peruerse maner shall haue good successe neither wil hope much better state haue let offece moue thee muche long sufferance pacience god yet wyl suffer escape vnpunyshed nowe god suffer men theyr licentious lyuyngthe longe sufferinge god despise gospell faithefull warnynges brynge dearthe thynges encrease theyr owne substance wynketh maketh though sawe whenne god shall sende pestilence men may dye falle downe fly leaues harueste whenne shall stirre vp battaile violent souldiours shall breake thy house destroye thynges beate thee handle thy wyfe chyldren vilainously thy face whenne thou shalte cry cruell doynges complayne greate wrathe god shall appeare god thynketh thy auarice insolence great madnes thenne shalt thou bee reproued thys wyse thow couldest despise counsayle god thoroughe thy couetousnesse insolencye nowe muste thou holde thy selfe contente thynges whyche thou haste stirred vppon thee thy licentious longe outragious lyuynge god suffereth hym selfe mocked longe wherefore menne myghte doo well yf woulde ceasse betyme amende god worde dothe diligently exhorte v doo woulde haue lycence doo bothe euen nowe despyse woorde god folow lustes yet god absteyne punishyng v gospell teacheth farther matter byd bolde tooke seruauntes reuyled theym kylled doth christ specially meane citie ierusalem whiche kylled prophetes length sonne god commeth therof kyng hearde thereof wrothe sent warriours euen romaynes could serue god turne kyll murderer burne citie iewes sold better cheape byrdes euen thirtie penye lacked lamentation coplaynyng god toke vengeance muche refused come called repentance mariage sonne therfore god refuseth nowe agayne heare thyng beware chance thee ar many thinges inough offende god ire vnpatience auarice care liuyng lechery hate vice synnes yet thynges nothyng comparison synnethe cotempt god worde greatest synne whiche contemnyng god worde yet moste common synne bee geuen auarice steale committe whoredome fornication common synnes world danger synne citizen husbandemed sette muche gospell sleape seruice man may se churche one loketh way waye great multitude scarsely ten twelue come thintente learne thynge yea furthermore besyde encreseth matter also comon synne deathlyke greuous hellyshe diuellyshe noted synnes bee count lyght matter presente sermon take hede yea rather great parte geue selues bousyng bybbyng tyme sermon regard thinke matter man moued man greued therfore men coldly affected worde synnes synnes slaughter adulterie theft c dothe make men oftentymes contrite sorowfull wold wishe vndone man counte thynges well done heare word diligently despise persecute man count matter consciencenote take hede wherfore suche synne whiche imperies commonalty city must destroyed acknowledged receaued repentance amendement lyfe ensue chanced therfore kyngedomes ierusalem england also shall greuously punyshed synne synne cryeth daiely god neyther dothe suffer god rest saith wroth gaue sonne highest price wold gladly haue communication teache instruct euerlastyng life none desyrous heare wherefore withdrawe punyshment iohn iohn damnation lyght came world men loue darkenes lyght theyr workes ar euyl though would saie would gladly wynke syns damnation worlde condemneth haue sent euen worde careth greueth full sinnes would healpee theym worde wyll therfore wil hear word let heare deuyls worde let perishe also kyngdome confusion thus hath chaunced congregation east mooste flouryshynge communaltiesthe easte church greate region whyche nowe vnder turke hungarie also almoste vndoone vtterlye place wyll heare gospel wherfore punyshment constreigned heare anabaptistes diuelyshe doctoures punishement god worde despised hearde greattest moste haynous synne therefore moste greatest greuousest punishemente prouided god embrace worde louyngly onely write fine letter bookes also heartes world grant hym place scarcely suffereth bokes sermon rather haue dyuel hert shall haue hym length wherfore learne also god hath cause inough punishe synnes oures synne passeth whenne worde set naught yll ordered call men mariage therfore holden wyth thys synne lette hym learne see vnto hym selfe thys doctrine may know lyttle synne moste greatest greuous synnes whiche god canne suffer punysheth greuously men crye agaynste periurie auarice beare route worlde thus trewe thynges canne longe escape vnpunyshed haue gospell care soo lyghtely meane tyme sette myndes idelly vppon trifle whyle woorde preached synne passynge synnes doubtlesse shall bee punyshed god errours lewde teacher maye enter wyth power take awaye thynges grece regyons nowe mahomette reygneth whych thys time dryuethe theym abhominations dyuell whyche hadde worde god wold beleue popedome chaunced thus also first trewe doctrine menne vnkynde despysed doctrine god punyshed synne thys wyse allowed monkery mooste impudente lye nowe also thys commynge passe agayn must nedes chance thys synne bothe corporall spirituall punyshementes dyuell castethe amongest v arrians anabaptistes goddes woorde regarded receaued thankefullye remember ye therefore muste beware thys synne magnyfye woorde god heare dylygently although none cause doo yet sufficient cause god hathe commaunded mooste acceptable seruice vnto hym littell matter doo serue suche greate lorde hee canne requite recompence moste lyberallye wherefore thys seruyce oughte moste acceptable christian men might thynk trewely yf lorde god requyre thys shoulde heare hys worde wyll gladly doo hym thys seruyce may boaste haue bestowed hower daye goddes seruice shoulde sufficient cause v regarde god word besydes cause also euidente thys doth god promyse also yf thou wylt heare woorde kepe thou shalt subdue deuyllcauses oughte moue v heare god worde wyll bolde come nere vnto thee word deuyll haue place besyde profite thou shalt haue thy synnes forgeuen thee thy hearte inflamed true study religion obedience towarde god man short thou shalte obtayne last lyfe euerlasting poynt prescribe thee suche seruice whiche great profit may redounde vnto thee profite thee yet thou bounde doo doone commaunde thee seruice moste thy profite proue experience nothing repete ten commaundementes lord prayer commeth always therof newe profite may vnderstande thyng came mynde commoditie specially therwith dyuell therby dryuen frome thee may hurt thee wherfore lette christian arrogant thynke hee vnderstandeth lordes prayer ten commandementes suche thynge come mynde iudge temptation say haue sayd day nowe wille saye agayne thou mayest alwayes repelle put awaye deuyll frome thee shalte thou doo vnto god moste profytable seruice thou doest thou shalte offende god greatly would gladly proue fele greate wrathe god ala thus goeth matter great parte nothyng regardeth worde yet nothyng certaine sinnes pestilence warre befalleth god regarde thee stoppe eares thy crie euen thou also hast deafe eares worde salomon sayth haue called ye haue refused pro haue put forth hand none would see ye haue despised councell neglected discipline also laugh scorne ye feared chaunced vnto sodein miserie shall fal vpon destruction tempest breake tribulation anguishe shall come vpon shall call e heare morning shall ryse shall fynde hated reformed receaued feare lorde obeyed councell caste correction shalbe punishement synne thou shalte thy appointed tyme bytterlye punished euen thou shalte haue god laugh thee scorne shall say chaunced worthely vnto thee wheras put forth vnto doctrine sincere councell thou despisedst therfore chaunceth worthely vnto thee yt thou hearest ye deuil thou wilt heare saith come vnto labour heuie burdened wil refresh heare thou vngodly souldier first curseth banneth afterward thrust thee speare thou cast refuse wrongfullye done diddest thou despise word god thou sholdest haue heard taken thy cheif salfegarde thou settest thy feldes possession ye hearing thinkest thou god take greuously six dayes hath appoited thee labour exercise husbandrie requireth himselfe seuenth daye thou sholdest hym seruice also yet shall obtayne thee wherfore learne horrible dreadfulll sermon iewes despised mariage preachyng gospell reuiled killed vp seruantes kynge abide therfore sendeth warrior euen romains destroyeth murtherers burneth vp ther citie say god doth wronge great prince sende son certain bound prisonnote deliuer would receaue deliuerer thackfully also woulde kyll hym mocke father also wold father take thinkest thou wold destroy prisoner prison also doth god sendeth sonne deliuer v syn death hel geue v euerlasting lyfe oughte heard v receaued fayth cast hym behinde go landes possession thinges seme much better v wherfore plage punishment god breake vpon v heapes swarmes pestilence turke warres whome blame selues come vnto mourning lamenting shall preuayle thynke thou muche thou hast displeased god longe time thou hast denied true seruice compare thy faulte wrath god thou shalte thynke well differreth longe euerlastynge paynes hell temporall paynes calleth thee repentance thou mayst amende cease sin last gospell kyng destroyed murtherers burned vp citie geue v example despisers feldes city seduce v folow maners wil otherwise worlde persuaded care worde alwayes set feldes merchandise shall greuously punished iudgement shal abide iewes shewe example wherfore let v folow let v rather heare worde diligetly deuotion thinges let v honorably receaue seruantes cal v ye lord sake whome sent shall perceaue god helper thinges difficultie shalbe present v defend v length shall geue v life euerlasting son bridgrome iesus christ first part cocerning iewes gon herken sayth gentils wtout hauing law worde god within ye wale open place yt deuil might ronne libertie also commandeth kynge called might come al without exception men woman olde yonge poore rich se daye god hath set forth baptisme ye worde ye supper might take part wherfore calling nothing el christ preached men baptised might gestes make mery mariage might haue remissio sinnes life euerlasting ye deuil hel gate bydden mariage whan number gestes fulfilled plaine euell good called kyng himselfe commeth seeth gestes hath perceaueth mariage garment alwayes amongest christian true christian faultie vicious yet haue ye name christian baptised vse sacrament heare sermon yet haue name thinke ye matter earnest true must accustome know wil neuer come passe teaching yt whole citie vilage yea hole house shold truly ensue godlines come passe maner ther commeth good euill must abyde touchyng name suffer called christian al bydden al come ye mariage garment euen vnto last day last ther shalbe made difference thus surely decreed king wil haue called mariage son also see whether called come wyth mariage garment man come mariage feaste fowle sluttishe working shoppe would gladly receaue vnto although wer bide ye feaste yea specially ye bridgrome wold greued therwt shold perceaue yt mocked yt mad proude person must come feaste wt mariage garment saith christ yt shal come passe also like wise although thou christened hearest sermon vsest ye sacrement yet art without mariage garmet beleuest carest earnestly gospel wouldest vse name christian pope doe thou mightest get commodity prebendes therby thou art christian god sake neither thy owne saluatio thou wouldest take greater pleasure therof truly thou must thynke thou mayst lye hyd thy hypocrisieno hipocrite hyde selfe face god kynge comming see thee pluck forth middest el last common day thou shalt die say makest thou syth thou hast name propertie christian thou beleuedst behoueth christia thou diddest neuer earnestly regard religion godlines howe thou mightest deliuered syn dede obtaine righteousnes saluation thou diddest onlie aspire substance thou gapedst howe thou mightest get heape vp wherfore thou art come mariage garment get hence ther rome thee amongest goodly decked mariage saith christ shalbe layd hypocrite charge eyther later day death shalbe dombe yt shalbe able alleage nothynge defence bringe god made thinges gaue vnto moste holy baptisme put gospell yea thy mouth gaue supper communion euerie wher absolution ordayned comon minister thou haddest home parentes maisters teach thou sholdest beleue godlines thou sholdest shewe thy liuing wherfore thou canst lay thy excuse thou ignorant article thy beleife thou shalt nedes constrained confesse baptised gospell sufficiently preached vnto cared sett wordlye thinges doth signifie place wher lacked mariage garment done could answere wherto must beare record yt gaue vnto v sonne shewed maner grace baptisme gospel remained shoulde receaue embracing armes offereth willingly vnto v wherfore horrible iudgement shall geuen hypocrite euen yt may caste bound hand foote vtter darkenes may damned deuil hell vnto euerlasting chaines handes feete bounde deliuer selues theyr workes shall abyde damnation darkenes shall lacke light god confort euer alwaye perpetuall miserie anguishe tormentes shall neuer come vnto muche sparke light horrible miserie oh could moued therby consider dolful paine lyue miserablye hel chaynes weping gnashinge teeth gnashinge teeth shalbe frost colde wepinge waylinge heate doctours haue expounded albeit christ wolde signifie hereby maner torment may inuented shalbe punishement ye time visitatio knowen receaued wheras called sacrament baptisme gospel absolution yet beleued vsed christ would teach v bringe v might know great felicitie hath chaunced v called magnificent noble glorious mariage may sure find recouerig fro sin deuil death hell euerlasting wayling yt knowlege great grace counteth thing estimatio hath worthely reward eternal death one two must nedes yt man either receaue ye gospell beleue get euerlasting saluatio beleue get euerlasting danatio yt gospel may iustly say ye yt paule sayd iewes spake blasphemed blud vpo owne head fro time forth go giltlesse ye getils whe ye iewes wold come god subdued destruction sent gospel v getiles much come v remaineth describe yt god wil cast yt haue mariage garment ye lord partly alluring partly fearing bring v point act yt shold take ye gospel cheife safgard studiouslye heare beleue allureth v promise great grace great punishmets feareth v whan preuayleth none two extreme destruction sure come god wold raine downe gold perchance ther wold som begin loke vp heauen wheras putteth forth vnto v punishment eternal death careth hath respecte life therfore ye ye whole sermo christ wold gladly allure feare v yt might earnestly embrace beleue word loke wayte certeinly ye ioyful coming ye last day whe shall retourne deliuer v fro euil bodely gostly whych thig yt almighty god merciful father graunt v christ son holy ghost amen xxi sonday trinitie sonday p gospell iohn iiii certayne ruler whose sonne sicke capernaum sone heard iesus come iurye galile wente vnto hym besoughte hym woulde come downe heale sonne euen poynt deathe sayde iesus vnto hym excepte ye see signes wonder ye wyll beleue ruler sayd vnto hym sir come euer sonne dye iesus saithe vnto go thy way thy sonne lyuethe man beleued worde iesus spoken vnto hym went way going downe seruauntes mett tolde hym saying thy sonne lyuethe enquired houre began amende sayde vnto hym yester day seuenthe houre feuer left father knewe ye houre iesus sayde vnto hym sonne liueth beleued householde agayne seconde miracle yt iesus dyd come iury galile exposition two thinges gospell whiche profitable therfore moste worthie memorie first miracle christ sheweth child perill wheras healeth yet commeth hym onely saith father go thy waye thy son lyueth forthwith worde childe recouered whiche many mile thence knew nothinge worde great miracle declareth vnto v mightie word lord iesus christ isthe power god word whatsoeuer setteth vpon bringeth passe although deuill neuer muche disease otherwise estemed v workes wherwith deuill vexe v moste miserable men destroying worke deuill nothing el requisite worde christ health gotten deuil muste geue place whether soone worde man christ soundeth see wherfore miracle pertayneth specially ende maye well knowe christ man lyue bodilye lyfe also almightie god much lorde ouer death deuill yea lord worde helpe againste euill therfore also peril necessitie must seeke helpe hym prince doth speciallye oughte make muche worde wolde power almightie hath hath doe thynges hath nothynge againste synne death deuill loke christ doth sonne ruler rom iac wher defendeth worde againste death lyfe shold oppressed death doth make worke v worde receaue purposeth deliuer v corporall euils also sin eternall death wherfore muste folow example ruler peril euilles may require health wheras almightie worde hath redie present power wil helpe v wher ruler maketh haste hateth delay christ maketh muche haste differreth helpinge vnto comming father rather houre moment wil haue sycke child made whole also must doubte christ redie helpe v aske trust surely himwhy christe sent thys worlde intet sent came earth deliuer v sin death destroye tyranny deuill open kyngdome god v cause ye father merciful god sent cause came earth wherfore asketh helpe hym shal depart without helpe see ruler intreateth bodelye helth howe much redie shall wil wheras perill helpe necessary v wher matter euerlastyng lyf hande first touching vse instructe teache suche kynde miracle taught therfore dyd christ worke afterward preserued monument bookes might know power christe haue refuge vnto trouble perill second whereof must teach history notable example sett forth vnto v whiche may know certainly truly faith aduersaries papistes teache none otherwise touching faith certein knowledge concerninge christ hath ye true christian haue deuil hipocrites haue also know christ miracle actes concerninge christian faith ye scripture speaketh wise yt obtaine remission sinnes righteousnesof christe faythe euerlastinge life saith paule suppose yt iustified faith without workes law rom abacuc luc ye prophet abacuk saith righteous lyueth faith christ saith mary whose sinnes forgeuen go thy wayes thy faith hath saued thee wherfore faith faith deuil hypocrite congregation whiche know history holde purely sincerely christian could hid priuie fro deuil dyd suffered ye earth although necessary christian knowe yet true faith whiche obtayne remission sinnes life euerlastinge place described exaple true faith eue thinke surely yt christ speaketh promiseth certaine without faulte two ioyned togetherwhat true fayth god promiseth yt shold ebrace faith doubt nothing yt true yt certaine although perceaue see loke wher ye promise embrace wt faith true christian faith see ruler commeth christe desyreth go downe helpe son ruler tooke heuily greatlye afrayd dreaded greatly least yt brough christ betimes son shold die afterward ther shold hope helpe declareth maner faith hath wher knowledgeth christ helper without meaninge woulde neuer haue come christ wherfore ought counted greate thynge wher nature despeired recoueringe lyfe men longer hope lyfe hym yet taketh longe iorney christ hope myght bring christe deade past cure yet could christe take faith although certaine knowledge christ yet setting forth wherof came worlde taken acknowledged onely helper bodilie necessity yea present worde set forth touching promise reuelacion gospel may fele godly power present euill speciallie againste spirirual euill hath diuine godlyke power must worde thought almighty point doth adhorte ruler might rather haue respect cause miracle miracle themselues mighte begine last hope saluation word although ther ben miracle shewed miracle ther alwayes present ayde required true faith despeireth promise worde although ther signe present ayde succoure must fayth al sainctes god may glorified god sheweth himselfe appliant vnto v soone way wil yet shoulde ceasse praisyng hym hypocrite doe wherfore requireth faith abide patiently althoughe god miracle done becke faith excepte respecte word touching christ whiche deadly malediction curse hym taken awaye al incombred bodilie euils death although destitute signes deliuerance yet despeire touching final last deliuerace death resurrection christe christ commandeth shold loke seeke signe wold haue v careful touchyng cheif signe hath put forth expresse worde without condition math al might certainly beleue haue remission synnes deliuerance death life euerlasting christes sake wold miracle signes serue geue place cheif wherfore thinges must loked none know god praised great signe aboue doth vse neuerthelesse may cheifly regarde first cheifest signe pleaseth god omitt inferiour signes true procuring cheif signe let v beware importune thinke must done necessitie god requireth cheife counted amogest v al al shold beleue surely shalbe saued euident pure couenant god neuerthelesse meane season god doth suspend prolonge ende successe present temptation specially amonge weake yet strenghthen themselues litle litle spirituall vse learne obey god al thinges yt please hym put worde althoughe promise loked without signe sensuall feling time yet let faint geue vp vse holy ghost president confortour although christ departe signes miracle true faith said whiche stycketh vnto word christ touching saluatio euerlasting life also concerning sure preseruation church also euery one v yt done without temptation god wholly deped wil therfore hath boud himselfe principal saluatio certaine might haue thinges depending faith trust therof may iudged administer wel vnto v although fulfil desirs pointes betwene two belonge common ecclesiasticall trade graunteth man would saye personal priuileges kyng euen peculiaer word touchinge saluation son syth put forth plaine euident ought embraced sure faith put forth concernyng remission sinne euerlasting life name christ loke thing word put forth promise shall certeinly come passe must certainelye beleued god tempted whan signe determined appointed promise required truly glorified appointed worde beleued achas ruler doth glorifie god beleueth determined word christ reg esa forthwith obtayneth helth sonne knoweth familie retournyng home learne therfore place true fayth euen doubt nothing word christe promise beleue surely worde promiseth shall come passethe nature faythe although sene perceaued cheif nature faith embrace beleue present thinges present beleued seen felte riche man although beleueth shal die hunger yere yet faith yt hath store substace yet sticketh surely god word yt god father wil prouide liuing yet caste away ye feare god serue owne vocation beleueth truly possible yt faith shold deceaue grounded god word almighti promiseth fyrst seeke ye kyngdome god righteousnes therof yt thing shallbe cast vnto v proue corrupted sin math yt lyue voyde righteousnes worde preacheth vnto v remission sinnes righteousnes none otherwise apprehended faith wherfore ye state christia yt although sustaineth ye body sin yet pure righteous wt sin faith ye worde doth fayth worke worke ca neuer ye brainlesse papistes teach touching ye workes althoughe neuer good yet vnprofitable seruats christ saith haue said touching righteousnes luc also cocerning lyfe infected synne drowned vp sure lyfe space momet yt may truly said ye wise paynimes ethnickes nothing certaine man death proue true example also example others also soone men inuegled enuironed sycknes danger yet haue ye word set forth v putteth v hope lyfe also euerlasting life beleue touche handes fele grope promised v worde beleue sure faith shall deceaue v grounded god worde whiche omnipotent euerlastynge shorte nature faith worde doth promise thinges vnuisible thigs come doth faith beleue inuisible thigs surely loketh come reason knoweth ye word god almightie god true without lyinge wherfore fayth hath diligent respect vnto worde perceaue word embrace boldlye careth nothinge eyther worlde deuil sure end shal befalle although deuil fleshe worlde make neuer muche wher perceaueth worde lackyng setteth much outward apperace yt threates violence whiche done worlde maye perceaue true suffer extremitie rather constrained receaue falshod popedome suche respecte vnto true faith neuer fallen horrible idolatry errours wherfore necessarie profitable doctrine v taught certifyed touchinge true faith haue worde god promise stycke surely therunto beleue shall surely come passe beleue thyng without worde god faythe vaine opinion neuer well escapewhere worde ther faythe thou shouldest beleue thou shouldest emperor rome thou mayst persuade thy selfe yet thou perceauest come passe dauid high blud heard word god samuell prophete touchyng kyngdome israell ende successe therof could voyde frustrate whatsoeuer saules frendes dyd contrarie also ruler requireth signe present ayde christe somwhat importunately christ wholly dryuen worde although christ woulde nowe also shewe signe healpe ruler hande yet wold haue hym endewed faith fele healpe woorde appoynteth hym doo go thy wayes thy sonne lyueth doothe ruler beleeue concernynge lyfe hys sonne worde faithe foloweth woorde doth lyfe folowe fayth thorough woorde also haue worde promyse god doth generally confort worlde saieth beleueth shall neuer see deathe likewise sayeth iohn baptist hym iohn beholde lambe god taketh away synnes world vniuersall generall sermon iohn whiche pertayne men saythe man shall beleue speaketh generally beleue shall neuer see death likewise iohn saieth christ lambe sent god shal take away synnes man man synnes worlde wherfore thou bee synnernote art worlde thynke appertaynethe vnto thee doubt thy matter hade done thy sake foundation wherin faith muche belongeth remission synnes euerlastyng lyfe ought leane shall deceaue v doo sticke thervnto ruler deceaued faith must thinke easier matter great ruler v christe puttethe foorthe vnto hym suche certayne woorde hee sayeth go thy way thy sonne lyueth harder matter v noo suche certayne woorde putte foorthe vnto v generallye v christe hym selfe althoughe putte foorthe generall worde yet hee speaketh priuatly ruler sayinge go thy way thy sonne lyueth doth speake euery man himselfe sonne thy synnes forgeuen thee thyne life euerlastyng man dothe speake thys euery one v baptised dothe baptisme belonge euery man wil partaker baptisme muste take selues dothe god saye thee baptised promise soeuer beleeueth baptised shall bee saued lykewise thou arte baptised dye christe dyed thee deathe redemed thee frome synne deathe howe god speake thee certainly ioyn thy persone certainly wyth woorde rom marc thenne doone baptisme wher bestowed thee alone thy propre baptisme whenne thou wouldest bee absolued frome thy synnes comest mynister christian wyth hope heare woorde god obteyne conforte thys woorde thou hearest openly christe dyed synnes pronounced thee alone deathe auaylable thy synnes woordes absolution bee brother myne synnersthe wordes absolucion therfore shoulde abyde susteyne damnation sonne god becom man sake dyed also rose agayne deade iustification rom despaire therfore christ hath satisfied thee thou must pay nothyng onely sticke vnto passion trust thus also concernynge supper lord body blood christ geuen thee alone pronounced thee alone bodye geuen thee blood shed thou maiest doubt trust sacrifice christ though wer proper vnto thee alone put thy mouth geuen peculiarly thee thou maist eate drinke thy self dothe god medle none beside speketh none yt comest vnto supper doest eate drink comanded thee consider thinke thy self maner christias let passe oportunity neuer come ioyfull supper lorde wherfore thou desire god shold cofort thee alone speke thee pronounce vnto thee remissio thy sinnes life euerlasting thou art worthy talke company deuill wherefore lacking though god spake v fault folow example ruler receue neither beleue true whatsoeuer christ speketh vnto v priuately ruler also occasion beleue yf wold haue folowed reason hadde respect worde howe coulde hee beleue thys lyttell worde woulde haue ben effectuous farre brought suche greate thyng passe might haue sayde vnknowen case haue lefte sonne seynge hope lyfe agaynst great perill small woorde efficacitie must nedes come nere greter thynges bryng passe great thing ruler omitteth thynges onely embraceth woorde geueth greate credence therto thoughe hee sawe healthe sonne presently face except ben mynde hee woulde haue departed contente word content iohn saith well man beleued woorde iesus spake vnto went waie doest thou knowe faith proprely thou seekest definition thereofwhat faythe euen thynge beleue christe promyseth gette thee therfore acquaynted first lerne whenne god promyseth thee baptisme christe gospell supper embrace promyse thy heart lette nothyng hynder thee therin although thou shalt haue many lettes fele synne deathe whyche offer selues alwayes syght sence thou let passe word thys case synne deathe wyll oppresse thee caste thee headlong destruction doth christian confesseth synne neyther vncertayne deathe yet hee despaireth therefore hee taketh holde worde muche canne saythe christ dyed therfore free frome synne canne dye neyther hathe death synne power vppon christe hathe made satisfaction thynges shod pay true faith neither possible deceaued hope yt sticketh word wise true yet sene felte yet trewe tyme shall surely comme whenne shalbe opened ruler dyd euen sticked surely woorde perceyued thynge beleued woorde hys seruauntes come nexte daye ioyefull tydynges hys sonne alyue lengthe also seeth wyth hys eye faithe longer requisite come passe beleued thus wyth v also haue remission oure synnes euerlastynge lyfe heare gospel beleue absolution vse supper lorde yet styll fele always deathe synne neyther wee remoue thys sence feelynge frome v whyle lyue thys lyfe yet beleue thou word neuertheles must also wholly beleue god word without signes vse condition paule lyue content god grace iohn must beleue worde although chaunce see thomas shall see tyme shal come wyth thys ruler beleued remyssion synnes euerlastyng lyfe woorde euen soo shall wee haue deede euerlastynge ryghteousnesse lyfe long lyue muste content wyth word beleue thys lyfe shall feele haue dede whyche thyng god mercifull father graunt sonne iesus christes sake thorough holye spirite amen xxii sonday trinitie sonday pthe gospell math xviii peter sayd vnto iesus lorde howe oft shall forgeue brother sinne agaynst tyll seuen time iesus sayethe vnto hym saye vnto vntyll seuen tymes seuentie time seuen tymes therefore kyngedome heauen lykenede vnto certayne man akynge whiche woulde take accoumptes seruauntes begon recken one brought vnto hym whiche ought hym ten thousande talentes forasmuche hable paye lorde commaunded hym solde wyfe chyldren payment made seruaunt fell downe besought saying sir haue pacience wyll paye lorde pitie seruaunte losed hym forgaue hym debt seruaunte wente founde one felowes ought hym hundred penny layd handes toke hym throate saying paye thou owest felowe fell downe besought hym saying haue pacience wyll paye woulde wente caste hym pryson tyll shoulde pay debt felowes sawe done sory came tolde vnto theyr lorde hadd happened lorde called hym sayde vnto hym thou vngracious seruaunte forgaue debt thou desiredst shouldest thou also haue compassion thy felowe euen pitie thee lorde wroth delyuered hym iaylers tyll shoulde pay due vnto like wise shall heauenlye father also vnto yf ye heartes forgeue euery one brother theyr trespass exposition ye heare begynnynge summe gospell peter asketh christe nedefull donechristians must forgeue reuenge brother synned againste hym howe often hee shoulde forgeue hym whether seuen tymes inough christ aunswereth seuen tymes seuentie tymes seuen tymes forgeuyng synnes amongest christian ought bee withoute measure ende must pardon one others synnes beware reuengyng belongeth god whose maiestie ought bee violated deut rom heb neyther hys iurisdiction broken parable also sheweth order afterwarde wyll gather togyther cause declare theim muste especially marke howe christe saieth kyngdome god lyke kynge whiche purposeth make reckenynge accompt seruantes commaundement touching remission sinne applied gouernance comminaltie seuerall office diuersities person therfore thynges consist variety rulynge obeyeng licence may geuen lustes vice men discipline honest order maye hadde restraynynge lewde wicked wherefore ment parentes geue theyr chylderne lycencious libertie ought vse certayne kynde reuengyng meanes couete desyre name facilitie gentylnesse lykewise also maysters ouer houshold seruauntes maiestrates officersthe worlde worse libertie let knowe appointed certainly reuenge thys worldes faulte worse libertie appereth wyld child wyll obey theyr parentes vntyll length come hangyng wherfore commandement vsed common welth kyngdom god equall subiecte onely god whiche head lyfe v calleth kyngdom god lyfe holy churche lyfewhat kyngdome god wher god hys word holy spirite hath gouernance thys churche thou must obserue trade thy peculiar office reuenge synne may alway pardonyng one reuengynge al thing may done toward thy neighbor mercy gentlenes whersoeuer hath nede althoughe reason might seme haue iust cause cotrarie christ requireth sheweth sure cause parable two seruants king first christ requireth christian thynk themselues howe great mercie god hathe shewed vnto also would deale extremely v many great cause reuenged v vexe v moste greuous euyls seyng obteined mercy without desert must shew mercy gentlenes neighbor must obserued great diligence christ declareth true way obteyn remission synne sheweth v selues fynger god agayne merite god yet obtaine concernyng parable seruaunt ought ten thousand talentes christ putteth forth thys ende maye teache v oure cause iudgemente god talente wyth theym tymes pastewhat talente tymes paste almost valoure syxe hundreth crownes seruaunt oughte tenne thousande talentes exceadynge greate summe oure synnes iustely compared godoure synnes innumerable thys maye declared oure synnes neuer put away selues owne workes ar able make satisfaction first beginnyng v verye propagation stocke synne sone borne bringe synne v worlde afterwarde longer lyue synne psal iohn ephe besydes originall synne wherin begotten conceaued borne also accumulate heape vp owne actuall syns meanes become great debters vnto god may right wel resembled lykened compared seruant beyng dede mean able satifie gret det iudgement shall suche seruant haue ueryly euen thys lorde commaundethe hys wyfe chyldern euer hath shoulde solde thys christe sheweth synners able paye debtes must also necessitie synnes sake suffer death paule saieth rom rewarde synne death god paradise threatned adam eue gen sayenge whatsoeuer daye ye eate thys tree ye shall dye death transgression commaudement al came point lawe god dothe vtterly condemne v yea iudgeth v vnto death rom paul saith one man synne entred worlde deathe meanes synne death went ouer menne somuche men synned yf syn shold neuer dye whyther therfore shall turne v debte certayne denye lorde requireth debte wee hable paye nowe set foorthe vnto v moste ioyfull luckye thyng whyche ought imbrace sayesynne humilitie muste confessed mercye craued metyng armes mean delyuered debt escape deathe attaynement hereof muste doo whiche christ saieth seruaunt dyd confesseth great debte acknowlegeth also extreme pouertie beggery payne meanes auoyde therfore falleth downe lorde worshyppeth saith lord beare wil pay thee altogether order praying seruant christ full well alloweth wold haue v praye maner whensoeuer wee desyre forgeuenesse oure debtesgod meanes abyde anye iusticiaries doynge bothe confesse debt also desire haue fauour shewed v denyeth debt phariseys mainteine rightousnes god setteth worse case one confessed danger present forasmuche able paye therfore abhominable errour papacie men sent away vnto theyr workes satisfaction synnes maye bee clensed put awaye thou wy say vn seruant byndeth hym selfe pay altogether true promiseth wyll doo may consyder saythe able dede doin daunger seke meanes escape trouble though promyse one wyttes yet thoughe wyth hys shoulde bee solde able satisfye leaste debte therefore appeareth euidentely christes mynde euen declare howe goeth manne feare daunger trouble suche case doubteth bynde hymselfe extreame inconueniences yea thynges impossible maye escape present trouble daungers paynes lyke ensue yea suche case would guage promyses bargaynes compactes goodes landes mouables vnmouables yea lyfe also maye delyuered euyls hange ouer head lyke maner matter come poynt betwene god v thorough law synnes reueled brought lyght rom law commeth knoweledge synne apostle saythe escape daunger wherinto thorowe synne fallen wee spare impossible condition maye obteyne respite fauour muche ryghte welle perceaue able satisfye debte yet lorde doothe forgeue hys seruaunt condition bargayne whyche knoweth impossible seruant desyreth fauoure mercye pardon whiche estemeth debtes worlde whyche notwithstandyngewe oughte neyghboures god v bee vnderstanded though man hath obteyned forgeuenesse afterwarde noo poynte shewe hym selfe thankefull greate liberalitie louynge kyndenesse shall afterwarde bee declared thys seruaunte sheweth gratitude thankefulnesse gentylnesse noo kyndenesse agayne rather declarethe hymselfe moost cruell moste fierce moste churlysshe agaynste hys fellowe seruaunteof god mercie muste loke remission synnes obedyence towarde lawe god wyth necessarye condytion yet referred vnto ende though lorde shoulde remytte forgeue debt forgeuenesse debt synnes grounded onelye mercy god unto thys alone must wee haue oure resorte thys bee desyred heartylye bee called neyther oughte wee doubte wee shall haue god mercyfull readye pleasure v shewed himselfe good bounteous beneficiall lyberall seruaunt sonne god whiche bosome father pronouncethe thys gospell seruant lorde sayeth hadde pitie hym sette hym lybertie forgaue hym hys debte ought think god myddeste synnesthis persuasyon fayth muste vndoubtedly haue god synne lawe vexe v threaten vnto v death damnation god desyreth deathe synner ezech rather shoulde tourne lyue sayeth prophete desyre manne shoulde dye sayeth lorde god returne lyue agayne surely lyue saieth lord god wyll deathe vngodly ezech rather vngodly turne wayes lyue turne turne wicked way wherfore ye dye ye house israell hertes thynke god cruell iudge whome synners haue hope forgeuenesse theyr synnes false imagination thys ought take awaye hope mercy god lawe fierce vnmercyfull agaynst synners lawe dothe office declaryng iudgement god shall bee agaynst synners neyther canne cause synners bee otherwysethe lawe examined lawe whyche accuseth curseth condempneth woundeth kylleth manye fyndeth gyltie withoute exception synners muste needes abyde sentence iudgemente lawe ryghtuousnesse god lawfully requireth menne yet lawe lette vnto god hys grace maye restore theym sette withoute daunger condemned lawe euer therefore appeale frome god thorowe decree lawe cruell suche one wil intreated vnto god mercifull one wyll deathe synners falle downe lorde seruaunt desyre mercye without doubte obteyne inwarde mercy god moste mercyfull bowel testimonie christe bowel god yearne moued synners driuen lawe synne destruction euerlasting bondage wherfore thou feelest thy debt haue thy recourse seruaunt mercye god thynke suertie goddes thou sholdest dye haue euerlastyng lyfe meane whiche god would haue mercy vpon v gospel sheweth place euen sonne god iesus christ becom man v synners toke syns vpon satisfied death loke faith touchyng christ deathe wrath god ouercome suffreth himselfe reconciled man angry hath declared iesu christe hathe verye prompt redy mynd mercy whiche hath mercy v father chyldren forthwith soone kyngdom death synne set vp adam eue psal gen set forth hope saluation agaynst thys kyngdome promyse touchynge seede woman thys oure doctrine thanks god churche sette foorth syncerely withoute fault remission sinnes cometh vnto v grace mercy god described thys place seruant oweth great summe yet obtaineth quittance merite desert onely mercy grace sticketh sure grace prayeth mercy god wherfore doctrine papistes erronious false blasphemous whenne preache concernynge remission synnes caste menne theyr vnpayable dettes vnto theyr owne workes teache remyssion synne onely asked god christe condemne heresie false iudge thou thys true meanyng gospell v preache truly touching remission sinnes whether comend mercy god christ persuade work satisfaction brief al sermon tendeth end shold learn god hath mercy v freely forgeueth debt naught esa christ admonisheth v touching grace also exa ple shold behaue selues likewise shew crueltie towarde neighbour haue receaued remittyng great debtes god wise acknowledge truly ye remission sinnes god fyrst cause whyche christe hath set foorthe meane tyme hee doothe teache way vnto saluation whereby myght obteyne grace remission synnes seconde cause christ requireth v consyder well wronge damage doone vnto v yf wee trye thynges iust balaunce shall perceaue oure debtes god alwayes tenne myllions talentes comparyson debte hundred penny neighbour dooth owe vnto v thys bee welle consydered wylle admonyshe v god hathe forgeuen v greate summe shold straightly require minute iudge al thing according equitie hundred pen respecte tenne millyons talentes wherfore thynges wyll make v ashamed without iuste cause yf wee whyche haue gotten remission greate thynges wyll pardon neighbour lytle thyngs well esteme mercy god strait neighbor third cause christe parable calleth v seruauntes thys seruant sayeth went foorth chaunced vppon one fellowe seruantes owed vnto hym hundred penny thys also might worthily adhort v vnto mercyfulnes withdraw v reuengyng felow seruauntes haue one lorde whose propre office reuenge trespass whose maiestie resisted hys power mynished neyther suffer thee thou saith place deut rom heb leaue reueging wil reward saieth lorde without thy reuengyng god office punyshe syn thys ministration hath onely deuyll vexeth body goodes god permytteth hym doo hath also certayne power earthe euerye one theyr parte shoulde punyshe reuenge parentes officer commaunded terrour feare euyll woorkes reuengers must al flee vnto suffer wrog eyther city housholdes felow seruantes ought reuenge owne wronges haue office punyshe yet punysheth god wyll leaue hym vnpunyshed hee doothe onely challenge thys owne office hee hym selfe also whenne reuengers appoynted hym ceasse frome dooynge dutie exerciseth reuenging oppressed vexed wherfore men must beware yt reuenge owne wronge meaninge christes saying wheras sayth parable seruant fell vpon one felow seruants fowerth cause also thinke vpon greatnes god mercie litle small debt felowe seruant hath power felow seruant would require right rigorously hym shall nothynge el meanes cause rigorousnes cruell bytternes longe lye hid christian take greuously bringe crueltie seruant lord eares say vniust pride vnmercifulnes geue moue holye spirite christian sorowe wyll make pitiful complaint vnto lord let man thinke complaint shall fall voyde although god wolde hym selfe neglecte wrong yet shoulde constrained christian mennes prayer neglecte therfore prayer righteous voide shal common curse people cry reuenginge fall voyd frustrat therfore christ haue v neglecte feare perill shew selues gentle felow seruants shalt thou perceaue dede yt yt thy gentlenes wyll wishe prosperitie successe thee wherfore men neuer thriue regarde cur ng blessyngs people see time dearth miserable multitude curseth ye couetous gardes salomon sayth prouerbes people curse hym hydeth grayne pro blessynge vpon sell vngodly couetous regardeth consider thou whether curse effectuous wheras good compassed trouble misery wherfore estemed lightly wheras christ place sheweth howe beware geue occasion make felow seruantes complaine vnto lorde shewe haue seen iudgementes horrible thing foloweth lord saith called seruant vnto fyfte cause yt thou mightest thinke wel vpon end thou wilt shewe mercie vnto thy felow seruaunt requirest thy right rigorously thinke yt god wil winke lay nothing thy charge declare reuenging time specially latter iudgemet whe shal geue greuous sentece thee euen thou deliuered tormenter vntil thou payst whole debte speciall thing shalt yu haue thy stubburnes wheras thou thy gentlenes mercy neyghbour sholdest haue god mercifull vnto thee shouldest haue escaped scotfree thy debtes nowe shalt thou fele vnmerciful yt wil pardo part thy debtes nothing el according ye prouerbe take vp stalke let go eare wheras thou castest awaie many thousand winne one halfpeny although parable farre beneth ye matter wtout obtaine remission sin constrained sustaine ye euerlasting wrath god wherfore christ cocludeth saith thus shal heauenly father deale also forgeue euery man brother fro bottom heart al offence sayth brother therfore ought enmitie hatred among v howbeit infirmitie great shal neuer liue without offending eche doth god require v euen shold liue hatred strife heartes forgeue one thynke brother shold cruell seing god good vnto forgeueth suche great summe freely christes sake estime selfe highly disdaine forgeue brother suche triflynge debtes maye come point forgeue right glad suffer neyghbours debte stricken counting booke yea thancke god also mercie hath pardoned wheras might haue required vnnumerable debtes caste bounde euerlasting chaynes doctrine whiche lorde iesus christe putteth forth people day euen refraine selues wrath reuenging forgeue neygbour gladlie may sure god forgeueth v daylie experience teacheth howe disobedient behalfe howe obedient folowing deuil whansoeuer moueth v wrath reuenge requireth v althoughe greate damaige christes saying true thou forgeuest thou mayeste sure god forgeue thee thou mercifull thou shalt still obtaine god mercie loke asuretie god wilbe mercifull vnto thee thou hast pleasure reuenge muste god likewise vnto thee yet thou canst reuenge hurt time god reuenging wrath thou procurest thy folishe impotent wrath hath end reuengynge thine hath iust cause power reuengyng belongeth god thee thou mayst sure thou resigne thy right reuenginge god preuentest thy hastie wrath wil reuenge punishe muche greuouslye thou woldest desire howe goeth yt desirous reuenge may wel perceaued men wil cosider synne punished geue wrath desire vengeance fare charitie ire last cease saying lord prayer ye sharpe nayle alwaie sore math continually pricketh wheras comanded therin pray vnto god forgeuinge trespaces forgeue trespace know ca obtaine forgeuenes owne trespaces except forgeue shall neuer obtayne wherfore lest shoulde meanes geue iudgement owne damnatio neuer say prayer thynge maye thyncke deuil deuise greuously cruellye manprayer brynge hym suche case wrath anger dare pray shal christian man pray prayer whiche onelye refuge christen men taken fro must go nought yea suche also beginne refuse communion therby depriuen themselfes great confort solace thereat shoulde receaue againste syn greife conscience muche better suffer wrong lay aside wrath rise neuer iust cause stubburnes purchase god wrath heuie displeasure wherfore feleth heart thus hardened desire reuengyng let looke gospell behold glasse greate danger let hym pray vnto god forgeuenes hath longe time borne hatered heart neyghbour proudly despisynge iudgement god let also forthwith begin forgeue neyghbour bottom heart least fall iudgement god obtaine remission sinne life euerlastyng christ red mer sauiour whiche thing mercifull god heauenly father graunte v amen xxiii sonday trinitie sonday gospell math xxii phariseis went toke counsayle howe might tangle wordes sente vnto theyr disciple herodes seruauntes saying master knowe thou art true teacheste waye god trulye neyther carest thou anye man thou regardest warde appearaunce men tell v therefore howe thinkest thou lawfull tribute begeuen vnto ceasar iesus perceauynge theyr wyckednes sayde tempte ye ye hypocrite shewe tribute moneye toke hym penye sayd vnto whose ymage superscription sayde vnto hym ceasars said vnto geue therefore vnto ceasar thyngs whiche ceasars vnto god thynges whiche god hearde wordes maruayled left went theyr way exposition cause gospel depedeth hereof iewes law moses promisea conditional promese made iewes kept commandementes god haue kyngdome kyng owne neuer subiectes strage gouernour trusted much promise thought shold neuer loose kyngdo although yt preset serued strage ruler yet thought yt lost right ye possession kingdome therfore many time rebelled ye romainsthe cause rebellion amonge iewes neuer litle occasion offered end might recouer kingdome imperie although many dyinge ye matter neuer preuailed mightie romains albeit wt al iurisdictios comotions rebellios litle yea rather nothig profit yt al thing al time grewe worse worse yet ye recouery right thought right good lawfull thei left nothig vnattepted meruelous exaple hypocrisie iewes could nobly notably bragge boste ye promise yt made vnto co cerning proprietie kingdom cotinual possession neuer remembred ye co dition kept comandements god walked wayeswe wold also haue heauen nothing worthie heauen yt mighte obserue yt ye promise sake wold haue kyngdo made sure vnto yet obedience whiche promised god performed nothing al kingdom said promised v therfore wil mean suffer take away fro v euen stubborne disobedient seruants alledge alwayes couenautes bargaines whatsoeuer afterward ought knowseruauntes yt ye maister bounde performe ye couenauntes bargaine made wt seruant ye seruant first likewise bounde worcke diligetly yt vocatio callig requireth master yt shold ye matter also ye iewes rebelled god vtterly neglected comadements yet wold enioye libertie therfore waighty earnest question amoge whether ought right obeye emperour rome stranger none iewes stocke seyng euident plaine promise yt shold haue kyng theyr owne matter come christwhy phariseis herodians came christ may snarle take trappe thought soeuer answereth ioyne vnto herodes seruats demaude whether lawful pay tribute vnto cesar thus persuaded surely thought christ answered lawfull shoulde fal indignation peoplenote subtiltie aduersaries counted haue done greate faulte asmuche spake contrary law god promise people haue kyng owne bloud haue stranger reigne ouer contrarie side say lawfull waye hym present death romains would neuer suffer christ therfore theyr iudgement muste nedes taken trap fal present danger whether doth affirme denie maliciously go snarle christ cast danger followed handled christ ye matter verely euen sothere wisdome forcast cou cell preuaile lord saythe salomon yt cut aduersaries throtes wyth owne sworde shewe saith tribute money shewed hym coyne accordinge request demaunded whose image superscription phariseyes thinckyng deuice nothing hindred answer pro said cesars christ hath nowe desired therfore streightwayes answereth question ye saith saye image superscription cesar according confession geue cesar owne whiche due vnto ye geue cesar whiche ye selfe saye could none otherwise vnderstaded yt cofessed receaued cesar lord ruler gouernour therfore harde matter christ eue owne wordes tourne whole matter vpon owne heades shold take awaye cesar cesars dede euen confession put forth question cause gospel moste wise prudent stratageme politique subtilitie subtile policie warre wherby casteth aduersaries snare prepared desier snarle answer thought christ durste neither affirme denie matter christ prouoketh answere haue answered snarled owne snare taken owne trappes perceaue right wel deuise naught plaine folyshnes yea pernicious selfes historie two thinges dilgently co sidered noted markedtwoo thinges learned historie first example iewes let v learne peruersitie frowardnes gladly complaine oppressed alwayes thincke haue wrong done v true consider state worlde many time iniured wronged afterwarde thincke haue iuste sufficient cause set forth right accuse violence iniquitie end complaining iewes coplained ye romains vsurping kingdom iuste cause romains iewes therfore coparison certainin misery sinns agaynste god considered best greatest right iust title kyngdome yet fault iewes although thy neyghbour doth wrong yet must thou cosider matter depely thincke maner haue moste greuously offended lorde god haue longe deserued shold take awaye ritght also body lyfe one thyng must learne semed greuous iewes subiectes heathe emperour thought thus selues people god heathen know nothing god defiled idolatrie adulterie whoredome dronckennes kynde wickednes shoulde serue knowledge lordes ruler feared god prayed vnto god deliueraunce trusted litle nothing al right title neither bragge yt matter perceaued right well deserued plague ben much greater cocernyng ye doctrine yt publiquely comonly taught corrupte vnpurethe miserable face comon weale iewes ye euangelical historie testifieth common wealth iustly vprightly gouerned couetousnes vsurie pride drockenes bancketing fleshely pleasure suche vice comonly vsed yea frely without punishment also among v present daye among ye iewes nothing almost good order whether respecte duty towards god shold god shold disseble wincke great contempte himselfe word meane defende naughty packes right title set forth honour would nothing amende thing amisse uerely god iuste cause forasmuch cast awaye beastly right god also suffer right people decay come naught iewes kingdome co dition stand euerthe right claymede condicion forgotten god gaue kingdom vnder certain codition whiche performe commanded maner promise righteous obedient kepte commandementes would haue promise wythout condition although behalfe shewed obediece good kynde people would haue thing nothing yea shoulde haue remembred rule thy dutie shalt thou receaue due vnto thee husbandeman countreye plaiteh vnthrifte riotously spendeth awaie hath payeth rent time appointed iniuried wronged put awaye farme farme hired forth better henote practise wil kepe couenautes better therfore must also learne moderat complaining onely consider right vnright neyghbour doth v also god right howe vnrightly haue dealte hym paciently humbly lyftynge vp heartes handes vnto god mekely reuerently say haue deserued shold iniurie wrong notwithstading must let go loke vpo selfe cosider ye matter goeth betwene god oh finde great loge register declareth vnto yt ten time worse yt haue ten time yea ten thousand time offeded god neighbour hath offeded therfore wil pacietly beare litle displeasure yt neyghbour hath done lest god seing fearce cruel minde neighbour reuege also punishe wickednes whiche haue committed lord forgeue handle according deserte also gladly forgeue whatsoeuer done againste againste right shoulde greatly vrge force right haue vnrightly dealt god concerning right preserue kepe defende right life good lawfull meanes doth wel let outragiously complaine quieting himselfe let contented minde saye righte thus wronge vniustly notwithstanding franckly freely confesse god haue deserued farre greuous thinges meanes shall lyke iewes thorow wickednes cause misery plague yet thought enioye right libertie although cast god among right longe afore euen euill subiectes shoulde require maiestrate helpe defence againste enemy yet would free paying tribute toll rent subsidie paymentes due maiestratemaiestrates god aforeseing hath geuen maiestrate swearde shoulde compel vnwilling disobedient comon people also would gladly haue pastours preacher among thempreachers yet defraude minister vniustly tythes duetiesthe wickednes common people pastours ought conscience paye forasmuche spirituall pastour hath power compell refuse paye duty miserable caytiues poll pill bribe steale defraude conuey good pastour continually prayer exhortation watcheth like faithfull sheppeheard saluatio soules euer thincke well gotten good math luc cor although haue gotten neuer wickedly vniustly sweare say iesus christ wel gotte gotten priest godly maiestrates behalfe ought maintaine right pastours seuerely punishe rebelles walke inordinatly wil paye duty deut worckeman worthy rewarde sayth sauiour christ blessed apostle writeth goeth warfare time owne coste planteth vineyarde eateth ye fruite therof fedeth flocke eateth mylke flocke saye thinges maner men saith lawe also written lawe moyses thou shalt mosell mouth oxe treadeth corne doth god take thought ox saith altogether sake sake doubt written yt eareth eare hope thresseth hope partaker hope sowe vnto spirituall thinges great thinge reape bodely thynges c ye know howe minister holy thinges lyue ye scripture wayte temple pertakers temple euen also lord ordaine whiche preache gospell shoulde lyue gospell againe saith let taught word math luc galat timoth deut minister vnto yt teacheth good thinges deceaued god mocked also place elder rule well worthy double honour specially laboure word teaching scripture sayth thou shalte mosell mouth oxe treadeth corne luc labourer worthie rewarde ye maiestrate negligent loke matter ought boud office yt meanes ye vngodly parishioner encouraged go forth wickednes wthold fro ye pastours yt due thought yt vngracious people shal escape vnpunished nay verely shalbe ye end verely ye pastour able folow rightgod wyll reuenge cause spiritual pastours god wtout doubt able also wil wil sede caterpillers plague pestileces destroy beast wil sede theues robbe spoile cormorats good wil sede also tempestes destroy thing yt necessary liuing cornebe holde parishioner beware wine herbes heir fruites c yea sende vnrighteous person short fewe dayes vpon earth geue good vniustly gotte shall wastefully spend warely niggardlye kept nowe haue leude people gotte deceipt pastours defrauding duty verely ye anger god wicked coscience giltie minde losse good corne cattel short life vtter dissipation haue may speake nothing greuously whe men thus iustly plagued sinnes thoughe coplaine yet shal receaue answere ye haue nede coplaine hath nothig chau ced vnto whiche ye haue worthely deserued loke vpo couetousnes pride gluttony druckenes whoredo adulterie enuye malice cotempt ye worde disobedience maiestrats dishonour pastours carnall securitie carelesse life c haue euils deserued plague ye great mercy god ye cosumed fire brimstone fro heauen sodome gomor sinnes ye occasion ye thus afflicted gene doth christ place admonish ye iewes also yt seing haue lost kingdo brought power ye romains shold greatly coplaine loosing right rather consyder sinnes ye occasion plague misery punishment nowe worthely suffer seing yt haue performed yt vnto god ought yt god boude performe yt promised could ye iewes meanes persuaded yt dispossessed kyngdome synnes sake therfore ought take pacietly quietly obiected alwayes right title yt greatly wrong done vnto profited nothing seing ye god otherwise determined punishemet sin yea yt worthely without desert therfore sendeth emperour rome vnto copelleth obey nil kyngdom otherwise promised iewes vnder codition yt say serued god according word lyued vprightly wrog c told plainly shold loose kingdom become subiectes strageroure synnes occasion thus must also thincke misery calamity wofull chaunces sinnes occasion turke fearce cruell enemie christen religion prince worlde although neuer sauage barbarous daylye getteth victory v christen men meanes empire maruelouslye enlarged become mightie stronge prince nowe consideration matter shall beginne turke rather selues verely selues thorow sinnes haue geuen hym entraunce christen border haue weakened selues fortified haue geuen prosperous successe warres many noble notable victory selues sinnes god wickednes one hath brought thing passe whatsoeuer suffer turckes hande suffer worthely according desertes papistes also go forth defende idolatry supersticionsthe papistes cruelly persecute put death true professours god trueth wold gladly haue idolatrie tyranny taken awaye might haue gospell sauiour christ quietly freely preached taught among v yt know gospell professe lyppes repent v former wicked life lyue becometh professe christ howe god otherwise suffer suche idolatrous tyrantes tirannical idolater lyue raigne among v persecute plague v beprickes thornes eye seing mouth professe know god tit workes vtterly deny hym apostle saith thus muche haue spoken concerning first part gospell seconde parte learneciuile regiment approued god difference betwene kyngdome world kyngdome christe christe thys oure gospell dothe condemne ciuile regimente rather confirmeth thinges pertaine vnto landes possession tribute family whatsoeuer thynge maketh vnto confyrmation ornamente politique state christe sayeth geue thynges cesar due cesar much though saye thou subiect one eyther hygher lower degree content thy state trouble politique order thy importunitie lewde behauioure hee hathe householde lette hym faythfully looke hys housholde rom
