pet lette subiectes obey ruler officer appoynted god punyshement wicked doer prayse safegarde theym doo well lette chyldren obedient parentes christe reproueth neyther doothe condemne ordinaunces degree person necessarie vnto politike kyngedome whyche god canne want thys tendeth thys ende christian manne exempt hym selfe frome politique kyngedome monkes dyd whyche thought thus lyue common sorte men shold hardely saued christ teacheth contrary manne shoulde thynke wyth hys doctrine gospelle taketh awaye ciuile ordinaunce politique regiment therefore abyde thy state continue thy vocation callynge geue cesar due cesar geue god whiche belongeth god say beleue iesus christe heare gospell embrace lyue ye feare god obedient co mandementes charitable louyng mercyful gentyll paciente c thou geue thys god requireth concernyng thynges belongynge thy body thy householde thy state condition lyfe lette thynges bee subiecte cesar christian may serue god cesar together truthe iewes woulde neyther haue geuen god due god cesar belonged vnto cesar muste diligently note god geueth cesar imperie regimente perfecte whole sounde god thy faith bryngeth impedimentthe temporall magistrate maye trouble kyngdome christe whatsoeuer thy office vocation bee thou mayest also thou wylte thy outwarde office exercise trewe godlynesse likewyse cesar ought trouble kyngdom god violentlye compelle menne geue god whyche due god doo owe god declared namely heare worde gladly accordyng vnto order oure lyfe doo nothyng contrary vnto canne doo god worlde neyther oughte cesar magistrate bee impedimente theyr subiectes thys seruice god magistrate wold presume doo subiectes oughte obeye hymrulers commandyng agenst god obeyed yea ought rather suffer extremity thenne doo thynge agaynste god theyr conscience therefore moste horrible synne whenne magistrate importune requyryng obedience wyll forbydde obedience whyche due vnto god whenne forbydde trewe doctrine gospell bee taughte theyr countreys punyshe theyr subiectes whenne receaue sacrament body blood christ vnder bothe kyndes accordynge christes institution agayne whenne enforce compulsion dryue men vnto idolatrie worshippyng image goynge pylgremage inuocation sainctes byenge pope pardon mass soules departed suche abhominations lyke excede passe boundes theyr powernote well hynder obedience whiche dewe vnto god doth god require v aboue thynges lette v obeye hym poyntes therfore magistrate sette selues agaynst god trewe woorshyppyng hym subiectes ought know thys behalfe owe noo obedience theyr ruler neyther obeyed written muste obeye god menne act christ commaundeth onely geue cesar dewe cesar also geue god due god magistrate abide thine obediece sake toward god word doth cruelly entreat thee yea taketh thy life thee content suffer tirany paciently comit thy cause god let cofort theesubiectes maye rebell agenste theyr ruler neuer wycked yt although magistrat hath power ouer v yet hath power alone god also euen lord dwelleth heuen greater either king cesar therfore obeyd tha magistrate vnder ye heues yt one commaundementes muste bee neglected sette aside commaundement cesar oughte geue place comaundement god thou wilt obeye godgod obeyed man shewe thy selfe flatterer magistrate god myghtie lorde punyshe disobedience thou doest vnto wyth hell fyre euerlastynge dampnation knowyng wyll wyttingly cast himselfe myserye rather wyshe onely one cesar also cesars yea whole worlde agaynst hym thenne shoulde disobeye lorde hys god thoroughe disobedience purchase hym selfe eternall deathe bee magistrate neuer madde math punyshe body oure sauiour christ sayeth bee afrayde theym kylle bodye sowle canne kylle feare hym rather whyche able destroye bothe body soule hell fyre cesar signifieth thys gospellbut shall marke vnder one word cesar onely persone cesar vnderstanded also euery ciuile magistrate temporall ruler worldly gouernour officer c geue sayeth christ cesar dewe cesar god due god nowe consyder also rewardes thou obeye god folowe commandemente rewarde thys obedyence shall euerlastynge immortall saye heauen eternall lyfe yf thou obeye temporall magistrate agaynste god rewarde thou shalte receaue apoc shall bee shorte transitorye thou shalte suffer peynes euerlastynge damnation moste horrible lake burneth fyre brymstone lyue vnder tyrant ought consyder may certainly knowe god requireth men obedience whych also oughte vnfaynedly bee shewed come lyfe come deathe mangre tyrantes beardes god doothe forbydde thou mayste geue cesar belongethe vnto cesar yet whiche due vnto hym omitted lefte vndone withoute cause cesar haue meate drynke cloth defence peace whatsoeuer requisite vnto thys present lyfe god haue thynges body soule last euerlastyng lyfe sette lesse god whome haue good heauenly thynges men god forbydde shoulde growe vnto suche madnesse doo offende lorde god magistrate ought looke better vnto officenote well compell subiectes doo christ hadde thus sayde geue cesar desyreth thou haste myght lawfully haue requyred subiectes would haue geuen hym wyllyngly myghte iustely haue taken awaye frome theym oure sauioure christ thys place saythe thus geue thynges cesar whyche dewe vnto cesarwhat cesars saye certayne determyned hys therewyth ought bee contente ciuile obedience outwarde honour tribute toll suche lyke worldly thyngs due vnto hym geue oughte suffice hym wyl require chalenge whyche belongethe vnto god know ye behalfe ye owe nothing man vnder paine euerlasting damnation ought geue temporall magistrate due god alone cesar lawfully require dothe god streightly forbyd subiects geue cesar vniustly asketh therfore greate impietie wyckednesse certayne popyshe prince chiefly byshoppes whyche deede nothynge ell th n prince worldly potentate proude stately toward subiectes content obedience haue bothe body goodes subiecteso tiranny onely serue theyr necessity also pleasure excepte also require subiectes beleue serue god pleaseth onely agreable also contrary worde god true religion god forbid wyl suffer subiects resort vnto place woorde god truely taughte forbyd bothe bokes holy scripture also good godly woorkes subiectes shold rede come vnto knowledge saluation hyre blasphemous preacher sette forthe mainteyne olde abhominations antichriste whose mouthes one worde heard may comfort conscience weaklyngs edifie true knowledge ignorant yea horrible sycophantes nothyng el thenne theyr sermon blaspheme gospell moste spitefully rayle professoures thynke haue done theyr duetie notablye well yf maynteyne sacrifice masse inuocation sainctes pylgremages purgatorie pardon monasticall lyfe syngle lyfe priestes receiuyng sacrament vnder one kindethe doctrine papistes pope primacie c confirme false perswasyon remission synnes confession contrition satisfaction penaunce wyll woorkes c exercise theyr tyrannye chieflythe receauynge sacramente vnder bothe kyndes theyr subiectes receyue holy misteries christes body bloode vnder bothe kyndes notwithstandyng euident playne institution christe primatiue churche holy father vsed order many hundred yeares christes ascension math cor notwithstandyng popyshe wicked order haue obserued subiects yea vnder pretence obedience due vnto magistrate though thus commanded geue thynges cesar god nothyng matter religion obeye cesar word god set cesar aboue god robbe god thynges geue cesar thynges ought dosedicion agaynste magistrate neuer escapeth vnpunyshed god dothe onely graunt cesar obedience subiectes also stablysheth commandement defendeth earnestly sedition agaynst magistrate dyd euer escape vnpunyshed example bothe diuine prophane doo euidently declare meane god also requireth obedience willeth body goodes subiect cesar requireth hearte conscience kept god worde holy spirite maye gouerne alone whenne god may thus doo muche cesar contrarye ryghte chalengeth also none euen bee lorde conscience menne haue opinion religion pleaseth hym god appointeth hys worde ende violence tyranny wyckednes good god meanes canne abyde hys kyngdome shoulde bee destroyed worshyppynge seruice hath commaunded hys worde shoulde abolyshed magistrate whyche taketh vppon hym doo muste nedes come confusion exaumples moste myghty kynges prince testifye soone chalenged altogether selues left nothyng god god defended recouerd owne right tyrantes brought nought shame confusion therefore woorthy remembred christe hath appoynted certayne lymittes beyonde whyche cesars power ought go namely rule hys courte meddle wyth god kyngdome geue cesar saieth thynges belonge cesar though shoulde say whyche god cesars looke ye geue cesar leste ye fall away obeye cesar muche whyche peraduenture wyll rewarde tyme notwithstandynge whosoeuer shall thus disobeye eyther feare fauoure eyther rewarde otherwise shall surely suffer paynes hell fyre lette cesar therefore bee contente wyth hys owne yf hee wyll doo neuer geue thou hym whiche none muste bee difference kept betwene two kyngdomes bee made confusyon god maye haue hysa christen magistrate ought kepe measure exaction cesar lykewyse whyche although corporall matter also cesar ought keepe meane excede nothyng difference betwene laufull magistrate cruell tyraunt tyrant violently plucketh vnto hym gette hee measurethe hys ryghte hys power pleasure godly lawfull magistrate knowethe hee appoynted god healthe preseruation hys subiectes oppresse destroye whyche christe also declarethe thys maketh difference betwene euerye priuate mannes goodes possession betwene whyche dewe cesar magistrate temporall ruler therefore doothe hys office whenne thorough hys pollynge pyllyng dryueth hys subiectes vnto slauerye beggery shepe shorne rent torne magistrate muste take tribute toll subiectes leaueth vnto sufficient wherwith may defende selues exercise theyr occupation norishe bothe themselues suche appertayn vnto great peryll daunger hand maynteyn publike peace defende countrey thyngs ar subiects euer able eyther body goodes ought magistrate commandementfor defene theyr contreye men oughte bestowe bothe lyues goodes matter ye magistrate ought forget righteous moderatio teperat rule yt oppresse subiects vnrighteous vnlaufull exaction content wyth whyche sufficiente redy appropriated office callyng otherwyse magistrate vnrighteous wicked take away whiche theyr owne doo geue god greate cause bee angrye theym surely wylle reuenge one meane sedition conspiracy insurrection inuasions foreyne ennemies waye saythe psalmographe oppression poore pitifull complaynte nedye wyll nowe ryse vppe saieth lorde thus muche haue spoken gospelle god geue oure magistrate v grace wee together maye geue vnto god whyche due vnto hym agayne whyche subiectes maye geue wyllyngely gladly ruler whyche dewe vnto theym therwyth may content shall world leade honeste godly lyfe wyth peace tranquillitie psalme worlde comme thoroughe faythe christe obteyne euerlastynge saluation whyce thyng lorde god graunt v thorough iesus christe hys sonne alone sauior whome wyth god father god holy ghoste honour glory prayse euer amen xxiiii sonday trinitie sonday p gospell math ix whyle iesus spake vnto people holde came certayne ruler worshippede saying daughter euen nowe diseased come laye thy hand vpon shee shall lyue iesus arose folowed hym dyd disciple behold woman diseased issue bloud twelue yeare came behynde hym touched hemme vesture shee said within selfe may touche euen vesture onlye shalbe safe iesus turned hym aboute sawe sayde daughter good comforte thy faythe hath made safe woman made whole euen tyme iesus came ruler house sawe minstrelles people makyng noyse sayde vnto get hence mayde dead slepeth laughede hym scorne people put forth went toke hand sayde damosell aryse damosell arose noyse brode lande exposition gospell sette foorthe two miracle ought bothe depelye diligently bee consydered pondred v first diseased woman hadde stronge faithe christ myght touch garment although knew doubted recouer healthe second certain ruler beleueth also although daughter deade yet christ wyll make alyue agayne truly faithe meruailously sette foorthe bothe miracle yea oure sake maye know vnderstand great vertue myght strength power true christen faith excellent great thinges worketh agayn whosoeuer hath thys faith leadeth vnto christe shall neuer lacke healpe confort god hande abundantly receaue soeuer hath nede accordyng promyse thynges soeuer ye desyre ye pray beleue ye receaue ye shall haue fyrst let v consyder exaumple woman troubled longe greuous noysom disease marke euangelist saith spent substaunce vppon phisitions marc ben diseased sicknes space xii yeares alwaye worse worse meruayle continued alyue long hauyng disease marc yet easily restored helth doyng nothing el much heard recouered theyr healthe onely touchynge christes garment labouryng also myght come vnto touching vesture therefore enforceth self asmuch go throw ye gret throng people vnto christ afraid make intercession vnto christe health humilitie lowlines mynd cometh behynd though christ shold knowe toucheth garmet streight wais beleued bega better issue bloud staied proued thing ye great losse goodes yet founde ease dayly worse worse marke gospell dothe testifie also diligently noted christe haue thys miracle healyng woman kepte secrete demaundeth touched hym apostle also thought matter almoste worthy laughed christ shoulde aske question touched hym seyng great throg people euery side christ felt knew nothow woman touched christe touchyng handes also heart certayn sure faithe confidence trust christ whiche cause great power wente christ hym selfe perceyued christ would haue touchyng hyd yea sake askynge question touched vrged enforced woman comfoorth declare openly al thyngs many presente hadde chanced myghte haue occasion commende thys woman faith moste acceptable hyghest honoure geue vnto christ euen beleue looke good thynges hys hande therfore prayseth womanne speaketh vnto moste curteously sayenge good confort daughter thy faithe hath made thee whole go peace whole frome thy disease must disciple needes confesse nothyng christ asked touched hym agayn common touchynge notable excellent thynge seynge christe greately comendeth woman calleth daughter ye also maketh whole small praise faith meruailous sayeng christ yf wee wyll weygh matter aryghte confessethe power proceded woman co fesseth matter openly hym doothe impute hym selfe fayth woman greate vertue power goeth frome hym notwithstandyng thys healthe proceded frome womanne frome christe christ doothe thys ende hee maye shewe vnto v greatly thyng pleaseth hym faythe suche moste certainely hopeth looketh health helpe hym alone though shoulde saye onely prouide thys ye may bee well endewed faythe soeuer daunger ye bee mynde muche ready helpe desyre craue doo much redyly delyuer death ye desyre lyfe bee true christe declareth plainely place seyng bothe liberally gladly suffreth vertue power procede healpynge woman therfore ought learne example peryls daungers shold set faith vpon christfrom christ alone muste looke healpe oure aduersitie looke healpe hande onely doo heare sermon temple put remembrance therof home neyther doo wee wante miracle thys daye yet canne faithe excited stirred vp beleue hym menne wyll beleue tyll haue great abundance necessarye thynges long healthe hope beleue well helpe god pouertie sycknesses one come haue faithe lament crye complayne though healpe neither heauen earth although heare dayly sermon otherwise god wil haue mercy v christes sake deliuer v euill flee vnto hym strong faithe doubt nothyng mercifull promise made vnto v blood christ doth agre woman act whiche peraduenture one twise heard christe myracles yet commeth stoute strong faith vnto christ christ ben highest part heuenthe force faythe faith would haue brast thorowe thynges yea haue brought christ downe earth haue holpen haue oftentymes sayd god deny helpe truely right faith sought called vpon wherfore ala sorowe muche wretch whiche hauyng worde god playnly yet suffer faith therby excited stirred vp confirmed faulte matter diuell oure corrupte wycked fleshe thys shoulde neuer vntowarde beleue christ would helpe v necessity combraunces neuer great many sayde faythe deceaue v therefore christ dooth ascribe faithe made thys woman whole thy fayth sayeth hathe made thee whole go peace thou whole thy disease lykewise shall faithe christe rayse vp death vnto lyfe vanquyshe deuyll destroye synne bryng euerlastyng saluation although christ doothe suche woorkes yet work fayth without faith workes wrought ye know neither christ sacramentes word god profite thyng without faith faith muste doo thynges ell must lefte vndoone speake thing pertainyng vnto saluation rom soeuer faith synne thus much first miracle second miracle ruler daughter dead luke recordeth thys mayde olde yeres luc woman diseased bloudy issue saye xij yeres olde long woman troubled sycknesse thynges prepared funerall minstrelles whyche theyr syngyng playinge maner people gaue token buryall present great noyse wept cried maner preparation noble buriall meane season father mayde thynges paste hope hope bee lyfe gone body maketh haste vnto christe nothyng doubting christe present mayde myght easylye restored vnto lyfe declare wordes fell downe feete iesus sayth euangelist sayd daughter dead pray thee come lay thy hand vpon may safe lyue although marke luke saye came iesus hys daughter laye dyenge yet also declare christe came ruler house mayde geuen vp ghost notwithstandyng signifie father dydde caste awaye faithe surely beleeued christ woulde restore vnto bothe lyfe healthe hathe euer sene hearde suche meruaylous people woman whyche place worlde coulde fynde healpe conceaued suche fayth hope truste confidence christ might touche hemme garment healed persuasion farre waye beleued came passe dede like maner maides father daughter dead certeinly persuaded christe laye hande vpon dead mayd receaue lyfe againe easie beleued man hande may rayse vp one fallen sleape rayse vp one fro death hande diligence paine taking noise c able would reason thus thincke ruler thought would haue tarried home neuer haue taken iourney vnto christ surely beleued christ able also wold restore dead daughter vnto life may see acceptable pleasant thing faith christ faith notwithsta ding reason worlde iudgeth plaine folishnes although christ occupied necessary busines disputation disciple iohn yet thing set part perceaued faith ruler turneth vnto foloweth satisfieth desire according faith somuch cometh house seeth thing prepared burial fearinge lest present sight shold tourne ye father minde example incredulitie men present cause fall faith straightwayes falleth vnto cofirmatio father faith bydding good cheare feare beleue comadeth also people yt present accopany corp vnto ye burial depart go house dead maid lay though say haue ye ye thincke cary dead ye deceaued ye muste seke dead corp place none maide onely sleapeth laughed scorne knowing right wel yt dead christ affirmeth yt dead remaineth yt proue sentence true shewing yt lyueth amog al present ther none minde christ father mayde christ content therwith say faith sake worcketh miracle sheweth euidently mayd liueth bene father faith mayd neuer reuiued lyfe great day generall resurrection remained styl sleape death noble thing god faith loketh health helpe hande christ therfore christ cometh vnto mayde taketh hand power worde calleth vnto lyfe streightwayes mayde rose vp euen though bene waken swete sleape ought note diligently wordes christe sayeth mayde deade sleapeth wordes right wel worthie remembred yea possible haue geuen might kepe vnderstand beleue wordes euen christ meaneth knew beholdeth dead corp man wold cosider right wel vnderstad man dead sleapeth could chaunge iudgement woulde counte dead one sleape might worthely reioyce yt hath learned excellent art learne experience selfes man excelleth reason lesse doth beleue thisreason comprehend mastereis god laughe scorne drousie dreame mere madnes appeareth deride lorde christ laugh scorne thincke maner felow rayse vp dead folke vnto life thought yt madde goeth worlde high wisedome god reason couteth plaine folishnes thinck thy selfe yf thy child dead saye dead sleapeth onely maye waken raysed vp sleape wyth litle finger mine woldest thou take plaine mocke plaine laughing scorne thy calamitie mishappe euen christ place like maner handled saye laughed scorne taken foole wherfore learne thou gospel death christ sleape likewise sicknes health see rayseth vp dead mayde finger one weare slepe woman deseased cometh one vnto christ diseased likewise blynd come hym receaue sight synners iustified ye condemned saued wonderfully deale v farre otherwise either reason ymagine beleue mayd men dead mine eye sayeth christ lyueth slepeth dauid owne men eye shepehearde keper shepe kyng ye beleue selues sinner ye holy angel god speake word sin death disease c streightwayes geueth place steade commeth righteousnes lyfe health c speake worde must matter therfore god place speaketh maruelous worde reason iudgement worlde saith maide dead sayd sleapeth might haue said according comon prouerbe yea sleapeth michael sleape continueth till daye iudgement sayeth expresly dead saye surely aliue true eye christ liueth yt may vnderstad true rayseth vp finger one child vseth rayse vp whe sleape short thing tend ende consyder mishappes according iudgement reasonwith christen eies must wee consider thinges christen eye sentence faith christen eye suche loke vpon synne hel death saye see death fele sinne perceaue damnation see thorow christ lyfe holines saluation lyke maner poore feele pouertie perceaue haue ynough euen vttermost haue christ momet able geue vnto whatsoeuer haue nede although haue nothing presently coulde get suche eye might truly glorie christen eye farre otherwise iudge thinges ye time dearth pestilence c world vseth iudge men behold loke vpo present abundace store hope concerning life muche good confort lytle despaire lykewise whe plague able prouide selues fleingnote thinke may sure place christian man althoughe neuer greatly diseased infected plague shall notwithstanding thinke thus haue christ please hym disease hurt vndoubtedly yf suche faythe euer aduersitie came shoulde neuer trouble v shoulde without feare yea mery quiet beleue neyther haue suche eye beholde thinges carnall eye herof cometh vnto v greate feare tremblyng thincke vengeaunce god fall vpon v hade meanes auoyde saith christe gospell written ath exod god abraham god isaac god iacob god god dead liuinge ergo abraham isaac iacob liue dead notwithstanding dead buried iij thousande yeres past consumed many hondred yeres vnto duste remaineth nothing christe proueth certeintie lyue reason thinges liue god v thinges dead worlde reason none otherwise behold death eye christian see thinges see heare worde christ father behold dead mayd haue spoken death may sayd sinne knowledge confession sinne necessarie glorie righteousnes ought sight marc mat worde christe baptisme beleueth baptised shalbe saued worde supper take eate1 cor body broken drincke cuppe newe testament bloud shalbe shed vnto ye remissio sin word must beleued true although fele see contrary yet credit geuen vnto like maner thou seest christen man dyinge thy eye beholde dead man thou must shutte close vp eye open suche eye beholde word shalt thou see man dead lyueth god word christ iohn beleueth shal neuer se death must learne gospell eye neuer plaine euident neuer wide open yet nothing death christian reputed taken nothyng uerely blindnes deafnes leprosie pestilence disease counted lesse nothinge therfore pouertie sicknes syn c offer selues thy eye therfore troubled shut thy carnall eye open thy christen eye saye christian haue lord whiche able rule thinges worde vexe selfe certein loke easely christ deliuereth mayd corporal death euen easely also wil deliuer v beleue haue sure hope relieued holpen also must consider mayd restored life owne faith dead beleueth seeth heareth father beleueth faith mightie maide receaueth life christ saith thinges possible beleueth mightie faith matter neuer great thou canst beleue haue sure hope christ thou shalt neuer deceaued thy desire neither shall deuill death able preuaile thyng thee miracle testifie whiche set forth v purpose faith woman dead maydes father commended christ might prouoke v also beleue shold otherwise beholde creature god otherwise v therfore although selues poore dead subiecte syn afflicted pouertie pestilence disease yet must beleue otherwise god boldly say maner although pouertie pestilece sin death trouble yet christian know pouertie pestilence sinne death hand christ al thinges wealth health righteousnes life althoughe see presently yet worde come see carnall eye true meanes doubted god graunt v son iesu christes sake alon sauiour redemer thorow holy ghost eye may behold calamity mishappes otherwise worlde beholdeth kepe suche conforte light vnto ende worlde may receaue ioye pleasure worlde come euerlasting lyfe amen xxv sonday trinitie sonday pthe gospell iohn vi iesus lift vp eye sawe greate company come vnto hym saithe vnto philip whence shal bie bread may eate sayde proue hym hee hym selfe knewe woulde philip aunswered two hundreth penyworthe bread sufficient euery man may take litle one disciple andrewe simon peter brother sayde vnto hym ladde whiche hath fiue barly loaues two fish among many iesus sayd make people sit downe much grasse place men sat downe number aboute fiue thousande iesus toke bread geuen thankes gaue disciple disciple set downe likewise fish much would eaten enough saith vnto disciple gather vp broken meate whiche remayneth nothynge loste gathered together fylled twelue baskettes broken meate fiue barlye loaues broken meate remayned vnto eaten men hadd sene miracle iesus dyd saide trueth prophet shoulde come worlde exposition gospell present sondaye red temple christias twyse yeare fyrst ye fourth sonday lent secondly present sonday ye haue hearde albeit treated gospell lent declared good confortable doctrine contained yet asmuche reade day church speake somewhat faith may increased wel co forted thorow mercifull promise god againste care bellyebelly care g eat enemy religion present daye greater obstacle let gospel christ belly care vtterly plucketh v awaye fro true faith ought haue god promise enforceth v vnto diuerse vice sinnes wickedness maye see dayes thorow worlde attempted auoyde belly care may haue wherof commodiouslye wealthely lyue one playeth vsurer iugler thirde baude fourth extorcioner c may speake nothing whoredome theafte murder periury flattery dissimulation fayned frendshippe contempte true religion vile wicked vice practised time yt bellye may lacke forasmuch therfore belly care prouoketh men vnto kynde wickednes suffreth aspire vnto point godlines sauiour christ gospell laboureth heale disease cure mischiefe fedyng great multitude people wildernes meanes declaryng fatherly care hath seke kyngdom god righteousnes therof therfore ought carefull corruptible thynges appertainynge vnto mortall lyfe rather study walke worthely faithfully vocation callingeall care lyuinge cast christ thinges cast care vpo therfore taking occasion thorowe miracle exhorte godly men caste care liuinge vpon christ careful ye faithful kynde louing father child liberally nourisheth fedeth beseche therfore geue good eare harcken well whiche shal spoken behalfe often meditation miracle shalbe moste present remedy againste ye vngodly carefulnes whiche many time disquieteth vexeth mindes shall therfore parte diligetly cosider miracle ye may ye able ouercome tentation hunger learne truste christ looke good thing hande christ accordinge naturall disposition singuler bountie greatly moued necessitie people miraculously fedde wildernes mightie great company people mighte haue moste certein signe sure argument carefulnes v commit oure whole life vnto euer partayneth ought worthely without cause cast care christ none otherwise careful faithfull put truste hym hath declared present miracle christ accopanied great multitude people nothinge eate streightwayes moued necessitie willingly without motion cosulted disciple concerning meate prepared fall daunger lacke sustenaunce woulde singuler goodnes christ moue commit selfe wholy vnto example good take place v true christian falsly vniustly chalenge vnto v name ought appropriated faithfull christian disdaineth comitt care belly christ math cosideratio wherof christ himselfe admonisheth v oure dutie sayinge carefull sayinge shal eate shal drincke wherwith shall couered heathen enquire thing heauenlye father knoweth ye haue nede thing seke ye rather first kingdom god righteousnes therof thing shall cast vnto christ doth take away fro v care temporall liuing attributeth prophane gentile without faith therfore vnsitting vnwourthy christen man maner ye heathen troubled belly care whereby also degenerateth groweth kynde made christia ethnicke heathen infidel christ requireth godly faithfull man auoyde carefulnes belly labour kyngdom god say gospell wherin shal finde heauenly treasure christ saith place worcke ye meate iohn meate perisheth ye meate abideth vnto euerlasting life ought directly plainly caste awaye v belly care commanded god holy worde exod thing meaneth commandement thou shalt haue strage god sight yt shold trust ye goodnes god alon aske loke hande good thing body soule infected wt belly care depedeth god alone neither beleue shal receaue good thinges yea putteth hys hope confidence worldly richesse prouision life incredulitie vnfaithfulnes doth merueillously fight law god whosoeuer infected therwith worshippeth foule dombe idoll mammon stead noble god liuyng lord thing christ himselfe also reproueth saying ye serue two maisters eyther shall hate one loue shal cleaue one math neglect meane ye serue god mammon euidet belly care true worshippinge god agree together therfore may fall awaye true godlines necessarie cast awaye filthie care belly furthermore holy scripture many promise commend set forth vnto v fatherly goodnes godsentences concerninge god prouidence thus saith princelike prophete dauid psalmes feare ye lord shall haue scarsenes psal whiche seke lorde shall want good thing beholde eye ye lorde vpon feare hym psal vpon yt trust mercy may deliuer lyues fro death nourrishe time honger laye thy care lorde psal psal psal shall nourrishe thee creature depend vpon thee lorde thou geuest meate due time thou geuing take thou opening thy hand well satisfied eye thinges loke vpon thee lord thou geuest meate due season thou openest thy hand fyllest euery liuing thing thy blessing psal lord geueth meate hongrie kynge salomon also dauids sonne saith lorde wyll let soule righteous suffer honger pro putteth vngodly fro desire blessing lord maketh men rich shall griefe accopanie iesus sonne syrach sayth trust god eccle abyde thy place easey thinge sight god quickly enriche poore man old tobias said son feare son lede poore life tobi notwithstanding shal haue plentie al good thinges feare lorde departe syn well blessed apostle paule saith lord hand carefull thing phil timoth pet god geueth v abundantly thinges enioye likewise saith peter cast care vpon god careth omitte reherse mo place holy scripture may seme present abundantly suffise seing haue many noble liberal promise god mete geue credit vnto whatsoeuer god hath promised vndoubtly performe beleue vnsittinge vnsemely christian doubt truth performaunce promise ohn seinge true also selfe trueth suche one neither deceaue accuse god vanitie wheras ought thorowly persuaded certeinly assured promise seing hath onely promised heauenly father also hath confirmed ratified promise diuers time many diuers miracle wherin contrary reason vouched saffe fede many people oppressed wyth greate penurie hunger knoweth notexamples xod god time past maruelously fede people israell whe lacked wine supplied necessitie turning water wine iohn ye gospel preset sonday heard christ fyue barly loues two fyshes fedde fyue thousand people yet therof remained xij baskettes ful ye fragmets time like maner math marc seuen loues fewe litle fish fedde foure thousand menne besides woman child yet remained seuen baskettes ful ye broken meat many miracle ought moue v distruse goodnes heauenly father flee vnto vnto holy ancker necessity seing god hath corfirmed promise many noble notable miracle otherwise resigne geue ouer selues thought liuing whole care bodie prouidence god loke al necessarie thinges mercifull goodnes requireth profession faith doctrine vocation calling otherwise shew selues christian ethnickes faythful vnfaithfull beleue promise god suche rather count god lyar whiche thinge ought farre christen heart worship god true faith deped wholly vpon fatherly prouidence cast care body vpon loke necessary thinges liberal hande shall iere highly please god whose eye loke vpon faith prophet saith yea meanes shall obtaine al thing nedefull expedient present lyfe god geueth faithfull blessing psal graunteth thinges whatsoeuer haue nede psalmographe testifieth saying haue bene yonge nowe old yet neuer see righteous forsaken sede begging bread psal sayth place satisfied ye emptie soule fylled hongry soule wt goodnes present place like declare yt god wil forsake ye faithful yt wil helpe blesse necessity god himselfe saith wil faile thee iosue neyther forsake thee mercifully dealt time paste poore widow eliseus hostesse multiplying encreasing oyle herof cometh iesus syrach conforteth exhorteth v moste goodly saying abide thou ye word god heb reg eccle exercise thy selfe remaine thy vocatio let nothing moue thee yt wicked rich welthy put thou thy trust god abide thy callyng easye thing god sodenly make poore man riche god blesseth ye good ye righteous place fortresseth v ye couetousnes ye wicked exhorteth v truste god dutie vocatio promiseth god prosper encrease goodes righteous saye beleue labour paine takinge excluded faith required whiche faith doth office euery vocationlabour forbidden gredy carefulnes yet committeth care god therfore desireth lyue worlde co modiously want good thinge let comit himselfe wholy god truly beleue hand loke necessarie thinges shal haue good successe doinges haue abundance thinges necessary present lyfe thinge present miracle contayned gospell daye euident testimonie sure witnesse wherin expressed christes hospitalitie toward people whiche feruent affection dere loue bare toward ye hearing christ doctrine beholding miracle folowed euen wyldernes hauinge regard neyther thinges home thinges abrod yea care fedinge belly vtterlye neglected thought selues happye yt might heare see christ appeareth manifestly shall lacke nothynge whiche follow christ faithfull mynde moreouer comit care belly god shall free many diuerse troublesome care wherewith vnfaithfull couetous person wrapped vexed entangled shall also preserued kepte many greuous noysome sinnes see wycked moyle turmoyle selues swyncke sweate beyond measure carcke care without ende get ye good worlde neither haue quietnes theyr breaste lyke men diseased dropsye whyche drynke thyrste suche insatiable couetousnesse occupyethe theyr heartes haue couete accordynge sayenge poete crescit amor nummi quantum ipsa pecunia crescit say money man hath dothe desyre1 timoth blessed paule paynteth matter lyuely truely saythe wyl ryche fall temptation snare many foolyshe noysome lustes whyche drowne men perdition destruction couetousnes money roote euyll whyche whyle lusted erred faythe tangled theym selues manye sorowes thow manne god flee thynges folow ryghtuousnesse godlynesse faith loue pacience meekenesse c woordes apostle proue sufficiently wycked vngodlye troubled wyth meruailous great care lustes yea holden captiue deuyls pleasure danger perdition vtter destruction free goodnes godlynes ragyng lustes carkinge care greatly vexe vnfaythfull satisfie theyr couetous desire attempt kynde mischiefe gette money spare man neyther afrayde godcouet snes stande awe god vengeance couetousnes blyndeth men eies prouoketh vnto vngodlynes crueltie without cause called apostle1 timoth roote euyls faith delyuereth v frome thyngesfaythe faith taketh away v bely care pensiuenes sustentation present lyfe worketh accordyng vocation callyng taketh good part whatsoeuer god sendeth muche bee lyttell vseth vnlaufull meanes get goodes world dependeth onely vpon blessyng heauenly father abundantly content godlines great rich saith ye apostle man cotet yt hath brought nothyng world neyther may cary thing haue foode rayment must therwith content suche vngodly wycked people take vnrestfull paynes lyttell transitorie pealfe thys worlde gayne gette spare laboure trauayle bothe sea lande yea many tymes without great daunger theyr lyfe uerily lucre gayne aduauntage ought estemed man shold rashely caste hym selfe daunger hasarde hys lyfe notwithstandyng day men maner wythout exception geuen couetousnes fylthye desyre worldly goodes sake neyther spare good name fame life substaunce yea saluation theyr soules wyll feare hasarde gette money truely sayde prophete frome leaste vnto moste ere hange vppon couetousnesse frome prophete prieste go aboute wyth falsehode lye agayne hee saythe frome lowest hyghest folowe fylthye lucre prophete vnto prieste deale lye faithefull wyth muche lesse busynesse trauayle doo gette good thynges hande lorde seyng fyrst seeke kyngdome god ryghteousnesse thereof truste goodnesse god afterwarde eschewyng ydelnesse laboure theyr office euery man accordyng vocation callynge meanes commeth passe god blesseth theyr trauayle encreaseth theyr goodes dayely wyse manne saythe pro blessyng lorde makethe menne ryche carefulle trauayle doth nothyng therto thys therfore true spedy way waxe ryche euen first seeke kyngdome godthe true wa waxe riche righteousnesse thereof beleue worde god looke good thynges hande god content sufficient diligently labour office euery man accordyng vocation callyng may sure haue good successe trauayles shall want good thing therfore vtterly deceaued otherwise go aboute gette go de worlde pro sodeinly waxe riche right wrong heare salomon sayth man dealeth faithfully shall fylled blessynges maketh much haste riche shall vngyltie wil ryche sone hath euyll eye consydereth pouertie shall come vpon hym see testimonie salomon blessyng god graunted faythefulle manne contrarywyse hym vnfaythfull couetous pouertie curse god threatened accordynge common prouerbe haste maketh waste agayn soone rype soone rotten lette v therfore thorough infidelitie make muche haste vniustly ryche lette v paciently faithfull mynde looke necessary good thynges hande god vndoutedly shall thynges succede come passe accordyng desyre yf truste god cast care vpon hym walke infidelitie vnrightousnes shall onely labour vayne also thorowe incredulitie wee shall prouoke whotte wrathe fierse anger vnquenchable displeasure almyghty god v god highly offended beleue promise doubt fatherly care bounteous liberalitie toward v whiche hath confirmed declared shewed many signes token miracle therfore christ certayne place gospell dyd vpbrayd diciples theyr incredulitie vnbelefe sayeng take ye thought marc ye haue bread perceaue ye yet neyther doo ye vnderstande haue ye heartes yet blynded haue ye eye see haue ye eares heare doo ye remembre brake fyue loaues among fyue thousand men howe many basket full broken meate toke ye vp sayde vnto hym twelue brake seuen loaues among foure thousande howe many basket leauynges broken meat toke ye vp sayd seuen sayd vnto happeneth ye vnderstande may see howe greatly slownesse vnbeliefe disciple greued christ sharply reproued meanes myght heale redresse infirmitie also wyll caste away vnbeliefe surely shal worthyly deserue wrath god moste greuous punyshement therefore blessed paule dothe dehorte dissuade v incredulitie vnbelefe saying let v tempt christe tempted hym1 cor slain serpentes neyther murmure ye murmured destroyed destroyer apostle place wittily fraieth v away incredulitie example saie old israelite faire thing beware man madnes hitherto pertaineth exaumple wherin reade certayn noble man troden downe people euen vnto deathe woulde beleue promise helizeus prophete4 reg whiche prophecied concerning deliuerace frome famyn hande present fact threatneth also vnfaithfull vengeaunce god whiche shall fall vppon beleue promyse god therfore may wretchedly peryshe let v caste care lyfe god beleue promyse loke good thinges mercyfull hand ye haue heard derely beloued howe christe euen owne free wyl moued fatherly pitie tender compassion towarde people whyche folowed hym heare doctrine se miracle howe miraculously meruailously hee fedde great multitude wyldernes hereby shoulde haue sure argumente infallible token fatherly care towarde v commytte lyfe vnto hym ueryly ready care goodnes christ toward people oughte ryght moue v shold geue ouer selues wholly vnto hym requireth v also fyrst commaundement thus doo prouoked many noble promyses god hath also confirmed many noble notable miracle ende yf worshyppe god true faith caste care lyfe vppon hym thenne vndoubtedly wyll god geue v thynges haue neede sustentation present lyfe delyuer v greate multitude care wherwith heartes vnfaithfull continually mooste myserably vexed tormented surer easy waye get richesse truste god faithful constant mynde looke blessynge hope receyue hym thynges wherof soeuer haue nede thus doo thorow incredulitie shall deserue wrathe god haue porcion idolater hypocrite lake burneth fyre brymstone whyche thynge god hys sonne christes sake turne awaye v apo make v partaker glorious kyngdom thorow christ lorde god father holy ghost honour glorye bothe nowe euer amen pthus endeth postill vpon al gospel redde churche thorow yeare sondayes god father god sonne god holy ghoste whyche one euerlastyng god prayse glorie honour wholsome doctrine benefites bothe worldes without end amen
